name: Ancestor's Chosen
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard.
flavor: "The will of all, by my hand done."

name: Angel of Mercy
text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
flavor: Every tear shed is a drop of immortality.

name: Angelic Blessing
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

name: Angelic Chorus
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor: The harmony of the glorious is a dirge to the wicked.

name: Angelic Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
flavor:
"The Ancestor protects us in ways we can't begin to comprehend."
—Mystic elder

name: Aura of Silence
text:
Artifact and enchantment spells your opponents cast cost {2} more to cast.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor: Not all silences are easily broken.

name: Aven Cloudchaser
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
flavor:
"At the Reapportionment, Eagle begged to be human. The Ancestor granted half that prayer."
—Nomad myth

name: Ballista Squad
text: {X}{W}, {T}: Ballista Squad deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: The perfect antidote for a tightly packed formation.

name: Bandage
text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card.
flavor: Life is measured in inches. To a healer, every one of those inches is precious.

name: Beacon of Immortality
text: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.
flavor: The cave floods with light. A thousand rays shine forth and meld into one.

name: Benalish Knight
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor:
"We called them 'armored lightning.'"
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Cho-Manno, Revolutionary
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Cho-Manno, Revolutionary.
flavor: "Mercadia's masks can no longer hide the truth. Our day has come at last."

name: Condemn
text: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.
flavor:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now!"
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

name: Demystify
text: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor:
"Illusion is a crutch for those with no grounding in reality."
—Cho-Manno

name: Field Marshal
text: Other Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and have first strike. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: He is the only one who sees the patterns in the overlapping maps and conflicting reports.

name: Ghost Warden
text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"I thought of fate as an iron lattice, intricate but rigidly unchangeable. That was until some force bent fate's bars to spare my life."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

name: Glorious Anthem
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.

name: Hail of Arrows
text: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.
flavor:
"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

name: Heart of Light
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
flavor: For those who reach enlightenment, violence is an unnecessary distraction.

name: High Ground
text: Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.
flavor: In war, as in society, position is everything.

name: Holy Day
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
flavor:
"Today there is feasting and peace across our land, but the war has not ended. Tuck away your bloodlust. You'll need it tomorrow."
—Karrim, Samite healer

name: Holy Strength
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
flavor:
"May angels fly at your back. May your blade cleave the darkness."
—War blessing of Serra

name: Honor Guard
text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The strength of one. The courage of ten.

name: Icatian Priest
text: {1}{W}{W}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Grelden knelt and felt the cool, dry hand of the priest on his brow. Hours later, when his wits returned, he was covered in his enemies' blood on the field of victory.

name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
flavor: Upon the frozen tundra stand the Kjeldoran Royal Guard, pikes raised, with the king's oath upon their lips.

name: Loxodon Mystic
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor: Elder mystics take their vow of silence so seriously that they impose it on any who enter their presence.

name: Loyal Sentry
text: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.
flavor: "My cause is simple: To stop you, at any cost, from ever seeing the inside of this keep."

name: Luminesce
text: Prevent all damage that black sources and red sources would deal this turn.
flavor:
"The White Shield is not the burnished metal you lash to your forearm but the conviction that burns in your chest."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Mobilization
text:
Soldier creatures have vigilance.
{2}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
flavor: Wars are won with strength, valor, and numbers—especially numbers.

name: Nomad Mythmaker
text: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control attached to a creature you control.
flavor: On the wild steppes, history vanishes in the dust. Only the mythmakers remain to say what was, and is, and will be.

name: Pacifism
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

name: Paladin en-Vec
text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)
flavor: "I do not consider myself a hero. I know only what the Vec teach: justice must always be served and corruption must always be opposed."

name: Pariah
text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
flavor:
"Why would I consider penance for my actions when I have so many subjects willing to do it for me?"
—Lord Konda

name: Reviving Dose
text:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.
flavor: Samite healers never mix their pungent elixir with sweetener or tea. The threat of a second dose is enough to get most warriors back on their feet.

name: Reya Dawnbringer
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "You have not died until I consent."

name: Righteousness
text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
flavor: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

name: Rule of Law
text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
flavor: Appointed by the kha himself, members of the tribunal ensure all disputes are settled with the utmost fairness.

name: Samite Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

name: Serra Angel
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.

name: Serra's Embrace
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and vigilance.
flavor: The touch of Serra's angels bears hopes aloft and empowers noble causes.

name: Skyhunter Patrol
text: Flying, first strike (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and it deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor:
"We leonin have come to rule the plains by taking to the skies."
—Raksha Golden Cub

name: Skyhunter Prowler
text: Flying, vigilance (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor: As tireless as her mount, a skyhunter's vigil is measured in days.

name: Skyhunter Skirmisher
text: Flying, double strike
flavor:
"Take the deadly grace and strength of the leonin, combined with a pteron mount capable of rending a foe in two and armed with notched steel. That is a skyhunter—and why Taj-Nar has never fallen."
—Raksha Golden Cub

name: Soul Warden
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
flavor:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching

name: Spirit Link
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
flavor: "We are all inextricably linked, souls woven in tapestry."

name: Spirit Weaver
text: {2}: Target green or blue creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Let my hope be your shield."

name: Starlight Invoker
text: {7}{W}: You gain 5 life.
flavor: "The constellations form a tapestry of light that traces my people's broken history. Day and night, I feel their glittering presence calling me to weave the pattern whole."

name: Steadfast Guard
text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor: "Best leave your tongue in its yap-hole, Mercadian scum, for your silvered words and golden bribes do not sparkle so brightly outside your city."

name: Suntail Hawk
text: Flying
flavor: Its eye the glaring sun, its cry the keening wind.

name: Tempest of Light
text: Destroy all enchantments.
flavor: "Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may takes its course."

name: Treasure Hunter
text: When Treasure Hunter enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "The treasures of the ancients belong in museums, not in the grubby hands of grave robbers."

name: True Believer
text: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: So great is his certainty that mere facts cannot shake it.

name: Tundra Wolves
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor:
"I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains."
—Onean scout

name: Venerable Monk
text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

name: Wall of Swords
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
flavor: The air hummed with the scissoring sound of uncounted blades that hovered in front of the invaders as though wielded by a phalanx of unseen hands.

name: Warrior's Honor
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The day will come when the righteous warrior faces a battle she cannot win. She will greet that day as she has any other."
—Asmira, holy avenger

name: Wild Griffin
text: Flying
flavor:
"I abandoned my dream of a squadron of griffin-riders when the cost proved too high. Three trainers were eaten for every griffin broken to the bridle."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Windborn Muse
text:
Flying
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
flavor:
"Her voice is justice, clear and relentless."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

name: Youthful Knight
text: First strike
flavor: Idealism fits him better than his armor.

name: Academy Researchers
text: When Academy Researchers enters the battlefield, you may put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield attached to Academy Researchers.
flavor: They brandish their latest theories as warriors would wield weapons.

name: Air Elemental
text: Flying
flavor:
"The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, *The Mirror of the Sea*

name: Ambassador Laquatus
text: {3}: Target player mills three cards.
flavor: "Life is a game. The only thing that matters is whether you're a pawn or a player."

name: Arcanis the Omnipotent
text:
{T}: Draw three cards.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Arcanis the Omnipotent to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Do not concern yourself with my origin, my race, or my ancestry. Seek my record in the pits, and then make your wager."

name: Aura Graft
text: Gain control of target Aura that's attached to a permanent. Attach it to another permanent it can enchant.
flavor: "It's not really stealing. It's more like extended borrowing."

name: Aven Fisher
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Fisher dies, you may draw a card.
flavor: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.

name: Aven Windreader
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of their library.
flavor: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."

name: Boomerang
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: Early Jamuraan hunters devised a weapon that would return to its source. Tolarian Aethermancers developed a spell that skipped the weapon entirely.

name: Cephalid Constable
text: Whenever Cephalid Constable deals combat damage to a player, return up to that many target permanents that player controls to their owner's hand.
flavor: Cephalids don't police people. They police loyalties.

name: Cloud Elemental
text:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: The soratami surround their sky-castles with living clouds that serve as both sword and shield.

name: Cloud Sprite
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.

name: Counsel of the Soratami
text: Draw two cards.
flavor: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."

name: Crafty Pathmage
text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
flavor:
Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning "escape quickly"

name: Dehydration
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor: The viashino used the spell to dry foods for crossing the Great Desert. The Suq'Ata later discovered its use in war.

name: Deluge
text: Tap all creatures without flying.
flavor:
"From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better."
—Emperor Aboshan

name: Denizen of the Deep
text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: According to merfolk legend, a denizen of the deep swallows the horizon at the end of each day, bringing on the cold blanket of night.

name: Discombobulate
text: Counter target spell. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor:
"I said 'pick his brain,' not 'tear off his head.'"
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Dreamborn Muse
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player mills X cards, where X is the number of cards in their hand.
flavor:
"Her voice is insight, piercing and true."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Evacuation
text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor:
"Once I supply the breeze, you'll see your warriors for the smoke they truly are."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Flashfreeze
text: Counter target red or green spell.
flavor:
"Nature? Fire? Bah! Both are chaotic and difficult to control. Ice is structured, latticed, light as a feather, massive as a glacier. In ice, there is power!"
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Fog Elemental
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
flavor:
"It's the perfect sentry. Those who should pass can go right through it."
—Teferi

name: Fugitive Wizard
flavor:
"The law has its place—as a footnote in my spellbook."
—Siyani, fugitive mage

name: Horseshoe Crab
text: {U}: Untap Horseshoe Crab.
flavor:
"Hmm . . . It looks kinda like a bug. Let's crack it open an' see if it tastes like one!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Hurkyl's Recall
text: Return all artifacts target player owns to their hand.
flavor: Hurkyl's research at the College of Lat-Nam wasn't enough to stop the two brothers, but for centuries thereafter her spellcraft taught artificers restraint.

name: Lumengrid Warden
flavor: The wardens keep watch over an endless sea of progress.

name: Mahamoti Djinn
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

name: Merfolk Looter
text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor:
It belongs to the merfolk now.
—Shipwreck prayer

name: Mind Bend
text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor:
"The world, I've come to realize, is a blank canvas on which to paint."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Peek
text:
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.
flavor: Sometimes you have to read between the minds.

name: Persuasion
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
You control enchanted creature.
flavor: There's no telling what an accomplished mage might collect.

name: Phantom Warrior
text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
flavor:
"There are as many pillows of illusion as flakes in a snow-storm. We wake from one dream into another dream."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Illusions"

name: Plagiarize
text: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.
flavor: "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"

name: Puppeteer
text: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
flavor:
"That's the funny thing about free will. You don't feel any different without it."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Reminisce
text: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
flavor: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

name: Remove Soul
text: Counter target creature spell.
flavor: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

name: Robe of Mirrors
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"Some say you cannot hit what you cannot see. I prefer that you hit what I want you to see."
—Arcanis the Omnipotent

name: Rootwater Commando
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: Rootwater merfolk are seldom seen these days, but elf corpses are as numerous as ever.

name: Rootwater Matriarch
text: {T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as that creature is enchanted.
flavor: In the harsh depths of Rootwater, the charms of surface dwellers are quite useless . . . except as lures.

name: Sea Monster
text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.

name: Shimmering Wings
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"I leave words like 'impossible' to the rabble. Whatever I can imagine, I can create."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Sift
text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
flavor: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.

name: Sky Weaver
text: {2}: Target white or black creature gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: "Let my wisdom give you wings."

name: Snapping Drake
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: The irritable drakes are solitary nesters. Even brooding females barely contain the urge to attack their own young.

name: Spiketail Hatchling
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Spiketail Hatchling: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor: It dodges waves of water to prepare for waves of magic.

name: Sunken Hope
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"I don't concern myself with my enemy's hopes. Hopes follow the tides. They will retreat soon enough."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Telepathy
text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
flavor:
"The question isn't whether I can read minds. It's whether I have yet to find a mind worth reading."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Telling Time
text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.
flavor: Mastery is achieved when "telling time" becomes "telling time what to do."

name: Thieving Magpie
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies collect jewels for theirs.

name: Tidings
text: Draw four cards.
flavor:
"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Time Stretch
text: Target player takes two extra turns after this one.
flavor: There's lots of time like the present.

name: Traumatize
text: Target player mills half their library, rounded down.
flavor:
"The educated mind is heavy with lore and knowledge. It's also the most likely to collapse under its own weight."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Twincast
text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor: Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.

name: Twitch
text:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.
flavor: Battles are won in nuance.

name: Unsummon
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: Tolarian apprentices learn to liberate Ætheric energy long before they are taught to bind it.

name: Vedalken Mastermind
text: {U}, {T}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: The vedalken see other beings from a cold distance, as either experimental subjects or objects of study.

name: Wall of Air
text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism

name: Afflict
text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor: One rarely notices a heartbeat, save when it is stolen.

name: Agonizing Memories
text: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
flavor: In the aftermath of war, when the slaying is long done, the greatest miseries come home to roost.

name: Ascendant Evincar
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Other black creatures get +1/+1.
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.
flavor: His soul snared by an angel's curse, Crovax twisted heroism into its purest shadow.

name: Assassinate
text: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin

name: Beacon of Unrest
text: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.
flavor: A vertical scream pierces the night air and echoes doom through the clouds.

name: Bog Wraith
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: Knowing Takenuma Swamp to be dangerous, Hisata set wards to warn him of predators. He never imagined that his murderer would pass through them unhindered.

name: Consume Spirit
text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.
flavor:
"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth

name: Contaminated Bond
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.
flavor:
"My favorite curses are those that manifest slowly, blackening the soul in ways the victim cannot hope to understand."
—Erissa, bog witch

name: Cruel Edict
text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
flavor:
"Choose your next words carefully. They will be your last."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Deathmark
text: Destroy target green or white creature.
flavor:
"I hope it's true that every snowflake is unique, because I never want to see one like this again. Now clean up that body."
—Thangbrand Gyrdsson, Kjeldoran patrol

name: Diabolic Tutor
text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.

name: Distress
text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor:
"They say the eyes are the windows to the soul. I like to break windows and take what's inside."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Doomed Necromancer
text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Doomed Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: Many necromancers share the same last words—the ones that conclude the undeath ritual.

name: Dross Crocodile
flavor:
"As soon as it surfaced, we could all smell it. Its rancid breath reeked of half-digested carrion and its own rotting innards."
—Dafri, Auriok champion

name: Drudge Skeletons
text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, *Necromancer's Handbook*

name: Dusk Imp
text: Flying
flavor: Imps are just intelligent enough to have an understanding of cruelty.

name: Essence Drain
text: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.
flavor:
"The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Fear
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor:
"Even the bravest of warriors yet knows the dark clutch of fright upon his stalwart heart."
—Lim-Dûl the Necromancer

name: Festering Goblin
text: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.

name: Grave Pact
text: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.
flavor:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Graveborn Muse
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of Zombies you control.
flavor:
"Her voice is damnation, unyielding and certain."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Gravedigger
text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

name: Hate Weaver
text: {2}: Target blue or red creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "Let my hate fuel your fury."

name: Hidden Horror
text: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
flavor: If the presence of evil were obvious, it wouldn't be nearly as dangerous.

name: Highway Robber
text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
flavor: "Tonight, madam, it's your money *and* your life."

name: Hypnotic Specter
text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
flavor: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.

name: Knight of Dusk
text: {B}{B}: Destroy target creature blocking Knight of Dusk.
flavor: "Challenge me with your strongest. I will paint my sword with their blood."

name: Looming Shade
text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.

name: Lord of the Undead
text:
Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "Do not weep at your defeat, my dear. In death, you will serve a greater purpose—mine."

name: Mass of Ghouls
flavor:
"An army has filled the valley, but it's not like any army I've ever seen. There are no tents, no fires, no horses . . . just a sea of bodies, writhing and moaning, as if a pestilent village were sent to invade us."
—Onean scout

name: Megrim
text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor:
"Pain is both a tool and a craft. Like any tool, it must be sharpened. Like any craft, it must be practiced."
—Hooks, Cabal torturer

name: Midnight Ritual
text: Exile X target creature cards from your graveyard. For each creature card exiled this way, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
flavor: Bury old friends deeply, lest they return bearing worms.

name: Mind Rot
text: Target player discards two cards.
flavor:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

name: Mortal Combat
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if twenty or more creature cards are in your graveyard, you win the game.
flavor: The crowd roared, the fighters bled, and the dead piled high in the pits. Only the Cabal could win.

name: Mortivore
text:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.
flavor: The light sigh of its breath whistles through its bones.

name: Nantuko Husk
text: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Nekrataal
text:
First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
flavor: His victims don't have time to feel despair.

name: Nightmare
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

name: No Rest for the Wicked
text: Sacrifice No Rest for the Wicked: Return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
flavor:
"The soul? Here, we have no use for such frivolities."
—Sitrik, birth priest

name: Phyrexian Rager
text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor: It takes no prisoners, but it keeps the choicest bits for Phyrexia.

name: Plague Beetle
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: No one knows whether they were named for the disease they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

name: Rain of Tears
text: Destroy target land.
flavor:
"When mortals die, they have family, friends, compatriots to mourn them. When the land dies, all else dies with it, and there is no one left to weep."
—Jacinth, Skyshroud ranger

name: Ravenous Rats
text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
flavor: Nothing is sacred to rats. Everything is simply another meal.

name: Recover
text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.
flavor: As Barrin exhumed his daughter's body, he finally realized the full price of his faith in Urza.

name: Royal Assassin
text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

name: Scathe Zombies
flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose, Nor spake, nor moved their eyes; It had been strange, even in a dream, To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Sengir Vampire
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

name: Severed Legion
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: No one in Aphetto answers a knock at the door after sundown.

name: Soul Feast
text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
flavor:
"I smell the tang of a mortal's fresh blood. I hear it sliding wetly beneath its skin. My hunger cannot refuse the invitation."
—Yuri, Sengir vampire

name: Spineless Thug
text: Spineless Thug can't block.
flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

name: Stronghold Discipline
text: Each player loses 1 life for each creature they control.
flavor: In Urborg, the instigators of each new rebellion are soaked in the blood of the last.

name: Thrull Surgeon
text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Thrull Surgeon: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: "Just take a little off the top."

name: Underworld Dreams
text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

name: Unholy Strength
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
flavor: Such power grows the body as it shrinks the soul.

name: Anaba Bodyguard
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor:
"They who challenge a minotaur enjoy the taste of their own blood."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Arcane Teachings
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
flavor: Not all knowledge is learned from parchment.

name: Beacon of Destruction
text: Beacon of Destruction deals 5 damage to any target. Shuffle Beacon of Destruction into its owner's library.
flavor: The Great Furnace's blessing is a spectacular sight, but the best view comes at a high cost.

name: Bloodfire Colossus
text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: It deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.

name: Bloodrock Cyclops
text: Bloodrock Cyclops attacks each combat if able.
flavor:
"There are only fifty words in the cyclops language, and ten of them mean 'kill.'"
—Ertai

name: Bogardan Firefiend
text: When Bogardan Firefiend dies, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
flavor:
"The next one who tells me to relax and curl up by a fire is dead."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Cryoclasm
text: Destroy target Plains or Island. Cryoclasm deals 3 damage to that land's controller.
flavor: The people of Terisiare had come to live on frozen fields as though on solid ground. Nothing reminded them of the difference more clearly than the rifts brought on by the Thaw.

name: Demolish
text: Destroy target artifact or land.
flavor:
"Pound the steel until it fits. Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song

name: Dragon Roost
text: {5}{R}{R}: Create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Dragons erupt from peaks of chaos and flow from rivers of molten rage.

name: Duct Crawler
text: {1}{R}: Target creature can't block Duct Crawler this turn.
flavor:
"Boss told us to try and train 'em. Trained it to attack—it ate Flugg. Trained it to run fast—it got away. Success!"
—Dlig, goblin spelunker

name: Earth Elemental
flavor: Earth elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

name: Firebreathing
text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Cradle your rage close to your heart and nurture your grudge with hatred that you may unleash upon your foes a dragon's fury."
—Tomor, dragonspeaker shaman

name: Fists of the Anvil
text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Gron's mind reeled with possibilities, most of which are best left unmentioned.

name: Flamewave Invoker
text: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: Inside even the humblest goblin lurks the potential for far greater things—and far worse.

name: Flowstone Slide
text: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.
flavor:
"Like an avalanche. With teeth. That will chase you. Uphill."
—Flint Foot, viashino runner

name: Furnace of Rath
text: If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
flavor: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

name: Furnace Whelp
text:
Flying
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?

name: Goblin Elite Infantry
text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: They talk a good fight.

name: Goblin King
text: Other Goblins get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk.
flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

name: Goblin Lore
text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
flavor: "Now listen closely, my young gob. There are many ways to eat pimple bugs, but I say the best way is all smashed together between two slug chips."

name: Goblin Piker
flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

name: Goblin Sky Raider
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."

name: Hill Giant
flavor: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

name: Incinerate
text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
flavor:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor: In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.

name: Lava Axe
text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: "Catch!"

name: Lavaborn Muse
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has two or fewer cards in hand, Lavaborn Muse deals 3 damage to that player.
flavor:
"Her voice is disaster, painful and final."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Lightning Elemental
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave, He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

name: Manabarbs
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor:
"I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Mogg Fanatic
text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: It deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"

name: Orcish Artillery
text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
flavor:
"So they want to kill my men? Well two can play at that game."
—General Khurzog

name: Prodigal Pyromancer
text: {T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: "What am I looking at? Ashes, dead man."

name: Pyroclasm
text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
flavor:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage

name: Rage Weaver
text: {2}: Target black or green creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
flavor: "Let my passion spur your victory."

name: Raging Goblin
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

name: Relentless Assault
text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

name: Rock Badger
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor:
"As it charged our keep, I mistook it for a bear. After it tore through our ramparts and half the guard, I wished it had been a bear after all."
—Ballista guard

name: Scoria Wurm
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Scoria Wurm to its owner's hand.
flavor: Late at night, ululations echo from deep under Shiv, as the wurms sing of times older than humanity.

name: Seismic Assault
text: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: Earth arms itself with fire.

name: Shatterstorm
text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.
flavor: From a marvel of magical mechanization to a smoking stack of scrap in one easy step.

name: Shivan Dragon
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

name: Shivan Hellkite
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{R}: Shivan Hellkite deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: A dragon's scale can be carved into a mighty shield, provided you can procure a dragontooth to cut it.

name: Shunt
text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
flavor: Aranghil held her fury in her heart, hard and bright as a ruby. With its razor edge, she rewrote the laws of battle.

name: Smash
text:
Destroy target artifact.
Draw a card.
flavor: Ravnica's laws protect not its citizens but its industry. Aging equipment is destroyed rather than restored, to bring more money into the factories' coffers.

name: Spark Elemental
text:
Trample, haste (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking. This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Spark Elemental.
flavor: Vulshok shamans could never keep them alive for more than a few seconds, yet those few seconds seemed to be enough.

name: Spitting Earth
text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
flavor:
"Within each of you is the strength of a landslide."
—Kumano, to his pupils

name: Squee, Goblin Nabob
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return Squee, Goblin Nabob from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"Some goblins are expendable. Some are impossible to get rid of. But he's both—at the same time!"
—Starke

name: Stun
text:
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Fortunately, merfolk aren't used to opponents with feet."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Sudden Impact
text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
flavor:
"Some say it's better to think before you act. While those people are considering all the options, that's usually when I kill them."
—Dravus, lava mage

name: Threaten
text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
flavor: Goblins' motivational techniques are crude, but effective.

name: Thundering Giant
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: The giant was felt a few seconds before he was seen.

name: Uncontrollable Anger
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each combat if able.
flavor: A barbarian's heart pounds with the fury of a prisoner, threatening at any moment to break the bars of its cage.

name: Viashino Runner
text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor:
"It moved this way, an' that way, an' then before I could stick it, it jumped over my head an' was gone."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Viashino Sandscout
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandscout to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
flavor: A viashino's overlapping scales form a buffer against Shiv's ash-flecked winds and a slippery target for goblin pikes.

name: Wall of Fire
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The erupting flames work as both barrier and weapon.

name: Aggressive Urge
text:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor: The power of the wild, concentrated in a single charge.

name: Avatar of Might
text:
If an opponent controls at least four more creatures than you, this spell costs {6} less to cast.
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor: In their most desperate hour, the elves of Llanowar had one song left to sing.

name: Blanchwood Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
flavor:
"Before armor, there was bark. Before blades, there were thorns."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Canopy Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.

name: Civic Wayfinder
text: When Civic Wayfinder enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: "These alleys are not safe. Come, I can guide you back to the market square."

name: Craw Wurm
flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

name: Creeping Mold
text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.

name: Elven Riders
text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
flavor: "Wirewood cannot hide great size. Only with speed and skill can we survive here."

name: Elvish Berserker
text: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor: Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.

name: Elvish Champion
text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn

name: Elvish Piper
text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

name: Enormous Baloth
flavor: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

name: Femeref Archers
text: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
flavor:
"Bet you can't put it through the eye."
"Left or right?"

name: Gaea's Herald
text: Creature spells can't be countered.
flavor: "Gaea sings with the voice of nature rampant: a thousand howls, chitters, and cries, and none of them can be ignored."

name: Giant Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor:
"When I trained under Multani, he bade me sit for hours watching Yavimaya's spiders. From them I learned stealth, patience, and the best way to snare a wind drake."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Grizzly Bears
flavor:
"We cannot forget that among all of Dominaria's wonders, a system of life exists, with prey and predators that will never fight wars nor vie for ancient power."
—Jolrael, empress of beasts

name: Hunted Wumpus
text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.

name: Hurricane
text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
flavor:
"Don't envy the grandeur of drakes. Their impression of grace fades when the first gust sends them crashing into one another."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Joiner Adept
text: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
flavor: A talented apprentice makes all things. The master makes all things possible.

name: Karplusan Strider
text: Karplusan Strider can't be the target of blue or black spells.
flavor: The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.

name: Kavu Climber
text: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor:
"There was a crack of branches, a rustle of leaves, then a tremendous roar. Our party had no chance as death descended from above."
—Taseen, elvish bard

name: Llanowar Elves
text: {T}: Add {G}.
flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

name: Llanowar Sentinel
text: When Llanowar Sentinel enters the battlefield, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, search your library for a card named Llanowar Sentinel, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor:
"The forest has as many eyes as leaves."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Lure
text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
flavor: Her true theft was to steal the soldiers away from their posts.

name: Might of Oaks
text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"

name: Might Weaver
text: {2}: Target red or white creature gains trample until end of turn. (It can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor: "Let my strength harden your resolve."

name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor:
"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts. . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
flavor: "My mind is the spread of the canopy. My heart is the embrace of the roots. I am deathless Llanowar, its fury and its peace."

name: Natural Spring
text: Target player gains 8 life.
flavor:
"Jewels cannot be eaten nor gold drunk. What civilization trades, nature simply provides."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Naturalize
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor:
"Well, it also makes a very nice flower pot. . . ."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

name: Overgrowth
text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}{G}.
flavor:
"Let the forest spread! From salt, stone, and fen, let the new trees rise."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Overrun
text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor: Nature doesn't walk.

name: Pincher Beetles
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"No fair! Since when does a bug get ta munch on *me*?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Primal Rage
text: Creatures you control have trample. (A creature with trample can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor: Ferocity and cunning accounted for half the victory. Gravity accounted for the rest.

name: Quirion Dryad
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's white, blue, black, or red, put a +1/+1 counter on Quirion Dryad.
flavor:
"Never underestimate the ability of natural forces to adapt to unnatural influences."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Rampant Growth
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

name: Recollect
text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
—Savra

name: Regeneration
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor:
"A touch of vine sap in the blood, and the flesh knits as quickly as new roots twining."
—Freyalise

name: Rhox
text:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: It's as solid as the club in its hand—and about as subtle.

name: Root Maze
text: Artifacts and lands enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor: Pause for the briefest of moments to consider the whorl of brambles, the tangled twist of bark, and the maze has already won.

name: Rootwalla
text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.

name: Rushwood Dryad
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: To a dryad, every tree in the forest is both a doorway and a window.

name: Scion of the Wild
text: Scion of the Wild's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
flavor: It has a hundred thousand extinctions to avenge.

name: Seedborn Muse
text: Untap all permanents you control during each other player's untap step.
flavor:
"Her voice is the wilderness, savage and pure."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

name: Skyshroud Ranger
text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: Not even the elves truly know the Skyshroud Forest. The rangers are merely the best equipped to handle its uncertainty.

name: Spined Wurm
flavor: Its spines act like the teeth of a saw, scoring distinctive marks in the vegetation of its territory.

name: Stalking Tiger
text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor: In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.

name: Stampeding Wildebeests
text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: The most violent and destructive storms in Femeref occur on cloudless days.

name: Sylvan Basilisk
text: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.
flavor:
"We're not sure what one looks like, so to be safe, nobody look at anything until we're out of here."
—Parbold Drix, veteran explorer

name: Sylvan Scrying
text: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: One glimpse of an elf's home lasts her weeks away in the wild.

name: Tangle Spider
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: Only rumors have ever escaped its web.

name: Treetop Bracers
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
flavor: Gravity is truly what you make of it.

name: Troll Ascetic
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.
flavor: It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.

name: Upwelling
text: Players don't lose unspent mana as steps and phases end.
flavor: Freyalise promised a dawn that would never end, a day of limitless life. As many dread her promise as revere it.

name: Verdant Force
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
flavor: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

name: Viridian Shaman
text: When Viridian Shaman enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
flavor: She stands as a living symbol of the natural world and an enemy of the forces that threaten it.

name: Wall of Wood
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor: Orcish lumberjacks spent the night sharpening their blades and resting for a day of labor. They awoke to find that the forest had been making its own preparations.

name: Yavimaya Enchantress
text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.

name: Benalish Hero
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the hero.

name: Mesa Pegasus
text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

name: Northern Paladin
text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
flavor: "Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort." —The Book of Tal

name: Pearled Unicorn
flavor: "'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

name: Savannah Lions
flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless flat plains of their homeland.

name: Veteran Bodyguard
text: As long as Veteran Bodyguard is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures is dealt to Veteran Bodyguard instead.
flavor: Good bodyguards are hard to find, mainly because they don't live long.

name: White Knight
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

name: Lord of Atlantis
text: Other Merfolk get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

name: Phantasmal Forces
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

name: Phantom Monster
text: Flying
flavor:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

name: Prodigal Sorcerer
text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

name: Sea Serpent
text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

name: Wall of Water
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.

name: Water Elemental
flavor: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

name: Black Knight
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

name: Demonic Hordes
text:
{T}: Destroy target land.
At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.
flavor: Created to destroy Dominia, Demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

name: Frozen Shade
text: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"There are some qualities—some incorporate things,/ That have a double life, which thus is made/ A type of twin entity which springs/ From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

name: Plague Rats
text: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats on the battlefield.
flavor:
"Should you a Rat to madness tease
Why ev'n a Rat may plague you..."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

name: Wall of Bone
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor:
"About, about in reel and rout
The death-fires danced at night;
The water, like a witch's oils,
Burnt green, and blue and white."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Zombie Master
text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
flavor: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.

name: Dragon Whelp
text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor:
"O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ."
—Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"

name: Dwarven Demolition Team
text: {T}: Destroy target Wall.
flavor: Foolishly, Najib retreated to his castle at El-Abar; the next morning he was dead. In just one night, the dwarven forces had reduced the mighty walls to mere rubble.

name: Fire Elemental
flavor: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

name: Granite Gargoyle
text:
Flying
{R}: Granite Gargoyle gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, Gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them."
—The Underworld Cookbook, by Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar

name: Gray Ogre
flavor: The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, and preferred to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

name: Hurloon Minotaur
flavor: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

name: Ironclaw Orcs
text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
flavor: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

name: Roc of Kher Ridges
text: Flying
flavor: We encountered a valley topped with immense boulders and eerie rock formations. Suddenly one of these boulders toppled from its perch and sprouted gargantuan wings, casting a shadow of darkness and sending us fleeing in terror.

name: Stone Giant
text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: What goes up, must come down.

name: Two-Headed Giant of Foriys
text:
Trample
Two-Headed Giant of Foriys can block an additional creature each combat.
flavor: None know if this Giant is the result of aberrant magics, Siamese twins, or a mentalist's schizophrenia.

name: Uthden Troll
text: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
flavor: "Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere, Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near, Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da hurt'll disappear." —Traditional

name: Wall of Stone
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor: The Earth herself lends her strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

name: Elvish Archers
text: First strike
flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

name: Fungusaur
text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

name: Ironroot Treefolk
flavor: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

name: Ley Druid
text: {T}: Untap target land.
flavor: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

name: Scryb Sprites
text: Flying
flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

name: Shanodin Dryads
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

name: Thicket Basilisk
text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

name: Timber Wolves
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

name: Verduran Enchantress
text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

name: Wall of Brambles
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
flavor: "What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf." —Conrad Aiken

name: Wall of Ice
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor:
"And through the drifts the snowy cliffs/ Did send a dismal sheen:/ Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken—/ The ice was all between."/
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: War Mammoth
text: Trample
flavor: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

name: Abzan Falconer
text:
Outlast {W} ({W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has flying.
flavor: The fastest way across the dunes is above.

name: Ainok Bond-Kin
text:
Outlast {1}{W} ({1}{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has first strike.
flavor: "Hold the line, for family and the fallen!"

name: Anointer of Valor
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature attacks, you may pay {3}. When you do, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
flavor: Light streaked down from the heavens, and a voice whispered in the soldier's ear: "You shall not fall today."

name: Battlefield Promotion
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. That creature gains first strike until end of turn. You gain 2 life.
flavor: "Welcome to the Legion. You saved a district—now let's go save the world."

name: Divine Visitation
text: If one or more creature tokens would be created under your control, that many 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying and vigilance are created instead.
flavor: The angels appreciated the offer but politely declined to eat any birdseed.

name: Doomed Traveler
text: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.

name: Flickerwisp
text:
Flying
When Flickerwisp enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: Its wings disturb more than air.

name: Gods Willing
text:
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn. (It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, enchanted, or equipped by anything of that color.)
Scry 1.
flavor: Honor the gods of Theros, and they will return the favor.

name: Last Breath
text: Exile target creature with power 2 or less. Its controller gains 4 life.
flavor: He gasped in wonder even as his body crumbled away.

name: Leonin Arbiter
text: Players can't search libraries. Any player may pay {2} for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
flavor: "Our people are torn by infighting. Until the two sides reconcile, our laws can carry no meaning."

name: Mentor of the Meek
text: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
flavor: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."

name: Monastery Mentor
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, create a 1/1 white Monk creature token with prowess.
flavor: "Speak little. Do much."

name: Path to Exile
text: Exile target creature. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: Her resentment vanished as strange, unknown lands opened up before her.

name: Relief Captain
text: When Relief Captain enters the battlefield, support 3. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to three other target creatures.)
flavor: Sometimes gestures of support are small. Sometimes not.

name: Scale Blessing
text: Bolster 1, then put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it. (To bolster 1, choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor:
"Your bravery honors us all."
—Dromoka, translated from Draconic

name: Seeker of the Way
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Seeker of the Way gains lifelink until end of turn.
flavor: "I don't know where my destiny lies, but I know it isn't here."

name: Sensor Splicer
text:
When Sensor Splicer enters the battlefield, create a 3/3 colorless Phyrexian Golem artifact creature token.
Golem creatures you control have vigilance.
flavor: With clarity of vision comes clarity of function.

name: Settle Beyond Reality
text:
Choose one or both —
• Exile target creature you don't control.
• Exile target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
flavor: Two taken, two judged, one returned.

name: Smothering Tithe
text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, that player may pay {2}. If the player doesn't, you create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor:
"I await your donation."
—Dasha, Orzhov priest

name: Wall of Omens
text:
Defender
When Wall of Omens enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor:
"I search for a vision of Zendikar that does not include the Eldrazi."
—Expedition journal entry

name: Wingsteed Rider
text:
Flying
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Wingsteed Rider, put a +1/+1 counter on Wingsteed Rider.
flavor: Trust is the only bridle a pegasus will accept.

name: Advanced Stitchwing
text:
Flying
{2}{U}, Discard two cards: Return Advanced Stitchwing from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
flavor:
"Improvement is a consequence of practice."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Body Double
text: You may have Body Double enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature card in a graveyard.
flavor: "I am who I pretend to be."
