flavor: Fire is never a gentle master.

name: Crimson Manticore
text:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, Manticores can be fearsome allies. As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.

name: Eternal Warrior
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance.
flavor: Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.

name: Fissure
text: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?"
—Plato

name: Giant Strength
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
flavor:
"O! it is excellent
To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous
To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare, *Measure for Measure*

name: Inferno
text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor:
"Any scrap of compassion that still existed in my soul was permanently snuffed out when they cast me out into the flames."
—Mairsil, called the Pretender

name: Pyrotechnics
text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
flavor:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant

name: Sisters of the Flame
text: {T}: Add {R}.
flavor: We are many wicks sharing a common tallow; we feed the skies with the ashes of our prey.

name: The Brute
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor:
"Union may be strength, but it is mere blind brute strength unless wisely directed."
—Samuel Butler

name: Wall of Dust
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Dust blocks a creature, that creature can't attack during its controller's next turn.
flavor: An ever-moving swarm of dust engulfs and disorients anything that comes near.

name: Winds of Change
text: Each player shuffles the cards from their hand into their library, then draws that many cards.
flavor:
"'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales, Which tells us the way to go."
—Ella Wheeler Wilcox

name: Carnivorous Plant
text: Defender
flavor:
"It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Durkwood Boars
flavor:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—Mark 5:13

name: Killer Bees
text:
Flying
{G}: Killer Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.

name: Land Leeches
text: First strike
flavor:
"The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Marsh Viper
text: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
flavor: "All we had left were their black and bloated bodies." —Maeveen O'Donagh, *Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Sandstorm
text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

name: Venom
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
flavor:
"I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, *Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Winter Blast
text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
flavor:
"Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!"
—William Shakespeare, *King Lear*

name: Armed Response
text: Armed Response deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of Equipment you control.
flavor: Raksha watched as the goblins continued to pour onto the Razor Fields. "They just don't know when to stop, do they?"

name: Auriok Champion
text:
Protection from black and from red
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
flavor:
"Her will shall banish the shadows. Her might shall punish the lawless. Her beauty shall restore the light."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Auriok Windwalker
text:
Flying
{T}: Attach target Equipment you control to target creature you control.
flavor: Each generation, a handful of Auriok girls are allowed to visit the Cave of Light. They return riding the wind and brandishing steel.

name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
text: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
flavor: "Memnarch shall rage against us. We shall endure."

name: Leonin Squire
text: When Leonin Squire enters the battlefield, return target artifact card with mana value 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"I may be kha, but without my soldiers, my people, I am nothing."
—Raksha Golden Cub

name: Loxodon Anchorite
text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: The loxodon ascribe religious superiority to those born albino, believing them to be spiritually pure.

name: Loxodon Stalwart
text:
Vigilance
{W}: Loxodon Stalwart gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Long ago, the Auriok attempted peace with the loxodons. The leonin attempted war. Neither succeeded.

name: Raksha Golden Cub
text:
Vigilance
As long as Raksha Golden Cub is equipped, Cat creatures you control get +2/+2 and have double strike.
flavor: Some believe that Raksha, youngest of the kha, is the reincarnation of Dakan, the first and mightiest of leonin leaders.

name: Retaliate
text: Destroy all creatures that dealt damage to you this turn.
flavor: The Auriok learned perseverance from their forebears. They learned justice from the leonin.

name: Roar of Reclamation
text: Each player returns all artifact cards from their graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"Yesterday's relics will determine the outcome of tomorrow's war."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Stasis Cocoon
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
flavor: Though the grip of a golem is strong, the grip of Auriok magic is far stronger.

name: Steelshaper's Gift
text: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Some blades seek their own wielders.

name: Vanquish
text: Destroy target blocking creature.
flavor:
"All beings have an inner light. Let me show you yours."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Acquire
text: Search target opponent's library for an artifact card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles.
flavor: Sometimes "innovation" means "stealing another's secret before anyone else can."

name: Advanced Hoverguard
text:
Flying
{U}: Advanced Hoverguard gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"They are like their vedalken masters: untouchable, aloof, and omnipresent."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Beacon of Tomorrows
text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one. Shuffle Beacon of Tomorrows into its owner's library.
flavor: To look into its light is to meet the gaze of history.

name: Blinkmoth Infusion
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Untap all artifacts.
flavor: Power begets power.

name: Disruption Aura
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay its mana cost."
flavor: Vedalken weapons sold to outsiders are as dependable as the vedalken themselves.

name: Early Frost
text: Tap up to three target lands.
flavor: Under its mists, the earth sleeps.

name: Fold into Aether
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, its controller may put a creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: Æther portals drift across Mirrodin's surface, dragging creatures across time and space.

name: Hoverguard Sweepers
text:
Flying
When Hoverguard Sweepers enters the battlefield, you may return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor: They only appear in emergencies, and emergencies never last long.

name: Into Thin Air
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Return target artifact to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Perhaps I should take Mirrodin apart and begin again."
—Memnarch

name: Plasma Elemental
text: Plasma Elemental can't be blocked.
flavor:
"I watched a ship sail right through it. I thought it was harmless . . . until I saw what it had done to the crew."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Qumulox
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
flavor: Even the clouds bend themselves to Memnarch's will, eager to swallow those who oppose him.

name: Thought Courier
text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: It is telling of the vedalkens' culture that they trust human couriers more than their own comrades.

name: Blind Creeper
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Blind Creeper gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: It shuns everything except its next meal.

name: Cackling Imp
text:
Flying
{T}: Target player loses 1 life.
flavor: Its laughter drives needles through your mind.

name: Desecration Elemental
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever a player casts a spell, sacrifice a creature.
flavor: Its precious corpses dance like puppets to attract mindless nim prey.

name: Devour in Shadow
text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.
flavor:
"Feel the burn of the mists. Master them. They will devour your enemies."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Ebon Drake
text:
Flying
Whenever a player casts a spell, you lose 1 life.
flavor: The deadliest killers serve only those who are not afraid to die.

name: Endless Whispers
text: Each creature has "When this creature dies, choose target opponent. That player puts this card from its owner's graveyard onto the battlefield under their control at the beginning of the next end step."
flavor: Those who find death under the black sun's shadow cannot escape its pull.

name: Fleshgrafter
text: Discard an artifact card: Fleshgrafter gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Necrogen enflames certain emotional centers in the Morioks' brains: hate, aggression, and especially greed.

name: Moriok Rigger
text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Moriok Rigger.
flavor: The Moriok scavenge for weapons, for armor, for food—and ultimately for their souls.

name: Night's Whisper
text: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
flavor: The Moriok call the black moon the Whisperer. At her apex, she whispers of power.

name: Nim Grotesque
text: Nim Grotesque gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
flavor: In the swirling mists, you could walk right up to one and not know until its teeth are in your throat.

name: Shattered Dreams
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose an artifact card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: Victims are lucky if they remember ever having had what was lost.

name: Cosmic Larva
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Cosmic Larva unless you sacrifice two lands.
flavor: For millennia they wandered from plane to plane, devouring all metal. Finally, their wanderings are over.

name: Feedback Bolt
text: Feedback Bolt deals damage to target player or planeswalker equal to the number of artifacts you control.
flavor: The path of least resistance is often through your enemies.

name: Goblin Brawler
text:
First strike
Goblin Brawler can't be equipped.
flavor: Perhaps he shuns technology. Perhaps he appreciates nature. Perhaps he doesn't know the difference.

name: Granulate
text: Destroy each nonland artifact with mana value 4 or less.
flavor: There aren't *that* many ways to destroy a solid steel weapon, but somehow the goblins keep finding new ones.

name: Iron-Barb Hellion
text:
Haste
Iron-Barb Hellion can't block.
flavor: When you feel a rumble in the ground, hold perfectly still. One sound will bring the hellion.

name: Krark-Clan Engineers
text: {R}, Sacrifice two artifacts: Destroy target artifact.
flavor: "Well, I jammed the whatsit into the whackdoodle, but I think I broke the thingamajigger."

name: Krark-Clan Ogre
text: {R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target creature can't block this turn.
flavor: The Krark Clan believes it's caught an ogre. The ogre believes he's caught seven goblins.

name: Magma Giant
text: When Magma Giant enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: Its open mouth is a furnace blast that blisters the skin. Its smoking fists are meteors that split the earth.

name: Magnetic Theft
text: Attach target Equipment to target creature. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)
flavor: Among the Vulshok, the most prized blades are those that killed their original owners.

name: Mana Geyser
text: Add {R} for each tapped land your opponents control.
flavor: The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.

name: Rain of Rust
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Destroy target land.
Entwine {3}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
flavor: On Mirrodin, mages who call upon the power of rust are shunned by their people and often turn mercenary to survive.

name: Reversal of Fortune
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You may copy an instant or sorcery card in it. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.
flavor: "Why learn hundreds of spells when you can learn only one and use it to steal hundreds?"

name: Screaming Fury
text: Target creature gets +5/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: He's got an axe to grind.

name: Vulshok Sorcerer
text:
Haste
{T}: Vulshok Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Vulshok sorcerers train by leaping into electrified storm clouds. Dead or alive, they come back down with smiles on their faces.

name: Beacon of Creation
text: Create a 1/1 green Insect creature token for each Forest you control. Shuffle Beacon of Creation into its owner's library.
flavor: A chorus of life heralds the arrival of Mirrodin's final sun.

name: Dawn's Reflection
text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional two mana in any combination of colors.
flavor: Only Sylvok magic could truly capture the perfection of a Mirrodin sunrise.

name: Fangren Pathcutter
text: Whenever Fangren Pathcutter attacks, attacking creatures gain trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"Tracking a fangren pack is easy. Catching up to one is fatal."
—Viridian scout

name: Ouphe Vandals
text: {G}, Sacrifice Ouphe Vandals: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source and destroy that artifact if it's on the battlefield. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
flavor: The ouphes finally managed to still the clockwork monstrosity by catching themselves in its cogs.

name: Rite of Passage
text: Whenever a creature you control is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it. (It must survive the damage to get the counter.)
flavor: Every scar is a lesson, every battle a test of what you have learned.

name: Sylvok Explorer
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
flavor: Any creature on a druid's shoulder is his family, any land under his feet his home.

name: Tangle Asp
text: Whenever Tangle Asp blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor:
"I have no fangs, yet I constantly bite. I have no scales, yet I slither through you. What am I?"
—Riddle of the viper's venom

name: Tel-Jilad Lifebreather
text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate target creature.
flavor: "The Tangle loans you life. Spend it well."

name: Tyrranax
text: {1}{G}: Tyrranax gets -1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: It outnumbers you one to many.

name: Viridian Lorebearers
text: {3}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts your opponents control.
flavor: A small band of elves pledged many years ago to avoid the Edges of Forgetting. They have remained hidden until now.

name: Viridian Scout
text: {2}{G}, Sacrifice Viridian Scout: It deals 2 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor: They know a hoverguard's only blind spot is directly above it.

name: Abbey Gargoyles
text: Flying, protection from red
flavor:
"They don't move, do they?"
"Only for the wrong sort of people."
"Are *we* the wrong sort of people?"

name: Animate Wall
text:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.
flavor:
"When you have been bitten with fangs of granite, you start to long for the ivory sabers of tigers."
—Norin the Wary

name: Armor of Faith
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Keep your chain mail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Aysen Bureaucrats
text: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.
flavor:
"When one's word is law, one's whim is equally binding."
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

name: Blessed Wine
text:
You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"Out there, there are spirits, but here, there is wine."
—Blessing for the bounty of Kjeld

name: Blinking Spirit
text: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

name: Castle
text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
flavor:
"Hang out our banners on the outward walls; / The cry is still, 'They come'; our castle's strength / Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare, *Macbeth*

name: D'Avenant Archer
text: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: Avenant's archers are also trained as poets, so that each arrow is guided by a fragment of verse.

name: Death Speakers
text: Protection from black
flavor:
"The dead may be beyond the law, but speaking the wisdom of the dead will afford no protection!"
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

name: Divine Offering
text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its mana value.
flavor: These tears of pain I weep to the skies, Not bitter drops, but water made divine. Each gem of sorrow slips, no longer mine, But proffered thus to echo other cries.

name: Dust to Dust
text: Exile two target artifacts.
flavor:
"All this nonsense made by mages
Rusts and crumbles through the ages."
—Aline Corralurn, "Inheritance"

name: Heal
text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Hipparion
text: Hipparion can't block creatures with power 3 or greater unless you pay {1}.
flavor:
"Someone once said that hipparions are to warriors what aesthir are to skyknights. Don't believe it."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Icatian Phalanx
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: Even after the wall was breached in half a dozen places, the phalanxes fought on, standing solidly against the onrushing raiders. Disciplined and dedicated, they held their ranks to the end, even in the face of tremendous losses.

name: Icatian Scout
text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"In these, our final days, I offer this. Though we could not save Icatia, we gave our children time to grow, and love, before it fell."
—Ailis Connaut, diary

name: Icatian Town
text: Create four 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens.
flavor: Icatia's once-peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

name: Ivory Guardians
text:
Protection from red
Creatures named Ivory Guardians get +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls a nontoken red permanent.
flavor:
"But who is to guard the guards themselves?"
—Juvenal, *Satires*

name: Kismet
text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
text: Flying; first strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: The heartlink between soldier and steed is hatched with the aesthir struggling from its shell.

name: Mesa Falcon
text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

name: Order of the Sacred Torch
text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.
flavor: A blazing light to drive out the shadows.

name: Order of the White Shield
text:
Protection from black
{W}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: A shield of light admits no shadow.

name: Repentant Blacksmith
text: Protection from red
flavor:
"For my confession they burned me with fire / And found that I was for endurance made."
—*The Arabian Nights*,
trans. Haddawy

name: Sacred Boon
text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
flavor:
"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Serra Paladin
text:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains vigilance until end of turn.
flavor:
One light, one blade, one purpose.
—Vow of the Serra Paladins

name: Shield Bearer
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor:
"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Shield Wall
text: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: The strongest walls are made not of stone or steel but of the focused strength of warriors.

name: Truce
text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.
flavor:
Not all victories require defeat.
—Onean idiom

name: Aether Storm
text:
Creature spells can't be cast.
Pay 4 life: Destroy Aether Storm. It can't be regenerated. Any player may activate this ability.
flavor: Thunder in the wind / no rain / peace mourns its passing.

name: Azure Drake
text: Flying
flavor: Little dreamt could seem so cruel As waiting for the wings outspread, The jagged teeth, the burning eyes, And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.

name: Binding Grasp
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Binding Grasp unless you pay {1}{U}.
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+1.
flavor:
"What I want, I take."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Dandân
text:
Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.
flavor:
"Catch good today. Start replacing crew tomorrow."
—Faysal al-Mousa, fisher captain, log

name: Dark Maze
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor:
"Stray not onto the path of darkness, or be lost forever."
—Baki, wizard attendant

name: Deflection
text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
flavor:
Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

name: Energy Flux
text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."
flavor:
"Nothing endures but change."
—Heraclitus

name: Enervate
text:
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Force Spike
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor:
"Unknown spears / Suddenly hurtle before my dream-awakened eyes . . . ."
—William Butler Yeats, "The Valley of the Black Pig"

name: Glacial Wall
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor:
"As we neared, Belfar proclaimed the wall to be made of glass and went forward to prove it. We had no choice but to pull his hands free from where he had touched it, leaving flesh palmprints on the icy wall."
—Tross, Vainus Expedition leader

name: Hydroblast
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's red.
• Destroy target permanent if it's red.
flavor:
"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Labyrinth Minotaur
text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor:
"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then we minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman

name: Lifetap
text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.
flavor:
"Keep a green tree in your heart and perhaps the singing bird will come."
—Chinese proverb

name: Memory Lapse
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
flavor:
"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler

name: Reef Pirates
text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player mills a card.
flavor: Relentless as the tides, souls dark as a moonless night. Bloodshed on their minds, and greed burning in their hearts like molten gold.

name: Sea Spirit
text: {U}: Sea Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"It rose above our heads, above the ship, and still higher yet. No foggy, ice-laden sea in the world could frighten me more."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Sea Sprite
text: Flying, protection from red
flavor:
"No one can catch what won't be caught."
—Kakra, sea troll

name: Sibilant Spirit
text:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.
flavor: She had expected death to roar, to thunder, to growl. She did not recognize it when it came hissing to her side.

name: Soul Barrier
text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Soul Barrier deals 2 damage to that player unless they pay {2}.
flavor:
"The Soul selects her own Society— Then—shuts the Door—"
—Emily Dickinson, "The Soul selects her own Society"

name: Updraft
text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"Come one, come all! this rock shall fly From its firm base as soon as I."
—Sir Walter Scott, "The Lady of the Lake"

name: Vodalian Soldiers
flavor:
"Vodalian rank is displayed by the colors and patterns of their skin. Beware the color red; that is the badge of the empress's favor."
—Corbio, pearl diver

name: Wind Spirit
text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor:
" . . . [W]hen the trees bow down their heads, / The wind is passing by."
—Christina Rossetti,
"Who Has Seen the Wind?"

name: Abyssal Specter
text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
flavor:
"Mystic shadow, bending near me, / Who art thou? / Whence come ye?"
—Stephen Crane, "Mystic shadow, bending near me"

name: Bog Rats
text: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.
flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.

name: Breeding Pit
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Breeding Pit unless you pay {B}{B}.
At the beginning of your end step, create a 0/1 black Thrull creature token.
flavor: The thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.

name: Deathgrip
text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.
flavor:
"Every forest is carpeted with the corpses of a thousand trees."
—Baron Sengir to Autumn Willow

name: Derelor
text: Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.
flavor:
"The derelor's greatest contribution to the Ebon Hand was the inspirational effect its creator's execution had upon the other thrull breeders."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore
text:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.
Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore can't be blocked except by Walls.
flavor: The highway of fear is the shortest route to defeat.

name: Fallen Angel
text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Angels are simply extensions of truth upon the fabric of life—and there is far more dark than light."
—Baron Sengir

name: Funeral March
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature.
flavor:
"Turn the key deftly in the oiled wards, And seal the hushed casket of my soul."
—John Keats, "To Sleep"

name: Greater Werewolf
text: At end of combat, put a -0/-2 counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Greater Werewolf.
flavor:
"Two legs by day, four legs by night, eyes raging in storm-gotten might."
—Ancient Northland riddle

name: Initiates of the Ebon Hand
text: {1}: Add {B}. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Initiates of the Ebon Hand at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor:
"We are no longer Nature's children, but her masters . . . ."
—Oath of the Ebon Hand

name: Kjeldoran Dead
text:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.
flavor:
"They shall drink sorrow's dregs. They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Knight of Stromgald
text:
Protection from white
{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Kjeldorans should rule supreme, and to the rest, death!"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Krovikan Fetish
text:
Enchant creature
When Krovikan Fetish enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
flavor: Some Krovikans find strength in the ears and eyes of their victims and wear such fetishes into battle.

name: Leshrac's Rite
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor:
"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Mind Ravel
text:
Target player discards a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor: An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.

name: Mind Warp
text: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
flavor: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.

name: Necrite
text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counterinsurgency.

name: Sengir Autocrat
text:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, create three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.
flavor:
"Evil is relative. Do sheep think any better of the shepherd?"
—Baron Sengir

name: Sorceress Queen
text: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"We have always counted time with sand; this pinch is your meaningless life."
—Nailah, self-proclaimed Queen of Rabiah

name: Stromgald Cabal
text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
flavor: When the alliance between Balduvia and Kjeldor deprived Stromgald of easy victories, its agents were forced to fuel their rituals with their own flesh.

name: The Wretched
text: At end of combat, gain control of all creatures blocking The Wretched for as long as you control The Wretched.
flavor:
Once I had the strength but no wisdom; now I have the wisdom but no strength.
—Persian proverb

name: Thrull Retainer
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice Thrull Retainer: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor:
"Until the Rebellion, thrulls served their masters faithfully—even at the cost of their own lives."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Torture
text:
Enchant creature
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor:
"It helps pass the time until you die."
—Grandmother Sengir

name: Touch of Death
text:
Touch of Death deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker. You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your life."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Ambush Party
text: First strike, haste
flavor:
"Fair fight? I'll take survival over chivalry any day!"
—Tor Wauki, Bandit King

name: Brassclaw Orcs
text: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
flavor:
"Modern Sarpadia's swarming with thrulls. It's a testament to the orcs that they've survived there so long."
—Elbieta, Argivian scholar

name: Conquer
text:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.
flavor:
"Every field watered in warriors' blood is sacred ground. Lay it not to waste, but claim it for our own—for glory, and for Stromgald!"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Dwarven Catapult
text: Dwarven Catapult deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among all creatures target opponent controls.
flavor:
"Often greatly outnumbered in battle, dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Dwarven Soldier
text: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Orc must die / Orc must die / Not an orc? / March on by."
—Dwarven marching song

name: Errantry
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can only attack alone.
flavor:
"There is no shame in solitude. The lone knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Fire Drake
text:
Flying
{R}: Fire Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: Brimstone marks this drake's territory. Unfortunately for travelers, all of the Burning Isles smell likewise.

name: Flame Spirit
text: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Flare
text:
Flare deals 1 damage to any target.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor: The secret of destruction is simple: everything burns.

name: Goblin Digging Team
text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
flavor:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

name: Goblin Hero
flavor:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back!"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran

name: Goblin War Drums
text: Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor:
"Goblins charge with a deafening war cry. The cry doesn't mean anything—it just drowns out the drums!"
—Reod Dai, mercenary

name: Goblin Warrens
text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
flavor:
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Imposing Visage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: With the horrible mask, Lagfrak the Low terrorized the countryside. But then he met Il-Chunt, the mask's model . . . .

name: Jokulhaups
text: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Keldon Warlord
text: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.
flavor: What if they threw a war, and *everybody* came?

name: Mountain Goat
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor:
"Folklore has it that to capture a mountain goat is a sign of divine blessing. I just know it's a sign that dinner is on the way."
—Klazina Jansdotter, Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

name: Orcish Captain
text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: There's a chance to win every battle.

name: Orcish Farmer
text: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller's next untap step.
flavor: There is no natural disaster quite like orcish farming.

name: Orgg
text:
Trample
Orgg can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.
Orgg can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.
flavor: It's bigger than it thinks.

name: Pyroblast
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's blue.
• Destroy target permanent if it's blue.
flavor:
"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Sabretooth Tiger
text: First strike
flavor:
"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans!"
—Norin the Wary

name: Stone Spirit
text: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Word of Blasting
text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's mana value to the Wall's controller.
flavor:
"Walls? What walls?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: An-Havva Constable
text: An-Havva Constable's toughness is equal to 1 plus the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
flavor:
"Joskun and the other constables serve with passion, if not with grace."
—Devin, faerie noble

name: Aurochs
text:
Trample
Whenever Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
flavor: One auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

name: Carapace
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor:
"Now *that's* a fashion statement."
—Devin, faerie noble

name: Cat Warriors
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: These stealthy felines have survived so many battles that some believe they must possess many lives.

name: Chub Toad
text: Whenever Chub Toad blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
Chub toad, chub toad At the door. Run away quick Or you'll run no more.
—Traditional children's rhyme

name: Craw Giant
text:
Trample
Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
flavor: Harthag gave a jolly laugh as he surveyed the army before him. "Ho ho ho! Midgets! You think you can stand in my way?"

name: Elder Druid
text: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor:
"Did clouds dance in his eyes, did thorns play at his fingertips?"
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard

name: Force of Nature
text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
flavor:
"It blinked, and flower petals fell like tears. Harthar, sensing weakness, attacked—and his blood fell like petals."
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard

name: Foxfire
text:
Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"Only the foolish fear foxfire."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Fyndhorn Elder
text: {T}: Add {G}{G}.
flavor:
"Do we know what we're doing? Yes—the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Ghazbán Ogre
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.
flavor:
"We were holding our own—until the ogre guiding us suddenly grinned and turned on our commander."
—Ivra Jursdotter, Sarpadian mercenary

name: Hungry Mist
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
flavor:
"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow priestess

name: Johtull Wurm
text: Whenever Johtull Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -2/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
flavor:
"To bring her down we must be on all sides at once—leave one avenue open and we'll all be dead."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

name: Lhurgoyf
text: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
flavor:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

name: Lifeforce
text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.
flavor:
"Every fallen tree nourishes a thousand seedlings."
—Autumn Willow to Baron Sengir

name: Nature's Lore
text: Search your library for a Forest card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor:
"It is in our nature to recognize beauty, but to repeat it—ah, that is another feat altogether."
—Hannah of Verdura

name: Pradesh Gypsies
text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."
—Lord Magnus of Llanowar

name: Primal Order
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals damage to that player equal to the number of nonbasic lands they control.
flavor:
"My sorrow: to dream of simple times, and wake in mine . . . ."
—Ola DaRiol, "Regrets"

name: Radjan Spirit
text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"Crawing, crawing, For my crowse crawing, I lost the best feather i' my wing For my crowse crawing."
—Anonymous Scottish ballad

name: Scaled Wurm
flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

name: Scavenger Folk
text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
flavor:
"Stoop, pick, turn, toss. This is the way we mourn our loss."
—Scavenger dirge

name: Shrink
text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"May you decrease like coal upon the hearth . . . Evaporate like water in a pail, Become as little as a linseed-grain . . . And so diminish that you come to nothing."
—Anglo-Saxon curse

name: Stampede
text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"When are beasts like a river?"
—*The One Thousand Questions*

name: Tarpan
text: When Tarpan dies, you gain 1 life.
flavor:
"A good tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Wanderlust
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor:
"How terrible to wander wishing only to escape oneself."
—Taysir

name: Wolverine Pack
text: Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
flavor:
"Give them great meals of beef and iron and steel, they will eat like wolves and fight like devils."
—William Shakespeare, *King Henry V*

name: Wyluli Wolf
text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary

name: Archangel
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor:
"My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike."
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Ardent Militia
text: Vigilance
flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.

name: Armored Pegasus
text: Flying
flavor: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.

name: Daraja Griffin
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.
flavor:
"And the flamingos said, 'Get out of our nest—we can't be seen with the likes of you!' So, the griffin ate them."
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

name: Ekundu Griffin
text: Flying, first strike
flavor:
"My goat was a small price to pay for the chance to see the hunting griffin dive and seize it."
—Suq'Ata trader

name: Enlightened Tutor
text: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.
flavor:
"I do not teach. I simply reveal."
—Daudi, Femeref tutor

name: Ethereal Champion
text: Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ethereal Champion this turn.
flavor:
"If I have learned anything as a wizard it is this: never fight your own battles."
—Waffa, sorcerer of Nyomba

name: Heavy Ballista
text: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor:
"Archers, ballistae—you can't even get near the island of Avenant."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Hero's Resolve
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+5.
flavor:
"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Infantry Veteran
text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor

name: Light of Day
text: Black creatures can't attack or block.
flavor:
"I do not miss sunlight. The very memory of it burns my eyes."
—Volrath

name: Longbow Archer
text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor:
"If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Roya, Zhalfirin archer

name: Pearl Dragon
text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Pearl Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"They knew Bantau was lost when, to hide the pearl he had found on the beach, he swallowed it—and soon grew wings."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Regal Unicorn
flavor: Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.

name: Remedy
text: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of targets, divided as you choose.
flavor:
"These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Reprisal
text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"The meek shall fight as one, and they shall overcome even the greatest of foes."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Resistance Fighter
text: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
flavor:
"My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Serenity
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all artifacts and enchantments. They can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"Just think of me as the storm before the calm."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Serra's Blessing
text: Creatures you control have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)
flavor:
"I have seen your strength imbued in angels' wings, and I have felt your sorrow rain down on the ruins brought by the Lord of the Wastes."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Standing Troops
text: Vigilance
flavor: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

name: Staunch Defenders
text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor:
"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Sunweb
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
flavor:
"There is no sweeter music than the wails of a dying dragon."
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Unyaro Griffin
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Unyaro Griffin: Counter target red instant or sorcery spell.
flavor: The griffin's shadow gives courage to the righteous and dread to the idle.

name: Warmth
text: Whenever an opponent casts a red spell, you gain 2 life.
flavor:
"Flame grows gentle with but a little distance."
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Browse
text: {2}{U}{U}: Look at the top five cards of your library, put one of them into your hand, and exile the rest.
flavor:
"Once great literature—now great litter."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Chill
text: Red spells cost {2} more to cast.
flavor:
"Temper, temper."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Daring Apprentice
text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
flavor: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.

name: Desertion
text: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.
flavor: First the insult, then the injury.

name: Dream Cache
text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.
flavor:
Dreams' riches are easily spent.
—Suq'Ata adage

name: Harmattan Efreet
text:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"One moment I was walking along the beach, and the next I was high in the air, staring into a hideous smiling face."
—Tarub, Suq'Ata sailor

name: Horned Turtle
flavor:
"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel

name: Insight
text: Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you draw a card.
flavor:
"We can fight with you or against you. After my day, I'd prefer the former."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Inspiration
text: Target player draws two cards.
flavor:
"Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Mystical Tutor
text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.
flavor:
"To the tutors, a 'poem of sand' was of little account, a 'poem of ivory,' priceless."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Polymorph
text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into their library.
flavor: "Ahh! Opposable digits!"

name: Prosperity
text: Each player draws X cards.
flavor:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kukemssa pirate

name: Psychic Transfer
text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.
flavor:
"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning."
—Kaervek

name: Relearn
text: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"Barrin taught me that the hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Sage Owl
text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor: The owl asks but never answers.

name: Soldevi Sage
text: {T}, Sacrifice two lands: Draw three cards, then discard one of them.
flavor:
"To hide the truth is more than folly—it is fatal."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

name: Spell Blast
text: Counter target spell with mana value X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)
flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

name: Storm Crow
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

name: Tidal Surge
text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
flavor:
"It is nature that gives us our boundaries and nature that enforces them."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Wind Drake
text: Flying
flavor:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake, *The Marriage of Heaven and Hell*

name: Abyssal Hunter
text: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature. Abyssal Hunter deals damage equal to Abyssal Hunter's power to that creature.
flavor: Some smiles show cheer; some merely show teeth.

name: Ashen Powder
text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
flavor:
"What you call decay, I call ripening. You'll gain no sustenance from this harvest."
—Kaervek

name: Blood Pet
text: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B}.
flavor: "You are wrong," Volrath said. "I do not hate the living. They often prove quite useful to me." And then he laughed.

name: Coercion
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor:
A rhino's bargain
—Femeref expression meaning "a situation with no choices"

name: Dread of Night
text: White creatures get -1/-1.
flavor:
"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel

name: Dry Spell
text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor:
"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow

name: Enfeeblement
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
flavor:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek

name: Fatal Blow
text: Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"What is crueler? To let a wound of the heart fester, or to simply cut it out?"
—Crovax

name: Feast of the Unicorn
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.
flavor:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the baron knows of one."
—Autumn Willow

name: Feral Shadow
text: Flying
flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.

name: Infernal Contract
text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
flavor:
"But I signed nothing!"
—Taraneh, Suq'Ata mage

name: Mischievous Poltergeist
text:
Flying
Pay 1 life: Regenerate Mischievous Poltergeist.
flavor:
"The past is a ghost that haunts you from the moment it exists until the moment you don't."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Painful Memories
text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.
flavor:
"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory."
—Jolrael

name: Perish
text: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Python
flavor:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Raise Dead
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

name: Razortooth Rats
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax

name: Strands of Night
text: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"I have seen the night torn into thin darkling strips and woven into shapes too bleak for dreams."
—Crovax

name: Stupor
text: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.
flavor:
There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.
—Suq'Ata saying

name: Vampiric Tutor
text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle and put that card on top. You lose 2 life.
flavor:
"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Aether Flash
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Aether Flash deals 2 damage to it.
flavor:
"You can't get there from here. Well, you can—it just won't be fun."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Anaba Shaman
text: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
"The shamans? Ha! They are craven cows not capable of true magic."
—Irini Sengir

name: Balduvian Barbarians
flavor:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an 'amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

name: Blaze
text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
flavor: Fire never dies alone.

name: Boil
text: Destroy all Islands.
flavor:
"The fishers will throw out their nets and draw them back filled with dust."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Crimson Hellkite
text:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana on X.
flavor:
"Dragonfire forged me a warrior."
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Fervor
text: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
flavor:
"If your blood doesn't run hot, I will make it run in the sands!"
—Maraxus of Keld

name: Final Fortune
text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
flavor:
Want all, lose all.
—Zhalfirin aphorism

name: Fit of Rage
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Anger is fleeting; remorse is eternal."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Goblin Recruiter
text: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards, reveal them, then shuffle and put those cards on top in any order.
flavor: "Next!"

name: Hulking Cyclops
text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.

name: Lightning Blast
text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to any target.
flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel

name: Reckless Embermage
text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to itself.
flavor: Many mages have been consumed by their work.

name: Shock
text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying

name: Spitting Drake
text:
Flying
{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: It prefers its meals cooked.

name: Talruum Minotaur
text: Haste
flavor:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying

name: Tremor
text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor:
"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimag, Femeref philosopher

name: Vertigo
text: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"I saw the wizard gesturing, but I didn't guess his plan until my aesthir cried out and went into a dive."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Viashino Warrior
flavor:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—*Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert*

name: Volcanic Dragon
text: Flying, haste
flavor: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

name: Volcanic Geyser
text: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to any target.
flavor:
My thunder comes before the lightning; my lightning comes before the clouds; my rain dries all the land it touches. What am I?
—Femeref riddle

name: Call of the Wild
text: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
flavor: Thinking of dinner made Squee realize that the forest was probably thinking the same thing.

name: Dense Foliage
text: Creatures can't be the targets of spells.
flavor:
"Big plants not only good for hidin', but full o' tasty bugs, too."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Early Harvest
text: Target player untaps all basic lands they control.
flavor:
"Tonight we'll eat a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Elven Cache
text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Elves know where to harvest the best of the forest, for they planted it there themselves.

name: Fallow Earth
text: Put target land on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
". . . and when the farmer awoke the next morning, all the seeds from his field were once again in their sacks."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Familiar Ground
text: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor:
"I'd rather fight on foreign soil. That way, if I lose I can blame it on the terrain."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Fyndhorn Brownie
text: {2}{G}, {T}: Untap target creature.
flavor:
"I've been insulted by drunks in a hundred inns, but never as skillfully or annoyingly as by those blasted brownies."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Gorilla Chieftain
text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
flavor:
"In the soil of leadership sprout the seeds of immortality."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper

name: Maro
text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: No two see the same Maro.

name: Nature's Resurgence
text: Each player draws a card for each creature card in their graveyard.
flavor:
Spring follows winter
—Elvish expression meaning "all things pass"

name: Panther Warriors
flavor: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

name: Redwood Treefolk
flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

name: River Boa
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
flavor:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Rowen
text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
flavor:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."
—Asmira, holy avenger

name: Trained Armodon
flavor: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.

name: Uktabi Orangutan
text: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
flavor:
"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Unseen Walker
text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{1}{G}{G}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.
flavor:
"To pass through the jungle: silence, courtesy, ferocity, as the occasion demands."
—Kamau, "Proper Passage"

name: Vitalize
text: Untap all creatures you control.
flavor:
"After waking to the magic of Llanowar, no dreams can compare."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Waiting in the Weeds
text: Each player creates a 1/1 green Cat creature token for each untapped Forest they control.
flavor: The trees have ears, eyes, and teeth.

name: Warthog
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor:
"Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits."
—Grebog, goblin swine-rider

name: Worldly Tutor
text: Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, then shuffle and put the card on top.
flavor:
"Aselbo soon had the rhino eating from his palm and the snake waiting at his heels."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Angelic Page
text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its messenger.

name: Blessed Reversal
text: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
flavor:
"A battle's outcome is never certain."
—The Southern Paladin

name: Breath of Life
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"Nothing can stop the power of life—not even death."
—Onean cleric

name: Cloudchaser Eagle
text:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Eagle enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
flavor: Most eagles hunt small animals. The cloudchasers hunt magic.

name: Crossbow Infantry
text: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: Twang. You're dead.

name: Eager Cadet
flavor: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the 'training' I needed."

name: Elite Archers
text: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: They fletch their arrows with the feathers of angels.

name: Gerrard's Wisdom
text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
flavor: A picture is worth a thousand swords.

name: Intrepid Hero
text: {T}: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
flavor: A fool knows no fear. A hero shows no fear.

name: Knight Errant
flavor: Knights are quick to pledge their loyalty and even quicker to charge into battle.

name: Knighthood
text: Creatures you control have first strike.
flavor: Kings don't make knights. Actions do.

name: Master Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: Her heart holds the pain of every soldier she's ever healed.

name: Purify
text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
flavor:
"We have no need for these trinkets. We need only the strength of our swords and the virtue of our hearts."
—The Northern Paladin

name: Razorfoot Griffin
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.

name: Reverse Damage
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
flavor: "Weapons usually bring death. Today, mine will bring life."

name: Rolling Stones
text: Wall creatures can attack as though they didn't have defender.
flavor:
"We spent three weeks trying to knock that wall down. Now it's knocking us down."
—Onean sergeant

name: Sacred Ground
text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
flavor: The land will never betray those who gave their lives for it.

name: Sacred Nectar
text: You gain 4 life.
flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed, And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"

name: Sanctimony
text: Whenever an opponent taps a Mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.
flavor: "The peasants labor for my profit. I approve."

name: Seasoned Marshal
text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
flavor: He reads the battlefield like a map, always seeking the shortest route to victory.

name: Serra Advocate
text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: An angel's blessing prepares a soldier for war better than a thousand military drills.

name: Skyshroud Falcon
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor: The earliest mystics believed that the falcon slit the sky to let the light break through.

name: Southern Paladin
text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target red permanent.
flavor:
"How can anyone fight so much yet enjoy it so little?"
—The Western Paladin

name: Starlight
text: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.
flavor:
"Even in the darkest night Stars and angels still shine bright."
—Onean children's rhyme

name: Sustainer of the Realm
text:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: You may break her shield, but you'll never break her spirit.

name: Vengeance
text: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor:
"It is the duty of the strong to oppose any who threaten the weak."
—The Southern Paladin

name: Worship
text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
flavor:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

name: Ancestral Memories
text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor:
"It's a poor sort of memory that only works backwards."
—Lewis Carroll,
*Through the Looking Glass*

name: Arcane Laboratory
text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
flavor:
Too many wizards spoil the spell, but too many spells spoil the wizard.
—Sign on entry to arcane lab

name: Archivist
text: {T}: Draw a card.
flavor: "Knowledge is a feast for the mind. Savor every swallow."

name: Baleful Stare
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.
flavor: He can drown you in his eyes.

name: Benthic Behemoth
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: The sea has many secrets, but some are too big to be kept.

name: Confiscate
text:
Enchant permanent
You control enchanted permanent.
flavor:
"The surface world contains nothing I cannot take."
—The Lord of Atlantis

name: Coral Merfolk
flavor: The coral merfolk delight in wrestling with their foes, skinning them alive on the razor-sharp edges of their reef.

name: Delusions of Mediocrity
text:
When Delusions of Mediocrity enters the battlefield, you gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves the battlefield, you lose 10 life.
flavor: When nothing but second best will do.

name: Equilibrium
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor:
Seek balance in all things—as long as the scales are weighted in your favor.
—Vodalian saying

name: Fighting Drake
text: Flying
flavor: Scholars in their ivory towers call them "sharks of the sky." Scholars on the road don't call them at all.

name: Fleeting Image
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"It was as if we fought a shadow."
—Onean soldier

name: Giant Octopus
flavor: The only thing that flows faster than water is fear.

name: Hibernation
text: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.
flavor: The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.

name: Levitation
text: Creatures you control have flying.
flavor: "We'll be easy targets if we remain on the ground. Let's take the fight to them."

name: Mana Breach
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land they control to its owner's hand.
flavor: The mana that binds the world together can also tear it apart.

name: Mana Short
text: Tap all lands target player controls and that player loses all unspent mana.
flavor:
"Remove their power, and their will to fight will follow."
—Tolarian wizard

name: Mawcor
text:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Neither head holds a brain—that's located somewhere in the chest—but four eyes aim much better than two.

name: Opportunity
text: Target player draws four cards.
flavor:
Little things like morals shouldn't hinder one's ambition.
—Pirate creed

name: Opposition
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor: Exhausting a wizard can be exhausting work.

name: Sleight of Hand
text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
flavor: "Most people believe magic is only a trick. Why change their minds?"

name: Telepathic Spies
text: When Telepathic Spies enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
flavor: Most spies sneak into enemy camps. These spies sneak into enemy minds.

name: Temporal Adept
text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Of course she's at the head of her class. All of her classmates have disappeared."
—Tolarian renegade

name: Tolarian Winds
text: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
flavor:
Why not ask the winds?
—Tolarian expression meaning "Who knows?"

name: Treasure Trove
text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
flavor: "Nope, there's nothing here either. You guys go on ahead, I'll catch up in a minute. . . . Whoo hoo!"

name: Vigilant Drake
text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.
flavor: It can stay aloft for weeks with little or no sleep.

name: Vizzerdrix
flavor: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made *that* mistake again.

name: Wall of Wonder
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{2}{U}{U}: Wall of Wonder gets +4/-4 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.
flavor: They wondered at the size of it. It wondered which to eat first.

name: Wind Dancer
text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: The sky is her stage.

name: Abyssal Horror
text:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
flavor:
"I dreamt of it once. Now I fear it dreams of me."
—Tolarian scholar

name: Befoul
text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: The bog's touch means death to all but the darkest of hearts.

name: Bereavement
text: Whenever a green creature dies, its controller discards a card.
flavor: Grief is a razor that slices the soul.

name: Crypt Rats
text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana on X.
flavor:
Beware anything born among the dead.
—Tolarian saying

name: Dakmor Lancer
text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

name: Dark Banishing
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"Hence 'banishèd' is banished from the world, / And the world's exile is death."
—William Shakespeare,
*Romeo and Juliet*

name: Darkest Hour
text: All creatures are black.
flavor: The eclipse made it clear whose side the sky was on.

name: Dregs of Sorrow
text: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.
flavor:
"We live for a thousand years. The death of even one brings untold sorrow."
—Elvish elder

name: Duress
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

name: Eastern Paladin
text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
flavor:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—The Southern Paladin

name: Engineered Plague
text:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
flavor: A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.

name: Foul Imp
text:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
flavor: The villagers call it "winged stench."

name: Fugue
text: Target player discards three cards.
flavor:
"It's hard to keep our own troops from fleeing when he's like this. How can our foes possibly stand against him?"
—Field marshal for the Eastern Paladin

name: Giant Cockroach
flavor: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

name: Hollow Dogs
text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

name: Howl from Beyond
text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Whether it howls for hunger or for joy, you're in trouble just the same.

name: Nausea
text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.

name: Nocturnal Raid
text: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The Eastern Paladin doesn't attack at night for the tactical advantage. He does it for the sheer joy of fighting beneath the moon.

name: Oppression
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards a card.
flavor:
"Defeating an enemy is not nearly as satisfying as watching one suffer."
—The Western Paladin

name: Ostracize
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: "You won't be needing this."

name: Persecute
text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.
flavor: "I want every last one of these tree-hugging, earth-loving, pointy-eared weaklings out of here. Now!"

name: Reprocess
text: Sacrifice any number of artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. Draw a card for each permanent sacrificed this way.
flavor: The battle's end is the meal's beginning.

name: Revenant
text:
Flying
Revenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
flavor: It eats death and drinks pain.

name: Serpent Warrior
text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
flavor: They're the fiercest of all the Western Paladin's soldiers. They're also the most fiercely loyal—but that loyalty comes at a price.

name: Stronghold Assassin
text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

name: Tainted Aether
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.
flavor: Pockets of Æther can be so foul they melt flesh from bone.

name: Western Paladin
