text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.
flavor:
"Expect nothing but scorn, flattery, and lies. And never turn your back on him."
—The Northern Paladin

name: Yawgmoth's Edict
text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor: The warping of bodies and souls has become the heart of Yawgmoth's existence.

name: Bedlam
text: Creatures can't block.
flavor: The generals were dead. The battle plans were forgotten. It was everyone for themselves.

name: Bloodshot Cyclops
text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.
flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.

name: Disorder
text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
flavor:
"Fire hurts them almost as much as the chaos that follows. Almost."
—The Western Paladin

name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
text: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: It deals damage equal to its power to any target.
flavor: The Ghitu believe their race was born of fire, and it's an honor to return to it.

name: Goblin Chariot
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

name: Goblin Gardener
text: When Goblin Gardener dies, destroy target land.
flavor: Years of attempts have brought the goblins no closer to growing a sausage tree.

name: Goblin Glider
text:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
flavor:
"What's got two arms, one wing, and no brains?"
—Ghitu riddle

name: Goblin Raider
text: Goblin Raider can't block.
flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do *two* things: hit *and* run.

name: Goblin Spelunkers
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: Goblins prefer caves to just about anything else. Caves prefer just about anything else to goblins.

name: Granite Grip
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.
flavor: "Let me introduce you to Rocky."

name: Impatience
text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't cast a spell this turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor: "I'm going to count to three. Three."

name: Ogre Taskmaster
text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
flavor: Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.

name: Pillage
text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"Burn their homes. Salt their lands. Nothing survives."
—The Western Paladin

name: Pygmy Pyrosaur
text:
Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb

name: Reflexes
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor:
"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

name: Storm Shaman
text: {R}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: She speaks with the voice of the winds, and the earth trembles.

name: Trained Orgg
flavor:
"That arm's for bashin'. That one's for smashin'. That one's for scratchin'. And that one . . . I don't know what that one's for."
—Orgg trainer

name: Volcanic Hammer
text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

name: Wildfire
text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
flavor: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a *big* appetite.

name: Anaconda
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: You'll never find an anaconda in a swamp. It will always find you first.

name: Ancient Silverback
text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.

name: Bull Hippo
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: The merfolk may rule the waters, but hippos have never had much respect for authority.

name: Compost
text: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.
flavor:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying

name: Elvish Lyrist
text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor: To an elf, magic and music are the same.

name: Gang of Elk
text: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor:
"I felt the ground shake, so I hid in my tent until the earthquake passed. It passed all right, and it left hoofprints."
—Femeref explorer

name: Lone Wolf
text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.

name: Monstrous Growth
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
flavor: Get in touch with your inner monster.

name: Nature's Revolt
text: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
flavor: The land rises up to defend against those who would spoil its beauty.

name: Pride of Lions
text: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
flavor: There's only one thing worse than a hungry lion—many hungry lions.

name: Reclaim
text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.

name: Seeker of Skybreak
text: {T}: Untap target creature.
flavor: Seekers spend their lives protecting a home they rarely visit.

name: Squall
text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
flavor:
"May the winds blow till they have wakened death. . . ."
—William Shakespeare,
*Othello*

name: Thorn Elemental
text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.

name: Thoughtleech
text: Whenever an Island an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
flavor:
"Their thoughts flow through my mind, and I am healed."
—Fyndhorn elder

name: Treefolk Seedlings
text: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
flavor:
Even the grandest forest begins with a single seedling.
—Llanowar saying

name: Untamed Wilds
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: No forest is so remote that the elves don't know its secrets.

name: Vernal Bloom
text: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.
flavor: Spring breathes the magic of new life.

name: Wild Growth
text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.
flavor: If you stop to listen, you can hear it grow.

name: Wing Snare
text: Destroy target creature with flying.
flavor: The elves long ago mastered the art of hunting with nets. They call it "fishing the sky."

name: Wood Elves
text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.

name: Sea Eagle
text: Flying
flavor: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.

name: Aven Flock
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{W}: Aven Flock gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Just as each added feather steadies the wing, so does the flock grow stronger with each new member.

name: Silverback Ape
flavor: It does not wear a crown or sit on a throne of gold, but those who have witnessed its power hail it nonetheless.

name: Blinding Angel
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips their next combat phase.
flavor: "Their eyes will shrivel and blacken before faith's true light."

name: Chastise
text: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its power.
flavor:
"Why do we pray to the Ancestor? Because She listens."
—Mystic elder

name: Diving Griffin
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor:
To outrace the griffin
—Kipamu expression meaning "to do the impossible"

name: Elite Javelineer
text: Whenever Elite Javelineer blocks, it deals 1 damage to target attacking creature.
flavor: "Precision is frequently more valuable than force."

name: Glory Seeker
flavor: The turning of the tide always begins with one soldier's decision to head back into the fray.

name: Ivory Mask
text: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: Made from its wearer's hopes, the mask ensures that those hopes will be fulfilled.

name: Master Decoy
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor: A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again.

name: Noble Purpose
text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
flavor: Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.

name: Oracle's Attendants
text: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.
flavor: The future isn't sacred, but its speaker is.

name: Peach Garden Oath
text: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.
flavor:
"We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood. . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."
—Peach Garden Oath

name: Rain of Blades
text: Rain of Blades deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
flavor: Some say they are the weapons of heroes fallen in battle, eager for one last chance at glory.

name: Redeem
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to up to two target creatures.
flavor:
"Let me redeem my brothers both from death."
—William Shakespeare, *Titus Andronicus*

name: Solidarity
text: Creatures you control get +0/+5 until end of turn.
flavor:
"We must all hang together, or assuredly we shall all hang separately."
—Benjamin Franklin

name: Sword Dancer
text: {W}{W}: Target attacking creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
flavor: Most soldiers think of the sword as a weapon. In the hands of Zho monks, swords are also the strongest of shields.

name: Balance of Power
text: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.
flavor:
"To empty your mind is to fill your grave."
—Lat-Nam teaching

name: Bribery
text: Search target opponent's library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles.
flavor: In Mercadia City, loyalties extend only as far as your purse can stretch.

name: Catalog
text: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
flavor:
Though those who study are as many as the hairs on an ox, those who succeed are as rare as unicorns' horns.
—Chinese proverb

name: Coastal Hornclaw
text: Sacrifice a land: Coastal Hornclaw gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Jamuraan farmers fear three things above all else: droughts, floods, and hornclaws.

name: Coastal Piracy
text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
flavor: "I don't like to think of myself as a pirate. I'm more like a stimulator of the local economy."

name: Concentrate
text: Draw three cards.
flavor: "The treasure in my mind is greater than any worldly glory."

name: Coral Eel
flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

name: Cowardice
text: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)
flavor:
"Cowards die many times before their deaths; The valiant never taste of death but once."
—William Shakespeare, *Julius Caesar*

name: Curiosity
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
flavor: "You know that secret? The one that wakes you up at night in a cold sweat? The one you think no one else in the world knows? Well, guess what."

name: Flash Counter
text: Counter target instant spell.
flavor: "So much for that bright idea!"

name: Index
text: Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor: "Let's see . . . Mercadia, mercenary, merfolk . . . you know, I really need a better filing system."

name: Intruder Alarm
text:
Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, untap all creatures.
flavor: One footstep among many is silent. One footstep alone is deafening.

name: Invisibility
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by Walls.
flavor: Verick held his breath. Breathing wouldn't reveal his position, but it would force him to smell the goblins.

name: Merchant of Secrets
text: When Merchant of Secrets enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: To scrape out a living in Aphetto, wizards are reduced to selling rumors, lies, forgeries, or—if they get desperate enough—the truth.

name: Merchant Scroll
text: Search your library for a blue instant card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Lat-Nam wizards trade knowledge on scrolls made of magic so they can better guard against thieves and spies.

name: Rewind
text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.
flavor: "Let's go over this one more time. . . ."

name: Sage of Lat-Nam
text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.
flavor: Within each device is a spark of its creator's soul. Within each sage is a lamp that awaits that spark.

name: Shifting Sky
text:
As Shifting Sky enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All nonland permanents are the chosen color.
flavor:
Master the sky and you rule everything beneath it.
—Metathran saying

name: Sneaky Homunculus
text: Sneaky Homunculus can't block or be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater.
flavor: Keep watch only for the giants and you'll be eaten by the ants.

name: Tidal Kraken
text: Tidal Kraken can't be blocked.
flavor: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.

name: Trade Routes
text:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.
flavor: The wise, the righteous, the mighty—the merchant feeds them all.

name: Wrath of Marit Lage
text:
When Wrath of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all red creatures.
Red creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
flavor:
"Marit Lage lies frozen in a glacier's heart. Still her dreams take form in our world, stealing the heat from our souls."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Ambition's Cost
text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
flavor: "Knowledge demands sacrifice."

name: Carrion Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Carrion Wall.
flavor: A wall built from the bodies of the enemy will never lack building material in times of war.

name: Death Pit Offering
text:
When Death Pit Offering enters the battlefield, sacrifice all creatures you control.
Creatures you control get +2/+2.
flavor:
"Kill them all and feed them to the new recruits."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Death Pits of Rath
text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the *sudden* extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan."
—Edgar Allan Poe,
"The Pit and the Pendulum"

name: Deathgazer
text: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor: Your entire life passes before its eyes.

name: Deepwood Ghoul
text: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.
flavor: They feed on the living to stay undead.

name: Execute
text:
Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Gluttonous Zombie
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.

name: Larceny
text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
flavor:
Opportunity makes the thief.
—Roman proverb

name: Maggot Carrier
text: When Maggot Carrier enters the battlefield, each player loses 1 life.
flavor:
"We do not suddenly fall on death, but advance towards it by slight degrees; we die every day."
—Seneca, *Epistles*, trans. Gummere

name: Mind Slash
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: "I can't think with all that screaming."

name: Mind Sludge
text: Target player discards a card for each Swamp you control.
flavor: When you get into the swamp, the swamp gets into you.

name: Murderous Betrayal
text: {B}{B}, Pay half your life, rounded up: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: Which hurts more: a sword in the gut or a dagger in the back?

name: Phyrexian Arena
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.

name: Phyrexian Plaguelord
text:
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Plaguelord: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The final stage of the illness: delirium, convulsions, and death."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Plague Wind
text: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy."
—*Keld Triumphant*

name: Primeval Shambler
text: {B}: Primeval Shambler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: His mind, like his body, is made up of the swamp's flotsam.

name: Sever Soul
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor:
"The mortal world is a grove of sweet fruit, and I am ready to harvest it."
—Fallen angel

name: Slay
text:
Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
flavor: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.

name: Swarm of Rats
text: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.
flavor:
"Rats, rats, rats Hundreds, thousands, millions of them, and every one a life."
—Bram Stoker, *Dracula*

name: Vicious Hunger
text: Vicious Hunger deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
flavor: Only the most ravenous soul feeds on the health of the weak.

name: Warped Devotion
text: Whenever a permanent is returned to a player's hand, that player discards a card.
flavor:
"The spirit of the devout is easily crushed by the loss of hope."
—Fallen angel

name: Zombify
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder

name: Canyon Wildcat
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: In the warrior kingdom of Keld, the cats used in the hunt are prized for their tracking sense and ability to climb walls.

name: Cinder Wall
text:
Defender
When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
flavor:
"The smell of roasted flesh hung over the valley for hours."
—Onean sergeant

name: Enrage
text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "You wouldn't like me when I'm angry."

name: Flashfires
text: Destroy all Plains.
flavor: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.

name: Lesser Gargadon
text: Whenever Lesser Gargadon attacks or blocks, sacrifice a land.
flavor:
"In some cultures, elephants are ridden by those in power. I don't think a mere elephant would even be noticed in Keld."
—Onean sergeant

name: Mogg Sentry
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Tortured with magic by their masters, the moggs are enflamed by the smell of sorcery.

name: Obliterate
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"The enemy has been destroyed, sir. So have the forest, the city, your palace, your dog . . ."
—Keldon soldier

name: Orcish Spy
text: {T}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.
flavor:
"You idiot! Never let the spies mingle with the orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight!"
—General Khurzog

name: Panic Attack
text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
flavor: Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.

name: Ridgeline Rager
text: {R}: Ridgeline Rager gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: While armies battled across Jamuraa, beasts stalked the high places looking for victims.

name: Rukh Egg
text: When Rukh Egg dies, create a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: Called "stonefeathers" by many lowlanders, rukhs are thought to descend from a phoenix that sacrificed its flame for a body of stone.

name: Searing Wind
text: Searing Wind deals 10 damage to any target.
flavor:
"The first wind of ascension is Forger, burning away impurity."
—*Keld Triumphant*

name: Shock Troops
text: Sacrifice Shock Troops: It deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: War is a conflict that determines not who is right—but who is left.

name: Sizzle
text: Sizzle deals 3 damage to each opponent.
flavor:
"Of course you should fight fire with fire. You should fight *everything* with fire."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Viashino Sandstalker
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
flavor:
"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—*Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert*

name: Choke
text: Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
flavor:
"One day we shall walk where once was water."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Collective Unconscious
text: Draw a card for each creature you control.
flavor: "The beasts of the wild are my senses. It is through their eyes that all knowledge shall come to me."

name: Elvish Pioneer
text: When Elvish Pioneer enters the battlefield, you may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
flavor: "Destruction is the work of an afternoon. Creation is the work of a lifetime."

name: Elvish Scrapper
text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Scrapper: Destroy target artifact.
flavor: "The stories tell of a distant time when machines overran the forests, destroying everything that lived. That time will not come again."

name: Emperor Crocodile
text: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
flavor: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.

name: Fecundity
text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller may draw a card.
flavor: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.

name: Fertile Ground
text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.
flavor:
"The love of nature . . . is a furious, burning, physical greed. . . ."
—Mary Webb, *The House in Dormer Forest*

name: Foratog
text: {G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Foratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Five hundred years to grow—barely a minute to eat.

name: Giant Badger
text: Whenever Giant Badger blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Disturb a sleeping badger and the snapping of your bones will awaken the countryside.

name: Horned Troll
text: {G}: Regenerate Horned Troll.
flavor: Sword hilts jut from some trolls' bodies where wounds healed so fast that the weapons were trapped inside.

name: Living Terrain
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a 5/6 green Treefolk creature that's still a land.
flavor: Some warriors walk the earth. Others are born of it.

name: Llanowar Behemoth
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Llanowar Behemoth gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Most people can't build decent weapons out of stone or steel. Trust the elves to do it with only mud and vines."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Moss Monster
flavor: After the battle, an eerie silence gripped the forest. The losers' remains were lightly dusted with green.

name: Nantuko Disciple
text: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
Unanswered prayers are themselves answers.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Natural Affinity
text: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.

name: Norwood Ranger
flavor: The song of the forest is in perfect harmony. If a single note is out of place, the elves will find its source.

name: Plow Under
text: Put two target lands on top of their owners' libraries.
flavor:
To renew the land, plow the land.
To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying

name: Primeval Force
text: When Primeval Force enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three Forests.
flavor: It has germinated in the earth for thousands of years. Finally it wakes to the battle's call.

name: Revive
text: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Even what is lost beyond recall returns when coaxed by a dryad's hand.

name: Vine Trellis
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Add {G}.
flavor: Nature twists knots stronger than any rope.

name: Blessed Orator
text: Other creatures you control get +0/+1.
flavor:
"He spoke with the tongue of Angels; we fought with the strength of lions."
—Handel, infantry soldier

name: Foot Soldiers
flavor: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

name: Inspirit
text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The hour of your redemption is here. . . . Rally to me. . . . rise and strike. Strike at every favorable opportunity. For your homes and hearths, strike!"
—General Douglas MacArthur, to the people of the Philippines

name: Kami of Old Stone
flavor:
"There was a wall here. Now it is dust. A tower rose here. Now it is fallen. An army fought here. Now it is dead. A spirit was here. It is all that remains."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Leonin Skyhunter
text: Flying
flavor: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.

name: Marble Titan
text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
flavor: It entered the temple with all the pomp and decorum of a rock hitting a goblin's skull.

name: Mending Hands
text: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor:
"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

name: Peace of Mind
text: {W}, Discard a card: You gain 3 life.
flavor:
"What can a peasant get for free that an emperor can never buy?"
—Dal riddle

name: Veteran Cavalier
text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor:
Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone.
—Arabian proverb

name: Zealous Inquisitor
text: {1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zealous Inquisitor this turn is dealt to target creature instead.
flavor: Wine and balm for the confessions of the repentant. Razors and irons for the confessions of the unrepentant.

name: Annex
text:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
You control enchanted land.
flavor: You should see how small the map is.

name: Battle of Wits
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 200 or more cards in your library, you win the game.
flavor: The wizard who reads a thousand books is powerful. The wizard who memorizes a thousand books is insane.

name: Dream Prowler
text: Dream Prowler can't be blocked as long as it's attacking alone.
flavor:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath

name: Exhaustion
text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.
flavor: Tired doesn't even begin to cover it.

name: Imaginary Pet
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have a card in hand, return Imaginary Pet to its owner's hand.
flavor: "It followed me home. Can I keep it?"

name: Sea's Claim
text:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
Enchanted land is an Island.
flavor:
"Who's the crazy one now!?"
—Torgle, mountaintop boatmaker

name: Time Ebb
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

name: Wanderguard Sentry
text: When Wanderguard Sentry enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
flavor: It allows those with dangerous weapons to pass. But not those with dangerous thoughts.

name: Withering Gaze
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You draw a card for each Forest and green card in it.
flavor: "Nature cares not for the knowledge to be gained from its study. Better to bleed it dry, lest its potential be wasted on lizards and leaves."

name: Blackmail
text: Target player reveals three cards from their hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.
flavor: In addition to killing peasants, punishing subordinates, and raising an army of nightmares, Braids somehow found time for her favorite hobby: petty extortion.

name: Final Punishment
text: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to that player this turn.
flavor: The pain of a lifetime—every scrape, illness, and bruise—condensed into a single moment.

name: Mindslicer
text: When Mindslicer dies, each player discards their hand.
flavor: It *is* the thing that goes bump in the night.

name: Phyrexian Gargantua
text: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
flavor: Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua.

name: Anarchist
text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.

name: Boiling Seas
text: Destroy all Islands.
flavor: What burns the land, boils the seas.

name: Flame Wave
text: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker and each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.
flavor:
"I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Flowstone Crusher
text: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"What's better than smashing things with a rock? A rock that gets up and smashes things for you."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith

name: Flowstone Shambler
text: {R}: Flowstone Shambler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: Flowstone troops are notoriously difficult to keep in formation.

name: Goblin Brigand
text: Goblin Brigand attacks each combat if able.
flavor: Like a loaded cannon—point and shoot.

name: Goblin Mountaineer
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: The only thing worse than a goblin is a goblin that knows his way around.

name: Kird Ape
text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.
flavor: It puts the "fur" in "fury."

name: Rogue Kavu
text: Whenever Rogue Kavu attacks alone, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Every litter of kavu yields one cub that refuses to hunt with the pack.

name: Seething Song
text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}.
flavor:
"The purest ore is produced from the hottest furnace, and the brightest thunder-bolt is elicited from the darkest storm."
—Charles Colton

name: Thundermare
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
flavor: Its hooves strike lightning and the thunder follows quickly after.

name: Whip Sergeant
text: {R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack this turn.)
flavor: Keldon soldiers learn to move faster than the whip.

name: Biorhythm
text: Each player's life total becomes the number of creatures they control.
flavor:
"I have seen life's purpose, and now it is my own."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

name: Elvish Bard
text: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.
flavor: Helplessly drawn in, the bard's enemies quickly find there's more than song to be found.

name: Elvish Warrior
flavor: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."

name: Groundskeeper
text: {1}{G}: Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "Soldiers speak of defending the soil, but they care only for their nations. I care nothing for their nations and everything for the soil."

name: King Cheetah
text: Flash
flavor:
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a king cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom

name: Needle Storm
text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.
flavor: The rain is driven like nails.

name: Order of the Sacred Bell
flavor: "My brother, it may now be time to ring the bell and put out the call for aid."

name: River Bear
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: The bears had been isolated on an island for hundreds of years, until the island sank and the bears didn't.

name: Silklash Spider
text:
Reach
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.
flavor: The only thing that flies over the Krosan Forest is the wind.

name: Tree Monkey
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: The vines and branches of the jungle canopy are all the wings it needs.

name: Utopia Tree
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor: The fruit of this fabled tree takes on the flavor of whatever food you love most.

name: Weird Harvest
text: Each player may search their library for up to X creature cards, reveal those cards, put them into their hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Krosa's distorted groves bear strange fruit.

name: Zodiac Monkey
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: It lives mainly on fruit, leaves, and the occasional nose.

name: Act of Heroism
text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+2 until end of turn and can block an additional creature this turn.
flavor:
"On every plane, there are those who run toward danger."
—Gideon Jura

name: Akroma, Angel of Wrath
text: Flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, haste, protection from black and from red
flavor: "Wrath is no vice when inflicted upon the deserving."

name: Akroma's Vengeance
text:
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: "Many must die for the one who should not have perished."

name: Auramancer
text: When Auramancer enters the battlefield, you may return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "In memories, we can find our deepest reserves of strength."

name: Cloudshift
text: Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.
flavor:
"Even storm clouds bow to worship Avacyn."
—Elder Rimheit

name: Congregate
text: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.
flavor:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—*Song of All*, canto 642

name: Darien, King of Kjeldor
text: Whenever you're dealt damage, you may create that many 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
flavor:
"With his dream of unification fulfilled, Darien became the last king of Kjeldor. Those who followed were known as the kings of New Argive."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

name: Dauntless Cathar
text: {1}{W}, Exile Dauntless Cathar from your graveyard: Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: "The harder they try to extinguish my faith, the brighter it burns in the darkness."

name: Disenchant
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor:
"The tools of evil are mere things. And like all things, they cannot last forever."
—*Song of All*, canto 881

name: Geist of the Moors
text: Flying
flavor:
"The battle is won. There's work to be done. / The Blessed Sleep must wait. / A fiend is about. It stalks the devout. / I'll save them from my fate."
—"The Good Geist's Vow"

name: Griffin Protector
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Griffin Protector gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The drums of war stir the hearts of all who fight for righteousness.

name: Kongming, "Sleeping Dragon"
text: Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: "Such a lord as this—all virtues' height— Had never been, nor ever was again."

name: Kor Firewalker
text:
Protection from red
Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
flavor: "A river of lava is just another river to cross."

name: Lunarch Mantle
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{1}, Sacrifice a permanent: This creature gains flying until end of turn."
flavor:
"A boon from the angels should never be cast aside."
—Manfried Ulmach, Chief Inquisitor

name: Nyx-Fleece Ram
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 1 life.
flavor: The gods are fascinated by innocence, perhaps because it's a quality they themselves lack.

name: Path of Peace
text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
flavor: As Hedrax stepped into oblivion, he welcomed the unwavering silence.

name: Promise of Bunrei
text: When a creature you control dies, sacrifice Promise of Bunrei. If you do, create four 1/1 colorless Spirit creature tokens.
flavor: "I am not afraid to die today nor afraid of what death will bring."

name: Renewed Faith
text:
You gain 6 life.
Cycling {1}{W} ({1}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Renewed Faith, you may gain 2 life.
flavor: Skepticism fades in the face of the miraculous.

name: Rest in Peace
text:
When Rest in Peace enters the battlefield, exile all graveyards.
If a card or token would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, exile it instead.
flavor: Some corpses the Golgari cannot claim. Some souls the Orzhov cannot shackle.

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
text:
First strike
Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
flavor: "Thraben is our home and I will not see it fall to this unhallowed horde."

name: Urbis Protector
text: When Urbis Protector enters the battlefield, create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying.
flavor:
"Guilds be damned. We can fend for ourselves."
—Vennick of the Gateless

name: Whitemane Lion
text:
Flash
When Whitemane Lion enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Saltfield nomads call a sudden storm a "whitemane."

name: Accumulated Knowledge
text: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Accumulated Knowledge in all graveyards.
flavor:
"I have seen and heard much here. There are secrets within secrets. Let me show you."
—Takara, to Eladamri

name: Bident of Thassa
text:
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
{1}{U}, {T}: Creatures your opponents control attack this turn if able.
flavor: The wills of mortals shift as the tide ebbs and flows.

name: Blue Elemental Blast
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target red spell.
• Destroy target red permanent.
flavor: Nothing escapes a sharp mind.

name: Blue Sun's Zenith
text: Target player draws X cards. Shuffle Blue Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
flavor:
"The Origin Query will wait. We must ensure we survive to return to it."
—Pelyus, vedalken ordinar

name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
flavor: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.

name: Brine Elemental
text:
Morph {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Brine Elemental is turned face up, each opponent skips their next untap step.
flavor: Water calls to water, and the world is left exhausted and withered in its wake.

name: Coralhelm Guide
text: {4}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
flavor:
"She knows every step of this coastline, both above and below the surface, and she has hideouts all along the way. She will get you there."
—Jori En, expedition leader

name: Cursecatcher
text: Sacrifice Cursecatcher: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor: "Of all the things that can be stolen, opportunity is the most valuable."

name: Exclude
text:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Terrifying, but thankfully temporary."
—Teferi

name: Flash
text: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, sacrifice it unless you pay its mana cost reduced by up to {2}.
flavor: No tactic transforms a battle like a well-timed carnivore.

name: Freed from the Real
text:
Enchant creature
{U}: Tap enchanted creature.
{U}: Untap enchanted creature.
flavor: When a strong mind moves, form and energy shift to heed it.

name: Jalira, Master Polymorphist
text: {2}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonlegendary creature card. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
flavor: "You can become anything if I just put my mind to it."

name: Man-o'-War
text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Murder of Crows
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature dies, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
flavor: Even more than carrion, they crave the last words of the dying.

name: Mystic of the Hidden Way
text:
Mystic of the Hidden Way can't be blocked.
Morph {2}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: "There are no obstacles, only different paths."

name: Pact of Negation
text:
Counter target spell.
At the beginning of your next upkeep, pay {3}{U}{U}. If you don't, you lose the game.
flavor: Those who expect betrayal at every turn are seldom disappointed.

name: Phantasmal Bear
text: When Phantasmal Bear becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor:
"You know it to be false, but when its claws find you, what you know won't matter much at all."
—Pol Jamaar, illusionist

name: Retraction Helix
text: Until end of turn, target creature gains "{T}: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand."
flavor: Where the geometries of the world collapse, a master of the aether can harvest power beyond comprehending.

name: Totally Lost
text: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.
flavor: Fblthp had always hated crowds.

name: Twisted Image
text:
Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"True strength is in the mind, for the body is too malleable a form."
—Politus, vedalken emisar

name: Ancient Craving
text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
flavor: Knowledge demands sacrifice.

name: Bloodhunter Bat
text:
Flying
When Bloodhunter Bat enters the battlefield, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
flavor: It returns eager to share the feast of blood and gore with its ghoulish master.

name: Caustic Tar
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target player loses 3 life."
flavor: The spite of the Cabal turns meadow into mire.

name: Death's-Head Buzzard
text:
Flying
When Death's-Head Buzzard dies, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: Infested with vermin, ever hungering, dropping from night's sky.

name: Dusk Legion Zealot
text: When Dusk Legion Zealot enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor: Once they reached Orazca, the Legion's explorers ransacked tombs and temples, hunting for the Immortal Sun.

name: Erg Raiders
text: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.
flavor: Their skills are extensive, and their appetite for battle just as vast.

name: Hell's Caretaker
text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate only during your upkeep.
flavor: "The rules are clear. If you want to leave, you need only convince another to take your place."

name: Horror of the Broken Lands
text:
Whenever you cycle or discard another card, Horror of the Broken Lands gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: It feeds on dry bones in the sand and desperate pleas in the wind.

name: Ihsan's Shade
text: Protection from white
flavor: No mortal could atone for Ihsan's betrayal. Redemption required him to become something else.

name: Laquatus's Champion
text:
When Laquatus's Champion enters the battlefield, target player loses 6 life.
When Laquatus's Champion leaves the battlefield, that player gains 6 life.
{B}: Regenerate Laquatus's Champion.
flavor: Chainer's dark gift to a darker soul.

name: Murder
text: Destroy target creature.
flavor:
"No matter how busy my schedule gets, I always try to take time for that personal touch."
—Queen Marchesa

name: Nezumi Cutthroat
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Nezumi Cutthroat can't block.
flavor:
"The nezumi will do things for money no other thinking creature would consider. This, of course, makes them useful beyond words."
—Meloku the Clouded Mirror

name: Phyrexian Ghoul
text: Sacrifice a creature: Phyrexian Ghoul gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Phyrexia wastes nothing. Its food chain is a spiraling cycle.

name: Phyrexian Obliterator
text:
Trample
Whenever a source deals damage to Phyrexian Obliterator, that source's controller sacrifices that many permanents.
flavor:
"Behold blessed perfection."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Ratcatcher
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Rat card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: An ogre's poisonous stench is like fine Kashkaval cheese to the noses lowest to the ground.

name: Ravenous Chupacabra
text: When Ravenous Chupacabra enters the battlefield, destroy target creature an opponent controls.
flavor: Opening Orazca unleashed more horrors than just the Immortal Sun.

name: Street Wraith
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Cycling—Pay 2 life. (Pay 2 life, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: The lamps on Wyndmoor Street snuff themselves at midnight and refuse to relight, afraid to illuminate what lies in the darkness.

name: Undead Gladiator
text:
{1}{B}, Discard a card: Return Undead Gladiator from your graveyard to your hand. Activate only during your upkeep.
Cycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: The Cabal loves encores.

name: Vampire Lacerator
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life unless an opponent has 10 or less life.
flavor: The lacerators cut themselves before each hunt. They must feed before the sun rises or bleed to death.

name: Zulaport Cutthroat
text: Whenever Zulaport Cutthroat or another creature you control dies, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor: "Eldrazi? Ha! Try walking through Zulaport at night with your pockets full. Now *that's* dangerous."

name: Act of Treason
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
flavor:
"Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Balduvian Horde
text: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
flavor:
"We earn no medals and fight for no titles. Blood is proof of our victory."
—Lovisa Coldeyes

name: Ball Lightning
text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.
flavor: The most frightening storms are those not woven by nature's hand.

name: Browbeat
text: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to them. If no one does, target player draws three cards.
flavor:
"Even the threat of power has power."
—Jeska, warrior adept

name: Chandra's Outrage
text: Chandra's Outrage deals 4 damage to target creature and 2 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor: Chandra never believed in using her "inside voice."

name: Cinder Storm
text: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to any target.
flavor: Any pyromancer can summon fire with a thought. The trick is putting it out.

name: Crimson Mage
text: {R}: Target creature you control gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
flavor:
"We wield the fires of rage. War is our blood and destruction our birthright."
—Crimson creed

name: Eidolon of the Great Revel
text: Whenever a player casts a spell with mana value 3 or less, Eidolon of the Great Revel deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor: Xenagos reveled while Theros burned.

name: Enthralling Victor
text: When Enthralling Victor enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power 2 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
flavor: If you stare at the sun for too long, you'll lose your ability to see clearly.

name: Frenzied Goblin
text: Whenever Frenzied Goblin attacks, you may pay {R}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.
flavor: The upside to not thinking about the consequences is that you'll always surprise those who do.

name: Hordeling Outburst
text: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
flavor:
"Leave no scraps, lest you attract pests."
—Mardu threat

name: Humble Defector
text: {T}: Draw two cards. Target opponent gains control of Humble Defector. Activate only during your turn.
flavor:
"You were once Mardu, so your body and will are strong. Now we must train your mind."
—Houn, Jeskai elder

name: Jackal Pup
text: Whenever Jackal Pup is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.
flavor: The first morning after acquiring her familiar, the wizard awoke with fleabites and mange.

name: Kindle
text: Kindle deals X damage to any target, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.
flavor: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.

name: Magus of the Wheel
text: {1}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Magus of the Wheel: Each player discards their hand, then draws seven cards.
flavor: "Fate is not as fixed as you might think."

name: Mogg Flunkies
text: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.
flavor: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.

name: Pyre Hound
text:
Trample
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Pyre Hound.
flavor: Its growl is the crackling and popping of a wildfire untamed.

name: Red Elemental Blast
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target blue spell.
• Destroy target blue permanent.
flavor: Nothing restrains a burning passion.

name: Simian Spirit Guide
text: Exile Simian Spirit Guide from your hand: Add {R}.
flavor:
"It's rarely worth questioning where the mana comes from. Just be grateful."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Soulbright Flamekin
text: {2}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, you may add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}.
flavor: When provoked, a flamekin's inner fire burns far hotter than any giant's forge.

name: Spikeshot Goblin
text: {R}, {T}: Spikeshot Goblin deals damage equal to its power to any target.
flavor:
"Proximity discouraged. Do not approach."
—Vulshok field guide

name: Thresher Lizard
text: Thresher Lizard gets +1/+2 as long as you have one or fewer cards in hand.
flavor: The sound of its plated tail beating on desert rocks is often mistaken for the footfalls of a much larger predator.

name: Trumpet Blast
text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack. They need signals to tell them when to stop.

name: Uncaged Fury
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
flavor:
"It's right to fear those that you keep locked away."
—Rahilda, Vildin-Pack alpha

name: Zada, Hedron Grinder
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada, Hedron Grinder, copy that spell for each other creature you control that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.
flavor: "A hedron holds magic for a thousand years—or less, if need be."

name: Ambassador Oak
text: When Ambassador Oak enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
flavor: Treefolk and elves share a common interest in the forests, but really the elves just feel at home with the view from above.

name: Azusa, Lost but Seeking
text: You may play two additional lands on each of your turns.
flavor: "I do not miss Jukai Forest. It is not my home. My home is Kamigawa, its people my family. Wherever I set my pack and rest my head, I am home."

name: Colossal Dreadmaw
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor: If you feel the ground quake, run. If you hear its bellow, flee. If you see its teeth, it's too late.

name: Echoing Courage
text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: A single seed unleashes a flurry of growth.

name: Ember Weaver
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
As long as you control a red permanent, Ember Weaver gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
flavor:
"Each night, the sun unravels and blows away. Each day, the spiders set a new one in the sky."
—Sunseeder myth

name: Epic Confrontation
text: Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
flavor: No matter the timeline, some legends will endure.

name: Giant Growth
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Only the most effective tactics stand the test of time."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder

name: Kavu Predator
text:
Trample
Whenever an opponent gains life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Kavu Predator.
flavor: In a withered world, the scent of healthy prey is enough to drive a predator to frenzy.

name: Krosan Colossus
text: Morph {6}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: When it walked, it altered geography. When it bellowed, it changed the weather.

name: Living Wish
text: You may reveal a creature or land card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand. Exile Living Wish.
flavor: The best wishes include the will to tame their consequences.

name: Lull
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: The clamor of war ceased as both armies stood and marveled at the beauty of Gaea's work.

name: Nettle Sentinel
text:
Nettle Sentinel doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you cast a green spell, you may untap Nettle Sentinel.
flavor: Though Shadowmoor's monster-haunted wilds beckon, she never leaves her post.

name: Plummet
text: Destroy target creature with flying.
flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid

name: Presence of Gond
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token."
flavor: "Here lies Gond, hero of Safehold Taldwen. May he ever guide our quest."

name: Protean Hulk
text: When Protean Hulk dies, search your library for any number of creature cards with total mana value 6 or less, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor:
"Meat *and* eggs. We eat!"
—Borborygmos

name: Stampede Driver
text: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor: "The thunder of hooves is music to my ears."

name: Timberpack Wolf
text: Timberpack Wolf gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control named Timberpack Wolf.
flavor:
"The need for the pack is bred in their bones. Their true strength will not show itself for any other purpose."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Tree of Redemption
text:
Defender
{T}: Exchange your life total with Tree of Redemption's toughness.
flavor: The executioner's tree in Thraben Cathedral holds the power to absolve more than the souls of the hanged.

name: Wildheart Invoker
text: {8}: Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"Life as we know it dangles on the brink of extinction. We must show the strength they would steal from us."
—*The Invokers' Tales*

name: Woolly Loxodon
text: Morph {5}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: Even among the hardiest warriors of the Temur, loxodons are respected for their adaptation to the mountain snows.

name: Pendelhaven
text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: The limbs of Pendelhaven extend as far as the meek roam, and reach as high as they strive.

name: Aeronaut Admiral
text:
Flying
Vehicles you control have flying.
flavor: The Consulate recruits its best pilots from the League of Aeronauts. Many go on to command entire fleets.

name: Aethergeode Miner
text:
Whenever Aethergeode Miner attacks, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Exile Aethergeode Miner, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
flavor: Gremlins in the wild feed on nodules of pure aether, which are also prized by miners.

name: Airdrop Aeronauts
text:
Flying
Revolt — When Airdrop Aeronauts enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, you gain 5 life.
flavor: "Supplies inbound. Keep that pressure on."

name: Alley Evasion
text:
Choose one —
• Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
• Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Sure, you know the law. But I know the streets."

name: Audacious Infiltrator
text: Audacious Infiltrator can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
flavor: "This little critter can turn all of you to scrap in under thirty seconds! Come on, who wants to be the first to go? Try and stop me!"

name: Bastion Enforcer
flavor: Headquartered at the Bastion of the Honorable, the Consulate's enforcers are charged with the impossible task of keeping the peace.

name: Call for Unity
text:
Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, put a unity counter on Call for Unity.
Creatures you control get +1/+1 for each unity counter on Call for Unity.
flavor: The "leaking spire" stands for liberation from Consulate control.

name: Caught in the Brights
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
When a Vehicle you control attacks, exile enchanted creature.
flavor: While hunting aether, a gremlin may ignore other stimuli, including threats to its own life.

name: Consulate Crackdown
text: When Consulate Crackdown enters the battlefield, exile all artifacts your opponents control until Consulate Crackdown leaves the battlefield.
flavor:
"The workshops are silent. Our creations have been seized. They have killed what made us alive."
—Pia Nalaar

name: Conviction
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.
flavor: "There is no greater coward than one who believes in nothing."

name: Countless Gears Renegade
text: Revolt — When Countless Gears Renegade enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
flavor: "Go forth and cause trouble, my little one!"

name: Dawnfeather Eagle
text:
Flying
When Dawnfeather Eagle enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn.
flavor:
"It came to rest upon the angel's arm, and then the weight of their gazes fell upon me."
—Aeronaut's journal

name: Deadeye Harpooner
text: Revolt — When Deadeye Harpooner enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, destroy target tapped creature an opponent controls.
flavor: "It seems there's even better hunting down here."

name: Decommission
text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Revolt — If a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, you gain 3 life.
flavor: "A key weakness in the design is its vulnerability to repeated, forceful blows."

name: Deft Dismissal
text: Deft Dismissal deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target attacking or blocking creatures.
flavor:
"With spy thopters all around, how can the consuls be so blind to Tezzeret's manipulations?"
—Gideon Jura

name: Exquisite Archangel
text:
Flying
If you would lose the game, instead exile Exquisite Archangel and your life total becomes equal to your starting life total.
flavor: A living invention born of a grand design.

name: Felidar Guardian
text: When Felidar Guardian enters the battlefield, you may exile another target permanent you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
flavor: The loyalty of a felidar is hard won but worth the effort.

name: Ghirapur Osprey
text: Flying
flavor: Many airship captains keep pets that share their love of the sky.

name: Restoration Specialist
text: {W}, Sacrifice Restoration Specialist: Return up to one target artifact card and up to one target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Dwarves' tools are priceless heirlooms handed down through generations.

name: Solemn Recruit
text:
Double strike
Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Solemn Recruit.
flavor: "I can no longer sit in my workshop and ignore the events outside. My hammers strike for the people of Ghirapur."

name: Sram, Senior Edificer
text: Whenever you cast an Aura, Equipment, or Vehicle spell, draw a card.
flavor: "As this conflict grows, it gets harder to prevent the city from breaking down. How much longer can we keep this machinery balanced?"

name: Sram's Expertise
text:
Create three 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.
You may cast a spell with mana value 3 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.
flavor: "It's important to always have the right tool for the job. This one is for picking my teeth."

name: Thopter Arrest
text: When Thopter Arrest enters the battlefield, exile target artifact or creature an opponent controls until Thopter Arrest leaves the battlefield.
flavor: The Consulate's eyes—unblinking, unsleeping—are everywhere.

name: Aethertide Whale
text:
Flying
When Aethertide Whale enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E} (six energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}: Return Aethertide Whale to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"To survive up here, I've learned when to use my harpoon and when to just enjoy the view."
—Kadhu, skywhaler

name: Baral, Chief of Compliance
text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever a spell or ability you control counters a spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
flavor: "The echo of silence is music to my ears."

name: Baral's Expertise
text:
Return up to three target artifacts and/or creatures to their owners' hands.
You may cast a spell with mana value 4 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.
flavor: "Get out of my way."

name: Bastion Inventor
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: "This armor transcends the limitations of mere flesh and bone."

name: Disallow
text: Counter target spell, activated ability, or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
flavor:
"How easily your flames are quenched."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Dispersal Technician
text: When Dispersal Technician enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact to its owner's hand.
flavor: As renegade forces closed in on the Aether Spire, Consulate blockades failed one by one.

name: Efficient Construction
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
flavor: For some of Ghirapur's aerowrights, building thopters is a byproduct of larger construction efforts.

name: Hinterland Drake
text:
Flying
Hinterland Drake can't block artifact creatures.
flavor:
"As a kid, I dreamed of flying on those wild drakes. They inspired me to build wings of my own."
—Nadja Cloudtoucher, aerowright

name: Ice Over
text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor:
"Slow the Consulate with whatever you've got!"
—Jasi Ganin, master siphoner

name: Illusionist's Stratagem
text:
Exile up to two target creatures you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"When everything hangs on a single moment, be sure you choose the right moment."
—Jace Beleren

name: Leave in the Dust
text:
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
flavor: The daredevil racers of the Derby Crows, long at odds with the Consulate, were quick to join the renegades in open revolt.

name: Mechanized Production
text:
Enchant artifact you control
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a token that's a copy of enchanted artifact. Then if you control eight or more artifacts with the same name as one another, you win the game.
flavor:
"Give me eight walkers, I'll give you the city."
—Dovin Baan

name: Negate
text: Counter target noncreature spell.
flavor:
"It is fascinating to see how the people of this plane replicate magical techniques without a natural gift. Also frustrating."
—Jace Beleren

name: Quicksmith Spy
text: When Quicksmith Spy enters the battlefield, target artifact you control gains "{T}: Draw a card" for as long as you control Quicksmith Spy.
flavor: "Let's just broaden its surveillance lens."

name: Reverse Engineer
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Draw three cards.
flavor: The Hold, an illegal research facility in a derelict merchant ship, became a wellspring of renegade intelligence.

name: Salvage Scuttler
text: Whenever Salvage Scuttler attacks, return an artifact you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: A hermit crab goes through many shells in its lifetime, and not all are natural in origin.

name: Shielded Aether Thief
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Whenever Shielded Aether Thief blocks, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}: Draw a card.
flavor: Conflict breeds opportunity.

name: Shipwreck Moray
text:
When Shipwreck Moray enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters).
Pay {E}: Shipwreck Moray gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: Shipwrecks do wonders for the local fauna, providing both shelter and aether.

name: Skyship Plunderer
text:
Flying
Whenever Skyship Plunderer deals combat damage to a player, for each kind of counter on target permanent or player, give that permanent or player another counter of that kind.
flavor: Escapes should always be daring.

name: Take into Custody
text: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: "You can tell me what I want to know, or you can talk to the Chief of Compliance. Why don't you make it easy on yourself?"

name: Trophy Mage
text: When Trophy Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with mana value 3, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: "The tools of the past will help us forge the future."

name: Wind-Kin Raiders
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Flying
flavor: Small aeronaut societies like the Wind-Kin had little to lose by siding with the renegades, and much to gain.

name: Alley Strangler
text: Menace
flavor: "You never know what day might be your last."

name: Battle at the Bridge
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn. You gain X life.
flavor:
"This is bigger than you. All of you."
—Tezzeret

name: Cruel Finality
text: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor: Bitter the bite of a demon's steel, and deep the abyss it opens.

name: Daring Demolition
text: Destroy target creature or Vehicle.
flavor: Living so close to death gives the aetherborn an unusual perspective on risk.

name: Fen Hauler
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Fen Hauler can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
flavor:
"Success is found where others fear to look."
—Ara, renegade smuggler

name: Foundry Hornet
text:
Flying
When Foundry Hornet enters the battlefield, if you control a creature with a +1/+1 counter on it, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: Its buzzing is easily mistaken for the hum of a thopter's wings.

name: Fourth Bridge Prowler
text: When Fourth Bridge Prowler enters the battlefield, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: Renegades run the gamut from lofty sages to petty thieves.

name: Gifted Aetherborn
text: Deathtouch, lifelink
flavor: A few aetherborn have discovered a way to sustain their own existences at the cost of an insatiable hunger for the life essence of other beings.

name: Gonti's Machinations
text:
Whenever you lose life for the first time each turn, you get {E}. (You get an energy counter. Damage causes loss of life.)
Pay {E}{E}, Sacrifice Gonti's Machinations: Each opponent loses 3 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
flavor: "I am confident that all our enterprises can benefit from this little revolution."

name: Ironclad Revolutionary
text: When Ironclad Revolutionary enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Ironclad Revolutionary and each opponent loses 2 life.
flavor: As the rebellion spread, renegade ingenuity outpaced the Consulate's greatest fears.

name: Night Market Aeronaut
text:
Flying
Revolt — Night Market Aeronaut enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.
flavor: "Death might come tomorrow, but today—today I am alive."

name: Perilous Predicament
text: Each opponent sacrifices an artifact creature and a nonartifact creature.
flavor: Comrades in life. Comrades in death.

name: Renegade's Getaway
text: Target permanent gains indestructible until end of turn. Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy a permanent with indestructible, and if it's a creature, it can't be destroyed by damage.)
flavor: You can't fight what you can't find.

name: Resourceful Return
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If you control an artifact, draw a card.
flavor: When the salvage team brought in the shattered gearhulk, a wave of excitement swept through the renegade foundry.

name: Secret Salvage
text: Exile target nonland card from your graveyard. Search your library for any number of cards with the same name as that card, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: There is no shortage of illegal salvage in Ghirapur, nor of those who are willing to profit from it.

name: Vengeful Rebel
text: Revolt — When Vengeful Rebel enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, target creature an opponent controls gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
flavor: Some aetherborn joined the rebellion for profit, others for the sake of their freedom, still others for revenge.

name: Yahenni's Expertise
text:
All creatures get -3/-3 until end of turn.
You may cast a spell with mana value 3 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.
flavor: "The Consulate pushed me to my limit, darling, and this is the result."

name: Chandra's Revolution
text: Chandra's Revolution deals 4 damage to target creature. Tap target land. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: Chandra was driven by her anger, directed particularly at the man who had taken her father from her.

name: Destructive Tampering
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
flavor:
"I don't think they'll appreciate my . . . adjustments."
—Karavin, renegade saboteur

name: Embraal Gear-Smasher
text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Embraal Gear-Smasher deals 2 damage to each opponent.
flavor: "A well-made wrench is a versatile, indispensable tool."

name: Enraged Giant
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Trample, haste
flavor: When fighting spilled over into Giant's Walk, the aether weapons and swooping airships angered the normally placid creatures.

name: Freejam Regent
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Flying
{1}{R}: Freejam Regent gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The dragons perching in Freejam's towers symbolize the zone's fierce independence.

name: Frontline Rebel
text: Frontline Rebel attacks each combat if able.
flavor: "Will you be strong and stand with me?"

name: Hungry Flames
text: Hungry Flames deals 3 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: In the hold of the *Heart of Kiran*, Chandra answered Dovin Baan's sabotage with an explosive retort.

name: Invigorated Rampage
text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +4/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Two target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor: Gremlins can change from pest to problem to plague in the span of a moment.

name: Kari Zev, Skyship Raider
text:
First strike, menace
Whenever Kari Zev, Skyship Raider attacks, create Ragavan, a legendary 2/1 red Monkey creature token. Ragavan enters the battlefield tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.
flavor: Aboard her ship, the *Dragon's Smile*, Kari follows no one's rules but her own.

name: Kari Zev's Expertise
text:
Gain control of target creature or Vehicle until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.
You may cast a spell with mana value 2 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.
flavor: "I was made for this!"

name: Lathnu Sailback
flavor: Travelers to Lathnu, high on the Devra Cliffs, need not fear the political strife of Ghirapur . . . but they have other dangers to worry about.

name: Lightning Runner
text:
Double strike, haste
Whenever Lightning Runner attacks, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters), then you may pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}. If you pay, untap all creatures you control, and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.
flavor: "Catch me if you can."

name: Pia's Revolution
text: Whenever a nontoken artifact is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to your hand unless target opponent has Pia's Revolution deal 3 damage to them.
flavor: Pia's passion was directed at the big picture—at making real, lasting change.

name: Precise Strike
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: "Hit where it hurts, and always hit first."

name: Quicksmith Rebel
text: When Quicksmith Rebel enters the battlefield, target artifact you control gains "{T}: This artifact deals 2 damage to any target" for as long as you control Quicksmith Rebel.
flavor: "Let's add just a bit more stopping power."

name: Reckless Racer
text:
First strike
Whenever Reckless Racer becomes tapped, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
flavor: Illegal street races turned out to be perfect practice for avoiding Consulate patrols.

name: Release the Gremlins
text: Destroy X target artifacts. Create X 2/2 red Gremlin creature tokens.
flavor:
"Being an inventor means knowing how to use the tools at hand to make something great—or to bring it down."
—Pia Nalaar

name: Siege Modification
text:
Enchant creature or Vehicle
As long as enchanted permanent is a Vehicle, it's a creature in addition to its other types.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has first strike.
flavor: Perfect for getting through to the consuls.

name: Sweatworks Brawler
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Menace
flavor: The residents of Embraal were never known for finesse, just for getting things done.

name: Wrangle
text: Gain control of target creature with power 4 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: Gremlins are loyal to nothing but their next meal.

name: Aetherwind Basker
text:
Trample
Whenever Aetherwind Basker enters the battlefield or attacks, you get {E} (an energy counter) for each creature you control.
Pay {E}: Aetherwind Basker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Its frill inspired the design of efficient aether collectors.

name: Druid of the Cowl
text: {T}: Add {G}.
flavor: "The wild tangle of the Cowl provides sanctuary to life that watched the first buildings rise."

name: Greenbelt Rampager
text: When Greenbelt Rampager enters the battlefield, pay {E}{E} (two energy counters). If you can't, return Greenbelt Rampager to its owner's hand and you get {E}.
flavor: Subtlety is not a necessary part of sabotage.

name: Greenwheel Liberator
