flavor: Minotaurs go into battle hungry. The first sight of their enemies' blood sends them into a flesh-eating rage.

name: Lightning Volley
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
flavor: "We are the motes of rain that join to make the thundercloud. The power of the storm god surges through us!"

name: Pinnacle of Rage
text: Pinnacle of Rage deals 3 damage to each of two targets.
flavor: Mount Sulano erupted not in magma but in anger.

name: Rise to the Challenge
text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Plidius wagered that Arissa couldn't kill a chimera with her javelins alone. She proved him wrong in a way everyone could see for days to come.

name: Satyr Firedancer
text: Whenever an instant or sorcery spell you control deals damage to an opponent, Satyr Firedancer deals that much damage to target creature that player controls.
flavor: His heart, the coal; his eye, the spark; his hand, the whirling flame.

name: Scouring Sands
text: Scouring Sands deals 1 damage to each creature your opponents control. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor: When Purphoros cleans the ashes from his forge, entire cities vanish.

name: Searing Blood
text: Searing Blood deals 2 damage to target creature. When that creature dies this turn, Searing Blood deals 3 damage to the creature's controller.
flavor: Purphoros's blessing: sometimes a boon, sometimes a bane. Always ablaze.

name: Archetype of Endurance
text:
Creatures you control have hexproof.
Creatures your opponents control lose hexproof and can't have or gain hexproof.
flavor: Despite its fearsome stature, it is as elusive as a shadow, circling round to stalk those who presume to hunt it.

name: Aspect of Hydra
text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is your devotion to green. (Each {G} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to green.)
flavor: "Even alone I outnumber you."

name: Charging Badger
text: Trample
flavor:
"If the hierarchies of nature were determined by ferocity alone, the badger would be lord of the beasts."
—Anthousa of Setessa

name: Culling Mark
text: Target creature blocks this turn if able.
flavor: Hunt without Nylea's leave and you may find yourself the next quarry.

name: Hero of Leina Tower
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Hero of Leina Tower, you may pay {X}. If you do, put X +1/+1 counters on Hero of Leina Tower.
flavor: "You cannot achieve greatness if its seed has not already been planted in your heart."

name: Hunter's Prowess
text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample and "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw that many cards."
flavor: To be counted among the warriors of Setessa's Leina Tower, you must not fear death, only failure.

name: Mischief and Mayhem
text: Up to two target creatures each get +4/+4 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The false god Xenagos treats the whole world as his rollick site. If his whims are left unchecked, Theros will be reduced to rubble and ashes."
—Elspeth

name: Mortal's Resolve
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
flavor: The Fates tried to cut her string but found the thread had turned to iron.

name: Pheres-Band Raiders
text: Inspired — Whenever Pheres-Band Raiders becomes untapped, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, create a 3/3 green Centaur enchantment creature token.
flavor: "Who can deny the call to battle when it sings in our blood?"

name: Pheres-Band Tromper
text: Inspired — Whenever Pheres-Band Tromper becomes untapped, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Trompers are the most feared warriors of the Pheres Band. Anger is their lifeblood. It sustains them and gives them purpose.

name: Satyr Wayfinder
text: When Satyr Wayfinder enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
flavor: The first satyr to wake after a revel must search for the site of the next one.

name: Setessan Oathsworn
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Setessan Oathsworn, put two +1/+1 counters on Setessan Oathsworn.
flavor: "Setessa is not the city of my birth, but it is the place I fight for, and the place I'm willing to die for. Does that not make it my home?"

name: Setessan Starbreaker
text: When Setessan Starbreaker enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Aura.
flavor: "Who says you cannot touch the stars?"

name: Snake of the Golden Grove
text:
Tribute 3 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may put three +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Snake of the Golden Grove enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, you gain 4 life.
flavor: Some fruits are best left ungathered.

name: Swordwise Centaur
flavor:
The girl who would become the Champion of the Sun hacked furiously at the practice dummy. At last she stopped, breathing heavily, and looked up at her instructor. "So much anger," said the centaur. "I will teach you the ways of war, child. But first you must make peace with yourself."
—*The Theriad*

name: Unravel the Aether
text: Choose target artifact or enchantment. Its owner shuffles it into their library.
flavor: Thaumaturges of Theros have learned to weave their magic into the world around them, but it can be pulled apart strand by strand.

name: Day of Destiny
text: Legendary creatures you control get +2/+2.
flavor:
"Rise like the sun, stand like the mountain, charge like the lion, die as a hero."
—General Takeno

name: Empty-Shrine Kannushi
text: Empty-Shrine Kannushi has protection from the colors of permanents you control.
flavor: "Crease the folds, bend the paper, turn the spirits, shield the soul."

name: Final Judgment
text: Exile all creatures.
flavor:
"The clashing warriors turned to face O-Kagachi, the greatest kami, and their sigh of awe was their last breath."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Indebted Samurai
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a Samurai you control dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Indebted Samurai.
flavor: "Forgive me, Saburo. I could not save you. But your blade will not rest in my hand."

name: Kami of False Hope
text: Sacrifice Kami of False Hope: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
flavor:
"Across the rift of battle, a bridge of gossamer. And for one moment, it holds."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Kami of Tattered Shoji
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of Tattered Shoji gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: It remembered all the shadows lantern-cast upon its paper wings, and sometimes those silhouettes played across its shape again, acting out silent tragedies.

name: Kentaro, the Smiling Cat
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
You may pay {X} rather than pay the mana cost for Samurai spells you cast, where X is that spell's mana value.
flavor: "The bonds of bushido will draw the dishonored back someday, and I will be there waiting."

name: Kitsune Palliator
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to each creature and each player this turn.
flavor: "Who am I to judge who is deserving and who is not? That is a question for lords, not healers."

name: Oyobi, Who Split the Heavens
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, create a 3/3 white Spirit creature token with flying.
flavor: Her angry call split the sky. From that rift descended her champions.

name: Split-Tail Miko
text: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: "I wish there were no use for those with my talents. I wish that I could walk Kamigawa forgotten and unneeded, with no war wounds to heal and no broken bones to mend."

name: Takeno's Cavalry
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Takeno's Cavalry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking Spirit.
flavor: At night he perfected his aim, shooting spiderwebs by starlight.

name: Tallowisp
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may search your library for an Aura card with enchant creature, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Isolated on its little candlewick, the kami never heard of the crime that drove its comrades to war.

name: Terashi's Grasp
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain life equal to its mana value.
flavor:
"The jeweler, the potter, the smith . . . They all imbue a bit of their souls into their creations. The kami destroy that crafted mortal shell and absorb the soul within."
—Noboru, master kitemaker

name: Terashi's Verdict
text: Destroy target attacking creature with power 3 or less.
flavor: It was as though the sky opened its eyes and found what it saw displeasing.

name: Ward of Piety
text:
Enchant creature
{1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature this turn is dealt to any target instead.
flavor: Reluctant to strike at the kami directly, some kitsune trained in more passive fighting techniques.

name: Yomiji, Who Bars the Way
text: Whenever a legendary permanent other than Yomiji, Who Bars the Way is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"As I died, I rejoiced. I would see my family again. But then I woke up back on the battlefield. Back in Kamigawa. Back in hell."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

name: Floodbringer
text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Tap target land.
flavor: "Such a small thing, a drop of water . . . And yet enough of them together can flood a field, cleanse a mire, or choke a forest."

name: Heed the Mists
text: Mill a card, then draw cards equal to the milled card's mana value.
flavor: "Once, I looked to the mists for wisdom. Now I wish only for understanding."

name: Jetting Glasskite
text:
Flying
Whenever Jetting Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time each turn, counter that spell or ability.
flavor: The bolt struck with a flash and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed.

name: Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch blocks a creature, return that creature to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
flavor: When it's finished, all that's left of you is a ripple on a still pond.

name: Kira, Great Glass-Spinner
text:
Flying
Creatures you control have "Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time each turn, counter that spell or ability."
flavor: Each spell is an intricate tapestry, and Kira is the great unraveler.

name: Minamo Sightbender
text: {X}, {T}: Target creature with power X or less can't be blocked this turn.
flavor: Woven from threads of the spirit world, the mistcloak rendered its wearer invisible, but quickly fell to tatters.

name: Minamo's Meddling
text: Counter target spell. That spell's controller reveals their hand, then discards each card with the same name as a card spliced onto that spell.
flavor: Like storm water through the segments of bamboo, the spell followed the links of magic. Then it destroyed them.

name: Phantom Wings
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Sacrifice Phantom Wings: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: Many kami could fly, which put some warriors at a distinct disadvantage. The mages of Minamo took it upon themselves to correct that imbalance.

name: Reduce to Dreams
text: Return all artifacts and enchantments to their owners' hands.
flavor:
"This world is a dream. We cling to our toys like children, but sooner or later we must learn to live without them."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Ribbons of the Reikai
text: Draw a card for each Spirit you control.
flavor:
"If wisdom is a river, then we cup our hands, reach in, and drink from it in sips. The kami, however, are like fish, swimming, breathing, surrounded in its presence."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Shimmering Glasskite
text:
Flying
Whenever Shimmering Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time each turn, counter that spell or ability.
flavor: A child's whisper could crack its shell, but not even an oni's scream could penetrate it.

name: Stream of Consciousness
text: Target player shuffles up to four target cards from their graveyard into their library.
flavor:
"All things return to their beginnings. The waters that spill across the Kamitaki Falls flow to sea, only to be returned to her as the rain that joins the mighty river."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Teardrop Kami
text: Sacrifice Teardrop Kami: You may tap or untap target creature.
flavor:
"Do not fall into the trap of thinking you understand the kami. Cannot a drop of water be dew on the meadow, a glacier's thaw, or the tear of a child?"
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Threads of Disloyalty
text:
Enchant creature with mana value 2 or less
You control enchanted creature.
flavor:
"Over time, Konda grew ever more suspicious, fearing even his most loyal allies were being manipulated by unseen hands."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Toils of Night and Day
text: You may tap or untap target permanent, then you may tap or untap another target permanent.
flavor:
"The war sent Kamigawa into turmoil. Here it was spring and there winter. For some, time stood still, while for others, moments flashed past like minnows in a pond."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Bile Urchin
text: Sacrifice Bile Urchin: Target player loses 1 life.
flavor:
"The two youths argued and tempers flared. One youth opened his mouth to utter a vile curse, but what he spat out instead was a kami of poison and filth."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Hero's Demise
text: Destroy target legendary creature.
flavor:
"What will it say on our graves, Lord Konda? Will it say we led our world to conquer immortal forces or that we were crushed by our own arrogance? At each defeat, I wonder."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda

name: Kyoki, Sanity's Eclipse
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target opponent exiles a card from their hand.
flavor:
"Kyoki, Eater of Minds, Corrupter of Thoughts, Bringer of Madness, Lord of Fear. Return, by our blood, and walk again."
—Ogre chant

name: Mark of the Oni
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no Demons, sacrifice Mark of the Oni.
flavor:
"As more oni walked Kamigawa, more darkness infested its inhabitants' souls."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Nezumi Shadow-Watcher
text: Sacrifice Nezumi Shadow-Watcher: Destroy target Ninja.
flavor:
"The Okiba Gang! Night-cursed thieves and assassins! I've had enough of their meddling! Triple the guard!"
—Marrow-Gnawer

name: Ogre Marauder
text: Whenever Ogre Marauder attacks, it gains "Ogre Marauder can't be blocked" until end of turn unless defending player sacrifices a creature.
flavor: Once freed, the oni demanded more and more sacrifices to appease them. The ogres happily obliged.

name: Psychic Spear
text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a Spirit or Arcane card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor:
"The wizards of Takenuma Swamp faced the horrors of humanity every day. It's no wonder they fared so well against the kami."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Scourge of Numai
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life if you don't control an Ogre.
flavor:
"Where a once-proud human city stood, only the ruins of Numai remain, deep amid rotting bamboo and plagued by oni."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Stir the Grave
text: Return target creature card with mana value X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"Your lungs may not draw breath, but while your hands can grip a sword, you will be useful to me."
—Nighteyes, nezumi necromancer

name: Takenuma Bleeder
text: Whenever Takenuma Bleeder attacks or blocks, you lose 1 life if you don't control a Demon.
flavor: "I prefer to weave my magic through oni blood, but yours will do in a pinch."

name: Three Tragedies
text: Target player discards three cards.
flavor:
"As the kami passed over the village of Mita, the inhabitants relived their three most grievous tragedies. Some cried. Some raged. Some were driven to madness. But the next morning, none possessed the will to fight."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Yukora, the Prisoner
text: When Yukora, the Prisoner leaves the battlefield, sacrifice all non-Ogre creatures you control.
flavor: It took ninety-nine monks to weave the spell that trapped Yukora. Upon the death of the ninety-nine, the spell was broken, and the demon returned to the mortal world seeking vengeance for its imprisonment.

name: Akki Blizzard-Herder
text: When Akki Blizzard-Herder dies, each player sacrifices a land.
flavor:
"It remains unclear whether the akki shamans could in fact create storms or simply predicted them."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Akki Raider
text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Akki Raider gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Akki were very territorial, attacking and destroying any settlements that came too close to their mountain homes. The more successful their raids, the bolder they became.

name: Ashen Monstrosity
text:
Haste
Ashen Monstrosity attacks each combat if able.
flavor: There was a dull thunder at the vanguard, then shocked cries in the midst of the column. Moments later, Takada, last of the rearguard, faced the kami alone.

name: Crack the Earth
text: Each player sacrifices a permanent.
flavor:
"As the war progressed, the destruction the kami caused became more widespread and less predictable."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: First Volley
text: First Volley deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor:
"We searched their bodies for signs of the blades that had killed them, but found nothing more than scorched flesh."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

name: Flames of the Blood Hand
text: Flames of the Blood Hand deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker. The damage can't be prevented. If that player or that planeswalker's controller would gain life this turn, that player gains no life instead.
flavor: Many ogres extracted blood oaths from the oni they summoned. Others simply extracted blood.

name: Frost Ogre
flavor: Mountain ogres allowed blizzards to sheathe them in ice, both to reinforce their armor and to hide their pungent musk from potential prey.

name: Frostling
text: Sacrifice Frostling: It deals 1 damage to target creature.
flavor: Its bite will take off more than a toe.

name: Goblin Cohort
text: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
flavor: Akki shells provided good protection when downhill charging became headlong tumbling.

name: Heartless Hidetsugu
text: {T}: Heartless Hidetsugu deals damage to each player equal to half that player's life total, rounded down.
flavor: Hidetsugu held over a dozen oni in blood oath. At his touch, rocks scorched. At his word, cities burned.

name: In the Web of War
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
flavor:
"In desperation, Konda sent warriors to parley with the ogre-magi. No one knows whether they were slaughtered at Shinka or if they even reached its bloodstained walls."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Ire of Kaminari
text: Ire of Kaminari deals damage to any target equal to the number of Arcane cards in your graveyard.
flavor:
"Thunder broke the brittle silence over the Araba. A surge of raw energy lifted the soldier's body into the air and briefly, in the heart of the flash, he saw the face of a god."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Ishi-Ishi, Akki Crackshot
text: Whenever an opponent casts a Spirit or Arcane spell, Ishi-Ishi, Akki Crackshot deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor:
"Here fell Ishi-Ishi, King of the Flaming Pebbles, Scourge of the Mountain Kami, Lover of Goats. May his shell never burn."
—Cave inscription

name: Mannichi, the Fevered Dream
text: {1}{R}: Switch each creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
flavor:
"Early in his reign, Konda fell ill. His head burned with fever, and he saw visions of his future. In them, he saw a spirit-child, and, in that child's eyes, a way to make his empire last forever."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Ogre Recluse
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, tap Ogre Recluse.
flavor:
"Those ogres who did not embrace oni worship were cast out, cursed, and forced into hermitage, waiting for the day the oni would come for them."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Shinka Gatekeeper
text: Whenever Shinka Gatekeeper is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.
flavor:
"Understanding is not a virtue of the ogre. Do not seek to reason your way into Shinka Keep."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Child of Thorns
text: Sacrifice Child of Thorns: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The soratami scoff at the perils of Jukai, calling the forest an 'unruly garden.' Perhaps we should send them a rose such as this."
—Dokai, Weaver of Life

name: Enshrined Memories
text: Reveal the top X cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor:
"The race is run in the mind before the first step is taken."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Gnarled Mass
flavor:
"On the fifty-seventh day of the Battle of Silk, the bell again tolled in hopes of summoning mortal aid. This time, a new breed of kami rose to answer its call."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Isao, Enlightened Bushi
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
{2}: Regenerate target Samurai.
flavor:
"I do not care if he claims no allegiance in this war. Find him, Takeno."
—Lord Konda

name: Lifegift
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
flavor:
"Walk the world and you'll find your soul; search your soul and you'll discover the world."
—Diary of Azusa

name: Lifespinner
text: {T}, Sacrifice three Spirits: Search your library for a legendary Spirit permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor:
"The husk splits like a madman's smile And mystery steps forth."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Loam Dweller
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
flavor:
"You know its mood by the plants that spring up around it. When it is placid, fields of lilies flow in its wake; when it is angry, every stem has a thorn."
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

name: Scaled Hulk
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Scaled Hulk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Say, what rhymes with 'run for your lives'?"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet

name: Unchecked Growth
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn. If it's a Spirit, it gains trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"That energy was once granted to growing things. Now the kami keep it for themselves, releasing it in sudden floods that overwhelm flesh and foliage alike."
—Sakiko, Mother of Summer

name: Uproot
text: Put target land on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"We arrived at the battlefield too late. *Again*. Another error on your part, and you will have to answer to me personally."
—General Takeno, letter to the imperial mapmaker

name: Advance Scout
text:
First strike
{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"The soldier's path is worn smooth by the tread of many feet—all in one direction, none returning."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Arc Lightning
text: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.
flavor: Rainclouds don't last long in Shiv, but that doesn't stop the lightning.

name: Argothian Elder
text: {T}: Untap two target lands.
flavor:
Sharpen your ears
—Elvish expression meaning "grow wiser"

name: Broken Fall
text: Return Broken Fall to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.
flavor:
"I think I used up all my good luck and all my bad luck in the same fall."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Cackling Fiend
text: When Cackling Fiend enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
flavor: Its windpipe is only the first to amplify its maddening laughter.

name: Catastrophe
text: Destroy all lands or all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
flavor: Radiant's eyes flashed. "Go, then," the angel spat at Serra, "and leave this world to those who truly care."

name: Crazed Skirge
text: Flying, haste
flavor: They are Phyrexia's couriers; the messages they carry are inscribed on their slick hides.

name: Curfew
text: Each player returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.
flavor: ". . . But I'm not tired!"

name: Dirtcowl Wurm
text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, put a +1/+1 counter on Dirtcowl Wurm.
flavor: Few of Rath's rivers follow a steady course, so many new channels are carved for them.

name: Disruptive Student
text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor:
"Teferi is a problem student. Always late for class. No appreciation for constructive use of time."
—Barrin, progress report

name: Exhume
text: Each player puts a creature card from their graveyard onto the battlefield.
flavor:
"Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."
—Sitrik, birth priest

name: Fire Ants
text: {T}: Fire Ants deals 1 damage to each other creature without flying.
flavor: Visitors to Shiv fear the dragons, the goblins, or the viashino. Natives fear the ants.

name: Gorilla Warrior
flavor: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

name: Heat Ray
text: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.
flavor: It's not known whether the Thran built the device to forge their wonders or to defend them.

name: Maniacal Rage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
flavor: Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.

name: Manta Riders
text: {U}: Manta Riders gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"Water is firmament to the finned."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Plated Rootwalla
text: {2}{G}: Plated Rootwalla gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor:
" . . . And the third little boar built his house out of rootwalla plates . . . ."
—Skyshroud children's story

name: Ray of Command
text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.
flavor: "Heel."

name: Sadistic Glee
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor:
"First blood isn't as important as last blood."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Sanctum Custodian
text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: Serra told them to guard Urza as he healed. Five years they stood.

name: Sanctum Guardian
text: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage.
flavor: "Protect our mother in her womb."

name: Sewer Rats
text: {B}, Pay 1 life: Sewer Rats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate no more than three times each turn.
flavor:
You lie down with rats, and the rats run away.
—Suq'Ata insult

name: Shower of Sparks
text: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.

name: Skyshroud Elite
text: Skyshroud Elite gets +1/+2 as long as an opponent controls a nonbasic land.
flavor:
"Civilization is a conspiracy to disguise the mutilation of nature."
—Skyshroud elite creed

name: Soltari Foot Soldier
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor:
"Children of the Ruins, raised to be warriors, know that life begins when another speaks their names."
—Soltari *Tales of Life*

name: Songstitcher
text: {1}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by target attacking creature with flying.
flavor: The true names of birds are songs woven into their souls.

name: Steam Blast
text: Steam Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: The viashino knew of the cracked pipes but deliberately left them unmended to bolster the rig's defenses.

name: Subversion
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
flavor: Kerrick's corrupt domain swelled like a blister on Tolaria's skin.

name: Sun Clasp
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"And darkness shall be cast from me For my soul resides in the Sun."
—Femeref dirge

name: Symbiosis
text: Two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Although the elves of Argoth always considered them a nuisance, the pixies made fine allies during the war against the machines.

name: Trumpeting Armodon
text: {1}{G}: Target creature blocks Trumpeting Armodon this turn if able.
flavor: These are its last days. But it will not go quietly.

name: Unnerve
text: Each opponent discards two cards.
flavor:
"If fear is the only tool you have left, then you'll never control me."
—Xantcha, to Gix

name: Wall of Heat
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor: At a distance, we mistook the sound for a waterfall . . . .

name: Wildfire Emissary
text:
Protection from white
{1}{R}: Wildfire Emissary gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The efreet is a striding storm with a voice that crackles like fire."
—Qhattib, vizier of Amiqat

name: Windfall
text: Each player discards their hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.
flavor:
"To fill your mind with knowledge, we must start by emptying it."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Terisiare's Devastation
text: You lose X life and create X tapped Powerstone tokens. Then all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each artifact you control. (The tokens are artifacts with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor: In the end, the war had no winner.

name: Kayla's Music Box
text:
{W}, {T}: Look at the top card of your library, then exile it face down. (You may look at it any time.)
{T}: Until end of turn, you may play cards you own exiled with Kayla's Music Box.
flavor: Kayla wondered if Urza's repair of the music box was a display of affection, or just of skill.

name: Machine God's Effigy
text:
You may have Machine God's Effigy enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it's an artifact and it has "{T}: Add {U}." (It's not a creature.)
{T}: Add {U}.
flavor: Gix ensured his most loyal followers were the first to taste Phyrexian perfection.

name: Thopter Shop
text:
Whenever one or more artifact creatures you control die, draw a card. This ability triggers only once each turn.
{2}{W}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
flavor: Rushed repairs once sent a thopter back to combat with a mechanic's still-warm lunch in the gunner's seat.

name: Rootpath Purifier
text: Lands you control and land cards in your library are basic.
flavor: "Holiness is not found in a druid's words, or even the rituals of Titania's court. It is found here, in the mud, where Gaea bares her soul, unshackled by ceremony."

name: Digsite Engineer
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 0/0 colorless Construct artifact creature token with "This creature gets +1/+1 for each artifact you control."
flavor: "Dig over there, you bolthead!"

name: Indomitable Archangel
text:
Flying
Metalcraft — Artifacts you control have shroud as long as you control three or more artifacts. (An artifact with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"Every sword drawn to defend is an angelic blade, guided to justice by an angelic hand."
—Auriok proverb

name: Phyrexian Rebirth
text: Destroy all creatures, then create an X/X colorless Phyrexian Horror artifact creature token, where X is the number of creatures destroyed this way.
flavor: As long as one drop of the oil exists, the joyous work continues.

name: Teshar, Ancestor's Apostle
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a historic spell, return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)
flavor: "The Ancestor saved us for a purpose."

name: Urza's Ruinous Blast
text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Exile all nonland permanents that aren't legendary.
flavor: Urza poured his love, his grief, and his hatred into the Sylex, and the Multiverse shook.

name: Fact or Fiction
text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
flavor: "Try to pretend like you understand what's important."

name: Filigree Attendant
text:
Flying
Filigree Attendant's power is equal to the number of artifacts you control.
flavor:
"The perfect assistant is one that's responsive, dextrous, and capable of reaching all the high shelves."
—Coruk, Esper artificer

name: Mnemonic Sphere
text:
{1}{U}, Sacrifice Mnemonic Sphere: Draw two cards.
Channel — {U}, Discard Mnemonic Sphere: Draw a card.
flavor:
"Let the Imperials search our laboratories. Will they think to look for secrets in a pretty bauble?"
—Emire, director of the Saiba Futurists

name: One with the Machine
text: Draw cards equal to the highest mana value among artifacts you control.
flavor:
"When I grafted the Planar Bridge into myself, I felt my Planeswalker spark flare beyond my body. The Multiverse was my plaything. It felt . . . incredible."
—Tezzeret

name: Padeem, Consul of Innovation
text:
Artifacts you control have hexproof.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control the artifact with the highest mana value or tied for the highest mana value, draw a card.
flavor: "Impress me."

name: Sai, Master Thopterist
text:
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
{1}{U}, Sacrifice two artifacts: Draw a card.
flavor: "Industry without artistry is just a fancy way to fill the junkyard."

name: Shimmer Dragon
text:
Flying
As long as you control four or more artifacts, Shimmer Dragon has hexproof.
Tap two untapped artifacts you control: Draw a card.
flavor: The indigo dragon gladly traded a bit of its hoard for everlasting moonlight.

name: Thought Monitor
text:
Affinity for artifacts
Flying
When Thought Monitor enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
flavor: It roams the skies over the Quicksilver Sea, alert for any hint of aberrant thought.

name: Thoughtcast
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Draw two cards.
flavor: Vedalken eyes don't see the beauty in things. They see only what those things can teach.

name: Vedalken Humiliator
text: Metalcraft — Whenever Vedalken Humiliator attacks, if you control three or more artifacts, creatures your opponents control lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1 until end of turn.
flavor: "And who will stop me? You?"

name: Feed the Swarm
text: Destroy target creature or enchantment an opponent controls. You lose life equal to that permanent's mana value.
flavor:
"On vile wings and bloody wind, the swarm will rise."
—Skyclave inscription

name: Hellkite Igniter
text:
Flying, haste
{1}{R}: Hellkite Igniter gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts you control.
flavor: Its flight sets the sky itself on fire.

name: Slobad, Goblin Tinkerer
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Target artifact gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor:
"I used to joke that he had been exiled for being too smart. Now I know why he never laughed."
—Glissa Sunseeker

name: Ancient Den
text: {T}: Add {W}.
flavor:
"Halcyon, the floating capital of Thran. The once shining city in the clouds, now lies ruined on the desert floor."
—*Fall of the Thran*

name: Great Furnace
text: {T}: Add {R}.
flavor:
"Molten blood runs through the ruins of the forge city of Phoenon, a still-beating heart whose body rotted centuries ago."
—*Fall of the Thran*

name: Seat of the Synod
text: {T}: Add {U}.
flavor:
"Full of immense beauty and power, the falls at Orleason inspired the empire's greatest dreamers."
—*Fall of the Thran*

name: Aeronaut Cavalry
text:
Flying
When Aeronaut Cavalry enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on another target Soldier you control.
flavor:
"The ground is where wars are waged, but the air is where they are won."
—Harbin, vanguard aviator

name: Ambush Paratrooper
text:
Flash
Flying
{5}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "It would be folly to fight a dragon engine head-on. Let's hit it from above."

name: Calamity's Wake
text: Exile all graveyards. Players can't cast noncreature spells this turn. Exile Calamity's Wake.
flavor: The sylex's blast had razed the land, leaving behind old snow and sorrow. Urza stood alone in the sudden silence.

name: Deadly Riposte
text: Deadly Riposte deals 3 damage to target tapped creature and you gain 2 life.
flavor:
"Automatons are fast, precise, and tireless, but they all share one weakness: predictability. Learn their patterns. Strike when they're vulnerable."
—Horance, Urzan general

name: Great Desert Prospector
text: When Great Desert Prospector enters the battlefield, create a tapped Powerstone token for each other creature you control. (The tokens are artifacts with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor: "Hello, beautiful."

name: In the Trenches
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
{5}{W}: Exile target nonland permanent you don't control until In the Trenches leaves the battlefield. Activate only as a sorcery and only once.
flavor: The battlefield became so pockmarked with craters and trenches that casualties were regularly attributed to "fell in a hole."

name: Kayla's Reconstruction
text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put up to X artifact and/or creature cards with mana value 3 or less from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
flavor: Anyone can destroy a continent. Few have the vision to rebuild one.

name: Lay Down Arms
text: Exile target creature with mana value less than or equal to the number of Plains you control. Its controller gains 3 life.
flavor: She'll swing a blade all her life, but never again for war.

name: Loran of the Third Path
text:
Vigilance
When Loran of the Third Path enters the battlefield, destroy up to one target artifact or enchantment.
{T}: You and target opponent each draw a card.
flavor: As a scholar, she saw the sylex not as a weapon, but as a key to the past.

name: Loran, Disciple of History
text: Whenever Loran, Disciple of History or another legendary creature enters the battlefield under your control, return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Urza and Mishra may have been Tocasia's most famous students, but Loran was the true heir to her legacy.

name: Loran's Escape
text: Target artifact or creature gains hexproof and indestructible until end of turn. Scry 1.
flavor: As Terisia City burned, Feldon pressed the sylex into Loran's hands and urged her to run. Hope ran with her.

name: Mass Production
text: Create four 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature tokens.
flavor:
"I need an army, not a masterpiece. Accelerate output, whatever it takes."
—Urza, notes to his engineers

name: Meticulous Excavation
text: {2}{W}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand. If it has unearth, instead exile it, then return that card to its owner's hand. Activate only during your turn.
flavor: "Remember, students, if it's glowing, humming, or whirring, don't touch it!"

name: Phalanx Vanguard
text:
Vigilance
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Phalanx Vanguard gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The cool, sleek automatons beside her mirrored her own iron resolve.

name: Powerstone Engineer
text: When Powerstone Engineer dies, create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor: "Well there's your problem—resonance leak lowering output by thirty percent. I can patch that up."

name: Prison Sentence
text:
Enchant creature
When Prison Sentence enters the battlefield, scry 2.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
flavor: War prisoners were ineffective political pawns, as neither brother cared enough to trade for them.

name: Recommission
text: Return target artifact or creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. If a creature enters the battlefield this way, it enters with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: "Put your backs into it! If we don't lay claim to it, the Fallaji will!"

name: Recruitment Officer
text: {3}{W}: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card with mana value 3 or less from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
flavor: "Every name on this list is already a hero! Will you add your own to it?"

name: Repair and Recharge
text: Return target artifact, enchantment, or planeswalker card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor:
"Throw the bodies out. They'll just weigh down the frame."
—Rolf, Argivian mechanic

name: Siege Veteran
text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
Whenever another nontoken Soldier you control dies, create a 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature token.
flavor: "Steady, recruit. We fight in the light of justice. We cast no shadow."

name: Soul Partition
text: Exile target nonland permanent. For as long as that card remains exiled, its owner may play it. A spell cast by an opponent this way costs {2} more to cast.
flavor: Teferi's body couldn't travel through time far enough, but with Kaya's help, his spirit could.

name: Survivor of Korlis
text:
First strike
{1}{W}, Exile Survivor of Korlis from your graveyard: Scry 2.
flavor: At first, the merchant state of Korlis saw no need to involve itself in the conflict between Yotia and the Fallaji. Mishra's dragon engines changed that.

name: Thopter Architect
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "She'll only fly once. Make it count!"

name: Tocasia's Welcome
text: Whenever one or more creatures with mana value 3 or less enter the battlefield under your control, draw a card. This ability triggers only once each turn.
flavor: "Your father was a dear friend to whom I owe much. He wanted me to look after you, to care for you should something happen to him."

name: Union of the Third Path
text: Draw a card, then you gain life equal to the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: Terisia City at last opened its ivory towers to all who sought respite from the endless war.

name: Warlord's Elite
text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, tap two untapped artifacts, creatures, and/or lands you control.
flavor: "The Warlord thinks we've gone soft, does he? The Fist of Progress will prove him wrong!"

name: Yotian Medic
text: Lifelink
flavor:
"Go, save as many as you can! The city walls may be rubble, but Kroog will live on in its people."
—Queen Kayla bin-Kroog

name: Platoon Dispenser
flavor:
"Hear that thud-clank, thud-clank? We're saved."
—Ani, Urzan soldier

name: Air Marshal
text: {3}: Target Soldier gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "Today our blades remember Kroog! May the seven brass gods be with us!"

name: Curate
text:
Surveil 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)
Draw a card.
flavor: "Aha! This must be one of the ancient keys to... No, wait. It's just another puzzle toy."

name: Desynchronize
text: Target nonland permanent's owner puts it on the top or bottom of their library. Scry 2.
flavor: Before Kaya could pull Teferi's spirit back, the overloaded temporal anchor failed, and he was set adrift in the currents of time.

name: Drafna, Founder of Lat-Nam
text:
{1}{U}: Return target artifact you control to its owner's hand.
{3}, {T}: Copy target artifact spell you control. (The copy becomes a token.)
flavor: Alongside his wife, Hurkyl, Drafna built a legacy of scholarship that endured for millennia.

name: Flow of Knowledge
text: Draw a card for each Island you control, then discard two cards.
flavor:
"Focus your mind. Do you hold a piece of the ocean or a thousand drops of rain?"
—Hurkyl

name: Forging the Anchor
text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of artifact cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
flavor: The metal turned and blossomed with Saheeli's will, each filigreed twist bringing the temporal anchor closer to completion.

name: Involuntary Cooldown
text: Tap up to two target artifacts and/or creatures. Put two stun counters on each of them. (If a permanent with a stun counter would become untapped, remove one from it instead.)
flavor:
"Back to the ivory towers! This won't hold for long!"
—Vayor, Third Path cryomancer

name: Keeper of the Cadence
text: {3}: Put target artifact, instant, or sorcery card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
flavor: "What you call magic, I call the power of memory."

name: Lat-Nam Adept
text: Whenever you draw your second card each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Lat-Nam Adept.
flavor: "Every book is a doorway to enlightenment. Curiosity is your key."

name: Machine Over Matter
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control an artifact creature.
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: The Warlord decreed that only someone who could move the statue would be strong enough to marry the princess. So Urza moved it.

name: Retrieval Agent
text: {2}: Retrieval Agent gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: The humming tome burned his leather glove, nearly taking his hand along with it. Then a strange power coursed through him.

name: Scatter Ray
text: Counter target artifact or creature spell unless its controller pays {4}.
flavor: Mishra's army demanded the secrets of the Third Path. Hurkyl's followers graciously showed them.

name: Skystrike Officer
text:
Flying
Whenever Skystrike Officer attacks, create a 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature token.
Tap three untapped Soldiers you control: Draw a card.
flavor: "Landing zone is clear. Activate and deploy!"

name: Splitting the Powerstone
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Create two tapped Powerstone tokens. If the sacrificed artifact was legendary, draw a card. (The tokens are artifacts with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor: As the glowing stone broke apart, so too did the last shred of the brothers' bond.

name: Stern Lesson
text: Draw two cards, then discard a card. Create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor:
"The brothers are brilliant, but their quarreling will be the death of me."
—Tocasia, journal entry

name: Take Flight
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has flying and "Whenever this creature attacks, draw a card."
flavor: Though neither brother cared to admit it, flying the ancient thopter was their last happy moment together.

name: Third Path Savant
text: {7}: Draw two cards.
flavor: As Mishra's army bore down on Terisia City, Corlo felt his focus, his patience, and his willpower twine together. With a deep breath, he plucked answers from the air.

name: Thopter Mechanic
text:
Whenever you draw your second card each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Thopter Mechanic.
When Thopter Mechanic dies, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
flavor: "You want me to install a seat belt? Please. You're lucky to get a seat!"

name: Urza's Rebuff
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell.
• Tap up to two target creatures.
flavor:
"As usual, my brother's maneuvers are brash and impulsive."
—Urza

name: Wing Commando
text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "The welds are weaker at the top."

name: Ashnod's Intervention
text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +2/+0 and gains "When this creature dies or is put into exile from the battlefield, return it to its owner's hand."
flavor: "Listen, Duck. Gix is everywhere, playing every side. Mishra won't listen . . . but perhaps Urza will."

name: Battlefield Butcher
text: {5}, {T}: Each opponent loses 2 life. This ability costs {1} less to activate for each creature card in your graveyard.
flavor: "Any more giant metal monsters want to try their luck? I'm just getting warmed up!"

name: Carrion Locust
text:
Flying
When Carrion Locust enters the battlefield, exile target card from an opponent's graveyard. If it was a creature card, that player loses 1 life.
flavor: No honor. No glory. No leftovers.

name: Corrupt
text: Corrupt deals damage to any target equal to the number of Swamps you control. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
flavor: "Most wise, most thoughtful, most powerful qadir," said the Gixian, "we offer whatever help we may give in your illustrious name."

name: Diabolic Intent
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Gix pierced his disciples' minds and savored their experiences as he took in their knowledge.

name: Disciples of Gix
text: When Disciples of Gix enters the battlefield, search your library for up to three artifact cards, put them into your graveyard, then shuffle.
flavor: "Machines feel no fear, no sorrow, no hunger—only glorious purpose, true and pure."

name: Dreams of Steel and Oil
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose an artifact or creature card from it, then choose an artifact or creature card from their graveyard. Exile the chosen cards.
flavor: Mishra's nightmares of Phyrexia rang with screams of agony and groans of twisted metal. The sounds stayed with him long after he awoke.

name: Emergency Weld
text: Return target artifact or creature card from your graveyard to your hand. Create a 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature token.
flavor: Scurrying repair bots quietly turned the tide of many battles, patching damaged automatons back into fighting form.

name: Fateful Handoff
text: Draw cards equal to the mana value of target artifact or creature you control. An opponent gains control of that permanent.
flavor:
"Get the sylex to Urza at any cost. Tell him to fill it with memories of the land."
—Ashnod, to Tawnos

name: Gix's Caress
text:
Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
Create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor: "Show me all the delicious misery you've sown."

name: Gixian Infiltrator
text: Whenever you sacrifice another permanent, put a +1/+1 counter on Gixian Infiltrator.
flavor: "Terisia City's fall is inevitable. My master's plan runs as sure and steady as the oil in my veins."

name: Gixian Puppeteer
text:
Whenever you draw your second card each turn, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
When Gixian Puppeteer dies, return another target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: To some, desecration. To Gix, decoration.

name: Gixian Skullflayer
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are three or more creature cards in your graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Gixian Skullflayer.
flavor: "With every culling, we bring this world closer to *compleation*."

name: Gnawing Vermin
text:
When Gnawing Vermin enters the battlefield, target player mills two cards.
When Gnawing Vermin dies, target creature you don't control gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Everyone warns about the sand and the food, but the rats are worse than both put together!"
—Sanwell, letter to his family

name: Gruesome Realization
text:
Choose one —
• You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
• Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: Mishra was gone—all that remained was a machine wearing his face.

name: Kill-Zone Acrobat
text: Whenever Kill-Zone Acrobat attacks, you may sacrifice another creature or artifact. If you do, Kill-Zone Acrobat gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Her circus training proved surprisingly valuable on the battlefield.

name: Misery's Shadow
text:
If a creature an opponent controls would die, exile it instead.
{1}: Misery's Shadow gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: In the ruins of Kroog, only anguish thrived.

name: Moment of Defiance
text:
Target creature gets +2/+1 and gains lifelink until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor: "Well? What are you waiting for? Let's not keep the buzzards waiting."

name: No One Left Behind
text:
This spell costs {3} less to cast if it targets a creature card with mana value 3 or less.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: Dying for the cause is overrated.

name: Overwhelming Remorse
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.
Exile target creature or planeswalker.
flavor: Tocasia's face haunted his vision. The explosion still rung in his ears. Mishra kept running and never once looked back.

name: Painful Quandary
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player loses 5 life unless they discard a card.
flavor: In Mishra's desperation to destroy his brother, he allowed Gix to destroy him instead.

name: Powerstone Fracture
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Destroy target creature or planeswalker.
flavor:
"Move! When the powerstone blows, that behemoth will be nothing but a hole in the ground."
—Ashnod, to Hajar

name: Thran Vigil
text: Whenever one or more artifact and/or creature cards leave your graveyard during your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
flavor: Glacian built his automatons to last, and last they did, beyond even the Thran themselves.

name: Thraxodemon
text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature or artifact: Draw a card.
flavor: Urza and Mishra weren't the only denizens of Terisiare to covet the powerstones' energy.

name: Trench Stalker
text: As long as you've drawn two or more cards this turn, Trench Stalker has deathtouch and lifelink.
flavor: It can hear a panicked heartbeat from a thousand paces away.

name: Clay Revenant
text:
Clay Revenant enters the battlefield tapped.
{2}{B}: Return Clay Revenant from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Tawnos built his clay statues for durability, not knowing they'd keep fighting long after the war.

name: Goring Warplow
text:
Prototype {1}{B} — 1/1 (You may cast this spell with different mana cost, color, and size. It keeps its abilities and types.)
Deathtouch
flavor: Built to crush walls and wills in equal measure.

name: Transmogrant Altar
text:
{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C}{C}.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Create a 3/3 colorless Zombie artifact creature token. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor:
"The human body—like any other machine—can be stripped for parts."
—Ashnod

name: Transmogrant's Crown
flavor: Fallaji soldiers hated seeing loved ones' faces among the transmogrants. Ashnod devised a solution.

name: Arms Race
text: {3}{R}: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield. That artifact gains haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "You want it good, fast, or cheap? You can't have all three."

name: Bitter Reunion
text:
When Bitter Reunion enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, draw two cards.
{1}, Sacrifice Bitter Reunion: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn.
flavor: The peace summit proved the grudge between Urza and Mishra could end only in blood.

name: Brotherhood's End
text:
Choose one —
• Brotherhood's End deals 3 damage to each creature and each planeswalker.
• Destroy all artifacts with mana value 3 or less.
flavor: The brothers' rivalry escalated into all-out enmity, and Tocasia paid the price.

name: Conscripted Infantry
text: When Conscripted Infantry dies, create a 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature token.
flavor: "Funny," remarked Laga to his squad. "Mishra's lackeys wear luxurious silks in their gilded palaces, while we toil in the trenches eating stale bread."

name: Excavation Explosion
text: Excavation Explosion deals 3 damage to any target. Create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor: Urza's engineers could take weeks to dig out a powerstone. The goblins weren't so painstaking.

name: The Fall of Kroog
text: Choose target opponent. Destroy target land that player controls. The Fall of Kroog deals 3 damage to that player and 1 damage to each creature they control.
flavor: As retaliation for the Warlord's ambush at the peace summit, Mishra leveled Yotia's capital city.

name: Fallaji Chaindancer
text: {2}: Fallaji Chaindancer gains double strike until end of turn.
flavor: She was eager to show the invading Yotians how she earned her nickname, "The Sandstorm of Tomakul."

name: Giant Cindermaw
text:
Trample
Players can't gain life.
flavor:
"Don't excavate too far into those canyons. I promised your parents I'd return you in one piece."
—Tocasia

name: Goblin Blast-Runner
text: Goblin Blast-Runner gets +2/+0 and has menace as long as you sacrificed a permanent this turn.
flavor: Most goblins can light a fuse and run, but only the cleverest remember to drop the bomb.

name: Mechanized Warfare
text: If a red or artifact source you control would deal damage to an opponent or a permanent an opponent controls, it deals that much damage plus 1 instead.
flavor: First the automatons reinforced depleted squads. Then they replaced them entirely.

name: Mishra, Excavation Prodigy
text:
Haste
{1}, {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
Whenever you discard one or more artifact cards, add {R}{R}. This ability triggers only once each turn.
flavor: While Urza read books, Mishra learned to read the desert itself.

name: Mishra's Domination
text:
Enchant creature
As long as you control enchanted creature, it gets +2/+2. Otherwise, it can't block.
flavor: Power radiated from the Weakstone, binding the dragon engine to Mishra's command.

name: Mishra's Onslaught
text:
Choose one —
• Create two 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature tokens.
• Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Hah. Urza has underestimated my strength yet again."
—Mishra

name: Obliterating Bolt
text: Obliterating Bolt deals 4 damage to target creature or planeswalker. If that creature or planeswalker would die this turn, exile it instead.
flavor: In desperation, Pero called on his memory of a lightning storm that nearly killed his family. When he opened his eyes, only smoke and dust remained.

name: Penregon Strongbull
text: {1}, Sacrifice an artifact: Penregon Strongbull gets +1/+1 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to each opponent.
flavor: His child-lifting act was second only to his cauldron-punting routine.

name: Pyrrhic Blast
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Pyrrhic Blast deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target. Draw a card.
flavor: Only the quartermaster wept for their loss.

name: Raze to the Ground
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy target artifact. If its mana value was 1 or less, draw a card.
flavor: First one, then a second, then a third of the ivory towers fell to the invaders, who moved in a circle around the city like an apocalyptic clock.

name: Roc Hunter
text: Reach
flavor: "Never track the roc itself with your eyes, for it will swoop with the sun at its back and blind you. Instead, track its shadow and, when it's almost upon you, heave your javelin upward with all your might."

name: Sardian Cliffstomper
text: As long as it's your turn and you control four or more Mountains, Sardian Cliffstomper gets +X/+0, where X is the number of Mountains you control.
flavor: When Urza betrayed the Sardian dwarves, they called upon the might of their neighbors for aid.

name: Tyrant of Kher Ridges
text:
Flying
When Tyrant of Kher Ridges enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to any target.
{R}: Tyrant of Kher Ridges gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: In war, dragons don't see sides, just side dishes.

name: Unleash Shell
text: Unleash Shell deals 5 damage to target creature or planeswalker and 2 damage to that permanent's controller.
flavor: The new cannon's destructive power more than made up for its unpredictable blast radius.

name: Whirling Strike
text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike and trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"I will trust desert steel in Fallaji hands over a soulless machine any day."
—Hajar, Mishra's bodyguard

name: Blitz Automaton
text:
Prototype {2}{R} - 3/2 (You may cast this spell with different mana cost, color, and size. It keeps its abilities and types.)
Haste
flavor: While Urza's machines favored defense, Mishra built his to end the war quickly.

name: Alloy Animist
text: {2}{G}: Until end of turn, target noncreature artifact you control becomes a 4/4 artifact creature.
flavor: "This metal belonged to Argoth before it was ripped from the ground. Now it belongs to Argoth again."

name: Argothian Opportunist
text: When Argothian Opportunist enters the battlefield, create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor: "Nature adapts. So should we."

name: Argothian Sprite
text:
Argothian Sprite can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
{7}: Put two +1/+1 counters on Argothian Sprite.
flavor:
"Make the exhaust vents smaller next time!"
—Urza, notes to his engineers

name: Audacity
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Audacity is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: Bravery outlives the brave.

name: Awaken the Woods
text: Create X 1/1 green Forest Dryad land creature tokens. (They're affected by summoning sickness.)
flavor:
"We expected the Argothians to stand their ground. We didn't expect the ground itself to stand."
—Myrel, Shield of Argive

name: Burrowing Razormaw
text: When Burrowing Razormaw dies, mill four cards. (Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.)
flavor:
"That's odd. I don't remember seeing plans to dig a trench near here."
—Lognell, Argivian scout

name: Citanul Stalwart
text: {T}, Tap an untapped artifact or creature you control: Add one mana of any color.
flavor: The endless grind of the Brothers' War had fouled Terisiare's land and blackened its skies. Argoth's defenders were determined to protect their isle from the same fate.

name: Fade from History
text: Each player who controls an artifact or enchantment creates a 2/2 green Bear creature token. Then destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
flavor: After a long hibernation, Argoth began slowly recovering from the ravages of war.

name: Fallaji Excavation
text: Create three tapped Powerstone tokens. You gain 3 life. (The tokens are artifacts with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
flavor: Few relics excited Fallaji archaeologists more than Thran powerstones, which they called "eyes of the Old Ones."

name: Fauna Shaman
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a creature card: Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: "I call upon both predators and protectors, for now is a season of war."

name: Fog of War
text: You gain 1 life for each creature on the battlefield. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures with power 3 or less.
flavor: So thick was the fog on Argoth's shores that the brothers' forces passed within shouting distance of each other without realizing it.

name: Gaea's Courser
text: Whenever Gaea's Courser attacks, if there are three or more creature cards in your graveyard, draw a card.
flavor: "Even the leaves oppose your being here. What hope have you against nature's might?"

name: Gaea's Gift
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. It gains reach, trample, hexproof, and indestructible until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control. Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
flavor: When it came to fighting an army of trees, even Mishra's best generals were stumped.

name: Gnarlroot Pallbearer
text:
Trample
When Gnarlroot Pallbearer enters the battlefield, target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
flavor: The flames of war consumed most of Argoth's treefolk. Vengeance consumed the rest.

name: Hoarding Recluse
text:
Reach, deathtouch
When Hoarding Recluse dies, put up to one other target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
flavor: To the spiders of Argoth, thopters were just bigger, crunchier flies.

name: Perimeter Patrol
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Perimeter Patrol gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The Fallaji quickly learned that the Kher Ridges held too many caves and valleys to be surveyed from the air alone.

name: Sarinth Steelseeker
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may reveal it and put it into your hand. If you don't put the card into your hand, you may put it into your graveyard.
flavor: "This metal junk is ugly, but it's got its uses."

name: Shoot Down
text: Exile target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.
flavor: Gwenna stayed her hand only once, to save young Harbin's life—a mistake she would never repeat.

name: Tawnos's Tinkering
text: Put two +1/+1 counters on target artifact, creature, or land you control. Untap that permanent. If it isn't a creature, it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.
flavor: While his master tried to surpass nature, Tawnos aimed to capture its beauty.

name: Tomakul Honor Guard
text: Ward {2} (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {2}.)
flavor: In the Great Desert, one law is enforced over all others: water belongs to all.

name: Wasteful Harvest
text: Mill five cards. You may put a permanent card from among the cards milled this way into your hand. (To mill a card, put the top card of your library into your graveyard.)
flavor: Once the brothers discovered the pristine island of Argoth, the war came down to who could plunder it faster.

name: Boulderbranch Golem
text:
Prototype {3}{G} — 3/3 (You may cast this spell with different mana cost, color, and size. It keeps its abilities and types.)
When Boulderbranch Golem enters the battlefield, you gain life equal to its power.
flavor:
"Artifice is not the only form of creation."
—Titania

name: Cradle Clearcutter
text:
Prototype {2}{G} - 1/3 (You may cast this spell with different mana cost, color, and size. It keeps its abilities and types.)
{T}: Add an amount of {G} equal to Cradle Clearcutter's power.
flavor: A thousand years of growth, harvested in minutes.

name: Haywire Mite
text:
When Haywire Mite dies, you gain 2 life.
{G}, Sacrifice Haywire Mite: Exile target noncreature artifact or noncreature enchantment.
flavor:
"They're easy enough to squish, but they're a pain to wash out of a workbench."
—Tergel, goblin explosioneer

name: Rust Goliath
text:
Prototype {3}{G}{G} — 3/5 (You may cast this spell with different mana cost, color, and size. It keeps its abilities and types.)
Reach, trample
flavor:
"You know those seedpods cluttering the eastern approach? I've got an idea . . . ."
—Calle, Urzan sergeant

name: Rescue Retriever
text:
Flash
When Rescue Retriever enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other Soldier you control.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to other attacking Soldiers you control.
flavor: It brings the two things weary soldiers need most: medicine and morale.

name: Blizzard Elemental
text:
Flying
{3}{U}: Untap Blizzard Elemental.
flavor: Students who had seen Rayne argue with Urza were certain she had summoned it to make him seem warmer by comparison.

name: Cloud Djinn
text:
Flying
Cloud Djinn can block only creatures with flying.
flavor:
As elusive as the footprint of a djinn
—Suq'Ata expression

name: Giant Crab
text: {U}: Giant Crab gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: During the giant crabs' mating season, Skyshroud nights are filled with the clatter of their skirmishes.

name: Killer Whale
text: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.

name: Wayward Soul
text:
Flying
{U}: Put Wayward Soul on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"no home no heart no hope"
—Stronghold graffito

name: Bone Harvest
text:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"Only fools believe they will face my armies but once."
—Kaervek

name: Death Stroke
text: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home, As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.

name: Diabolic Edict
text: Target player sacrifices a creature.
flavor: Greven *il*-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

name: Skittering Horror
text: When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Horror.
flavor:
"This monstrosity will do—for now."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath

name: Skittering Skirge
text:
Flying
When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Skirge.
flavor: The imps' warbling cries echo through Phyrexia's towers like those of mourning doves in a cathedral.

name: Tar Pit Warrior
text: When Tar Pit Warrior becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor:
"The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep."
—Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"

name: Lowland Giant
flavor: "Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."

name: Sonic Burst
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card at random.
Sonic Burst deals 4 damage to any target.
flavor: Music scythes the savage beast.

name: Crash of Rhinos
text: Trample
flavor:
Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way.
—Femeref adage

name: Crashing Boars
text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature they control. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.
flavor: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.

name: Plated Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: Most spiders wait patiently for their prey to arrive. Most spiders aren't forty feet tall.

name: Yavimaya Wurm
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor: When the gorilla playfully grabbed the wurm's tail, the wurm doubled back and playfully ate the gorilla's head.

name: Ajani's Pridemate
text: Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Ajani's Pridemate.
flavor:
"When one of us prospers, the pride prospers."
—Jazal Goldmane

name: Curse of the Forsaken
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature attacks enchanted player, its controller gains 1 life.
flavor:
"Purge the damned, for they have no place among the righteous!"
—Seeta of Thraben

name: Darksteel Mutation
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature is an Insect artifact creature with base power and toughness 0/1 and has indestructible, and it loses all other abilities, card types, and creature types.
flavor: Infinitely powerless.

name: Mirror Entity
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{X}: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.
flavor: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.

name: Razor Hippogriff
text:
Flying
When Razor Hippogriff enters the battlefield, return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand. You gain life equal to that card's mana value.
flavor: She incubates her eggs in gold and mana.

name: Serene Master
text: Whenever Serene Master blocks, exchange its power and the power of target creature it's blocking until end of combat.
flavor:
"A great warrior studies many different disciplines and takes the best from each."
—Gideon Jura

name: Serra Avatar
text:
Serra Avatar's power and toughness are each equal to your life total.
When Serra Avatar is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.
flavor: "Serra isn't dead. She lives on through me."

name: Unexpectedly Absent
text: Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library.
flavor: Once you've been dragged down the currents of time, you'll never quite trust your own permanence again.

name: Wall of Reverence
text:
Defender, flying
At the beginning of your end step, you may gain life equal to the power of target creature you control.
flavor: The lives of elves are long, but their memories are longer. Even after death, they do not desert their homes.

name: Azami, Lady of Scrolls
text: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Draw a card.
flavor:
"Choices belong to those with the luxuries of time and distance. We have neither. I recommend we proceed with the plan to destroy all shrines of the kami."
—Lady Azami, letter to Sensei Hisoka

name: Brilliant Plan
text: Draw three cards.
flavor: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

name: Control Magic
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
flavor:
"Do as I think, not as I do."
—Jace Beleren

name: Curse of Inertia
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may tap or untap target permanent of their choice.
flavor:
"As long as I pull the strings, you will dance."
—Tezzeret

name: Dismiss
text:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"There is nothing you can do that I cannot simply deny."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Diviner Spirit
text: Whenever Diviner Spirit deals combat damage to a player, you and that player each draw that many cards.
flavor: Sentience is its natural habitat.

name: Djinn of Infinite Deceits
text:
Flying
{T}: Exchange control of two target nonlegendary creatures. You can't activate this ability during combat.
flavor: The winds of change have a mind of their own.

name: Guard Gomazoa
text:
Defender, flying
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Guard Gomazoa.
flavor: It lingers near the outposts of the Makindi Trenches, inadvertently granting another layer of defense.

name: Jace's Archivist
text: {U}, {T}: Each player discards their hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.
flavor: "This is a sacred duty. Master Beleren's trust has bought an eternity of my loyalty."

name: Mnemonic Wall
text:
Defender
When Mnemonic Wall enters the battlefield, you may return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"I'd build an entire fortress of them if I could."
—Mzali, Lighthouse archmage

name: Order of Succession
text: Choose left or right. Starting with you and proceeding in the chosen direction, each player chooses a creature controlled by the next player in that direction. Each player gains control of the creature they chose.
flavor: "Long live . . . me."

name: Skyscribing
text:
Each player draws X cards.
Forecast — {2}{U}, Reveal Skyscribing from your hand: Each player draws a card. (Activate only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)
flavor:
"All clouds should be so organized."
—Isperia

name: Strategic Planning
text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor: "Plans evolved within the tent decide a victory 1,000 *li* away."

name: Thornwind Faeries
text:
Flying
{T}: Thornwind Faeries deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Guarding the ship is the Thornwinds' first concern. Getting along with the locals ranks fourth or fifth at best.

name: Tidal Force
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, you may tap or untap target permanent.
flavor:
"Do not speak the name of the sea, for if it should hear you and rise up, no fortress in the world could hide you."
—Gimara of Halimar

name: Vision Skeins
text: Each player draws two cards.
flavor: "I could see in the other mage's eyes that he'd thought of it too. Then it became a race to exploit the knowledge first."

name: Wonder
text:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.
flavor:
"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Annihilate
text:
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Whatever Yawgmoth marks, dies. There is no escape."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

name: Army of the Damned
text:
Create thirteen tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.
Flashback {7}{B}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: Sometimes death comes knocking. Sometimes it tears down the walls.

name: Baleful Force
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor:
"As with any malevolent being, the trick is knowing how long you can afford to keep it in your service."
—Liliana Vess

name: Disciple of Griselbrand
text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.
flavor: The demon Griselbrand dared to stand against Avacyn, earning him the loathing of thousands and the admiration of a few.

name: Endless Cockroaches
text: When Endless Cockroaches dies, return it to its owner's hand.
