flavor: In life, they were a motley crew: farmers, lords, cutpurses, priests. In death, they are united in singular, benevolent purpose.

name: Purify the Grave
text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Flashback {W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: Some priests speak in whispers of the Helvault, a silver prison of unpurged evils.

name: Ray of Distortion
text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Flashback {4}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: "Now your staff is as twisted as your soul."

name: Roc Egg
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Roc Egg dies, create a 3/3 white Bird creature token with flying.
flavor: A thin shell lies between the roc and a world of bite-sized treats.

name: Storm Herd
text: Create X 1/1 white Pegasus creature tokens with flying, where X is your life total.
flavor:
"When you hear thunder on a cloudless day, take cover and brace for the coming of the storm herd."
—Skotov, Tin Street basket vendor

name: Trostani's Judgment
text: Exile target creature, then populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
flavor:
"Some cannot be saved as they are, but all can serve the Worldsoul."
—Trostani

name: Zetalpa, Primal Dawn
text: Flying, double strike, vigilance, trample, indestructible
flavor: The sky takes flight and the earth trembles.

name: Chemister's Insight
text:
Draw two cards.
Jump-start (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a card in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)
flavor: "My specialty is theoretical universal limits and ways to circumvent them."

name: Clever Impersonator
text: You may have Clever Impersonator enter the battlefield as a copy of any nonland permanent on the battlefield.
flavor:
"Our own selves are the greatest obstacles to enlightenment."
—Narset, khan of the Jeskai

name: Fervent Denial
text:
Counter target spell.
Flashback {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: "I prefer a reality in which you are not."

name: Jace's Sanctum
text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor:
"For all our lofty talk of keeping watch, we had no idea what we were getting into."
—Jace Beleren

name: Oona's Grace
text:
Target player draws a card.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
flavor: Oona grants her favored subjects a dream from her own guarded heart.

name: Runic Repetition
text: Return target exiled card with flashback you own to your hand.
flavor: "What some call obsession, I call the quest for perfection."

name: Secrets of the Dead
text: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, draw a card.
flavor:
"The veil between the living and the dead is so very thin that the whispers of the ancients can finally be heard."
—Amalric of Midvast Hall

name: Think Twice
text:
Draw a card.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: "Either I know just the spell I need, or I'm about to."

name: Asylum Visitor
text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player has no cards in hand, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
Madness {1}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: "The ravings of the mad are laced with eldritch knowledge."

name: Grim Haruspex
text:
Morph {B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
Whenever another nontoken creature you control dies, draw a card.
flavor: "We all want to know what's going on in someone else's head. I simply open it up and look."

name: Murderous Compulsion
text:
Destroy target tapped creature.
Madness {1}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: "Thank you. This blade becomes so hot in my hand, but your blood has quenched it."

name: Sanitarium Skeleton
text: {2}{B}: Return Sanitarium Skeleton from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: His mind was lost long before his flesh.

name: Alchemist's Greeting
text:
Alchemist's Greeting deals 4 damage to target creature.
Madness {1}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor:
"Impressive."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Burning Vengeance
text: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: Mist is the geists' sorrow. Wind is their pain. Fire is their vengeance.

name: Devil's Play
text:
Devil's Play deals X damage to any target.
Flashback {X}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: A devil's hands are never idle.

name: Fiery Temper
text:
Fiery Temper deals 3 damage to any target.
Madness {R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: "Let the flames ignore the sinless."

name: Rolling Temblor
text:
Rolling Temblor deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: When demons open a path to your front door, it's time to move.

name: Druid's Deliverance
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn. Populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
flavor: "Selesnya's roots reach deep into the Worldsoul, and we will not be moved."

name: Garruk's Packleader
text: Whenever another creature with power 3 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.
flavor:
"He has learned much in his long years. And unlike selfish humans, he's willing to share."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Giant Adephage
text:
Trample
Whenever Giant Adephage deals combat damage to a player, create a token that's a copy of Giant Adephage.
flavor:
"To a creature like that, we must seem like, well, bugs."
—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

name: Momentous Fall
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
You draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then you gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor: It wasn't long until the elves had developed a use for every part of the Eldrazi.

name: Overwhelming Stampede
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.
flavor:
"I trust the instincts of any beast over the advice of any human who presumes to be an expert in the art of war."
—Rinshel, elf insurgent

name: Second Harvest
text: For each token you control, create a token that's a copy of that permanent.
flavor:
"The cornfields promise a good yield this season."
—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf

name: Avenging Huntbonder
text:
Double strike
Whenever Avenging Huntbonder attacks, put a double strike counter on another target attacking creature.
flavor: "I teach the cubs how to kill the two-legs quickly, and why it's best for the pride."

name: Call the Coppercoats
text:
Strive — This spell costs {1}{W} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Choose any number of target opponents. Create X 1/1 white Human Soldier creature tokens, where X is the number of creatures those opponents control.
flavor: When the alarm crystals flash, Drannith's finest answer the call.

name: Flawless Maneuver
text:
If you control a commander, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
flavor:
"Captain, your units are the tip of our spear. There is zero room for failure."
—Jirina Kudro

name: Crystalline Resonance
text: Whenever you cycle a card, you may have Crystalline Resonance become a copy of another target permanent until your next turn, except it has this ability.
flavor:
"As a boulder diverts a stream, the crystals bend life around them."
—Rielle, the Everwise

name: Decoy Gambit
text: For each opponent, choose up to one target creature that player controls, then return that creature to its owner's hand unless its controller has you draw a card.
flavor:
"We'll distract them. The rest of you, get out of here!"
—Alux, Skysail defender

name: Fierce Guardianship
text:
If you control a commander, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Counter target noncreature spell.
flavor:
"Hunt somewhere else. This is your only warning."
—Gavi, nest warden

name: Tidal Barracuda
text:
Any player may cast spells as though they had flash.
Your opponents can't cast spells during your turn.
flavor: It lurks in the spaces between moments.

name: Deadly Rollick
text:
If you control a commander, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Exile target creature.
flavor: Otrimi was disappointed at how quickly its new friend got tired and stopped playing.

name: Dredge the Mire
text: Each opponent chooses a creature card in their graveyard. Put those cards onto the battlefield under your control.
flavor: Fortunately, the reanimation spell just missed the long-dead colony of dung scorpions.

name: Netherborn Altar
text: {T}, Put a soul counter on Netherborn Altar: Put your commander into your hand from the command zone. Then you lose 3 life for each soul counter on Netherborn Altar.
flavor: It is spoken of only in whispers, visited only by the desperate.

name: Species Specialist
text:
As Species Specialist enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Whenever a creature of the chosen type dies, you may draw a card.
flavor: "I don't have anything against Snapdax. I'm just more of a dog person."

name: Titan Hunter
text:
At the beginning of each player's end step, if no creatures died this turn, Titan Hunter deals 4 damage to that player.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 4 life.
flavor: "Monster or human, my rate's the same."

name: Deflecting Swat
text:
If you control a commander, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
You may choose new targets for target spell or ability.
flavor: Archmage attacks are little more than annoyances to Kalamax.

name: Frontier Warmonger
text: Whenever one or more creatures attack one of your opponents or a planeswalker they control, those creatures gain menace until end of turn.
flavor: She cares little for leaders or loyalties, so long as the battle rages on.

name: Curious Herd
text: Choose target opponent. You create X 3/3 green Beast creature tokens, where X is the number of artifacts that player controls.
flavor:
"If you don't break camp as you leave, you'll return to find it broken for you."
—Jonald, mission naturalist

name: Glademuse
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, if it's not their turn, that player draws a card.
flavor:
"Rage can be heard throughout the world, but wisdom comes at a whisper."
—Rielle, the Everwise

name: Obscuring Haze
text:
If you control a commander, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures your opponents control.
flavor: Whether hunter or hunted, Kathril chooses when it is seen.

name: Aerial Responder
text: Flying, vigilance, lifelink
flavor: Dwarves have an instinct for repair, an inherent understanding of how systems work, and a reputation for fearlessness. They're perfect candidates for the Fair's emergency response team.

name: Banisher Priest
text: When Banisher Priest enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until Banisher Priest leaves the battlefield. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)
flavor: "Oathbreaker, I cast you out!"

name: Bounty Agent
text:
Vigilance
{T}, Sacrifice Bounty Agent: Destroy target legendary permanent that's an artifact, creature, or enchantment.
flavor: "Lately I've seen the biggest bounties of my career—and for the biggest names."

name: Cavalry Pegasus
text:
Flying
Whenever Cavalry Pegasus attacks, each attacking Human gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"It is hope, hooved and winged."
—Cymede, queen of Akros

name: Citywide Bust
text: Destroy all creatures with toughness 4 or greater.
flavor:
"Oh, you fellas are going to love the lockup. Excellent gruel. Very low ceilings."
—Libuse, Boros sergeant

name: Cleansing Nova
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy all creatures.
• Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
flavor: In their final moments, the demons gazed upon grace in its purest form.

name: Dearly Departed
text:
Flying
As long as Dearly Departed is in your graveyard, each Human creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor:
"Never forget our ancestors. They have not forgotten us."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Descend upon the Sinful
text:
Exile all creatures.
Delirium — Create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor: Above the cries, a phrase rang out: "You will all be saved."

name: Magus of the Disk
text:
Magus of the Disk enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
flavor: Studying the journals of the necromage Nevinyrral leaves disciples gripped with the urge to exercise his draconian judgment.

name: Odric, Master Tactician
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Odric, Master Tactician and at least three other creatures attack, you choose which creatures block this combat and how those creatures block.
flavor: "Fear holds no place in faith's battle plan."

name: Spirit Cairn
text: Whenever a player discards a card, you may pay {W}. If you do, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
flavor: The most beautiful souls shine even in death.

name: Thraben Doomsayer
text:
{T}: Create a 1/1 white Human creature token.
Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +2/+2.
flavor: "Swarms of the unhallowed claw at Thraben's gates! Do you still deny the end approaches?"

name: Frantic Search
text: Draw two cards, then discard two cards. Untap up to three lands.
flavor: It took the banning of temporal manipulation at Tolaria West to teach its students the value of time.

name: Mind Spring
text: Draw X cards.
flavor: Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.

name: Murmuring Mystic
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, create a 1/1 blue Bird Illusion creature token with flying.
flavor: Rumors float through the city like crows, alighting on citizens seemingly at random.

name: Swarm Intelligence
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor: The Locust God's children were numberless, relentlessly eating away every trace of the city's protection.

name: Xathrid Necromancer
text: Whenever Xathrid Necromancer or another Human creature you control dies, create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
flavor: "My commands shall echo forever in their dusty skulls."

name: Captivating Crew
text: {3}{R}: Gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: "We sail. We plunder. Then we dance."

name: Lightning Rift
text: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, Lightning Rift deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor:
"Jealous of storms, Vadrok took lightning from the sky and buried it deep under the earth. It still rumbles there, longing to escape."
—*Tales of the Ozolith*

name: Shared Animosity
text: Whenever a creature you control attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking creature that shares a creature type with it.
flavor:
"It is the nature of souls that they burn more brightly together than apart."
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

name: Tectonic Reformation
text:
Each land card in your hand has cycling {R}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: Alone in the charred desolation of her kingdom, she regretted many things—most of all not acting sooner.

name: Titan of Eternal Fire
text: Each Human creature you control has "{R}, {T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
flavor: There is no gift more precious or more perilous than fire.

name: Beast Whisperer
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, draw a card.
flavor: "The tiniest mouse speaks louder to me than all the festival crowds on Tin Street."

name: Heroes' Bane
text:
Heroes' Bane enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}{G}{G}: Put X +1/+1 counters on Heroes' Bane, where X is its power.
flavor: Travelers' tales claim that hydras bite off their own heads to make themselves deadlier.

name: Hunter's Insight
text: Choose target creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player or planeswalker this turn, draw that many cards.
flavor:
"The predator knows the true way of the world. Life is conflict. Only the strong survive."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Vorapede
text:
Vigilance, trample
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor:
"If you think you've killed one, guess again."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Wilderness Reclamation
text: At the beginning of your end step, untap all lands you control.
flavor:
"Walls crack. Buildings fall. Always the wilds return."
—Domri Rade

name: Excavation Technique
text:
Demonstrate (When you cast this spell, you may copy it. If you do, choose an opponent to also copy it. Players may choose new targets for their copies.)
Destroy target nonland permanent. Its controller creates two Treasure tokens.
flavor: "Stand back. This part gets messy."

name: Monologue Tax
text: Whenever an opponent casts their second spell each turn, you create a Treasure token.
flavor:
"Your unsolicited words enrich us all. Please, continue."
—Yold, professor of cryptorelicology

name: Promise of Loyalty
text: Each player puts a vow counter on a creature they control and sacrifices the rest. Each of those creatures can't attack you or planeswalkers you control for as long as it has a vow counter on it.
flavor: "It's us against the world. Forever."

name: Commander's Insight
text: Target player draws X cards plus an additional card for each time they've cast a commander from the command zone this game.
flavor: No amount of solitary studying can replace a master's tutelage.

name: Perplexing Test
text:
Choose one —
• Return all creature tokens to their owners' hands.
• Return all nontoken creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor: "Your proofs were a bit nontraditional, but effective nonetheless. Full marks."

name: Sly Instigator
text: {U}, {T}: Until your next turn, target creature an opponent controls can't be blocked. Goad that creature. (Until your next turn, that creature attacks each combat if able and attacks a player other than you if able.)
flavor: "Me? I'm just an innocent bystander!"

name: Spawning Kraken
text: Whenever a Kraken, Leviathan, Octopus, or Serpent you control deals combat damage to a player, create a 9/9 blue Kraken creature token.
flavor:
"I never imagined I'd lay eyes on a creature that makes Gyruda look small and harmless!"
—Lukka

name: Theoretical Duplication
text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control this turn, create a token that's a copy of that creature.
flavor:
"You made it asymmetrical just to annoy me, didn't you?"
—Imbraham, Quandrix dean

name: Blight Mound
text:
Attacking Pests you control get +1/+0 and have menace.
Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
flavor: Pests feed on carrion, mud, and one another.

name: Bold Plagiarist
text:
Flash
Whenever an opponent puts one or more counters on a creature they control, they put the same number and kind of counters on Bold Plagiarist.
flavor: "I know a good idea when I see one."

name: Essence Pulse
text: You gain 2 life. Each creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
flavor:
"There is nothing so invigorating and stubbornly belligerent as the pure energy of life."
—Valentin, Witherbloom dean

name: Incarnation Technique
text:
Demonstrate (When you cast this spell, you may copy it. If you do, choose an opponent to also copy it.)
Mill five cards, then return a creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "Draw out your fear, but don't let it control you. You're in charge now."

name: Marshland Bloodcaster
text:
Flying
{1}{B}, {T}: Rather than pay the mana cost of the next spell you cast this turn, you may pay life equal to that spell's mana value.
flavor: Blood magic is more artery than science.

name: Stinging Study
text: You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the mana value of a commander you own on the battlefield or in the command zone.
flavor: Silverquill first-years welcome discomfort in the classroom, knowing it will prepare them for the years ahead.

name: Veinwitch Coven
text:
Menace
Whenever you gain life, you may pay {B}. If you do, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Some Strixhaven study groups are more welcoming than others.

name: Inferno Project
text:
Trample
Inferno Project enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the total mana value of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.
flavor: Art born from such raw emotion often takes on a life of its own.

name: Blossoming Bogbeast
text: Whenever Blossoming Bogbeast attacks, you gain 2 life. Then creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
flavor:
As subtle as a bogbeast
—Witherbloom expression meaning
"crude and clumsy"

name: Guardian Augmenter
text:
Flash
Commander creatures you control get +2/+2.
Commanders you control have hexproof.
flavor: After years of research, he finally unlocked the formula for a perfect punch.

name: Pest Infestation
text: Destroy up to X target artifacts and/or enchantments. Create twice X 1/1 black and green Pest creature tokens with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
flavor: A thousand years of history undone by one juvenile prank.

name: Sequence Engine
text: {X}, {T}: Exile target creature card with mana value X from a graveyard. Create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor:
"Reality, when broken down, is just math."
—Deekah, professor of fractal theory

name: Trudge Garden
text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 4/4 green Fungus Beast creature token with trample.
flavor:
"Sure, trudges smell like soggy death, but the mushrooms on their backs are the tastiest delicacy in Sedgemoor!"
—Gyome, Witherbloom chef

name: Yedora, Grave Gardener
text: Whenever another nontoken creature you control dies, you may return it to the battlefield face down under its owner's control. It's a Forest land. (It has no other types or abilities.)
flavor: "Even in death, we never stop growing."

name: Dispatch
text:
Tap target creature.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, exile that creature.
flavor: Venser wondered if it could still be called a teleportation spell if the destination is oblivion.

name: Hunted Lammasu
text:
Flying
When Hunted Lammasu enters the battlefield, target opponent creates a 4/4 black Horror creature token.
flavor: The lammasu ruled the velds before the city grew. Now they roam Ravnica's skies, but their ancient enemies have not forgotten them.

name: Tragic Arrogance
text: For each player, you choose from among the permanents that player controls an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a planeswalker. Then each player sacrifices all other nonland permanents they control.
flavor: The spear thrown by Kytheon's own hand was the weapon that felled his friends.

name: Aetherspouts
text: For each attacking creature, its owner puts it on the top or bottom of their library.
flavor:
"Don't worry, there's plenty for everyone."
—Vickon, Eleventh Company battlemage

name: Crafty Cutpurse
text:
Flash
When Crafty Cutpurse enters the battlefield, each token that would be created under an opponent's control this turn is created under your control instead.
flavor: Possession is eleven-tenths of the pirate code.

name: Curse of the Swine
text: Exile X target creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller creates a 2/2 green Boar creature token.
flavor: Another imminent battle subsided in busy snuffling and carefree rooting.

name: Bloodthirsty Aerialist
text:
Flying
Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Bloodthirsty Aerialist.
flavor: A circus acrobat in life, she kills with such fluid grace that even her victims are awed by her performance.

name: Epicure of Blood
text: Whenever you gain life, each opponent loses 1 life.
flavor: "Fleshy, with just a hint of leather. A fine vintage."

name: Necropolis Regent
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, put that many +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor: "Jarad fancies himself king of the undercity, but he's merely king of rot."

name: Silversmote Ghoul
text:
At the beginning of your end step, if you gained 3 or more life this turn, return Silversmote Ghoul from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice Silversmote Ghoul: Draw a card.
flavor: Being trapped between two forms of unlife is a fate worse than mere death.

name: Suffer the Past
text: Exile X target cards from target player's graveyard. For each card exiled this way, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor: Ulamog's tentacles, their touch like burning ice, rummaged through his soul and stung his memories one by one.

name: Taste of Death
text: Each player sacrifices three creatures. You create three Food tokens. (They're artifacts with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.")
flavor:
"Hone the knife and mourn the least. Three chimes to sound the sweet, grim feast."
—Barrow witch incantation

name: Brass's Bounty
text: For each land you control, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor:
"Why squabble for trinkets when we could be living large off all this gold?"
—Admiral Beckett Brass

name: Erratic Cyclops
text:
Trample
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Erratic Cyclops gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that spell's mana value.
flavor:
"The League accepts no responsibility for former members and the damage they may cause."
—Maree, Izzet chamberlain

name: Quicksmith Genius
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
flavor: Quicksmiths are eager to jump from one project to the next, relying on flashes of inspiration rather than careful research.

name: Ageless Entity
text: Whenever you gain life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Ageless Entity.
flavor: Tel-Jilad's sworn protectors are the trolls, yet more fearsome protectors were created by the Tangle itself.

name: Verdant Sun's Avatar
text: Whenever Verdant Sun's Avatar or another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
flavor:
"Ixalli's fertile rays enliven us all. Each of us is a testament to the sun's strength and love."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider

name: Pyromancer's Goggles
text: {T}: Add {R}. When that mana is spent to cast a red instant or sorcery spell, copy that spell and you may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor:
"I hope to meet Jaya Ballard someday. I think we'd get along."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Omnath, Locus of Mana
text:
You don't lose unspent green mana as steps and phases end.
Omnath, Locus of Mana gets +1/+1 for each unspent green mana you have.
flavor: From the Roil emerged a ravenous primordial being of pure mana.

name: Cage of Hands
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
{1}{W}: Return Cage of Hands to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Our own actions built the prisons that now hold us. Our hands reached too far and tried to hold too much."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Call to Glory
text: Untap all creatures you control. Samurai creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"General Takeno glared at us as if we were the enemy. 'The day is not over yet,' he shouted, 'and unless you have a nezumi's heart, you *will* stand and fight!'"
—*Battle of Akagi River: A Survivor's Tale*

name: Cleanfall
text: Destroy all enchantments.
flavor: During the war, the rites of purification were still effective, but the kami, not the kitsune, chose what to cleanse.

name: Devoted Retainer
text: Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: Deep within Eiganjo Castle lay the Palace of Infinite Halls, a seemingly endless network of corridors once guarded by a seemingly endless legion of samurai.

name: Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
text:
{1}{W}: Target permanent you control gains protection from white until end of turn.
{1}: Target spell or permanent becomes white until end of turn.
flavor: "Virtue is an inner light that can prevail in every soul."

name: Ethereal Haze
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by creatures this turn.
flavor:
"Imagine a dove flying through smoke. Does the dove injure the smoke? Does the smoke impede the dove?"
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Hold the Line
text: Blocking creatures get +7/+7 until end of turn.
flavor: "Forgive me, Master Kami, but in the interest of my people I must halt your advance."

name: Honden of Cleansing Fire
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 2 life for each Shrine you control.
flavor: To the sorrow of all, its fire was turned toward those who worshipped it.

name: Horizon Seed
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, regenerate target creature.
flavor: In peaceful times, these beings escorted the honored kami to their new shrines. In the Kami War, they became the medics of an unstoppable army.

name: Indomitable Will
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
flavor:
"None of you are yet samurai. Defend your homes with honor, die for your cause, and perhaps then you will be worthy of the word."
—General Takeno

name: Innocence Kami
text:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, untap Innocence Kami.
flavor: Her voice was light, her substance music.

name: Isamaru, Hound of Konda
flavor: The hound sniffed the air and let slip a low growl. General Takeno looked down at the faithful Isamaru and calmed him with a touch. "Alert the men. The kami are coming."

name: Kabuto Moth
text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Many great warriors died in the first days of the war, as the spirits of their weaponry turned against them with terrifying rage."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Kami of Ancient Law
text: Sacrifice Kami of Ancient Law: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor:
"Duty and law are the foundation on which civilization stands. They must not fall, for when they do, they take everything with them."
—Lord Konda

name: Kami of the Painted Road
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of the Painted Road gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: In ancient times, precepts of kami law were inscribed onto bridges as a gesture of respect. During the war, humans regarded them as warnings of where not to travel.

name: Kitsune Blademaster
text:
First strike
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: Those kitsune trained in the blade preferred to fight with a blade-catching jitte in the off hand, buying them just enough time to deliver the first deadly cut.

name: Kitsune Diviner
text: {T}: Tap target Spirit.
flavor: She who once led prayers honoring the kami adapted to use her influence to stay them.

name: Kitsune Riftwalker
text: Protection from Spirits and from Arcane
flavor: The wake of his passage shoved aside the influence of the kami.

name: Lantern Kami
text: Flying
flavor:
"Snuffing the light of a lantern without saying a small prayer is bad luck. Though its flame can only singe, its soul can repeatedly visit misery on one's house."
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Masako the Humorless
text:
Flash
Tapped creatures you control can block as though they were untapped.
flavor: Konda's servants dared not neglect their duties for a moment under Masako's icy gaze, knowing that what she saw, Lord Konda would hear.

name: Mothrider Samurai
text:
Flying
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: When the night blossoms open, the wings of Eiganjo take flight.

name: Otherworldly Journey
text: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor:
"The landscape shimmered and I felt a chill breeze. When my vision cleared, I found myself alone among the corpses of my fallen friends."
—Journal found in Numai

name: Quiet Purity
text: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor:
"When the Kami of Utter Silence passes, walls lose their secrets. Scrolls lose their lessons. Tapestries lose their beauty. Where there was meaning, there is only stillness."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Reciprocate
text: Exile target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.
flavor:
"Just as the noble soul calls virtue to itself, the evil soul summons harm."
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Samurai Enforcers
text: Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
flavor: From the moment they swore their oaths, they belonged to their lord, sword and soul.

name: Silent-Chant Zubera
text: When Silent-Chant Zubera dies, you gain 2 life for each Zubera that died this turn.
flavor: When the Honden of Cleansing Fire was abandoned, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to erode mortal will.

name: Terashi's Cry
text: Tap up to three target creatures.
flavor:
"The sun kami is terrible to behold. When its temper flares, best seek shade and pray for forgiveness."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Vassal's Duty
text: {1}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target legendary creature you control this turn is dealt to you instead.
flavor: "My life is yours, my lord. There is no greater service than to yield it for your safety."

name: Vigilance
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)
flavor:
"Put a spear in a peasant's hands, and you have an expendable troop. Put a purpose in his heart, and you win a warrior."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Aura of Dominion
text:
Enchant creature
{1}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Untap enchanted creature.
flavor:
"Lies and deceit do yield results, but legitimate authority is the ultimate form of control."
—Meloku the Clouded Mirror

name: Cut the Tethers
text: For each Spirit, return it to its owner's hand unless that player pays {3}.
flavor:
"You cannot bar the path of gods. You can only divert their journey for a while."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Eerie Procession
text: Search your library for an Arcane card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor:
"Though in years past speculation was not encouraged about the strange ways of kami, now we must understand their motivations, if such is even possible to the mortal mind."
—Lady Azami

name: Eye of Nowhere
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Once we prayed to the kaijin for safe voyage. Now we only pray that we can escape their gaze."
—Hayato, master sailor

name: Field of Reality
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by Spirits.
{1}{U}: Return Field of Reality to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"The scholars of the Minamo School understood the veil between their world and that of the kami. Moreover, they knew how to exploit it."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Floating-Dream Zubera
text: When Floating-Dream Zubera dies, draw a card for each Zubera that died this turn.
flavor: When the Honden of Seeing Winds was forgotten, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to uncover mortal secrets.

name: Graceful Adept
text: You have no maximum hand size.
flavor:
"When you have mastered my lessons, it will seem as though the whole of the world has opened up to your mind and nothing is beyond your grasp."
—Lady Azami

name: Guardian of Solitude
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"It seemed an easy thing, to step into the nothingness, to fall, to die. But then, for an instant, I saw it, eyes filled with endless sorrow, and I turned back to face my pain."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Hisoka, Minamo Sensei
text: {2}{U}, Discard a card: Counter target spell if it has the same mana value as the discarded card.
flavor: "By all rights we should have perished in the Kami War. Our perseverence is a tribute to mortal ingenuity. And perhaps a few forgotten secrets found in the nick of time."

name: Hisoka's Defiance
text: Counter target Spirit or Arcane spell.
flavor: "With every passing day, the kami shape our world to suit their will. I, for one, would not see them succeed."

name: Honden of Seeing Winds
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card for each Shrine you control.
flavor: To the sorrow of all, its winds found sin in the hearts of those who once learned from its wisdom.

name: Kami of Twisted Reflection
text: Sacrifice Kami of Twisted Reflection: Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Its form reflected humanity as it stood during the Kami War: disjointed, confused, and incomplete.

name: Meloku the Clouded Mirror
text:
Flying
{1}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Create a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with flying.
flavor: He loved his cities in the clouds. When he traveled to the lands below, he brought many reminders of his home.

name: Part the Veil
text: Return all creatures you control to their owner's hand.
flavor: At the waterfall, the border between the humanoid and the spirit worlds was weakest. The kami moved across it with ease and at will.

name: Reach Through Mists
text: Draw a card.
flavor:
"Know one part of the name, obsession begins. Know two parts, paranoia sets in. Know three parts, madness descends. Know all, and only the kami know what will become of you."
—Lady Azami

name: River Kaijin
flavor:
"Since the war began, fishermen don't sing to the kaijin to ask for full nets. They guard the shore with thrice-blessed spears, saving the nets for their wives to pack their belongings and leave."
—Hayato, master sailor

name: Sire of the Storm
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may draw a card.
flavor: This storm blows gales through the dreams of men.

name: Soratami Cloudskater
text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: "You hide your actions from eyes on the ground, but nothing escapes the clouds."

name: Soratami Mirror-Mage
text:
Flying
{3}, Return three lands you control to their owner's hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: "The clouds obey my whims, and you'll obey theirs."

name: Soratami Savant
text:
Flying
{3}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
flavor: "To prevent, one must first predict."

name: Soratami Seer
text:
Flying
{4}, Return two lands you control to their owner's hand: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
flavor: Their mirrors show two worlds: that which is and that which should be.

name: Squelch
text:
Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.
flavor: Oku-Doku had gone through all the motions: the same akki cursewords, the same ingredients with their horrid stink, the same rude gestures. Yet not a person died.

name: Teller of Tales
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may tap or untap target creature.
flavor: Words never uttered by mortals flowed incessantly from its many mouths.

name: Thoughtbind
text: Counter target spell with mana value 4 or less.
flavor:
"As the rest of the mortal world waged war, Lady Azami and her students invaded tomes of knowledge. Their search yielded spells critical in the fight."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: The Unspeakable
text:
Flying, trample
Whenever The Unspeakable deals combat damage to a player, you may return target Arcane card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: It is madness that drives men to seek forbidden knowledge, and madness has given it form.

name: Wandering Ones
flavor:
"I saw them once, when I was a child. They led me to my parents' arms when I was lost. Why have they abandoned me now? Why won't they take me home again?"
—Unnamed beggar

name: Ashen-Skin Zubera
text: When Ashen-Skin Zubera dies, target opponent discards a card for each Zubera that died this turn.
flavor: When the Honden of Night's Reach began to crumble, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to haunt mortal dreams.

name: Cursed Ronin
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{B}: Cursed Ronin gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "You are fortunate, my enemy. You have paid the price but once. I never stop paying."

name: Dance of Shadows
text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: "Only one man survived, barely sane. He got out two words before collapsing: shadows' shadows."

name: Deathcurse Ogre
text: When Deathcurse Ogre dies, each player loses 3 life.
flavor: After their worship of oni began, only a few of Kamigawa's ogres remained in the bitter cold of the Tendo Peaks. Most were drawn to the darkness of Takenuma.

name: Gutwrencher Oni
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, discard a card if you don't control an Ogre.
flavor:
"Blood drips. Blood sings. Blood devours all and only blood remains."
—Ogre chant

name: Honden of Night's Reach
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent discards a card for each Shrine you control.
flavor: To the sorrow of all, its dark reach grasped and crushed those who guarded its silent vigil.

name: Horobi, Death's Wail
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature.
flavor:
"From the ashes of Reito rose a new kami. And thereafter at every battle came Horobi, Death's Wail."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Iname, Death Aspect
text: When Iname, Death Aspect enters the battlefield, you may search your library for any number of Spirit cards, put them into your graveyard, then shuffle.
flavor: Iname revels in sadistic glee at the crushing of souls, but soon mourns the lives so cruelly cut short. So the cycle begins anew.

name: Kami of the Waning Moon
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor:
"For a moment, Reito's defenders regrouped. Then wailing kami reappeared to send them scattering like flocks of frightened birds."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Kiku, Night's Flower
text: {2}{B}{B}, {T}: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
flavor:
"A wanderer has told me of an assassin in the Takenuma Swamp who uses her dark arts to animate her enemies' shadows against them. A wild tale, but it explains much."
—Diary of Azusa

name: Marrow-Gnawer
text:
All Rats have fear.
{T}, Sacrifice a Rat: Create X 1/1 black Rat creature tokens, where X is the number of Rats you control.
flavor: Marrow-Gnawer united three nezumi gangs when he slew their leaders in a single night. Now they call him their first lord.

name: Midnight Covenant
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."
flavor:
"Not all mortals fought the kami. The ogres revered the oni, while some humans made pacts based upon empty promises."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Nezumi Bone-Reader
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards a card. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: Four generations ago, old Split-Tail stole a bundle of scrolls from the Minamo School. Soon after, the first nezumi shamans were born.

name: Nezumi Ronin
text: Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"Some nezumi became as skilled in the samurai arts as the humans and kitsune. Yet no lord would have them, so they sold their swords to the highest bidder."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Night of Souls' Betrayal
text: All creatures get -1/-1.
flavor:
"How can we wage war against ourselves? What happens when the kami of our very souls rise against us? I answer simply: We cannot. We die. There can be no victory in this war."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda

name: Numai Outcast
text:
Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
{B}, Pay 5 life: Regenerate Numai Outcast.
flavor:
"Beware the blade of dishonor. It kills more silently than war, more quickly than age."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Painwracker Oni
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature if you don't control an Ogre.
flavor:
"Blood flows. Blood calls. Blood devours all and only blood remains."
—Ogre chant

name: Pull Under
text: Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Although nowhere on Kamigawa was safe during the war, the Takenuma Swamp was the most horrifying. The rotting bamboo itself rebelled against its mortal inhabitants, pulling them into unmarked graves."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Rag Dealer
text: {2}{B}, {T}: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
flavor:
"After General Takeno found the Oathkeeper amidst the bamboo marshes, more scavengers braved the swamp's nezumi, oni, and kami in hopes of glory."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Rend Flesh
text: Destroy target non-Spirit creature.
flavor:
"The Reito Massacre was a testament to the kami's unstoppable power. The human defenders might as well have been moths battling a forest fire."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Rend Spirit
text: Destroy target Spirit.
flavor:
"The battle at Ganzan Pass was a testament to human endurance. The untrained and frightened group escaped three legions of kami, leaving more than their share of slain foes in their wake."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Seizan, Perverter of Truth
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses 2 life and draws two cards.
flavor:
"If you would taste the wisdom of the oni, be prepared to salt it with your blood."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Swallowing Plague
text: Swallowing Plague deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life.
flavor:
"We are recalling all forces from the Takenuma Swamp. We lose men daily to kami attacks, and it seems our defeats only encourage them further."
—General Takeno, letter to Lord Konda

name: Villainous Ogre
text:
Villainous Ogre can't block.
As long as you control a Demon, Villainous Ogre has "{B}: Regenerate Villainous Ogre."
flavor:
"The war saw the ogres emerge from their caves, reeking of blood, with the power of oni in their veins."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Waking Nightmare
text: Target player discards two cards.
flavor:
"Once each year, the oni and other evil spirits paraded through villages to disturb mortals' sleep. During the war, this parade became a nightly event."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Wicked Akuba
text: {B}: Target player dealt damage by Wicked Akuba this turn loses 1 life.
flavor: The sound of children weeping is a song that fills its heart with joy.

name: Akki Avalanchers
text: Sacrifice a land: Akki Avalanchers gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: Among Godo's hordes, "beware of falling rocks" came to mean "akki live nearby."

name: Akki Coalflinger
text:
First strike
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor: No matter where you find them, goblins love rocks.

name: Akki Rockspeaker
text: When Akki Rockspeaker enters the battlefield, add {R}.
flavor: The lava-proof shells of akki evolved over centuries, as akki pranks almost always got seriously out of hand.

name: Akki Underminer
text: Whenever Akki Underminer deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a permanent.
flavor:
"Deep inside the Sokenzan Mountains, a band of akki discovered a cache of ancient items of power. Their ensuing spree of destruction became known as 'The Three Days of Fun.'"
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Battle-Mad Ronin
text:
Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
Battle-Mad Ronin attacks each combat if able.
flavor: "I fought fiercely, bravely, and without mercy. Had I not struck down my captain in the heat of battle, I might have become a hero instead of an outcast."

name: Ben-Ben, Akki Hermit
text: {T}: Ben-Ben, Akki Hermit deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of untapped Mountains you control.
flavor: Some akki thought of Ben-Ben as a kami of trickery in disguise. They hunted for him in the maze of warrens, often falling prey to his traps.

name: Blind with Anger
text: Untap target nonlegendary creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.
flavor:
"I can post only the most honorable and strong-willed samurai to defend your stronghold. I have seen what can happen to lesser men."
—General Takeno, letter to Lord Konda

name: Crushing Pain
text: Crushing Pain deals 6 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
flavor: It is said that the mere touch of a kami is like embracing the sun itself.

name: Earthshaker
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Earthshaker deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor: It scaled the Sokenzan Mountains in search of Kumano's secret. The mountain shook for two days, and the kami never returned.

name: Ember-Fist Zubera
text: When Ember-Fist Zubera dies, it deals damage to any target equal to the number of Zubera that died this turn.
flavor: When the Honden of Infinite Rage shattered, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to sow mortal destruction.

name: Hanabi Blast
text: Hanabi Blast deals 2 damage to any target. Return Hanabi Blast to its owner's hand, then discard a card at random.
flavor: The most powerful of akki fire spells were developed at the cost of blood, toil, tears, sweat, and usually a nose or two.

name: Hearth Kami
text: {X}, Sacrifice Hearth Kami: Destroy target artifact with mana value X.
flavor:
"Every treachery, great or small, begets a spirit that rages at the injustice. Given the opportunity, each will return that treachery to its owner tenfold."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Honden of Infinite Rage
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Honden of Infinite Rage deals damage to any target equal to the number of Shrines you control.
flavor: To the sorrow of all, its rage became focused on those who once stoked it.

name: Kami of Fire's Roar
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature can't block this turn.
flavor:
"I can hear the shamans chanting in the hills. They say their magic will protect us from the kami, that our gold has bought our safety. But no one sleeps soundly tonight."
—Scroll fragment from the ruins of Reito

name: Kumano's Pupils
text: If a creature dealt damage by Kumano's Pupils this turn would die, exile it instead.
flavor:
"Long before he reluctantly joined the war, stories spread of Kumano's followers winning victories against the kami."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Lava Spike
text: Lava Spike deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: Some kami attacks during the war were rife with trickery, subterfuge, and subtlety, draining hope and pride from the mortal world. Other attacks were a lot more straightforward.

name: Mana Seism
text: Sacrifice any number of lands, then add that much {C}.
flavor:
"It is the nature of humanity not to worry about tomorrow, especially when there's a good chance they won't live to see the end of today."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Ore Gorger
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may destroy target nonbasic land.
flavor:
"We've stumbled upon a network of caves not on our maps. We can only hope it is safe to spend the night."
—Lost Battalion, message to General Takeno

name: Pain Kami
text: {X}{R}, Sacrifice Pain Kami: It deals X damage to target creature.
flavor:
"All kami are our enemies now, A very tough lesson to learn. But it's one that's taken quickly, When you feel what it's like to burn!"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet

name: Ronin Houndmaster
text:
Haste
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: Some samurai fell so far out of grace that only dogs would keep them company.

name: Shimatsu the Bloodcloaked
text: As Shimatsu the Bloodcloaked enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of permanents. Shimatsu enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor: Their dominion over dark and destructive forces twisted the oni into beings of pure malevolence.

name: Sideswipe
text: You may change any targets of target Arcane spell.
flavor: Hisoka's wizards struggled for years to master the art of redirection that came so naturally to the shamans of Ganzan Pass.

name: Sokenzan Bruiser
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor:
"We camped near the Sokenzan Mountains. Though I know its inhabitants are sparse, I hear cries coming from the highest peaks every night, as if the mountains themselves bellow for vengeance."
—Lost Battalion, message to General Takeno

name: Soul of Magma
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Soul of Magma deals 1 damage to target creature.
flavor:
"In every other mind, the battle was lost. General Takeno alone was not touched by despair. Drawing his blade, he was attack and rallying cry in one."
—*Battle of Akagi River: A Survivor's Tale*

name: Stone Rain
text: Destroy target land.
flavor:
"The kami struck with gouts of fire, showers of rock, and the combined rage of the spirit world. Only Eiganjo Castle remained standing, glistening untouched in the sun."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Unearthly Blizzard
text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
flavor:
"We are trapped. The mountains and blinding kami storms have made us hopelessly lost. We are starving. In the name of all things sacred, please, send help . . . ."
—Lost Battalion, final message to General Takeno

name: Unnatural Speed
text: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
flavor:
"How can we hope to match the speed of lightning? The fury of storms? The power of mountains? The answer is simple. We cannot. I advise against this war."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda

name: Zo-Zu the Punisher
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Zo-Zu the Punisher deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
flavor:
"He can cause a lot of pain and do it with no fuss. That's all good, but I just wish he didn't do it to us!"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet

name: Dosan the Falling Leaf
text: Players can cast spells only during their own turns.
flavor:
"Each night as Master Dosan prays to the kami, the hate he receives in return withers his body a little more. Though the kami are slowly killing him, still he continues his prayers."
—Meditation journal of a young budoka

name: Dripping-Tongue Zubera
text: When Dripping-Tongue Zubera dies, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token for each Zubera that died this turn.
flavor: When the Honden of Life's Web was destroyed, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to ensure mortal defeat.

name: Feast of Worms
text: Destroy target land. If that land was legendary, its controller sacrifices another land.
flavor:
"The dust beneath our feet was once part of a mighty civilization. Shall we too provide the path for a future generation?"
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Gale Force
text: Gale Force deals 5 damage to each creature with flying.
flavor: Everything the kami had done, they did with more force. Gentle breezes became typhoons, rolling rivers turned to crushing rapids, and gentle growth became overnight masses of thorns and vines.

name: Glimpse of Nature
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell this turn, draw a card.
flavor: Dosan sat in repose for many hours. He made no motion, no sound at all. And as he sat, nature revealed itself to him.

name: Hana Kami
text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Hana Kami: Return target Arcane card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: It grew in lands lit by pride and watered by tears.

name: Honden of Life's Web
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token for each Shrine you control.
flavor: To the sorrow of all, its web became a net that strangled those who helped weave it.

name: Humble Budoka
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: Each time wanderers entered the forest seeking enlightenment, Dosan was there, waiting for them to arrive.

name: Iname, Life Aspect
text: When Iname, Life Aspect dies, you may exile it. If you do, return any number of target Spirit cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Iname rejoices in the dawn of a new life, but soon becomes jealous of the simple joys denied him by his station. So the cycle begins anew.

name: Joyous Respite
text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.
flavor:
"I have been gifted by the kami with long life. So far, they have not seen fit to withdraw their gift. There may yet be a way to stop the killing without more blood, human or kami, being spilled."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Jukai Messenger
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: Dosan's monks, deep in spiritual thought, could walk through the thickest of forests without leaving a mark, even the leaves beneath their feet unaffected by their passing.

name: Kami of the Hunt
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of the Hunt gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Don't worry, Jiro. The kami would never attack us this close to home . . . . Jiro?"
—Hoto, temple guardian, last words

name: Kashi-Tribe Warriors
text: Whenever Kashi-Tribe Warriors deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: The orochi and the monks had always had an unspoken agreement: live and let live. But when the kami began raging, some warrior youths began questioning that agreement.

name: Kodama of the North Tree
text:
Trample
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"The monks of the North Tree rarely saw their kodama until the Kami War, when it woke like a slumbering, angry bear."
—"Poem of the Five Trees"

name: Kodama of the South Tree
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, each other creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"The monks of the South Tree had always reveled beneath their kodama's friendly gaze. During the Kami War, this gaze became fierce and full of hate."
—"Poem of the Five Trees"

name: Moss Kami
text: Trample
flavor: Kami manifest in the form of whatever they embody in the physical plane. Some tower in the shape of moss or bark, while others take forms beyond mortal imagining.

name: Nature's Will
text: Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, tap all lands that player controls and untap all lands you control.
flavor:
"Without the kami to speak to nature on our behalf, we must beg help from nature directly."
—Seshiro the Anointed

name: Orochi Leafcaller
text: {G}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor: "Only orochi hatched from eggs 'touched by the kami' may become shamans. These days, there are fewer and fewer new shamans being born."

name: Orochi Ranger
text: Whenever Orochi Ranger deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor:
"The young come to me, confused. They have been taught to respect the kami, and now they must fight them? I do not know what to say."
—Sachi, to her father

name: Orochi Sustainer
text: {T}: Add {G}.
flavor: "Nothing is the same anymore. The forests are not as lush, the waters not as pure, the air not as clear. Without the kami to direct and sustain the forces of nature, it's only a matter of time before we feel their neglect."

name: Sachi, Daughter of Seshiro
text:
Other Snake creatures you control get +0/+1.
Shamans you control have "{T}: Add {G}{G}."
flavor: "The warriors deal in poison and fangs. We shamans remember why our ancestors crawled with their bellies to the earth."

name: Seshiro the Anointed
text:
Other Snake creatures you control get +2/+2.
Whenever a Snake you control deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
flavor: His family was the first to reach out to the human monks. He soon knew as many koans as he did blade strikes.

name: Soilshaper
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target land becomes a 3/3 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
flavor: It spoke with the voice of nature, but its words were curses spat upon humankind.

name: Strength of Cedars
text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of lands you control.
flavor:
"No sooner had the beast collapsed under the blows of Takeno's sword than the earth rippled and the creature rose again to face him."
—*Battle of Akagi River: A Survivor's Tale*

name: Time of Need
text: Search your library for a legendary creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor:
"When the kumo attacked the monks' sacred shrine, a mournful toll for help echoed through the forest. Thus began the Battle of Silk, which would last six years."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Eiganjo Castle
text:
{T}: Add {W}.
{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target legendary creature this turn.
flavor: Since the war began, the castle's walls mark the only place on Kamigawa where no kami has ever set foot.

name: Minamo, School at Water's Edge
text:
{T}: Add {U}.
{U}, {T}: Untap target legendary permanent.
flavor: Its students graduate the school and enter history.

name: Okina, Temple to the Grandfathers
text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{G}, {T}: Target legendary creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: If a land can be said to have a heart, Okina is the heart of Kamigawa.

name: Shinka, the Bloodsoaked Keep
text:
{T}: Add {R}.
{R}, {T}: Target legendary creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: The glow from within looks inviting, but woe awaits whomever finds out who stokes the fire or what simmers in the pot.

name: Shizo, Death's Storehouse
text:
{T}: Add {B}.
{B}, {T}: Target legendary creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: Centuries ago, Shizo was a verdant field of wildflowers. After 891 samurai died in a single battle on its grasses, it became a haunted moor.

name: Blood of the Martyr
text: Until end of turn, if damage would be dealt to any creature, you may have that damage dealt to you instead.
flavor: The willow knows what the storm does not: that the power to endure harm outlives the power to inflict it.

name: Indestructible Aura
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
flavor: Theodar strode the battle lines, snatching swords with his bare hands and casting them aside until all cowered before him.

name: Keepers of the Faith
flavor: And then the Archangel Anthius spoke to them, saying, "Fear shall be vanquished by the Sword of Faith."

name: Flash Flood
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target red permanent.
• Return target Mountain to its owner's hand.
flavor: Many people say that no power can bring the mountains low. Many people are fools.

name: Wall of Vapor
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Wall of Vapor by creatures it's blocking.
flavor:
"Walls of a castle are made out of stone,/ Walls of a house out of bricks or of wood./ My walls are made out of magic alone,/ Stronger than any that ever have stood."
—Chrysoberyl Earthsdaughter, *Incantations*

name: Banshee
text: {X}, {T}: Banshee deals half X damage, rounded down, to any target, and half X damage, rounded up, to you.
flavor: Some say Banshees are the hounds of Death, baying to herd their prey into the arms of their master.

name: Shimian Night Stalker
text: {B}, {T}: All damage that would be dealt to you this turn by target attacking creature is dealt to Shimian Night Stalker instead.
flavor:
"When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out/ Contagion to this world."
—William Shakespeare, *Hamlet*

name: The Fallen
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, The Fallen deals 1 damage to each opponent and planeswalker it has dealt damage to this game.
flavor: Magic often masters those who cannot master it.

name: Transmutation
text: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
flavor:
"You know what I was,/ You see what I am: change me, change me!"
—Randall Jarrell, *The Woman at the Washington Zoo*

name: Beasts of Bogardan
text:
Protection from red
Beasts of Bogardan gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls a nontoken white permanent.
flavor: Bogardan is a land as volatile as the creatures who live there.

name: Goblin Shrine
text:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +1/+0.
When Goblin Shrine leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each Goblin creature.
flavor:
"I knew it weren't no ordinary pile of—you know."
—Norin the Wary

name: Mountain Yeti
text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
Protection from white
flavor: The Yeti's single greatest asset is its unnerving ability to blend in with its surroundings.

name: Wall of Opposition
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Wall of Opposition gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Like so many obstacles in life, the Wall of Opposition is but an illusion, held fast by the focus and belief of the one who creates it.

name: Emerald Dragonfly
text:
Flying
{G}{G}: Emerald Dragonfly gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: "Flittering, wheeling, / darting in to strike, and then / gone just as you blink." —"Dragonfly Haiku," poet unknown

name: Revelation
text: Players play with their hands revealed.
flavor: "Many are in high place, and of renown: but mysteries are revealed unto the meek." —Ecclesiasticus 3:19

name: Archivist of Oghma
text:
Flash
Whenever an opponent searches their library, you gain 1 life and draw a card.
flavor: "Knowledge is the greatest tool of the mortal mind, outweighing anything made by mortal hands. Before anything else can exist, the idea must exist."

name: Ascend from Avernus
text: Return all creature and planeswalker cards with mana value X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. Exile Ascend from Avernus.
flavor: Smoke clogged the streets and rubble littered the ground, but sunlight shining on the long-lost towers of Elturel was still a beautiful sight.

name: Astral Confrontation
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each opponent you're attacking.
Exile target creature.
flavor: "After voyaging all the way through the Astral Sea with my life hanging by a silver thread, fighting the mind flayer was the easy part."

name: Bane's Invoker
text: Wind Walk — {8}: Up to two target creatures each get +2/+2 and gain flying until end of turn.
flavor: "The Lord of Darkness elevates only those who serve."

name: Beckoning Will-o'-Wisp
text:
Flying
Lure the Unwary — At the beginning of combat on your turn, choose an opponent.
Creatures attacking the last chosen player get +1/+0.
flavor: Follow the light at your own risk.

name: Crystal Dragon // Rob the Hoard
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor:
"Wait, it was just guarding a bunch of eggs! Where is the treasure?"
—Xalcorin the bard

name: Cut a Deal
text: Each opponent draws a card, then you draw a card for each opponent who drew a card this way.
flavor:
"It's a win-win arrangement. I just happen to win the most."
—Duke Thalamra Vanthampur

name: Far Traveler
text: Commander creatures you own have "At the beginning of your end step, exile up to one target tapped creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control."
flavor: You have traveled to many places, over mountains and across seas, but a new journey always calls.

name: Flaming Fist
text: Commander creatures you own have "Whenever this creature attacks, it gains double strike until end of turn."
flavor: You carry the security of Baldur's Gate on your shoulders, and you welcome the weight of responsibility.

name: Flaming Fist Officer
text: Whenever another creature you control leaves the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Flaming Fist Officer.
flavor: "Got the remaining citizens to safety! These miscreants have an appointment with my spear."

name: Githzerai Monk
text:
Flash
Flying
Psychic Defense — When Githzerai Monk enters the battlefield, tap all creatures you don't control.
flavor: The githzerai dwell in the heart of Limbo, shaping the chaos of that plane with their powerful psionic abilities.

name: Goliath Paladin
text:
Vigilance
When Goliath Paladin enters the battlefield, you take the initiative.
flavor: "Why do you cower in the darkness, little gnolls? If you would challenge me, step into the light."

name: Greatsword of Tyr
text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it and tap up to one target creature defending player controls.
Equip {W} ({W}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
flavor: In the light of its gleaming blade, the faithful shine and the wicked cower.

name: Icewind Stalwart
text: Protection Fighting Style — When Icewind Stalwart enters the battlefield, exile up to one target non-Warrior creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
flavor: "Get behind my shield!"

name: Inspiring Leader
text: Commander creatures you own have "Creature tokens you control get +2/+2."
flavor: Your family needed a farmer, so you tilled. Your town needed a fighter, so you trained. When your people needed a leader, you knew what you had to do.

name: Rescuer Chwinga
text:
Flash
Natural Shelter — When Rescuer Chwinga enters the battlefield, you may return another permanent you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Fortunately for lost travelers, chwingas' curiosity often gets the better of their shyness.

name: Roving Harper
text: When Roving Harper enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: The Harpers value peaceful coexistence, historical preservation, and harmony with nature, and each day they spread their ideals a little farther.

name: Sculpted Sunburst
text: Choose a creature you control, then each opponent chooses a creature they control with equal or lesser power. If you chose a creature this way, exile each creature not chosen by any player this way.
flavor: A searing light that spares only the chosen.

name: Slaughter the Strong
text: Each player chooses any number of creatures they control with total power 4 or less, then sacrifices all other creatures they control.
flavor: It was a big day for the gravediggers at Cliffside Cemetery.

name: Steadfast Unicorn
text: {3}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn. Activate only during your turn.
flavor: Only the good-hearted may set foot in a unicorn's domain.

name: Stoneskin
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+10.
flavor: "Ooh, nice shot! I almost felt that one."

name: Veteran Soldier
text: Commander creatures you own have "Whenever this creature attacks a player, if no opponent has more life than that player, for each opponent, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token that's tapped and attacking that opponent."
flavor: You've always been happiest fighting for a cause you believe in alongside loyal comrades.

name: Your Temple Is Under Attack
text:
Choose one —
• Pray for Protection — Creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
• Strike a Deal — You and target opponent each draw two cards.
flavor: "You trespass on sacred ground, monster. Leave while you still can."

name: You're Confronted by Robbers
text:
Choose one —
• Stall for Time — Tap up to three target creatures.
• Call for Aid — Create three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
flavor: Their only mistake was giving the bard time to speak.

name: Aarakocra Sneak
text:
Flying
When Aarakocra Sneak enters the battlefield, you take the initiative.
flavor: "Shhh! I think I hear goblins. And I definitely smell them."

name: Bane's Contingency
text: Counter target spell. If that spell targets a commander you control, instead counter that spell, scry 2, then draw a card.
flavor: "My whims dictate the fate of nations. Your pitiful mortal magic is no more significant than a gnat buzzing in my ear."

name: Blur
text:
Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
Draw a card.
flavor: "It's as much of a trick of the mind as it is a trick of the eye."

name: Candlekeep Inspiration
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X, where X is the number of cards you own in exile and in your graveyard that are instant cards, are sorcery cards, and/or have an Adventure.
flavor: Tales of heroes past galvanize the heroes of the future.

name: Candlekeep Sage
text: Commander creatures you own have "When this creature enters or leaves the battlefield, draw a card."
flavor: You love the smell of dusty tomes, the flicker of candles during late-night reading, and the old texts that bring to life the scholars who have come before.

name: Displacer Kitten
text: Avoidance — Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, exile up to one target nonland permanent you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
flavor:
"Isn't she the cutest thing you've almost seen?"
—Doen, purveyor of exotic pets

name: Draconic Lore
text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if you control a Dragon.
Draw three cards.
flavor: The wyrmling studied the ancient carvings and dreamed of a day when her own exploits would be immortalized in stone.

name: Dragonborn Looter
text: {1}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: Erdur never thought of it as stealing. Treasure simply didn't deserve to be stuck underground where no one could admire it.

name: Dream Fracture
text:
Counter target spell. Its controller draws a card.
Draw a card.
flavor: In her dream, Lola gazed into a mirror. Her familiar features warped, her jaw stretching wider and wider until it cracked and her reflection pulled her into its gaping maw.

name: Dungeon Delver
text: Commander creatures you own have "Room abilities of dungeons you own trigger an additional time."
flavor: You're driven not by a lust for gold or baubles, but by the thrill of danger and the excitement of the unknown.

name: Elminster's Simulacrum
text: For each opponent, you create a token that's a copy of up to one target creature that player controls.
flavor:
"Why simply sit back and applaud the good ideas of others when I can improve upon them?"
—Elminster

name: Feywild Caretaker
text:
When Feywild Caretaker enters the battlefield, you take the initiative.
At the beginning of your end step, if you have the initiative, create a 1/1 blue Faerie Dragon creature token with flying.
flavor: "Hello, my fluttering friends! Isn't it a beautiful day?"

name: Feywild Visitor
text: Commander creatures you own have "Whenever one or more nontoken creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, you create a 1/1 blue Faerie Dragon creature token with flying."
flavor: Fey energy clings to you, a shimmering reminder of your otherworldly travels.

name: Font of Magic
text: Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each time you've cast a commander from the command zone this game.
flavor: Warnis had always felt a glimmer of potential within herself, flickering just out of reach. That night, as the cultists attacked, it became a torrent of power that was hers to command.

name: Gray Harbor Merfolk
text:
Gray Harbor Merfolk can't be blocked.
Gray Harbor Merfolk gets +2/+0 as long as you control a commander that's a creature or planeswalker.
flavor: Harbormasters tend to forget that security shouldn't stop at the surface.

name: Illithid Harvester // Plant Tadpoles
text: Ceremorphosis — When Illithid Harvester enters the battlefield, turn any number of target tapped nontoken creatures face down. They're 2/2 Horror creatures.
flavor: "Your mind belongs to the Emperor now."

name: Irenicus's Vile Duplication
text: Create a token that's a copy of target creature you control, except the token has flying and it isn't legendary.
flavor:
"You will serve me better in this form."
—Jon Irenicus

name: Kenku Artificer
text: Homunculus Servant — When Kenku Artificer enters the battlefield, put three +1/+1 counters on up to one target noncreature artifact. That artifact becomes a 0/0 Homunculus artifact creature with flying.
flavor: Though her words may be unoriginal, her creations are anything but.

name: Modify Memory
text: Exchange control of two target creatures controlled by different players. If you control neither creature, draw three cards.
flavor: Percival's clothes itched and his dinner was unpleasantly wriggly, but the kobold looked like he was having the time of his life.

name: Nimbleclaw Adept
text: Bigby's Hand — {T}: Untap two other target permanents. Activate only as a sorcery and only once each turn.
flavor: "Don't worry, I can reach it."

name: Pseudodragon Familiar
text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Pseudodragons are favored companions of wizards, prized for their cunning and curiosity.

name: Renari, Merchant of Marvels
text:
You may cast Dragon spells and artifact spells as though they had flash.
Choose a Background (You can have a Background as a second commander.)
flavor: "Sure, you can get one elsewhere . . . if you want a knockoff that'll break the first time you use it."

name: Robe of the Archmagi
flavor: It offers the power to shape worlds and the elegance to do so with style.

name: Run Away Together
text: Choose two target creatures controlled by different players. Return those creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor: True love means always knowing what's on the other's mind.

name: Shameless Charlatan
text: Commander creatures you own have "{2}{U}: This creature becomes a copy of another target creature."
