Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: Innistrad pyromancers find their best raw materials in the fury of the dead.

name: Breaking Point
text: Any player may have Breaking Point deal 6 damage to them. If no one does, destroy all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
flavor: "Enough!"

name: Freewind Equenaut
text:
Flying
As long as Freewind Equenaut is enchanted, it has "{T}: Freewind Equenaut deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature."
flavor: Confront her, and feel the hooves of her steed. Ignore her, and feel the sting of her arrow.

name: Armory Guard
text: Armory Guard has vigilance as long as you control a Gate.
flavor: The Dimir agents watched from the shadows. "Eight hours, and I've yet to see him blink," Nefara hissed. "I suggest we find another way in."

name: Gustcloak Sentinel
text: Whenever Gustcloak Sentinel becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.
flavor: Entire platoons have mysteriously vanished from battle, leaving enemy weapons to slice through empty air.

name: Dawnstrike Paladin
text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: She crushes darkness beneath her charger's hooves.

name: Daily Regimen
text:
Enchant creature
{1}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor: What self-indulgence tears down, discipline builds up again.

name: Pay No Heed
text: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.
flavor: "My course is before me. There is nothing behind me."

name: Bonds of Faith
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.
flavor:
"What cannot be destroyed will be bound."
—Oath of Avacyn

name: Miraculous Recovery
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: "I am the rock of the polis. Death only strengthens me."

name: Crowned Ceratok
text:
Trample
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.
flavor: The best way to calm a rampaging ceratok is to wait until it dies of natural causes.

name: Gorehorn Minotaurs
text: Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
flavor: Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.

name: Ghor-Clan Savage
text: Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
flavor: The snap of sinew. The crunch of bone. A cry for mercy. These are the music of the Gruul.

name: Conquering Manticore
text:
Flying
When Conquering Manticore enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: It speaks no commands but is always obeyed.

name: Regrowth
text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: While the root remains, the tree yet lives.

name: Jace's Phantasm
text:
Flying
Jace's Phantasm gets +4/+4 as long as an opponent has ten or more cards in their graveyard.
flavor: In the abstract memories of the Iquati, Jace found interesting ideas to improve upon.

name: Crosstown Courier
text: Whenever Crosstown Courier deals combat damage to a player, that player mills that many cards.
flavor: Information travels quickly through Ravnica's network of messengers and thought agents.

name: Dream Stalker
text: When Dream Stalker enters the battlefield, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: What happens when it is the dream that wakes and the sleeper that fades into memory?

name: Stealer of Secrets
text: Whenever Stealer of Secrets deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
flavor: The Dimir would hire her, if only they knew where she lived. The Azorius would condemn her, if only they knew her name.

name: Aether Adept
text: When Aether Adept enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: "The universe is my instrument, and the song I play upon it is one you are forbidden to hear."

name: Phantasmal Dragon
text:
Flying
When Phantasmal Dragon becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor: Its hunger and ire are no less for being wrought of lies and mist.

name: Leyline Phantom
text: When Leyline Phantom deals combat damage, return it to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it survived combat.)
flavor:
"Is the maze itself a phantom? Or is one as real as the other? Perhaps I am as mad as the dragon."
—Jace Beleren, journal

name: Agoraphobia
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -5/-0.
{2}{U}: Return Agoraphobia to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Everyone in this city is choosing sides. I choose inside."

name: Remand
text:
Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it into its owner's hand instead of into that player's graveyard.
Draw a card.
flavor: For the Azorius, the law can be a physical shield against chaos and anarchy.

name: Griptide
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"Beware the seagrafs just off the shore. These waters are filled with hungry geists looking for an easy meal."
—Captain Eberhart

name: Summoner's Bane
text: Counter target creature spell. Create a 2/2 blue Illusion creature token.
flavor:
"I don't need to have the perfect plan. My foe just has to have an imperfect one."
—Jace Beleren

name: Jace's Ingenuity
text: Draw three cards.
flavor: "Brute force can sometimes kick down a locked door, but knowledge is a skeleton key."

name: Future Sight
text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play lands and cast spells from the top of your library.
flavor:
"Is the inevitable any less miraculous?"
—Veldka, wandering sage

name: Pulse Tracker
text: Whenever Pulse Tracker attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.
flavor:
"You can't think your way out of this, Jace. Thought implies life, and life requires a pulse—music to a hunter's ears."
—Vraska

name: Gatecreeper Vine
text:
Defender
When Gatecreeper Vine enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card or a Gate card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Every inch of Ravnica is home to something.

name: Vinelasher Kudzu
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Vinelasher Kudzu.
flavor: It grows to hate you.

name: Sadistic Augermage
text: When Sadistic Augermage dies, each player puts a card from their hand on top of their library.
flavor: "Don't worry. I know the drill."

name: Slate Street Ruffian
text: Whenever Slate Street Ruffian becomes blocked, defending player discards a card.
flavor:
"Merciless to the point of psychosis. Let's give him a job."
—Zelinas, Orzhov recruiter

name: Festerhide Boar
text:
Trample
Morbid — Festerhide Boar enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
flavor:
"Bury your dead deep. The boars are hungriest while the corpse is still warm."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

name: Last Kiss
text: Last Kiss deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
flavor:
"Romanticize it, glamorize it, call it what you will. To me, it will always be carnal, bloody murder."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric

name: Grisly Spectacle
text: Destroy target nonartifact creature. Its controller mills cards equal to that creature's power.
flavor:
"Watch people flock to a murder scene. Then tell me we're not all a little sick in the head."
—Juri, proprietor of the Juri Revue

name: Leonin Snarecaster
text: When Leonin Snarecaster enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.
flavor: Formerly oppressed by the polis of Meletis, leonin occasionally "mistake" their old enemies for game.

name: Hellraiser Goblin
text: Creatures you control have haste and attack each combat if able.
flavor: Don't let him lead the soldiers, but by all means let him lead the way.

name: Mardu Heart-Piercer
text: Raid — When Mardu Heart-Piercer enters the battlefield, if you attacked this turn, Mardu Heart-Piercer deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: "Those who have never ridden before the wind do not know the true joy of war."

name: Krenko, Mob Boss
text: {T}: Create X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens, where X is the number of Goblins you control.
flavor:
"He displays a perverse charisma fueled by avarice. Highly dangerous. Recommend civil sanctions."
—Agmand Sarv, Azorius hussar

name: Ogre Battledriver
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
flavor: Ogres are driven by passion, rage, and another ogre standing behind them with a whip.

name: Reckless Abandon
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Reckless Abandon deals 4 damage to any target.
flavor: The climax of a warlord's career is always death.

name: Arc Trail
text: Arc Trail deals 2 damage to any target and 1 damage to another target.
flavor:
"Don't try to hit your enemies. Concentrate on the space between them, and fill the air with doom."
—Spear-Tribe teaching

name: Krenko's Command
text: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
flavor: Goblins are eager to follow orders, especially when those orders involve stealing, hurting, annoying, eating, destroying, or swearing.

name: Dauntless Onslaught
text: Up to two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The people of Akros must learn from our leonin adversaries. If we match their staunch ferocity with our superior faith, we cannot fail."
—Cymede, queen of Akros

name: Faerie Impostor
text:
Flying
When Faerie Impostor enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return another creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Many Tin Street shops display a sign on the door: "No cloaks allowed."

name: Coral Trickster
text:
Morph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Coral Trickster is turned face up, you may tap or untap target permanent.
flavor: They wait in darkened depths, laughing eagerly.

name: Sparkmage Apprentice
text: When Sparkmage Apprentice enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Sparkmages are performance artists of sorts, but pain is the price of admission.

name: Lone Missionary
text: When Lone Missionary enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor: His mission has become a grim pilgrimage, a tour of the Eldrazi-stricken outposts across Zendikar. But he marches on alone, stubborn as the daily dawn.

name: Faerie Invaders
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
flavor: Small enough to penetrate the narrowest crack in a castle wall and numerous enough to hack apart a griffin.

name: Swift Justice
text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike and lifelink.
flavor:
"Having conviction is more important than being righteous."
—Aurelia

name: Celestial Flare
text: Target player sacrifices an attacking or blocking creature.
flavor:
"You were defeated the moment you declared your aggression."
—Gideon Jura

name: Gustcloak Harrier
text:
Flying
Whenever Gustcloak Harrier becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.
flavor: Banking steeply, the aven streaked toward the ground—and vanished.

name: Gustcloak Savior
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, you may untap that creature and remove it from combat.
flavor:
"Our death-arrows flew in high arcs towards the aven. And then . . . nothing."
—Coliseum guard

name: Gustcloak Skirmisher
text:
Flying
Whenever Gustcloak Skirmisher becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.
flavor: They're trained in the art of pressing their luck.

name: Kinsbaile Skirmisher
text: When Kinsbaile Skirmisher enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "If a boggart even dares breathe near one of my kin, I'll know. And I'll not be happy."

name: Loxodon Partisan
text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"On every plane I've encountered loxodons, I've found stalwart and loyal friends."
—Elspeth

name: Precinct Captain
text:
First strike
Whenever Precinct Captain deals combat damage to a player, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
flavor: "In troubled times, we all need someone to watch our back."

name: Soul Parry
text: Prevent all damage one or two target creatures would deal this turn.
flavor:
"I was called to this world of steel, and it will be my steel that answers."
—Elspeth

name: Veteran Armorsmith
text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +0/+1.
flavor: "Courage is a proud and gleaming shield. It does not bend or hide from sight. To fight with courage, we must forge in steel."

name: Veteran Swordsmith
text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+0.
flavor: "Truth is a straight, keen edge. There are no soft angles or rounded edges. To fight for truth, we must forge in steel."

name: Surrakar Banisher
text: When Surrakar Banisher enters the battlefield, you may return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: Surrakar grab things they *don't* want.

name: Makindi Griffin
text: Flying
flavor: As the hedrons began to coalesce into colossal Eldrazi superstructures, the griffins were forced to seek new territory lest their aeries be crushed between the massive stone monoliths.

name: Oust
text: Put target creature into its owner's library second from the top. Its controller gains 3 life.
flavor:
"'Invincible' is just a word."
—Gideon Jura

name: Repel the Darkness
text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Draw a card.
flavor: A boon to those who cannot see in the dark. A bane to those who live in it.

name: Frontier Guide
text: {3}{G}, {T}: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: "The elders say Zendikar has no safe, peaceful places. How would they know? They've never looked."

name: Graypelt Hunter
text:
Trample
Whenever Graypelt Hunter or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Graypelt Hunter.
flavor: He'll cleave wood and bone alike to carve a path for his allies.

name: Groundswell
text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Landfall — If you had a land enter the battlefield under your control this turn, that creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead.
flavor: "This world will not be tamed."

name: Joraga Bard
text: Whenever Joraga Bard or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Ally creatures you control gain vigilance until end of turn.
flavor: Adventuring bards recite *Chanter's Epics*, never-ending tales that keep their comrades' minds alert to danger.

name: Ondu Giant
text: When Ondu Giant enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: Some druids nurture gardens. Others nurture continents.

name: Bloodrite Invoker
text: {8}: Target player loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.
flavor:
"The brood lineages unfolded across the world, each patterned after one of three progenitors, each a study in mindless consumption."
—*The Invokers' Tales*

name: Bloodthrone Vampire
text: Sacrifice a creature: Bloodthrone Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Some humans willingly offered up their blood, hoping it would grant the vampire families the strength to stave off the Eldrazi.

name: Cadaver Imp
text:
Flying
When Cadaver Imp enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: The mouth must be pried open before rigor mortis sets in. Otherwise the returning soul can find no ingress.

name: Consume the Meek
text: Destroy each creature with mana value 3 or less. They can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"Others ask why the Eldrazi destroy. I ask why they preserve."
—Ganda, Goma Fada deserter

name: Induce Despair
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, reveal a creature card from your hand.
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the revealed card's mana value.
flavor: All the angel saw was her doom.

name: Smother
text: Destroy target creature with mana value 3 or less. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"Before I hire new recruits, I test how long they can hold their breath. You'd be surprised how often it comes up."
—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

name: Emrakul's Hatcher
text: When Emrakul's Hatcher enters the battlefield, create three 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C}."
flavor: Wordlessly it leads its abhorrent brood.

name: Forked Bolt
text: Forked Bolt deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two targets.
flavor:
"Play no favorites. Everybody dies."
—Sparkmage saying

name: Hellion Eruption
text: Sacrifice all creatures you control, then create that many 4/4 red Hellion creature tokens.
flavor: Just when you thought you'd be safe, in the middle of an open field with no Eldrazi around for miles.

name: Magmaw
text: {1}, Sacrifice a nonland permanent: Magmaw deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
"The purpose of existence is simple: everything is fuel for the magmaw."
—Jaji, magmaw worshipper

name: Torch Slinger
text:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Torch Slinger enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
flavor: Once thrown, twice burned.

name: Champion of the Parish
text: Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of the Parish.
flavor: "I stand for every cobbler, tanner, and fool in this town—and they stand for me."

name: Chapel Geist
text: Flying
flavor: Death has bound it with chains of past regrets. Forever it searches for atonement, each kindness removing a single link.

name: Eerie Interlude
text: Exile any number of target creatures you control. Return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: The barrier between existence and oblivion is thinner than you know.

name: Elder Cathar
text: When Elder Cathar dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. If that creature is a Human, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.
flavor: "My greatest hope is that you will surpass me in every way, consigning my name to some forgotten corner of history."

name: Gather the Townsfolk
text:
Create two 1/1 white Human creature tokens.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, create five of those tokens instead.
flavor: In the memories of those they lost lies the strength needed to defend their city.

name: Slayer of the Wicked
text: When Slayer of the Wicked enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Vampire, Werewolf, or Zombie.
flavor: You don't want to see his trophy room.

name: Thraben Heretic
text: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard.
flavor: "Let them decry me for burning the dead. I'm not giving those ghoulcallers any more fuel for their madness."

name: Village Bell-Ringer
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Village Bell-Ringer enters the battlefield, untap all creatures you control.
flavor: "Priests, hunters, slayers—to arms! The enemy approaches!"

name: Pore Over the Pages
text: Draw three cards, untap up to two lands, then discard a card.
flavor: "'I'm certain that the fate of Markov Manor is connected to these cryptoliths . . .' This Tamiyo was on to something."

name: Tower Geist
text:
Flying
When Tower Geist enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
flavor: Jenrik's tower is served by those who once sought to enter it uninvited.

name: Compelling Deterrence
text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Then that player discards a card if you control a Zombie.
flavor: "So much for neighborly hospitality!"

name: Havengul Runebinder
text: {2}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token, then put a +1/+1 counter on each Zombie creature you control.
flavor: "So many corpses, so little time."

name: Screeching Skaab
text: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, mill two cards.
flavor: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.

name: Stitched Drake
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Flying
flavor:
"The best skaabs are more powerful and more beautiful than the sum of their parts."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Abattoir Ghoul
text:
First strike
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Abattoir Ghoul this turn dies, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
flavor: Death took his humanity but not his skill with the knife.

name: Diregraf Ghoul
text: Diregraf Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.
flavor:
"At least this one still has arms and legs. Well, most of its legs."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Ghoulraiser
text: When Ghoulraiser enters the battlefield, return a Zombie card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"Come. Bring your brothers. Tonight, you feast on living flesh."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Moan of the Unhallowed
text:
Create two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: For a ghoul, every village is a buffet and every disaster is a reunion.

name: Tribute to Hunger
text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
flavor: Marella was delighted. The ball had attracted so many suitors for her daughter, including that handsome stranger. She wondered where the two were now . . . .

name: Victim of Night
text: Destroy target non-Vampire, non-Werewolf, non-Zombie creature.
flavor:
"Do not touch a drop. Not yet. I want to watch this so-called slayer's last crisis of faith."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Citanul Woodreaders
text:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Citanul Woodreaders enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, draw two cards.
flavor: They seek out living trees to glean age-old secrets from sap and wood.

name: Gilt-Leaf Seer
text: {G}, {T}: Look at the top two cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor: Desmera blinded her seers so that her beauty would be the last image burned in their memories. The act only deepened their insight.

name: Jaddi Lifestrider
text: When Jaddi Lifestrider enters the battlefield, you may tap any number of untapped creatures you control. You gain 2 life for each creature tapped this way.
flavor: Nature's arms encircle all who are willing to draw close.

name: Nissa's Chosen
text: If Nissa's Chosen would die, put it on the bottom of its owner's library instead.
flavor: Once, Nissa selected worthy fighters to defend the Joraga. Now, she gathers forces to defend all of Zendikar.

name: Oakgnarl Warrior
text: Vigilance, trample
flavor: "Roam as you will, your roots remain in the strong earth of your Rising."

name: Seek the Horizon
text: Search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor:
"The horizon is the perpetual ideal, the constant promise of hope."
—Nissa Revane

name: Vines of the Recluse
text: Target creature gets +1/+2 and gains reach until end of turn. Untap it. (A creature with reach can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: "The most elegant solutions are found in nature. You just have to know where to look."

name: Woodborn Behemoth
text: As long as you control eight or more lands, Woodborn Behemoth gets +4/+4 and has trample. (It can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor: It carries the hopes of Zendikar's embattled wilds on its mighty boughs.

name: Bala Ged Scorpion
text: When Bala Ged Scorpion enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature with power 1 or less.
flavor: Fast and lethal, with a penchant for the weak and infirm.

name: Blistergrub
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
When Blistergrub dies, each opponent loses 2 life.
flavor:
"Avoid anything that scuttles, scrabbles, or shambles."
—Opar, veteran guide

name: Despoiler of Souls
text:
Despoiler of Souls can't block.
{B}{B}, Exile two other creature cards from your graveyard: Return Despoiler of Souls from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: Rats and vultures devour. It desecrates.

name: Giant Scorpion
text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor: Its sting hurts, but death is strangely painless.

name: Grim Discovery
text:
Choose one or both —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Few among the living understand just how much of their world is shaped by the ruins of the dead.

name: Indulgent Tormentor
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card unless target opponent sacrifices a creature or pays 3 life.
flavor: The promise of anguish is payment enough for services rendered.

name: Innocent Blood
text: Each player sacrifices a creature.
flavor: Zombies mourn for the living and celebrate those who will soon be given the gift of death.

name: Mire's Toll
text: Target player reveals a number of cards from their hand equal to the number of Swamps you control. You choose one of them. That player discards that card.
flavor: As the bridge snapped, Berko was sure he heard the swamp laughing at him.

name: Priest of the Blood Rite
text:
When Priest of the Blood Rite enters the battlefield, create a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.
flavor: Some will sacrifice everything for but a taste of power.

name: Squelching Leeches
text: Squelching Leeches's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
flavor: Setting foot in their muck is an open invitation.

name: Quicken
text:
The next sorcery spell you cast this turn can be cast as though it had flash. (It can be cast any time you could cast an instant.)
Draw a card.
flavor: A skilled Izzet Chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next.

name: Snap
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Untap up to two lands.
flavor: It doesn't matter if the mind or body cracks first. They both have to go.

name: Empty the Warrens
text:
Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
flavor: It's never just *one* goblin.

name: Grapeshot
text:
Grapeshot deals 1 damage to any target.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
flavor: Mages often seek to emulate the powerful relics lost to time and apocalypse.

name: Cloudcrown Oak
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor:
"Clever folk build their homes near cloudcrowns. If a hawk or even just a faerie tries to swoop in, it'll get swatted from here to Cloverdell."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

name: Talara's Battalion
text:
Cast this spell only if you've cast another green spell this turn.
Trample
flavor: The safewright Talara protects a delicate woodland waterfall. She has vowed to send wave after wave of warriors to slay any who would dare disturb its beauty.

name: Aquitect's Will
text: Put a flood counter on target land. That land is an Island in addition to its other types for as long as it has a flood counter on it. If you control a Merfolk, draw a card.
flavor:
"You may want to hold your breath."
—Kellyg, merrow aquitect

name: Engulf the Shore
text: Return to their owners' hands all creatures with toughness less than or equal to the number of Islands you control.
flavor:
"The tides have begun to ignore the moon."
—Tamiyo's journal

name: Master of the Pearl Trident
text: Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: "Let the land dwellers know the coast is no longer the border between our realms. A new age of empire has begun."

name: Merfolk Sovereign
text:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Target Merfolk creature can't be blocked this turn.
flavor: "Be like the sea: flow around that which is unmovable; for everything else, crash into it unrelentingly."

name: Merrow Reejerey
text:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a Merfolk spell, you may tap or untap target permanent.
flavor: Steady and silent as the deep current, the reejerey guides the course of the school.

name: Rootwater Hunter
text: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
"Bitter water, vicious wave;
Shadow-cold shallows, root-made maze.
Home's angry embrace."
—*Rootwater Saga*

name: Tidal Warrior
text: {T}: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.
flavor: The tide of battle favors those who can swim.

name: Tidal Wave
text: Create a 5/5 blue Wall creature token with defender. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor:
"The floor of the sea is paved with the shattered remnants of vessels that navigated its surface unwelcomed."
—Thassa, god of the sea

name: Wake Thrasher
text: Whenever a permanent you control becomes untapped, Wake Thrasher gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Anyone who thinks merrows have more brains than brawn has never been run over by one.

name: Warren Instigator
text:
Double strike
Whenever Warren Instigator deals damage to an opponent, you may put a Goblin creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: There is always a rabble to be roused.

name: Battle Squadron
text:
Flying
Battle Squadron's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
flavor: The goblins made an unruly pile with military precision.

name: Boggart Brute
text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: He has the biggest bashing stick, so it's a safe bet he's the leader.

name: Cleaver Riot
text: Creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn. (They deal both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
flavor: Measure once, cut twice.

name: Ember Hauler
text: {1}, Sacrifice Ember Hauler: It deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: Flurk's crude goblin language didn't differentiate between "I *bring* the flame" and "I *am* the flame."

name: Foundry Street Denizen
text: Whenever another red creature enters the battlefield under your control, Foundry Street Denizen gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: After the Foundry Street riot, Arrester Hulbein tried to ban bludgeons. Which, inevitably, resulted in another riot.

name: Goblin Chieftain
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 and have haste.
flavor: "It's time for the 'Smash, Smash' song!"

name: Goblin Diplomats
text: {T}: Each creature attacks this turn if able.
flavor: When you need to convey that special kind of message.

name: Goblin Wardriver
text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"A true warrior fights with whatever's handy."
—Qerk of the Secret Warren

name: Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf Daen
text:
Reach
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf Daen attacks, you gain 1 life for each attacking Elf you control.
flavor: "This is our land. We will not allow eyeblights to poison its beauty."

name: Dwynen's Elite
text: When Dwynen's Elite enters the battlefield, if you control another Elf, create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
flavor: Call one, call them all.

name: Elvish Branchbender
text: {T}: Until end of turn, target Forest becomes an X/X Treefolk creature in addition to its other types, where X is the number of Elves you control.
flavor: "How do the vinebred feel? Fah! We do not ask the puppet how it feels when the puppeteer bids it dance."

name: Elvish Vanguard
text: Whenever another Elf enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Vanguard.
flavor: "Our lives are woven together like the trees' branches over our heads, forming a canopy that protects us all."

name: Ezuri's Archers
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Ezuri's Archers blocks a creature with flying, Ezuri's Archers gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Eyes and arrows trained ever skyward.

name: Kujar Seedsculptor
text: When Kujar Seedsculptor enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
flavor: Every leaf, tree, and building in Kujar has been placed to achieve maximum harmony, in accordance with the elvish philosophy known as the Great Conduit.

name: Nature's Way
text: Target creature you control gains vigilance and trample until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.
flavor: Many elves incorporate the beauty of nature into their inventions. Very few capture its savagery.

name: Regal Force
text: When Regal Force enters the battlefield, draw a card for each green creature you control.
flavor: It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence.

name: Sylvan Advocate
text:
Vigilance
As long as you control six or more lands, Sylvan Advocate and land creatures you control get +2/+2.
flavor: "The land gives of itself. Its abundance provides, even in times of chaos."

name: Yeva, Nature's Herald
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
You may cast green creature spells as though they had flash.
flavor: "I can call an army to my side in the blink of an eye. Best not blink."

name: Artificer's Epiphany
text: Draw two cards. If you control no artifacts, discard a card.
flavor: The artificers of Kaladesh strive ceaselessly for perfection, progress, and the ultimate expression of elegance.

name: Barrage Ogre
text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Barrage Ogre deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: The elves had devised countless strategies to combat Memnarch's war machines, but they had no idea what to do when one was *thrown* at them.

name: Ghirapur Gearcrafter
text: When Ghirapur Gearcrafter enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying. (A creature with flying can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: The metal must be pure. The hand must be steady. The product must be perfect.

name: Shrapnel Blast
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to any target.
flavor: From trinket to trauma.

name: Neurok Replica
text: {1}{U}, Sacrifice Neurok Replica: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: All the curiosity of the Neurok with only a trace of their duplicity.

name: Haazda Snare Squad
text: Whenever Haazda Snare Squad attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, tap target creature an opponent controls.
flavor: They've been probation officers, army grunts, bounty hunters—anything to make their district safer.

name: Lyev Decree
text: Detain up to two target creatures your opponents control. (Until your next turn, those creatures can't attack or block and their activated abilities can't be activated.)
flavor: The Azorius have so many codes and statutes that you're always in violation of one of them.

name: Maze Sentinel
text:
Vigilance
Multicolored creatures you control have vigilance.
flavor: The route has been known for millennia, but only by those with no means to tell it.

name: Renounce the Guilds
text: Each player sacrifices a multicolored permanent.
flavor:
"Scores will die in the name of peace. That is what you call compromise?"
—Gideon Jura, to Aurelia

name: Riot Control
text: You gain 1 life for each creature your opponents control. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
flavor:
"Ravnicans need order. If they don't have it, we shall bring it to them."
—Isperia

name: Steeple Roc
text: Flying, first strike
flavor:
"Sometimes it forgets to loosen its grip before taking flight. I lost my roof that way."
—Ecaban, Boros scout

name: Sunspire Gatekeepers
text: When Sunspire Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.
flavor: "You will pass with respect, or you will not pass at all."

name: Wake the Reflections
text: Populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
flavor:
"You see a bird, an oak, a packbeast. I see the potential for an army."
—Lalia, Selesnya dryad

name: Maze Glider
text:
Flying
Multicolored creatures you control have flying.
flavor: The pattern of the Implicit Maze extends in more than two dimensions.

name: Mindstatic
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {6}.
flavor:
"It's always satisfying to stymie the best efforts of a rival, but the reactions of the Gruul are particularly amusing."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

name: Murmuring Phantasm
text: Defender
flavor:
"The most insidious thing in the world is nonsense that sounds just plausible enough to listen to."
—Lazav

name: Opal Lake Gatekeepers
text: When Opal Lake Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, you may draw a card.
flavor: Sentries guard Ravnica's landmarks and outlying districts, unaware of these places' import to the maze.

name: Uncovered Clues
text: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal up to two instant and/or sorcery cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor: The Implicit Maze winds through Ravnica, connecting arcane landmarks of all ten guilds.

name: Bane Alley Blackguard
flavor: "I'm in the field of procurement, and business is good. The guilds want all kinds of maps and relics these days, though what they want them for I'm not quite sure."

name: Blood Scrivener
text: If you would draw a card while you have no cards in hand, instead you draw two cards and you lose 1 life.
flavor: Make sure you bleed the fine print.

name: Crypt Incursion
text: Exile all creature cards from target player's graveyard. You gain 3 life for each card exiled this way.
flavor: The Golgari maze-runner Varolz hungers to prove his fortitude in battle, and his trail of victims feeds other hungers.

name: Fatal Fumes
text: Target creature gets -4/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: Travelers in the undercity dread the horrors and assassins of the Dimir, but nearly as many die from more mundane hazards.

name: Hired Torturer
text:
Defender
{3}{B}, {T}: Target opponent loses 2 life, then reveals a card at random from their hand.
flavor: "Follow your passion, I always say. Might as well get paid to do what you love."

name: Rakdos Drake
text:
Flying
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: Rakdos rioters paint their faces to resemble the drakes' bloodied muzzles.

name: Sinister Possession
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 2 life.
flavor:
"You caught something on a cold night's stroll? No, I'd say something caught you."
—Mezim Magrah, civic healer

name: Ubul Sar Gatekeepers
text: When Ubul Sar Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, target creature an opponent controls gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: There are many gates into the undercity, but few ways out.

name: Awe for the Guilds
text: Monocolored creatures can't block this turn.
flavor: When the guilds cooperate, the guildless celebrate their peaceful society. When the guilds clash, the guildless just try to keep out of the way.

name: Clear a Path
text: Destroy target creature with defender.
flavor: "Why do guards always look surprised when we bash them?" asked Ruric. "I think they expect a bribe," said Thar.

name: Maze Rusher
text:
Haste
Multicolored creatures you control have haste.
flavor:
"The maze seems to fight us at every turn, resisting our efforts to solve it."
—Niv-Mizzet

name: Punish the Enemy
text: Punish the Enemy deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker and 3 damage to target creature.
flavor:
"When justice descends, the servant will burn with the master."
—Aurelia

name: Riot Piker
text:
First strike
Riot Piker attacks each combat if able.
flavor: He doesn't care whether he's rioting about trade rights or just having a drunken brawl. He wakes up every morning eager to smash some heads.

name: Rubblebelt Maaka
text: Bloodrush — {R}, Discard Rubblebelt Maaka: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The maaka remain loyal to us in this time of strife. We don't even have to feed them—our enemies do."
—Nedja, Gruul shaman

name: Maze Behemoth
text:
Trample
Multicolored creatures you control have trample.
flavor: It returned to the leylines as quickly as it had appeared, leaving only broken bodies to mark its passage.

name: Mending Touch
text: Regenerate target creature.
flavor:
"The gift of life must be freely given. Anything less would diminish us all."
—Arin, Selesnya healer

name: Mutant's Prey
text: Target creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
flavor: Every street corner is a hunting ground, every citizen potential prey.

name: Phytoburst
text: Target creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn.
flavor: Phytohydras are banned as houseplants in many residential spires. If left unfed, they find their own exit—usually at the cost of extensive property damage.

name: Saruli Gatekeepers
text: When Saruli Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, you gain 7 life.
flavor: In Ravnica's wilder districts, nature still stirs, and its protectors still mind their posts.

name: Skylasher
text:
Flash
This spell can't be countered.
Reach, protection from blue
flavor:
"It preys on those who would spy on our lands, so we never prey on it."
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman

name: Blessing of the Nephilim
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each of its colors.
flavor: "Before the first stone was laid or the first elf-child born, the power of the nephilim was gathering. Let that power be spread by my hands."

name: Brace for Impact
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target multicolored creature this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
flavor: Flesh can be tempered by spellcraft and forged ever stronger by the hammers of foes.

name: Carom
text:
The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn is dealt to another target creature instead.
Draw a card.
flavor: Her enemy's strength is her own.

name: Guardian of the Guildpact
text: Protection from monocolored
flavor: The magic of the Guildpact gives aegis to the spirits pressed into its service. Upon entering the afterlife, they find new focus and are charged with defending the Guildpact against those who would see it broken.

name: Haazda Exonerator
text: {T}, Sacrifice Haazda Exonerator: Destroy target Aura.
flavor: "This aura threatens the sanctity of your soul. Wrenching it free won't be easy on either of us. If you're ready, we'll begin."

name: Haazda Shield Mate
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Haazda Shield Mate unless you pay {W}{W}.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
flavor: The Haazda shield is broad, protecting both the free and the guilded.

name: Mistral Charger
text: Flying
flavor: Some sky steeds break from the thundering herd to ride free on the open winds.

name: Proper Burial
text: Whenever a creature you control dies, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
flavor: Properly honored dead gain the peace of the grave and freedom from the call of the Ghost Quarter.

name: Stoic Ephemera
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
When Stoic Ephemera blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
flavor: "Life is fleeting, and so is death. Only the oath is eternal."

name: Psychic Possession
text:
Enchant opponent
Skip your draw step.
Whenever enchanted opponent draws a card, you may draw a card.
flavor: "You will do the thinking for the both of us!"

name: Bond of Agony
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Each other player loses X life.
flavor: The Rakdos are unique in designing torture equipment they can operate while "suffering" alongside their victims.

name: Brain Pry
text: Choose a nonland card name. Target player reveals their hand. That player discards a card with that name. If they can't, you draw a card.
flavor: To the Rakdos, the fun is in the shakedown. The loot is usually discarded.

name: Delirium Skeins
text: Each player discards three cards.
flavor: There came a rush, a sudden fire in the mind. Then the two saw only the sooty fog of madness, heard only the crackling of their last thoughts burning away.

name: Drekavac
text: When Drekavac enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a noncreature card.
flavor: Like a vulture's scalp, the face of a drekavac is oily and hairless. The filth and disease of its carrion diet slip off its blood-slick skin.

name: Enemy of the Guildpact
text: Protection from multicolored
flavor: Guilds often exterminate those who saw or knew too much. Some vindictive souls retain their knowledge, using it in the afterlife to crush the guilded and the vile bargain that gives them power.

name: Macabre Waltz
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand, then discard a card.
flavor:
"All dead move to the hollow rhythm of necromancy."
—Savra

name: Nightcreep
text: Until end of turn, all creatures become black and all lands become Swamps.
flavor:
"Please tell me I'm hallucinating. I'd rather be crazy than here."
—Gorev Hadszak, Wojek investigator

name: Nihilistic Glee
text:
{2}{B}, Discard a card: Target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Hellbent — {1}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card. Activate only if you have no cards in hand.
flavor: "All ends in obliteration—love in hatred, life in death, and light in empty darkness."

name: Ragamuffyn
text: Hellbent — {T}, Sacrifice a creature or land: Draw a card. Activate only if you have no cards in hand.
flavor: They cut the stitches and give her sips of her brew. Then they sew her up again, and she's back to stirring.

name: Slaughterhouse Bouncer
text: Hellbent — When Slaughterhouse Bouncer dies, if you have no cards in hand, target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
flavor: A Rakdos party is a flop if anyone lives to talk about it.

name: Unliving Psychopath
text:
{B}: Unliving Psychopath gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with power less than Unliving Psychopath's power.
flavor:
"The victim bears the marks of the 'Ktozok Impaler'. . . but he was executed years ago!"
—Gorev Hadszak, Wojek investigator

name: Vesper Ghoul
text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color.
flavor:
"Nature's exceptions remind us not to think in absolutes. Just as the orchid blossoms on blackened stone, so does the gift of mana occasionally manifest in the undead."
—Bougrat, druid of the Cult of Yore

name: Wit's End
text: Target player discards their hand.
flavor:
"Some images are so powerful that one glance burns them into your mind forever. Come, let us gaze on nothingness."
—Szadek

name: Cackling Flames
text:
Cackling Flames deals 3 damage to any target.
Hellbent — Cackling Flames deals 5 damage instead if you have no cards in hand.
flavor:
"I like a little entertainment with my dinner."
—Rakdos

name: Flame-Kin War Scout
text: When another creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Flame-Kin War Scout. If you do, Flame-Kin War Scout deals 4 damage to that creature.
flavor:
"The forward flame-kin are popping. We have incoming!"
—Svar, Boros signaler

name: Gnat Alley Creeper
text: Gnat Alley Creeper can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
flavor: Despite its diminutive name, Gnat Alley is the longest street in Ravnica. Mile after twisting mile, it threads its way among the broader, safer thoroughfares like a parasite.

name: Ignorant Bliss
text: Exile all cards from your hand face down. At the beginning of the next end step, return those cards to your hand, then draw a card.
flavor:
"A quick step beyond oblivion lies a place so full of thoughts that it leaves no room for your own."
—Quyzl, chronarch prodigy

name: Kindle the Carnage
text: Discard a card at random. If you do, Kindle the Carnage deals damage equal to that card's mana value to each creature. You may repeat this process any number of times.
flavor: "Start knockin' heads, boys, and don't stop 'til the ragamuffyn sings!"

name: Ogre Gatecrasher
text: When Ogre Gatecrasher enters the battlefield, destroy target creature with defender.
flavor: A popular game among ogres is to see how many revolutions a head can make before it pops off.

name: Psychotic Fury
text:
Target multicolored creature gains double strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Rage, my servants. Our ancient power is renewed in blood."
—Rakdos

name: Taste for Mayhem
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
Hellbent — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/+0 as long as you have no cards in hand.
flavor: The taste of blood breaks down what little self-control the Rakdos possess.

name: Utvara Scalper
text:
Flying
Utvara Scalper attacks each combat if able.
flavor: He wages war wherever the wind carries him.

name: Weight of Spires
text: Weight of Spires deals damage to target creature equal to the number of nonbasic lands that creature's controller controls.
flavor:
"Finally, a good use for an Azorius courthouse."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage

name: Whiptail Moloch
text: When Whiptail Moloch enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature you control.
flavor:
"It wags its tail when it's happy. It wags its tail when it's angry. Nope, there's no good time to be around a whiptail."
—Rugar, Leaguehall Infirmary patient

name: Flash Foliage
text:
Cast this spell only during combat after blockers are declared.
Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token that's blocking target creature attacking you.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"This undemanding vegetation takes root in a mote of dust but grows incredibly quickly."
—Simic research notes

name: Might of the Nephilim
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each of its colors.
flavor:
"Send a runner to Tin Street, and tell 'em the delivery has been . . . uh . . . held up."
—Bonmod, caravan rear guard

name: Simic Initiate
text: Graft 1 (This creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
flavor: Simic initiates begin their training as experimental subjects. Failures are flushed to the undersewers.

name: Sprouting Phytohydra
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Sprouting Phytohydra is dealt damage, you may create a token that's a copy of Sprouting Phytohydra.
flavor: A hydra tender's problem isn't having enough defenses but enough pots.

name: Stomp and Howl
text: Destroy target artifact and target enchantment.
flavor:
"Mizzium may be impervious to fire, but obviously certain other things can . . . modify its form."
—Ivos Koba, indrik handler

name: Street Savvy
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and can block creatures with landwalk abilities as though they didn't have those abilities.
flavor: "It takes more than swift feet and dark shadows to slip by me unnoticed."

name: Archangel's Light
text: You gain 2 life for each card in your graveyard, then shuffle your graveyard into your library.
flavor:
"This is the light of Avacyn. Even in her absence she offers us hope."
—Radulf, priest of Avacyn

name: Bar the Door
text: Creatures you control get +0/+4 until end of turn.
flavor:
"It may not look like much, but it's a good old door with strong wards. It'll hold."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk

name: Burden of Guilt
text:
Enchant creature
{1}: Tap enchanted creature.
flavor:
"Grab an axe and defend the gate! Your despair is an extravagance we can ill afford."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Curse of Exhaustion
text:
Enchant player
Enchanted player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
flavor:
"I do believe your heresy will prove more difficult now that you have more pressing concerns."
—Bishop Argust

name: Elgaud Inquisitor
text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
When Elgaud Inquisitor dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
flavor: "It will take more than steel alone to purge this world of evil."

name: Gavony Ironwright
text: Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +1/+4.
flavor: "I wish my work could shelter everyone, yet I pray we are never so few that it does."

name: Niblis of the Mist
text:
Flying
When Niblis of the Mist enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.
flavor:
"Not even a roaring fire could thaw the chill it put in my heart."
—Vonn, geist-trapper

name: Niblis of the Urn
text:
Flying
Whenever Niblis of the Urn attacks, you may tap target creature.
flavor:
"I never had the nerve to open that bottle. I'll bet you're wishing right now you hadn't been so curious yourself."
—Old Rutstein

name: Sanctuary Cat
flavor: Cats prowl the corridors of Avacyn's churches in search of devils or signs of their mischief.

name: Silverclaw Griffin
text: Flying, first strike
flavor: It patrols the grafs for miles around Thraben, ensuring that the unhallowed do not wake for long.

name: Skillful Lunge
text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Valor is a currency of the living that serves us well."
—Cosper Lowe of the Silbern Guard

name: Artful Dodge
text:
Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Flashback {U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: Those who know the alleys and sewers of the Erdwal can disappear like smoke.

name: Beguiler of Wills
text: {T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of creatures you control.
flavor: "Come, let me free you of the tyranny of thought."

name: Bone to Ash
text:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Chant of the Skifsang
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -13/-0.
flavor: The skifsang, seafarers of Nephalia, craft spells like other sailors craft nets—making them strong enough to snare even the deadliest catch.

name: Chill of Foreboding
text:
Each player mills five cards.
Flashback {7}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: "Wait . . . did you fellows hear something?"

name: Counterlash
text: Counter target spell. You may cast a spell that shares a card type with it from your hand without paying its mana cost.
flavor: "Pathetic. Let me show you how it's done."

name: Headless Skaab
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Headless Skaab enters the battlefield tapped.
flavor: A head is a needless encumbrance when muscle is all that's required.

name: Nephalia Seakite
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
flavor:
"Keep one eye on the cliff road or you may fall to your death. Keep one eye on the sky or your death may fall on you."
—Manfried Ulmach, Elgaud Master-at-Arms

name: Niblis of the Breath
text:
Flying
{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
flavor:
"Why do the dead remain among us? Where is Flight Alabaster to lead them home? Where is Avacyn?"
—Eruth of Lambholt

name: Shriekgeist
text:
Flying
Whenever Shriekgeist deals combat damage to a player, that player mills two cards.
flavor: Wounds of the flesh are easy to heal. Wounds of the mind may never be undone.

name: Soul Seizer // Ghastly Haunting
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
flavor: The body often twists and flails spasmodically as the spirit explores its new home.

name: Black Cat
text: When Black Cat dies, target opponent discards a card at random.
flavor: Its last life is spent tormenting your dreams.

name: Chosen of Markov // Markov's Servant
text: {T}, Tap an untapped Vampire you control: Transform Chosen of Markov.
flavor: "I have been found worthy by this great house . . ."

name: Curse of Thirst
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of Thirst deals damage to that player equal to the number of Curses attached to them.
flavor:
"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut

name: Death's Caress
text: Destroy target creature. If that creature was a Human, you gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor: The faint smell of cloves, the rustling of the wind, and a paralyzing descent into an airless, fathomless tomb.

name: Falkenrath Torturer
text: Sacrifice a creature: Falkenrath Torturer gains flying until end of turn. If the sacrificed creature was a Human, put a +1/+1 counter on Falkenrath Torturer.
flavor: "There was a time when our cages rang with wailing. Now only a handful of these whimpering fools remain."

name: Gravepurge
text:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"The Blessed Sleep? Ha! Wake up my lovelies, there's work to be done!"
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony

name: Harrowing Journey
text: Target player draws three cards and loses 3 life.
flavor:
"There are always fools who attempt to traverse Kruin Pass before sundown and every time they wind up in a race for their lives."
—Old Rutstein

name: Highborn Ghoul
text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
flavor:
"All the dead sleep lightly here, no matter how refined their beds may be."
—Grafdigger Wulmer

name: Ravenous Demon // Archdemon of Greed
text: Sacrifice a Human: Transform Ravenous Demon. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: His twisted words entice the weak.

name: Sightless Ghoul
text:
Sightless Ghoul can't block.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: It blindly marches on Thraben's gates, guided by its master's direful will.

name: Skirsdag Flayer
text: {3}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Human: Destroy target creature.
flavor: Certain initiates into the Skirsdag cult take a vow of blindness, pledging obedience to none but demonkind.

name: Spiteful Shadows
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to its controller.
flavor:
"Let us remind these human cattle why they fear the shadows of this world."
—Aldreg, Skirsdag cultist

name: Undying Evil
text: Target creature gains undying until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor:
"Is it true the evil that people do follows them into death? Let's find out."
—Liliana Vess

name: Vengeful Vampire
text:
Flying
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: He wields the full power of wrath unfettered by the sympathies of a soul.

name: Zombie Apocalypse
text: Return all Zombie creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped, then destroy all Humans.
flavor:
"There will come a day so dark you will pray for death. On that day your prayers will be answered."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum

name: Afflicted Deserter // Werewolf Ransacker
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Afflicted Deserter.
flavor: The rising of the first full moon eliminated any doubt as to the horrible truth lurking within.

name: Alpha Brawl
text: Target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to each other creature that player controls, then each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to that creature.
flavor: Being an alpha means proving it every full moon.

name: Curse of Bloodletting
text:
Enchant player
If a source would deal damage to enchanted player, it deals double that damage to that player instead.
flavor: It is the demon's mark, an infernal claim on the flesh of the guilty.

name: Erdwal Ripper
text:
Haste
Whenever Erdwal Ripper deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Savage vampires lurk in the Erdwal's network of passageways where prey is plentiful and easy to catch.

name: Forge Devil
text: When Forge Devil enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to you.
flavor: Devils infiltrated the lower levels of Thraben Cathedral, making cracks in load-bearing pillars and setting fire to precious archives.

name: Hinterland Hermit // Hinterland Scourge
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hinterland Hermit.
flavor: He tried to live far from those he could hurt . . .

name: Markov Blademaster
text:
Double strike
Whenever Markov Blademaster deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: "Mortals practice swordplay for a few decades at best. How can they ever attain the exquisite mastery that eternity has to offer?"

name: Markov Warlord
text:
Haste
When Markov Warlord enters the battlefield, up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
flavor: "What use is a stake or holy symbol in the hands of a coward?"

name: Mondronen Shaman // Tovolar's Magehunter
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mondronen Shaman.
flavor: "Tovolar, my master. Gather the howlpack, for the Hunter's Moon is nigh and Thraben's walls grow weak."

name: Moonveil Dragon
text:
Flying
{R}: Each creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Their hearts beat, their lungs draw breath, and they have one true form. I count them as allies of the living."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Nearheath Stalker
text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: "Do not speak of this to the elders. They look unfavorably upon my indulgences."

name: Russet Wolves
flavor:
"The wolves of our valley are bred to detest the scent of ghouls. For centuries they have kept our estates clear of such carrion."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Scorch the Fields
text: Destroy target land. Scorch the Fields deals 1 damage to each Human creature.
flavor:
"Your fields will turn as black as a ghoul's tongue and fire shall be your only harvest."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum

name: Shattered Perception
text:
Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor:
"You must shatter the fetters of the past. Only then can you truly act."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Wrack with Madness
text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
flavor: The skathul, spirits consumed by revenge, fester and seethe while looking for weak minds to assault.

name: Briarpack Alpha
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Briarpack Alpha enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The wolves turned on us and a chill swept over me. The pack had a new leader."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Dawntreader Elk
text: {G}, Sacrifice Dawntreader Elk: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: Silent as winter snow, it seeks wild places unspoiled by the walking dead.

name: Deranged Outcast
text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice a Human: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
flavor: Cast out by his village, he now takes grim offense at refugees who seek shelter in his forest.

name: Favor of the Woods
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks, you gain 3 life.
flavor: Feeling abandoned by Avacyn, some Kessigers turned to the pagan rituals of their ancestors.

name: Ghoultree
text: This spell costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.
flavor: It uproots entire fengrafs to add to its twisted frame.

name: Gravetiller Wurm
text:
Trample
Morbid — Gravetiller Wurm enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
flavor: As the creatures of the night closed in on humanity, Innistrad's primeval forces stirred, as though waking to watch the slaughter.

name: Hollowhenge Beast
flavor: In a world of monsters, it's the stuff of nightmares.

name: Kessig Recluse
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor: Its silk is highly prized, but then again, so is your life.

name: Lambholt Elder // Silverpelt Werewolf
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Lambholt Elder.
flavor:
"Be wary of the seemingly gentle souls. The weak here were slaughtered long ago."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Scorned Villager // Moonscarred Werewolf
text:
{T}: Add {G}.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Scorned Villager.
flavor: "My village's fear drove me into the wild . . ."

name: Somberwald Dryad
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: The Somberwald is her domain, and she has yet to hear an acceptable excuse for trespassing.

name: Strangleroot Geist
text:
Haste
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: Geists of the hanged often haunt the tree on which they died.

name: Ulvenwald Bear
text: Morbid — When Ulvenwald Bear enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
flavor:
Out chasing bears
—Kessig expression meaning "died in the woods"

name: Village Survivors
text:
Vigilance
Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control have vigilance.
flavor: As their villages fell to werewolves, fleeing refugees discovered they too had remarkable survival instincts.

name: Young Wolf
text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: The Ulvenwald makes no allowances for youth. Today's newborn is either tomorrow's hunter or tomorrow's lunch.

name: Elbrus, the Binding Blade // Withengar Unbound
flavor: Those who grasp its hilt soon hear the demon's call.

name: Foul Familiar
text:
Foul Familiar can't block.
{B}, Pay 1 life: Return Foul Familiar to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Serve me, and live forever."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Goblin Mutant
text:
Trample
Goblin Mutant can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.
Goblin Mutant can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.
flavor: If only it had three brains, too.

name: Lava Burst
text: Lava Burst deals X damage to any target. If Lava Burst would deal damage to a creature, that damage can't be prevented or dealt instead to another permanent or player.
flavor:
"Overkill? This isn't a game of kick-the-ouphe!"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Orcish Cannoneers
text: {T}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
flavor:
"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

name: Shatter
text: Destroy target artifact.
flavor:
"Let the past be the past. Do not call up that which you cannot put down. Destroy that which destroyed us, so long ago."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Balduvian Bears
flavor:
"They're a hardy bunch, but I'd still bet that they just slept through the worst of the cold times."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Folk of the Pines
text: {1}{G}: Folk of the Pines gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Our friends of the forest take many forms, yet all serve the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Zeriam, Golden Wind
text:
Flying
Whenever a Griffin you control deals combat damage to a player, create a 2/2 white Griffin creature token with flying.
flavor:
"For their courage, the griffins were granted domain over all the desert skies."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Mana Cannons
text: Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, Mana Cannons deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of colors that spell is.
flavor:
"I hate the smell of charred Phyrexian, but it sure beats the alternative!"
—Jaya

name: Robaran Mercenaries
text:
Vigilance
Robaran Mercenaries has all activated abilities of all legendary creatures you control.
flavor: "We learned from the best. And the worst. Pretty much whoever was available."

name: Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit
text: Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: Martyred for worshipping her ancestors, she now walks among them.

name: Hero of Precinct One
text: Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, create a 1/1 white Human creature token.
flavor: When the established order falters, what remains are ordinary people and their struggle to survive.

name: Kothophed, Soul Hoarder
text:
Flying
Whenever a permanent owned by another player is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor: "I will be your most demanding master, Liliana. But I have great things in mind for you."

name: Krenko, Tin Street Kingpin
text: Whenever Krenko, Tin Street Kingpin attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it, then create a number of 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens equal to Krenko's power.
flavor: "After the people flee, but before the enemy arrives—that's grabbin' time."

name: Thrill of Possibility
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards.
flavor: "Right now, in these first moments of creation, it is simultaneously nothing and everything."

name: Shivan Gorge
text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}{R}, {T}: Shivan Gorge deals 1 damage to each opponent.
flavor: Both forge and pyre.

name: Cleric of the Forward Order
text: When Cleric of the Forward Order enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each creature you control named Cleric of the Forward Order.
flavor: War after war, a healer's enemy is always the same—death itself.

name: Divine Sacrament
text:
White creatures get +1/+1.
Threshold — White creatures get an additional +1/+1 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
flavor: "My wings shall be your shield. My sword shall be your vengeance."

name: Glory
text:
Flying
{2}{W}: Choose a color. Creatures you control gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn. Activate only if Glory is in your graveyard.
flavor:
"Glory was gone; Glory was everywhere."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Improvised Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+5.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: "I don't care if it's covered in rust, blood, or enemy insignias. If it'll stop an arrow, I'll take it."

name: Lieutenant Kirtar
text:
Flying
{1}{W}, Sacrifice Lieutenant Kirtar: Exile target attacking creature.
flavor:
"His strengths are pride, devotion, and ambition. His weaknesses are the same."
—Pianna, nomad captain

name: Lyra Dawnbringer
text:
Flying, first strike, lifelink
Other Angels you control get +1/+1 and have lifelink.
flavor: "You are not alone. You never were."

name: Mystic Zealot
text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Zealot gets +1/+1 and has flying.
flavor: Nomad youths aspire to one of two roles in the tribe: priest or warrior. Their secret dream is to become both.

name: Nomad Decoy
text:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
Threshold — {W}{W}, {T}: Tap two target creatures. Activate only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
flavor: If you can take something from a nomad, it's probably bait.

name: Test of Endurance
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 50 or more life, you win the game.
flavor: Most wars are won not by those with the best tactics or truest cause but simply by the ones left standing.

name: Aquamoeba
text: Discard a card: Switch Aquamoeba's power and toughness until end of turn.
flavor: Some tides need no moon.

name: Floodgate
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Floodgate has flying, sacrifice it.
When Floodgate leaves the battlefield, it deals damage equal to half the number of Islands you control, rounded down, to each nonblue creature without flying.
flavor:
"Quick, Rhirhok—teach me to swim!"
—Makht, goblin casualty

name: Glintwing Invoker
text: {7}{U}: Glintwing Invoker gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: The Mirari flares in his mind.

name: Hermetic Study
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
flavor: "At last! I have discovered a way to weaponize one of Tolaria's most abundant resources: horseshoe crabs."

name: High Tide
text: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps an Island for mana, that player adds an additional {U}.
flavor:
"Close the walls! Retract the docks! The homarids are coming!"
—Benson, Argivian sentry

name: Ovinize
text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and has base power and toughness 0/1.
flavor: The crocodile's failed attack left it feeling both hungry and sheepish

name: Turnabout
text: Choose artifact, creature, or land. Tap all untapped permanents of the chosen type target player controls, or untap all tapped permanents of that type that player controls.
flavor: The best cure for a big ego is a little failure.

name: Entomb
text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your graveyard, then shuffle.
flavor: A grave is the safest place to store ill-gotten treasures.

name: Flesh Reaver
text: Whenever Flesh Reaver deals damage to a creature or opponent, Flesh Reaver deals that much damage to you.
flavor: Though the reaver is horrifyingly effective, its dorsal vents spit a highly corrosive cloud of filth.

name: Goblin Turncoat
text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Regenerate Goblin Turncoat.
flavor: Modo was great at making friends . . . into shields.

name: Hyalopterous Lemure
text: {0}: Hyalopterous Lemure gets -1/-0 and gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"I was wrong! Not harmless at all!"
—Norin the Wary

name: Necrosavant
text: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate only during your upkeep.
flavor: To the novice necromancers, it looked exactly like a regular human grave.

name: No Mercy
text: Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
flavor:
"We had years to prepare, while they had mere minutes."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent

name: Oversold Cemetery
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have four or more creature cards in your graveyard, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: It was a profitable scheme, at least until the dead began to object.

name: Twisted Experiment
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-1.
flavor: After six days in the hands of the Gixians, what remained was utterly unrecognizable as the person it once was.

name: Wretched Anurid
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life.
flavor: The only prince inside this frog is the one it ate.

name: Deadapult
text: {R}, Sacrifice a Zombie: Deadapult deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor:
"Nothing ruins your day like a blazing zombie."
—Tahngarth

name: Gamble
text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle.
flavor: When you've got nothing, you might as well trade it for something else.

name: Gempalm Incinerator
text:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
flavor: "I've got this under control! Probably!"

name: Goblin Medics
text: Whenever Goblin Medics becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Dorik was unshakably confident, having learned medicine from the finest butcher shops in Yotia.

name: Last Chance
text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
flavor: "I only had time to read half the spell, but I'm pretty sure this will work!"

name: Macetail Hystrodon
text:
First strike, haste
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: The goblins tracked the hystrodon with much stealth and cunning. Then they were eaten with much pain and yelling.

name: Overmaster
text:
The next instant or sorcery spell you cast this turn can't be countered.
Draw a card.
flavor: "My, what a pretty little trick. At least you'll die with style."

name: Pashalik Mons
text:
Whenever Pashalik Mons or another Goblin you control dies, Pashalik Mons deals 1 damage to any target.
{3}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
flavor: The thunderhead that leads in the storm.

name: Ridgetop Raptor
text: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
flavor:
"The Skirk Ridge has many wonderful things to discover—like escape routes."
—Foothill guide

name: Siege-Gang Commander
text:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: "Ready . . . uh . . . fire!"

name: Slice and Dice
text:
Slice and Dice deals 4 damage to each creature.
Cycling {2}{R} ({2}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Slice and Dice, you may have it deal 1 damage to each creature.
flavor: Tahngarth relished the chance to bloody his blades on those who had ravaged his home.

name: Spark Spray
text:
Spark Spray deals 1 damage to any target.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: "You see this rock-grinder? One step closer and it'll be a face-grinder!"

name: Storm Entity
text:
Haste
Storm Entity enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other spell cast this turn.
flavor: Dweldian magi don't enter the Realm of Thrones when they die. Instead their souls are drawn to great works of magic.

name: Subterranean Scout
text: When Subterranean Scout enters the battlefield, target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
