flavor: When things get ugly above ground, goblins resort to alternate routes of passage.

name: Suq'Ata Lancer
text:
Haste
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"Never stop 'til you see your lance come out the other side."
—Telim'Tor

name: Undying Rage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
When Undying Rage is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Undying Rage to its owner's hand.
flavor: Radha was born in Skyshroud, but her temper is undeniably Keldon.

name: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, for each Aura and Equipment attached to Valduk, Keeper of the Flame, create a 3/1 red Elemental creature token with trample and haste. Exile those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: The hammer strikes. The Flame awakens.

name: Arboria
text: Creatures can't attack a player unless that player cast a spell or put a nontoken permanent onto the battlefield during their last turn.
flavor: As the world steeled itself for the New Phyrexian invasion, the heart of the Pinelands awoke, and a new maro-sorcerer strode forth to join the fight.

name: Break Asunder
text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: "No good will come of this."

name: Fa'adiyah Seer
text: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.
flavor: She nurtures each flower from seed to blossom, and in return, they whisper secrets only she can hear.

name: Invigorating Boon
text: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor:
"Bright spores coalesced in empty air. Seedlings burst through barren soil. Genesis had arrived.
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Jolrael, Mwonvuli Recluse
text:
Whenever you draw your second card each turn, create a 2/2 green Cat creature token.
{4}{G}{G}: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: "Humans bring nothing but suffering and deceit. They are not welcome in my forest."

name: Nut Collector
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token.
Threshold — Squirrel creatures get +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
flavor: "I'll call you Reginald, and you're Mimi, and you're Tank, and you're Bobo..."

name: Symbiotic Beast
text: When Symbiotic Beast dies, create four 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
flavor:
I'll take the patrol through the hunting grounds. You take the caves. Give me an angry apex predator over those little creepy-crawlies any day."
—Oranes, Yavimaya hunter

name: Werebear
text:
{T}: Add {G}.
Threshold — Werebear gets +3/+3 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
flavor: He exercises his right to bear arms.

name: Wrath of God
text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
flavor: Each side prayed for the gods to smite the other. In the end, all their prayers were answered.

name: Chainer's Edict
text:
Target player sacrifices a creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: "You forfeited any right to mercy the moment you challenged me."

name: Argivian Phalanx
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each creature you control.
Vigilance
flavor: New Argive welcomed the kor people when they were displaced by the Rathi overlay. The kor repay that kindness with fierce loyalty.

name: Artillery Blast
text: Domain — Artillery Blast deals X damage to target tapped creature, where X is 1 plus the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor: To conserve ammunition, Jhoira modified ancient Thran artillery cannons to fire gouts of pure Shivan lava.

name: Benalish Faithbonder
text:
Vigilance
Enlist (As this creature attacks, you may tap a nonattacking creature you control without summoning sickness. When you do, add its power to this creature's until end of turn.)
flavor: "A single light can hold back endless darkness."

name: Charismatic Vanguard
text: {4}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "This battlefield is an anvil, my mace a forging hammer . . . and you, Phyrexian scum, are the scrap metal that's about to be reshaped as I see fit."

name: Citizen's Arrest
text: When Citizen's Arrest enters the battlefield, exile target creature or planeswalker an opponent controls until Citizen's Arrest leaves the battlefield.
flavor: "What lurks behind the faces of those you think you can trust?"

name: Clockwork Drawbridge
text:
Defender
{2}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor: Argivia's clockwork fortifications are the stuff of legend, reminding all on Dominaria that ingenuity has saved them before and can do so again.

name: Destroy Evil
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target creature with toughness 4 or greater.
• Destroy target enchantment.
flavor: Serra's grace most often manifests as a healing touch, but it may also grant a merciful death.

name: Join Forces
text: Untap up to two target creatures. They each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Okay—you take the sixteen ragers and the hulk on the right. I'll take the ten defilers and the plaguelord on the left. Ready?"
—Danitha, to Radha

name: Knight of Dawn's Light
text:
First strike
If you would gain life, you gain that much life plus 1 instead.
{1}{W}: Knight of Dawn's Light gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Phyrexians destroyed my village, but they cannot break my hope."

name: Mesa Cavalier
text:
Flying
When Mesa Cavalier enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor: In the fight to defeat Phyrexia, the courage of Benalish knights is matched only by that of their pegasus steeds.

name: Prayer of Binding
text:
Flash
When Prayer of Binding enters the battlefield, exile up to one target nonland permanent an opponent controls until Prayer of Binding leaves the battlefield. You gain 2 life.
flavor: When a Phyrexian agent cannot be killed, they must be contained.

name: Resolute Reinforcements
text:
Flash
When Resolute Reinforcements enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
flavor: Morale rarely survives the sudden appearance of a squad of Sursi skirmishers at an army's flank.

name: Samite Herbalist
text: Whenever Samite Herbalist becomes tapped, you gain 1 life and scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor: "Spiritual wholeness is not something you can give to yourself: it is attained only through the divine blessing of healing another."

name: Take Up the Shield
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. It gains lifelink and indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
flavor: "You are all part of my pride. As long as I live, I will protect you."

name: Temporary Lockdown
text: When Temporary Lockdown enters the battlefield, exile each nonland permanent with mana value 2 or less until Temporary Lockdown leaves the battlefield.
flavor: "Any one of us could be compromised," said Karn. "No one leaves until we know who can be trusted."

name: Valiant Veteran
text:
Other Soldiers you control get +1/+1.
{3}{W}{W}, Exile Valiant Veteran from your graveyard: Put a +1/+1 counter on each Soldier you control.
flavor: "Let them come. We will show them that Argivian steel is stronger than any Phyrexian metal."

name: Academy Loremaster
text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player may draw an additional card. If they do, spells they cast this turn cost {2} more to cast.
flavor: As a young student, she dusted the shelves of Tolaria's great library. Now, she writes the books that line them.

name: Academy Wall
text:
Defender
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card. This ability triggers only once each turn.
flavor: Once the Society of Mishra took control, the Tolarian Academy at Lat-Nam became a haven for dark research.

name: Coral Colony
text:
Defender
{1}{U}, {T}: Target player mills X cards, where X is the number of creatures you control with defender. (To mill a card, a player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.)
flavor: The seafloor is strewn with the wreckage of Vodalia's would-be conquerors.

name: Ertai's Scorn
text:
This spell costs {U} less to cast if an opponent cast two or more spells this turn.
Counter target spell.
flavor: "You're not so special, Karn. Anything that has been assembled can be disassembled."

name: Haughty Djinn
text:
Flying
Haughty Djinn's power is equal to the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: "I adore your outfit. It's so . . . rustic."

name: Haunting Figment
text:
Vigilance
Haunting Figment can't be blocked as long as you've cast an instant or sorcery spell this turn.
flavor: Some bad dreams stay with you forever.

name: Micromancer
text: When Micromancer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an instant or sorcery card with mana value 1, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: "Ideas don't have to be big to be great."

name: Shore Up
text: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn. Untap it. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: Homarid shells are adapted to the crushing pressure of the deepest depths; on land, their sturdiness seems supernatural.

name: Silver Scrutiny
text:
You may cast Silver Scrutiny as though it had flash if X is 3 or less.
Draw X cards.
flavor: Karn's creation allowed him to monitor events across Dominaria—and everything he saw worried him.

name: Soaring Drake
text: Flying
flavor: The already spectacular views from the towers of the College at Lat-Nam are sometimes enhanced by glimpses of drakes diving into the ocean to devour small sharks.

name: Talas Lookout
text:
Flying
When Talas Lookout dies, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
flavor:
"The Talas pirates are motivated by money, so we paid them twice what they could steal from us to spy for us instead."
—Jhoira

name: Tidepool Turtle
text: {2}{U}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor: Prized by wizards as a mobile scrying pool, it bears visions drawn from the depths of the sea.

name: Tolarian Terror
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard.
Ward {2} (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {2}.)
flavor: Afterward, a number of treatises on sea serpent morphology were swiftly revised.

name: Vesuvan Duplimancy
text: Whenever you cast a spell that targets only a single artifact or creature you control, create a token that's a copy of that artifact or creature, except it's not legendary.
flavor:
"There hasn't been an original thought on Vesuva in centuries."
—Emmest, Tolarian chronicler

name: Vodalian Hexcatcher
text:
Flash
Other Merfolk you control get +1/+1.
Sacrifice a Merfolk: Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor: "You're just one more pollutant to be removed from the sea."

name: Volshe Tideturner
text: {T}: Add {U}. Spend this mana only to cast an instant or sorcery spell or a kicked spell.
flavor: Ships suspected of carrying Sheoldred's agents have a tendency to drift far off course as they sail through the Voda Sea.

name: Battle-Rage Blessing
text: Target creature gains deathtouch and indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
flavor:
"Since when is it cheating to give one side an unfair advantage?"
—Braids

name: Battlefly Swarm
text:
Flying
{B}: Battlefly Swarm gains deathtouch until end of turn.
flavor: Having encountered the bitter Phyrexian battleflies before, Squee knew not to bother eating them—or at least to stop after the fifth.

name: Blight Pile
text:
Defender
{2}{B}, {T}: Each opponent loses X life, where X is the number of creatures with defender you control.
flavor:
"Keep your distance. It may be broken, but it's far from benign."
—Stenn

name: Cult Conscript
text:
Cult Conscript enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}{B}: Return Cult Conscript from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate only if a non-Skeleton creature died under your control this turn.
flavor: His eternal rest turned out to be more of a quick nap.

name: Cut Down
text: Destroy target creature with total power and toughness 5 or less.
flavor:
"There can be no mercy, no half measures. When facing Phyrexians, it's kill swiftly or die."
—Jodah

name: Drag to the Bottom
text: Domain — Each creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is 1 plus the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor: Windgrace's gladehunters hibernate in the quagmires of Urborg until the scent of Phyrexian technology awakens their hunger.

name: Extinguish the Light
text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker. If its mana value was 3 or less, you gain 3 life.
flavor: Jaya did not want to die, but of all the things to die for, Dominaria felt right.

name: Gibbering Barricade
text:
Defender
{2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life and draw a card.
flavor:
"Who needs stone walls when you can hide behind an impenetrable barrier of screaming nightmares?"
—Braids

name: Phyrexian Vivisector
text: Whenever a creature you control dies, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor: Before he was the Father of Machines, Yawgmoth was a twisted Thran physician, and his legacy of medical atrocities lives on in New Phyrexia.

name: Pilfer
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: To the merchant, it was nothing more than a few missing trinkets. To Tinybones, it was the greatest heist of all time.

name: Sengir Connoisseur
text:
Flying
Whenever one or more other creatures die, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Connoisseur. This ability triggers only once each turn.
flavor: "We cannot afford to let the Phyrexians win. They taste terrible."

name: Shadow Prophecy
text: Domain — Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control. Put up to two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. You lose 2 life.
flavor: "Lord Windgrace, grant me wisdom."

name: Shadow-Rite Priest
text:
Other Clerics you control get +1/+1.
{3}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice another Cleric: Search your library for a black creature card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: Backstabbing is common within demonic cults. So are front- and side-stabbing.

name: Sheoldred, the Apocalypse
text:
Deathtouch
Whenever you draw a card, you gain 2 life.
Whenever an opponent draws a card, they lose 2 life.
flavor: "Gix failed. I shall not."

name: Splatter Goblin
text: When Splatter Goblin dies, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"For some, perfection is but a single moment when form and purpose converge."
—Rona

name: Tattered Apparition
text:
Flying
{1}{B}: Tattered Apparition gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Ah yes, I remember that one. I turned him inside out and cast his soul into an endless nightmare a few centuries ago."
—Braids

name: Toxic Abomination
text: When Toxic Abomination enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
flavor: Deep in the forgotten reaches of Urborg, ancient Phyrexian monstrosities shamble endlessly, putrid ichor leaking from their rusted forms.

name: Writhing Necromass
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.
Deathtouch
flavor:
"We sent three of our best legions! You're telling me no one came back?"
—Tori D'Avenant

name: Coalition Warbrute
text:
Enlist (As this creature attacks, you may tap a nonattacking creature you control without summoning sickness. When you do, add its power to this creature's until end of turn.)
Trample
flavor: Anger is his greatest weapon, and he sharpens it daily.

name: Electrostatic Infantry
text:
Trample
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Electrostatic Infantry.
flavor:
"That's not exactly what I had in mind when I said 'charge,' but I like your enthusiasm!"
—Balmor, battlemage captain

name: Flowstone Infusion
text: Target creature gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: The rumor that contact with flowstone would reveal Phyrexian sleeper agents was spread mostly by Phyrexian sleeper agents.

name: Flowstone Kavu
text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
{R}: Flowstone Kavu gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: The kavu adjusted easily to the Rathi overlay, incorporating the invasive flowstone into their own adaptable forms.

name: Furious Bellow
text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor: Minotaurs sometimes pretend to be lost in a battle rage, leading their opponents to underestimate their cleverness.

name: Goblin Picker
text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
flavor: Countless generations of Shivan goblins have worked on the Mana Rig, giving them an unparalleled eye for useful relics.

name: Hurler Cyclops
text: {1}, Sacrifice another creature: Hurler Cyclops deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
"It's my fault, really. I told him to throw anything he could find at the enemy."
—Throppel, auxiliary commander

name: Jaya's Firenado
text: Jaya's Firenado deals 5 damage to target creature or planeswalker. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor:
"For all their supposed advances, the Phyrexians still aren't fireproof."
—Jaya Ballard

name: Lightning Strike
text: Lightning Strike deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor: Danitha watched in shock as electricity lanced from Jaya's fingertips, obliterating the charging Phyrexians. "What?" said the pyromancer serenely. "I told you I'd learned some new tricks."

name: Meria's Outrider
text:
Reach
Domain — When Meria's Outrider enters the battlefield, it deals damage to each opponent equal to the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor: Arrows fashioned from the living wood of Yavimaya carry all of the forest's rage in their fire-hardened points.

name: Molten Monstrosity
text:
This spell costs {X} less to cast, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.
Trample
flavor: The cold snap killed off most of the heat-loving hellions . . . leaving only the strongest alive to breed.

name: Shivan Devastator
text:
Flying, haste
Shivan Devastator enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor: There were many reasons why Shiv was not high on Sheoldred's list of places to conquer: big, fiery reasons.

name: Twinferno
text:
Choose one —
• When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
• Target creature you control gains double strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"More fire?" Jaya asked.
"More fire," Jodah agreed.

name: Barkweave Crusher
text: Enlist (As this creature attacks, you may tap a nonattacking creature you control without summoning sickness. When you do, add its power to this creature's until end of turn.)
flavor:
"Phyrexia may be ancient, but Gaea is eternal."
—Queen Allenal of Ruadach

name: Bite Down
text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature or planeswalker you don't control.
flavor:
"Yavimaya takes care of herself; the kavu are evidence of this. What does your Coalition offer that the forest cannot provide?"
—Jenson Carthalion

name: Broken Wings
text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.
flavor:
"Serra guides our shots true. Also, I just tuned the cannons."
—Tiana

name: Deathbloom Gardener
text:
Deathtouch
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor: "I can provide the Coalition with poisons that will break down Phyrexian machinery as easily as they stop the heart."

name: Elfhame Wurm
text: Vigilance, trample
flavor: The wurms consume everything in their path, so the elves make sure that their path goes through as many Phyrexians as possible.

name: Gaea's Might
text: Domain — Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor:
"Why fight over the lumber in a tree's trunk when its branches have room for all?"
—Multani

name: Leaf-Crowned Visionary
text:
Other Elves you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may pay {G}. If you do, draw a card.
flavor: "The seedling you save today may be the sheltering boughs of generations to come."

name: Llanowar Loamspeaker
text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
{T}: Target land you control becomes a 3/3 Elemental creature with haste until end of turn. It's still a land. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: Twigs broken underfoot in Llanowar tend to return the favor.

name: Llanowar Stalker
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Llanowar Stalker gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: If you spot one elf in Llanowar, it's likely there's another with a knife at your back.

name: Magnigoth Sentry
text: Reach
flavor: When one of Yavimaya's enormous magnigoth trees awakens into a treefolk, it is a towering presence of physical strength and ancient wisdom.

name: Mossbeard Ancient
text:
Trample
When Mossbeard Ancient enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.
flavor: Older than the mountains, the dragons, and the wars of humans and machines.

name: Nishoba Brawler
text:
Trample
Domain — Nishoba Brawler's power is equal to the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor: Though native to cold climates, the nishoba have adapted to more temperate environments since the Ice Age ended.

name: Snarespinner
text:
Reach
Whenever Snarespinner blocks a creature with flying, Snarespinner gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: In the rich jungles of Yavimaya, bright colors are the perfect camouflage.

name: Sunbathing Rootwalla
text: Domain — {3}{G}: Until end of turn, Sunbathing Rootwalla gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: A rootwalla's prey includes anything or anyone that wanders into view.

name: Territorial Maro
text: Domain — Territorial Maro's power and toughness are each equal to twice the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor: The Coalition was more than just treaties and alliances: it was the soul of a world rising up against the invading tide.

name: Yavimaya Sojourner
text: Domain — This spell costs {1} less to cast for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor: To the long-lived treefolk, the Phyrexians invading again after only three centuries was as though they never left.

name: Serra Redeemer
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, put two +1/+1 counters on that creature.
flavor: "Heroism is neither a strong arm nor a divine destiny. It is the choice to stand unbowed against impossible odds."

name: Cosmic Epiphany
text: Draw cards equal to the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.
flavor:
"All knowledge, past and future, is etched upon reality. Every answer we seek is out there, hidden only by the limits of our minds."
—Jodah

name: Ragefire Hellkite
text:
Flying
Whenever Ragefire Hellkite attacks, you may sacrifice another creature. If you do, Ragefire Hellkite gains double strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Well, the good news is that sound wasn't the volcano erupting . . ."
—George, Coalition scout

name: Briar Hydra
text:
Trample
Domain — Whenever Briar Hydra deals combat damage to a player, put X +1/+1 counters on target creature you control, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor: Flora and fauna alike rose to Yavimaya's defense.

name: Aven Sentry
text: Flying
flavor: "My flock flew from a distant continent ruined by cataclysm and war. Benalia gave us shelter to end our exodus."

name: Baird, Steward of Argive
text:
Vigilance
Creatures can't attack you or planeswalkers you control unless their controller pays {1} for each of those creatures.
flavor: "The walls of Argive were built by a peaceful dynastic union that has guarded us against war for fifteen centuries. The lesson is clear."

name: Benalish Honor Guard
text: Benalish Honor Guard gets +1/+0 for each legendary creature you control.
flavor:
"The true measure of all heroes is not what they achieve, but who they inspire."
—*Triumph of Gerrard*

name: Benalish Marshal
text: Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor:
"Some aspire to climb the mountain of Honor. The Benalish are born upon its peak, and from there ascend among the stars."
—*History of Benalia*

name: Blessed Light
text: Exile target creature or enchantment.
flavor: Enchanted by mage-smiths and blessed by priests, Benalish windows let in light and cast out darkness.

name: Board the Weatherlight
text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a historic card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)
flavor: A new gathering for a new age.

name: Call the Cavalry
text: Create two 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with vigilance.
flavor: Benalish citizens born under the same constellations share a star-clan. Their loyalty to one another interlaces the Seven Houses.

name: Charge
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Honor rides before us. All we have to do is catch up."
—Danitha Capashen

name: D'Avenant Trapper
text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, tap target creature an opponent controls. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)
flavor:
"Go swiftly, clever arrow, and teach
The philosophy of stillness."
—D'Avenant verse

name: Dauntless Bodyguard
text:
As Dauntless Bodyguard enters the battlefield, choose another creature you control.
Sacrifice Dauntless Bodyguard: The chosen creature gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor: The Benalish aristocracy is hereditary, but the loyalty of its subjects is earned.

name: Dub
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has first strike, and is a Knight in addition to its other types. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: "Rise, knight of New Benalia."

name: Evra, Halcyon Witness
text:
Lifelink
{4}: Exchange your life total with Evra, Halcyon Witness's power.
flavor:
"Light from the Null Moon took form—a mirage made real, alone in grandeur, isolated in a world that once had been its own."
—*Fall of the Thran*

name: Healing Grace
text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn by a source of your choice. You gain 3 life.
flavor:
"Whatever faith you have in Serra, she has more in you."
—Lyra Dawnbringer

name: Invoke the Divine
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.
flavor:
"Let go of all that harms you. Cast your burdens into the darkness, and build for the faithful a house of light."
—*Song of All*, canto 1008

name: Knight of Grace
text:
First strike
Hexproof from black (This creature can't be the target of black spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Knight of Grace gets +1/+0 as long as any player controls a black permanent.
flavor: A light to pierce the shadows.

name: Knight of New Benalia
flavor: The mage-smiths of New Benalia have perfected the art of blending fine steel and enchanted glass into weapons that are both beautiful and deadly. Only elite knights are entrusted with these martial works of art.

name: Kwende, Pride of Femeref
text:
Double strike
Creatures you control with first strike have double strike.
flavor: Descendant of a vanished land, student of a forgotten general, and master of blades no smith could forge anew. He honors them all by living a life worthy of song.

name: Mesa Unicorn
text: Lifelink
flavor: The unicorns of Sursi are a manifestation of Serra's joy and compassion. They frolic and dance like children, offering blessings to anyone they encounter.

name: Pegasus Courser
text:
Flying
Whenever Pegasus Courser attacks, another target attacking creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: A pegasus chooses its rider, bearing the worthy into the clouds and tossing all others to the ground.

name: Seal Away
text:
Flash
When Seal Away enters the battlefield, exile target tapped creature an opponent controls until Seal Away leaves the battlefield.
flavor: An ancient nemesis rendered harmless long ago.

name: Sergeant-at-Arms
text:
Kicker {2}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W} as you cast this spell.)
When Sergeant-at-Arms enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
flavor: Knights get the glory. Soldiers get things done.

name: Serra Disciple
text:
Flying, first strike
Whenever you cast a historic spell, Serra Disciple gets +1/+1 until end of turn. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)
flavor: Theologians now believe the Ancestor was another divine form of Serra.

name: Tragic Poet
text: {T}, Sacrifice Tragic Poet: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "In a healing world I write—I, who will never be healed. Let my last gift be one of memory: from a thousand lost thoughts, choose one, and remember my name."

name: Academy Journeymage
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control a Wizard.
When Academy Journeymage enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.
flavor: "We don't choose who comes here. We choose how long they stay."

name: Arcane Flight
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying.
flavor: The Tolarian Academies are known for their magical research, powerful sorcerers, and accidental destruction of ecosystems.

name: Befuddle
text:
Target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"The trick to talking sense into Keldons is getting them to hold still. I learned that from Radha."
—Jhoira

name: Cold-Water Snapper
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: For generations, the inhabitants of Orvada have hungered for turtle soup. For generations, the turtles have frustrated their ambitions.

name: Deep Freeze
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has base power and toughness 0/4, has defender, loses all other abilities, and is a blue Wall in addition to its other colors and types.
flavor: For cryomancers, studying the Ice Age isn't just an academic exercise.

name: Diligent Excavator
text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, target player mills two cards. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)
flavor: Archaeologists don't just dig in the dirt. They excavate time, scraping off the years grain by grain.

name: Homarid Explorer
text: When Homarid Explorer enters the battlefield, target player mills four cards.
flavor:
"Homarids spread northward from Sarpadia as the climate cooled, raiding coastal settlements for supplies."
—*Time of Ice*

name: In Bolas's Clutches
text:
Enchant permanent
You control enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent is legendary.
flavor:
"Your contract is in default. You belong to me now. Serve, or die."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Karn's Temporal Sundering
text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Target player takes an extra turn after this one. Return up to one target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Exile Karn's Temporal Sundering.
flavor: Centuries ago, a quest to harness time became a spiral into chaos.

name: Merfolk Trickster
text:
Flash
When Merfolk Trickster enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. It loses all abilities until end of turn.
flavor: Saved from destruction by one planeswalker's sacrifice, the Eliterate colony forswore the taking of life.

name: Naban, Dean of Iteration
text: If a Wizard entering the battlefield under your control causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.
flavor: "Perfect. Now do it again."

name: Opt
text:
Scry 1.
Draw a card.
flavor: The crystal pulsed with the power of Teferi's planeswalker spark. Had Jhoira given him a blessing or a curse?

name: Rescue
text: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: With just a few seconds to escape, Deryan saved Hurkyl's editions on restoring physical objects from ash.

name: Tempest Djinn
text:
Flying
Tempest Djinn gets +1/+0 for each basic Island you control.
flavor: The first to arrive on Dominaria from their distant home, the marids are the oldest tribe of djinn and the most respected by storm and sea.

name: Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive
text: Creatures you control with power or toughness 1 or less can't be blocked.
flavor: "My ancestor Toshiro used to say, 'Life is a series of choices between bad and worse.' I'm a master of making great bad choices."

name: Tolarian Scholar
flavor: The Tolarian Academies embrace a tradition of study and research while discouraging the kinds of experiments that ruined the original island of Tolaria.

name: Unwind
text: Counter target noncreature spell. Untap up to three lands.
flavor:
"A problem is only a problem if you don't have the tools to correct it."
—Jhoira

name: Vodalian Arcanist
text: {T}: Add {C}. Spend this mana only to cast an instant or sorcery spell.
flavor: The Vodalian Empire tends to be insular. The scholarly Volshe caste are the exception, using education as an antidote to xenophobia.

name: Weight of Memory
text: Draw three cards. Target player mills three cards.
flavor: In lives that have stretched for centuries, there are bound to be a few awkward silences.

name: Wizard's Retort
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control a Wizard.
Counter target spell.
flavor:
"The second mage learned to dissipate blasts of lightning. Threat and response: thus did the study of magic progress."
—Naban, dean of iteration

name: Zahid, Djinn of the Lamp
text:
You may pay {3}{U} and tap an untapped artifact you control rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Flying
flavor: "I do as I please, little mortal. Do go on about your wishes, though—they amuse me to no end."

name: Blessing of Belzenlok
text: Target creature gets +2/+1 until end of turn. If it's legendary, it also gains lifelink until end of turn.
flavor:
"My heart is not mine, it is Belzenlok's. All hearts are his, and all blood."
—"Rite of Belzenlok"

name: Cabal Evangel
flavor: "All hail the Demonlord Belzenlok, Evincar of the Stronghold, Scion of Darkness, Doom of Fools, Lord of the Wastes, Master of the Ebon Hand, Eternal Patriarch of the Cabal . . ."

name: Cabal Paladin
text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, Cabal Paladin deals 2 damage to each opponent. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)
flavor:
"The Demonlord has ruled every age. Every ruin, myth, and nightmare proves his power."
—"Rite of Belzenlok"

name: Caligo Skin-Witch
text:
Kicker {3}{B} (You may pay an additional {3}{B} as you cast this spell.)
When Caligo Skin-Witch enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, each opponent discards two cards.
flavor: "Take their faces. The lips of these unbelievers may yet honor the Demonlord."

name: Dark Bargain
text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard. Dark Bargain deals 2 damage to you.
flavor: "I have pustules of the great Ratadrabik, very cheap. No? Surely you'll want a tincture of Nevinyrral's pulverized remains. Genuine!"

name: Deathbloom Thallid
text: When Deathbloom Thallid dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
flavor:
"Nature is not always gentle or kind, but all life begets life."
—Marwyn of Llanowar

name: Demonic Vigor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to its owner's hand.
flavor: In the Cabal, death is just another mark of devotion.

name: Dread Shade
text: {B}: Dread Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The forest surrounding the Vess estate became the Caligo Morass, a vast bog stalked by horrors too terrible to name."
—"The Fall of the House of Vess"

name: Drudge Sentinel
text: {3}: Tap Drudge Sentinel. It gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
flavor: The Cabal assured the Seven Houses that hostages receive all the food and rest they require.

name: Eviscerate
text: Destroy target creature.
flavor:
"Fear the dark if you must, but don't mistake sunlight for safety."
—Josu Vess

name: Feral Abomination
text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor:
"Urborg used to be lovely—scenic volcanoes, respectable lich lords. Since the Cabal came with their nightmares and thrulls, it's all gone to the worms."
—Mister Lostspoons, Skulltown gossip

name: Final Parting
text: Search your library for two cards. Put one into your hand and the other into your graveyard. Then shuffle.
flavor:
"Sleep now, brother. That is the one gift I can give you."
—Liliana Vess

name: Fungal Infection
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
flavor: To thallids, the whole world is just a pile of mulch to grow saprolings in.

name: Knight of Malice
text:
First strike
Hexproof from white (This creature can't be the target of white spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Knight of Malice gets +1/+0 as long as any player controls a white permanent.
flavor: A shadow to swallow the light.

name: Lingering Phantom
text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, you may pay {B}. If you do, return Lingering Phantom from your graveyard to your hand. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)
flavor:
"True power never dies, but lies awake, waiting for its name to be spoken."
—*The Eldest Reborn*

name: Rat Colony
text:
Rat Colony gets +1/+0 for each other Rat you control.
A deck can have any number of cards named Rat Colony.
flavor: Wreckage from the Phyrexian Invasion provided the rats with a seemingly unlimited number of breeding grounds.

name: Settle the Score
text: Exile target creature. Put two loyalty counters on a planeswalker you control.
flavor:
"You bound me with a contract only your death could end—and you thought me the fool?"
—Liliana Vess

name: Soul Salvage
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: The first mistake the Grimnant knights made was bullying the owner of an Urborg corpse shop. Their second mistake was dying.

name: Thallid Omnivore
text: {1}, Sacrifice another creature: Thallid Omnivore gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If a Saproling was sacrificed this way, you gain 2 life.
flavor: Thelon of Havenwood created thallids as a food source in times of darkness. Thallids did the same with saprolings.

name: Thallid Soothsayer
text: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
flavor: Some of the thallids that escaped into the fens of Urborg began emulating the Cabal's bloodsoaked rituals in their own peculiar way.

name: Urgoros, the Empty One
text:
Flying
Whenever Urgoros, the Empty One deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card at random. If the player can't, you draw a card.
flavor: As the phantom flies overhead, the city of Vhelnish screams in silence.

name: Whisper, Blood Liturgist
text: {T}, Sacrifice two creatures: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "Look how they beg for the knife! The Demonlord has trained them well."

name: Windgrace Acolyte
text:
Flying
When Windgrace Acolyte enters the battlefield, mill three cards and you gain 3 life.
flavor: Acolytes of the lost Lord Windgrace fight to keep Urborg relics out of Cabal hands.

name: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg
flavor: When Belzenlok's lieutenant Yar-Kul grew too ambitious, the Demonlord transformed him into a maggot. The frog that ate the maggot grew and grew, until a ravenous spirit burst from its body.

name: Yawgmoth's Vile Offering
text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Put up to one target creature or planeswalker card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Destroy up to one target creature or planeswalker. Exile Yawgmoth's Vile Offering.
flavor: Centuries ago, a mad god offered a simple trade.

name: Bloodstone Goblin
text: Whenever you cast a spell, if that spell was kicked, Bloodstone Goblin gets +1/+1 and gains menace until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: The stone whispers tales of darkness and fire. She replies, "Tell me more."

name: Fervent Strike
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike and haste until end of turn.
flavor:
"The flame paints a bright wheel on the sky, then shifts into a stabbing spark. The enemy falls; the smoke of victory rises."
—"Legends of the Firedancer"

name: Fiery Intervention
text:
Choose one —
• Fiery Intervention deals 5 damage to target creature.
• Destroy target artifact.
flavor: Burning something is easy. Choosing a target can be more difficult.

name: Firefist Adept
text: When Firefist Adept enters the battlefield, it deals X damage to target creature an opponent controls, where X is the number of Wizards you control.
flavor: The versatile "fiery gauntlet" is among the first spells young Ghitu mages learn.

name: Frenzied Rage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor:
"The heat in our hearts sometimes rises to the surface."
—Valduk, keeper of the Flame

name: Ghitu Chronicler
text:
Kicker {3}{R} (You may pay an additional {3}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Ghitu Chronicler enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "What fire forged, fire remembers."

name: Ghitu Journeymage
text: When Ghitu Journeymage enters the battlefield, if you control another Wizard, Ghitu Journeymage deals 2 damage to each opponent.
flavor: The Ghitu of Shiv are as fierce and uncompromising as their volcanic home.

name: Ghitu Lavarunner
text: As long as there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, Ghitu Lavarunner gets +1/+0 and has haste.
flavor: Tolarians teach the theory of pyromancy. The Ghitu prefer applied research.

name: Goblin Chainwhirler
text:
First strike
When Goblin Chainwhirler enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each opponent and each creature and planeswalker they control.
flavor: "The trick is, once you get moving, don't stop!"

name: Keldon Raider
text: When Keldon Raider enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
flavor: Keldon raiders' spoils are limited to what their colos can carry. No matter the value, the rest goes up in smoke.

name: Keldon Warcaller
text: Whenever Keldon Warcaller attacks, put a lore counter on target Saga you control.
flavor:
"The Mountain gave the Flame to Kradak to light the furnaces of his people's hearts. The wanderers became Keldons, and he the first warlord."
—"The Flame of Keld"

name: Radiating Lightning
text: Radiating Lightning deals 3 damage to target player and 1 damage to each creature that player controls.
flavor: As the Cabal legions pushed into Shiv, they learned not to stand so close together.

name: Rampaging Cyclops
text: Rampaging Cyclops gets -2/-0 as long as two or more creatures are blocking it.
flavor: Keldon warriors take advantage of the cyclops's inability to focus on more than one thing at a time.

name: Run Amok
text: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: Keld faced an apocalypse to fulfill a dire prophecy. Now Keldons have nothing left to believe in except themselves.

name: Seismic Shift
text: Destroy target land. Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
flavor:
"Shiv is a restless land. It heaves ash, bleeds lava, and scabs over in black obsidian."
—*The First Eruption*

name: Shivan Fire
text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Shivan Fire deals 2 damage to target creature. If this spell was kicked, it deals 4 damage instead.
flavor: Sometimes Shivan dragons toy with their food. Other times they just cook it.

name: Skizzik
text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, if Skizzik wasn't kicked, sacrifice it.
flavor: It skitters across Shiv, each tendril hitting the ground with a sharp snap.

name: Squee, the Immortal
text: You may cast Squee, the Immortal from your graveyard or from exile.
flavor: "You gotta be pretty smart to live long as me, but not being able to die helps."

name: Two-Headed Giant
text: Whenever Two-Headed Giant attacks, flip two coins. If both coins come up heads, Two-Headed Giant gains double strike until end of turn. If both coins come up tails, Two-Headed Giant gains menace until end of turn.
flavor: He watches the pass in both directions, and all must pay his toll.

name: Warcry Phoenix
text:
Flying, haste
Whenever you attack with three or more creatures, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, return Warcry Phoenix from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped and attacking.
flavor: War begins with one red ember.

name: Warlord's Fury
text:
Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"The old ways were for a winter world. We do what's best for us, not for the past. We are Keldons!"
—Grand Warlord Radha

name: Wizard's Lightning
text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if you control a Wizard.
Wizard's Lightning deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor:
"The study of magic began when the first mage taught herself to throw lightning."
—Naban, dean of iteration

name: Adventurous Impulse
text: Look at the top three cards of your library. You may reveal a creature or land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor: Every odyssey begins with a single step.

name: Arbor Armament
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. That creature gains reach until end of turn.
flavor:
"Llanowar's boughs are ever ready
To unleash an autumn of steel leaves."
—"Song of Freyalise"

name: Baloth Gorger
text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
If Baloth Gorger was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor: A baloth only cares about the many things it eats and the few things that eat it.

name: Broken Bond
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: "I can't bear to see another plane broken before I make my own home whole. I'm sorry, but my watch is over."

name: Corrosive Ooze
text: Whenever Corrosive Ooze blocks or becomes blocked by an equipped creature, destroy all Equipment attached to that creature at end of combat.
flavor: Nothing tastes finer to an ooze than a priceless family heirloom.

name: Elfhame Druid
text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Add {G}{G}. Spend this mana only to cast kicked spells.
flavor: The bond between Llanowar elves and their kavu empowers both.

name: Fungal Plots
text:
{1}{G}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice two Saprolings: You gain 2 life and draw a card.
flavor: Thallids nurture saprolings, entertain them, and eat them.

name: Gaea's Protector
text: Gaea's Protector must be blocked if able.
flavor: Fallen Phyrexians were transmuted into elementals by Gaea long ago, but Yavimaya's other inhabitants still regard them with unease.

name: Kamahl's Druidic Vow
text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Look at the top X cards of your library. You may put any number of land and/or legendary permanent cards with mana value X or less from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest into your graveyard.
flavor: Centuries ago, a barbarian laid his rage to rest.

name: Krosan Druid
text:
Kicker {4}{G} (You may pay an additional {4}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Krosan Druid enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, you gain 10 life.
flavor: "Druids endure disaster as seeds endure winter. Now Krosa blooms once more."

name: Llanowar Envoy
text: {1}{G}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor:
"Cherish this world in honor of the martyrs who saved it. We too must be prepared to give our lives."
—*The Mending of Dominaria*

name: Llanowar Scout
text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: Llanowar elfhames occupy different heights within the great forest. Elves of the Loridalh and Kelfae hames can see neither earth nor sky.

name: Mammoth Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: Most spiders of Llanowar disdain elvish alliances. No elf has as many beautiful eyes or as many strong arms.

name: Marwyn, the Nurturer
text:
Whenever another Elf enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Marwyn, the Nurturer.
{T}: Add an amount of {G} equal to Marwyn's power.
flavor: Midwife to mothers and leader to all.

name: Nature's Spiral
text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"As Argoth's last defenders fell to Urza's juggernauts, Titania said, 'Nature cannot be destroyed, only changed.'"
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Pierce the Sky
text: Pierce the Sky deals 7 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor: Llanowar elves conceal their ballistae in the upper canopy of the forest, ready to clear the skies of any intruder.

name: Primordial Wurm
flavor:
"You can hear its tail thrashing from a mile away. Keep in mind that its jaws may already be half a mile closer."
—Jenson Carthalion, Yavimaya exile

name: Saproling Migration
text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Create two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens. If this spell was kicked, create four of those tokens instead.
flavor: Thallids herd saprolings from place to place in search of detritus to feed them.

name: Spore Swarm
text: Create three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
flavor: As the irrepressible power of a dormant Multani courses through Yavimaya, the forest passes judgment on travelers and natives alike. Only the fungus prospers.

name: Sporecrown Thallid
text: Each other creature you control that's a Fungus or Saproling gets +1/+1.
flavor:
"The identifying ornamental growths of alpha thallids may be hereditary, or catalyzed by some chemical signal."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Steel Leaf Champion
text: Steel Leaf Champion can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
flavor: One eye open to see the truth of the world. One eye covered to gaze at the goddess within.

name: Sylvan Awakening
text: Until your next turn, all lands you control become 2/2 Elemental creatures with reach, indestructible, and haste. They're still lands.
flavor:
"Yavimaya is aware, but not always awake. You will know the difference when you see it."
—Karn

name: Territorial Allosaurus
text:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Territorial Allosaurus enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, it fights another target creature.
flavor: A living remnant of the Ice Age.

name: Yavimaya Sapherd
text: When Yavimaya Sapherd enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
flavor:
"When their community grows cluttered, thallids begin a traditional bobbing dance, then trek out in all directions."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Cabal Stronghold
text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}, {T}: Add {B} for each basic Swamp you control.
flavor: The seat of Belzenlok's power, the Stronghold serves as the gathering place for the Cabal as their dark influence spreads from Urborg.

name: Temporal Machinations
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. If you control an artifact, draw a card.
flavor: The Cabal soldier blinked and found day had become night, he had a face full of thistle seeds, and the old man was nowhere to be seen.

name: Karplusan Hound
text: Whenever Karplusan Hound attacks, if you control a Chandra planeswalker, this creature deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor:
"Don't worry, they don't bite. They much prefer setting people on fire."
—Jaya Ballard, to Chandra

name: Pyromantic Pilgrim
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: "From the volcanoes of Shiv to the Balduvian steppes, I have sought a worthy teacher. At last, I have found one."

name: Mind Control
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
flavor:
"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren

name: Crowd of Cinders
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Crowd of Cinders's power and toughness are each equal to the number of black permanents you control.
flavor: They envy the life-giving heat so much that they tear it from those who still possess it.

name: Mind Shatter
text: Target player discards X cards at random.
flavor: Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.

name: Moonglove Winnower
text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor: Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.

name: Cinder Pyromancer
text:
{T}: Cinder Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Whenever you cast a red spell, you may untap Cinder Pyromancer.
flavor: "If the whole world burns, I'll never grow cold."

name: Greenweaver Druid
text: {T}: Add {G}{G}.
flavor: The other tribes call them fanatics, but none deny that the Mul Daya elves have an iron-strong bond to some force greater than themselves.

name: Howl of the Night Pack
text: Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token for each Forest you control.
flavor: The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.

name: Runeclaw Bear
flavor: Bears aren't always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.

name: Bogardan Hellkite
text:
Flash
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
flavor: Cleansing the world, one breath at a time.

name: Dragonstorm
text:
Search your library for a Dragon permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
flavor: Dragons come not in packs or in herds but in storms.

name: Ebon Dragon
text:
Flying
When Ebon Dragon enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent discard a card.
flavor:
"The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth."
—*Troilus and Cressida*, William Shakespeare

name: Kokusho, the Evening Star
text:
Flying
When Kokusho, the Evening Star dies, each opponent loses 5 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
flavor: The fall of the evening star never heralds a gentle dawn.

name: Exorcist
text: {1}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black creature.
flavor: Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.

name: Festival
text:
Cast this spell only during an opponent's upkeep.
Creatures can't attack this turn.
flavor: Only after the townsfolk had drawn us into their merry celebration did we discover that their holiday rituals held a deeper purpose.

name: Holy Light
text: Nonwhite creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired." —*The Book of Tal*

name: Knights of Thorn
text: Protection from red; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: "With a great cry, the Goblin host broke and ran as the first wave of Knights penetrated its ranks." —Tivadar of Thorn, *History of the Goblin Wars*

name: Martyr's Cry
text: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.
flavor: "It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge." —Vervamon the Elder

name: Miracle Worker
text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature you control.
flavor:
"Those blessed hands could bring surcease to even the most tainted soul."
—Sister Betje, *Miracles of the Saints*

name: Squire
flavor:
"Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse.
Of his stature he was of even lengthe,
And wonderly deliver, and greete of strengthe."
—Geoffrey Chaucer, *The Canterbury Tales*

name: Amnesia
text: Target player reveals their hand and discards all nonland cards.
flavor: "When one has witnessed the unspeakable, 'tis sometimes better to forget." —Vervamon the Elder

name: Curse Artifact
text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Curse Artifact deals 2 damage to that player unless they sacrifice that artifact.
flavor: Voska feared the artifact had come too easily.

name: Eater of the Dead
text: {0}: If Eater of the Dead is tapped, exile target creature card from a graveyard and untap Eater of the Dead.
flavor: Even the putrid muscles of the dead can provide strength to those loathsome enough to consume them.

name: Grave Robbers
text: {B}, {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard. You gain 2 life.
flavor:
"If you don't have your health, you don't have anything."
—Proverb

name: Inquisition
text: Target player reveals their hand. Inquisition deals damage to that player equal to the number of white cards in their hand.
flavor: Many of those entrusted to Primata Delphine's care tended to express themselves with screams.

name: Worms of the Earth
text:
Players can't play lands.
Lands can't enter the battlefield.
At the beginning of each upkeep, any player may sacrifice two lands or have Worms of the Earth deal 5 damage to that player. If a player does either, destroy Worms of the Earth.
flavor: The ground collapsed, leaving nothing but the great Worms' mucous residues.

name: Goblin Caves
text:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +0/+2.
flavor: The stench of countless generations of unspeakable activities was enough to loosen both our footing and our stomachs.

name: Orc General
text: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph." —Malga Phlegmtooth

name: Hidden Path
text: Green creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor:
"Where moments before we were lost beyond hope, the strange, floating lights showed us the way and restored our morale."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Lurker
text: Lurker can't be the target of spells unless it attacked or blocked this turn.
flavor:
"Each night we felt it watching us from the darkness beyond our fire. We only had one pack horse left."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, *Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Niall Silvain
text: {G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.
flavor: This is his domain, and while you remain here you must value all life as you value your own.

name: People of the Woods
text: People of the Woods's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
flavor:
"Their rain of arrows left only myself alive, cowering within a tree hollow. They did not even come out to loot the bodies."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Savaen Elves
text: {G}{G}, {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a land.
flavor: "Purity of magic can only come from purity of the land. How can a meal nourish if the ingredients are spoiled?" —Sidaine of Savaen

name: Whippoorwill
text: {G}{G}, {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn. Damage that would be dealt to that creature this turn can't be prevented or dealt instead to another permanent or player. When the creature dies this turn, exile the creature.
flavor: If the Whippoorwill remains silent, the soul has not reached its reward.

name: Coal Golem
text: {3}, Sacrifice Coal Golem: Add {R}{R}{R}.
flavor: "Three such creatures stood burning at the crest of the hill. Only seconds later, the Fireball struck our front line." —Lydia, Countess Brellis

name: Auriok Glaivemaster
text: As long as Auriok Glaivemaster is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
flavor: "Give me a bit of steel and I'll deliver it into the hearts of my enemies."

name: Echoing Calm
text: Destroy target enchantment and all other enchantments with the same name as that enchantment.
flavor: A single light unleashes a hail of cleansing.

name: Hallow
text: Prevent all damage target spell would deal this turn. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
flavor: "Bend with the storm, then reply in kind."

name: Leonin Battlemage
text:
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Leonin Battlemage.
flavor: The strongest of the pride are measured not by the steel in their hands but by the steel in their souls.

name: Metal Fatigue
text: Tap all artifacts.
flavor: The Auriok have fought the metal hordes for so long now that knowing how to cripple them has become an instinct.

name: Pteron Ghost
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Pteron Ghost: Regenerate target artifact.
flavor: Defending to the death isn't always enough.

name: Pulse of the Fields
text: You gain 4 life. Then if an opponent has more life than you, return Pulse of the Fields to its owner's hand.
flavor: Before religion or civilization, there was order.

name: Purge
text: Destroy target artifact creature or black creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: For the first and last time, the horrific creature experienced terror.

name: Ritual of Restoration
text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Leonin raising ceremonies take place at the white sun's dawn, the rebirth of artifacts mirroring the birth of a new day.

name: Soulscour
text: Destroy all nonartifact permanents.
flavor:
"I have seen the end of times, a future in which all our kind are torn from this world."
—Ushanti, leonin shaman

name: Steelshaper Apprentice
text: {W}, {T}, Return Steelshaper Apprentice to its owner's hand: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Theirs is a craft brought about by necessity, now raised to the level of art.

name: Turn the Tables
text: All combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn is dealt to target attacking creature instead.
flavor: "Your arrogance is my best weapon."

name: Carry Away
text:
Enchant Equipment
When Carry Away enters the battlefield, unattach enchanted Equipment.
You control enchanted Equipment.
flavor: Stealing goblin weapons would be easier if the goblins were smart enough to let go.

name: Hoverguard Observer
text:
Flying
Hoverguard Observer can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: It could be made to run silently, but its low hum reminds the Neurok that they are always watched.

name: Last Word
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Counter target spell.
flavor: "Someday, someone will best me. But it won't be today, and it won't be you."

name: Machinate
text: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of artifacts you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor: As long as there are questions to be asked, the vedalken will ask them.

name: Magnetic Flux
text: Artifact creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.
flavor: After the researcher's astonishing success, his assistants spent six hours finding a way to return the specimens safely to the ground.

name: Neurok Prodigy
text:
Flying
Discard an artifact card: Return Neurok Prodigy to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Why should I be bound by rules when I can see so far beyond them?"

name: Pulse of the Grid
text: Draw two cards, then discard a card. Then if an opponent has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Grid to its owner's hand.
flavor: Before labs or lectures, there was insight.

name: Retract
text: Return all artifacts you control to their owner's hand.
flavor:
"Secrets are meant to remain secret."
—Memnarch

name: Synod Artificer
text:
{X}, {T}: Tap X target noncreature artifacts.
{X}, {T}: Untap X target noncreature artifacts.
flavor: Memnarch shared a touch of his power with the vedalken in return for their service. It is a debt he intends to collect.

name: Vex
text: Counter target spell. That spell's controller may draw a card.
flavor:
"The druids would be better off if they spent more time in the lab and less time watching trees grow."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Burden of Greed
text: Target player loses 1 life for each tapped artifact they control.
flavor:
"The one who dies with the most toys is still dead."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Chittering Rats
text: When Chittering Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent puts a card from their hand on top of their library.
flavor: Bottom feeders sometimes rise to the top.

name: Death Cloud
text: Each player loses X life, discards X cards, sacrifices X creatures, then sacrifices X lands.
flavor: The swarm's million wings stir the foulest of breezes.

name: Echoing Decay
text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: A single fear unleashes a torrent of nightmares.

name: Grimclaw Bats
text:
Flying
{B}, Pay 1 life: Grimclaw Bats gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Even on a world of metal, there are those who thirst for blood.

name: Hunger of the Nim
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each artifact you control.
flavor: Their pain is so great, they can't help but share it with others.

name: Mephitic Ooze
text:
Mephitic Ooze gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Whenever Mephitic Ooze deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. The creature can't be regenerated.
flavor: In Mephidross, refuse doesn't last long—it's all scavenged, reanimated, or consumed.

name: Murderous Spoils
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain control of all Equipment that were attached to it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor: Scavengers are always the first to pay their respects.

name: Nim Abomination
text: At the beginning of your end step, if Nim Abomination is untapped, you lose 3 life.
flavor: It is one of the oldest nim, steeped so long in the Dross that it has lost all vestiges of humanity.

name: Pulse of the Dross
text: Target player reveals three cards from their hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card. Then if that player has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Dross to its owner's hand.
flavor: Before tyrants or torturers, there was evil.

name: Scavenging Scarab
text: Scavenging Scarab can't block.
flavor: The beetles feed not on the flesh of corpses but on the metal, grinding out the iron and steel to add to their own bulky shells.

name: Screams from Within
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
When enchanted creature dies, return Screams from Within from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: There's no escaping an enemy that lives inside your head.

name: Scrounge
text: Target opponent chooses an artifact card in their graveyard. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.
flavor: When leonin settlers abandon their homes to the nim, items of value are often left behind.

name: Barbed Lightning
text:
Choose one —
• Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature.
• Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
flavor: Every creature on Mirrodin is a lightning rod.

name: Crazed Goblin
text: Crazed Goblin attacks each combat if able.
flavor: Because fighting is easier than figuring out what else to do.

name: Drooling Ogre
text: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, that player gains control of Drooling Ogre. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor:
"Is it the stomping kind or the munching kind?"
—Slobad, goblin tinkerer

name: Echoing Ruin
text: Destroy target artifact and all other artifacts with the same name as that artifact.
flavor: A single misstep unleashes an avalanche of ruin.

name: Flamebreak
text: Flamebreak deals 3 damage to each creature without flying and each player. Creatures dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
flavor:
"Now I'm thirsty."
—Korva, Vulshok battlemaster

name: Goblin Archaeologist
text: {R}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target artifact and untap Goblin Archaeologist. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Goblin Archaeologist.
flavor: Always easily impressed, Durg was about to be blown away.

name: Inflame
text: Inflame deals 2 damage to each creature dealt damage this turn.
flavor: A Vulshok weapon strikes with the fire of the forge that made it.

name: Krark-Clan Stoker
text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Add {R}{R}.
flavor: Fallen enemies are fed to the scavengers. Fallen friends are thrown into the Great Furnace, their souls returned to the Great Mother.

name: Pulse of the Forge
text: Pulse of the Forge deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker. Then if that player or that planeswalker's controller has more life than you, return Pulse of the Forge to its owner's hand.
flavor: Before wars or weapons, there was anger.

name: Unforge
text: Destroy target Equipment. If that Equipment was attached to a creature, Unforge deals 2 damage to that creature.
flavor: Compared to the fire of the forge, the strength of steel is nothing.

name: Vulshok War Boar
text: When Vulshok War Boar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an artifact.
flavor: It must eat its weight in metal daily, or its furnacelike belly will consume itself for lack of fuel.

name: Fangren Firstborn
text: Whenever Fangren Firstborn attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on each attacking creature.
flavor: In the Tangle, bad is often followed by worse.

name: Nourish
text: You gain 6 life.
flavor: Gelfruit grows abundantly wherever Sylvok druids live, as if the Tangle knows that humans are not as hardy as the beasts or as nimble as the elves.

name: Oxidize
text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"Ashes to ashes, rust to rust."
—Viridian shaman

name: Pulse of the Tangle
text: Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token. Then if an opponent controls more creatures than you, return Pulse of the Tangle to its owner's hand.
flavor: Before predators or prey, there was life.

name: Rebuking Ceremony
text: Put two target artifacts on top of their owners' libraries.
flavor: From the Radix at the hub of the Tangle all the way out to the Edges of Forgetting, a Viridian elf's life is built around the temporary.

name: Roaring Slagwurm
text: Whenever Roaring Slagwurm attacks, tap all artifacts.
flavor: Wurms compete for nesting grounds near the Radix. The young who hatch closest have the best chance for survival.

name: Stand Together
text: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature and two +1/+1 counters on another target creature.
flavor: Strange times make for strange allies.

name: Tanglewalker
text: Each creature you control can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact land.
flavor: In bringing life to Mirrodin, Memnarch was more successful than he knew—for Mirrodin began to take on a life of its own.

name: Tel-Jilad Outrider
text: Protection from artifacts
flavor: "When the levelers come again, we shall be ready for them."

name: Tel-Jilad Wolf
text: Whenever Tel-Jilad Wolf becomes blocked by an artifact creature, Tel-Jilad Wolf gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: Thanks to the wolves, Tel-Jilad is the one area of Mirrodin the myr don't see often.

name: Viridian Acolyte
text: {1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor: "We have no sun to guide our dead, so I tend the prismatic flames of the spirit fires that show the souls their way. When I die, I hope there is one left to guide my spirit home."

name: Arashin Foremost
text:
Double strike
Whenever Arashin Foremost enters the battlefield or attacks, another target Warrior creature you control gains double strike until end of turn.
flavor: "I would gladly give my life if it would inspire my clan to victory."

name: Aven Tactician
text:
Flying
When Aven Tactician enters the battlefield, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: The aven are admired, for they are able to fly with the dragons.

name: Dragon Hunter
text:
Protection from Dragons
Dragon Hunter can block Dragons as though it had reach.
flavor: "Dromoka has taught me the secrets of her kind, that I might use them in her service."

name: Dragon's Eye Sentry
text: Defender, first strike
flavor: Even the humblest guard of Ojutai's strongholds ponders the puzzles of the Great Teacher's lessons.

name: Dromoka Captain
text:
First strike
Whenever Dromoka Captain attacks, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: "We fight not out of fear, but for honor."

name: Dromoka Dunecaster
text: {1}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature without flying.
flavor: "The dragonlords rule the tempests of the skies. Here in the wastes, the storms are mine to command."

name: Dromoka Warrior
flavor: Dromoka has regard for the humans who serve under her. In return for her protection, they obey with steadfast loyalty, acting as weapons for her and her scalelords against the other clans.

name: Echoes of the Kin Tree
text: {2}{W}: Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: Even after Anafenza was executed, many secretly maintained their beliefs in the old ways.

name: Enduring Victory
text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature. Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor:
"My dragonlord is immortal. Most dragons are not."
—Kadri, Dromoka warrior

name: Fate Forgotten
text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.
flavor: When Sarkhan saved Ugin in Tarkir's past, it changed Tarkir's future. The Sultai no longer exist, having been supplanted by the dragonlord Silumgar and his clan.

name: Graceblade Artisan
text: Graceblade Artisan gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.
flavor:
"Can you catch a snowflake on the edge of your blade? Her sword has snagged an entire blizzard."
—Zogye, Ojutai mystic

name: Herald of Dromoka
text:
Vigilance
Other Warrior creatures you control have vigilance.
flavor: The trumpeters of Arashin are ever alert in their watch over the Great Aerie.

name: Misthoof Kirin
text:
Flying, vigilance
Megamorph {1}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: It heralded Sarkhan's return to Tarkir's present.

name: Radiant Purge
text: Exile target multicolored creature or multicolored enchantment.
flavor: The Shifting Wastes are Dromoka's domain. She will not tolerate intruders.

name: Resupply
text:
You gain 6 life.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"If the scalelords are the brains of Dromoka's army, the supply caravans are its beating heart."
—Baihir, Dromoka mage

name: Sandcrafter Mage
text: When Sandcrafter Mage enters the battlefield, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: With heat, sand can form a delicate work of art; with pressure, an impenetrable bulwark.

name: Sandstorm Charger
text: Megamorph {4}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor:
"May our foes choke upon its horns!"
—Urdnan, Dromoka warrior

name: Secure the Wastes
text: Create X 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens.
flavor:
"The Shifting Wastes provide our clan eternal protection. It is our duty to return the favor."
—Kadri, Dromoka warrior

name: Silkwrap
text: When Silkwrap enters the battlefield, exile target creature with mana value 3 or less an opponent controls until Silkwrap leaves the battlefield. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)
flavor: Better scarves than scars.

name: Strongarm Monk
text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"His companions are wise to follow him, for his foes dare not stand in his way."
—Zhiada, Dirgur protector

name: Student of Ojutai
text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you gain 2 life.
flavor: "Human enlightenment is a firefly that sparks in the night. Dragon enlightenment is a beacon that disperses all darkness."

name: Surge of Righteousness
text: Destroy target black or red creature that's attacking or blocking. You gain 2 life.
flavor: Though she stood alone, she struck with the force of an army.

name: Territorial Roc
text: Flying
flavor:
"Such lesser creatures must be purged from the sky. What use do they have but to help channel the lightning of our mighty dragonlord?"
—Gvar Barzeel, Kolaghan warrior

name: Ancient Carp
flavor:
"Why eat now what could one day grow into a feast?"
—Ojutai, translated from Draconic

name: Contradict
text:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.
flavor: Those who question Ojutai may not like the answers they receive.

name: Dance of the Skywise
text: Until end of turn, target creature you control becomes a blue Dragon Illusion with base power and toughness 4/4, loses all abilities, and gains flying.
flavor: The Ojutai believe in the Great Wheel: those who best serve the dragonlord are destined to be reborn as dragons.

name: Elusive Spellfist
text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Elusive Spellfist gets +1/+0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
flavor:
"Learn to see an obstacle from a new perspective. Underneath, for example."
—Chanyi, Ojutai monk

name: Glint
text: Target creature you control gets +0/+3 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: Rakshasa waste no opportunity to display their wealth and power, even in the midst of a sorcerous duel.

name: Gudul Lurker
text:
Gudul Lurker can't be blocked.
Megamorph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: The small are mostly ignored by dragons.

name: Learn from the Past
text:
Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"I've been told my whole life that the great Ojutai holds all knowledge, but I wonder what our forebears knew."
—Narset

name: Mirror Mockery
text:
Enchant creature
