flavor: As Emrakul's influence radiated across Innistrad, evacuation from Kessig's remote villages became increasingly difficult.

name: Hamlet Captain
text: Whenever Hamlet Captain attacks or blocks, other Humans you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Bloodsuckers, howlers, monsters from the beyond . . . it doesn't much matter. I won't have to face them alone."

name: Kessig Prowler // Sinuous Predator
text: {4}{G}: Transform Kessig Prowler.
flavor: In the wake of Emrakul, some werewolves' human forms were lost forever.

name: Noose Constrictor
text:
Reach
Discard a card: Noose Constrictor gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"More rope may not be necessary."
—Kep, Lunarch inquisitor

name: Permeating Mass
text: Whenever Permeating Mass deals combat damage to a creature, that creature becomes a copy of Permeating Mass.
flavor: Woodland geists concluded that Emrakul would be unable to warp the denizens of the forest if the geists got there first.

name: Primal Druid
text: When Primal Druid dies, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: "The power of the woods is only ever borrowed."

name: Shrill Howler // Howling Chorus
text:
Creatures with power less than Shrill Howler's power can't block it.
{5}{G}: Transform Shrill Howler.
flavor:
"A werewolf's howl is terrifying, to be sure. But this . . . this was a chilling sound I somehow felt. I fear what will reply to it."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Somberwald Stag
text: When Somberwald Stag enters the battlefield, you may have it fight target creature you don't control.
flavor: Despite the reemergence of werewolves and the proliferation of Eldrazi, elk numbers in the Somberwald have remained steady.

name: Spirit of the Hunt
text:
Flash
When Spirit of the Hunt enters the battlefield, each other creature you control that's a Wolf or a Werewolf gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: The bonds of the pack transcend time and death.

name: Springsage Ritual
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.
flavor:
"Every evil destroyed is a strike against the enemy."
—Erold, Gatstaf springsage

name: Swift Spinner
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: Its web is woven so tightly that not even geists can avoid capture.

name: Tangleclaw Werewolf // Fibrous Entangler
text:
Tangleclaw Werewolf can block an additional creature each combat.
{6}{G}: Transform Tangleclaw Werewolf.
flavor:
"What has long, flesh-rending claws and enormous, bone-crushing teeth?"
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Ulvenwald Captive // Ulvenwald Abomination
text:
Defender
{T}: Add {G}.
{5}{G}{G}: Transform Ulvenwald Captive.
flavor:
"Even on a plane as dark as this one, nature will organize a defense against the unnatural."
—Nissa Revane

name: Ulvenwald Observer
text: Whenever a creature you control with toughness 4 or greater dies, draw a card.
flavor:
"I tell you, the trees were closing in! It's by the grace of the Heron alone that I made it out of the Ulvenwald!"
—Ricton, traveling merchant

name: Waxing Moon
text: Transform up to one target Werewolf you control. Creatures you control gain trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"Show them what it means to be the source of nightmares!"
—Ulrich, Krallenhorde alpha

name: Woodcutter's Grit
text: Target creature you control gets +3/+3 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: The magic used by Kessigers is known for its practical applications.

name: Woodland Patrol
text: Vigilance
flavor: Each had seen friends and family taken by the corruption, so each carried an axe at the other's request.

name: Archon of Justice
text:
Flying
When Archon of Justice dies, exile target permanent.
flavor: In dark times, Truth bears a blade.

name: Ballynock Trapper
text:
{T}: Tap target creature.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you may untap Ballynock Trapper.
flavor: No matter how large or small, fierce or fleeting, the kithkin have a trap for it.

name: Cenn's Enlistment
text:
Create two 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
flavor: The more the scarier.

name: Endure
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and permanents you control this turn.
flavor: The Aurora had lessened the kithkins' kindness, deepened their paranoia, and dulled their sense of pain.

name: Kithkin Zealot
text: When Kithkin Zealot enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each black and/or red permanent target opponent controls.
flavor: The more his flock fears, the more power he wields.

name: Light from Within
text: Chroma — Each creature you control gets +1/+1 for each white mana symbol in its mana cost.
flavor:
"Muscle does not make one strong. It only masks the soul's light. True strength lies in purity of purpose."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer

name: Loyal Gyrfalcon
text:
Defender, flying
Whenever you cast a white spell, Loyal Gyrfalcon loses defender until end of turn.
flavor: It's tethered not to keep it from fleeing but to keep it from eating everything in sight.

name: Patrol Signaler
text: {1}{W}, {Q}: Create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: Many a keen-eared bogle has run afoul of a clever and silently orchestrated kithkin ambush.

name: Springjack Shepherd
text: Chroma — When Springjack Shepherd enters the battlefield, create a 0/1 white Goat creature token for each white mana symbol in the mana costs of permanents you control.
flavor: "Better for a doun to lose its cenn than its springjacks."

name: Banishing Knack
text: Until end of turn, target creature gains "{T}: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand."
flavor: Suddenly he realized that everything was connected by invisible strings, strings that could be pulled—or cut.

name: Dream Thief
text:
Flying
When Dream Thief enters the battlefield, draw a card if you've cast another blue spell this turn.
flavor: Awylla's salvaged dreams would finally be put to good use.

name: Idle Thoughts
text: {2}: Draw a card if you have no cards in hand.
flavor: Inspiration strikes the uncluttered mind.

name: Indigo Faerie
text:
Flying
{U}: Target permanent becomes blue in addition to its other colors until end of turn.
flavor: "You should see your face right now."

name: Inundate
text: Return all nonblue creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor: "For years, the landfolk have emptied their refuse into the waters. It's time to return the favor."

name: Merrow Levitator
text:
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, you may untap Merrow Levitator.
flavor: He fancies himself a master thief, claiming to "steal the ground" from his victims.

name: Razorfin Abolisher
text: {1}{U}, {T}: Return target creature with a counter on it to its owner's hand.
flavor: Once you have been marked by the merrow, you are not long for their waters.

name: Wilderness Hypnotist
text: {T}: Target red or green creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"I felt as if I were moving in brackish water, as if I were drowning, even though I knew I stood on dry land."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine

name: Ashling, the Extinguisher
text: Whenever Ashling, the Extinguisher deals combat damage to a player, choose target creature that player controls. The player sacrifices that creature.
flavor: The Aurora had transformed her into a relentless force of destruction.

name: Crumbling Ashes
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy target creature with a -1/-1 counter on it.
flavor:
"I was there to watch my brothers' quenching. I drew the slightest warmth from their dying rage."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Lingering Tormentor
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
flavor: The bogeyman doesn't disappear when you close your eyes.

name: Merrow Bonegnawer
text:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from their graveyard.
Whenever you cast a black spell, you may untap Merrow Bonegnawer.
flavor: Banished to the Dark Meanders for hideous crimes, some merrows find a taste for the darkness . . . and the dead.

name: Raven's Crime
text:
Target player discards a card.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
flavor: It plucks away memories like choice bits of carrion.

name: Smoldering Butcher
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: A cinder's axe bears no marks from parrying a foe's blade.

name: Soul Reap
text: Destroy target nongreen creature. Its controller loses 3 life if you've cast another black spell this turn.
flavor: Their thoughtweft carried Darial's last thoughts back to his doun. They sorely wished it had not.

name: Soul Snuffers
text: When Soul Snuffers enters the battlefield, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature.
flavor: They once sought to unite with the flame of transcendence. Now they seek only to extinguish the lights of others.

name: Syphon Life
text:
Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
flavor: Leeches never tire of feeding.

name: Talara's Bane
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a green or white creature card from it. You gain life equal to that creature card's toughness, then that player discards that card.
flavor:
"Your thoughts betray you."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Umbra Stalker
text: Chroma — Umbra Stalker's power and toughness are each equal to the number of black mana symbols in the mana costs of cards in your graveyard.
flavor: Don't venture into the darkness, lest it decide not to let you leave.

name: Chaotic Backlash
text: Chaotic Backlash deals damage to target player equal to twice the number of white and/or blue permanents they control.
flavor: The concept of thoughtweft fascinates the Nighthearth cult. Imagine, bringing agony to an entire people by torturing just one.

name: Fiery Bombardment
text: Chroma — {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Fiery Bombardment deals damage to any target equal to the number of red mana symbols in the sacrificed creature's mana cost.
flavor: It kills two beasts with one thrown.

name: Hatchet Bully
text: {2}{R}, {T}, Put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control: Hatchet Bully deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: "It's not much for eating, but I think we can find somethin' to do with it."

name: Hateflayer
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{2}{R}, {Q}: Hateflayer deals damage equal to its power to any target. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
flavor: It has no safe side.

name: Hotheaded Giant
text:
Haste
Hotheaded Giant enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it unless you've cast another red spell this turn.
flavor: As he races the moon each night, he draws a glowing equator across the world.

name: Outrage Shaman
text: Chroma — When Outrage Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature equal to the number of red mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.
flavor: A boggart's mind is a tinderbox of volatile thoughts, hungry for a spark.

name: Puncture Blast
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Puncture Blast deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor: Gnarltrunk didn't remember having quite that many knotholes.

name: Stigma Lasher
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever Stigma Lasher deals damage to a player, that player can't gain life for the rest of the game.
flavor: The Extinguisher's curse lasted long after her departure.

name: Unwilling Recruit
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +X/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: Frorn didn't want to be kept, but he didn't want to be thrown back either.

name: Duskdale Wurm
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor:
"Last time, it tore up the Wilt-Leaf, turned Mistmeadow into a mudhole, and made the river jump its banks. On the bright side, we were eating venison for weeks."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer

name: Marshdrinker Giant
text: When Marshdrinker Giant enters the battlefield, destroy target Island or Swamp an opponent controls.
flavor: When giants rise from their long slumbers, they rarely remember how fragile the waking world can be.

name: Monstrify
text:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
flavor: Gackt came to regret keeping his pet toads on his head.

name: Phosphorescent Feast
text: Chroma — Reveal any number of cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each green mana symbol in those cards' mana costs.
flavor: The boggarts gorged themselves until their bellies glowed.

name: Primalcrux
text:
Trample
Chroma — Primalcrux's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.
flavor: When nature is backed into a corner, just like its children, it lashes out.

name: Savage Conception
text:
Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
flavor: Some beasts are born not of a mother, but of magic.

name: Tilling Treefolk
text: When Tilling Treefolk enters the battlefield, you may return up to two target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: He digs his roots into barren ground, searching for old seeds that never had the chance to sprout.

name: Twinblade Slasher
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{1}{G}: Twinblade Slasher gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: Righteous anger hones a humble soul.

name: Cataclysm
text: Each player chooses from among the permanents they control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.
flavor: The *Weatherlight* dragged the *Predator* behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.

name: Convalescence
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 10 or less life, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Selenia had hurt Mirri terribly, but injuries of the flesh could be treated. The wounds she had torn in Crovax's soul would never close.

name: Exalted Dragon
text:
Flying
Exalted Dragon can't attack unless you sacrifice a land. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)
flavor: If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.

name: Reconnaissance
text: {0}: Remove target attacking creature you control from combat and untap it.
flavor: War favors the informed.

name: Shackles
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{W}: Return Shackles to its owner's hand.
flavor: Shackles of gold are still shackles.

name: Shield Mate
text: Sacrifice Shield Mate: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
flavor: They bear weightier burdens than the shields they carry.

name: Zealots en-Dal
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if all nonland permanents you control are white, you gain 1 life.
flavor:
"Great chains shall free our warriors."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Aether Tide
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X creature cards.
Return X target creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor: The tide of magic brought them here. Now it would take them home.

name: Cunning
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature attacks or blocks, sacrifice Cunning at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
flavor:
". . . Dry-walkers die
We feed on sweet flesh . . . ."
—*Rootwater Saga*

name: Ephemeron
text:
Flying
Discard a card: Return Ephemeron to its owner's hand.
flavor: From nothing came teeth.

name: Ertai, Wizard Adept
text: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Counter target spell.
flavor:
"Was that *it*?"
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Fade Away
text: For each creature, its controller sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {1}.
flavor:
"Consider the fable of the greedy herder. As her flock grew, so did her weariness; she slept, and the sheep wandered off."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Mind Over Matter
text: Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor:
Lyna turned to the figure beside her. "They're gone. What now?"
"As ever," said Urza, "we wait."

name: Mirozel
text:
Flying
When Mirozel becomes the target of a spell or ability, return Mirozel to its owner's hand.
flavor: The mirozels are the only stars in Rath's opaque skies.

name: Rootwater Mystic
text: {1}{U}: Look at the top card of target player's library.
flavor:
"Read the roots tell the tale
Future forms in waving weeds
Higher than truth is hope."
—*Rootwater Saga*

name: School of Piranha
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice School of Piranha unless you pay {1}{U}.
flavor: Some schools aren't worth getting into.

name: Scrivener
text: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"History is a potent weapon."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Thalakos Drifters
text: Discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: They drift in and out of shadow and ever on toward madness.

name: Theft of Dreams
text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
flavor:
"Volrath stole everything there was of me."
—Takara

name: Whiptongue Frog
text: {U}: Whiptongue Frog gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Their favorite food? Wind dancers.

name: Carnophage
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.
flavor: Eating is all it knows.

name: Cat Burglar
text: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: The *il*-Kor no longer roam the open plains, but they are still hunters.

name: Culling the Weak
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add {B}{B}{B}{B}.
flavor:
"The blood of the weak shall be the ink with which we scribe great Yawgmoth's glorious name."
—Stronghold architect, journal

name: Cursed Flesh
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . . .

name: Dauthi Cutthroat
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with shadow.
flavor: In their twisted logic, to empty the shadow world is to escape it.

name: Dauthi Jackal
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{B}{B}, Sacrifice Dauthi Jackal: Destroy target blocking creature.
flavor:
"All Dauthi are jackals, regardless of breed."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Death's Duet
text: Return two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.

name: Grollub
text: Whenever Grollub is dealt damage, each opponent gains that much life.
flavor: Mogglings caught in a misdeed often blame the grollub. Even though the creature is usually innocent, no taskmaster can resist an excuse to beat it.

name: Hatred
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"I will flay the skin from your flesh and the flesh from your bones and scrape your bones dry. And still you will not have suffered enough."
—Greven *il*-Vec, to Gerrard

name: Necrologia
text:
Cast this spell only during your end step.
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Draw X cards.
flavor:
"My enemies' death yields threefold benefit: removal, reuse, and research."
—Volrath

name: Plaguebearer
text: {X}{X}{B}: Destroy target nonblack creature with mana value X.
flavor: Its respiration is your expiration.

name: Recurring Nightmare
text: Sacrifice a creature, Return Recurring Nightmare to its owner's hand: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor:
"I am confined by sleep and defined by nightmare."
—Crovax

name: Scare Tactics
text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Fear rules those weak enough to accept it."
—Greven *il*-Vec

name: Vampire Hounds
text: Discard a creature card: Vampire Hounds gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: The hounds' barks are a horrifying chorus of screams, moans, and whispers.

name: Cinder Crawler
text: {R}: Cinder Crawler gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate only if Cinder Crawler is blocked.
flavor: The crawler doesn't care what gets in its way. It pushes everything into the boiling muck and waits for the meal to cook.

name: Dizzying Gaze
text:
Enchant creature you control
{R}: Enchanted creature deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor:
"When I cut down my angel I only started my fall."
—Crovax

name: Fighting Chance
text: For each blocking creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by that creature this turn.
flavor: A stroke of luck can smite an army.

name: Furnace Brood
text: {R}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
flavor: Furnace air crackles with magmatic cackles.

name: Mage il-Vec
text: {T}, Discard a card at random: Mage il-Vec deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Living below a flowstone foundry produces a disproportionate number of fire mages among the *il*.

name: Monstrous Hound
text:
Monstrous Hound can't attack unless you control more lands than defending player.
Monstrous Hound can't block unless you control more lands than attacking player.
flavor: "Stay."

name: Ogre Shaman
text: {2}, Discard a card at random: Ogre Shaman deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: Ogre shamans must be bright enough to learn their invocations and dim enough to use them.

name: Onslaught
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, tap target creature.
flavor: The last thing to go through the mogg's mind was its teeth.

name: Pandemonium
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to any target of their choice.
flavor:
"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Ravenous Baboons
text: When Ravenous Baboons enters the battlefield, destroy target nonbasic land.
flavor: Build something and the baboons will tear it down. Leave the pieces lying and they will scatter them.

name: Reckless Ogre
text: Whenever Reckless Ogre attacks alone, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: There is no such thing as a regiment of ogres.

name: Sabertooth Wyvern
text: Flying, first strike
flavor: Most creatures grow out of their baby teeth, but sabertooth wyverns grow into theirs.

name: Spellshock
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Spellshock deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor: A snap of fingers, a snap of teeth.

name: Bequeathal
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, you draw two cards.
flavor:
"On my death, I give you this treasure: the knowledge that life is hard, yet too soon past."
—Dal funeral rite

name: Cartographer
text: When Cartographer enters the battlefield, you may return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: How do you map a world when the land moves beneath your feet?

name: Elven Palisade
text: Sacrifice a Forest: Target attacking creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Volrath is not the only one who can shape this world to serve him."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Jackalope Herd
text: When you cast a spell, return Jackalope Herd to its owner's hand.
flavor: There's little more demeaning than getting your butt kicked by a bunch of bunnies.

name: Predatory Hunger
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor: Hunger growls, never purrs.

name: Pygmy Troll
text:
Whenever Pygmy Troll becomes blocked by a creature, Pygmy Troll gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{G}: Regenerate Pygmy Troll.
flavor: "Who you callin' 'shorty'?"

name: Rabid Wolverines
text: Whenever Rabid Wolverines becomes blocked by a creature, Rabid Wolverines gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Is there any other kind?

name: Resuscitate
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "{1}: Regenerate this creature."
flavor:
"It is the art of convincing someone to live."
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Rootwater Alligator
text: Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Rootwater Alligator.
flavor: Subduing and skinning an alligator is the first rite of maturity adolescent merfolk must pass.

name: Song of Serenity
text: Creatures that are enchanted can't attack or block.
flavor: Heartwood brings peace in great symphonies where dryads conduct the trees through every note.

name: Ophidian
text: Whenever Ophidian attacks and isn't blocked, you may draw a card. If you do, Ophidian assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor:
"I will ... tell thee more than thou hast wit to ask."
—Christopher Marlowe, *Doctor Faustus*

name: Quirion Ranger
text: Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate only once each turn.
flavor:
"I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately."
—Henry David Thoreau, *Walden*

name: Soltari Priest
text:
Protection from red
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor:
"Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men."
—Seneca, "On Providence," trans. Basore

name: Muscle Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.
flavor: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.

name: Scragnoth
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Protection from blue
flavor: It possesses no intelligence, only counter-intelligence.

name: Whipcorder
text:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
Morph {W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: His bolas whirl like galaxies, but it's his enemies who see stars.

name: Sparksmith
text: {T}: Sparksmith deals X damage to target creature and X damage to you, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
flavor: "If it didn't hurt, how would I know it worked?"

name: Withered Wretch
text: {1}: Exile target card from a graveyard.
flavor: Once it consecrated the dead. Now it desecrates them.

name: Astral Slide
text: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may exile target creature. If you do, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor:
"The hum of the universe is never off-key."
—Mystic elder

name: Arrogant Wurm
text:
Trample
Madness {2}{G} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: It's hard to be humble when the whole world is bite size.

name: Cabal Coffers
text: {2}, {T}: Add {B} for each Swamp you control.
flavor: Deep within the Cabal's vault, the Mirari pulsed like a dead sun-and its darkness radiated across Otaria.

name: Resurrection
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"Think of this new life not as a gift from the angels but as a command to fight for their cause once more."
—War blessing of Serra

name: Glistener Elf
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: "Beg me for life, and I will fill you with the glory of Phyrexian perfection."

name: Despise
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a creature or planeswalker card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor:
"Truth is always a weapon in your enemies' hands."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

name: Dismember
text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.
flavor:
"You serve Phyrexia. Your pieces would better serve Phyrexia elsewhere."
—Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane

name: Gitaxian Probe
text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"My flesh holds no secrets, monster. The spirit of Mirrodin will fight on."
—Vy Covalt, Mirran resistance

name: Dissolve
text: Counter target spell. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor: "You thought only the gods could stop you?"

name: Abzan Beastmaster
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest toughness or tied for the greatest toughness.
flavor: His beasts move the great siege towers of the Abzan across the endless sands.

name: Frost Walker
text: When Frost Walker becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor:
"As the clans carved out their territories, we saw allies where the Mardu saw only obstacles."
—Yasova Dragonclaw

name: Clash of Wills
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.
flavor:
"The mind of an Eldrazi is a puzzle that can never be solved. The trick is to make sure a piece goes missing."
—Jace Beleren

name: Smash to Smithereens
text: Destroy target artifact. Smash to Smithereens deals 3 damage to that artifact's controller.
flavor:
"All of these old relics have one thing in common. Every last one of them is made of smithereens."
—Zada of Slab Haven

name: Flaying Tendrils
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn. If a creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
flavor: Only one Eldrazi stood against them, yet the defenders were outnumbered.

name: Rise from the Tides
text: Create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token for each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard.
flavor:
"Dear brother, it's sweet that you have chosen to share your toys with Ludevic, but I too have found some new playmates."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Call the Bloodline
text: {1}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 black Vampire Knight creature token with lifelink. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: At Sorin's appeal, Olivia Voldaren summoned the full might of her bloodline to gather at Lurenbraum Fortress.

name: Servo Exhibition
text: Create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.
flavor: Impressing a judge is one thing. Delighting a child is another.

name: Farrel's Zealot
text: Whenever Farrel's Zealot attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature. If you do, Farrel's Zealot assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor: After the fall of Trokair, Farrel and his followers formally broke their ties with the rest of Icatia.

name: Farrelite Priest
text: {1}: Add {W}. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Farrelite Priest at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: Although their methods were often brutal, Farrel's followers believed in the preservation of justice and virtue.

name: Hand of Justice
text: {T}, Tap three untapped white creatures you control: Destroy target creature.
flavor:
"The Hand of Justice will come to cleanse the world if we are true."
—Oliver Farrel

name: Icatian Infantry
text:
{1}: Icatian Infantry gains first strike until end of turn.
{1}: Icatian Infantry gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: The Icatian army easily repelled early surprise attacks by the Orcs on border towns like Montford.

name: Icatian Lieutenant
text: {1}{W}: Target Soldier creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: To become an officer, an Icatian Soldier had to pass a series of tests. These evaluated not only fighting and leadership skills, but also integrity, honor, and moral strength.

name: Icatian Skirmishers
text:
First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
Whenever Icatian Skirmishers attacks, all creatures banded with it gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Skirmishers engaged raiders before they could reach the towns. Although these units typically suffered huge losses, they never lacked volunteers.

name: Order of Leitbur
text:
Protection from black
{W}: Order of Leitbur gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Order of Leitbur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Followers of Tourach regarded all other religions equally: with open contempt. Not so the followers of Leitbur, who made it their mission to eradicate the Order of the Ebon Hand.

name: Homarid Shaman
text: {U}: Tap target green creature.
flavor:
"The ground grew swampy; hooves and claws sank into the marshy earth. Snarls of rage and bleats of despair echoed through the trees as the waters grew higher and higher."
—Kyliki of Havenwood, "Havenwood Remembered"

name: River Merfolk
text: {U}: River Merfolk gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor:
"Dwelling in icy mountain streams near Goblin and Orcish foes, the River Merfolk were known for their stoicism."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. V*

name: Svyelunite Priest
text: {U}{U}, {T}: Target creature gains shroud until end of turn. Activate only during your upkeep. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"Early Vodalians worshipped Svyelun, goddess of the Pearl Moon. Later she became a more abstract figure."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. V*

name: Vodalian Knights
text:
First strike
Vodalian Knights can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Vodalian Knights.
{U}: Vodalian Knights gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Fear the Knight leaping from the water into the air, weapon ready.

name: Vodalian Mage
text: {U}, {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor:
"Vodalian Mages are remarkable. Their merchants bring them arcane lore and devices from across the seas."
—Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

name: Armor Thrull
text: {T}, Sacrifice Armor Thrull: Put a +1/+2 counter on target creature.
flavor:
"The worst thing about being a mercenary for the Ebon Hand is having to wear a dead Thrull."
—Ivra Jursdotter

name: Basal Thrull
text: {T}, Sacrifice Basal Thrull: Add {B}{B}.
flavor:
Initially bred for sacrifice, the Thrulls eventually turned on their masters, the Order of the Ebon Hand, with gruesome results.
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Order of the Ebon Hand
text:
Protection from white
{B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: A true follower of Tourach took pride in achievement to the exclusion of other concerns.

name: Thrull Champion
text:
Thrull creatures get +1/+1.
{T}: Gain control of target Thrull for as long as you control Thrull Champion.
flavor:
"Those idiots should never have bred Thrulls for combat!"
—Jherana Rure

name: Thrull Wizard
text: {1}{B}: Counter target black spell unless that spell's controller pays {B} or {3}.
flavor:
"In crafting intelligent Thrulls to assist in sacrifices, Sahr inadvertantly set the stage for the Thrull Rebellion."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Dwarven Armorer
text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Put a +0/+1 counter or a +1/+0 counter on target creature.
flavor:
"The few remaining pieces from this period suggest the Dwarves eventually made weapons and armor out of everything, even children's toys."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Dwarven Lieutenant
text: {1}{R}: Target Dwarf creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Dwarven officers were tireless in battle, moving up and down the lines to rally their troops and boost morale."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Goblin Chirurgeon
text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Regenerate target creature.
flavor: The Chirurgeons patched up their fallen comrades with a gruesome mix of twisted limbs and mangled flesh.

name: Goblin Flotilla
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
At the beginning of each combat, unless you pay {R}, whenever Goblin Flotilla blocks or becomes blocked by a creature this combat, that creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Exceptionally poor sailors, Goblins usually arrived at their destination retching and in no condition to fight.

name: Orcish Veteran
text:
Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater.
{R}: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Orcs are not exactly known for their valor—although most Orcs have seen countless battles, only a handful have actually fought in them.

name: Elven Fortress
text: {1}{G}: Target blocking creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Many Elven Fortresses weren't built by masons and carpenters, but created from the living forest itself.

name: Elvish Hunter
text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor:
"Elves often tipped their arrows with a drug that caused a deep but harmless sleep."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Elvish Scout
text: {G}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.
flavor: Even one whose ears were closely tuned to the sounds of Havenwood could miss hearing a Scout move past.

name: Feral Thallid
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Feral Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Feral Thallid: Regenerate Feral Thallid.
flavor:
"Born and bred of fungus, Thallids were nearly impossible to kill."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Fungal Bloom
text: {G}{G}: Put a spore counter on target Fungus.
flavor:
"Thallids could absorb energy from the forest itself. Even Elves were at a disadvantage in fighting them."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Thelonite Druid
text: {1}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Forests you control become 2/3 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
flavor:
"The magic at the heart of all living things can bear awe-inspiring fruit."
—Kolevi of Havenwood, Elder Druid

name: Thelonite Monk
text: {T}, Sacrifice a green creature: Target land becomes a Forest. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor:
"As the climate worsened, some Thelonites turned to fertilizing with fresh blood in an attempt to keep Havenwood alive and growing."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Thorn Thallid
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: It deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
"The danger in cultivating massive plants caught the elves by surprise."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Celestial Kirin
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, destroy all permanents with that spell's mana value.
flavor: All bow at its visitation—some in awe, some in honor, some in fear.

name: Eidolon of Rhetoric
text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
flavor: It is the soul of a philosopher who died of starvation contemplating the universe.

name: Lumithread Field
text:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
Morph {1}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: Having conquered the Bastion of Suns, the Ota took its light for their own.

name: Pull from Eternity
text: Put target face-up exiled card into its owner's graveyard.
flavor:
It is best to conquer dragons before they hatch.
—Femeref adage

name: Sinew Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.
flavor: As the muscle cords of the creature twitched, Hanna saw an unsettling unanimity in the others' rippling flesh. She didn't know what it meant, but she urged Sisay to keep the ship at a safe distance.

name: Soul's Attendant
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
flavor: In truth, her own faith was gone, trodden in Ulamog's wake. She pantomimed the blessing in the hope that it would inspire others to continue to struggle.

name: Spelltithe Enforcer
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {1}.
flavor: His assistants calculate the amount of the tribute. He measures out the punishment for delinquency.

name: Blighted Agent
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Blighted Agent can't be blocked.
flavor:
"Urabrask may suspect our surveillance, but he cannot stop it."
—Avaricta, Gitaxian sective

name: Fatespinner
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player chooses draw step, main phase, or combat phase. The player skips each instance of the chosen step or phase this turn.
flavor: No one knows what she is watching, but she never takes her eyes off it.

name: Frozen Aether
text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor: Gjornersen entertained his followers by taking bets on which would move first—the drowsing land wurm or the frozen goblins.

name: Paradox Haze
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's first upkeep each turn, that player gets an additional upkeep step after this step.
flavor:
"Keep your pace steady through the haze, lest you step on the heels of your future self or trip the self a moment behind you."
—Teferi

name: One with Nothing
text: Discard your hand.
flavor: When nothing remains, everything is equally possible.

name: Undead Warchief
text:
Zombie spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Zombie creatures you control get +2/+1.
flavor: It has the strength of seven men. In fact, it used to be seven men.

name: Burning Inquiry
text: Each player draws three cards, then discards three cards at random.
flavor: Jariad burned the midnight oil, burned through scroll after scroll, and then burned down his laboratory.

name: Norin the Wary
text: When a player casts a spell or a creature attacks, exile Norin the Wary. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "I have a bad feeling about this."

name: Pyretic Ritual
text: Add {R}{R}{R}.
flavor: The Multiverse is filled with limitless power just waiting for someone to reach out and seize it.

name: Boundless Realms
text: Search your library for up to X basic land cards, where X is the number of lands you control, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor:
"Planeswalking cannot be taught. Either you see the doors or you do not."
—Nissa Revane

name: Bramblewood Paragon
text:
Each other Warrior creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.
flavor: Those who seek to escape her blades succeed only in dying on their stomachs.

name: Game-Trail Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Trample
flavor:
"I pity them, never knowing the pleasures of a single familiar form, but at least they find a noble shape at times."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Hornet Sting
text: Hornet Sting deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: It was only then—to his infinite sorrow—that Gork realized hornets don't make honey.

name: Manaweft Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
flavor:
"I see in their interconnectedness a strange embodiment of the natural order."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

name: Reki, the History of Kamigawa
text: Whenever you cast a legendary spell, draw a card.
flavor:
"After his death, monks spent ten years transcribing the tattoos from Reki's body and gathering stories from those who spoke with him. Thus the volume you hold was written."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Sakura-Tribe Scout
text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor:
"Scouts of the Sakura Tribe spent two years wandering the forest to learn every leaf and tree. That knowledge was called upon during the Kami War to ensure the orochi's survival."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Iron Myr
text: {T}: Add {R}.
flavor: The myr are like rusted metal: gleaming purpose hidden by a thin disguise of debris.

name: Abzan Advantage
text: Target player sacrifices an enchantment. Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor:
"To survive, you must seize every opportunity."
—Daghatar the Adamant

name: Abzan Skycaptain
text:
Flying
When Abzan Skycaptain dies, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)
flavor: "A tempest is coming. Turn your faces toward the wind!"

name: Arashin Cleric
text: When Arashin Cleric enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
flavor: "We'll have time to put out the fires when those trapped within the ruins are safe."

name: Aven Skirmisher
text: Flying
flavor: "We do not hide from the dragons that pretend to rule the skies. If we did, the dragons would become our rulers, and our way of life would be lost."

name: Dragon Bell Monk
text:
Vigilance
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: He has spent years training his eyes and ears to detect the subtle signs of a dragon's approach.

name: Dragonscale General
text: At the beginning of your end step, bolster X, where X is the number of tapped creatures you control. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put X +1/+1 counters on it.)
flavor: "Dragons seek war. I bring it to them."

name: Great-Horn Krushok
flavor: Perfectly suited for life in the Shifting Wastes, the krushok is well protected by its horn, its hide, and its temper.

name: Honor's Reward
text: You gain 4 life. Bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)
flavor: It seldom rains in Abzan lands. When it does, the khan marks the occasion by honoring the families of the fallen.

name: Lotus-Eye Mystics
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Lotus-Eye Mystics enters the battlefield, return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Every action has a foreseen purpose.

name: Mardu Woe-Reaper
text: Whenever Mardu Woe-Reaper or another Warrior enters the battlefield under your control, you may exile target creature card from a graveyard. If you do, you gain 1 life.
flavor: "Those who died in battle deserve their rest."

name: Pressure Point
text:
Tap target creature.
Draw a card.
flavor: By studying dragon anatomy, Jeskai monks have learned how to locate clusters of nerves that will incapacitate even the mightiest dragons.

name: Sandblast
text: Sandblast deals 5 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: In the Shifting Wastes, more are killed by sand than by steel.

name: Soul Summons
text: Manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
flavor: Ugin's magic reaches beyond the dragons. The clans have adapted it for war.

name: Wandering Champion
text: Whenever Wandering Champion deals combat damage to a player, if you control a blue or red permanent, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
flavor: "Learn from your enemies, but do not tolerate them."

name: Wardscale Dragon
text:
Flying
As long as Wardscale Dragon is attacking, defending player can't cast spells.
flavor: Dromoka's brood emerge from the dragon tempests covered with tough scales that protect them from most clan weapons and magic.

name: Enhanced Awareness
text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
flavor:
"Study the topography of your enemies, and you will have a map to victory."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

name: Jeskai Sage
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Jeskai Sage dies, draw a card.
flavor: "The one who conquers the mind is greater than the one who conquers the world."

name: Lotus Path Djinn
text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "The lotus takes root where body and mind intersect. It blooms when body and mind become one."

name: Marang River Prowler
text:
Marang River Prowler can't block and can't be blocked.
You may cast Marang River Prowler from your graveyard as long as you control a black or green permanent.
flavor: The currents of the Marang wash away both tracks and blood.

name: Mindscour Dragon
text:
Flying
Whenever Mindscour Dragon deals combat damage to an opponent, target player mills four cards.
flavor:
"The bells may one day ring as an anthem of our own end."
—Kyu, Sage-Eye mystic

name: Neutralizing Blast
text: Counter target multicolored spell.
flavor: "To defeat your enemies, you must remove their ability to make war against you."

name: Rakshasa's Disdain
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your graveyard.
flavor: "Every failure, every death only makes my strength greater."

name: Refocus
text:
Untap target creature.
Draw a card.
flavor: "Before you can open your third eye, you must prove you can open the first two."

name: Shifting Loyalties
text: Exchange control of two target permanents that share a card type. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, land, and planeswalker are card types.)
flavor:
"Show the enemy the true path, and the spirit will yearn to follow it."
—Houn, Jeskai elder

name: Sultai Skullkeeper
text: When Sultai Skullkeeper enters the battlefield, mill two cards.
flavor: A skullkeeper is the first to arrive after the palace archers strike down intruders, probing their brains for choice bits of knowledge.

name: Supplant Form
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. You create a token that's a copy of that creature.
flavor:
"Ice can be shaped to any form, even the whisper of a memory."
—Mytha, Temur shaman

name: Temporal Trespass
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Take an extra turn after this one. Exile Temporal Trespass.
flavor: Few truly live in the moment.

name: Whisk Away
text: Put target attacking or blocking creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor: The maneuvers of the Abzan formation intrigued Ojutai in both their complexity and their futility.

name: Will of the Naga
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
flavor: The charm of a naga is undeniable.

name: Alesha's Vanguard
text: Dash {2}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)
flavor: Boundaries drawn on maps or marked with stone have no meaning for the Mardu.

name: Ancestral Vengeance
text:
Enchant creature
When Ancestral Vengeance enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
flavor: The defenses of the Abzan extend well beyond the walls of their fortresses.

name: Battle Brawler
text: As long as you control a red or white permanent, Battle Brawler gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
flavor: Every time he returns from battle unscathed, he feels a tinge of disappointment.

name: Dark Deal
text: Each player discards all the cards in their hand, then draws that many cards minus one.
flavor: The first khans of the Sultai relied on the magic of the rakshasa to ensure the survival of the clan.

name: Diplomacy of the Wastes
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. If you control a Warrior, that player loses 2 life.
flavor:
"Our emissaries are gifted negotiators."
—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death

name: Douse in Gloom
text: Douse in Gloom deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
flavor: The Mardu warrior was overjoyed when Tasigur set him free and granted him passage through the jungle. He failed to notice the Sultai leader's cruel smile.

name: Fearsome Awakening
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If it's a Dragon, put two +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor: On Tarkir, dragons emerge from enormous tempests, phenomena tied to Ugin's very presence on the plane.

name: Grave Strength
text: Choose target creature. Mill three cards, then put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each creature card in your graveyard.
flavor: So long as death follows life, the supply lines of the Sultai will never be cut.

name: Gurmag Angler
text: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
flavor: If everything in the Gurmag Swamp hungers for human flesh, what bait could be more effective?

name: Merciless Executioner
text: When Merciless Executioner enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
flavor: He enjoys his work, for he sees only the worst Abzan criminals: those who betray their own kin.

name: Orc Sureshot
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Words have yet to halt an arrow."

name: Qarsi High Priest
text: {1}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature: Manifest the top card of your library. (Put that card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
flavor: "Hear me, nameless, and obey."

name: Reach of Shadows
text: Destroy target creature that's one or more colors.
flavor:
"Is it better to be a fool or a coward? Fools may get things done occasionally, but cowards live longer."
—Ghelesh Shadowmane, rakshasa mage

name: Sibsig Host
text: When Sibsig Host enters the battlefield, each player mills three cards.
flavor:
"They were your friends, your family, your clan. They want only to welcome you."
—Tasigur, the Golden Fang

name: Sultai Emissary
text: When Sultai Emissary dies, manifest the top card of your library. (Put that card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
flavor: To the Sultai, Ugin's power was just one more resource to be exploited.

name: Tasigur's Cruelty
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Each opponent discards two cards.
flavor: The cruelest tortures leave no mark upon the flesh.

name: Arcbond
text: Choose target creature. Whenever that creature is dealt damage this turn, it deals that much damage to each other creature and each player.
flavor:
"If you must die today, make your death worthy of legend."
—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death

name: Bloodfire Enforcers
text: Bloodfire Enforcers has first strike and trample as long as an instant card and a sorcery card are in your graveyard.
flavor: Bloodfire practitioners train to focus their rage, building it deep inside themselves until they are ready to release it as a devastating attack.

name: Break Through the Line
text: {R}: Target creature with power 2 or less gains haste until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
flavor:
"If the Mardu were more in tune with their beasts, they would not scare so easily."
—Jilaya, Temur whisperer

name: Collateral Damage
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Collateral Damage deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor: It is much easier to create fire than to contain it.

name: Defiant Ogre
text:
When Defiant Ogre enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Defiant Ogre.
• Destroy target artifact.
flavor: "I have no clan, but I still have purpose."

name: Dragonrage
text: Add {R} for each attacking creature you control. Until end of turn, attacking creatures you control gain "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
flavor:
"Dragons in the skies of Tarkir—for the first time, it feels like my home."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Fierce Invocation
text: Manifest the top card of your library, then put two +1/+1 counters on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
flavor: Anger can empower those who embrace it.

name: Friendly Fire
text: Target creature's controller reveals a card at random from their hand. Friendly Fire deals damage to that creature and that player equal to the revealed card's mana value.
flavor:
"Never tell goblins to 'fire at will.'"
—Urut Barzeel, Mardu hordechief

name: Gore Swine
flavor:
"The Mardu are like the gore swine. We are wild, hunt in packs, and rarely clean the blood from our blades."
—Vallash, Mardu warrior

name: Hungering Yeti
text: As long as you control a green or blue permanent, you may cast Hungering Yeti as though it had flash. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
flavor: No clan is as adept at saying "go away" as the Temur.

name: Lightning Shrieker
text:
Flying, trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, Lightning Shrieker's owner shuffles it into their library.
flavor: Dragonslayers learned to keep silent about their deeds after seeing the terrible vengeance wrought by Kolaghan and her brood.

name: Mardu Scout
text: Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)
flavor: The Mardu all enjoy war, but only the goblins make a game of it.

name: Shockmaw Dragon
text:
Flying
Whenever Shockmaw Dragon deals combat damage to a player, it deals 1 damage to each creature that player controls.
flavor: Dragons of the Kolaghan brood are always on the move. They are the driving force behind the Mardu's nomadic way of life.

name: Smoldering Efreet
text: When Smoldering Efreet dies, it deals 2 damage to you.
flavor: The efreet are drawn to the Kaisham Wanderers, a loosely organized Jeskai school where trickery is employed to challenge the status quo and upend the belief systems of others.

name: Wild Slash
text:
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, damage can't be prevented this turn.
Wild Slash deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: Never mistake deception for cleverness.

name: Abzan Kin-Guard
text: Abzan Kin-Guard has lifelink as long as you control a white or black permanent.
flavor: "The Mardu rush headlong toward extinction. We ensure the longevity of our clan by protecting our territory, not rampaging through it."

name: Ambush Krotiq
text:
Trample
When Ambush Krotiq enters the battlefield, return another creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: The Abzan merchants soon discovered why this route was clear of dragons.

name: Archers of Qarsi
text:
Defender
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor:
"We think of the naga as creeping cutthroats, slitherers in the swamps. But they are equally at home in the trees."
—Goton, Qal Sisma shaman

name: Battlefront Krushok
text:
Battlefront Krushok can't be blocked by more than one creature.
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor: Krushoks clear debris from fertile fields, fallow fields, and battlefields.

name: Cached Defenses
text: Bolster 3. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put three +1/+1 counters on it.)
flavor: The glittering scales in the Abzan vaults represent mighty deeds of the past and protection for generations to come.

name: Destructor Dragon
text:
Flying
When Destructor Dragon dies, destroy target noncreature permanent.
flavor: After countless attacks on the Salt Road where it passes through the frozen tundra, the Abzan began to refer to the area as Atarka territory rather than Temur lands.

name: Feral Krushok
flavor: In a stunning act of diplomacy, Yasova Dragonclaw ceded a portion of Temur lands to the Sultai. Her clan protested until they saw she had given the Sultai the breeding grounds of the krushoks. They hadn't realized she had a sense of humor.

name: Frontier Mastodon
text: Ferocious — Frontier Mastodon enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.
flavor: Each bronze disk on its harness is an offering from a young Temur hunter, a sign of respect to the spirits of the wild.

name: Fruit of the First Tree
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, you gain X life and draw X cards, where X is its toughness.
flavor: "I will be the ancestor my descendants call upon for aid. On that day I will take up my sword for my family once more."

name: Hunt the Weak
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Then that creature fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
flavor: Dragons scorn the weak, even among their own kind.

name: Ruthless Instincts
text:
Choose one —
• Target nonattacking creature gains reach and deathtouch until end of turn. Untap it.
• Target attacking creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: A single battle affects countless others.

name: Sandsteppe Mastodon
text:
Reach
When Sandsteppe Mastodon enters the battlefield, bolster 5. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put five +1/+1 counters on it.)
flavor: A mastodon's path always leads to an oasis.

name: Sudden Reclamation
text: Mill four cards, then return a creature card and a land card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"There is no secret buried so deep that we will never find it."
—Kurtar, Sultai necromancer

name: Wildcall
text: Manifest the top card of your library, then put X +1/+1 counters on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
flavor: A howl on the wind hides many dangers.

name: Augur il-Vec
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Sacrifice Augur il-Vec: You gain 4 life. Activate only during your upkeep.
flavor: "If it would end this exile, my life is yours."

name: Barren Glory
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control no permanents other than Barren Glory and have no cards in hand, you win the game.
flavor:
"The only perfect world is an empty world, with no one to sin or wage war."
—Tarran, magus of the disk

name: Even the Odds
text:
Cast this spell only if you control fewer creatures than each opponent.
Create three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
flavor:
"They who fall singing the battle hymn of Benalia go not unavenged."
—Adom Capashen, Benalish commander

name: Gift of Granite
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
flavor: The blessing adds both protection to the recipient and weightlessness to the stone.

name: Magus of the Moat
text: Creatures without flying can't attack.
flavor: "The spirits of the mythic ones ever circle their beloved keep, forbidding entry to all who come with the heavy tread of hate."

name: Samite Censer-Bearer
text: {W}, Sacrifice Samite Censer-Bearer: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to each creature you control this turn.
flavor: Samite alchemists extracted aromatic traces of healing minerals from the residue of the receding salt dunes.

name: Scout's Warning
text:
The next creature card you play this turn can be played as though it had flash.
Draw a card.
flavor: "There is no tactic I enjoy more than ambushing the ambushers."

name: Bound in Silence
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
flavor: A fight put off forever is already won.

name: Lucent Liminid
text: Flying
flavor: It is a herald of the sun goddess, projected from the hallowed glass whenever her light passes through.

name: Lymph Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have absorb 1. (If a source would deal damage to a Sliver, prevent 1 of that damage.)
flavor: Its skin remains in a flowing, liquid state that keeps its body coated with potent restorative lymph.

name: Mistmeadow Skulk
text: Lifelink, protection from mana value 3 or greater
flavor: Doyo suspected the boggarts of brewing a plot against his crop, so he scythed away his grain to clear the sightlines.

name: Patrician's Scorn
text:
If you've cast another white spell this turn, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Destroy all enchantments.
flavor: Lady Farisa's contempt of tawdry kitsch grew even more infamous after her death.

name: Ramosian Revivalist
text: {6}, {T}: Return target Rebel permanent card with mana value 5 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: The Ramosian tradition is alive, but its namesake has long since been forgotten.

name: Aven Augur
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Aven Augur: Return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands. Activate only during your upkeep.
flavor: "I have seen the future. It does not include you."

name: Foresee
text: Scry 4, then draw two cards.
flavor: Wind time's watch, and watch time unwind.

name: Magus of the Future
text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play lands and cast spells from the top of your library.
flavor: Those gifted with the sight have one eye in the present and the other in the future.

name: Venser's Diffusion
text: Return target nonland permanent or suspended card to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Each reality is but the dream of another, and each sleeper a god unknowing."

name: Arcanum Wings
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Aura swap {2}{U} ({2}{U}: Exchange this Aura with an Aura card in your hand.)
flavor: Nobles don wings to reach the sky villas of their peers, exchanging them for more fashionable attire upon arrival.

name: Bonded Fetch
text:
Defender, haste
{T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: A well-made homunculus grooms the mind of its master, pruning the thoughts that lead to madness. Few loredelvers survive the study of the infinite without one.

name: Narcomoeba
text:
Flying
When Narcomoeba is put into your graveyard from your library, you may put it onto the battlefield.
flavor: It was created by the Iquati as a living memory—one that objects to being forgotten.

name: Nix
text: Counter target spell if no mana was spent to cast it.
flavor:
"There is no shortcut to work done true and well. The Creators learned this to their sorrow, the first time they made the world."
—Githri the Prisoner

name: Sarcomite Myr
text:
{2}: Sarcomite Myr gains flying until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Sarcomite Myr: Draw a card.
flavor:
"A horrible sight, yes, but the sounds . . . Its twanging tendons and grinding gears are almost musical."
—Brudiclad, Telchor engineer

name: Second Wind
text:
Enchant creature
{T}: Tap enchanted creature.
{T}: Untap enchanted creature.
flavor: Vindr stormchasers believe that the same ancient forces that move the winds can also move mortal minds and hearts.

name: Augur of Skulls
text:
{1}{B}: Regenerate Augur of Skulls.
Sacrifice Augur of Skulls: Target player discards two cards. Activate only during your upkeep.
flavor: Within each empty skull, it seeks ways to preserve its own failing undeath.

name: Cutthroat il-Dal
text: Hellbent — Cutthroat il-Dal has shadow as long as you have no cards in hand. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: Her blades slashed across the noble's shadow. He scoffed, then fell over dead.

name: Lost Hours
text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player puts that card into their library third from the top.
flavor:
"Your thoughts do not interest me nearly as much as the absence thereof."
—Gorghul, augur of skulls

name: Minions' Murmurs
text: You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of creatures you control.
flavor:
"They are quick to offer advice, those whose mistakes doomed them to undeath. How can I not listen to the wisdom of failure?"
—Ratadrabik of Urborg

name: Pooling Venom
text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, its controller loses 2 life.
{3}{B}: Destroy enchanted land.
flavor: The land can only hold so much poison before it begins to bite back.

name: Slaughter Pact
text:
Destroy target nonblack creature.
At the beginning of your next upkeep, pay {2}{B}. If you don't, you lose the game.
flavor: Death is only the beginning of the end.

name: Stronghold Rats
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Stronghold Rats deals combat damage to a player, each player discards a card.
flavor: In the stronghold's dungeons, the shadows hide in the vermin.

name: Frenzy Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have frenzy 1. (Whenever a Sliver attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
flavor: The Arturan conjurers took the strange, alien fossil and patterned their own twisted creations in its image.

name: Witch's Mist
text: {2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
flavor:
"Hear us, Overmother. Let the strong thrive under your gelatinous hand, and let the weak writhe under your serrated heel."
—Prayer of the devoted

name: Yixlid Jailer
text: Cards in graveyards lose all abilities.
flavor: "I have an eternity to know the souls who are bound here, to behold their every facet. But moments from now they will be gagged and masked, and they shall be known by none other."

name: Char-Rumbler
text:
Double strike
{R}: Char-Rumbler gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Elementals flourished as Dominaria healed and new forms of life adapted to the land's reinfusion with mana.

name: Magus of the Moon
text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.
flavor: Tidal forces of the blood moon wrench and buckle the land, drawing monoliths of stone and soil toward the flaming orb.

name: Rift Elemental
text: {1}{R}, Remove a time counter from a permanent you control or suspended card you own: Rift Elemental gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"It's difficult to heal a rift after it begins wandering about on its own."
—Teferi

name: Scourge of Kher Ridges
text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Scourge of Kher Ridges deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
{5}{R}: Scourge of Kher Ridges deals 6 damage to each other creature with flying.
flavor: Doom casts its own flickering shadow.

name: Emblem of the Warmind
text:
Enchant creature you control
Creatures you control have haste.
flavor:
"It takes but one spark to ignite a parched forest. Our hearts, I fear, are too dry for this new visitor."
—Elek Longbeard

name: Flowstone Embrace
text:
Enchant creature
{T}: Enchanted creature gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The seventh symbol, the Mark of Stone, stores the power of ancient Rath."
—*Tome of Elemental Mastery*

name: Grinning Ignus
text: {R}, Return Grinning Ignus to its owner's hand: Add {C}{C}{R}. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor:
"Take care what you offer the ignus. Food, perhaps. Coins. But nothing flammable!"
—Stovic, village eccentric

name: Steamflogger Boss
text:
Other Riggers you control get +1/+0 and have haste.
If a Rigger you control would assemble a Contraption, it assembles two Contraptions instead.
flavor: "Whip the Xs! Pinch the Os! What we're building, no one knows!"

name: Tarox Bladewing
text:
Flying, haste
Grandeur — Discard another card named Tarox Bladewing: Tarox Bladewing gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.
flavor: Despising his siblings as insults to his line, he finds and devours each in turn.

name: Force of Savagery
text: Trample
flavor:
"Life cannot be created and then abandoned. It must be nurtured and fed so that it may express its ripened might."
—Freyalise

name: Heartwood Storyteller
text: Whenever a player casts a noncreature spell, each of that player's opponents may draw a card.
flavor: His roots reach deep, nurtured not by soil and rain, but by millennia of experience.

name: Llanowar Augur
text: Sacrifice Llanowar Augur: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn. Activate only during your upkeep.
flavor: "I am irrelevant. The future I hold in my hands is everything."

name: Quiet Disrepair
text:
Enchant artifact or enchantment
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• Destroy enchanted permanent.
• You gain 2 life.
flavor:
"Artifice has always stood upon nature's shoulders. Let us watch nature take a turn."
—Freyalise

name: Riftsweeper
text: When Riftsweeper enters the battlefield, choose target face-up exiled card. Its owner shuffles it into their library.
flavor: "Beings of the rifts are not natural. No longer will these abominations tread upon the body of Gaea."

name: Centaur Omenreader
text: As long as Centaur Omenreader is tapped, creature spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
flavor: The wisdom of the omenreaders is legendary. Creatures travel for miles through icy peril to seek their counsel.

name: Imperiosaur
text: Spend only mana produced by basic lands to cast this spell.
flavor:
"An ancient, powerful force has overtaken the valley. I sympathize for its former inhabitants, but I rejoice for the land itself."
—Olanti, Muraganda druid

name: Muraganda Petroglyphs
text: Creatures with no abilities get +2/+2.
flavor: Some mages forsake their scrolls and libraries to learn at the feet of ancient trees and sacred stones.

name: Spellwild Ouphe
text: Spells that target Spellwild Ouphe cost {2} less to cast.
flavor:
"You'd think that their big glowing eyes would be almost hypnotic to look at. In fact, it's the other way around—they are entranced by nearly everything they see."
—Balecki, Spellwild druid

name: Dryad Arbor
text: (Dryad Arbor isn't a spell, it's affected by summoning sickness, and it has "{T}: Add {G}.")
flavor:
"Touch no tree, break no branch, and speak only the question you wish answered."
—Von Yomm, elder druid, to her initiates

name: Tradewind Rider
text:
Flying
{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"'Tis a shame, in such a tempest, to have but one anchor."
—Laurence Sterne, *Tristram Shandy*

name: Armageddon
text: Destroy all lands.
flavor:
"'O miserable of happy! Is this the end
Of this new glorious world... ?'"
—John Milton, *Paradise Lost*

name: Hermit Druid
text: {G}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a basic land card. Put that card into your hand and all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.
flavor: Seeking the company of plants ensures that your wits will go to seed.

name: Exalted Angel
text:
Flying
Whenever Exalted Angel deals damage, you gain that much life.
Morph {2}{W}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor:
"She is a theme of honor and renown, ...Whose present courage may beat down our foes."
—William Shakespeare, *Troilus and Cressida*

name: Cunning Wish
text: You may reveal an instant card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand. Exile Cunning Wish.
flavor: The foolish wish for that which they desire. The cunning wish for that which they require.

name: Angelic Guardian
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever one or more creatures you control attack, they gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)
flavor: "No single arrow can pierce an entire flock."

name: Vengeant Vampire
text:
Lifelink
When Vengeant Vampire dies, destroy target creature an opponent controls and you gain 4 life.
flavor: "Those who stood in my path now lay behind me."

name: Immortal Phoenix
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Immortal Phoenix dies, return it to its owner's hand.
flavor: Their fires burn quietly, allowing the phoenixes to glide silently through the canyon.

name: Rampaging Brontodon
text:
Trample
Whenever Rampaging Brontodon attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each land you control.
flavor: Not even the tallest tree stands a chance against the underside of a dinosaur's foot.

name: Char
text: Char deals 4 damage to any target and 2 damage to you.
flavor: Izzet mages often acquire their magic reagents from dubious sources, so the potency of their spells is never predictable.

name: Goblin Rally
text: Create four 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
flavor: You don't so much hire goblins as put ideas in their heads.

name: Deadbridge Goliath
text: Scavenge {4}{G}{G} ({4}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)
flavor: Some Golgari insects live for centuries—and they never stop growing.

name: Boros Elite
text: Battalion — Whenever Boros Elite and at least two other creatures attack, Boros Elite gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"First, you must fight among the rank and file. It is there I will discern your skills as a leader."
—Aurelia, to Gideon Jura

name: Daring Skyjek
text: Battalion — Whenever Daring Skyjek and at least two other creatures attack, Daring Skyjek gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "The hard part isn't landing in the saddle. The hard part is leaping before you see it."

name: Bomber Corps
text: Battalion — Whenever Bomber Corps and at least two other creatures attack, Bomber Corps deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: "Subtlety is for lawmages and spies."

name: Devouring Light
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Exile target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: Into the light the good are welcomed, and with the light the evil are banished.

name: Scatter the Seeds
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Create three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
flavor: From the seeds of faith, great forests grow.

name: Azorius Justiciar
text: When Azorius Justiciar enters the battlefield, detain up to two target creatures your opponents control. (Until your next turn, those creatures can't attack or block and their activated abilities can't be activated.)
flavor: "Your potential to commit a crime warrants further investigation."

name: Hover Barrier
text: Defender, flying
flavor: As whispers and rumors increased, so did the demand for fail-safe barriers.

name: Martyred Rusalka
text: {W}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature can't attack this turn.
