text: Each player chooses from the lands they control a land of each basic land type, then sacrifices the rest.
flavor:
"The earth shook, the sky rained fire, and it seemed the world was ending."
—Benalish refugee

name: Harsh Judgment
text:
As Harsh Judgment enters the battlefield, choose a color.
If an instant or sorcery spell of the chosen color would deal damage to you, it deals that damage to its controller instead.
flavor:
"At least they remember me."
—Gerrard

name: Liberate
text: Exile target creature you control. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor:
"Not everyone gets a second chance."
—Hanna

name: Obsidian Acolyte
text:
Protection from black
{W}: Target creature gains protection from black until end of turn.
flavor:
The truthful will stand in the gaze of death and escape unharmed.
—Obsidian acolyte creed

name: Pledge of Loyalty
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from the colors of permanents you control. This effect doesn't remove Pledge of Loyalty.
flavor: Urza convinced many Dominarians not only to set aside their differences, but to embrace them.

name: Restrain
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Hanna would give up her own life before she'd abandon the *Weatherlight*."
—Sisay

name: Rewards of Diversity
text: Whenever an opponent casts a multicolored spell, you gain 4 life.
flavor:
"Everything is in place. Nothing can happen that isn't part of my plan."
—Urza

name: Spirit of Resistance
text: As long as you control a permanent of each color, prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.
flavor:
"Our victory must come from all of Dominaria, or it will not come."
—Urza

name: Strength of Unity
text:
Enchant creature
Domain — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor: All Dominarians agreed on one thing: they would not go down without a fight.

name: Wayfaring Giant
text: Domain — Wayfaring Giant gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor: Its stature and stride increase with each step it takes.

name: Winnow
text:
Destroy target nonland permanent if another permanent with the same name is on the battlefield.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Strength in numbers? I think not."
—Gerrard

name: Blind Seer
text: {1}{U}: Target spell or permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
flavor:
"I think he sees more than he lets on."
—Gerrard

name: Disrupt
text:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Draw a card.
flavor: Teferi wanted no part of Urza's battle plans, but both agreed the Phyrexian portal must be closed.

name: Dream Thrush
text:
Flying
{T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: Whether for good or ill, their arrival always means change.

name: Empress Galina
text: {U}{U}, {T}: Gain control of target legendary permanent. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor: "Above the waves you may be mighty indeed, but down here you belong to me."

name: Essence Leak
text:
Enchant permanent
As long as enchanted permanent is red or green, it has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this permanent unless you pay its mana cost."
flavor:
"We define the boundaries of reality; they don't define us."
—Teferi

name: Mana Maze
text: Players can't cast spells that share a color with the spell most recently cast this turn.
flavor:
"Those who know only one path to victory can never hope to triumph."
—The Blind Seer

name: Rainbow Crow
text:
Flying
{1}: Rainbow Crow becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: Children claim no two feathers are exactly the same color, then eagerly gather them for proof.

name: Sapphire Leech
text:
Flying
Blue spells you cast cost {U} more to cast.
flavor:
"The subject's wings are clearly vestigial. We suspect the gems somehow keep it aloft."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Shoreline Raider
text: Protection from Kavu
flavor:
"This strange new beast makes for an excellent meal. Get me more."
—Empress Galina

name: Sway of Illusion
text:
Any number of target creatures become the color of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"I suggest you take a closer look."
—Tidal visionary

name: Tidal Visionary
text: {T}: Target creature becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: Beneath the waves, things appear the way merfolk want them to.

name: Vodalian Merchant
text: When Vodalian Merchant enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: Not choosing sides in a war can be dangerous—but lucrative.

name: Well-Laid Plans
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to a creature by another creature if they share a color.
flavor: "I knew this day would come," said Urza. Looking at the destruction, Barrin sighed, "You don't have to revel in it."

name: Addle
text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and you choose a card of that color from it. That player discards that card.
flavor:
"I'll wring out your tiny mind like a sponge."
—Urborg witch

name: Andradite Leech
text:
Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.
{B}: Andradite Leech gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Older specimens are completely encrusted with gems, which serve as both armor and weapons."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Bog Initiate
flavor:
"Urborg's magic is strong. Did Urza send you to protect us or to protect against us?"
—Urborg witch, to Barrin

name: Crypt Angel
text:
Flying, protection from white
When Crypt Angel enters the battlefield, return target blue or red creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Once an angel, now an abomination.

name: Defiling Tears
text: Until end of turn, target creature becomes black, gets +1/-1, and gains "{B}: Regenerate this creature."
flavor: Serra's living warriors looked on in horror. "Where is our Lady now?" they cried.

name: Dredge
text:
Sacrifice a creature or land.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"I'd strip away the world to see what's under it, but I'd never just leave it to these Phyrexian parasites and their false god."
—Urborg witch

name: Marauding Knight
text:
Protection from white
Marauding Knight gets +1/+1 for each Plains your opponents control.
flavor: "They ride our trails as if they were designed to," said the guard. "They were," replied Gerrard.

name: Mourning
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-0.
{B}: Return Mourning to its owner's hand.
flavor: Barrin waited for the nausea to pass or for Urza to say something else. He waited in vain.

name: Phyrexian Reaper
text: Whenever Phyrexian Reaper becomes blocked by a green creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: It desires only to help others shed the itchy wet skin of life.

name: Phyrexian Slayer
text:
Flying
Whenever Phyrexian Slayer becomes blocked by a white creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: Benalia was only the first nation victimized by Tsabo Tavoc's specialized killers.

name: Scavenged Weaponry
text:
Enchant creature
When Scavenged Weaponry enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
flavor: "The Phyrexians have progressed," admired Urza. "Their parts are interchangeable."

name: Spreading Plague
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, destroy all other creatures that share a color with it. They can't be regenerated.
flavor: The cruelest strain of plague keeps its hosts alive long enough to return home and infect their families.

name: Tainted Well
text:
Enchant land
When Tainted Well enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted land is a Swamp.
flavor:
"No, *you* get the water. I ain't thirsty."
—Squee

name: Urborg Shambler
text: Other black creatures get -1/-1.
flavor: A writhing mass of rot, with sharp claws and a vicious spirit.

name: Ancient Kavu
text: {2}: Ancient Kavu becomes colorless until end of turn.
flavor: Those with the ability to change their nature survived Phyrexia's biological attacks. Everything else died.

name: Callous Giant
text: If a source would deal 3 or less damage to Callous Giant, prevent that damage.
flavor: "The invasion has awoken slumbering mountains," noted Urza. "Good. We can use all the help we can get."

name: Crown of Flames
text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Return Crown of Flames to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"All my life I've fought these monsters. Today I finish that fight."
—Barrin

name: Goblin Spy
text: Play with the top card of your library revealed.
flavor:
"Isn't he on our side?"
"Yep."
"Why's he spyin' on us?"
"Don't ask."

name: Kavu Monarch
text:
Kavu creatures have trample.
Whenever another Kavu enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Kavu Monarch.
flavor: Kavu emerged all across Dominaria, but the first and the strongest came from Yavimaya.

name: Kavu Scout
text: Domain — Kavu Scout gets +1/+0 for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor: The kavu evolved for centuries deep inside Dominaria, and some can draw from its strength.

name: Lightning Dart
text: Lightning Dart deals 1 damage to target creature. If that creature is white or blue, Lightning Dart deals 4 damage to it instead.
flavor: Broken and punctured by dozens of Phyrexian portals, the angry sky began to spit lightning back at the world.

name: Loafing Giant
text: Whenever Loafing Giant attacks or blocks, mill a card. If a land card was milled this way, prevent all combat damage Loafing Giant would deal this turn.
flavor: "Forget it. I'm not getting up today."

name: Ruby Leech
text:
First strike
Red spells you cast cost {R} more to cast.
flavor:
"Its gems didn't stop pulsating until they were completely removed."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Scarred Puma
text: Scarred Puma can't attack unless a black or green creature also attacks.
flavor: It's not eager to lose the *other* eye.

name: Searing Rays
text: Choose a color. Searing Rays deals damage to each player equal to the number of creatures of that color that player controls.
flavor:
"This is a battle of pawns, for the highest stakes imaginable."
—Urza

name: Shivan Harvest
text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonbasic land.
flavor:
"The blood of your ancestors ran heavy on this soil. Now it's your turn to sacrifice for the glory of Shiv."
—Viashino heretic

name: Skittish Kavu
text: Skittish Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as no opponent controls a white or blue creature.
flavor: Fierce when roused, this breed of kavu is easily distracted by a strong voice or melodic tune.

name: Slimy Kavu
text: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until end of turn.
flavor: Its slime liquefies the ground as efficiently as its fangs shred prey.

name: Tectonic Instability
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, tap all lands its controller controls.
flavor:
"Think of the problems we'll face if you uproot entire continents," said Urza.
"I have," replied Teferi, "but the alternative is worse."

name: Turf Wound
text:
Target player can't play lands this turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"I can't imagine how anyone lives in Shiv, let alone why they choose to stay."
—Sisay

name: Zap
text:
Zap deals 1 damage to any target.
Draw a card.
flavor: "All this time I thought Squee was useless," chuckled Sisay. "Who knew he'd be such a good shot?"

name: Bind
text:
Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.
flavor:
"The battlefield is cluttered enough. Be still."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

name: Blurred Mongoose
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"The mongoose blew out its candle and was asleep in bed before the room went dark."
—Llanowar fable

name: Jade Leech
text: Green spells you cast cost {G} more to cast.
flavor:
"It took magic to extract one of the stones and five people to carry it."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Kavu Chameleon
text:
This spell can't be countered.
{G}: Kavu Chameleon becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
flavor:
"They weren't part of my plan, but Gaea insisted."
—Urza

name: Kavu Lair
text: Whenever a creature with power 4 or greater enters the battlefield, its controller draws a card.
flavor: As a dark rain of Phyrexians fell from the sky, fountains of kavu erupted from the ground.

name: Llanowar Vanguard
text: {T}: Llanowar Vanguard gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
flavor: Llanowar rallied around Eladamri's banner and united in his name.

name: Pulse of Llanowar
text: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type.
flavor:
"Gaea's memory is eternal, and she exists in all things."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Quirion Sentinel
text: When Quirion Sentinel enters the battlefield, add one mana of any color.
flavor: All elvenkind stood against Phyrexia. The Quirion nation deployed its most spiritual adepts, who wielded the power of their native soil.

name: Quirion Trailblazer
text: When Quirion Trailblazer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: "All that matters is the path ahead."

name: Restock
text: Return two target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Restock.
flavor:
"We hid such stockpiles all over Rath. We should continue that practice here."
—Lin Sivvi

name: Saproling Infestation
text: Whenever a player kicks a spell, you create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
flavor: "My army took centuries to gather," remarked Urza. "Yavimaya seems to conjure hers out of thin air."

name: Scouting Trek
text: Search your library for any number of basic land cards, reveal those cards, then shuffle and put them on top.
flavor:
"I have chosen my path. Who will walk it with me?"
—Eladamri

name: Tangle
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Each attacking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: Gaea battles rampant death with abundant life.

name: Tranquility
text: Destroy all enchantments.
flavor: The plagues robbed Dominaria of all but its dreams. Eladamri hoped dreams were enough.

name: Wallop
text: Destroy target blue or black creature with flying.
flavor: In Yavimaya, flying low to join a battle can be a costly mistake.

name: Wandering Stream
text: Domain — You gain 2 life for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor:
"Dominaria touches us all."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Whip Silk
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
{G}: Return Whip Silk to its owner's hand.
flavor: Llanowar forges weapons of steel. Yavimaya grows her weapons within.

name: Abbey Griffin
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor:
"The darkness crawls with vampires and ghouls, but we are not without allies."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Angel of Flight Alabaster
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target Spirit card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: She endures without Avacyn but secretly asks each soul she guides if it has seen her.

name: Angelic Overseer
text:
Flying
As long as you control a Human, Angelic Overseer has hexproof and indestructible.
flavor: From mortal hope immortal power springs.

name: Avacynian Priest
text: {1}, {T}: Tap target non-Human creature.
flavor: Moorlanders speak in awe of the priests' talent for arriving just in time to drive off the wicked things that prowl the ravished parish.

name: Elite Inquisitor
text:
First strike, vigilance
Protection from Vampires, from Werewolves, and from Zombies
flavor: "No matter how many I kill, there are always more to hunt. It makes me smile just to think about it."

name: Gallows Warden
text:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +0/+1.
flavor: The spirit cares nothing for the crimes or triumphs of the slain. It shelters all beneath its stormy cloak.

name: Nevermore
text:
As Nevermore enters the battlefield, choose a nonland card name.
Spells with the chosen name can't be cast.
flavor: "By the law of Avacyn, the following thoughts, words, and deeds are henceforth disallowed."

name: Paraselene
text: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 1 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.
flavor:
"Moonlight has a way of showing all things as they truly are—for better or for worse."
—Zilla of Lambholt

name: Selfless Cathar
text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Selfless Cathar: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "If I fail to offer myself, we will surely be overrun. My fate would be the same."

name: Spare from Evil
text: Creatures you control gain protection from non-Human creatures until end of turn.
flavor:
"As long as we can utter a prayer or lift a weapon, we have the power to fight back."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Spectral Rider
text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
flavor: Never a word. Never a warning. Only the sound of hoofbeats along the crossways, and the screams of the avenged.

name: Stony Silence
text: Activated abilities of artifacts can't be activated.
flavor:
Let moss grow over gargoyles
—Gavony saying meaning "forget painful memories"

name: Thraben Purebloods
flavor:
"I've learned to trust my dogs' instincts. When they're calm, I'm calm. And when they get nervous, I get my crossbow."
—Hinrik of House Cecani

name: Thraben Sentry // Thraben Militia
text:
Vigilance
Whenever another creature you control dies, you may transform Thraben Sentry.
flavor: "Looks like it's going to be a quiet night."

name: Urgent Exorcism
text: Destroy target Spirit or enchantment.
flavor:
"To show geists pity is to prolong their agonies. Whether they know it or not, they seek the Blessed Sleep, and we are to give it to them."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Voiceless Spirit
text: Flying, first strike
flavor:
"I'd rather take on a neckbiter or moonhowler any day. Oh well, looks like I'm going to end up parrying with empty air half the night."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer

name: Armored Skaab
text: When Armored Skaab enters the battlefield, mill four cards.
flavor: Literally made for battle.

name: Back from the Brink
text: Exile a creature card from your graveyard and pay its mana cost: Create a token that's a copy of that card. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: On Innistrad, death is just a career change.

name: Battleground Geist
text:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +1/+0.
flavor: Not content to nudge vases and chill drawing rooms, some geists muster spectral armies to claw at the hearts of the living.

name: Curse of the Bloody Tome
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player mills two cards.
flavor: After seeing his life's work drip away, the mage decided it was a good time to go crazy.

name: Fortress Crab
flavor: Unbreakable and unappetizing, the crab grows uninterrupted, sometimes to the size of a cottage and beyond.

name: Frightful Delusion
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}. That player discards a card.
flavor: Whether he actually exists is in question, but the terror she feels is excruciatingly real.

name: Hysterical Blindness
text: Creatures your opponents control get -4/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The panic is amusing, but the real fun comes when the spell passes and the villagers start looking for a scapegoat."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Invisible Stalker
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Invisible Stalker can't be blocked.
flavor: "All that concerns me is the vampires' sense of smell and those freezing Nephalian nights."

name: Laboratory Maniac
text: If you would draw a card while your library has no cards in it, you win the game instead.
flavor: His mind whirled with grand plans, never thinking of what might happen if he were to succeed.

name: Lantern Spirit
text:
Flying
{U}: Return Lantern Spirit to its owner's hand.
flavor: Bound to the square where she died, she calls out to those in danger—usually scaring them straight into the peril she warns of.

name: Lost in the Mist
text: Counter target spell. Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: The secrets she carried could have saved many lives, but they quietly drowned with her.

name: Ludevic's Test Subject // Ludevic's Abomination
text: Trample
flavor: After several frustrating experiments, the visionary Ludevic realized he needed to create a monster that fed on torch-wielding mobs.

name: Moon Heron
text: Flying
flavor: The heron is the symbol of the archangel Avacyn. The fact that such spirits still fly gives the church hope that its founder may one day return.

name: Rooftop Storm
text: You may pay {0} rather than pay the mana cost for Zombie creature spells you cast.
flavor:
"Let those idiot priests tremble! A new era in unlife begins here and now. Oglor, raise the lightning vane!"
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Selhoff Occultist
text: Whenever Selhoff Occultist or another creature dies, target player mills a card.
flavor: "The mist whispers to those who know it to be more than a mundane fog."

name: Sensory Deprivation
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
flavor: They call it "stitcher's anesthesia," a spell to deaden the senses while the mad doctors begin their grisly work.

name: Spectral Flight
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
flavor:
"The church looks down on binding spirits into armor, but now I can look down on them."
—Dierk, geistmage

name: Stitcher's Apprentice
text: {1}{U}, {T}: Create a 2/2 blue Homunculus creature token, then sacrifice a creature.
flavor: "Oglor create life, Oglor take it away. Oglor god! . . . until Master return."

name: Curse of Death's Hold
text:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls get -1/-1.
flavor: "May you and all your kin waste and wither until your clan is no more!"

name: Curse of Oblivion
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player exiles two cards from their graveyard.
flavor: The first step to peace is to learn how to forget.

name: Ghoulcaller's Chant
text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return two target Zombie cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"The living are born small and weak. The dead rise ready to serve. The choice is obvious."
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony

name: Gruesome Deformity
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has intimidate. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
flavor: She wanted to inspire terror wherever she went. The demons happily granted her wish.

name: Heartless Summoning
text:
Creature spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
Creatures you control get -1/-1.
flavor:
"They won't be winning any beauty pageants, but they'll do the trick."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Manor Skeleton
text:
Haste
{1}{B}: Regenerate Manor Skeleton.
flavor: Lungs dried to parchment wheeze blasphemies within a cage of bleached bone.

name: Markov Patrician
text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: Vampires of the Markov bloodline pride themselves on their exquisite taste in fashion, art, and "wine of the vein."

name: Maw of the Mire
text: Destroy target land. You gain 4 life.
flavor: As the chapel was dragged under, the bell in the tower rang until the murky depths forever silenced its toll.

name: Night Terrors
text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
flavor: Innistrad is a place where dreams invade the mind and mere shadows exact a terrible toll.

name: Rotting Fensnake
flavor: Its venom sacs are long gone, but its crushing strength is somehow greater than ever.

name: Screeching Bat // Stalking Vampire
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {2}{B}{B}. If you do, transform Screeching Bat.
flavor: The bat has such clarity of hearing that simple sounds become symphonies.

name: Skeletal Grimace
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has "{B}: Regenerate this creature."
flavor:
"And then I realized we all have skeletons on the inside. Why wait until the bodies are dead to control them?"
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Village Cannibals
text: Whenever another Human creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Village Cannibals.
flavor: Some have endured the horrors of Innistrad by becoming the worst monsters of all.

name: Walking Corpse
flavor:
"Is it hopeless? When wave upon wave of our dead return as mindless flesh-eaters to claw upon Thraben's walls? We're too busy cutting them down to indulge ourselves in such philosophical foppery."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Balefire Dragon
text:
Flying
Whenever Balefire Dragon deals combat damage to a player, it deals that much damage to each creature that player controls.
flavor: If it comes for you, die boldly or die swiftly—for die you will.

name: Bloodcrazed Neonate
text:
Bloodcrazed Neonate attacks each combat if able.
Whenever Bloodcrazed Neonate deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: While elder vampires select their meals with care, the newly sired frenzy at the first whiff.

name: Crossway Vampire
text: When Crossway Vampire enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
flavor: "Do not flatter Fate. It did not guide you into my clutches tonight. That was all my doing."

name: Curse of Stalked Prey
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to enchanted player, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
flavor:
"Innocent thorns can fill the air with your bloodscent. Don't stray from the path."
—Elmut, crossway watcher

name: Curse of the Pierced Heart
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of the Pierced Heart deals 1 damage to that player or a planeswalker that player controls.
flavor:
"May your veins weep, and may every vampire take notice."
—Stensian curse

name: Falkenrath Marauders
text:
Flying, haste
Whenever Falkenrath Marauders deals combat damage to a player, put two +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor: No slinking in the dark for them, no luring whispers. They claim their prey in the speed and glory of the hunt.

name: Feral Ridgewolf
text:
Trample
{1}{R}: Feral Ridgewolf gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The wolves no longer hunt just to feed. They kill for sport, or for some madness behind their eyes."
—Elmut, crossway watcher

name: Furor of the Bitten
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each combat if able.
flavor: Those who only believe themselves infected with lycanthropy can be as dangerous as those who really are.

name: Hanweir Watchkeep // Bane of Hanweir
text:
Defender
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hanweir Watchkeep.
flavor: He scans for wolves, knowing there's one he can never anticipate.

name: Harvest Pyre
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile X cards from your graveyard.
Harvest Pyre deals X damage to target creature.
flavor: Corpses destroyed by fire form the most destructive geists.

name: Infernal Plunge
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add {R}{R}{R}.
flavor: "Oh mighty Griselbrand, Scourge of the Heedless World, gladly I consume myself for thee!"

name: Into the Maw of Hell
text: Destroy target land. Into the Maw of Hell deals 13 damage to target creature.
flavor: Few entrances lead to where demons and devils lurk. Unfortunately, they occasionally open new ones.

name: Kessig Wolf
text: {1}{R}: Kessig Wolf gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Don't be afraid when you hear the wolves howl. Be afraid when you don't hear them at all."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer

name: Kruin Outlaw // Terror of Kruin Pass
text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Kruin Outlaw.
flavor: "Hold tight. I've got a surprise for them."

name: Night Revelers
text: Night Revelers has haste as long as an opponent controls a Human.
flavor: Vampires think of themselves as the indisputable nobility of Innistrad, able to do as they please. There are few who can prove them wrong.

name: Nightbird's Clutches
text:
Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: Shiny polished silver can ward off many creatures, but it attracts others.

name: Rage Thrower
text: Whenever another creature dies, Rage Thrower deals 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: "Some lament these haunted times, but I'm a geistflame-tank-half-full kind of person."

name: Reckless Waif // Merciless Predator
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Reckless Waif.
flavor: "Yes, I'm alone. No, I'm not worried."

name: Riot Devils
flavor: Devils are demons' unearthly desires made flesh. Let loose on the world, they satisfy their mad craving for destruction in a whirlwind of chaos.

name: Scourge of Geier Reach
text: Scourge of Geier Reach gets +1/+1 for each creature your opponents control.
flavor: Stensian villagers mourned the loss of human life. Thraben vampire slayers mourned the loss of living wood.

name: Stromkirk Noble
text:
Stromkirk Noble can't be blocked by Humans.
Whenever Stromkirk Noble deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: "A responsible king walks among his subjects."

name: Tormented Pariah // Rampaging Werewolf
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Tormented Pariah.
flavor: "Hey lads, the moon's rising. All the better to watch him beg for mercy."

name: Traitorous Blood
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains trample and haste until end of turn.
flavor:
"I can make you dance to my tune like a puppet, your very blood eager to obey."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Vampiric Fury
text: Vampire creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Many peasants secretly admire vampires' glamour and elegance—until they witness a moment of pure bloodlust.

name: Village Ironsmith // Ironfang
text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Village Ironsmith.
flavor: Each night, he abandons the trappings of civilization.

name: Bramblecrush
text: Destroy target noncreature permanent.
flavor:
"Civilization is fertilizer."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Darkthicket Wolf
text: {2}{G}: Darkthicket Wolf gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: Werewolf slayers don't know for certain how werewolves are created. So they kill all the wolves, just to be safe.

name: Elder of Laurels
text: {3}{G}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.
flavor: Hopes and prayers can carry the same force as swords and torches.

name: Essence of the Wild
text: Creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of Essence of the Wild.
flavor: Wander too far into the wild and it may take you for its own.

name: Full Moon's Rise
text:
Werewolf creatures you control get +1/+0 and have trample.
Sacrifice Full Moon's Rise: Regenerate all Werewolf creatures you control.
flavor: Some lycanthropes wish they could abandon their weak human shapes and revel in the power of the wolf.

name: Gatstaf Shepherd // Gatstaf Howler
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Gatstaf Shepherd.
flavor:
"What is worse than a wolf in sheep's clothing?"
—Wolfhunter's riddle

name: Grave Bramble
text: Defender, protection from Zombies
flavor: Nature abhors a zombie.

name: Grizzled Outcasts // Krallenhorde Wantons
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Grizzled Outcasts.
flavor: Seen as unsavory, the hunters were never allowed in town—until one night they vanished.

name: Hollowhenge Scavenger
text: Morbid — When Hollowhenge Scavenger enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, you gain 5 life.
flavor: After werewolves slaughtered the citizenry of Hollowhenge, other creatures moved in.

name: Kindercatch
flavor: In the forest villages of Kessig, parents feed their children wormwood and other bitter herbs, hoping to make them less palatable to things that roam the night.

name: Lumberknot
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Lumberknot.
flavor: Animated by geists fused in its oak, it hungers for more life to add to its core.

name: Make a Wish
text: Return two cards at random from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: In Gavony wishing is taken as a sign of weakness, yet the wells usually brim with silver.

name: Mayor of Avabruck // Howlpack Alpha
text:
Other Human creatures you control get +1/+1.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mayor of Avabruck.
flavor: He can deny his true nature for only so long.

name: Orchard Spirit
text: Orchard Spirit can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
flavor:
"Pick not the rotten fruit, but neither touch the best. Leave those as an offering for our unseen guests."
—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf

name: Parallel Lives
text: If an effect would create one or more tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.
flavor:
"There will come a time when the only prey left will be each other."
—Ulrich of Krallenhorde Pack

name: Ranger's Guile
text: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: In the remote corners of Kessig, protection is found in secret powers unknown to the Church of Avacyn.

name: Somberwald Spider
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Morbid — Somberwald Spider enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
flavor: Stensian vampires encourage spiders near their manors so they can rob the webs.

name: Ulvenwald Mystics // Ulvenwald Primordials
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Ulvenwald Mystics.
flavor: "With this ritual, we cast aside our fragile humanity . . ."

name: Villagers of Estwald // Howlpack of Estwald
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Villagers of Estwald.
flavor: You can spot a werewolf-infested town by its lack of butcher shops.

name: Woodland Sleuth
text: Morbid — When Woodland Sleuth enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "Whatever did this is near. Death reversion has not yet occurred. Be alert!"

name: Wreath of Geists
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
flavor: Before you travel the woods of Kessig, first get permission from those who died trying.

name: Genesis
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Genesis is in your graveyard, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"First through the Riftstone was Genesis—and the world was lifeless no more."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Overwhelming Forces
text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
flavor: By the year 208, Cao Cao commanded more than 1,000 experienced generals and a million infantry, cavalry, and naval troops.

name: Temporal Manipulation
text: Take an extra turn after this one.
flavor: Doing something at the last minute isn't so bad when you can make that minute last.

name: Ravages of War
text: Destroy all lands.
flavor:
"Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war."
—Lao Tzu, *Tao Te Ching*,
trans. Feng and English

name: Capture of Jingzhou
text: Take an extra turn after this one.
flavor: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.

name: Teferi's Protection
text:
Until your next turn, your life total can't change and you gain protection from everything. All permanents you control phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before you untap during your untap step.)
Exile Teferi's Protection.
flavor:
"Someday, when the world is safe again, my homeland will return."
—Teferi

name: Mirri's Guile
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor: Hanna was astounded. Mirri read every leaf and wisp of breeze like a book of ancient lore.

name: Sylvan Tutor
text: Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.
flavor: The whole of creation stood transfixed, silenced by the weight of anticipation.

name: Bear Cub
flavor:
Every little cub has its mother's teeth to guard it.
—Elvish saying

name: Ingenious Leonin
text: {3}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on another target attacking creature you control. If that creature is a Cat, it gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Leonin claws were already deadly weapons of natural evolution before he improved upon them.

name: Merfolk Pupil
text:
When Merfolk Pupil enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
{1}{U}, Exile Merfolk Pupil from your graveyard: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: Maintaining a personal bubble is even more important when you have gills.

name: Soul Read
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.
• Draw two cards.
flavor: It's easy to be two steps ahead when you can see their every thought.

name: Synchronized Eviction
text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if you control at least two creatures that share a creature type.
Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library second from the top.
flavor: "I told you this one would be a handful."

name: Conductor of Cacophony
text:
Conductor of Cacophony enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{B}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Conductor of Cacophony: It deals 1 damage to each other creature and each player.
flavor:
Only an imitation of tortured shrieking
—or so the Rakdos claim.

name: Creeping Bloodsucker
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Creeping Bloodsucker deals 1 damage to each opponent. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
flavor:
"If a vampire were feeding on you every night, wouldn't you have bite marks? Stop wasting my time."
—Donya, village healer

name: Deadly Plot
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target creature or planeswalker.
• Return target Zombie creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
flavor:
"Open grave available, only one previous tenant."
—Sign on cemetery gate

name: Disciple of Perdition
text:
When Disciple of Perdition dies, choose one. If you have exactly 13 life, you may choose both.
• You draw a card and you lose 1 life.
• Exile target opponent's graveyard. That player loses 1 life.
flavor: "Could you please spare some of your blood for my precious little tree?"

name: Ossuary Rats
text: When Ossuary Rats enters the battlefield, it deals X damage to target creature or planeswalker an opponent controls, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
flavor: You know you've ventured too deep when the rats stop running and hold their ground.

name: Skullslither Worm
text: When Skullslither Worm enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card. For each opponent who can't, put two +1/+1 counters on Skullslither Worm.
flavor: As larvae, they burrow into a host's brain to feed upon it, growing until they're large enough to burst free and seek out larger prey.

name: Suspicious Shambler
text: {4}{B}{B}, Exile Suspicious Shambler from your graveyard: Create two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: It was the perfect disguise—at least until its stomach started moaning.

name: Termination Facilitator
text:
{T}: Put a bounty counter on target creature or planeswalker. Activate only as a sorcery.
Whenever a creature or planeswalker an opponent controls with a bounty counter on it is dealt damage, destroy it.
flavor: "You sign. They die. As simple as that."

name: Coalborn Entity
text: {2}{R}: Coalborn Entity deals 1 damage to target creature token, player, or planeswalker.
flavor: The blacksmith forgot to feed the forge, so the forge fed itself.

name: Daring Piracy
text: At the beginning of your combat on your turn, create a 1/1 red Pirate creature token with menace and haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: Sky pirates often leap randomly into the fray and assume there will be something to land on.

name: Goblin Researcher
text: When Goblin Researcher enters the battlefield, exile the top card of your library. During any turn you attacked with Goblin Researcher, you may play that card.
flavor: Slonk was struck by lightning twenty-seven times before he got the idea. Another forty-three hits and he'd perfected it.

name: Plundering Predator
text:
Flying
When Plundering Predator enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
flavor: You can gather a tidy fortune if you can avoid getting clobbered by falling treasure.

name: Giant Ladybug
text:
Reach
When Giant Ladybug enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.
flavor: It's bad luck to step on one, but worse luck to have one step on you.

name: Mild-Mannered Librarian
text: {3}{G}: Mild-Mannered Librarian becomes a Werewolf. Put two +1/+1 counters on it and you draw a card. Activate only once.
flavor: She had always believed in the transformative powers of great literature.

name: Primeval Herald
text:
Trample
Whenever Primeval Herald enters the battlefield or attacks, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: When they call, nature answers.

name: Rampaging Growth
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put it on the battlefield, then shuffle. Until end of turn, that land becomes a 4/3 Insect creature with reach and haste. It's still a land.
flavor: When they had the house checked for bugs, they didn't think big enough.

name: Spectral Hunt-Caller
text: {5}{G}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor: The nightsong begins with a lone howl, but soon swells to a deafening chorus.

name: Towering Gibbon
text:
Reach
Towering Gibbon's power is equal to the greatest mana value among creatures you control.
flavor: "Don't worry, folks. We're perfectly safe here. That's a banana processing plant."

name: Infernal Idol
text:
{T}: Add {B}.
{1}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Infernal Idol: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
flavor:
"The courier's death was regrettable, but then again, she was warned not to touch it."
—Lord Xander

name: Arrest
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
flavor: Getting caught was bad enough, but being rolled to the the detention center was by far the worst part.

name: Flicker of Fate
text: Exile target creature or enchantment, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
flavor: "Sure, I've got nine lives, but that doesn't mean I'm keen to waste one now."

name: Mirror Image
text: You may have Mirror Image enter the battlefield as a copy of a creature you control.
flavor: "Do I really look like that? I'm . . . beautiful!"

name: Preordain
text: Scry 2, then draw a card. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
flavor: In a Multiverse of endless possibilities, Aminatou decided to experience all of them.

name: Spectral Sailor
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
{3}{U}: Draw a card.
flavor: "Permission to haunt aboard, cap'n?"

name: Feast on the Fallen
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if an opponent lost life last turn, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
flavor: He only paused to catch his breath, not knowing that it would be his last.

name: Oathsworn Vampire
text:
Oathsworn Vampire enters the battlefield tapped.
You may cast Oathsworn Vampire from your graveyard if you gained life this turn.
flavor: "Neither time nor death could keep me from upholding our pact."

name: Stitcher's Supplier
text: When Stitcher's Supplier enters the battlefield or dies, mill three cards.
flavor: "Let me give you a hand. He won't be needing it; he's left-handed. Also dead."

name: Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker
text:
Haste
{T}: Create a token that's a copy of target nonlegendary creature you control, except it has haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "Wanna see a neat trick?"

name: Rigging Runner
text:
First strike
Raid — Rigging Runner enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if you attacked this turn.
flavor: "Prepare to be boarded! Or don't. I'm coming over either way."

name: Spear Spewer
text:
Defender
{T}: Spear Spewer deals 1 damage to each player.
flavor:
"Okay, maybe the 962nd spear will be the one that gets 'em!"
—Kreech, ballista operator

name: Caustic Caterpillar
text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Caustic Caterpillar: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor:
"That was a Consulate spy thopter. Leave the caterpillar to its meal."
—Pia Nalaar, renegade inventor

name: Elvish Rejuvenator
text: When Elvish Rejuvenator enters the battlefield, look at the top five cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them onto the battlefield tapped. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
flavor: "As long as its roots still reach the soil, I can heal it."

name: Feast of Blood
text:
Cast this spell only if you control two or more Vampires.
Destroy target creature. You gain 4 life.
flavor:
"The best part of a wedding is the cutting of the cake, followed closely by the cutting of the cake decorator."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Festering Evil
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Festering Evil deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
{B}{B}, Sacrifice Festering Evil: It deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: Evil is never absent, only hidden.

name: Aftershock
text: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land. Aftershock deals 3 damage to you.
flavor: Deciding the house's ownership through a wizard duel had sounded like a brilliant idea at the time.

name: Acrobatic Maneuver
text:
Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
Draw a card.
flavor: Renegades find ever more creative ways to work around the Consulate's aether regulations.

name: Aethershield Artificer
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, target artifact creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
flavor: Most smiths shape metal, but some prefer more delicate materials.

name: Alseid of Life's Bounty
text:
Lifelink
{1}, Sacrifice Alseid of Life's Bounty: Target creature or enchantment you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
flavor:
"Dawn-kissed, he nourishes the golden grain."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet

name: Apothecary Geist
text:
Flying
When Apothecary Geist enters the battlefield, if you control another Spirit, you gain 3 life.
flavor: For some customers, the old apothecary shop still opens its doors.

name: Attended Healer
text:
Whenever you gain life for the first time each turn, create a 1/1 white Cat creature token.
{2}{W}: Another target Cleric gains lifelink until end of turn.
flavor: "My cats have taught me more about the sacred than anything in some old ruin."

name: Basri's Acolyte
text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
When Basri's Acolyte enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures you control.
flavor: Basri carries on his god's legacy, spreading her teachings throughout the Multiverse.

name: Blessed Spirits
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Blessed Spirits.
flavor: Not all heroes die in armor.

name: Brightmare
text: When Brightmare enters the battlefield, tap up to one target creature. You gain life equal to that creature's power.
flavor: A ray of hope in the darkest night.

name: Bring to Trial
text: Exile target creature with power 4 or greater.
flavor: "In you go, big guy. Watch your head."

name: Built to Last
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's an artifact creature, it gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
flavor: Consulate-built automatons have a lifetime warranty.

name: Captivating Unicorn
text: Constellation — Whenever an enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls.
flavor:
"Gazing at the unicorn, I felt closer to the majesty of Nyx than I ever had before."
—Oineus, traveling merchant

name: Combat Professor
text:
Flying
At the beginning of combat on your turn, target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains vigilance until end of turn.
flavor: "Before Yovus was cut down at Pranticle Peak, she performed which maneuver? Anyone? From the reading?"

name: Dawning Angel
text:
Flying
When Dawning Angel enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor:
"As the sun rose behind the Bone Spire, an angel appeared over the charnel fields, bringing a surge of new hope."
—Krinnea, *Siege of the Bone Spire*

name: Daybreak Chaplain
text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: "May the light shine through me to guide the lost."

name: Daybreak Charger
text: When Daybreak Charger enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: It's often mistaken for the coming dawn as it gallops across the horizon.

name: Divine Verdict
text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: Giants and pit spawn attempted to topple the cathedral's pillars. The fine grit of their remains still swirls in the breeze outside.

name: Dreadful Apathy
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
{2}{W}: Exile enchanted creature.
flavor: Those whose lives were uninspired are doomed to the wretched tedium of Phylias in death.

name: Favored of Iroas
text: Constellation — Whenever an enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, Favored of Iroas gains double strike until end of turn.
flavor: "The promise of victory fills my heart. There is no room for fear."

name: Forced Worship
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
{2}{W}: Return Forced Worship to its owner's hand.
flavor: Imprisonment teaches revenge. Hobbling teaches resignation.

name: Gallant Cavalry
text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
When Gallant Cavalry enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.
flavor: "Our duty does not stop at our borders."

name: Giant Ox
text: Giant Ox crews Vehicles using its toughness rather than its power.
flavor:
"How strong is he? Well, I once lost control of the plow, and he carved a furrow right through my house! Didn't even slow down."
—Guldir, Beskir farmer

name: Glory Bearers
text: Whenever another creature you control attacks, it gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "We are bearers of the ancient light, keepers of sun-crowned Heliod's blessings. Fight, and the light will protect you!"

name: Hotshot Mechanic
text: Hotshot Mechanic crews Vehicles as though its power were 2 greater.
flavor: "If your mech is factory standard, you might as well be walking."

name: Imperial Aerosaur
text:
Flying
When Imperial Aerosaur enters the battlefield, another target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Its assistance is unnervingly similar to its hunting technique.

name: Inspiring Cleric
text: When Inspiring Cleric enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor: "The Immortal Sun will bring us true eternal life to replace the everlasting shadow of undeath."

name: Inspiring Overseer
text:
Flying
When Inspiring Overseer enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life and draw a card.
flavor:
"This city could certainly use a bit more divine intervention."
—Inspector Jillard

name: Justiciar's Portal
text: Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. It gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: With the new guildmaster's innovations, arresters can arrive on the scene moments before a crime is committed.

name: Kitsune Ace
text:
Whenever a Vehicle you control attacks, choose one —
• That Vehicle gains first strike until end of turn.
• Untap Kitsune Ace.
flavor: "Oh, sorry—were we racing?"

name: Law-Rune Enforcer
text: {1}, {T}: Tap target creature with mana value 2 or greater.
flavor:
"See that no one enters or leaves New Prahv today. And notify me at once of any Planeswalker activity."
—Dovin Baan

name: Leonin Warleader
text: Whenever Leonin Warleader attacks, create two 1/1 white Cat creature tokens with lifelink that are tapped and attacking.
flavor: When one leonin hunts, many more are surely nearby.

name: Mesa Lynx
text: As long as it's not your turn, Mesa Lynx gets +0/+2.
flavor: Its ferocity is tempered by patience, knowing it must wait for just the right moment to strike a killing blow.

name: Michiko Konda, Truth Seeker
text: Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, that player sacrifices a permanent.
flavor:
"Watch over my father. Tell him I'm safe, but I won't come home until I find out how to bring him back to his senses, and Kamigawa is again at peace."
—Michiko Konda, last letter to General Takeno

name: Moment of Triumph
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. You gain 2 life.
flavor: "The time of salvation is at hand. Dusk washes over the world, and the Legion will rise immortal!"

name: Nightguard Patrol
text: First strike, vigilance
flavor: "The Wojek defend the laws. We defend the people."

name: Not Forgotten
text: Put target card from a graveyard on the top or bottom of its owner's library. Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
flavor: Visit the dead, and they may return the favor.

name: Order of the Golden Cricket
text: Whenever Order of the Golden Cricket attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, it gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"Should you take it in mind to ride a springjack, remember: there are easier ways to fly, and harder ways to break your skull."
—Lann of Cloverdell

name: Phalanx Tactics
text: Target creature you control gets +2/+1 until end of turn. Each other creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Every soldier has a place to stand and a role to play.

name: Pillardrop Rescuer
text:
Flying
When Pillardrop Rescuer enters the battlefield, return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Gentle hands of stone whisk the careless from the crumbling ruins of Pillardrop.

name: Pious Wayfarer
text: Constellation — Whenever an enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Every footstep is a prayer, every road a temple.

name: Pouncing Lynx
text: As long as it's your turn, Pouncing Lynx has first strike.
flavor: "I don't understand. He's normally so well behaved!"

name: Prowling Felidar
text:
Vigilance
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Prowling Felidar.
flavor: On occasion, felidars leave meaty "gifts" outside the tents of explorers they consider worthy.

name: Rambunctious Mutt
text: When Rambunctious Mutt enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact or enchantment an opponent controls.
flavor: Emphatic words with powerful gestures. Clearly this was playtime.

name: Savannah Sage
text: When Savannah Sage enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor: "Now is not the time for your light to fade."

name: Seller of Songbirds
text: When Seller of Songbirds enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying.
flavor:
"Lady Wren is the one merchant in Keyhole Downs who isn't running a scam."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar

name: Spirited Companion
text: When Spirited Companion enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: It formed a friendship with several playful spirits, and soon "the pack" was known as the source of much mischief in Eiganjo.

name: Stalwart Valkyrie
text:
You may pay {1}{W} and exile a creature card from your graveyard rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Flying
flavor: "Only the worthy may pass."

name: Starnheim Aspirant
text: Angel spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
flavor: "I do not fear death. I know my soul will rise to Starnheim, where I will feast forever among valkyries and heroes. Can you say the same?"

name: Steppe Lynx
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Steppe Lynx gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Nothing quickens the predator's blood like the unfamiliar scents of new hunting grounds and the mewling cries of new prey.

name: Taranika, Akroan Veteran
text:
Vigilance
Whenever Taranika, Akroan Veteran attacks, untap another target creature you control. Until end of turn, that creature has base power and toughness 4/4 and gains indestructible.
flavor: "I like to think Kytheon keeps watch over all of us."

name: Tempered Veteran
text:
{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{4}{W}{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor: "I've been carrying a sword since before you were born. I wouldn't give up my oath for all the peace and comfort in the world."

name: Trained Caracal
text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: Some Ravnicans consider carrying a sword to be beneath them, preferring instead a tooth-and-claw escort.

name: Transcendent Envoy
text:
Flying
Aura spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor:
"The first griffins were made by the gods to capture falling stars; they were given the keenest eyes and the swiftest wings, and sent to keep watch above the clouds."
—*The Cosmogony*

name: Valkyrie Harbinger
text:
Flying, lifelink
At the beginning of each end step, if you gained 4 or more life this turn, create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying and vigilance.
flavor: Where she flies, the Light of Starnheim shines.

name: Valorous Steed
text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
When Valorous Steed enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.
flavor: A unicorn chooses only the most virtuous and noble of knights to be its companion.

name: Weight of Conscience
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Tap two untapped creatures you control that share a creature type: Exile enchanted creature.
flavor: Sometimes the weight of the world on your shoulders is a literal one.

name: Aeronaut Tinkerer
text: Aeronaut Tinkerer has flying as long as you control an artifact. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: "All tinkerers have their heads in the clouds. I don't intend to stop there."

name: Aviation Pioneer
text: When Aviation Pioneer enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
flavor: "They say perfection is unattainable, but they said that about flight too."

name: Barrin, Tolarian Archmage
text:
When Barrin, Tolarian Archmage enters the battlefield, return up to one other target creature or planeswalker to its owner's hand.
At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent was put into your hand from the battlefield this turn, draw a card.
flavor: "There is no age at which you stop learning."

name: Bury in Books
text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if it targets an attacking creature.
Put target creature into its owner's library second from the top.
flavor: There are no weapons allowed in the Biblioplex, but a clever mage is never truly defenseless.

name: Chillerpillar
text:
{4}{S}{S}: Monstrosity 2. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous. {S} can be paid with one mana from a snow source.)
As long as Chillerpillar is monstrous, it has flying.
flavor: From its cocoon, a flurry takes flight.

name: Chilling Trap
text: Target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn. If you control a Wizard, draw a card.
flavor:
"Serves you right for rushing ahead."
—Kaliea, Sea Gate trapfinder

name: Drownyard Explorers
text: When Drownyard Explorers enters the battlefield, investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: "Angels and inquisitors terrorize villages, but no one seems to notice the stirring out at sea."

name: Elite Instructor
text: When Elite Instructor enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: The greatest minds in Meletis study under the masters at the Dekatia, a renowned school of magic and philosophy.

name: Erdwal Illuminator
text:
Flying
Whenever you investigate for the first time each turn, investigate an additional time.
flavor:
"When all else fails, follow the geist's lantern."
—Vallon, Thraben inspector

name: Eyekite
text:
Flying
Eyekite gets +2/+0 as long as you've drawn two or more cards this turn.
flavor:
"This one will need direction. After all, each of its eyes is larger than its brain."
—Cyla, Lord of the Aerie

name: Fallowsage
text: Whenever Fallowsage becomes tapped, you may draw a card.
flavor: Memories of ages past are said to swim the minds of lounging fallowsages.

name: Floodhound
text: {3}, {T}: Investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: The thief doubled back twice, doused herself with perfume, crossed the ocean, and still woke up with her pursuer close on her heels.

name: Frostpeak Yeti
text: {1}{S}: Frostpeak Yeti can't be blocked this turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow source.)
flavor: Some heroes line their coats with yeti fur. More yetis line their bellies with heroes.

name: Gearseeker Serpent
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.
{5}{U}: Gearseeker Serpent can't be blocked this turn.
flavor: Its collection is vast, yet each ship has a special place in its heart.

name: Gearsmith Prodigy
text: Gearsmith Prodigy gets +1/+0 as long as you control an artifact.
flavor: Young artificers on Kaladesh let their imaginations run wild.

name: Glen Elendra Pranksters
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may return target creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Victims spirited through a faerie ring find themselves stranded miles away.

name: Icebind Pillar
text: {S}, {T}: Tap target artifact or creature. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow source.)
flavor:
"Oh, Valki. I'm disappointed in you. How could the god of lies be so gullible?"
—Tibalt

name: Jace's Scrutiny
text:
Target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn.
Investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: "Just a collage of images: cryptoliths, the sea, a tangle of shipwrecks."

name: Library Larcenist
text: Whenever Library Larcenist attacks, draw a card.
flavor: "I specialize in missing manuscripts, pilfered poetry, and lifted letters."

name: Littjara Kinseekers
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
When Littjara Kinseekers enters the battlefield, if you control three or more creatures that share a creature type, put a +1/+1 counter on Littjara Kinseekers, then scry 1.
flavor: Like calls to like, and none are forgotten.

name: Lookout's Dispersal
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control a Pirate.
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.
flavor: Her song plucks the strings of the storm, shifting wind and storm into a harmony that will carry her ship to safety.

name: Lumengrid Sentinel
text:
Flying
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may tap target permanent.
flavor: The vedalken order their Neurok sentinels to watch over the shores of the Quicksilver Sea, as if they know of intruders yet to come.

name: Military Intelligence
text: Whenever you attack with two or more creatures, draw a card.
flavor: To know the battlefield is to anticipate the enemy. To know the enemy is to anticipate victory.

name: Mistwalker
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Flying
{1}{U}: Mistwalker gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"To escape Littjara, follow a bird."
—Tuskeri folklore

name: Moonfolk Puzzlemaker
text:
Flying
Whenever Moonfolk Puzzlemaker becomes tapped, scry 1.
flavor: "Research is hardly the dry, serious pastime outsiders make it out to be."

name: Mystic Skyfish
text: Whenever you draw your second card each turn, Mystic Skyfish gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: The problem wasn't that fish had learned how to fly. It was that sharks had adapted to follow them.

name: No Escape
text:
Counter target creature or planeswalker spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
Scry 1.
flavor: Jace surmised that they were walking into Bolas's trap. He felt no joy in being right.

name: Octoprophet
text: When Octoprophet enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
flavor: In every swirl of the tide, it sees the awakening of things yet to come.

name: One With the Wind
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
flavor:
"River and sea, jungle and sky. Water flows freely between the two halves of the world. We are creatures of the water."
—Shaper Tuvasa

name: Oneirophage
text:
Flying
Whenever you draw a card, put a +1/+1 counter on Oneirophage.
flavor: It manifests at wizard academies to siphon inspiration from young prodigies.

name: Perilous Voyage
text: Return target nonland permanent you don't control to its owner's hand. If its mana value was 2 or less, scry 2.
flavor: For the first time in her life, Vraska tried to prevent death.

name: Pestermite
text:
Flash
Flying
When Pestermite enters the battlefield, you may tap or untap target permanent.
flavor: The fae know when they're not wanted. That's precisely why they show up.

name: Pilfering Hawk
text:
Flying
{S}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow source.)
flavor:
"Well, at least it left us a mouse in exchange. Er . . . ugh . . . make that half a mouse."
—Binhald, Beskir veteran

name: River Sneak
text:
River Sneak can't be blocked.
Whenever another Merfolk enters the battlefield under your control, River Sneak gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: No ripples, no splashes, no warning.

name: Sage's Row Savant
text: When Sage's Row Savant enters the battlefield, scry 2.
flavor: The streets of Ravnica are full of former guild members now using their institutional skills for personal gain.

name: Seafloor Oracle
text: Whenever a Merfolk you control deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
flavor: Where the light falls dim and blue on broken ships, secrets lie unclaimed.

name: Sentinels of Glen Elendra
text:
Flash
Flying
flavor: Some say the valley of Glen Elendra is mythical, and that rumors of its existence are nothing but a faerie prank. Others say it is the fae's most fiercely guarded secret.

name: Shaper Apprentice
text: Shaper Apprentice has flying as long as you control another Merfolk.
flavor: The River Heralds would wreck a thousand ships to keep intruders from finding the golden city.

name: Stinging Lionfish
text: Whenever you cast your first spell during each opponent's turn, you may tap or untap target nonland permanent.
flavor: Starfish are its favorite prey.

name: Stonybrook Angler
text: {1}{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
flavor: "Water is in the air, the trees, and the earth. Understand its motion, speak its language, and the subtle currents that flow through all living things will fall under your command."

name: Storm Sculptor
text:
Storm Sculptor can't be blocked.
When Storm Sculptor enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: In his hands, the wind can become a weapon or a means of escape.

name: Teferi's Protege
text: {1}{U}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: Teferi's legacy lives on in Tolaria through the study of time magic and a tradition of irrepressible mischief.

name: Tolarian Kraken
text: Whenever you draw a card, you may pay {1}. When you do, you may tap or untap target creature.
flavor:
"It's contemplative, resourceful, and original. Everything else aside, it's the perfect student."
—Naban, dean of iteration

name: Tolarian Sentinel
text:
Flying
{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: "It is not just our people I try to rescue. It is our culture, and our hope that we can return to greatness."

name: Tome Anima
text: Tome Anima can't be blocked as long as you've drawn two or more cards this turn.
flavor: Sometimes knowledge takes on a life of its own.

name: Triton Shorestalker
text: Triton Shorestalker can't be blocked.
flavor: "Who will miss you, drywalker? A wife? A child? Perhaps they will blame the sea for your fate, and teach future generations to stay far away from it."

name: Undersea Invader
text:
Flash
Undersea Invader enters the battlefield tapped.
flavor:
"The currents are strange today, and the fish are fearful. Something's stirring in the depths."
—Rathstaf, Kannah fisherman

name: Watertrap Weaver
text: When Watertrap Weaver enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: The river is a powerful friend.

name: Wavebreak Hippocamp
text: Whenever you cast your first spell during each opponent's turn, draw a card.
flavor: Tritons search for omens in its wake.

name: Weldfast Wingsmith
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Weldfast Wingsmith gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "Airships are too confining. If I'm in the sky, I want to feel the wind in my hair and taste the aether."

name: Blight Keeper
text:
Flying
{7}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Blight Keeper: Target opponent loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
flavor: It withers fruit and flesh alike.

name: Blood Price
text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order. You lose 2 life.
flavor: Blood is the oldest currency.

name: Consign to the Pit
text: Destroy target creature. Consign to the Pit deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor: First your whole life flashes before your eyes. Then you have considerable time to reflect on every regret as you plummet.

name: Cruel Sadist
text:
{B}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on Cruel Sadist.
{2}{B}, {T}, Remove X +1/+1 counters from Cruel Sadist: It deals X damage to target creature.
flavor: Face of innocence. Hand of death. Designed by Edmund McMillen

name: Demon of Catastrophes
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Flying, trample
flavor: A pit yawned open, a column of oily smoke arose, and a towering form hissed, "I accept this offering."

name: Demonic Gifts
text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +2/+0 and gains "When this creature dies, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control."
flavor: It began as a flavor on the tongue, like a bloody morsel of roast boar—but soon the power was a conflagration in her veins.

name: Demon's Disciple
text: When Demon's Disciple enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature or planeswalker.
flavor: Taborax's cultists are the latest in a long history of beings who have desired to see Zendikar torn to pieces.

name: Devouring Swarm
text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Devouring Swarm gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Their arrival is heralded by the deafening hum of ten thousand wings. Their departure is marked by the silence of the dead.

name: Dread Presence
text:
Whenever a Swamp enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —
• You draw a card and you lose 1 life.
• Dread Presence deals 2 damage to any target and you gain 2 life.
flavor: It beckons silently, waiting in the darkness.

name: Dread Rider
text: {1}{B}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Target opponent loses 3 life.
flavor:
"What kind of monstrous grave robber leaves the treasures, but takes the bodies?"
—Fjall, Beskir elder

name: Exsanguinate
text: Each opponent loses X life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
flavor: Vampires don't consider patience a virtue nor gluttony a sin.

name: Gnawing Zombie
text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor: On still nights you can hear its rotted teeth grinding tirelessly on scavenged bones.

name: Ill-Gotten Inheritance
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Ill-Gotten Inheritance deals 1 damage to each opponent and you gain 1 life.
{5}{B}, Sacrifice Ill-Gotten Inheritance: It deals 4 damage to target opponent and you gain 4 life.
flavor: "The suffering of others is not my concern."

name: Karfell Kennel-Master
text: When Karfell Kennel-Master enters the battlefield, up to two target creatures each get +1/+0 and gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)
flavor: Trapped in a realm of dead flesh and scarce hunting, the ravenous wolves of Karfell follow the Dread Marn to warm game.

name: Liliana's Steward
text: {T}, Sacrifice Liliana's Steward: Target opponent discards a card. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: Servants at Vess Manor are chosen for their strong work ethic and respectful demeanor. Being alive is not required.

name: Marauding Blight-Priest
text: Whenever you gain life, each opponent loses 1 life.
flavor: "The vampires never had gods. We followed our bloodchiefs. Now they are gone. What is left? Destruction and death, my friends. That is enough."

name: Mire Blight
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
flavor:
"Is there anything in Guul Draz that *doesn't* suck the life out of you?"
—Tarsa, Sea Gate sell-sword

name: Mire Triton
text:
Deathtouch
When Mire Triton enters the battlefield, mill two cards and you gain 2 life.
flavor: Caught between life and death, between land and sea, between thought and oblivion.

name: Moment of Craving
text: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. You gain 2 life.
flavor: "The time of condemnation is at hand. Dusk washes over the world, and I consign you to eternal darkness!"

name: Necromancer's Stockpile
text: {1}{B}, Discard a creature card: Draw a card. If the discarded card was a Zombie card, create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
flavor: The experiments decided to perform some research of their own.

name: Nested Ghoul
text: Whenever a source deals damage to Nested Ghoul, create a 2/2 black Phyrexian Zombie creature token.
flavor:
"The chest cavity is cleared of useless meat. I know just what to do with the space."
—Gyed, Vault Priest

name: Ob Nixilis's Cruelty
text: Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
flavor: Trapped on Ravnica with no affection for either side, Ob Nixilis sought gratification in random acts of torment.

name: Pit Keeper
text: When Pit Keeper enters the battlefield, if you have four or more creature cards in your graveyard, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "The undead are not 'awakened.' They are evicted when there is no room left in the pit for more bodies."

name: Returned Reveler
text: When Returned Reveler dies, each player mills three cards.
flavor: The flesh is dead and the life forgotten, but old habits persist.

name: Sling-Gang Lieutenant
text:
When Sling-Gang Lieutenant enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
Sacrifice a Goblin: Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor: Freshly promoted to "first rock," Zaz was eager to make an impact.

name: Spark Reaper
text: {3}, Sacrifice a creature or planeswalker: You gain 1 life and draw a card.
flavor:
"I know they're unstoppable fighters created to harvest souls—it's just they're so rude about it."
—Kaya

name: Strangling Spores
text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
flavor: Imagine a thousand tiny mushrooms cropping up within your lungs.

name: Tormented Soul
text: Tormented Soul can't block and can't be blocked.
flavor: Those who raged most bitterly at the world in life are cursed to roam the nether realms in death.

name: Vampire Envoy
text:
Flying
Whenever Vampire Envoy becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.
flavor: "Zendikar will fight until it has bled its last."

name: Vermin Gorger
text: {T}, Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
flavor:
"Once, vampires ruled this world, commanding the fear and respect that befit our noble blood. Have we truly sunk so low?"
—Sorin Markov

name: Vito, Thorn of the Dusk Rose
text:
Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.
{3}{B}{B}: Creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn.
flavor: "Through the blood of the wicked, we shall be redeemed. Let us pray."

name: Witch's Cauldron
text: {1}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life and draw a card.
flavor: The best recipes start with reliable cookware.

name: Act on Impulse
text: Exile the top three cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may play cards exiled this way. (If you cast a spell this way, you still pay its costs. You can play a land this way only if you have an available land play remaining.)
flavor: "You don't want to know what happens after I put on the goggles."

name: Arms Dealer
text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Arms Dealer deals 4 damage to target creature.
flavor:
"Guaranteed to leave your enemies sufficiently stabbed, bitten, cleaved, or exploded."
—Grezkrick's Emporium motto

name: Axgard Cavalry
text: {T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
flavor:
Riding the goat
—Dwarven expression meaning
"a foolhardy act of bravery"

name: Big Score
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards and create two Treasure tokens. (They're artifacts with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor: "Unimaginable riches? I assure you, I have a *vivid* imagination."

name: Blood Aspirant
text:
Whenever you sacrifice a permanent, put a +1/+1 counter on Blood Aspirant.
{1}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature or enchantment: Blood Aspirant deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature can't block this turn.
flavor: It's a small step from revel to bloodbath.

name: Bogardan Dragonheart
text: Sacrifice another creature: Until end of turn, Bogardan Dragonheart becomes a Dragon with base power and toughness 4/4, flying, and haste.
flavor: A hunger to soar must be sated.
