text: When Deathknell Berserker dies, if its power was 3 or greater, create a 2/2 black Zombie Berserker creature token.
flavor:
"Sven felled the elf with an arrow through the chest, but moments later, the corpse rose with a sneer to fight again."
—*Longbeard Saga*

name: Dogged Pursuit
text: At the beginning of your end step, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor: Kaya had stalked countless horrific foes, but never one that killed with such callous precision and twisted creativity.

name: Draugr Recruiter
text: Boast — {3}{B}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. (Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)
flavor: "You cannot stand against us, but when you fall, you will stand with us!"

name: Duskwielder
text: Boast — {1}: Target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life. (Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)
flavor: "My shadow alone will slay you."

name: Egon, God of Death // Throne of Death
text:
Deathtouch
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile two cards from your graveyard. If you can't, sacrifice Egon and draw a card.
flavor: Egon ages backward, his wisdom soured by youthful spite.

name: Elderfang Disciple
text: When Elderfang Disciple enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
flavor: "One day, the great serpent will rejoin us on Skemfar, and those who've wronged us will taste of our venom."

name: Feed the Serpent
text: Exile target creature or planeswalker.
flavor: He spent the final moments of his existence tumbling down the length of the serpent's jaws, driven mad by the magnitude of the Cosmos.

name: Grim Draugr
text: {1}{S}: Grim Draugr gets +1/+0 and gains menace until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures. {S} can be paid with one mana from a snow source.)
flavor: She was a ragged shadow of her living form, but she had lost none of her deadly prowess.

name: Hailstorm Valkyrie
text:
Flying, trample
{S}{S}: Hailstorm Valkyrie gets +2/+2 until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow source.)
flavor: When the path to Starnheim was opened, vengeance rained down upon the enemies of Bretagard.

name: Infernal Pet
text: Whenever you cast your second spell each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Infernal Pet and it gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"Here, my pet. Another little light for you to snuff out."
—Kzarakh, Immersturm gamekeeper

name: Koma's Faithful
text:
Lifelink
When Koma's Faithful dies, each player mills three cards. (To mill a card, a player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.)
flavor: "Great Serpent, hear my song! We wait, our faith unshaken, for your glorious return."

name: Poison the Cup
text:
Destroy target creature. If this spell was foretold, scry 2.
Foretell {1}{B} (During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)
flavor: Dark schemes cut down what armies cannot.

name: Raise the Draugr
text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return two target creature cards that share a creature type from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "King Narfi calls. We go to war!"

name: Skemfar Avenger
text: Whenever another nontoken Elf or Berserker you control dies, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor: Stripped of their divinity, the elves of Skemfar channeled their rage and sorrow into bloody brutality.

name: Tergrid, God of Fright // Tergrid's Lantern
text:
Menace
Whenever an opponent sacrifices a nontoken permanent or discards a permanent card, you may put that card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
flavor: Fear is her one true companion.

name: Tergrid's Shadow
text:
Each player sacrifices two creatures.
Foretell {2}{B}{B} (During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)
flavor: Tergrid, god of fright, never acknowledges her own shadow . . . or its murderous deeds.

name: Varragoth, Bloodsky Sire
text:
Deathtouch
Boast — {1}{B}: Target player searches their library for a card, then shuffles and puts that card on top. (Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)
flavor: "I waded through a river of fire to bring death to Bretagard."

name: Vengeful Reaper
text:
Flying, deathtouch, haste
Foretell {1}{B} (During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)
flavor: "Starnheim is closed to you, coward."

name: Weigh Down
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
flavor: The draugr often drown intruders. Years later, their corpses rise from the depths to join the ranks of the Dread Marn.

name: Withercrown
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has base power 0 and has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life unless you sacrifice this creature."
flavor:
"We'll see each other again soon."
—Egon, god of death

name: Arni Brokenbrow
text:
Haste
Boast — {1}: You may change Arni Brokenbrow's base power to 1 plus the greatest power among other creatures you control until end of turn. (Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)
flavor: "I headbutted a troll. And won."

name: Birgi, God of Storytelling // Harnfel, Horn of Bounty
text:
Whenever you cast a spell, add {R}. Until end of turn, you don't lose this mana as steps and phases end.
Creatures you control can boast twice during each of your turns rather than once.
flavor: "This is a tale to make all Kaldheim tremble..."

name: Breakneck Berserker
text: Haste
flavor: "Go for the knees! The last giant who tried to get past us got rolled back down the mountain in a dozen pieces."

name: Calamity Bearer
text: If a Giant source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
flavor: He'd ignite the World Tree itself if he could.

name: Cinderheart Giant
text:
Trample
When Cinderheart Giant dies, it deals 7 damage to a creature an opponent controls chosen at random.
flavor: What fire giants lack in arcane prowess, they make up for with reckless, explosive rage.

name: Craven Hulk
text: Craven Hulk can't block alone.
flavor: Abandoned at birth, the giant was raised by goats. Ironically, it grew up to be the most cautious member of the herd.

name: Dwarven Reinforcements
text:
Create two 2/1 red Dwarf Berserker creature tokens.
Foretell {1}{R} (During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)
flavor: "Orders? We don't wait for orders!"

name: Fearless Liberator
text: Boast — {2}{R}: Create a 2/1 red Dwarf Berserker creature token. (Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)
flavor: "No one else had the spine for it, so I ran right between that giant's legs and hauled poor Valdir back to Axgard!"

name: Fearless Pup
text:
First strike
Boast — {2}{R}: Fearless Pup gets +2/+0 until end of turn. (Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)
flavor: "Awooo!"

name: Frenzied Raider
text: Whenever you activate a boast ability, put a +1/+1 counter on Frenzied Raider.
flavor: "Arrogant maggot. You won't be so proud when I rip out your tongue and drink from your skull!"

name: Frost Bite
text: Frost Bite deals 2 damage to target creature or planeswalker. If you control three or more snow permanents, it deals 3 damage instead.
flavor:
"Don't wander far—it's a bit nippy out there!"
—Leidurr, expedition leader

name: Hagi Mob
text: Boast — {1}{R}: Hagi Mob deals 1 damage to any target. (Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)
flavor: "Graarg!"

name: Provoke the Trolls
text: Provoke the Trolls deals 3 damage to any target. If a creature is dealt damage this way, it gets +5/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"I like burning and pillaging as much as anyone, but sometimes it's just easier to throw a rock and let the trolls do the work."
—Urik, Tuskeri raid leader

name: Reckless Crew
text: Create X 2/1 red Dwarf Berserker creature tokens, where X is the number of Vehicles you control plus the number of Equipment you control. For each of those tokens, you may attach an Equipment you control to it.
flavor: "Boat's burning! Row faster!"

name: Shackles of Treachery
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. Until end of turn, it gains haste and "Whenever this creature deals damage, destroy target Equipment attached to it."
flavor: In that instant, Toralf felt only the power of the storm and the need to destroy.

name: Smashing Success
text: Destroy target artifact or land. If an artifact is destroyed this way, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor:
"Who said there's no profit in destruction?"
—Magda, brazen outlaw

name: Squash
text:
This spell costs {3} less to cast if you control a Giant.
Squash deals 6 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
flavor: The troll had recently crushed a human in much the same way. Sadly, he expired too quickly to appreciate the irony.

name: Tundra Fumarole
text: Tundra Fumarole deals 4 damage to target creature or planeswalker. Add {C} for each {S} spent to cast this spell. Until end of turn, you don't lose this mana as steps and phases end. ({S} is mana from a snow source.)
flavor: The only thing that smells worse than troll is burnt troll.

name: Tuskeri Firewalker
text: Boast — {1}: Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn. (Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)
flavor: "Toralf blessed me with fire. I am worthy of Starnheim!"

name: Arachnoform
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has reach, and is every creature type.
flavor: Deep within the endless webs of cloning silk, the weaver awaits.

name: Blessing of Frost
text: Distribute X +1/+1 counters among any number of creatures you control, where X is the amount of {S} spent to cast this spell. Then draw a card for each creature you control with power 4 or greater.
flavor: A friend of Jorn is never cold.

name: Fynn, the Fangbearer
text:
Deathtouch
Whenever a creature you control with deathtouch deals combat damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
flavor: "Come, Koma, and reclaim what you lost! Or does the great serpent fear a rematch?"

name: Glittering Frost
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is snow.
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.
flavor: At last, the storm's rage subsided, leaving silent, frozen beauty in its wake.

name: Gnottvold Recluse
text: Reach
flavor: Fed up with webs impeding travelers in other realms, Kolvori banished the giant spiders to Gnottvold, where their webs snare only the occasional rampaging troll.

name: Grizzled Outrider
flavor: "Sure, a horse might be faster. But I'd like to see a horse take the head clean off a troll in one swipe!"

name: Guardian Gladewalker
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
When Guardian Gladewalker enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor: The raiders' only warning was a whisper floating through the mist: "Trespassers."

name: Horizon Seeker
text: Boast — {1}{G}: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. (Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)
flavor: "A five-day climb? Ha! I'll do it in two."

name: Icehide Troll
text: {S}{S}: Icehide Troll gets +2/+0 and gains indestructible until end of turn. Tap it. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. {S} can be paid with one mana from a snow source.)
flavor: A troll's greatest weapon is its ability to emerge unexpectedly from the landscape.

name: Jaspera Sentinel
text:
Reach
{T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Add one mana of any color.
flavor: The arrows of the elvish elite strike as true and deadly as the fangs of the Cosmos Serpent they revere.

name: King Harald's Revenge
text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +1/+1 for each creature you control and gains trample. It must be blocked this turn if able.
flavor: "We will destroy the pretenders and reclaim the divinity of the Einir."

name: Kolvori, God of Kinship // The Ringhart Crest
text:
As The Ringhart Crest enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
{T}: Add {G}. Spend this mana only to cast a creature spell of the chosen type or a legendary creature spell.
flavor: Kolvori's love for her family knows no bounds.

name: Littjara Glade-Warden
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{2}{G}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: In every tree, a restless spirit.

name: Mammoth Growth
text:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Foretell {G} (During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)
flavor: Thus the longhall became a flathall.

name: Ravenous Lindwurm
text: When Ravenous Lindwurm enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor:
"I'm no coward, but I'd sooner tangle with a rampaging Torga troll than a hungry lindwurm!"
—Yegar, Beskir warrior

name: Rootless Yew
text: When Rootless Yew dies, search your library for a creature card with power or toughness 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor:
"We are bound to wander this forest forever. Sometimes I think it wanders with us."
—Ogni, Kannah scout

name: Sculptor of Winter
text: {T}: Untap target snow land.
flavor: "I and my kin remember the old ways. The frost whispers to me in a language too ancient for the Skoti usurpers to comprehend."

name: Snakeskin Veil
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. It gains hexproof until end of turn.
flavor: "Does a serpent roar and chase its prey? No. A serpent waits silently for oblivious prey to draw near."

name: Cleaving Reaper
text:
Flying, trample
Pay 3 life: Return Cleaving Reaper from your graveyard to your hand. Activate only if you had an Angel or Berserker enter the battlefield under your control this turn.
flavor: "I won't pollute my blade with your blood, demon. You'll die by your own axe!"

name: Surtland Flinger
text: Whenever Surtland Flinger attacks, you may sacrifice another creature. When you do, Surtland Flinger deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target. If the sacrificed creature was a Giant, Surtland Flinger deals twice that much damage instead.
flavor: Victory before camaraderie.

name: Canopy Tactician
text:
Other Elves you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G}.
flavor: "Death and life are two ends of the same spear."

name: Armed and Armored
text: Vehicles you control become artifact creatures until end of turn. Choose a Dwarf you control. Attach any number of Equipment you control to it.
flavor: The dwarves of Axgard seldom have reason to leave their impregnable underground kingdom—but when they do, they go in force.

name: Warchanter Skald
text: Whenever Warchanter Skald becomes tapped, if it's enchanted or equipped, create a 2/1 red Dwarf Berserker creature token.
flavor: "Who will be the hero of my tale?"

name: Youthful Valkyrie
text:
Flying
Whenever another Angel enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Youthful Valkyrie.
flavor: Before she is admitted to the host of Starnheim, a young valkyrie must learn a thousand tales of her ancestors.

name: Giant's Grasp
text:
Enchant Giant you control
When Giant's Grasp enters the battlefield, gain control of target nonland permanent for as long as Giant's Grasp remains on the battlefield.
flavor: "Behave and you'll be a fine pet. Bite me and you're ammunition."

name: Elderfang Ritualist
text: When Elderfang Ritualist dies, return another target Elf card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Her fingers stiffened as the shrouded corpse stirred. Her final, ragged breath was one of triumph. "Return, my chosen, and grant our people victory!"

name: Bearded Axe
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each Dwarf, Equipment, and/or Vehicle you control.
Equip {2}
flavor: Every dwarven artisan spends the first hundred years of their life forging a single weapon and infusing it with runic magic.

name: Fire Giant's Fury
text: Target Giant you control gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn. Whenever it deals combat damage to a player this turn, exile that many cards from the top of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards.
flavor: So ended the feast, the hall, and the clan.

name: Gladewalker Ritualist
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Whenever another creature named Gladewalker Ritualist enters the battlefield under your control, draw a card.
flavor: "We are all."

name: Authority of the Consuls
text:
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Citizens are free to do as they wish, within the confines of the Consulate's laws.

name: Aviary Mechanic
text: When Aviary Mechanic enters the battlefield, you may return another permanent you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Pilots take crippled skyships to the Aviaries, trusting Ghirapur's most talented mechanics to get them back into the air.

name: Captured by the Consulate
text:
Enchant creature you don't control
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, if it has a single target, change the target to enchanted creature if able.
flavor:
"At last, the infamous Pia Nalaar."
—Tezzeret

name: Fairgrounds Warden
text: When Fairgrounds Warden enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until Fairgrounds Warden leaves the battlefield.
flavor: "You're coming with me."

name: Fragmentize
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment with mana value 4 or less.
flavor:
"Too much friction on your bearings, your countersinking is inconsistent, and there are lines in your casting. Dispose of it, and begin again."
—Dovin Baan

name: Fumigate
text: Destroy all creatures. You gain 1 life for each creature destroyed this way.
flavor:
"Ghirapur's gremlin population poses a threat to the infrastructure of the fairgrounds. Threats must be eliminated."
—Sram, senior edificer

name: Gearshift Ace
text:
First strike
Whenever Gearshift Ace crews a Vehicle, that Vehicle gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Some display their trophies at the Hall of Mechanists. Others display their talent in the streets of Ghirapur.

name: Herald of the Fair
text: When Herald of the Fair enters the battlefield, target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Welcome, one and all! Right this way! Open your eyes, your ears, and your imaginations to the wonders of the Inventors' Fair!"

name: Master Trinketeer
text:
Servos and Thopters you control get +1/+1.
{3}{W}: Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
flavor: "Let us never forget the joy that lies at the heart of invention."

name: Propeller Pioneer
text:
Flying
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
flavor: "The sky isn't the limit. It's the starting point."

name: Refurbish
text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"There's no reason to buy a new one when I've got the tools to fix the one you've got."
—Ripu, repair specialist

name: Revoke Privileges
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack, block, or crew Vehicles.
flavor: "By order of Consulate Mandate 482, I am required to detain you, citizen."

name: Skyswirl Harrier
text: Flying
flavor: The great birds dive through the sky, wings skimming the aether streams, to fall upon their unsuspecting prey.

name: Tasseled Dromedary
flavor: There is no dress code for the Inventors' Fair, but you'll be hard-pressed to find anyone or anything not done up in their finest.

name: Thriving Ibex
text:
When Thriving Ibex enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Ibex attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Textiles at the Inventors' Fair feature threads from every corner of Kaladesh.

name: Toolcraft Exemplar
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control an artifact, Toolcraft Exemplar gets +2/+1 until end of turn. If you control three or more artifacts, it also gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: "If you wish to produce the finest work, you must start with the finest tools."

name: Trusty Companion
text:
Vigilance
Trusty Companion can't attack alone.
flavor: It shows affection an automaton never could.

name: Visionary Augmenter
text: Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
flavor: "It's a multifunctional radial extension system with superlateral, force-amplifying rigging. Of course it will win."

name: Ceremonious Rejection
text: Counter target colorless spell.
flavor: The judges at the Fair are held in such high esteem that a nod of recognition can inspire an inventor for a lifetime—and a wave of dismissal can end a career.

name: Confiscation Coup
text: Choose target artifact or creature. You get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters), then you may pay an amount of {E} equal to that permanent's mana value. If you do, gain control of it.
flavor: "Citizens, do not resist. This is for your safety. Tezzeret bids you to surrender your inventions. Now."

name: Curio Vendor
flavor: "Step right up! Try your hand! It'll thrill the senses and boggle the mind!"

name: Disappearing Act
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.
Counter target spell.
flavor:
"Baral took my family from me back then. I'd do anything to face him now."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Experimental Aviator
text:
Flying
When Experimental Aviator enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.
flavor: "The little thopters seemed lonely up here, so I thought I'd join them."

name: Failed Inspection
text: Counter target spell. Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: The most dangerous thing an artificer can do is believe an invention is perfect.

name: Glimmer of Genius
text: Scry 2, then draw two cards. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
flavor: Creators live for that moment of inspiration: precious, profound, perfect.

name: Insidious Will
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell.
• You may choose new targets for target spell.
• Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor:
"We meet again, pyromancer."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Janjeet Sentry
text:
When Janjeet Sentry enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}: You may tap or untap target artifact or creature.
flavor: Janjeet Observatory is open to the public, but access to the adjoining laboratories is restricted.

name: Long-Finned Skywhale
text:
Flying
Long-Finned Skywhale can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: The aethersphere is home to the most wondrous beings on all of Kaladesh, although the dangers of traversing it mean that not much is known of them.

name: Malfunction
text:
Enchant artifact or creature
When Malfunction enters the battlefield, tap enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor: "They don't make them like they used to."

name: Minister of Inquiries
text:
When Minister of Inquiries enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}: Target player mills three cards.
flavor: "This research violates Consulate law."

name: Nimble Innovator
text: When Nimble Innovator enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: "A failure is simply another opportunity for improvement. Just wait until you see what I come up with next."

name: Paradoxical Outcome
text: Return any number of target nonland, nontoken permanents you control to their owners' hands. Draw a card for each card returned to your hand this way.
flavor: The results of Rashmi's experimentation forced her to consider the possibility that multitudinous realities existed beyond her own.

name: Revolutionary Rebuff
text: Counter target nonartifact spell unless its controller pays {2}.
flavor: By the time a Consulate sanction becomes official, the renegade quicksmiths have already found a way to circumvent it.

name: Shrewd Negotiation
text: Exchange control of target artifact you control and target artifact or creature you don't control.
flavor: "Pleasure doing business with you."

name: Tezzeret's Ambition
text: Draw three cards. If you control no artifacts, discard a card.
flavor: "To achieve what none have achieved before, one must dare what none have dared before."

name: Thriving Turtle
text:
When Thriving Turtle enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Turtle attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Aether shapes everything on Kaladesh, from the sky to the sea.

name: Vedalken Blademaster
text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: Vedalken have six thin, agile fingers on each hand, giving them unparalleled dexterity.

name: Aetherborn Marauder
text:
Flying, lifelink
When Aetherborn Marauder enters the battlefield, move any number of +1/+1 counters from other permanents you control onto Aetherborn Marauder.
flavor: "I don't know what that is or who it belongs to, but it's shiny and I want it."

name: Ambitious Aetherborn
text: Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
flavor: Aetherborn who are unwilling to accept the decomposition of their bodies invent ways to preserve and augment themselves.

name: Die Young
text: Choose target creature. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters), then you may pay any amount of {E}. The creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each {E} paid this way.
flavor: "When the time comes, let go. Nothing lasts forever."

name: Dukhara Scavenger
text: When Dukhara Scavenger enters the battlefield, you may put target artifact or creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
flavor: The teeth marks add character.

name: Eliminate the Competition
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice X creatures.
Destroy X target creatures.
flavor: Open hostilities are strictly forbidden at the Inventors' Fair, but "accidents" still happen.

name: Embraal Bruiser
text:
Embraal Bruiser enters the battlefield tapped.
Embraal Bruiser has menace as long as you control an artifact.
flavor: In Embraal, inventor gangs defend their turf with ingenious devices and blunt objects.

name: Essence Extraction
text: Essence Extraction deals 3 damage to target creature and you gain 3 life.
flavor: The "gifted" among the aetherborn can draw the life essence of other living beings into themselves.

name: Fortuitous Find
text:
Choose one or both —
• Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: An aetherborn wastes neither time nor treasure.

name: Foundry Screecher
text:
Flying
Foundry Screecher gets +1/+0 as long as you control an artifact.
flavor:
"My creations still can't match the dive speed of those floppy-winged mammals. Maybe I should enter one of them in the Fair."
—Viprikti, thopterist

name: Fretwork Colony
text:
Fretwork Colony can't block.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Fretwork Colony and you lose 1 life.
flavor: The swarm leaves behind a flawless pattern that only occasionally threatens the structural integrity of the wood.

name: Harsh Scrutiny
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card. Scry 1.
flavor:
"If you've done nothing wrong, you have nothing to fear."
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj

name: Live Fast
text: You draw two cards, lose 2 life, and get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
flavor: "When you have the chance, take it. Laugh, sing, dance. Don't allow the night to end."

name: Lost Legacy
text: Choose a nonartifact, nonland card name. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. That player shuffles, then draws a card for each card exiled from their hand this way.
flavor:
"That name shall not be spoken."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Make Obsolete
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: Yesterday's marvels are today's antiques.

name: Maulfist Squad
text:
Menace
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
flavor: "Nice invention there. Looks real fragile."

name: Night Market Lookout
text: Whenever Night Market Lookout becomes tapped, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor: The Consulate rarely cracks the coded announcement of a night market's location before dawn, and enforcers are taken care of if they wander too close.

name: Rush of Vitality
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains lifelink and indestructible until end of turn. (Damage dealt by that creature also causes its controller to gain that much life, and it can't be destroyed by damage or effects that say "destroy.")
flavor: Short lives lead to forbidden choices.

name: Subtle Strike
text:
Choose one or both —
• Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor: Renegades do some of their best work right under the Consulate's nose.

name: Syndicate Trafficker
text: {1}, Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on Syndicate Trafficker. It gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor: "The price isn't negotiable, but I'm sure you'll agree it's fair."

name: Thriving Rats
text:
When Thriving Rats enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Rats attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: In Ghirapur, even the lowliest residents live in lavish surroundings.

name: Tidy Conclusion
text: Destroy target creature. You gain 1 life for each artifact you control.
flavor: Aetherborn patrons use any means necessary to secure victory for their protégés.

name: Weaponcraft Enthusiast
text: Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
flavor:
"No, I don't believe they have the proper permits for those, but I'm not going to be the one to ask."
—Caru, Consulate warden

name: Brazen Scourge
text: Haste
flavor: Driven by an insatiable hunger, gremlins never cease feeding. They can destroy a lifetime of work in just a few moments.

name: Built to Smash
text: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. If it's an artifact creature, it gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: Free from Consulate regulations, renegade-built automatons push performance to the limit.

name: Fateful Showdown
text: Fateful Showdown deals damage to any target equal to the number of cards in your hand. Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
flavor: Tonight at the Grand Exhibition, witness Head Judge Tezzeret face off against the infamous renegade Pia Nalaar.

name: Furious Reprisal
text: Furious Reprisal deals 2 damage to each of two targets.
flavor:
"Now that's the Chandra I've been waiting to see."
—Liliana Vess

name: Giant Spectacle
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace.
flavor: The giant-decorating contest at the migration festival is a tradition that may have started as a dare.

name: Hijack
text: Gain control of target artifact or creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: "Whoa there. Easy. We're just going to take a little detour."

name: Incendiary Sabotage
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Incendiary Sabotage deals 3 damage to each creature.
flavor: "All of those Consulate safety measures undone with one simple tweak."

name: Inventor's Apprentice
text: Inventor's Apprentice gets +1/+1 as long as you control an artifact.
flavor:
"Everyone starts off making garbage. If you finally make something halfway decent, it'll be the best day of your life."
—Nehra, inventor

name: Maulfist Doorbuster
text:
When Maulfist Doorbuster enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Maulfist Doorbuster attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.
flavor: "Knock, knock . . . too late."

name: Ruinous Gremlin
text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Ruinous Gremlin: Destroy target artifact.
flavor: City officials once sent twenty gleaming automatons to exterminate a nest of gremlins. They soon saw the error of their ways.

name: Speedway Fanatic
text:
Haste
Whenever Speedway Fanatic crews a Vehicle, that Vehicle gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: If her vehicle even has a brake, she couldn't tell you which pedal it is.

name: Spireside Infiltrator
text: Whenever Spireside Infiltrator becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.
flavor: "The Consulate promised that we would all have access to aether. I'm just keeping them honest."

name: Spontaneous Artist
text:
When Spontaneous Artist enters the battlefield, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Pay {E}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: Graffiti of the "leaking spire" symbol is found wherever the renegades have been.

name: Start Your Engines
text: Vehicles you control become artifact creatures until end of turn. Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Inventors from around the world have come to the Fair hoping their creations will fly, drive, or sail their way to a top prize.

name: Territorial Gorger
text:
Trample
Whenever you get one or more {E} (energy counters), Territorial Gorger gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Inventors have been known to capture gremlins with the intent to release them in a rival's workshop. More often than not, that plan backfires.

name: Terror of the Fairgrounds
flavor:
"Consider this a high alert, people. Permission to destroy on sight. Either we take it down or it'll take down the Fair."
—Pav, gremlin watch

name: Thriving Grubs
text:
When Thriving Grubs enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Grubs attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Some passengers ride without tickets.

name: Wayward Giant
text: Menace
flavor:
"The giants follow the flow of aether, and twice a year it leads them through here. Lesson learned. More clearance is needed."
—Sram, senior edificer

name: Appetite for the Unnatural
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 2 life.
flavor:
"I'd just let the monkey have it if I were you. You can make another, but the same can't be said of your fingers."
—Turni, Greenwheel groundskeeper

name: Arborback Stomper
text:
Trample
When Arborback Stomper enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.
flavor: The power of aether draws creatures to it like a magnetic force, and those that are touched by it are forever altered.

name: Architect of the Untamed
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}: Create a 6/6 colorless Beast artifact creature token.
flavor: Next to her designs, life seems like a pale imitation.

name: Attune with Aether
text: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
flavor: "I've never seen a world where aether weaves through every aspect of nature."

name: Blossoming Defense
text: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains hexproof until end of turn.
flavor: Those who move harmoniously with the flow of aether can channel the power of the natural world.

name: Commencement of Festivities
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to players this turn.
flavor: Never before have there been so many brilliant minds and wondrous inventions in one place. Denizens from every corner of Kaladesh will flock to the once-in-a-lifetime Inventors' Fair.

name: Fairgrounds Trumpeter
text: At the beginning of each end step, if a +1/+1 counter was put on a permanent under your control this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Fairgrounds Trumpeter.
flavor: The louder the elephant trumpeted, the more the crowd cheered. And the more the crowd cheered . . .

name: Larger Than Life
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"They say Head Judge Tezzeret will be reviewing every invention at the Fair. I made sure to build something that will stand out."
—Jehvani, Vahadar artificer

name: Longtusk Cub
text:
Whenever Longtusk Cub deals combat damage to a player, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Longtusk Cub.
flavor: It won't be small forever.

name: Ornamental Courage
text: Untap target creature. It gets +1/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: Inspired by the thorns and brambles of the untamed wilds, elvish armor is both beautiful and formidable.

name: Oviya Pashiri, Sage Lifecrafter
text:
{2}{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{4}{G}, {T}: Create an X/X colorless Construct artifact creature token, where X is the number of creatures you control.
flavor: "Inspiration is reciprocal: we all have a responsibility to each other to create."

name: Peema Outrider
text:
Trample
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
flavor: Connected as artificer and invention, bonded as rider and steed.

name: Sage of Shaila's Claim
text: When Sage of Shaila's Claim enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
flavor: Even now, Shaila's descendants proudly occupy the greenway that she refused to relinquish to the Consulate.

name: Servant of the Conduit
text:
When Servant of the Conduit enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor: "Creation without connection to nature is just manufacture."

name: Take Down
text:
Choose one —
• Take Down deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
• Take Down deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.
flavor: The drake flew true. The arrow flew truer.

name: Thriving Rhino
text:
When Thriving Rhino enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Rhino attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: As unpredictable as aether, and just as hard to contain.

name: Wild Wanderer
text: When Wild Wanderer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: "We all began in nature, and nature is where we belong."

name: Wildest Dreams
text: Return X target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Wildest Dreams.
flavor:
"I opened my mind to the immensity of the wonders around me. It was only then that I could see the Great Conduit."
—Rashmi, aether-seer

name: Bastion Mastodon
text: {W}: Bastion Mastodon gains vigilance until end of turn.
flavor: The Consulate's automaton bank contains only the most impressive specimens.

name: Dukhara Peafowl
text: {U}: Dukhara Peafowl gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Elegant filigree birds perch along the eleven bridges that cross Canal Dukhara.

name: Narnam Cobra
text: {G}: Narnam Cobra gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor: Some say tales of the Narnam greenhouse are told to scare the children, but every tale grows from a seed of truth.

name: Prakhata Pillar-Bug
text: {B}: Prakhata Pillar-Bug gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: Not a mote of dust escapes the dutiful cleaners that keep the exclusive Prakhata Club immaculate.

name: Scrapheap Scrounger
text:
Scrapheap Scrounger can't block.
{1}{B}, Exile another creature card from your graveyard: Return Scrapheap Scrounger from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: Some machines refuse to accept their own obsolescence.

name: Weldfast Monitor
text: {R}: Weldfast Monitor gains menace until end of turn.
flavor: The avant-garde among Ghirapur's inventors disregard the Consulate's safety standards completely.

name: Renegade Firebrand
text: As long as you control a Chandra planeswalker, Renegade Firebrand gets +1/+0 and has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: "For freedom! For fame! For fire!"

name: Terrain Elemental
flavor:
"You tread upon the land all the time, yet you seem dismayed when it moves to step on you."
—Nissa Revane

name: Alabaster Kirin
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor: The appearance of a kirin signifies the passing or arrival of an important figure. As word of sightings spread, all the khans took it to mean themselves. Only the shaman Chianul thought of Sarkhan Vol.

name: Dazzling Ramparts
text:
Defender
{1}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor: When Anafenza holds court under the First Tree, the gates of Mer-Ek are sealed. No safer place exists in all of Tarkir.

name: Defiant Strike
text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Stand where the whole battle can see you. Strike so they'll never forget."
—Anafenza, khan of the Abzan

name: End Hostilities
text: Destroy all creatures and all permanents attached to creatures.
flavor: Her palm flared like the eye of a waking dragon. Then all was calm.

name: Erase
text: Exile target enchantment.
flavor:
"Truth is hard enough to see, let alone understand. We must remove all distractions to find clarity."
—Zogye, wandering sage

name: Feat of Resistance
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. It gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn. (It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, enchanted, or equipped by anything of that color.)
flavor: Dragons are extinct on Tarkir, but Abzan magic still emulates their endurance.

name: Jeskai Student
text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: Discipline is the first pillar of the Jeskai Way. Each member of the clan trains in a weapon, perfecting its use over a lifetime.

name: Mardu Hordechief
text: Raid — When Mardu Hordechief enters the battlefield, if you attacked this turn, create a 1/1 white Warrior creature token.
flavor: The horde grows with each assault.

name: Rush of Battle
text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. Warrior creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by those Warriors also causes their controller to gain that much life.)
flavor: The Mardu charge reflects the dragon's speed—and its hunger.

name: Sage-Eye Harrier
text:
Flying
Morph {3}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: These winged warriors meditate in flight, tracing mandalas in the clouds.

name: Salt Road Patrol
text: Outlast {1}{W} ({1}{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
flavor:
"Soldiers win battles, but supplies win wars."
—Kadri, Abzan caravan master

name: Siegecraft
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+4.
flavor:
"They thought their fortress impregnable . . . until we marched up with ours, and blocked out the sun."
—Golran, dragonscale captain

name: Venerable Lammasu
text: Flying
flavor: Lammasu are the enigmatic travelers of Tarkir, soaring high above all lands in all seasons. None know their true purpose, but they often arrive on the eve of great conflicts or turning points in history.

name: War Behemoth
text: Morph {4}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor:
"The Houses always hope for peace, but we always pack for war."
—Gvar Barzeel, krumar commander

name: Blinding Spray
text:
Creatures your opponents control get -4/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"The stronger our enemies seem, the more vulnerable they are."
—Sultai secret

name: Force Away
text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
flavor: Where an enemy once rode, not even a whisper remains.

name: Glacial Stalker
text: Morph {4}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor:
"Have you spent a winter high in the mountains, where the ice walks and speaks to the wind? It is not a place for those who have not learned respect."
—Ulnok, Temur shaman

name: Icy Blast
text:
Tap X target creatures.
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, those creatures don't untap during their controllers' next untap steps.
flavor: "Do not think the sand or the sun will hold back the breath of winter."

name: Jeskai Windscout
text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: They range from Sage-Eye Stronghold to the farthest reaches of Tarkir.

name: Monastery Flock
text:
Defender, flying
Morph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor:
"The arrow strikes one bird down, but the flock remains."
—Jeskai teaching

name: Scion of Glaciers
text: {U}: Scion of Glaciers gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"There is nothing so free as the spring river born of winter's ice."
—Nitula, the Hunt Caller

name: Set Adrift
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.
flavor: The envoy spoke, and Sidisi replied.

name: Stubborn Denial
text:
Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, counter that spell instead.
flavor: The Temur have no patience for subtlety.

name: Taigam's Scheming
text: Surveil 5. (Look at the top five cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)
flavor: "The Jeskai would have me bow in restraint. So I have found a people unafraid of true power."

name: Waterwhirl
text: Return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor:
"Be as water: untamed and unheld, yet inexorably flowing toward a greater goal."
—Shensu, Riverwheel mystic

name: Weave Fate
text: Draw two cards.
flavor: Temur shamans speak of three destinies: the now, the echo of the past, and the unwritten. They find flickering paths among tangled possibilities.

name: Wetland Sambar
flavor: As a test of calm and compassion, a Jeskai monk softly approaches a grazing sambar and offers it a lotus from his or her hand. If the creature eats, the student ascends to the next level of training.

name: Dead Drop
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Target player sacrifices two creatures.
flavor:
Got a diving lesson
—Sultai expression meaning "was fed to the crocodiles"

name: Debilitating Injury
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
flavor:
"If weakness does not exist within the Temur then we shall force it upon them."
—Sidisi, khan of the Sultai

name: Disowned Ancestor
text: Outlast {1}{B} ({1}{B}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
flavor: Long after death, the spirits of the Disowned continue to seek redemption among their Abzan kin.

name: Empty the Pits
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Create X tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.
flavor: The Sultai would rebuild the empire on the backs of the dead.

name: Gurmag Swiftwing
text: Flying, first strike, haste
flavor:
"Anything a falcon can do, a bat can do in pitch darkness."
—Urdnan the Wanderer

name: Kheru Bloodsucker
text:
Whenever a creature you control with toughness 4 or greater dies, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
{2}{B}, Sacrifice another creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Kheru Bloodsucker.
flavor: It stares through the empty, pain-twisted faces of those it has drained.

name: Krumar Bond-Kin
text: Morph {4}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: "The Abzan replaced my savagery with a noble heritage. I would give my life for my House."

name: Molting Snakeskin
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has "{2}{B}: Regenerate this creature."
flavor: Flesh wounds are meaningless to those who discard their flesh so readily.

name: Murderous Cut
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Destroy target creature.
flavor: The blades of a Sultai assassin stab like the fangs of a dragon.

name: Raiders' Spoils
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+0.
Whenever a Warrior you control deals combat damage to a player, you may pay 1 life. If you do, draw a card.
flavor:
"To conquer is to eat."
—Edicts of Ilagra

name: Rakshasa's Secret
text: Target opponent discards two cards. Mill two cards.
flavor: The voice of a rakshasa is soft, its breath sweet. But every word is the murmur of madness.

name: Retribution of the Ancients
text: {B}, Remove X +1/+1 counters from among creatures you control: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.
flavor: Abzan ancestors died to protect their Houses, and they protect them still.

name: Rite of the Serpent
text: Destroy target creature. If that creature had a +1/+1 counter on it, create a 1/1 green Snake creature token.
flavor:
"From your death, new life. From your loss, our profit."
—Kirada, Qarsi overseer

name: Rotting Mastodon
flavor: Mastodons became extinct long ago, but foul forces of the Gurmag Swamp sometimes animate their decaying remains. The Sultai happily exploit such creatures but consider them inferior to their own necromantic creations.

name: Shambling Attendants
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor:
"Let the world behold what becomes of those who defy us."
—Taigam, Sidisi's Hand

name: Sidisi's Pet
text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
Morph {1}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: The Sultai distinguish between pet and slave by the material of the chain.

name: Sultai Scavenger
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Flying
flavor: Since they guard armies of walking carrion, Sultai aven are never far from a meal.

name: Throttle
text: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The best servants are made from those who died without a scratch."
—Sidisi, khan of the Sultai

name: Ainok Tracker
text:
First strike
Morph {4}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: Some ainok of the mountains are accepted among the Temur as trusted hunt-mates.

name: Arrow Storm
text:
Arrow Storm deals 4 damage to any target.
Raid — If you attacked this turn, instead Arrow Storm deals 5 damage to that permanent or player and the damage can't be prevented.
flavor: First the thunder, then the rain.

name: Barrage of Boulders
text:
Barrage of Boulders deals 1 damage to each creature you don't control.
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, creatures can't block this turn.
flavor: Crude tactics can be effective nonetheless.

name: Bloodfire Expert
text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: Some efreet abandon their homes in the volcanic Fire Rim to embrace the Jeskai Way and discipline their innate flames.

name: Bring Low
text: Bring Low deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has a +1/+1 counter on it, Bring Low deals 5 damage to it instead.
flavor:
"People are often humbled by the elements. But the elements, too, can be humbled."
—Surrak, khan of the Temur

name: Canyon Lurkers
text: Morph {3}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: The broken Qal Sisma foothills make poor terrain for cavalry, but a perfect setting for ambushes.

name: Dragon-Style Twins
text:
Double strike
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "We are the flicker of the flame and its heat, the two sides of a single blade."

name: Goblinslide
text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token with haste.
flavor: Goblins, like snowflakes, are only dangerous in numbers.

name: Mardu Blazebringer
text: When Mardu Blazebringer attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
flavor:
"Make sure he's pointed in the right direction before you light him. And don't let the goblins anywhere near the torch."
—Kerai Suddenblade, Mardu hordechief

name: Valley Dasher
text:
Haste
Valley Dasher attacks each combat if able.
flavor: Mardu riders' greatest fear is that a battle might end before their weapons draw blood.

name: Alpine Grizzly
flavor: The Temur welcome bears into the clan, fighting alongside them in battle. The relationship dates back to when they labored side by side under Sultai rule.

name: Awaken the Bear
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: When Temur warriors enter the battle trance known as "awakening the bear," they lose all sense of enemy or friend, seeing only threats to the wilderness.

name: Dragonscale Boon
text: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature and untap it.
flavor:
"When we were lost and weary, the ainok showed us how to survive. They have earned the right to call themselves Abzan, and to wear the Scale."
—Anafenza, khan of the Abzan

name: Feed the Clan
text:
You gain 5 life.
Ferocious — You gain 10 life instead if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.
flavor: The Temur believe three things only are needed in life: a hot fire, a full belly, and a strong companion.

name: Heir of the Wilds
text:
Deathtouch
Ferocious — Whenever Heir of the Wilds attacks, if you control a creature with power 4 or greater, Heir of the Wilds gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: In the high caves of the Qal Sisma mountains, young hunters quest to hear the echoes of their fierce ancestors.

name: Highland Game
text: When Highland Game dies, you gain 2 life.
flavor:
"Bring down a stag and fix its horns upon her head. This one hears the whispers."
—Chianul, at the weaving of Arel

name: Incremental Growth
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature, two +1/+1 counters on another target creature, and three +1/+1 counters on a third target creature.
flavor: The bonds of family cross the boundaries of race.

name: Kin-Tree Warden
text:
{2}: Regenerate Kin-Tree Warden.
Morph {G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: "The amber of the tree and the blood of my veins are the same."

name: Sagu Archer
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Morph {4}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: His arrows whistle like a serpent's hiss.

name: Scout the Borders
text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature or land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
flavor:
"I am in my element: the element of surprise."
—Mogai, Sultai scout

name: Tusked Colossodon
flavor: A band of Temur hunters, fleeing the Mardu, dug a hideout beneath such a creature as it slept. The horde found them and attacked. For three days the Temur held them at bay, and all the while the great beast slumbered.

name: Cleanse
text: Destroy all black creatures.
flavor: The clouds broke and the sun's rays burst forth; each foul beast in its turn faltered, and was gone.

name: Glyph of Life
text: Choose target Wall creature. Whenever that creature is dealt damage by an attacking creature this turn, you gain that much life.
flavor: Any wall can be battered down, but at what cost?

name: Lifeblood
text: Whenever a Mountain an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.
flavor:
"Foolish wizard! As you tap the power of your lofty keep, so grows my strength."
—Malvern Xelionos, *Letters*

name: Moat
text: Creatures without flying can't attack.
flavor: The purpose of any moat is to impede attack. Some are filled with water, some with thistles. Some are filled with things best left unseen.

name: Osai Vultures
text:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures.
Remove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: A sign of battle, the Vultures circle and wait for the victorious to depart.

name: Petra Sphinx
text: {T}: Target player chooses a card name, then reveals the top card of their library. If that card has the chosen name, that player puts it into their hand. If it doesn't, the player puts it into their graveyard.
flavor: What walks on four legs in the morning, two legs in the afternoon, and three legs in the evening?

name: Righteous Avengers
text: Plainswalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Plains.)
flavor: Few can withstand the wrath of the righteous.

name: Thunder Spirit
text: Flying, first strike
flavor:
"It was full of fire and smoke and light and . . . it drove between us and the Efrafans like a thousand thunderstorms with lightning."
—Richard Adams, *Watership Down*

name: Wall of Caltrops
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Caltrops blocks a creature, if at least one other Wall creature is blocking that creature and no non-Wall creatures are blocking that creature, Wall of Caltrops gains banding until end of turn. (If any creatures with banding you control are blocking a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by.)
flavor: "Ow! Ow ow ow! Oooh, ow, OW!"

name: Wall of Light
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Protection from black
flavor: As many attackers were dazzled by the wall's beauty as were halted by its force.

name: Devouring Deep
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: "Full fathom five thy father lies;/ Of his bones are coral made;/ Those are pearls that were his eyes;/ Nothing of him that doth fade,/ But doth suffer a sea-change/ Into something rich and strange." —William Shakespeare, *The Tempest*

name: Dream Coat
text:
Enchant creature
{0}: Enchanted creature becomes the color or colors of your choice. Activate only once each turn.
flavor:
"Adopt the character of the twisting octopus, which takes on the appearance of the nearby rock. Now follow in this direction, now turn a different hue."
—Theognis, *Elegies 1, 215*

name: Field of Dreams
text: Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
flavor: Some people say that the world is round, and if you travel far enough you'll come to the other side, where everything is upside down.

name: Part Water
text: X target creatures gain islandwalk until end of turn. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor:
". . . and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left."
—Exodus, 14:22

name: Ghosts of the Damned
text: {T}: Target creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
flavor: The voices of the dead ring in the heart long after they have faded from the ears.

name: Glyph of Doom
text: Choose target Wall creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that were blocked by that creature this turn.
flavor:
"He knows he has a short span of life, that the day will come when he must pass through the wall of oblivion . . ."
—William Faulkner

name: Headless Horseman
flavor:
". . . [T]he ghost rides forth to the scene of battle in nightly quest of his head . . . he sometimes passes along the Hollow, like a midnight blast . . ."
—Washington Irving, The Legend of Sleepy Hollow

name: Hell Swarm
text: All creatures get -1/-0 until end of turn.
flavor: The brightness of day turned in an instant to dusk as the swarm descended upon the battlefield.

name: Hellfire
text: Destroy all nonblack creatures. Hellfire deals X plus 3 damage to you, where X is the number of creatures that died this way.
flavor: "High on a throne of royal state . . . insatiate to pursue vain war with heav'n." —John Milton, *Paradise Lost*

name: Horror of Horrors
text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Regenerate target black creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor:
"And a horror of outer darkness after,/ And dust returneth to dust again."
—Adam Lindsay Gordon, The Swimmer

name: Jovial Evil
text: Jovial Evil deals X damage to target opponent, where X is twice the number of white creatures that player controls.
flavor: "Today, for a lark, let's visit the plains. I'm sure we'll find something to entertain us."

name: Nether Void
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, counter it unless that player pays {3}.
flavor: These days, some wizards are finding that they have a little too much spell left at the end of their mana.

name: The Abyss
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, destroy target nonartifact creature that player controls of their choice. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: "An immense river of oblivion is sweeping us away into a nameless abyss." —Ernest Renan, *Souvenirs d'Enfance et de Jeunesse*

name: Touch of Darkness
text: One or more target creatures become black until end of turn.
flavor:
"Black spirits and white, red spirits and gray,/
Mingle, mingle, mingle, you that mingle may."
—Thomas Middleton, The Witch

name: Walking Dead
text: {B}: Regenerate Walking Dead.
flavor: The Walking Dead are the remains of freakish experiments by the Necromantic Lords.

name: Aerathi Berserker
text: Rampage 3 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
flavor: Ærathi children who show promise are left to survive for a year in the wilderness. Those who return are shown the way of the Berserker.

name: Crimson Kobolds
flavor: "Kobolds are harmless." —Bearand the Bold, epitaph

name: Crookshank Kobolds
flavor: The Crookshank military boasts a standing army of nearly twenty-four million, give or take twenty-two million.

name: Firestorm Phoenix
text:
Flying
If Firestorm Phoenix would die, return it to its owner's hand instead. Until that player's next turn, that player plays with that card revealed in their hand and can't play it.
flavor: "The bird of wonder dies, the maiden phoenix,/ Her ashes new-create another heir/ As great in admiration as herself." —William Shakespeare, *King Henry the Eighth*

name: Frost Giant
text: Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
flavor: The Frost Giants have been out in the cold a long, long time, but they have their rage to keep them warm.

name: Gravity Sphere
text: All creatures lose flying.
flavor: On the morning of the Battle of Gal-Shan, the Sorcerer's cry rang out: "Let no bird fly, let no creature take wing, let all the battle join as one."

name: Hyperion Blacksmith
text: {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact an opponent controls.
flavor:
"The smith a mighty man is he/ With large and sinewy hands./ And the muscles of his brawny arms/ Are strong as iron bands."
—Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, The Village Blacksmith

name: Kobold Drill Sergeant
text: Other Kobold creatures you control get +0/+1 and have trample.
flavor: "Joining this army is easy, boy. Just survive your first battle."

name: Kobold Overlord
text:
First strike
Other Kobold creatures you control have first strike.
flavor: "One for all, all for one; we strike first, and then you're done!" —Oath of the Kobold Musketeers

name: Kobold Taskmaster
text: Other Kobold creatures you control get +1/+0.
flavor: The Taskmaster knows that there is no cure for the common Kobold.

name: Kobolds of Kher Keep
flavor: Kher Keep is unique among fortresses: impervious to aerial assault but defenseless from the ground.

name: Primordial Ooze
text:
Primordial Ooze attacks each combat if able.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Primordial Ooze. Then you may pay {X}, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters on it. If you don't, tap Primordial Ooze and it deals X damage to you.
flavor: The thick, moving mass from the beginning of evolution swallows and digests the animate and inanimate as it unthinkingly strives to continue its existence.

name: Quarum Trench Gnomes
text: {T}: If target Plains is tapped for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of white mana. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor:
"O Great Captain, all is lost. They tunneled, they burrowed, they trenched. They sapped the strength of our defenses."
—Sorgus, *Chronicles of the Quarum Plains*

name: Raging Bull
flavor:
"Sometimes the bulls win, and sometimes the bears win. But the bulls have more fun."
—Anonymous

name: Spinal Villain
text: {T}: Destroy target blue creature.
flavor: "Striking silent as a dream,/ Cutting short the strangled scream . . ." —Tobrian, "Watchdragon"

name: Wall of Earth
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor: The ground shuddered violently and the earth seemed to come to life. The elemental force contained in the vast wall of earth was trapped, bent to its controller's will.

name: Barbary Apes
flavor: Unpredictable in the extreme, these carnivorous apes will prey even upon their own kind.

name: Giant Turtle
text: Giant Turtle can't attack if it attacked during your last turn.
flavor:
"The turtle lives 'twixt plated decks/ Which practically conceal its sex./ I think it clever of the turtle/ In such a fix to be so fertile."
—Ogden Nash, "The Turtle"

name: Hornet Cobra
text: First strike
flavor:
"Then inch by inch out of the grass rose up the head and spread hood of Nag, the big black cobra, and he was five feet long from tongue to tail."
—Rudyard Kipling, *The Jungle Books*

name: Rust
text: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
flavor:
"How dull it is to pause, to make an end,/ To rust unburnished, not to shine in use,/ As though to breathe were life!"
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Ulysses"

name: Shelkin Brownie
text: {T}: Target creature loses all "bands with other" abilities until end of turn.
flavor: Leave a bowl of milk on your doorstep each night for the brownies, or they'll cause you no end of mischief.

name: Typhoon
text: Typhoon deals damage to each opponent equal to the number of Islands that player controls.
flavor: Fierce winds ripped across the tropical landscape. What they did not destroy with their fiery breath was washed away by torrential rain.

name: Hammerheim
text:
{T}: Add {R}.
{T}: Target creature loses all landwalk abilities until end of turn.
flavor: "'Tis distance lends enchantment to the view,/ And robes the mountain in its azure hue." —Thomas Campbell, "Pleasures of Hope"

name: Karakas
text:
{T}: Add {W}.
{T}: Return target legendary creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: "To make a prairie it takes a clover and one bee,/ One clover, and a bee,/ And revery." —Emily Dickinson

name: Tolaria
text:
{T}: Add {U}.
{T}: Target creature loses banding and all "bands with other" abilities until end of turn. Activate only during any upkeep step.
flavor: "Fairest Isle, all isles excelling,/ Seat of Pleasures, and of loves . . ." —John Dryden

name: Urborg
text:
{T}: Add {B}.
{T}: Target creature loses first strike or swampwalk until end of turn.
flavor: "Resignedly beneath the sky/The melancholy waters lie./So blend the turrets and shadows there/That all seem pendulous in air,/While from a proud tower in town/Death looks gigantically down." —Edgar Allan Poe, "The City in the Sea"

name: Akroma's Devoted
text: Cleric creatures have vigilance.
flavor: Akroma asked for only one thing from her troops: unwavering, unconditional loyalty.

name: Aven Redeemer
text:
Flying
{T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: Redeemers rise with the sun, and the spirits of the people rise with them.

name: Beacon of Destiny
text: {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to Beacon of Destiny instead.
flavor: "We all borrowed life from the Ancestor to exist in this world. Today, I repay that debt."

name: Cloudreach Cavalry
text: As long as you control a Bird, Cloudreach Cavalry gets +2/+2 and has flying.
flavor: "It's easy to lose sight of hope until you gaze out from my vantage point."

name: Essence Sliver
text: Whenever a Sliver deals damage, its controller gains that much life.
flavor: The slivers would survive, even at the expense of every other creature on Otaria.

name: Glowrider
text: Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
flavor: "It is not yet time."

name: Lowland Tracker
text:
First strike
Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
flavor:
"I feed my hatred to the righteous and they join my crusade."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

name: Planar Guide
text: {3}{W}, Exile Planar Guide: Exile all creatures. At the beginning of the next end step, return those cards to the battlefield under their owners' control.
flavor: "Every moment has its own savior."

name: Plated Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures get +0/+1.
flavor: Overcoming extinction has only made the slivers more determined to live.

name: Stoic Champion
text: Whenever a player cycles a card, Stoic Champion gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: His outer calm belies his inner fury.

name: Wall of Hope
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Hope is dealt damage, you gain that much life.
flavor:
"What cage would you rather be inside of than out?"
—Daru riddle

name: Ward Sliver
text:
As Ward Sliver enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All Slivers have protection from the chosen color.
flavor: The first wave of slivers perished from the Riptide wizards' magic. The second wave shrugged off their spells like water.

name: Whipgrass Entangler
text: {1}{W}: Until end of turn, target creature gains "This creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {1} for each Cleric on the battlefield."
flavor: "Now that I have your attention, perhaps I can tell you of the Order."

name: Aven Envoy
text: Flying
flavor: Their grieving faces tell far more than a list of casualties ever could.

name: Cephalid Pathmage
text:
Cephalid Pathmage can't be blocked.
{T}, Sacrifice Cephalid Pathmage: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
flavor: Pathmages can open doors that aren't even there.

name: Covert Operative
text: Covert Operative can't be blocked.
flavor: Some spies seek clarity. Others seek transparency.

name: Keeneye Aven
text:
Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: "I have no need of a map. The very continent itself guides my way."

name: Keeper of the Nine Gales
text:
Flying
{T}, Tap two untapped Birds you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: "You cannot fight the storm."

name: Mistform Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{1}: This permanent becomes the creature type of your choice in addition to its other types until end of turn."
flavor: Taking the form of a junior researcher, the first sliver slipped out of Riptide.

name: Mistform Ultimus
text: Mistform Ultimus is every creature type (even if this card isn't on the battlefield).
flavor: It may wear your face, but its mind is its own.

name: Primoc Escapee
text:
Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: Though a completely artificial species, primocs are a natural fit for the skies of Otaria.

name: Riptide Director
text: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Draw a card for each Wizard you control.
flavor: Those who lead others to wisdom become the wisest themselves.

name: Riptide Mangler
text: {1}{U}: Change Riptide Mangler's base power to target creature's power. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor: It wants you to be its chum.

name: Shifting Sliver
text: Slivers can't be blocked except by Slivers.
flavor: Once the last few slivers the Riptide Project controlled were dead, there was nothing to keep the island from being completely overrun.

name: Synapse Sliver
text: Whenever a Sliver deals combat damage to a player, its controller may draw a card.
flavor:
"Species XR17 feeds upon the mental energies of its victims. This explains why the goblins remain unaffected."
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Warped Researcher
text: Whenever a player cycles a card, Warped Researcher gains flying and shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: New insights yield new senses.

name: Blood Celebrant
text: {B}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color.
flavor:
"Their blood is the nectar that nourishes the Cabal."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Crypt Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{T}: Regenerate target Sliver."
flavor:
"Death couldn't contain the slivers. What made us think we could?"
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Dark Supplicant
text: {T}, Sacrifice three Clerics: Search your graveyard, hand, and/or library for a card named Scion of Darkness and put it onto the battlefield. If you search your library this way, shuffle.
flavor: Cabal clerics serve two masters: their patriarch and their god.

name: Deathmark Prelate
text: {2}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Zombie: Destroy target non-Zombie creature. It can't be regenerated. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: Death is a secret he is willing to share.

name: Drinker of Sorrow
text:
Drinker of Sorrow can't block.
Whenever Drinker of Sorrow deals combat damage, sacrifice a permanent.
flavor: It strikes at your soul, heedless of your prayers.

name: Dripping Dead
text:
Dripping Dead can't block.
Whenever Dripping Dead deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: It oozes death from every pore.

name: Earthblighter
text: {2}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Destroy target land.
flavor: "A single dedicated mind can bring about the greatest destruction. That, or goblins—goblins work too."

name: Smokespew Invoker
text: {7}{B}: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
flavor: The Mirari festers in its flesh.

name: Sootfeather Flock
text:
Flying
Morph {3}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor: They pick at the remains of the city's corpse.

name: Toxin Sliver
text: Whenever a Sliver deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: It doesn't need to use its venom—it just needs you to know it can.

name: Vile Deacon
text: Whenever Vile Deacon attacks, it gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Clerics on the battlefield.
flavor: "The Cabal and the Order really aren't that different. After all, we are both empowered by faith."

name: Zombie Brute
text:
Amplify 1 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each Zombie card you reveal in your hand.)
Trample
flavor: Measure its determination by the screams of its prey.

name: Blade Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures get +1/+0.
flavor: After breaking free from the Riptide Project, the slivers quickly adapted to life on Otaria—much to the dismay of life on Otaria.

name: Crested Craghorn
text:
Haste
Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
flavor:
"Craghorns experience a wide range of emotions: rage, fury, anger . . ."
—Foothill guide

name: Frenetic Raptor
text: Beasts can't block.
flavor:
"How do you stop a raptor from charging? No, seriously! Help!"
—Blarg, goblin jester

name: Goblin Assassin
text: Whenever Goblin Assassin or another Goblin enters the battlefield, each player flips a coin. Each player whose coin comes up tails sacrifices a creature.
flavor: The more victims he kills, the more likely he is to get the right one.

name: Goblin Firebug
text: When Goblin Firebug leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a land.
flavor: Most goblins leave behind a wake of destruction. A few goblins take one with them.

name: Goblin Goon
text:
Goblin Goon can't attack unless you control more creatures than defending player.
Goblin Goon can't block unless you control more creatures than attacking player.
flavor: Giant-sized body. Goblin-sized brain.

name: Goblin Grappler
text: Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
flavor: Daru soldiers learned it's better to have a clean death from a sharp blade than to tangle with a goblin's rusted chains.

name: Goblin Lookout
text: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Goblin creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "Throw rocks at 'em! Throw spears at 'em! Throw Furt at 'em!"

name: Hunter Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have provoke. (Whenever a Sliver attacks, its controller may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
flavor: Once they get the scent, there is no escape.

name: Magma Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{T}: Target Sliver creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of Slivers on the battlefield."
flavor: As malleable as molten steel, but as dangerous as the finished blade.

name: Skirk Alarmist
text:
Haste
{T}: Turn target face-down creature you control face up. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice it.
flavor: "I treat each day as your last."

name: Skirk Outrider
text: As long as you control a Beast, Skirk Outrider gets +2/+2 and has trample.
flavor: Once the goblins thought about it, they preferred being atop a slateback to being in front of, behind, or underneath one.

name: Berserk Murlodont
text: Whenever a Beast becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor:
"The harder we press forward, the harder Krosa pushes us back."
—Aven scout

name: Branchsnap Lorian
text:
Trample
Morph {G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
