flavor: Lorians treat trees and prey the same way: by ripping them limb from limb.

name: Brontotherium
text:
Trample
Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
flavor: Lucky victims get run over. Unlucky victims get run through.

name: Defiant Elf
text: Trample
flavor: "I lost one home when Yavimaya was destroyed. I will not lose another."

name: Elvish Soultiller
text: When Elvish Soultiller dies, choose a creature type. Shuffle all creature cards of that type from your graveyard into your library.
flavor: Mutated elves wondered if this was their final form, or if it was just another step.

name: Glowering Rogon
text: Amplify 1 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each Beast card you reveal in your hand.)
flavor: A herd of one.

name: Hundroog
text: Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor:
"New links are being added to the food chain on a daily basis."
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Needleshot Gourna
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: The first aven scout squad returned from Krosa with disturbing stories. The second returned with disturbing casualties.

name: Root Sliver
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Sliver spells can't be countered.
flavor:
"It would take another apocalypse to stop the slivers now."
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Totem Speaker
text: Whenever a Beast enters the battlefield, you may gain 3 life.
flavor: "Elves and beasts are tied together, and I am the knot that binds them."

name: Vexing Beetle
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Vexing Beetle gets +3/+3 as long as no opponent controls a creature.
flavor: As the Mirari's mutating effects grew out of control, centaurs and druids fled—but insects swarmed closer.

name: Wirewood Hivemaster
text: Whenever another nontoken Elf enters the battlefield, you may create a 1/1 green Insect creature token.
flavor: "Most insects have been drawn to the Mirari. But all that remain in Wirewood are under my care."

name: Avian Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Flying
flavor: Today it flies with the flock. Tomorrow it may wake to find them gone, its body in an unfamiliar form.

name: Brigid, Hero of Kinsbaile
text:
First strike
{T}: Brigid, Hero of Kinsbaile deals 2 damage to each attacking or blocking creature target player controls.
flavor: Thanks to one champion archer, the true borders of Kinsbaile extend an arrow's flight beyond the buildings.

name: Cenn's Heir
text: Whenever Cenn's Heir attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each other attacking Kithkin.
flavor: His home clachan's familial spirit bolsters his own, but he will be ready to preside over the town as cenn only after he learns to project that strength to others.

name: Favor of the Mighty
text: Each creature with the highest mana value has protection from all colors.
flavor:
"What does a mountain fear of a fly? Giants are barely aware of us, let alone afraid."
—Gaddock Teeg

name: Goldmeadow Dodger
text: Goldmeadow Dodger can't be blocked by creatures with power 4 or greater.
flavor: "I've gotten close enough to a giant to smell his breath, but none has ever so much as spotted me. I wonder how long my record can extend?"

name: Goldmeadow Stalwart
text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, reveal a Kithkin card from your hand or pay {3}.
flavor: The thoughtweft ties a clachan together. Sharing each other's hopes and fears, all the village's citizens spring into action upon the first threat to any one of them.

name: Harpoon Sniper
text: {W}, {T}: Harpoon Sniper deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature, where X is the number of Merfolk you control.
flavor: Made from whiskergill bones, merrow spinebows can fire bolts through tree trunks.

name: Hillcomber Giant
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: The giants believe the fossils they find in Lorwyn's rocky heights are dreams frozen in time, and they treasure them.

name: Judge of Currents
text: Whenever a Merfolk you control becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
flavor: Though the currents of the Lanes shift every year, the merrow never lose track of where they are or where they are going.

name: Kinsbaile Balloonist
text:
Flying
Whenever Kinsbaile Balloonist attacks, you may have target creature gain flying until end of turn.
flavor: Even when a giant's tantrum turns the sky into a chaotic gale, the path of the balloonist never falters.

name: Kithkin Greatheart
text: As long as you control a Giant, Kithkin Greatheart gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
flavor: Sometimes a curious giant singles out a "little one" to follow for a few days, never realizing the effect it will have on the little one's life.

name: Kithkin Harbinger
text: When Kithkin Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Kithkin card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.
flavor: Her ears are open to even the softest voice.

name: Kithkin Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: The empathetic nature of the thoughtweft allows kithkin healers to treat the cause of an illness rather than fight its symptoms.

name: Lairwatch Giant
text:
Lairwatch Giant can block an additional creature each combat.
Whenever Lairwatch Giant blocks two or more creatures, it gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: A giant can brood over a grudge for decades, and woe to those who interrupt him.

name: Militia's Pride
text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token that's tapped and attacking.
flavor: If you pick a fight with one kithkin, be ready to fight them all.

name: Neck Snap
text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor:
"We merrows need not be disadvantaged when fighting on land. We lack the vulnerability of those who breathe only through their throats."
—Minnarin, merrow reejerey

name: Shields of Velis Vel
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Creatures target player controls get +0/+1 and gain all creature types until end of turn.
flavor: Changelings can alter shape based on what the beings around them desire most.

name: Summon the School
text:
Create two 1/1 blue Merfolk Wizard creature tokens.
Tap four untapped Merfolk you control: Return Summon the School from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"When merrows talk, listeners grow fins."
—Kithkin saying

name: Surge of Thoughtweft
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. If you control a Kithkin, draw a card.
flavor: Kithkin weave together their very thoughts, creating a depth of cooperation unknown to other races.

name: Veteran of the Depths
text: Whenever Veteran of the Depths becomes tapped, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: In the backwaters of the Merrow Lanes lie stones scarred with tallies of countless generations, each representing a victory of merrow soldiers.

name: Wellgabber Apothecary
text: {1}{W}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target tapped Merfolk or Kithkin creature this turn.
flavor: "You've discovered that boggarts bite, I see. And will the militia be chasing this lot? . . . Ah, you're staying in town to avoid Nath's hunt. Wise. Now this poultice . . ."

name: Wizened Cenn
text: Other Kithkin creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: "Thoughtweft binds us together as one, part of an intricate pattern that would unravel if even one thread came loose."

name: Deeptread Merrow
text: {U}: Deeptread Merrow gains islandwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: "My success at navigating the Dark Meanders irritates the Inkfathom school. They consider themselves peerless divers, but I try to remind them that they cannot own commodities like bravery and cunning."

name: Drowner of Secrets
text: Tap an untapped Merfolk you control: Target player mills a card.
flavor: Merrows consider themselves the keepers of Lorwyn's past—and consider it their duty to edit when necessary.

name: Ego Erasure
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Creatures target player controls get -2/-0 and lose all creature types until end of turn.
flavor: When all is taken away, all are equal.

name: Ethereal Whiskergill
text:
Flying
Ethereal Whiskergill can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor: Fallowsages debate whether the whiskergill is native to the Dark Meanders or merely dreamstuff made real.

name: Faerie Trickery
text: Counter target non-Faerie spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
flavor: The fae are so quick and their life spans so short that it's difficult to get retribution for their pranks.

name: Familiar's Ruse
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
Counter target spell.
flavor: Because of their capricious nature, faeries can serve as living lenses for disruptive magic.

name: Forced Fruition
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player draws seven cards.
flavor:
"Petals within petals within petals, tadpole. The truth lurks below an opulence of illusion."
—Neerdiv, fallowsage

name: Glimmerdust Nap
text:
Enchant tapped creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor: The dreams of giants are as long as time and as deep as the earth. Thus they are prized by the dream-harvesting fae.

name: Inkfathom Divers
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
When Inkfathom Divers enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor:
"None appreciate sun and shallows like those who have seen the depths."
—Lianda of the Stonybrook school

name: Merrow Commerce
text: At the beginning of your end step, untap all Merfolk you control.
flavor: Schools meet and mingle on Lorwyn's riverways. In the bustling interplay, the merrow renew their sense of community as they sharpen their wits and hone their trading skills.

name: Protective Bubble
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: Skilled merrow rudders ensure their charges arrive on time and without incident.

name: Shapesharer
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{2}{U}: Target Shapeshifter becomes a copy of target creature until your next turn.
flavor: One good mimic deserves another.

name: Silvergill Adept
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, reveal a Merfolk card from your hand or pay {3}.
When Silvergill Adept enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: "I bring baubles of lore, lost secrets seined from the listening waves."

name: Silvergill Douser
text: {T}: Target creature gets -X/-0 until end of turn, where X is the number of Merfolk and/or Faeries you control.
flavor: The Silvergill school monitors traffic on the Lanes, ensuring that the riffraff don't interfere with travelers.

name: Streambed Aquitects
text:
{T}: Target Merfolk creature gets +1/+1 and gains islandwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{T}: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.
flavor:
"We look in the river and see scattered stones. A merrow looks and sees a map of Lorwyn."
—Illulia, flamekin soulstoke

name: Surgespanner
text: Whenever Surgespanner becomes tapped, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: They ride on waves of Æther, washing out anything that might pollute the Merrow Lanes.

name: Tideshaper Mystic
text: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn. Activate only during your turn.
flavor: He paints with drop and shimmer a world that exists only in the wistful heart.

name: Turtleshell Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{1}{U}: Switch Turtleshell Changeling's power and toughness until end of turn.
flavor: A changeling involuntarily mimics the nearest being at hand, sometimes trading a borrowed shell for borrowed claws.

name: Wings of Velis Vel
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Until end of turn, target creature has base power and toughness 4/4, gains all creature types, and gains flying.
flavor: Changeling magic grants unusual wishes.

name: Zephyr Net
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has defender and flying.
flavor: Faeries hang beings that interest them as ornaments in the sky, each clique competing to outshine the prize of the last.

name: Black Poplar Shaman
text: {2}{B}: Regenerate target Treefolk.
flavor: It absorbs the pain of other treefolk, which leaves it bitter, yet addicted to the sensation of agony.

name: Boggart Birth Rite
text: Return target Goblin card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Auntie excitedly held up the squalling newborn. "This one looks like Byoog! Maybe he'll tell us what he saw and felt in the beyond."

name: Boggart Loggers
text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{2}{B}, Sacrifice Boggart Loggers: Destroy target Treefolk or Forest.
flavor: Auntie Flint lent axes to Nibb and Gyik, thinking they'd share their experiences with her. She's still waiting for them to come back.

name: Dreamspoiler Witches
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: At night, the faeries steal dreamstuff for their queen. At daybreak, countless creatures wake weak and hollow.

name: Exiled Boggart
text: When Exiled Boggart dies, discard a card.
flavor: Among the boggarts, there is only one real rule: all new treasures and experiences must be shared. Those who hoard their gifts commit the one truly unforgivable sin.

name: Facevaulter
text: {B}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Facevaulter gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Boggarts get so excited when they find something new to smash that they really don't notice who gets underfoot.

name: Faerie Tauntings
text: Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may have each opponent lose 1 life.
flavor: Beneath the fae's constant pranks runs a subtler undercurrent of mockery: the influence of Oona, their hidden queen.

name: Final Revels
text:
Choose one —
• All creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
• All creatures get -0/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: One whiff of the sweet, pungent scent leads to euphoria—or to an early grave.

name: Fodder Launch
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a Goblin.
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn. Fodder Launch deals 5 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor: Leave it to a boggart to come up with a projectile as disgusting as it is deadly.

name: Ghostly Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{1}{B}: Ghostly Changeling gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: In desolate places, changelings may take the shape of fancies, or memories, or fears.

name: Hornet Harasser
text: When Hornet Harasser dies, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"And though she didn't get her honey, Auntie found something far more interesting."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

name: Hunter of Eyeblights
text:
When Hunter of Eyeblights enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you don't control.
{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with a counter on it.
flavor: Snokk ran as fast as he could, but the sound of hooves grew ever louder in his ears.

name: Knucklebone Witch
text: Whenever a Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Knucklebone Witch.
flavor: Each bone honors its owner's best pranks.

name: Mad Auntie
text:
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Regenerate another target Goblin.
flavor: One part cunning, one part wise, and many, many parts demented.

name: Mournwhelk
text:
When Mournwhelk enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
Evoke {3}{B} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
flavor: It hoards Lorwyn's rare sorrows.

name: Nameless Inversion
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Target creature gets +3/-3 and loses all creature types until end of turn.
flavor: Just as a changeling's influence can have dramatic effects, so too can its sudden withdrawal.

name: Nath's Buffoon
text: Protection from Elves
flavor: Smik learned the elvish dance quickly enough. The most difficult, yet most important step was to stay out of Nath's sight until called to perform.

name: Nectar Faerie
text:
Flying
{B}, {T}: Target Faerie or Elf gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
flavor:
"The unpredictable fae are just as likely to provide a blight as a boon."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Peppersmoke
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. If you control a Faerie, draw a card.
flavor: Like being trapped in a perpetual sneeze, faerie-dust poisoning is both exhilarating and agonizing.

name: Quill-Slinger Boggart
text: Whenever a player casts a Kithkin spell, you may have target player lose 1 life.
flavor:
"A good day in Goldmeadow is one in which I don't spend all evening picking quills out of my backside."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

name: Scarred Vinebreeder
text: {2}{B}, Exile an Elf card from your graveyard: Scarred Vinebreeder gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: For disfigured elves, there are few choices beyond death or nettlevine.

name: Skeletal Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Skeletal Changeling.
flavor: Though they lack true flesh and bone of their own, changelings imitate either with equal ease.

name: Spiderwig Boggart
text: When Spiderwig Boggart enters the battlefield, target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: Auntie Flint was the first to pioneer the spiderwig, a mass of arachnids intended to be worn rather than eaten.

name: Squeaking Pie Sneak
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, reveal a Goblin card from your hand or pay {3}.
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor:
"Why do our pies squeak? It's all the faeries, mice, and prickly-hogs we stuff inside."
—Borb of the Squeaking Pie warren

name: Thorntooth Witch
text: Whenever you cast a Treefolk spell, you may have target creature get +3/-3 until end of turn.
flavor: The crone's boughs creaked as she spoke. "You look peaked, little one. Come, sip from my warm brew. It'll have you blooming in no time."

name: Warren Pilferers
text: When Warren Pilferers enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If that card is a Goblin card, Warren Pilferers gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: "What do they need all this stuff for? They're dead. We're alive. Simple enough."

name: Axegrinder Giant
flavor: The angriest of giants are often the most skillful weaponsmiths. Their grudges fuel endless sessions at the forge, all the while growling ferociously to themselves.

name: Blades of Velis Vel
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Up to two target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain all creature types until end of turn.
flavor: "The changing kind suffers as we do. We must join as one to quench our tyrants!"

name: Blind-Spot Giant
text: Blind-Spot Giant can't attack or block unless you control another Giant.
flavor: Among the solitude-loving giantkind, teamwork is unusual. But he appreciates hearing the occasional "Swing down and to your left."

name: Boggart Forager
text: {R}, Sacrifice Boggart Forager: Target player shuffles their library.
flavor:
"Reach in this hole, lose a hand. Reach in that hole, find a sparkly."
—Auntie wisdom

name: Boggart Sprite-Chaser
text: As long as you control a Faerie, Boggart Sprite-Chaser gets +1/+1 and has flying.
flavor:
"Auntie pointed out to the faerie how much mischief a flying boggart could wreak, and a beautiful new friendship was born."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

name: Caterwauling Boggart
text: Goblins you control and Elementals you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor:
"As far as I can tell, that frog dangling from the stick serves absolutely no purpose whatsoever."
—Gaddock Teeg

name: Ceaseless Searblades
text: Whenever you activate an ability of an Elemental, Ceaseless Searblades gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Flamekins' fires burn cool until they decide otherwise.

name: Consuming Bonfire
text:
Choose one —
• Consuming Bonfire deals 4 damage to target non-Elemental creature.
• Consuming Bonfire deals 7 damage to target Treefolk creature.
flavor:
"The elves use treefolk to drive us away. It is time to remove their tools."
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

name: Crush Underfoot
text: Choose a Giant creature you control. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature.
flavor:
Five-toed grave
—Kithkin phrase meaning "a giant's footprint"

name: Flamekin Bladewhirl
text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, reveal an Elemental card from your hand or pay {3}.
flavor:
"The elves may try to confine us, but they will learn that our blazing spirit can never be suppressed."
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

name: Flamekin Spitfire
text: {3}{R}: Flamekin Spitfire deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Some flamekin warriors explore the art of coherence, an ancient discipline that harnesses the chaos of fire and focuses it with pinpoint precision.

name: Giant's Ire
text: Giant's Ire deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker. If you control a Giant, draw a card.
flavor: The only feeling greater than hurling something a mile is crushing something else with it that was really, really irritating you.

name: Goatnapper
text: When Goatnapper enters the battlefield, untap target Goat and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: Kith goats are just for practice. The real prize, of course, is a giant's cloudgoat.

name: Hearthcage Giant
text:
When Hearthcage Giant enters the battlefield, create two 3/1 red Elemental Shaman creature tokens.
Sacrifice an Elemental: Target Giant creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The flamekin are mere kindling for his warmth.

name: Hurly-Burly
text:
Choose one —
• Hurly-Burly deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
• Hurly-Burly deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.
flavor:
"Things were popping like corn in a skillet. Olly landed in the pig pen with his prize sow on top of him, both squealin' like boggarts."
—Deagan, cenn of Burrenton

name: Inner-Flame Igniter
text: {2}{R}: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor: A light an army can follow.

name: Lowland Oaf
text: {T}: Target Goblin creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. Sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "I don't know why the little one was so mad. He said to put him down, and I put him down."

name: Needle Drop
text:
Needle Drop deals 1 damage to any target that was dealt damage this turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"First it was plovers and mulldrifters. Now it's knitting needles the size of javelins."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

name: Bog-Strider Ash
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Whenever a player casts a Goblin spell, you may pay {G}. If you do, you gain 2 life.
flavor: "If you want to test wisdom, offer it to fools and watch how they tear it up."

name: Elvish Handservant
text: Whenever a player casts a Giant spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Handservant.
flavor: The hardest lesson for any elf to learn is humility. It takes a giant to teach that.

name: Eyes of the Wisent
text: Whenever an opponent casts a blue spell during your turn, you may create a 4/4 green Elemental creature token.
flavor:
Calm as a wisent's watch
—Elvish expression meaning "safe"

name: Guardian of Cloverdell
text:
When Guardian of Cloverdell enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens.
{G}, Sacrifice a Kithkin: You gain 1 life.
flavor: Although they're protective of all creatures, many treefolk are especially fond of the empathic kithkin.

name: Heal the Scars
text: Regenerate target creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
flavor: Elvish battle-magic has evolved two specialties: inflicting wounds that scar, and healing wounds without scarring. Politics determines the recipients of each.

name: Hunt Down
text: Target creature blocks target creature this turn if able.
flavor: "Springjacks and faeries can be difficult to hunt, but my favorite prey are the flamekin. They never fail to put up a worthy fight when cornered."

name: Kithkin Daggerdare
text: {G}, {T}: Target attacking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: The kith dance their elaborate reels not merely to celebrate the events of their lives but to form an unbreakable bond of loyalty with their kin, a bond stronger than the fear of death itself.

name: Kithkin Mourncaller
text: Whenever an attacking Kithkin or Elf is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may draw a card.
flavor: Eidren's hunts are dangerous affairs. All dread the inevitable recounting of those who died while flushing out his prey.

name: Lammastide Weave
text:
Choose a card name, then target player mills a card. If a card with the chosen name was milled this way, you gain life equal to its mana value.
Draw a card.
flavor: "A ribbon torn will ward away dark dreams."

name: Rootgrapple
text: Destroy target noncreature permanent. If you control a Treefolk, draw a card.
flavor:
"All the sylvan secrets of this world are etched between my rings. The skinfolk's metal aberrations can rot between my roots."
—Colfenor, the Last Yew

name: Seedguide Ash
text: When Seedguide Ash dies, you may search your library for up to three Forest cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: "May you shade three generations of seedlings."

name: Sylvan Echoes
text: Whenever you clash and win, you may draw a card. (This ability triggers after the clash ends.)
flavor: It takes a huntmaster's eye to discern the contours of mythical prey.

name: Timber Protector
text:
Other Treefolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other Treefolk and Forests you control have indestructible.
flavor: In his presence, an ordinary grove becomes a bastion to turn spells and break armies.

name: Warren-Scourge Elf
text: Protection from Goblins
flavor:
"If one can associate any virtue with the eyeblights, it is the talent some achieve in disposing of them. I have seen the slaying of boggarts raised nearly to an art form."
—Fiala, Gilt-Leaf winnower

name: Woodland Changeling
text: Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
flavor: Changelings cannot resist the draw of a new shape, even if doing so would be in their best interests.

name: Armored Ascension
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Plains you control and has flying.
flavor: "The meadow sprang up beneath me, and I perceived a path from our people's defeat to our highest glory."

name: Baneslayer Angel
text: Flying, first strike, lifelink, protection from Demons and from Dragons
flavor: Some angels protect the meek and innocent. Others seek out and smite evil wherever it lurks.

name: Glorious Charge
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"One's blade is only as sharp as one's conviction."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Griffin Sentinel
text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor: Once a griffin sentinel adopts a territory as its own, only death can force it to betray its post.

name: Guardian Seraph
text:
Flying
If a source an opponent controls would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
flavor: Her gaze prevents the petty sins and her sword punishes the rest.

name: Honor of the Pure
text: White creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.

name: Lifelink
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
flavor: The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.

name: Palace Guard
text: Palace Guard can block any number of creatures.
flavor: "I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench."

name: Rhox Pikemaster
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Other Soldier creatures you control have first strike.
flavor: When the rhoxes charge, everyone else knows which way to run.

name: Siege Mastodon
flavor:
"Defending the citadel is easy. I just take these big fellows outside the main gate and let the enemy take a good long look."
—Mastodon keeper

name: Silence
text: Your opponents can't cast spells this turn.
flavor:
"All the wizardry in the world has to pass through one small and easily sealed door."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Silvercoat Lion
flavor: Hunters of every species on the savannah, silvercoats disdain camouflage in favor of total dominance of the food chain.

name: Stormfront Pegasus
text: Flying
flavor:
"At summer's end, the pegasus herd stampedes across the sky. Their silent footfalls taunt the clouds and bid the rains to come."
—Stormfront fable

name: Undead Slayer
text: {W}, {T}: Exile target Skeleton, Vampire, or Zombie.
flavor: "My motive is not vengeance but mercy. I deliver the soulless back to their severed souls."

name: Wall of Faith
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Wall of Faith gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"This is a fine suit, armorsmith. I will be safe from harm. If only you could forge rings to mail the rest of my people . . ."
—Lord Hilneth

name: Alluring Siren
text: {T}: Target creature an opponent controls attacks you this turn if able.
flavor:
"The ground polluted floats with human gore,
And human carnage taints the dreadful shore
Fly swift the dangerous coast: let every ear
Be stopp'd against the song! 'tis death to hear!"
—Homer, *The Odyssey*, trans. Pope

name: Convincing Mirage
text:
Enchant land
As Convincing Mirage enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.
flavor: "Where are we? You must learn to ask more useful questions than that."

name: Disorient
text: Target creature gets -7/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"If it has a brain, even a primitive one, we can most surely scramble it."
—Garild, merfolk mage

name: Hive Mind
text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player copies that spell. Each of those players may choose new targets for their copy.
flavor:
"All consciousness is one, separated only by a thin veil of the physical."
—Jace Beleren

name: Illusionary Servant
text:
Flying
When Illusionary Servant becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor:
"Illusion is a handy but fragile medium. Use it only in a pinch, or against the dim-witted."
—Jace Beleren

name: Jump
text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"Humanity has always envied the power of flight. So we took it."
—Scytha, aeromage

name: Tome Scour
text: Target player mills five cards.
flavor: Genius is overrated, especially when it's someone else's.

name: Wall of Frost
text:
Defender
Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor:
"I welcome it. The pasture is cleared of weeds and the wolves are frozen solid."
—Lumi, goatherd

name: Zephyr Sprite
text: Flying
flavor: "I've never understood why so many beings lumber around on the ground. There are three dimensions, yet they use only two."

name: Acolyte of Xathrid
text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.
flavor: Like all priests, she gives her blessings only to those truly worthy of them.

name: Disentomb
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"Stop complaining. You can rest when you're dead. Oh—sorry."
—Liliana Vess

name: Dread Warlock
text: Dread Warlock can't be blocked except by black creatures.
flavor: "I don't know who to pity more: those who flee from my presence or the damned who can withstand it."

name: Kelinore Bat
text: Flying
flavor: The nesting bats of Kelinore sleep soundly while the sun passes, nestled among their grisly collections.

name: Soul Bleed
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 1 life.
flavor: Whether the end comes swift or slow, it always comes too soon.

name: Vampire Aristocrat
text: Sacrifice a creature: Vampire Aristocrat gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: "I admit, I am a creature of the city. The sights, the nightly excitement, the abundance of fine drink . . ."

name: Vampire Nocturnus
text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus and other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+1 and have flying.
flavor: "Your life will set with the sun."

name: Warpath Ghoul
flavor: The battle was over, but the carnage continued for days.

name: Weakness
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
flavor: "For strength to have any meaning, there must also be . . . you."

name: Berserkers of Blood Ridge
text: Berserkers of Blood Ridge attacks each combat if able.
flavor: They take a blood oath to die in battle. So far none have failed to fulfill the promise.

name: Burst of Speed
text: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn. (They can attack and {T} even if they just came under your control.)
flavor: Great generals inspire by example. Goblin chieftains inspire by electrifying the barracks.

name: Inferno Elemental
text: Whenever Inferno Elemental blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Inferno Elemental deals 3 damage to that creature.
flavor:
"Those who wish to invade our monastery, please take it up with my servant."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Jackal Familiar
text: Jackal Familiar can't attack or block alone.
flavor:
"Let the gray-hairs keep their ravens and drakes. My familiar will be a reflection of me: bloodthirsty, with a predator's instinct."
—Taivang, barbarian warlord

name: Viashino Spearhunter
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: Viashino lack the majesty of their draconic ancestors, but they lash out with equal rage and twice the spite.

name: Yawning Fissure
text: Each opponent sacrifices a land.
flavor: The mapmaker scowled. He sighed, unrolled his parchment, and painted a large black blob where the Eternal Meadow was once marked.

name: Ant Queen
text: {1}{G}: Create a 1/1 green Insect creature token.
flavor:
"Kill the queen first, or we'll be fighting her drones forever. It is not in a queen's nature to have enough servants."
—Borzard, exterminator captain

name: Bountiful Harvest
text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.
flavor: Following the sun's cycle, harvest season comes once a year—unless the druids bid the sun behave otherwise.

name: Bramble Creeper
text: Whenever Bramble Creeper attacks, it gets +5/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"I've seen the fully grown ones tear a baloth to gory ribbons in seconds."
—Kivi, thornberry harvester

name: Centaur Courser
flavor:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

name: Emerald Oryx
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: After the oryx dies, its flesh returns to the earth, but its emerald bones remain as a tribute to the forest.

name: Entangling Vines
text:
Enchant tapped creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor: Every living thing has roots in nature. Sometimes nature gets its roots into you.

name: Great Sable Stag
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Protection from blue and from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything blue or black.)
flavor: Ineffable and incorruptible.

name: Kalonian Behemoth
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"Do not fire upon it—it is bad luck. And a waste of arrows."
—Alera Benath, Kalonian ranger

name: Mist Leopard
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"I can't claim to hunt all creatures. There are some things in the jungle that simply can't be hunted."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Mold Adder
text: Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Mold Adder.
flavor: The more you struggle against its coils, the tighter they get.

name: Oakenform
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
flavor:
"When the beast cloaks itself in the mighty oak, what good is a bow? When the oak wraps itself around the snarling beast, what good is a hatchet?"
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

name: Prized Unicorn
text: All creatures able to block Prized Unicorn do so.
flavor:
"The desire for its magic horn inspires such bloodthirsty greed that all who see the unicorn will kill to possess it."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

name: Regenerate
text: Regenerate target creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: "This wound shall be like the chills of winter: swiftly forgotten when spring shoots rise."

name: Stampeding Rhino
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor:
"Sometimes I wonder if our weapons and armor are a step backward."
—Soron, rhox pikemaster

name: Cloud Crusader
text:
Flying
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: Each crusader bonds with a griffin fledgling while still a child, and the two grow up as siblings.

name: Goldenglow Moth
text:
Flying
Whenever Goldenglow Moth blocks, you may gain 4 life.
flavor:
"Little moth, fluttering bright, What luck will you bring tonight?"
—Benalish children's rhyme

name: Tireless Missionaries
text: When Tireless Missionaries enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
flavor: If they succeed in their holy work, their order will vanish into welcome obscurity, for there will be no more souls to redeem.

name: Armored Cancrix
flavor: Creatures displaced from time still turn up every year, stranded by the temporal disaster that once swept across Dominaria.

name: Harbor Serpent
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Harbor Serpent can't attack unless there are five or more Islands on the battlefield.
flavor: Like most giant monsters villagers worship as gods, it proves a fickle master.

name: Jace's Erasure
text: Whenever you draw a card, you may have target player mill a card.
flavor: "You should try to clear your mind of idle thoughts. And if you can't, I will."

name: Maritime Guard
flavor: Once common in the Kapsho Seas, merfolk were hunted almost to extinction. They survived those dark days and emerged calculating and determined to endure.

name: Phantom Beast
text: When Phantom Beast becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor: As insubstantial as fear, and as dangerous.

name: Redirect
text: You may choose new targets for target spell.
flavor:
"Your strategy is marvelous. I've just made a few minor adjustments."
—Veris, watcher of Indi Keep

name: Time Reversal
text: Each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library, then draws seven cards. Exile Time Reversal.
flavor:
"Optimists see the world as they wish it to be. Pessimists see the world as it is. Must these roles be mutually exclusive?"
—Evo Ragus

name: Water Servant
text:
{U}: Water Servant gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{U}: Water Servant gets -1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"This creature has innate perceptiveness. It knows when to rise and when to vanish into the tides."
—Jestus Dreya, *Of Elements and Eternity*

name: Barony Vampire
flavor: "Poor little sun-dweller out past curfew. And to think, you might have survived if it wasn't so close to suppertime."

name: Blood Tithe
text: Each opponent loses 3 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
flavor: The Crimson Throne may be empty, but its coffers are full.

name: Bog Raiders
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: Zombies are the perfect marshland fighters—they don't need to breathe and they don't care what they step in.

name: Dark Tutelage
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to its mana value.
flavor:
"It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness."
—Seneca, *Epistles*, trans. Gummere

name: Demon of Death's Gate
text:
You may pay 6 life and sacrifice three black creatures rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Flying, trample
flavor: The locks on the cages of the damned are opened with keys of marrow, sinew, and blood.

name: Liliana's Caress
text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, that player loses 2 life.
flavor: "This might hurt less if you don't fight so hard. But I doubt it."

name: Nether Horror
flavor:
"My dreams darkened and seeped into my waking hours. Spellcraft and nightmare merged to create this monstrosity."
—Sunniva, witch of Holm Hollow

name: Nightwing Shade
text:
Flying
{1}{B}: Nightwing Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"There is one hour of the night even we do not watch."
—Sedva, captain of the watch

name: Quag Sickness
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each Swamp you control.
flavor: The dread gases didn't kill Farbid. But as he lay in the muck, miserable and helpless, watching ghouls and rats advance on him, he wished they had.

name: Rotting Legion
text: Rotting Legion enters the battlefield tapped.
flavor: Zombies have one speed: shamble.

name: Stabbing Pain
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Tap that creature.
flavor:
"You can take the fight out of nearly any creature if you know where its soft spot is."
—Guttor, flesh-warper

name: Arc Runner
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Arc Runner.
flavor: The storms of the wastelands form quickly and hit hard. Few have anything to do with rain.

name: Bloodcrazed Goblin
text: Bloodcrazed Goblin can't attack unless an opponent has been dealt damage this turn.
flavor:
"A single drop of blood draws their attention, then they strip your bones clean before you have time to die."
—Jamias, hermit of Telfer Peak

name: Destructive Force
text: Each player sacrifices five lands. Destructive Force deals 5 damage to each creature.
flavor: The end of the world rarely comes quietly.

name: Fire Servant
text: If a red instant or sorcery spell you control would deal damage, it deals double that damage instead.
flavor:
"Elemental fire shimmers with rose hues and, unlike terrestrial blazes, smolders long after it's extinguished."
—Jestus Dreya, *Of Elements and Eternity*

name: Incite
text: Target creature becomes red until end of turn and attacks this turn if able.
flavor: The veneer of rationality peeled from the mage, revealing the spite and rage beneath.

name: Manic Vandal
text: When Manic Vandal enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
flavor: It's fun. He doesn't need another reason.

name: Volcanic Strength
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has mountainwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: His blood boiled over, and he erupted with fists of stone.

name: Autumn's Veil
text: Spells you control can't be countered by blue or black spells this turn, and creatures you control can't be the targets of blue or black spells this turn.
flavor: The rustling of leaves and a passing shadow are a dryad's only trace.

name: Back to Nature
text: Destroy all enchantments.
flavor:
"Nature is a mutable cloud which is always and never the same."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson, *Essays*

name: Brindle Boar
text: Sacrifice Brindle Boar: You gain 4 life.
flavor: The war lasted for generations. The boars didn't need to hunt for food anymore. They fed on the fallen corpses, and the living fed off of them.

name: Dryad's Favor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has forestwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: She grants knowledge of the ways to traverse the forest's invisible connections.

name: Hunters' Feast
text: Any number of target players each gain 6 life.
flavor: Those who kill a jawspur rhino must prepare spells to lift the carcass—even a dozen hunters can't lift its bulk.

name: Sacred Wolf
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor:
"I raised my bow, and the wolf stared at me. Under its gaze, my finger would not release the string."
—Aref the Hunter

name: Arbalest Elite
text: {2}{W}, {T}: Arbalest Elite deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. Arbalest Elite doesn't untap during your next untap step.
flavor: There are few things as satisfying as a good, healthy thunk.

name: Armored Warhorse
flavor:
"When we of the Northern Verge claim a mount, no peasant's nag will do. It must be as strong as our virtue, and must join us of its own will."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Benalish Veteran
text: Whenever Benalish Veteran attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "One day I will rest and join my comrades in the afterlife, but not while scum like you still sully this world."

name: Divine Favor
text:
Enchant creature
When Divine Favor enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
flavor: With an armory of light, even the squire may champion her people.

name: Gideon's Avenger
text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a +1/+1 counter on Gideon's Avenger.
flavor: "The good don't sit and wait for the evil to act. They prepare to defend. They prepare to punish."

name: Griffin Rider
text: As long as you control a Griffin creature, Griffin Rider gets +3/+3 and has flying.
flavor: After fighting alongside the griffin riders, older knights of Thune learned to admire a mount that could rip an enemy to shreds in seconds.

name: Guardians' Pledge
text: White creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: A dozen fighting for each other are worth a thousand fighting for themselves.

name: Peregrine Griffin
text:
Flying
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: A griffin is not just an eagle's wings and a lion's claws. It is also the fiercest of hearts.

name: Personal Sanctuary
text: During your turn, prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.
flavor:
"There is a place deep within my soul where no foe can intrude and no tyrant can conquer."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Stonehorn Dignitary
text: When Stonehorn Dignitary enters the battlefield, target opponent skips their next combat phase.
flavor: It did not escape the ambassador's notice that the sound of war drums could also marshal the city to attention.

name: Timely Reinforcements
text: If you have less life than an opponent, you gain 6 life. If you control fewer creatures than an opponent, create three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
flavor: The gods are not always kind, but they do have a soft spot for plucky underdogs.

name: Amphin Cutthroat
flavor:
"The amphin have long built their society in secret. While surface dwellers squabbled over trivial borders, they patiently expanded, building their ammonite temple-caves. Now amphin priests eye the shore, and amphin hunters gird for war."
—Gor Muldrak, *Cryptohistories*

name: Aven Fleetwing
text:
Flying
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor:
"It was too fast, even for our veteran archers. They might as well have been blowing it kisses."
—Vulok, elvish archer

name: Chasm Drake
text:
Flying
Whenever Chasm Drake attacks, target creature you control gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"Once he's got you, hold on. Fall from a drake and you'll suffer much worse than a bruise."
—Garl, drake trainer

name: Flight
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
flavor:
"Those who claim to know the world in its entirety rarely have the requisite perspective."
—Ulmarus the Wise

name: Frost Breath
text: Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
flavor: If you have to be stuck somewhere for a while, it's better to be stuck there with a friend.

name: Lord of the Unreal
text: Illusion creatures you control get +1/+1 and have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: "The dream does not end until I say so."

name: Master Thief
text: When Master Thief enters the battlefield, gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Master Thief.
flavor: Possession is ten-tenths of the law.

name: Merfolk Mesmerist
text: {U}, {T}: Target player mills two cards.
flavor:
"Don't you think if I saw a half-woman, half-fish with three glowing eyes, I'd have remembered?"
—Drugo, town guard

name: Mind Unbound
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a lore counter on Mind Unbound, then draw a card for each lore counter on Mind Unbound.
flavor: The creations of the hand are confined by reality. The creations of the mind know no such limits.

name: Skywinder Drake
text:
Flying
Skywinder Drake can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: It's so light and fragile that it can glide where the air is thinnest.

name: Visions of Beyond
text: Draw a card. If a graveyard has twenty or more cards in it, draw three cards instead.
flavor:
"The past is the foundation for all that exists in the present. We merely reconstruct what our ancestors have already discovered."
—Sachimir, Sage of Memories

name: Blood Seeker
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may have that player lose 1 life.
flavor: A drop now is all he needs to find you later.

name: Brink of Disaster
text:
Enchant creature or land
When enchanted permanent becomes tapped, destroy it.
flavor:
"When you find yourself teetering on the edge of oblivion, mine will be the hands taking pleasure in giving you the final push."
—Liliana Vess

name: Dark Favor
text:
Enchant creature
When Dark Favor enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1.
flavor: When he began to curse what he held holy, his strength grew unrivaled.

name: Drifting Shade
text:
Flying
{B}: Drifting Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: It stalks the fens by the light of the full moon, gathering shadows as it floats among them.

name: Hideous Visage
text: Creatures you control gain intimidate until end of turn. (Each of those creatures can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
flavor: "Seeing you cower before me is its own reward."

name: Monomania
text: Target player chooses a card in their hand and discards the rest.
flavor:
"What do vermin cling to when all hope is lost?"
—Sorin Markov

name: Onyx Mage
text: {1}{B}: Target creature you control gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor:
"We wield death and darkness, powers that make lesser mages tremble in fear."
—Onyx creed

name: Sorin's Vengeance
text: Sorin's Vengeance deals 10 damage to target player or planeswalker and you gain 10 life.
flavor: "Cherish these last moments. Though your miserable life has come to nothing, I have given it a magnificent end."

name: Taste of Blood
text: Taste of Blood deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker and you gain 1 life.
flavor:
"How blessed are some people, whose lives have no fears, no dreads, to whom sleep is a blessing that comes nightly, and brings nothing but sweet dreams."
—Bram Stoker, *Dracula*

name: Wring Flesh
text: Target creature gets -3/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Don't blame me. You're the one walking around with skin."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: Bonebreaker Giant
flavor: One thing's for sure—his fists are harder than your skull.

name: Circle of Flame
text: Whenever a creature without flying attacks you or a planeswalker you control, Circle of Flame deals 1 damage to that creature.
flavor:
"Which do you think is a better deterrent: a moat of water or one of fire?"
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Furyborn Hellkite
text:
Bloodthirst 6 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.)
Flying
flavor:
"Careful. A drop of blood here means death for us all."
—Kalek, mountain guide

name: Goblin Fireslinger
text: {T}: Goblin Fireslinger deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: A rock between your eyes hurts. A burning rock between your eyes ruins your whole day.

name: Scrambleverse
text: For each nonland permanent, choose a player at random. Then each player gains control of each permanent for which they were chosen. Untap those permanents.
flavor: Sometimes a little chaos is in order.

name: Slaughter Cry
text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: It's rather embarrassing to end up with your head mounted over his hearth.

name: Tectonic Rift
text: Destroy target land. Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
flavor:
"You will kneel before me, even if I have to split the earth under your feet!"
—Ash Kronor, Keldon warlord

name: Wall of Torches
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor: The foolish try to leap through the unlit spaces. The arrogant believe the fires harmless. The wise find a different door.

name: Doubling Chant
text: For each creature you control, you may search your library for a creature card with the same name as that creature. Put those cards onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: What's scarier than one of every beast in the forest?

name: Dungrove Elder
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Dungrove Elder's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.
flavor: All the trees of the forest are his army, and every leaf his shield.

name: Gladecover Scout
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: "The forest is my cover and I hold it close. In such a tight embrace, there is no room for wickedness."

name: Titanic Growth
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
flavor: The pup looked over the treetops, eyeing the man who just yesterday had kicked her. Suddenly, her hunger was infused with pure delight.

name: Vastwood Gorger
flavor: The gorger's insect-like eyes pick up the slightest movement in any direction. Its body then whips toward its prey with startling speed, swallowing it in one engulfing gulp.

name: Battleflight Eagle
text:
Flying
When Battleflight Eagle enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Eagles make fine mounts, but they're too proud to carry anyone for long.

name: Guardian Lions
text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor: Approach in peace or not at all.

name: Healer of the Pride
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 2 life.
flavor: "No life is without meaning. No living thing is too small to be strong."

name: Knight of Glory
text:
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "I will uphold the law, and no manner of foe will stop me."

name: Show of Valor
text: Target creature gets +2/+4 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Duty, honor, and valor are either in your heart or they are not. You will never know for certain until you are tested."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Touch of the Eternal
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, count the number of permanents you control. Your life total becomes that number.
flavor:
"Time is a vigilant tyrant, but there are those who have broken free of its gaze."
—Laikas, Erunian monk

name: War Falcon
text:
Flying
War Falcon can't attack unless you control a Knight or a Soldier.
flavor: The falcon is the picture of nobility, maintaining a regal bearing even as it conducts the bloody business of war.

name: Warclamp Mastiff
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor:
"One bite from that dog will send you to the healer's tent for days."
—Watchmaster Finn of An Karras

name: Courtly Provocateur
text:
{T}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.
{T}: Target creature blocks this turn if able.
flavor: "My one regret is that I have mastered an art that leaves its audience unable to applaud."

name: Downpour
text: Tap up to three target creatures.
flavor:
"The sky holds vast oceans. They are at your fingertips if you know how to call them."
—Talrand, sky summoner

name: Encrust
text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step and its activated abilities can't be activated.
flavor:
"Barnacles are the sea's final defense."
—Garild, merfolk mage

name: Hydrosurge
text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Thirsty?"
—Drunvalus, hydromancer

name: Mind Sculpt
text: Target opponent mills seven cards.
flavor:
"Your mind was a curious mix of madness and genius. I just took away the genius."
—Jace Beleren

name: Omniscience
text: You may cast spells from your hand without paying their mana costs.
flavor:
"The things I once imagined would be my greatest achievements were only the first steps toward a future I can only begin to fathom."
—Jace Beleren

name: Tricks of the Trade
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and can't be blocked.
flavor: "Pathetic. You might as well have protected your treasures with a paper box and some string."

name: Void Stalker
text: {2}{U}, {T}: Put Void Stalker and target creature on top of their owners' libraries, then those players shuffle their libraries.
flavor: Now you see it, now you're gone.

name: Blood Reckoning
text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, that creature's controller loses 1 life.
flavor:
"There is no greater folly than standing against me."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Cower in Fear
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"You will fully understand fear when you discover it is the final thing you put your faith in."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Crippling Blight
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and can't block.
flavor:
"Still alive? No matter. I'll leave you as a warning to others who would oppose me."
—Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter

name: Diabolic Revelation
text: Search your library for up to X cards, put those cards into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor:
"There are some secrets so dark no human mind should ever contain them. Interested?"
—Nefarox, Overlord of Grixis

name: Knight of Infamy
text:
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "Your laws, like your bones, were made to be broken."

name: Servant of Nefarox
text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "My cause is power, and at the altar of power I will gladly forfeit my soul."

name: Veilborn Ghoul
text:
Veilborn Ghoul can't block.
Whenever a Swamp enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Veilborn Ghoul from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Liliana's voice carries far, reaching beyond the cold pall of death.

name: Vile Rebirth
text: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
flavor:
"'Here lies our beloved Gartu, the gentlest of all men.' Ooh, I love irony."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Chandra's Fury
text: Chandra's Fury deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker and 1 damage to each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.
flavor: "I asked if they wanted to do things the easy way. I meant easy for me."

name: Craterize
text: Destroy target land.
flavor:
"'Utterly' is my favorite way to destroy something."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Firewing Phoenix
text:
Flying
{1}{R}{R}{R}: Return Firewing Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"When a phoenix nests in a volcano, we rejoice, for it means a hundred years of war."
—Golmak, Keldon warlord

name: Goblin Battle Jester
text: Whenever you cast a red spell, target creature can't block this turn.
flavor: Somehow goblins found a tactical advantage by sending a clown to war.

name: Mindclaw Shaman
text: When Mindclaw Shaman enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand. You may cast an instant or sorcery spell from among those cards without paying its mana cost.
flavor: Nicol Bolas gives power to those who will abuse it most.

name: Reckless Brute
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Reckless Brute attacks each combat if able.
flavor: His mind knows no fear, registering only the burning impulse to destroy.

name: Smelt
text: Destroy target artifact.
flavor:
"Looks like that wasn't darksteel after all."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Turn to Slag
text: Turn to Slag deals 5 damage to target creature. Destroy all Equipment attached to that creature.
flavor:
"If it wasn't a blackened, stinking, melted abomination before, it certainly is now."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Wild Guess
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards.
flavor: No guts, no glory.

name: Worldfire
text: Exile all permanents. Exile all cards from all hands and graveyards. Each player's life total becomes 1.
flavor: Even the smallest spark may set a world ablaze.

name: Arbor Elf
text: {T}: Untap target Forest.
flavor: "The forest will surround you with its life if you are still and calm."

name: Bond Beetle
text: When Bond Beetle enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor:
A beetle on your shoulder
—Elvish expression meaning "a blessing of luck"

name: Fungal Sprouting
text: Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.
flavor:
"Saprolings need only a host to feed upon. Numbers will take care of the rest."
—Ghave, Guru of Spores

name: Mwonvuli Beast Tracker
text: When Mwonvuli Beast Tracker enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with deathtouch, hexproof, reach, or trample and reveal it. Shuffle and put that card on top.
flavor: "The more dangerous, the better."

name: Predatory Rampage
text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn. Each creature your opponents control blocks this turn if able.
flavor:
"It is the fate of the weak to fall."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Ranger's Path
text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: The forest can seem like a dense maze. Those who travel the canopy know otherwise.

name: Roaring Primadox
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"They're easy enough to find. Question is, are you sure you want to find one?"
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

name: Serpent's Gift
text: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor: Venom is nature's way of redressing the imbalance between weak and mighty.

name: Spiked Baloth
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor: If a baloth isn't hungry, it's dead.

name: Yeva's Forcemage
text: When Yeva's Forcemage enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: "Nature can't be stopped. It rips and tears at Ravnica's tallest buildings to claim its place in the sun."

name: Blessing
text:
Enchant creature
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Virtue can't survive without strength."
—Ardanna of the Angelic Council

name: Bonescythe Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have double strike. (They deal both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
flavor:
"Their appendages are sharper than our swords and quicker than our bows."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

name: Capashen Knight
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{1}{W}: Capashen Knight gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: He protects Benalia as much with his reputation as with his force of arms.

name: Charging Griffin
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Charging Griffin attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Four claws, two wings, one beak, no fear.

name: Devout Invocation
text: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. Create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying for each creature tapped this way.
flavor: A prayer to bring demons to their knees.

name: Hive Stirrings
text: Create two 1/1 colorless Sliver creature tokens.
flavor: Sliver young are sorted into clutches according to their potential and their future role. Human scholars can only guess how those are determined.

name: Imposing Sovereign
text: Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor: Some are born to rule. The rest are born to bow before them.

name: Indestructibility
text:
Enchant permanent
Enchanted permanent has indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy that permanent. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)
flavor: "By all means, keep trying."

name: Master of Diversion
text: Whenever Master of Diversion attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.
flavor: Choose your battles carefully. For example, avoid the big guy.

name: Sentinel Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)
flavor: Through its watchful gaze, all slivers may see.

name: Seraph of the Sword
text:
Flying
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Seraph of the Sword.
flavor: "Only when my sword lies idle shall I rejoice."

name: Soulmender
text: {T}: You gain 1 life.
flavor: "Healing is more art than magic. Well, there is still quite a bit of magic."

name: Steelform Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control get +0/+1.
flavor:
"Though the slivers may sometimes resemble us, they are not human. Anyone who fights them must remember this."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Stonehorn Chanter
text: {5}{W}: Stonehorn Chanter gains vigilance and lifelink until end of turn. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap. Damage dealt by it also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: With the Stonehorn, piety and power are one.

name: Dismiss into Dream
text: Each creature your opponents control is an Illusion in addition to its other types and has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."
flavor:
"You trust in the shadows of a breeze."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Disperse
text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: Gryffid found his way home and resumed life as best he could, constantly hiding his newfound fear of clouds.

name: Galerider Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have flying.
flavor: Masters of adaptation, galeriders serve multiple purposes useful to the hive. When they're not patrolling their territories, their majestic wings serve to circulate cool air through the vast hive chambers.

name: Glimpse the Future
text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor:
"No simple coin toss can solve this riddle. You must think and choose wisely."
—Shai Fusan, archmage

name: Messenger Drake
text:
Flying
When Messenger Drake dies, draw a card.
flavor: The more important the message, the larger the messenger.

name: Seacoast Drake
text: Flying
flavor: Seacoast drakes have been known to follow ships for hundreds of miles, waiting to snap up garbage, bait, and the occasional sailor.

name: Trained Condor
text:
Flying
Whenever Trained Condor attacks, another target creature you control gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"They're smart enough to understand that war means lots of carrion."
—Griv, condor rider

name: Zephyr Charge
text: {1}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"All armies prefer high ground to low and sunny places to dark."
—Sun Tzu, *Art of War*, trans. Giles

name: Accursed Spirit
text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
flavor: Many have heard the slither of dragging armor and the soft squelch of its voice. But only its victims ever meet its icy gaze.

name: Artificer's Hex
text:
Enchant Equipment
At the beginning of your upkeep, if enchanted Equipment is attached to a creature, destroy that creature.
flavor:
"Some treasures aren't worth finding, let alone stealing."
—Dack Fayden

name: Blightcaster
text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may have target creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: "Your flesh is unprepared for my gifts."

name: Dark Prophecy
text: Whenever a creature you control dies, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor: When the bog ran short on small animals, Ekri turned to the surrounding farmlands.

name: Deathgaze Cockatrice
text:
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor:
"Sometimes I come across a stone finger or foot and I know I'm in cockatrice territory."
—Rulak, bog guide

name: Grim Return
text: Choose target creature card in a graveyard that was put there from the battlefield this turn. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.
flavor: The necromancer's touch strips away memory and loyalty, and only strength and malice remain.

name: Minotaur Abomination
flavor:
"Look at that. Shuffling, wobbling, entrails placed haphazardly. It's shameful. Who would let that kind of work flap about for all to see?"
—Lestin, necromancer

name: Shrivel
text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Do not weep for the frail. Their time couldn't have been that far off."
—Nathrac, plaguesower

name: Syphon Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have lifelink. (Damage dealt by a Sliver creature you control also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: When the hive must feed, every appendage becomes an additional mouth.

name: Undead Minotaur
flavor:
"The work that went into creating this magnificent specimen. Horrific, deadly, well-balanced. Not all necromancers do elegant work like this."
—Lestin, necromancer

name: Vampire Warlord
text: Sacrifice another creature: Regenerate Vampire Warlord. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: "How can you serve me? By dying."

name: Awaken the Ancient
text:
Enchant Mountain
Enchanted Mountain is a 7/7 red Giant creature with haste. It's still a land.
flavor: Some days you stand to greet the horizon. Other days the horizon stands to greet you.

name: Battle Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control get +2/+0.
flavor:
"One emitted a strange series of buzzing clicks and guttural commands, then clawed arms emerged from all of them. Is there no limit to their adaptations?"
—Hastric, Thunian scout

name: Blur Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
flavor: They move in a synchronized swarm, turning entire squads into heaps of bloody rags and bones in an instant.

name: Burning Earth
text: Whenever a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, Burning Earth deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor:
"Your world is formed from the same power that wraps my burning hand around your throat."
—Shrazik, lavamancer

name: Cyclops Tyrant
text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Cyclops Tyrant can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
flavor: A single eye, blinded by rage.

name: Fleshpulper Giant
text: When Fleshpulper Giant enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature with toughness 2 or less.
flavor: He doesn't hate small folk. He just likes the squishing sound they make.

name: Marauding Maulhorn
text: Marauding Maulhorn attacks each combat if able unless you control a creature named Advocate of the Beast.
flavor:
"It's not just you. Everyone makes it angry."
—Ardenoth, elvish nature advocate

name: Molten Birth
text: Create two 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens, then flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Molten Birth to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Few can coax the creatures within the magma to be cooled and take form."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Regathan Firecat
flavor: It stalks the Regathan highlands, leaving behind melted snow, scorched earth, and the charred corpses of would-be temple robbers.

name: Shiv's Embrace
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: When you see the world as a dragon sees it, everything looks fit to burn.

name: Striking Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have first strike. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: You're too busy recoiling in fear to realize that it's already hit you.

name: Thorncaster Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "Whenever this creature attacks, it deals 1 damage to any target."
flavor: Every inch of a sliver's body is a potential claw, appendage, or projectile.

name: Advocate of the Beast
text: At the beginning of your end step, put a +1/+1 counter on target Beast creature you control.
flavor: "I am neither their drover nor their leader. To these majestic beasts, I am simply their herdmate and nothing more."

name: Into the Wilds
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may put it onto the battlefield.
flavor:
"Wonders hide where the trees grow thickest."
—Mul Daya proverb

name: Kalonian Tusker
flavor:
"And all this time I thought *we* were tracking *it*."
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

name: Megantic Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control get +3/+3.
flavor: Even the thrums, the lowliest of slivers, become deadly in its presence.

name: Oath of the Ancient Wood
text: Whenever Oath of the Ancient Wood or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor: "Some gaze upon the forest and see trees. I see true power."

name: Predatory Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: No matter how much the slivers change, their collective might remains.

name: Voracious Wurm
text: Voracious Wurm enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the amount of life you've gained this turn.
flavor: Shepherds in Kalonia know it's better to let sheep roam than have them be trapped when the wurms are feeding.

name: Constricting Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "When this creature enters the battlefield, you may exile target creature an opponent controls until this creature leaves the battlefield."
flavor: Slivers are often seen toying with enemies they capture, not out of cruelty, but to fully learn their physical capabilities.

name: Heliod's Pilgrim
text: When Heliod's Pilgrim enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Aura card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: The blessings of Heliod are apparent for all to see.

name: Marked by Honor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)
flavor: Stand your post for duty. Stand your ground for honor.

name: Mass Calcify
text: Destroy all nonwhite creatures.
flavor: The dead serve as their own tombstones.

name: Meditation Puzzle
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
You gain 8 life.
flavor: Find your center, and you will find your way.

name: Pillar of Light
text: Exile target creature with toughness 4 or greater.
flavor:
"The vaulted ceiling of our faith rests upon such pillars."
—Darugand, banisher priest

name: Resolute Archangel
text:
Flying
When Resolute Archangel enters the battlefield, if your life total is less than your starting life total, it becomes equal to your starting life total.
flavor: Cut it down, bury it in snow, put it to the torch. The rose will still bloom again.

name: Sanctified Charge
text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. White creatures you control also gain first strike until end of turn. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: You need only raise your spear to receive this blessing.

name: Spirit Bonds
text:
Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {W}. If you do, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
{1}{W}, Sacrifice a Spirit: Target non-Spirit creature gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
flavor: Designed by Justin Gary

name: Sungrace Pegasus
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: The sacred feathers of the pegasus are said to have healing powers.

name: Wall of Essence
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Essence is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
flavor:
"If you cannot turn your enemy's strength to weakness, then make that strength your own."
—Gresha, warrior sage

name: Warden of the Beyond
text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Warden of the Beyond gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent owns a card in exile.
flavor: He draws strength from a vast source few mortals can fathom. Designed by Isaiah Cartwright

name: Amphin Pathmage
text: {2}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
flavor:
"There are those who do not believe in the existence of the amphin. This seems somehow to be of their own design."
—Gor Muldrak, *Cryptohistories*

name: Chasm Skulker
text:
Whenever you draw a card, put a +1/+1 counter on Chasm Skulker.
