text:
Enchant nonland permanent
Enchanted permanent can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
flavor:
"A master of hieromancy can see the advantage in any scenario."
—Warden Hixus, to Kytheon

name: Survive the Night
text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
Investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: The longest nights are measured not in hours, but in heartbeats.

name: Territorial Hammerskull
text: Whenever Territorial Hammerskull attacks, tap target creature an opponent controls.
flavor: From the eyes up, it's solid bone and stubbornness.

name: Volunteer Reserves
text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
flavor:
"I'm always a little leery of anyone who offers to kill other people for free."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Wall of One Thousand Cuts
text:
Defender, flying
{W}: Wall of One Thousand Cuts can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.
flavor: Families of the fallen donate the swords of their loved ones to bolster the city's defenses.

name: Chillbringer
text:
Flying
When Chillbringer enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: If you can see your breath, it's too late to run.

name: Clear the Mind
text:
Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"The best way to keep a secret is to forget it."
—Lazav

name: Corrupted Conscience
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: Karn's creation is now his master.

name: Crush Dissent
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Amass 2. (Put two +1/+1 counters on an Army you control. If you don't control one, create a 0/0 black Zombie Army creature token first.)
flavor:
"All I ask is complete obedience."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Foil
text:
You may discard an Island card and another card rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Counter target spell.
flavor: Among wizards, poor timing is the most consistent mistake.

name: Gone Missing
text:
Put target permanent on top of its owner's library.
Investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor:
"Sometimes it's best for the lost to stay lost."
—Herzag, mayor of Havengul

name: Hedron Crab
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, target player mills three cards.
flavor: Hedrons perplex minds both great and small.

name: Humongulus
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: Searching the city for Fblthp felt like sifting the rain for a single drop of blood.

name: Jwar Isle Avenger
text:
Surge {2}{U} (You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.)
Flying
flavor: Though solitary by nature, the sphinxes did not hesitate to join in the fight against the Eldrazi.

name: Kiora's Dambreaker
text: When Kiora's Dambreaker enters the battlefield, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
flavor:
"When your enemy flees, send the sea to pursue them."
—Kiora

name: Niblis of Dusk
text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: It fuels its lanterns by leaching the warmth from its surroundings.

name: Pondering Mage
text: When Pondering Mage enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle. Draw a card.
flavor: "Never leave the future to fate."

name: Ringwarden Owl
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: The owls learn of mana from the mages who know it best.

name: Rishadan Footpad
text: When Rishadan Footpad enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {2}.
flavor: "The best things in life are free. Money, for instance."

name: River Darter
text: River Darter can't be blocked by Dinosaurs.
flavor:
"Don't make splashes. Make progress."
—Tishana

name: Secrets of the Golden City
text:
Ascend (If you control ten or more permanents, you get the city's blessing for the rest of the game.)
Draw two cards. If you have the city's blessing, draw three cards instead.
flavor: Stolen knowledge can never be stolen back.

name: Shipwreck Looter
text: Raid — When Shipwreck Looter enters the battlefield, if you attacked this turn, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
flavor: One pirate's wreck is another's reward.

name: Silent Observer
text: Flying
flavor: It's not just a feeling—you are being watched.

name: Skitter Eel
text: {2}{U}: Adapt 2. (If this creature has no +1/+1 counters on it, put two +1/+1 counters on it.)
flavor:
"Life has no mistakes, only experiments."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer

name: Somber Hoverguard
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
flavor: The vedalken interrogate all intruders—once the hoverguards are done with them.

name: Soothsaying
text:
{3}{U}{U}: Shuffle your library.
{X}: Look at the top X cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor: The vizier's wisdom proved invaluable in untangling the Mercadian knot of lies.

name: Sphinx's Tutelage
text:
Whenever you draw a card, target opponent mills two cards. If two nonland cards that share a color were milled this way, repeat this process.
{5}{U}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: "You've never considered the implications of dealing with another telepath, Jace."

name: Spire Monitor
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
flavor: Each monitor is given an eye for each spire it is to guard.

name: Steady Progress
text:
Proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
Draw a card.
flavor: "More of that strange oil . . . It's probably nothing."

name: Thunder Drake
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast your second spell each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Thunder Drake.
flavor: The arrival of the Planar Bridge caused eddies in the aether, creating some entirely new species while transforming others.

name: Tinker
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor:
"I wonder how it feels to be bored."
—Jhoira, artificer

name: Trail of Evidence
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor:
"Every answer seems to lead to a more terrifying question."
—Jace Beleren

name: Windcaller Aven
text:
Flying
Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Windcaller Aven, target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Every cry lifts her allies toward the thunder.

name: Wind Strider
text:
Flash
Flying
flavor: "Currents are currents, whether in sea or sky."

name: Aid the Fallen
text:
Choose one or both —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target planeswalker card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "I never liked you. Now get up—we have a fight to finish."

name: Carrion Imp
text:
Flying
When Carrion Imp enters the battlefield, you may exile target creature card from a graveyard. If you do, you gain 2 life.
flavor: No scrap of nutrition goes to waste in the undercity.

name: Catacomb Crocodile
flavor:
"I am sewer-king!" said Rat. "I am quick and cunning and I know every tunnel."
"No, I am king!" said Zombie. "I am cold and deadly and no rot can harm me."
Then Croc came and ate them both.

name: Catacomb Slug
flavor:
"The entire murder scene was covered in dripping, oozing slime. No need for a soothsayer to solve that one."
—Pel Javya, Wojek investigator

name: Deadeye Tormentor
text: Raid — When Deadeye Tormentor enters the battlefield, if you attacked this turn, target opponent discards a card.
flavor: Despite their noble heritage, the pirates of the Deadeye Fleet are known for underhanded tactics and despicable trickery.

name: Death Denied
text: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Takenuma was filled with a chorus of moans, shrieks, and wails. Some came from the living, some from the dying, and some, most horribly, from the dead.

name: Desperate Castaways
text: Desperate Castaways can't attack unless you control an artifact.
flavor: A pirate crew without a ship is a crew that will do anything to get one.

name: Dinosaur Hunter
text: Whenever Dinosaur Hunter deals damage to a Dinosaur, destroy that creature.
flavor: "Aye, the foul beast chomped me, but I got away. You'd best believe when I find it again, it won't get away so easy."

name: Dread Drone
text: When Dread Drone enters the battlefield, create two 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C}."
flavor: Each Eldrazi ancient spawned a lineage of horrors in unfathomable shapes.

name: Dusk Charger
text:
Ascend (If you control ten or more permanents, you get the city's blessing for the rest of the game.)
Dusk Charger gets +2/+2 as long as you have the city's blessing.
flavor: Stories say demon blood runs in its veins, making it fearless and bloodthirsty.

name: Farbog Revenant
text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: Spiteful geists rise from the muck of the Farbogs, eager to lure travelers to their doom.

name: Grim Affliction
text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature, then proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
flavor: Even the small wounds let hope bleed out.

name: Hound of the Farbogs
text: Delirium — Hound of the Farbogs has menace as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard. (A creature with menace can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: As you hear it baying in the distance, you'll feel its breath on your neck.

name: Instill Infection
text:
Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"The results of our ninth inoculation were the same. The specimen was, of course, euthanized before the contagion could spread."
—Vedalken research notes

name: Lazotep Behemoth
flavor:
"I know I should be more concerned. But a big, blue zombie-potamus from beyond the stars? This is what they're invading us with?"
—Mileva, Boros legionnaire

name: Merciless Resolve
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature or land.
Draw two cards.
flavor: "You sought to anger me, Nahiri. Soon you will see how well you have succeeded."

name: Mind Rake
text:
Target player discards two cards.
Overload {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")
flavor: Spells of madness often require a sacrifice of sanity.

name: Plague Wight
text: Whenever Plague Wight becomes blocked, each creature blocking it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: For some goods, the best couriers are the dead.

name: Rabid Bloodsucker
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Rabid Bloodsucker enters the battlefield, each player loses 2 life.
flavor: She haunts the streets, wings spread wide, with carrion on her breath and blood in her eyes.

name: Returned Centaur
text: When Returned Centaur enters the battlefield, target player mills four cards.
flavor: Driven away by his living kin, he wanders mourning through the wilderness, seeking the dead city of Asphodel.

name: Spreading Rot
text: Destroy target land. Its controller loses 2 life.
flavor:
"What is this foul presence that defies the sun's cleansing rays?"
—Itzama the Crested

name: Stallion of Ashmouth
text: Delirium — {1}{B}: Stallion of Ashmouth gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate only if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor: Echoing hoofbeats can no longer be assumed to be help from the Gavony Riders.

name: Tar Snare
text: Target creature gets -3/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: The amorphous, magically animated residue known as the Fathom Sludge lurks in the Hagra Cistern, attacking its prey with pseudopods and dragging it down to be digested.

name: Thornbow Archer
text: Whenever Thornbow Archer attacks, each opponent who doesn't control an Elf loses 1 life.
flavor: "I will not rest until the stench of eyeblights is eradicated from these woods."

name: Twins of Maurer Estate
text: Madness {2}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor:
"Children, where are your parents?"
—Reig, wandering monk, last words

name: Undercity's Embrace
text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, you gain 4 life.
flavor: The undercity is always hungry.

name: Untamed Hunger
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor:
"Mindlessness is not weakness. When we are lost to hunger we are unstoppable."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

name: Vampire Champion
text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor: "These pirates must answer for their ancestors, who renounced the Church of Dusk and sailed from Torrezon as heretics."

name: Vessel of Malignity
text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Vessel of Malignity: Target opponent exiles two cards from their hand. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: From within its prison, the book endlessly whispers words of cruelty and spite.

name: Vraska's Finisher
text: When Vraska's Finisher enters the battlefield, destroy target creature or planeswalker an opponent controls that was dealt damage this turn.
flavor: "You might have pleaded your case with my queen earlier. Now I am here, and it is far too late."

name: Walk the Plank
text: Destroy target non-Merfolk creature.
flavor: When Captain Thorn adds a new ship to his fleet, he gives the crew a simple choice: follow me, or fall in the sea.

name: Warteye Witch
text: Whenever Warteye Witch or another creature you control dies, scry 1.
flavor: Eyeballs that portend unpleasant futures become slimy snacks instead.

name: Zulaport Chainmage
text: Cohort — {T}, Tap an untapped Ally you control: Target opponent loses 2 life.
flavor: The chains obey her. Everything else would do best to get out of her way.

name: Bellows Lizard
text: {1}{R}: Bellows Lizard gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: As the price of wood and coal rose, smiths found creative ways to keep their forges burning.

name: Boulder Salvo
text:
Surge {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.)
Boulder Salvo deals 4 damage to target creature.
flavor:
"If someone claims the sky is falling, I listen."
—Yon Basrel, Oran-Rief survivalist

name: Charging Monstrosaur
text: Trample, haste
flavor: "I knew I should have stayed with the boat. Always stay with the boat!"

name: Cinder Hellion
text:
Trample
When Cinder Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
flavor: Chandra used jets of flame to lure hellions into the path of oncoming Eldrazi.

name: Cobblebrute
flavor: Ravnica's most ancient streets take on a life of their own. A few have decided to move to nicer neighborhoods.

name: Dual Shot
text: Dual Shot deals 1 damage to each of up to two target creatures.
flavor: There is an eagerness among the Quiver of Kessig to prove they are the equal of the other cathar orders.

name: Dynacharge
text:
Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Overload {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")
flavor: Nothing evens the odds like a little lightning.

name: Frilled Deathspitter
text: Enrage — Whenever Frilled Deathspitter is dealt damage, it deals 2 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
flavor: Nothing says trouble like a reedy hiss with a hint of liquid gurgle.

name: Geomancer's Gambit
text:
Destroy target land. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
Draw a card.
flavor: Telepathy changes minds, necromancy changes lives, but geomancy changes the world.

name: Ghitu War Cry
text: {R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The war cry is not simply a shout but a sacrament.

name: Gut Shot
text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Gut Shot deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
"Down here, we have a more pointed version of the scriptures."
—Urabrask's enforcer

name: Hulking Devil
flavor: Fear the patient devil, the one who is calm in the midst of chaos. Beware the silent devil, the one whose cackle does not mingle with the others.

name: Impending Disaster
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are seven or more lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Impending Disaster and destroy all lands.
flavor:
"The goblins are in charge of maintenance? Why not just set it on fire now and call it a day?"
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician

name: Incorrigible Youths
text:
Haste
Madness {2}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor:
"Ah, to be young again."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Insolent Neonate
text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Discard a card, Sacrifice Insolent Neonate: Draw a card.
flavor: "Manners are for mortals."

name: Kaervek's Torch
text:
As long as Kaervek's Torch is on the stack, spells that target it cost {2} more to cast.
Kaervek's Torch deals X damage to any target.
flavor:
The pulsing heat of the midday Sun burns in the Lion's eye.
—Stone inscription, source unknown

name: Lightning Javelin
text: Lightning Javelin deals 3 damage to any target. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor: The harpies descended without mercy upon Akros, only to find their attack put them within range of the javelineers.

name: Molten Rain
text: Destroy target land. If that land was nonbasic, Molten Rain deals 2 damage to the land's controller.
flavor: It came as a cruel answer to the farmers' prayers.

name: Mutiny
text: Target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to another target creature that player controls.
flavor: Pirate captains rarely enjoy a peaceful retirement.

name: Prickleboar
text: As long as it's your turn, Prickleboar gets +2/+0 and has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor:
"Canyons in the Phoberos badlands are essentially gates to the Underworld."
—Mirinthes, Akroan captain

name: Reckless Wurm
text:
Trample
Madness {2}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: Bred for battle in the Grand Coliseum, these wurms annihilated whole ecosystems when released into the wild.

name: Rivals' Duel
text: Choose two target creatures that share no creature types. Those creatures fight each other. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
flavor: They could agree on one thing only: one of them must die.

name: Samut's Sprint
text: Target creature gets +2/+1 and gains haste until end of turn. Scry 1.
flavor: Samut's war was intensely personal. Every hour she faced enemies she once loved as friends and horrors she once revered as gods.

name: Star of Extinction
text: Destroy target land. Star of Extinction deals 20 damage to each creature and each planeswalker.
flavor:
"The visions haunt me. I see the end of the world, brought on by the search for the Immortal Sun."
—Shaper Pashona

name: Sun-Crowned Hunters
text: Enrage — Whenever Sun-Crowned Hunters is dealt damage, it deals 3 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
flavor: One alone is dangerous, and they are never alone.

name: Swashbuckling
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has haste.
flavor: The pirates of the Brazen Coalition are the descendants of those displaced by the Legion of Dusk, and they are eager for vengeance.

name: Vessel of Volatility
text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice Vessel of Volatility: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}.
flavor:
"To be honest, I'm not quite sure what's going to happen."
—Renna, Selhoff alchemist

name: Zada's Commando
text:
First strike
Cohort — {T}, Tap an untapped Ally you control: Zada's Commando deals 1 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
flavor:
"There's a word for someone who brings too much gear to battle: 'survivor.'"
—Zada of Slab Haven

name: Ancient Brontodon
flavor: It is taller than all but the tallest trees, and older than all but the oldest.

name: Asceticism
text:
Creatures you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate target creature.
flavor:
"Let my ignominy build walls thicker than iron and stronger than darksteel."
—Thrun, the last troll

name: Blossom Dryad
text: {T}: Untap target land.
flavor: The only force on Ixalan not interested in finding the golden city is Ixalan itself.

name: Byway Courier
text: When Byway Courier dies, investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: A good courier travels fast and asks no questions.

name: Centaur Glade
text: {2}{G}{G}: Create a 3/3 green Centaur creature token.
flavor: The Mirari called to the centaurs, and all who heard it were forever changed.

name: Clip Wings
text: Each opponent sacrifices a creature with flying.
flavor: It is a grim duty to save the world from those created to protect it.

name: Elvish Fury
text:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Fail to respect the forest and you will fertilize it.

name: Hardy Veteran
text: As long as it's your turn, Hardy Veteran gets +0/+2.
flavor: For the Sun Empire, the Immortal Sun is a symbol of national identity. When they reclaim it, the Empire will flourish once more.

name: Mantle of Webs
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
flavor:
"Why does everything the Golgari touch end up sticky?"
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Nest Invader
text: When Nest Invader enters the battlefield, create a 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C}."
flavor: It nurtures its masters' glorious future.

name: Overgrown Armasaur
text: Enrage — Whenever Overgrown Armasaur is dealt damage, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
flavor: It embodies the riotous growth of the jungle, where creatures crowd upon creatures, where roots sprawl and vines swarm.

name: Penumbra Spider
text:
Reach
When Penumbra Spider dies, create a 2/4 black Spider creature token with reach.
flavor: When it snared a passing cockatrice, its own soul darkly doubled.

name: Snapping Sailback
text:
Flash
Enrage — Whenever Snapping Sailback is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it. (It must survive the damage to get the counter.)
flavor: Lurking beneath the murky waters of Ixalan's rivers, sailbacks can rip a meal off the shore in the blink of an eye.

name: Squirrel Wrangler
text:
{1}{G}, Sacrifice a land: Create two 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice a land: Squirrel creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Gnawed to death. Bad way to go."

name: Stoic Builder
text: When Stoic Builder enters the battlefield, you may return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Some have returned to Hollowhenge, the ruins of Avabruck, to restore the lost capital of Kessig.

name: Tajuru Pathwarden
text: Vigilance, trample
flavor: "My people blazed these pathways long ago, before the Eldrazi came. We will ride them long after the Eldrazi are gone."

name: Thrun, the Last Troll
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Thrun, the Last Troll.
flavor: His crime was silence, and now he suffers it eternally.

name: Watcher in the Web
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Watcher in the Web can block an additional seven creatures each combat.
flavor: "Lost in the woods" is an optimistic way to describe a villager's disappearance. "Found in the woods" is frequently more appropriate.

name: Blinding Souleater
text: {W/P}, {T}: Tap target creature. ({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for inscribing our souls with subservience, to reinforce the sacred order."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

name: Crystal Shard
text: {3}, {T} or {U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor: The vedalken know it is not of this world, so they know that this world is not the only one.

name: Accorder Paladin
text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
flavor: "I fight for the suns, the surface, and everything in between."

name: Ardent Recruit
text: Metalcraft — Ardent Recruit gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: "We lost our homes and our kin. We won't let those rotters take our future as well."

name: Banishment Decree
text: Put target artifact, creature, or enchantment on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"Unworthy of consecration."
—Axsh, lesser cenobite

name: Choking Fumes
text: Put a -1/-1 counter on each attacking creature.
flavor:
"Fall to your knees and welcome our embrace."
—Qal-Sha, Priest of Norn

name: Frantic Salvage
text:
Put any number of target artifact cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.
flavor: "We will mourn when there is time. For now, we survive."

name: Gore Vassal
text: Sacrifice Gore Vassal: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. Then if that creature's toughness is 1 or greater, regenerate it.
flavor:
"Rid them of their unfaithful organs. Bring new hearts to the unbelievers."
—*Tome of Machines*, verse 1703

name: Kemba's Legion
text:
Vigilance
Kemba's Legion can block an additional creature each combat for each Equipment attached to Kemba's Legion.
flavor: The squabble over succession was quickly replaced by the struggle to survive.

name: Master's Call
text: Create two 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens.
flavor: The need to obey was inscribed on every plate in their bodies.

name: Priests of Norn
text:
Vigilance
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"May our blessings sever the tongues of the forsaken."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Tine Shrike
text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: A new bird of prey—one that hunts sentience.

name: Cryptoplasm
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Cryptoplasm become a copy of another target creature, except it has this ability.
flavor:
"If left in the enemy's shape too long, it might be lost to them."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

name: Distant Memories
text: Search your library for a card, exile it, then shuffle. Any opponent may have you put that card into your hand. If no player does, you draw three cards.
flavor:
"The fleeting shadows of his primitive self have all but vanished."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Fuel for the Cause
text: Counter target spell, then proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
flavor: "Your ideas will be discarded and your will repurposed."

name: Mirran Spy
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may untap target creature.
flavor: Accurate information is a precious commodity in times of war.

name: Mitotic Manipulation
text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put one of those cards onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor:
"They can't even comprehend nature. How could they improve it?"
—Venser

name: Neurok Commando
text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever Neurok Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
flavor: "There's no more time for secluded study. Answers are there only for those with the courage to take them."

name: Oculus
text: When Oculus dies, you may draw a card.
flavor:
"In its gaze I saw no mercy, no recognition that I was worthy to exist."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

name: Quicksilver Geyser
text: Return up to two target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
flavor:
"Phyrexians are tenacious. That's not the same thing as clever."
—Tezzeret

name: Serum Raker
text:
Flying
When Serum Raker dies, each player discards a card.
flavor: The serum from the blinkmoths they gather greases the joints of witch engines.

name: Spire Serpent
text:
Defender
Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Spire Serpent gets +2/+2 and can attack as though it didn't have defender.
flavor: A mirror to draw its eye, a rod to rouse its rage, and a sword to break its bonds.

name: Vedalken Anatomist
text: {2}{U}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. You may tap or untap that creature.
flavor: "Specimen 211 examination report. Observation: graft sublimation incomplete. Result: death. Prepare specimen 212."

name: Caustic Hound
text: When Caustic Hound dies, each player loses 4 life.
flavor: At first, the Mirrans aimed for its exposed gut. The survivors quickly learned to do otherwise.

name: Horrifying Revelation
text: Target player discards a card, then mills a card.
flavor:
"Ours is a glorious transmission! Behold a future where all bow to the Father of Machines."
—Isila, Priest of Sheoldred

name: Morbid Plunder
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Even the dead are raw materials for the Phyrexian vision of perfection.

name: Phyresis
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"Perfection is at hand. You have been freed of weakness and made *compleat*."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Scourge Servant
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"The union of the oil and necrogen has produced many pleasing reactions."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Spread the Sickness
text: Destroy target creature, then proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
flavor: Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.

name: Virulent Wound
text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. When that creature dies this turn, its controller gets a poison counter.
flavor: Sadly, the extent of Gerkk's healing knowledge was "don't pick at it."

name: Blisterstick Shaman
text: When Blisterstick Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: A productive warren requires a good deal of prodding.

name: Burn the Impure
text: Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has infect, Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor: Flame doesn't kneel to Phyrexia.

name: Concussive Bolt
text:
Concussive Bolt deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, creatures controlled by that player or by that planeswalker's controller can't block this turn.
flavor: Shock one, awe the rest.

name: Crush
text: Destroy target noncreature artifact.
flavor: A golem's hands know no tenderness.

name: Gnathosaur
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Gnathosaur gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: Mirran creatures that could withstand the Phyrexian oil found an abundance of crunchy snacks.

name: Into the Core
text: Exile two target artifacts.
flavor:
"They believe they're driving us back, but we're leading them to their doom."
—Kethek, furnace stoker

name: Koth's Courier
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: Koth sent partisans into the Tangle to bring survivors to the safe haven of the tunnels below Kuldotha.

name: Kuldotha Ringleader
text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Kuldotha Ringleader attacks each combat if able.
flavor: Being surrounded by goblins is less objectionable when they're fighting *for* you.

name: Metallic Mastery
text: Gain control of target artifact until end of turn. Untap that artifact. It gains haste until end of turn.
flavor:
"All will be reforged in the fires of glory."
—Urabrask the Hidden

name: Ogre Resister
flavor: He didn't have a word for "home," but he knew it was something to be defended.

name: Rally the Forces
text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Drive them back! Make their underworld into their grave!"
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Slagstorm
text:
Choose one —
• Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each creature.
• Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each player.
flavor:
"As long as we have the will to fight, we are never without weapons."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Spiraling Duelist
text: Metalcraft — Spiraling Duelist has double strike as long as you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: "I never move the same way twice. Those rotters can't grasp chaos."

name: Creeping Corrosion
text: Destroy all artifacts.
flavor:
"We will reveal the futility of their heresy by showing them how fragile their relics are."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Fangren Marauder
text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 5 life.
flavor:
"The fangren fight without comfort of any kind. We can ask no less of ourselves."
—Tilien, Sylvok partisan

name: Glissa's Courier
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor:
"So, the survivors from Oxid Ridge are on the move. Let them come and witness predation in its purest form."
—Glissa

name: Melira's Keepers
text: Melira's Keepers can't have counters put on it.
flavor: Her warriors are the last defense against the coming storm.

name: Mirran Mettle
text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Metalcraft — That creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead if you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: "Our land will not yield to Phyrexian corruption!"

name: Pistus Strike
text: Destroy target creature with flying. Its controller gets a poison counter.
flavor:
"Even a nuisance such as the pistus fly has a purpose in our new world."
—Glissa

name: Plaguemaw Beast
text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
flavor: Phyrexia's spiral of consumption grows ever wider and darker.

name: Quilled Slagwurm
flavor: Vorinclex removed its teeth so it wouldn't waste time chewing before moving to the next kill.

name: Tangle Mantis
text: Trample
flavor: The fiercest hunters in the Tangle don't seek out the mantises. They *are* the mantises.

name: Unnatural Predation
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"Domination by the strongest—that is all that matters in the Tangle now."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Bladed Sentinel
text: {W}: Bladed Sentinel gains vigilance until end of turn.
flavor: The Mirran partisans created hundreds of patrol sentinels to divert Phyrexian assaults from the Tangle.

name: Dross Ripper
text: {2}{B}: Dross Ripper gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Such a creation serves no purpose other than exterminating every one of us."
—Sadra Alic, Neurok strategist

name: Gust-Skimmer
text: {U}: Gust-Skimmer gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Phyrexian smog clouds choked the skies, threatening creatures who couldn't comprehend the menace below.

name: Spin Engine
text: {R}: Target creature can't block Spin Engine this turn.
flavor:
"It will be battle-ready before our strike at Oxid Ridge, and it will guarantee our victory."
—Ketuc of the Helm

name: Tangle Hulk
text: {2}{G}: Regenerate Tangle Hulk.
flavor:
"A true Phyrexian predator. It will never know death, just as nature intended."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Kataki, War's Wage
text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {1}."
flavor:
"Before the war, we prayed to Kataki to sharpen our swords and harden our armor. Without his blessing our weapons are all but useless against the kami hordes."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

name: Red Cliffs Armada
text: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than seven thousand warships on the Yangtze.

name: False Defeat
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"All warfare is based on deception."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

name: Guan Yu's 1,000-Li March
text: Destroy all tapped creatures.
flavor: "He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse;/ With dragon blade he took each pass by force."

name: Liu Bei, Lord of Shu
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Liu Bei, Lord of Shu gets +2/+2 as long as you control a permanent named Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior or a permanent named Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior.
flavor:
"Only wisdom and virtue can truly win men's devotion."
—Liu Bei

name: Misfortune's Gain
text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
flavor: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

name: Shu Cavalry
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.

name: Shu Elite Companions
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."

name: Shu Soldier-Farmers
text: When Shu Soldier-Farmers enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor: During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.

name: Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior
text: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: Zhang Fei's uncharacteristic alliance with a defeated Riverlands general, Yan Yan, allowed Shu forces to advance through forty-five Riverlands strongpoints with no casualties.

name: Forced Retreat
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"Leadership, not numbers, determines victory."
—A Wu commander, before his 5,000 troops forced 15,000 Wei troops to retreat from Ruxu

name: Lu Meng, Wu General
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.

name: Sun Quan, Lord of Wu
text: Creatures you control have horsemanship. (They can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: "One score and four he reigned, the Southland king: / A dragon coiled, a tiger poised below the mighty Yangtze."

name: Wu Elite Cavalry
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: At the second battle of Ruxu, the brave Wu general Gan Ning raided Cao Cao's camp of 400,000 men with only 100 cavalry. Not a single man or horse was lost.

name: Wu Warship
text: Wu Warship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor: Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.

name: Desperate Charge
text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."

name: Ghostly Visit
text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor: Cao Cao was haunted to death by the ghosts of the empresses and other high courtiers he had murdered.

name: Stolen Grain
text: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to target opponent or planeswalker. You gain 5 life.
flavor: At the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao defeated Yuan Shao by raiding his grain depot, leaving him with no way to feed his troops.

name: Wei Elite Companions
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: Cao Cao was more concerned with capabilities than lineage. He excelled at recruiting and retaining men of talent to serve him.

name: Wei Infantry
flavor: Wei won the battle of Hefei when Zhang Liao defeated Sun Quan and then foiled a Wu scheme to incite rebellion.

name: Wei Strike Force
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: At the battle of Chang'an, Ma Chao defeated the two generals Cao Cao sent to guard the pass but was forced to flee when Cao Cao's trickery turned his own ally against him.

name: Young Wei Recruits
text: Young Wei Recruits can't block.
flavor:
"To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away."
—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

name: Fire Ambush
text: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor: "With fire he broke the battle at Bowang . . . . Striking fear deep into Cao Cao's soul, thus Kongming scored a coup at his debut."

name: Lu Bu, Master-at-Arms
text: Haste; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: "Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer,/ Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."

name: Raging Minotaur
text: Haste
flavor: The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.

name: Zodiac Dragon
text: When Zodiac Dragon is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may return it to your hand.
flavor: ". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream,/ For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."

name: Jungle Lion
text: Jungle Lion can't block.
flavor: The lion's only loyalty is to its hunger.

name: Meng Huo, Barbarian King
text: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.

name: Meng Huo's Horde
flavor: Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.

name: Riding the Dilu Horse
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship. This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor:
"All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change."
—Liu Bei, after being told that the Dilu brings its master ill fortune

name: Slashing Tiger
text: Whenever Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Unless you enter the tiger's lair, you cannot get hold of the tiger's cubs."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

name: Trip Wire
text: Destroy target creature with horsemanship.
flavor: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

name: Alaborn Musketeer
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: Muskets gave the Alaborn army an advantage it had long lacked—air defense.

name: Alaborn Trooper
flavor:
"I dedicate my body to my country And my life to my King."
—Alaborn Soldier's Oath

name: Champion Lancer
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
flavor: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.

name: Spotted Griffin
text: Flying
flavor: When the cat flies and the bird stalks, guard your horses carefully.

name: Steam Catapult
text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: "You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"

name: Symbol of Unsummoning
text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
flavor:
". . . inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude . . . ."
—Kate Chopin, The Awakening

name: Talas Researcher
text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: From time, knowledge. From knowledge, power.

name: Thing from the Deep
text: Whenever Thing from the Deep attacks, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an Island.
flavor: Seafarers fear sailing off the world's edge not so much as down its gullet.

name: Dakmor Plague
text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

name: Prowling Nightstalker
text: Prowling Nightstalker can't be blocked except by black creatures.
flavor: Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.

name: Rain of Daggers
text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. You lose 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
flavor: Knives in the sky, cries in the air, and blood on the ground.

name: Devastation
text: Destroy all creatures and lands.
flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

name: Goblin Bully
flavor: It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.

name: Goblin Cavaliers
flavor: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

name: Goblin General
text: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Lead, follow, or run like crazy.

name: Alluring Scent
text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
flavor: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

name: Bee Sting
text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor:
Busy as a bumblebee, blistered as a goblin.
—Alaborn saying

name: Elite Cat Warrior
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: "Hear that? No? That's a cat warrior."

name: Ironhoof Ox
text: Ironhoof Ox can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor: The good news is it's vegetarian. The bad news is it just doesn't like you.

name: Southern Elephant
flavor: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

name: Whiptail Wurm
flavor: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

name: Wild Ox
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.

name: Peace Talks
text: This turn and next turn, creatures can't attack, and players and permanents can't be the targets of spells or activated abilities.
flavor:
"By the tongues of a thousand serpents, this time I do not lie."
—Ahmahz il Kin, Suq'Ata diplomat

name: Dark Privilege
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor:
"As you breathe your last, understand why I accept such forbidden gifts."
—Purraj of Urborg

name: Urborg Mindsucker
text: {B}, Sacrifice Urborg Mindsucker: Target opponent discards a card at random. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor:
"My pet will pick the ripe fruit from your tortured brain as if it were hanging from a vine."
—Kaervek

name: Wicked Reward
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Target creature gets +4/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The blood on my hands is merely proof of my ambition."
—Kaervek

name: Bull Elephant
text: When Bull Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return two Forests you control to their owner's hand.
flavor:
Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I?
—Zhalfirin riddle

name: Answered Prayers
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life. If Answered Prayers isn't a creature, it becomes a 3/3 Angel creature with flying in addition to its other types until end of turn.
flavor: Angels cannot ignore pious pleas.

name: Battle Screech
text:
Create two 1/1 white Bird creature tokens with flying.
Flashback—Tap three untapped white creatures you control. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: All sounds harmonize with the Worldsoul.

name: Enduring Sliver
text:
Outlast {2} ({2}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Other Sliver creatures you control have outlast {2}.
flavor: Time has ground mountains to sand, but the slivers ever remain.

name: First Sliver's Chosen
text: Sliver creatures you control have exalted. (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each instance of exalted among permanents you control.)
flavor: The most tenacious members of the hive instinctually guard the First Sliver.

name: Force of Virtue
text:
If it's not your turn, you may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Flash
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor:
"Where divinity leads, victory follows."
—Silverblade motto

name: Gilded Light
text:
You gain shroud until end of turn. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: Whoever survives the first blow lives to land the second.

name: Impostor of the Sixth Pride
text: Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
flavor: The tribe was as strong as his longing, their territory as vast as his isolation. The changeling knew he had found a home, and a form.

name: Lancer Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have first strike.
flavor:
"These polearms were supposed to help!"
—Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

name: On Thin Ice
text:
Enchant snow land you control
When On Thin Ice enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until On Thin Ice leaves the battlefield.
flavor: He cursed the wind. He cursed the cold. But by stepping on the ice, he cursed himself.

name: Recruit the Worthy
text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
flavor: For peace of mind, they mustered for war.

name: Reprobation
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses all abilities and is a Coward creature with base power and toughness 0/1. (It keeps all supertypes but loses all other types and creature types.)
flavor: There was a time all craven beasts cowered before Avacyn's divine might.

name: Rhox Veteran
text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Rhox Veteran attacks, tap target creature an opponent controls.
flavor: "Battle is all about where you stand. Never stand in my way."

name: Segovian Angel
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor: When Worzel summoned Segovian angels to fight Thomil's Gargantikari gnats, the ensuing battle numbered among the Multiverse's least destructive.

name: Stirring Address
text:
Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Overload {5}{W} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")
flavor: "For glory! For justice! For our queen!"

name: Trustworthy Scout
text: {1}{W}, Exile Trustworthy Scout from your graveyard: Search your library for a card named Trustworthy Scout, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: "Don't worry. If you lose me I'll be right behind you."

name: Wing Shards
text:
Target player sacrifices an attacking creature.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
flavor: Her feathers cut the air, as sharp as they are silent.

name: Zhalfirin Decoy
text: {T}: Tap target creature. Activate only if you had a creature enter the battlefield under your control this turn.
flavor:
"Never let them take their eyes off you."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Bazaar Trademage
text:
Flying
When Bazaar Trademage enters the battlefield, draw two cards, then discard three cards.
flavor: He traded a lamp for a scepter, the scepter for a ruby, and the ruby for a simple rug.

name: Choking Tethers
text:
Tap up to four target creatures.
Cycling {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Choking Tethers, you may tap target creature.
flavor: A wizard can be outnumbered but never outsmarted.

name: Cunning Evasion
text: Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, you may return it to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Begin with your escape and work backward."
—*Way of Secrets*

name: Echo of Eons
text:
Each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library, then draws seven cards.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: The present is a matter of perspective.

name: Iceberg Cancrix
text: Whenever another snow permanent enters the battlefield under your control, you may have target player mill two cards.
flavor: Its shell can withstand anything but a thaw.

name: Phantasmal Form
text:
Until end of turn, up to two target creatures each have base power and toughness 3/3, gain flying, and become blue Illusions in addition to their other colors and types.
Draw a card.
flavor: Within each of us lurks the fathomless.

name: Phantom Ninja
text: Phantom Ninja can't be blocked.
flavor:
"Ninjas can run across water, pull ladders from pockets, kill with a kiss, and slip between bricks. Pack of lies, I say."
—Benden, teahouse gossip

name: Rebuild
text:
Return all artifacts to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: The first step in any artificer's scheme is to take inventory.

name: Scour All Possibilities
text:
Scry 2, then draw a card.
Flashback {4}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: Searching the future for answers often leads to further questions.

name: Scuttling Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "{2}: Untap this creature."
flavor: A living fossil active after eons of dormancy.

name: Spell Snuff
text:
Counter target spell.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, draw a card.
flavor: "Good night."

name: Cordial Vampire
text: Whenever Cordial Vampire or another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on each Vampire you control.
flavor: "Please, come in! Hors d'oeuvres are on the table."

name: Dead of Winter
text: All nonsnow creatures get -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of snow permanents you control.
flavor:
"At last, silence."
—Tevesh Szat

name: Gluttonous Slug
text:
Menace
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
flavor: No amount of salt will save you

name: Graveshifter
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
When Graveshifter enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "Why throw away a perfectly good identity?"

name: Headless Specter
text:
Flying
Hellbent — Whenever Headless Specter deals combat damage to a player, if you have no cards in hand, that player discards a card at random.
flavor: No tongue to chant, yet the forsaken hymn still emanates from its body.

name: Mob
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Destroy target creature.
flavor: Not all monsters fight with teeth and claws.

name: Nether Spirit
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Spirit is the only creature card in your graveyard, you may return Nether Spirit to the battlefield.
flavor: Four walls and a roof won't provide safety from that which is buried.

name: Ninja of the New Moon
text: Ninjutsu {3}{B} ({3}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
flavor: The night is the greatest ally of all.

name: Putrid Goblin
text: Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
flavor: Too stupid to survive, too dumb to die.

name: Rank Officer
text:
When Rank Officer enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
{1}{B}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Each opponent loses 2 life.
flavor: It recruits the fresh and tosses the rotten.

name: Ransack the Lab
text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor:
"I think someone is stealing from my laboratory. It had better not be you!"
—Geralf, letter to Gisa

name: Return from Extinction
text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return two target creature cards that share a creature type from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: The First Sliver calls. The dead answer.

name: Sadistic Obsession
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{B}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature."
flavor: Not everyone should take joy in their work.

name: Shatter Assumptions
text:
Choose one —
• Target opponent reveals their hand and discards all colorless nonland cards.
• Target opponent reveals their hand and discards all multicolored cards.
flavor: Rigid minds are the first to break.

name: Throatseeker
text: Unblocked attacking Ninjas you control have lifelink.
flavor:
"I just felt a drip. It must be about to rain."
—Stoneway Market vendor, last words

name: Umezawa's Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
• Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
• You gain 2 life.
flavor: "Be ever loyal to your own best interests."

name: Venomous Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Deathtouch
flavor: It doesn't contain venom. It is venom.

name: Bladeback Sliver
text: Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, Sliver creatures you control have "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker."
flavor: Slivers can turn a last stand into a stunning victory.

name: Cleaving Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control get +2/+0.
flavor: When it wriggled closer to a thrum of slivers, their talons hardened and glinted in the sun. One took a playful swipe at a tree trunk, and its new blade cut clean through.

name: Goatnap
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. If that creature is a Goat, it also gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "The steering horns ain't steering!"

name: Goblin Champion
text:
Haste
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: The stories of his heroics are inspiring, though none of them are remotely true.

name: Hollowhead Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card."
flavor:
"Brilliant! They evolved away from energy-taxing brains and respond only to spinal reflex arcs from the hive mind."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Igneous Elemental
text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if there is a land card in your graveyard.
When Igneous Elemental enters the battlefield, you may have it deal 2 damage to target creature.
flavor: Volcanic violence made manifest.

name: Lava Dart
text:
Lava Dart deals 1 damage to any target.
Flashback—Sacrifice a Mountain. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor:
"Small outbursts are healthy."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Ore-Scale Guardian
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each land card in your graveyard.
Flying, haste
flavor: A dragon's loyalty cannot be earned, but it can be bought.

name: Planebound Accomplice
text: {R}: You may put a planeswalker card from your hand onto the battlefield. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "Told you I had friends."

name: Pyrophobia
text: Pyrophobia deals 3 damage to target creature. Cowards can't block this turn.
flavor:
"I hate this! I hate fire! I hate you for taking me on this route!"
—Norin the Wary

name: Spinehorn Minotaur
text: As long as you've drawn two or more cards this turn, Spinehorn Minotaur has double strike.
flavor: "If you think twice, I'll cut twice."

name: Spiteful Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "Whenever this creature is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target player or planeswalker."
flavor: Victories against the hive are tragedies.

name: Vengeful Devil
text:
Haste
Morbid — {T}: Vengeful Devil deals 1 damage to any target. Activate only if a creature died this turn.
flavor: Devils love adding injury to injury.

name: Volatile Claws
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain all creature types.
flavor: Whether modeled after bear, bird, or baloth, all claws send the same message.

name: Ayula's Influence
text: Discard a land card: Create a 2/2 green Bear creature token.
flavor: Ayula's runic clawmarks ensure her territories are never left defenseless.

name: Bellowing Elk
text: As long as you had another creature enter the battlefield under your control this turn, Bellowing Elk has trample and indestructible.
flavor:
"Their two-tone vocalization contains a whistle and a roar. Both mean get away."
—Vivien Reid

name: Collector Ouphe
text: Activated abilities of artifacts can't be activated.
flavor:
"He steals power from treasure after treasure, and what does it do for the ouphe? Nothing."
—Jhoira

name: Conifer Wurm
text:
Trample
{3}{G}: Conifer Wurm gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of snow permanents you control.
flavor: During seasonal thaws, the wurms slough their skin against trees to promote growth.

name: Excavating Anurid
text:
When Excavating Anurid enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a land. If you do, draw a card.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Excavating Anurid gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
flavor: Turg's spawn ruled long after he croaked.

name: Frostwalla
text: {S}: Frostwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow source.)
flavor: Glare from the snows in the boreal expanse hides its true size.

name: Glacial Revelation
text: Reveal the top six cards of your library. You may put any number of snow permanent cards from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
flavor: The harshest environments offer the greatest opportunities for exploration.

name: Mother Bear
text: {3}{G}{G}, Exile Mother Bear from your graveyard: Create two 2/2 green Bear creature tokens. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: Even without her, the cubs will always know their mother's love.

name: Murasa Behemoth
text:
Trample
Murasa Behemoth gets +3/+3 as long as there is a land card in your graveyard.
flavor: The loss of its hunting grounds made it all the more dangerous.

name: Rime Tender
text: {T}: Untap another target snow permanent.
flavor: "Fools view winter as the season of death because they cannot see the life underneath."

name: Saddled Rimestag
text: Saddled Rimestag gets +2/+2 as long as you had another creature enter the battlefield under your control this turn.
flavor: Horns of hoarfrost grow every night, gleam at dawn, and melt by dusk.

name: Savage Swipe
text: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn if its power is 2. Then it fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
flavor: Nine generations of metalworking skill are no match for nine hundred pounds of rage.

name: Spore Frog
text: Sacrifice Spore Frog: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
flavor: A progenitor of tadpoles and allergies in equal measure.

name: Tempered Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it."
flavor: The question isn't whether slivers will adapt to a world's perils but whether the world's perils will adapt to slivers.

name: Thornado
text:
Destroy target creature with flying.
Cycling {1}{G} ({1}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: Every bough, branch, and bramble lashed out in defense of the forest.

name: Trumpeting Herd
text:
Create a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)
flavor: An elephant never forgives.

name: Twin-Silk Spider
text:
Reach
When Twin-Silk Spider enters the battlefield, create a 1/2 green Spider creature token with reach.
flavor: A forest-wide network of webs brings a hungry couple to captured prey.

name: Winding Way
text: Choose creature or land. Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor: Every path leads to discovery.

name: Abiding Grace
text:
At the beginning of your end step, choose one —
• You gain 1 life.
• Return target creature card with mana value 1 from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"Into the smothering dark, Serra spoke a single word: 'Hope.'"
—*Song of All*, canto 2

name: Arcbound Mouser
text:
Lifelink
Modular 1 (This creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
flavor: It doesn't purr. It hums.

name: Arcbound Prototype
text: Modular 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
flavor: It flickered to life, saw itself alone, and began to build.

name: Blacksmith's Skill
text: Target permanent gains hexproof and indestructible until end of turn. If it's an artifact creature, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Before he was subjugated by demonic forces, Dakkon was a master smith of unrivaled artistry.

name: Caprichrome
text:
Flash
Vigilance
Devour artifact 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of artifacts. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
flavor: It is what it eats.

name: Disciple of the Sun
text:
Lifelink
When Disciple of the Sun enters the battlefield, return target permanent card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Heart of a titan, faith as bright as the dawn.

name: Esper Sentinel
text: Whenever an opponent casts their first noncreature spell each turn, draw a card unless that player pays {X}, where X is Esper Sentinel's power.
flavor: The more Esper changes, the more he refuses to.

name: Fairgrounds Patrol
text: {1}{W}, Exile Fairgrounds Patrol from your graveyard: Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: "No signs of any suspicious activity. Yet."

name: Glorious Enforcer
text:
Flying, lifelink
At the beginning of each combat, if you have more life than an opponent, Glorious Enforcer gains double strike until end of turn.
flavor: "You are unworthy of life, but take heart. You have earned a clean death."

name: Guardian Kirin
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Guardian Kirin.
flavor:
Followed the kirin
—Ojutai expression meaning
"died a hero's death"

name: Healer's Flock
text: Flying, lifelink
flavor: The sight of a flock overhead is bittersweet. It means many are wounded, but it also means help is on the way.

name: Knighted Myr
text:
{2}{W}: Adapt 1. (If this creature has no +1/+1 counters on it, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are put on Knighted Myr, it gains double strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"This one fights like a leonin!"
—Jor Kadeen

name: Late to Dinner
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Create a Food token. (It's an artifact with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.")
flavor: "I knew you were set in your ways, friend, but even I didn't expect you to keep our engagement, under the circumstances."

name: Lens Flare
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Lens Flare deals 5 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: The key for surviving a war is never becoming its focus.

name: Marble Gargoyle
text:
Flying
{W}: Marble Gargoyle gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Once past the stony exterior, the meat is exquisite and can be stuffed with thallids or simmered in a broth of manticore venom."
—Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar
*The Underworld Cookbook*

name: Nykthos Paragon
text: Whenever you gain life, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on each creature you control. Do this only once each turn.
flavor: Though Heliod turned against humanity in his hunger for power, the ideals he once championed still stand strong.

name: Piercing Rays
text:
Exile target tapped creature.
Forecast — {2}{W}, Reveal Piercing Rays from your hand: Tap target untapped creature. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)
flavor: The forecast calls for pain.

name: Prismatic Ending
text: Converge — Exile target nonland permanent if its mana value is less than or equal to the number of colors of mana spent to cast this spell.
flavor: Right before his demise, he experienced a shattering revelation.

name: Scour the Desert
text: Exile target creature card from your graveyard. Create X 1/1 white Bird creature tokens with flying, where X is the exiled card's toughness.
flavor: Even in the most barren wastelands, every death feeds more life.

name: Search the Premises
text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor:
"To halt these lurid practices, Geralf must be found and made an example of."
—Inquisitor Delmund

name: Serra's Emissary
text:
Flying
As Serra's Emissary enters the battlefield, choose a card type.
You and creatures you control have protection from the chosen card type.
flavor: Where swords fail, faith transcends.

name: Thraben Watcher
text:
Flying, vigilance
Other nontoken creatures you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
flavor:
"Fear not the angels' constant eyes,
E'er on watch from lightless skies;
Eternal vigil we will keep,
Protectors of the Blessed Sleep."

name: Aeromoeba
text:
Flying
Discard a card: Switch Aeromoeba's power and toughness until end of turn.
flavor: Some clouds heed no wind.

name: Burdened Aerialist
text:
When Burdened Aerialist enters the battlefield, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
Whenever you sacrifice a token, Burdened Aerialist gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "Curse this glorious golden weight!"

name: Etherium Spinner
text: Whenever you cast a spell with mana value 4 or greater, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
flavor: "Thopters from a foundry always lack that personal touch."

name: Hard Evidence
text:
Create a 0/3 blue Crab creature token.
Investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: The investigator felt a pinch on his ankle. When he looked down, something glittered in the sand.

name: Lose Focus
text:
Replicate {U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
flavor: The spell wavered, caught on the tip of his tongue and at the edge of his awareness.

name: Lucid Dreams
text: Draw X cards, where X is the number of card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor: Never be afraid to look where others can't—or won't.

name: Mental Journey
text:
Draw three cards.
Basic landcycling {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.)
flavor: "My wandering mind has always been an asset."

name: Mystic Redaction
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 1.
Whenever you discard a card, each opponent mills two cards. (They put the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.)
flavor: "I'm sorry, but this information is classified."

name: Parcel Myr
text: {2}, Sacrifice Parcel Myr: Draw a card.
flavor:
"Crack it open. Maybe it knows something we can use."
—Kara Vrist, Mirran resistance

name: Phantasmal Dreadmaw
text:
Trample
When Phantasmal Dreadmaw becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor:
"That was perhaps the most terrifying thing I thought I almost saw."
—Captain Lannery Storm

name: Raving Visionary
text:
{U}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
Delirium — {2}{U}, {T}: Draw a card. Activate only if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor: "Fear not, child. Open your eyes and witness Keranos's truth!"

name: Recalibrate
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. If you've discarded a card this turn, draw a card.
flavor:
"Trial 991: Still encountering issues with accidental aetherization. Maybe if we widen the dimensional matrix to 0.7?"
—Izzet research notes

name: Rishadan Dockhand
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{1}, {T}: Tap target land.
flavor: It's not hard to find work in Rishada, so long as you've got a strong back and don't ask too many questions.

name: Scuttletide
text:
{1}, Discard a card: Create a 0/3 blue Crab creature token.
Delirium — Crabs you control get +1/+1 as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor:
"We're going to need more butter."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Shattered Ego
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
{3}{U}{U}: Put enchanted creature into its owner's library third from the top.
flavor:
"You can't even fathom the depths of your own insignificance."
—Geyadrone Dihada

name: Steelfin Whale
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, untap Steelfin Whale.
flavor: It feeds on metal filings suspended in the water, sieving flecks of precious ore through magnetic baleen.

name: Step Through
text:
Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
Wizardcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Wizard card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.)
flavor: Doors open both ways.

name: Suspend
text: Exile target creature and put two time counters on it. If it doesn't have suspend, it gains suspend. (At the beginning of its owner's upkeep, they remove a time counter. When the last is removed, they play it without paying its mana cost. If it's a creature, it has haste.)
flavor: Time moves in mysterious ways.

name: Sweep the Skies
text: Converge — Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying for each color of mana spent to cast this spell.
flavor: A gleam of refracted light is often the only warning.

name: Vedalken Infiltrator
text:
Vedalken Infiltrator can't be blocked.
Metalcraft — Vedalken Infiltrator gets +1/+0 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: "An expert always keeps their tools close at hand."

name: Archon of Cruelty
text:
Flying
Whenever Archon of Cruelty enters the battlefield or attacks, target opponent sacrifices a creature or planeswalker, discards a card, and loses 3 life. You draw a card and gain 3 life.
flavor: Malice spreads on wings of tyranny.

name: Bone Shards
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature or discard a card.
Destroy target creature or planeswalker.
flavor: In the Kathari dumping grounds known as the Boneheaps, its not hard to improvise an offense.

name: Cabal Initiate
text:
Discard a card: Cabal Initiate gains lifelink until end of turn.
Threshold — Cabal Initiate gets +1/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
flavor: "Hear our prayers, oh Shadowed One, and bless us in bloody agony."

name: Discerning Taste
text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. You gain life equal to the greatest power among creature cards put into your graveyard this way.
flavor: "Everyone loves a dash of crushed pixie . . . except the pixie."

name: Echoing Return
text: Return target creature card and all other cards with the same name as that card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: A single ambition unleashes a legion of horrors.

name: Feast of Sanity
text: Whenever you discard a card, Feast of Sanity deals 1 damage to any target and you gain 1 life.
flavor: The tastiest morsels are found in the mazes of the mind.

name: Flay Essence
text: Exile target creature or planeswalker. You gain life equal to the number of counters on it.
flavor:
"Your argument as to why I should spare you lacked substance. Now, so do you."
—Geyadrone Dihada

name: Gilt-Blade Prowler
text: {1}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Draw a card. Activate only if you've discarded a card this turn.
flavor:
"Let's just say my people are in the business of capital acquisition and intellectual property speculation."
—Er-Miral

name: Hell Mongrel
text:
Discard a card: Hell Mongrel gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Madness {2}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: It feeds on shadows, fear, and blood.

name: Kitchen Imp
text:
Flying, haste
