Madness {B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: "Order up! Ooze aspic and jellied anurid eyes!"

name: Legion Vanguard
text: {1}, Sacrifice another creature: Legion Vanguard explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: It takes guts to be a trailblazer.

name: Loathsome Curator
text:
Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)
Menace
When Loathsome Curator exploits a creature, destroy target creature you don't control with mana value 3 or less.
flavor: She collects only the choicest of deaths.

name: Magus of the Bridge
text:
Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
When a creature is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, exile Magus of the Bridge.
flavor: "The dead know their place."

name: Nested Shambler
text: When Nested Shambler dies, create X tapped 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens, where X is Nested Shambler's power.
flavor: Home is where the heart was.

name: Persist
text: Return target nonlegendary creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it.
flavor: In the tight-knit doun of Mistmeadow, death is less important than duty.

name: Radiant Epicure
text: Converge — When Radiant Epicure enters the battlefield, each opponent loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the number of colors of mana spent to cast this spell.
flavor: Taste is not a sensation for the tongue alone.

name: Sinister Starfish
text: {T}: Surveil 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.)
flavor:
"Throw that one back. I don't like how it's looking at me."
—Netos, Meletian fisherman

name: Sudden Edict
text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Target player sacrifices a creature.
flavor:
"In one future, I see glory. In the other . . . well, that's another story."
—Whisper, blood liturgist

name: Tourach's Canticle
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card, then discards a card at random.
flavor: The same hymns Tourach sang to praise the Ebon Praetor would later be adapted to glorify Tourach himself.

name: Tragic Fall
text:
Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
Hellbent — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if you have no cards in hand.
flavor: Every final journey begins with a single misstep.

name: Underworld Hermit
text: When Underworld Hermit enters the battlefield, create a number of 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens equal to your devotion to black. (Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)
flavor: Some souls yearn to escape death. Others are content to feed the wildlife.

name: Unmarked Grave
text: Search your library for a nonlegendary card, put that card into your graveyard, then shuffle.
flavor:
"I'm sure they were once someone important, but I couldn't tell you who they were."
—Doros, expedition guide

name: Vile Entomber
text:
Deathtouch
When Vile Entomber enters the battlefield, search your library for a card, put that card into your graveyard, then shuffle.
flavor: The dead are lonely in the crypt and always eager for company.

name: Young Necromancer
text: When Young Necromancer enters the battlefield, you may exile two cards from your graveyard. When you do, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "Who needs imaginary friends when you've got dead ones?"

name: Captain Ripley Vance
text: Whenever you cast your third spell each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Captain Ripley Vance, then it deals damage equal to its power to any target.
flavor: The Spitfire Bastion bristles with cannons claimed from every ship she's conquered.

name: Chef's Kiss
text: Gain control of target spell that targets only a single permanent or player. Copy it, then reselect the targets at random for the spell and the copy. The new targets can't be you or a permanent you control.
flavor: "Cooked to perfection, of course."

name: Faithless Salvaging
text:
Discard a card, then draw a card.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)
flavor: All that's left are broken beliefs.

name: Flame Blitz
text:
At the beginning of your end step, Flame Blitz deals 5 damage to each planeswalker.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: "Blast it, not again!"

name: Galvanic Relay
text:
Exile the top card of your library. During your next turn, you may play that card.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
flavor: Abandoned years ago, the experiment continues to iterate upon itself.

name: Goblin Traprunner
text: Whenever Goblin Traprunner attacks, flip three coins. For each flip you win, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token that's tapped and attacking.
flavor: The best traprunners know exactly where to step. The others . . . do their best.

name: Gouged Zealot
text:
Reach
Delirium — Whenever Gouged Zealot attacks, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, Gouged Zealot deals 1 damage to each creature defending player controls.
flavor: He can't fear what he can't see.

name: Harmonic Prodigy
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
If an ability of a Shaman or another Wizard you control triggers, that ability triggers an additional time.
flavor: Each note strikes with deadly precision.

name: Lightning Spear
flavor: When wielded, it begs to be released.

name: Mine Collapse
text:
If it's your turn, you may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Mine Collapse deals 5 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
flavor: "Good ol' rock," muttered Rhirhok as the shaking began. "Nice ol' rock . . . ."

name: Mount Velus Manticore
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may discard a card. When you do, Mount Velus Manticore deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of card types the discarded card has.
flavor: Born from a stray spark that flew from Purphoros's forge.

name: Skophos Reaver
text:
As long as it's your turn, Skophos Reaver gets +2/+0.
Madness {1}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: "KILL! KILL FOR MOGIS!"

name: Slag Strider
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
{1}, Sacrifice an artifact: Slag Strider deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Imbued with life by a stray bolt of spellcraft, it began to wander about the foundry, to the blacksmiths' alarm.

name: Spreading Insurrection
text:
Gain control of target creature you don't control until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
flavor: Everyone wants to be on the winning side.

name: Strike It Rich
text:
Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: A few coins soon grow into an obsession.

name: Tavern Scoundrel
text:
Whenever you win a coin flip, create two Treasure tokens. (They're artifacts with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice another permanent: Flip a coin.
flavor: "No refunds. I cheated you fair and square."

name: Unholy Heat
text:
Unholy Heat deals 2 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
Delirium — Unholy Heat deals 6 damage instead if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor: "The devils use fire. Why shouldn't we?"

name: Viashino Lashclaw
text: {T}, Discard a card: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn.
flavor: "Victory is the greatest motivator of all. So sayeth the bey."

name: Abundant Harvest
text: Choose land or nonland. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
flavor: "Gaea knows what you need. Do you?"

name: Blessed Respite
text: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
flavor:
"Water the soil with blood, if you must. Eventually it must be tilled with forgiveness."
—Greensleeves

name: Chatterstorm
text:
Create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
flavor:
"Friends, foragers, fuzzy fighters! Tonight we're after more than just acorns!"
—Larrel, Deep Forest hermit

name: Crack Open
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor: What no spell or lockpick could open, the forest coaxed apart.

name: Deepwood Denizen
text:
Vigilance
{5}{G}, {T}: Draw a card. This ability costs {1} less to activate for each +1/+1 counter on creatures you control.
flavor: "You didn't come all this way just to bother me, did you? Say your piece and be gone."

name: Fae Offering
text: At the beginning of each end step, if you've cast both a creature spell and a noncreature spell this turn, create a Clue token, a Food token, and a Treasure token.
flavor:
"Beware the gift when you do not know the giver."
—Chulane, Teller of Tales

name: Foundation Breaker
text:
When Foundation Breaker enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Evoke {1}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
flavor: The castle finally got vengeance for enduring years of royally bad taste.

name: Funnel-Web Recluse
text:
Reach
Morbid — When Funnel-Web Recluse enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: It thrives on a steady diet of hastily disposed-of evidence.

name: Glimmer Bairn
text: Sacrifice a token: Glimmer Bairn gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: "Tricks and treats, souls and sweets! On wooded path, whom shall we meet?"

name: Glinting Creeper
text:
Converge — Glinting Creeper enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.
Glinting Creeper can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
flavor: Natural crystalline growths filter and refract light in dazzling displays that attract pollinators and daze predators.

name: Herd Baloth
text: Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are put on Herd Baloth, you may create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.
flavor: Baloth social structure is simple: the biggest one's the leader.

name: Jade Avenger
text: Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"Froggy fighter at the gate.
Draw your sword and meet your fate."
—Traditional children's rhyme

name: Jewel-Eyed Cobra
text:
Deathtouch
When Jewel-Eyed Cobra dies, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor:
"Sure, they're worth a lot, but I'd rather survive to spend my earnings."
—Mokgar, Kalonian hunter

name: Sanctum Weaver
text: {T}: Add X mana of any one color, where X is the number of enchantments you control.
flavor: The arrival of spring's first flowers is a sacred occasion to Karametra's acolytes, who fill the Setessan woods with song in celebration.

name: Smell Fear
text:
Proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
Target creature you control fights up to one target creature you don't control.
flavor:
"It's fun when they run a little."
—Wasitora, Nekoru queen

name: Squirrel Sovereign
text: Other Squirrels you control get +1/+1.
flavor: For rule of the Aldering Forest, Numstail stole the acorn from Nestwind, who stole it from Brankie, who stole it from Lightroot, who stole it from Leafpaw, who stole it from Darkfur . . .

name: Sylvan Anthem
text:
Green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever a green creature enters the battlefield under your control, scry 1.
flavor:
The harsher the winter, the more glorious the spring.
—Yavimaya saying

name: Urban Daggertooth
text:
Vigilance
Enrage — Whenever Urban Daggertooth is dealt damage, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
flavor: Stop, smell the roses, eat the peoples.

name: Wren's Run Hydra
text:
Reach
Wren's Run Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
Reinforce X—{X}{G}{G} ({X}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature.)
flavor: The boggart hopped carelessly among the roots . . . until the roots woke up.

name: Angelic Curator
text: Flying, protection from artifacts
flavor:
"Do not treat your people as you treat your artifacts. Let them go, and they will live; seal them here, and they will die."
—Urza, to Radiant

name: Sea Drake
text:
Flying
When Sea Drake enters the battlefield, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.
flavor: Highly territorial, they often attack boats whose colors too closely resemble those of other drakes.

name: Seal of Removal
text: Sacrifice Seal of Removal: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"I am the unraveler, the loosened thread that will not hold."
—Seal inscription

name: Upheaval
text: Return all permanents to their owners' hands.
flavor: The calm comes after the storm.

name: Patriarch's Bidding
text: Each player chooses a creature type. Each player returns all creature cards of a type chosen this way from their graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"There's some new darkness in the air tonight. If I were you, I'd stay home and lock the doors."
—Ferrick, village warden

name: Skirge Familiar
text:
Flying
Discard a card: Add {B}.
flavor:
"The skirges screech along with the bone saw. It makes a terrible racket, but they seem to enjoy it."
—Keskit, the Flesh Sculptor

name: Chance Encounter
text:
Whenever you win a coin flip, put a luck counter on Chance Encounter.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Chance Encounter has ten or more luck counters on it, you win the game.
flavor:
"What are the odds, indeed?"
—Yusri, to Desera

name: Flame Rift
text: Flame Rift deals 4 damage to each player.
flavor:
"You might want to step back."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Mogg Salvage
text:
If an opponent controls an Island and you control a Mountain, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.
flavor: Three moggs, one treasure, too bad.

name: Hunting Pack
text:
Create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
flavor: There is no "I" in "team," but there is definitely "meat."

name: Squirrel Mob
text: Squirrel Mob gets +1/+1 for each other Squirrel on the battlefield.
flavor: An army of squirrels is still an army.

name: Riptide Laboratory
text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}{U}, {T}: Return target Wizard you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Working with the best of intentions, its researchers unwittingly unleashed a plague of troubles upon Dominaria.

name: Blossoming Calm
text:
You gain hexproof until your next turn. You gain 2 life.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)
flavor: Mood: A spell that protects her from her enemies.

name: Rise and Shine
text:
Target noncreature artifact you control becomes a 0/0 artifact creature. Put four +1/+1 counters on each artifact that became a creature this way.
Overload {4}{U}{U} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")
flavor: Mood: "You can't keep us locked away anymore. To battle!"

name: World-Weary
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -4/-4.
Basic landcycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.)
flavor: Intent: This is an abstract depiction of a spell that causes a person to rapidly age.

name: Gargadon
text:
Trample
Suspend 4—{1}{R} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{R} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
flavor: Intent: Magic has made a Grater Gargadon and a Lesser Gargadon (see ref). We want you to design the "average" Gargadon.

name: Timeless Witness
text:
When Timeless Witness enters the battlefield, return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
Eternalize {5}{G}{G} ({5}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it, except it's a 4/4 black Zombie Human Shaman with no mana cost. Eternalize only as a sorcery.)
flavor: Intent: We'd like to re-imagine the Eternal Witness as an initiate on Amonkhet.

name: Resurgent Belief
text:
Suspend 2—{1}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {1}{W} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in your graveyard.)
flavor: No god on Theros ever truly dies as long as there are those who still have faith in them.

name: Timeless Dragon
text:
Flying
Plainscycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Plains card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.)
Eternalize {2}{W}{W} ({2}{W}{W}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it, except it's a 4/4 black Zombie Dragon with no mana cost. Eternalize only as a sorcery.)
flavor: It has flown the sky for eons without ever touching ground.

name: Profane Tutor
text:
Suspend 2—{1}{B} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {1}{B} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: As Dakkon forged the Blackblade for Geyadrone Dihada, he unwittingly forged himself into her schemes.

name: Gaea's Will
flavor: With every end, a new beginning.

name: Celestial Judgment
text: For each different power among creatures on the battlefield, choose a creature with that power. Destroy each creature not chosen this way.
flavor:
"I was going to suggest silver, but a beam of pure angelic fury works even better."
—Rem Karolus, Fiendslayer

name: Curse of Conformity
text:
Enchant player
Nonlegendary creatures enchanted player controls have base power and toughness 3/3 and lose all creature types.
flavor: Whether you'll fit in isn't up to you at all.

name: Moorland Rescuer
text: When Moorland Rescuer dies, return any number of other creature cards with total power X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield, where X is Moorland Rescuer's power. Exile Moorland Rescuer.
flavor: "Hold on tight, little one. I'll get you to safety."

name: Stalwart Pathlighter
text:
Vigilance
Coven — At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control three or more creatures with different powers, creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
flavor: "Festival's just ahead. You're almost there!"

name: Cleaver Skaab
text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice another Zombie: Create two tokens that are copies of the sacrificed creature.
flavor: Furious and unable to separate, the bitter rivals consoled themselves by splitting everything else they saw in half.

name: Drown in Dreams
text:
Choose one. If you control a commander as you cast this spell, you may choose both.
• Target player draws X cards.
• Target player mills twice X cards.
flavor:
"Within our minds are limitless depths. Dive down, but don't forget to surface."
—Teferi

name: Ravenous Rotbelly
text: When Ravenous Rotbelly enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice up to three Zombies. When you sacrifice one or more Zombies this way, each opponent sacrifices that many creatures.
flavor: The patrol found the graf empty save for a few well-chewed bones.

name: Celebrate the Harvest
text: Search your library for up to X basic land cards, where X is the number of different powers among creatures you control. Put those cards onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: The Harvesttide dance is one of joyous abandon, a last revel before winter nights.

name: Curse of Clinging Webs
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a nontoken creature enchanted player controls dies, exile it and you create a 1/2 green Spider creature token with reach.
flavor: Clare realized too late why no one ever took the shortcut through the abandoned mill.

name: Heronblade Elite
text:
Vigilance
Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Heronblade Elite.
{T}: Add X mana of any one color, where X is Heronblade Elite's power.
flavor: "When angels fall, humans must rise."

name: Ruinous Intrusion
text: Exile target artifact or enchantment. Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature you control, where X is the mana value of the permanent exiled this way.
flavor: The gourd carving was supposed to take place *after* the feast.

name: Sigardian Zealot
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, choose any number of creatures with different powers. Each of them gets +X/+X and gains vigilance until end of turn, where X is Sigardian Zealot's power.
flavor: "We fight together! In Sigarda's name, ready your weapons!"

name: Avacyn's Memorial
text:
Indestructible
Other legendary permanents you control have indestructible.
flavor: They had no marble, so the faithful repaired her likeness with wood, straw, twine, and clay.

name: Curse of Obsession
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's draw step, that player draws two additional cards.
At the beginning of enchanted player's end step, that player discards their hand.
flavor: He ripped up board after board until his hands were bloody. Still, he could not find whatever it was he sought.

name: Victory's Envoy
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control.
flavor: Her paean is the clash of spears, her prayer a battle cry.

name: Gravespawn Sovereign
text: Tap five untapped Zombies you control: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
flavor: The Cabal never expected its creations to create servants of their own.

name: A-Falcon Abomination
text:
Flash
Flying
When Falcon Abomination enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token with decayed. (It can't block. When it attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat.)
flavor: The foulest of fowl.

name: A-Lier, Disciple of the Drowned
text:
Spells can't be countered.
As long as it's your turn, each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard has flashback. The flashback cost is equal to that card's mana cost.
flavor: Beneath the waves, lost gods stir in their slumber.

name: A-Hobbling Zombie
text:
Deathtouch
When Hobbling Zombie dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token with decayed. (It can't block. When it attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat.)
flavor:
"I see someone tried to stop you, my pet. How delightful."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Afterlife
text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller creates a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
flavor: Facets of life, reflections of the soul.

name: Alarum
text: Untap target nonattacking creature. It gets +1/+3 until end of turn.
flavor:
"One timely cry of warning can save nine of surprise."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Benevolent Unicorn
text: If a spell would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage minus 1 to that permanent or player instead.
flavor:
The best use for a unicorn's horn is to adorn a unicorn.
—Femeref adage

name: Disempower
text: Put target artifact or enchantment on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"Mangara is gone. Who among you doubts that I have taken his power?"
—Kaervek

name: Divine Retribution
text: Divine Retribution deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of attacking creatures.
flavor:
"To the undiscerning eye, justice and vengeance can look the same."
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Femeref Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor:
"Faith is my shield, and hope is my armor; I am vulnerable only to myself."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Femeref Knight
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{W}: Femeref Knight gains vigilance until end of turn.
flavor:
"I will return / with lizard skins for your sandals. Paint your eyes black and wait for me."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Femeref Scouts
flavor:
"The days before the war were filled with strange portents: scouts and herders spoke of villages reduced to ash, of farmers taken from their fields, and of foul beasts roaming the plains in packs. I know, for I spoke to them all."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Healing Salve
text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor:
"The Femeref look only to the Sun for healing; they have never truly understood life's cycle."
—Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage

name: Illumination
text: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell. Its controller gains life equal to its mana value.
flavor:
"A brilliant light can either illuminate or blind. How will you know which until you open your eyes?"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Iron Tusk Elephant
text: Trample

name: Jabari's Influence
text:
Cast this spell only after combat.
Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature that attacked you this turn and put a -1/-0 counter on it.
flavor:
"Common soldiers can't understand what a sidar knows: the enemy can be a resource."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Melesse Spirit
text: Flying, protection from black
flavor: Like a laughing knife, immaculate and sharp, is the Melesse.

name: Mtenda Griffin
text:
Flying
{W}, {T}: Return Mtenda Griffin to its owner's hand and return target Griffin card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate only during your upkeep.
flavor:
"Unlike Zhalfir, the griffin needs no council to keep harmony among its parts."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Mtenda Herder
text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"All animals—even humans—can be herded. The trick is to make them think they choose their own destination."
—Mangara

name: Noble Elephant
text: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor:
"Proud am I, / strong am I, / courageous in defending my children / and fierce in punishing what stands in my way."
—"So the Elephant Speaks," Zhalfirin song

name: Null Chamber
text:
As Null Chamber enters the battlefield, you and an opponent each choose a card name other than a basic land card name.
Spells with the chosen names can't be cast and lands with the chosen names can't be played.
flavor: Discovered by Femeref mages, the Null Chamber is the ultimate testing ground for the uncreative.

name: Rashida Scalebane
text: {T}: Destroy target attacking or blocking Dragon. It can't be regenerated. You gain life equal to its power.
flavor: It is not by the blood of dragons that Rashida measures victories, but by the sum of children who no longer wake from nightmares of scales and fire.

name: Ritual of Steel
text:
Enchant creature
When Ritual of Steel enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
flavor:
"Our soldiers are blessed with lizard scales as hard and cold as steel."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Shadowbane
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you and/or creatures you control this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a black source is prevented this way, you gain that much life.
flavor: Light creates shadow; light destroys shadow. Such is the transience of darkness.

name: Sidar Jabari
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Sidar Jabari attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.
flavor:
"Prophecy is whatever one makes of it, but destiny cannot be changed."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Spectral Guardian
text: As long as Spectral Guardian is untapped, noncreature artifacts have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"A treasure to guard other treasures is worth the highest price."
—Mtai, Civic Guildmage

name: Teremko Griffin
text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor:
"When we're aloft, I love to lean over the *Weatherlight*'s railing and watch the patterns the griffins' shadows make on the clouds below."
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Wall of Resistance
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if Wall of Resistance was dealt damage this turn, put a +0/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Telim'Tor could no longer recall the exact number of assaults—but his troops could.

name: Zhalfirin Knight
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{W}{W}: Zhalfirin Knight gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"You returned a warrior. . . . Your hair was cut, your eye tattooed with the red triangle of war."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Zuberi, Golden Feather
text:
Flying
Other Griffin creatures get +1/+1.
flavor:
"If the griffins tell of their gods, perhaps they speak of feathers bright as the Sun."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Azimaet Drake
text:
Flying
{U}: Azimaet Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor:
"A vizier's dish, best served drenched in honey and almonds."
—Suq'Ata royal recipe

name: Bay Falcon
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor:
"Wear the falcon's feathers in your hair— be fast as the falcon, bright as the Sun."
—"Rise on Wings," Zhalfirin song

name: Cerulean Wyvern
text: Flying, protection from green
flavor:
"Once, a Quirion asked why I was so cautious when the day was clear. I told him of the sky-blue hide of the cerluean wyvern, and he offered me double if I could conjure a strong tailwind!"
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Cloak of Invisibility
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has phasing and can't be blocked except by Walls. (It phases in or out before its controller untaps during each of their untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
flavor:
"Useful . . . if you can find it."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

name: Dream Fighter
text: Whenever Dream Fighter blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Dream Fighter and that creature phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. Each one phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
flavor: Not only the sleeping should fear dreams.

name: Ether Well
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library. If that creature is red, you may put it on the bottom of its owner's library instead.
flavor: "Whoa—my tail will *never* fit through that hole!"

name: Jolt
text:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"There's nothing like a sudden shock to clarify one's thoughts."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

name: Kukemssa Pirates
text: Whenever Kukemssa Pirates attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target artifact defending player controls. If you do, Kukemssa Pirates assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor:
". . . pirates gambled with a djinn and lost the thing more dear than gold."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Meddle
text: If target spell has only one target and that target is a creature, change that spell's target to another creature.
flavor:
"Shadimir was as surprised as he was relieved when the blow turned aside."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Merfolk Raiders
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
flavor:
"Turn your back for a second and they just vanish! As if they weren't shifty enough before."
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

name: Merfolk Seer
text: When Merfolk Seer dies, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, draw a card.
flavor:
The sea leaves no room for tears.
—Zhalfirin adage

name: Mind Harness
text:
Enchant red or green creature
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
You control enchanted creature.
flavor: Centuries ago, Mangara won the loyalty of the Quirion not by ruling their minds but by supporting their independence.

name: Mist Dragon
text:
{0}: Mist Dragon gains flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{0}: Mist Dragon loses flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{3}{U}{U}: Mist Dragon phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
flavor:
"Across the plains, farmers who braved the mists began to vanish. Most blamed the goblins; none guessed the truth."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Political Trickery
text: Exchange control of target land you control and target land an opponent controls. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor:
"Politics is a game—move a stone here, move a stone there—except sometimes the stones bleed."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Reality Ripple
text: Target artifact, creature, or land phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
flavor:
"Can you prepare for the unexpected? No, you cannot. You can prepare only to be surprised."
—Teferi

name: Sandbar Crocodile
text: Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
flavor:
"We've run aground sandbars before, but today, a sandbar ran aground us."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

name: Shimmer
text:
As Shimmer enters the battlefield, choose a land type.
Each land of the chosen type has phasing. (It phases in or out before its controller untaps during each of their untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
flavor:
To buy unseen land, pay in unseen coin.
—Suq'Ata maxim

name: Soar
text:
You may cast Soar as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 and has flying.
flavor:
"Would you give up your hands to fly? That is what the birds have done."
—*The One Thousand Questions*

name: Suq'Ata Firewalker
text:
Suq'Ata Firewalker can't be the target of red spells or abilities from red sources.
{T}: Suq'Ata Firewalker deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
"Comfortable even in a furnace? I've never met one who'd accept my wager."
—Talibah, embermage

name: Taniwha
text:
Trample
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, all lands you control phase out. (They phase in before you untap during your next untap step.)
flavor:
"Taniwha rolls in its sleep, and the land is awash with the waves."
—Poetics of Hanan

name: Teferi's Curse
text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent has phasing. (It phases in or out before its controller untaps during each of their untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
flavor:
"Stepping through time is like riding a camel. It may get you where you want to go, but the ride is rarely pleasant."
—Teferi

name: Teferi's Drake
text:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
flavor:
"We threw dried fruit to the drakes that rode the air, streaming along the *Weatherlight'*s side as we sailed amidst the clouds."
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Teferi's Imp
text:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Whenever Teferi's Imp phases out, discard a card.
Whenever Teferi's Imp phases in, draw a card.
flavor: Made you look.

name: Thirst
text:
Enchant creature
When Thirst enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Thirst unless you pay {U}.
flavor: The first of the Thousand Deaths.

name: Vaporous Djinn
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Vaporous Djinn phases out unless you pay {U}{U}. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
flavor:
"What is taking them so long to fill the waterskins?"
—Mwani, Mtenda goatherd

name: Wave Elemental
text: {U}, {T}, Sacrifice Wave Elemental: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
flavor:
"Consider the wave: how weak the mother yet how strong the child."
—Tywanna, Shaper Guildmage

name: Barbed-Back Wurm
text: {B}: Target green creature blocking Barbed-Back Wurm gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The Mwonvuli Jungle has given the darkness teeth for tearing the gift of life from the weak."
—Jolrael

name: Binding Agony
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, Binding Agony deals that much damage to that creature's controller.
flavor:
A crash of rhinos in my head
—Femeref expression meaning "a severe head pain"

name: Breathstealer
text: {B}: Breathstealer gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"As a child, I slept with a cloth over my face, to hide from the spirits that might pull the air from my lungs."
—Mosi, Femeref weaver

name: Carrion
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Create X 0/1 black Insect creature tokens, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
flavor: King or herder, the maggots care not.

name: Choking Sands
text: Destroy target non-Swamp land. If that land was nonbasic, Choking Sands deals 2 damage to the land's controller.
flavor:
"The people wiped the sand from their eyes and cursed—and left the barren land to the hyenas and vipers."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Dirtwater Wraith
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{B}: Dirtwater Wraith gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The foul entities of the Uuserk swamp had never before dared to spread their influence to the very heart of Zhalfir."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Dread Specter
text: Whenever Dread Specter blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor:
Whatever follows life is incurable.
—Zhalfirin aphorism

name: Fetid Horror
text: {B}: Fetid Horror gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Of the six who went down the Uuserk Trail to scout ahead, one returned. She clawed at her eyes and nostrils and sobbed with horror. I was curious about what she saw, but we chose another path."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal

name: Grave Servitude
text:
You may cast Grave Servitude as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-1 and is black.
flavor:
"I no longer believe in a final resting place."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Gravebane Zombie
text: If Gravebane Zombie would die, put Gravebane Zombie on top of its owner's library instead.
flavor:
"A zombie's bed must be a lumpy one or he wouldn't leave it so often."
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Harbinger of Night
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature.
flavor:
Embrace the Harbinger
—Suq'Ata expression meaning "abandon hope"

name: Kaervek's Hex
text: Kaervek's Hex deals 1 damage to each nonblack creature and an additional 1 damage to each green creature.
flavor:
"If the curse does not strike you dead, question your soul."
—Kaervek

name: Mire Shade
text: {B}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mire Shade. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor:
"We realized the bog had not given up a soul but had come to claim a new one."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal

name: Phyrexian Tribute
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice two creatures.
Destroy target artifact.
flavor:
"In your final breath you still have something to offer Phyrexia."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Ravenous Vampire
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a nonartifact creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Ravenous Vampire. If you don't, tap Ravenous Vampire.
flavor: Eternal life brings eternal hunger.

name: Reign of Terror
text: Destroy all green creatures or all white creatures. They can't be regenerated. You lose 2 life for each creature that died this way.
flavor:
"I don't know what takes them; they die around me without time to scream."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal

name: Restless Dead
text: {B}: Regenerate Restless Dead.
flavor:
The rich's heirs often thank them after death . . . but preferably not in person.
—Suq'Ata epigram

name: Shallow Grave
text: Return the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: Good help is hard to dig up.

name: Soul Rend
text:
Destroy target creature if it's white. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"Since I cannot stop death, I choose to stop life."
—Kaervek

name: Soulshriek
text: Target creature you control gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor:
"The flesh is a casket for the soul."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Wall of Corpses
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}, Sacrifice Wall of Corpses: Destroy target creature Wall of Corpses is blocking.
flavor:
"I shall make walls of their flesh, and their blood will be my mortar."
—Kaervek

name: Withering Boon
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay 3 life.
Counter target creature spell.
flavor:
"Life for life: this is the immutable law."
—Panya, Granger Guildmage

name: Barreling Attack
text: Target creature gains trample until end of turn. When that creature becomes blocked this turn, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor:
"The trollish game of push-fall inspired this impressive tactic."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Blind Fury
text: All creatures lose trample until end of turn. If a creature would deal combat damage to a creature this turn, it deals double that damage to that creature instead.
flavor:
"Tell me . . . have you ever sung the Song of Blood?"
—Purraj of Urborg

name: Blistering Barrier
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor:
I live without food, stand without leg, wound without force, and am harder to fight than to kill. What am I?
—Femeref riddle

name: Builder's Bane
text: Destroy X target artifacts. Builder's Bane deals damage to each player equal to the number of artifacts they controlled that were put into a graveyard this way.
flavor: There is only so much a person may be buried with.

name: Burning Palm Efreet
text: {1}{R}{R}: Burning Palm Efreet deals 2 damage to target creature with flying and that creature loses flying until end of turn.
flavor: Even the lion envies the lark.

name: Burning Shield Askari
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{R}{R}: Burning Shield Askari gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Any day that I ride my horse up to my ankles in the remains of my enemies is a good day."
—Akin, seasoned askari

name: Chaosphere
text:
Creatures with flying can block only creatures with flying.
Creatures without flying have reach. (They can block creatures with flying.)
flavor:
"I dance the nothing dance, / Feet in the air, knives in the ground."
—Femeref chant

name: Dwarven Miner
text: {2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.
flavor:
"Fetch the pestridder, Paka—we've got dwarves in the rutabagas!"
—Jamul, Femeref farmer

name: Dwarven Nomad
text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
flavor:
A dwarf's life belongs as much to the land as to the dwarf.
—Creed of the Stonethrow Clan

name: Ekundu Cyclops
text: If a creature you control attacks, Ekundu Cyclops also attacks if able.
flavor:
"Big one I, One big eye. One-eye see Two-eye die!"
—Traditional cyclops chant

name: Emberwilde Djinn
text:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may pay {R}{R} or 2 life. If the player does, they gain control of Emberwilde Djinn.
flavor: A hefty price is no guarantee of quality merchandise.

name: Flame Elemental
text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice Flame Elemental: It deals damage equal to its power to target creature.
flavor: Storyteller: By my hand in the fire, this story is a tale of power. Listeners: May it give you strength.

name: Goblin Scouts
text: Create three 1/1 red Goblin Scout creature tokens with mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor:
"Pathetic—like I wouldn't know a goblin painted up to look like a dwarf!"
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

name: Goblin Soothsayer
text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Red creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"I see a great victory and rivers of blood. And . . . hmm, looks like a spleen."
—Grishnak, goblin soothsayer

name: Lightning Reflexes
text:
You may cast Lightning Reflexes as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
flavor: "Inhale. Kill. Exhale."

name: Pyric Salamander
text: {R}: Pyric Salamander gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Sacrifice Pyric Salamander at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor:
When you've been chased by a dragon, you run from every lizard.
—Suq'Ata saying

name: Raging Spirit
text: {2}: Raging Spirit becomes colorless until end of turn.
flavor:
"Its burning power is more elusive than shade on the Unyaro Plains, more perilous than the horn of a rhino."
—Akin, seasoned askari

name: Reign of Chaos
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target Plains and target white creature.
• Destroy target Island and target blue creature.
flavor:
"The Burning Isles are the home to a dozen lords who claim dominion. Jamuraa will look to only one leader: me."
—Kaervek

name: Searing Spear Askari
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{R}: Searing Spear Askari gains menace until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: When the other soldiers of Zhalfir fall, the askaris will yet stand.

name: Sirocco
text: Target player reveals their hand. For each blue instant card revealed this way, that player discards that card unless they pay 4 life.
flavor:
"Blow, fiery wind, / strip illusion from the eye. / Blow, fiery wind of truth."
—Femeref chant

name: Subterranean Spirit
text:
Protection from red
{T}: Subterranean Spirit deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor:
"Air hot with sulfur. / Earth heaves beneath me. / Could it be the mountain / ate something bad?"
—Dwarven mining song

name: Telim'Tor
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Telim'Tor attacks, all attacking creatures with flanking get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The curious merely amass knowledge. The ambitious use it."
—Telim'Tor

name: Telim'Tor's Edict
text:
Exile target permanent you own or control.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor:
"Execution awaits the dissenter."
—Kasib ibn Naji, *Letters*

name: Torrent of Lava
text:
Torrent of Lava deals X damage to each creature without flying.
As long as Torrent of Lava is on the stack, each creature has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to this creature by Torrent of Lava this turn."
flavor: The mountain's voice shouts us all down.

name: Brushwagg
text: Whenever Brushwagg blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Defiantly, the young cyclops popped the brushwagg into his mouth. His cheeks suddenly puffed, his eye bulged, and he was forced to agree with his elder."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Canopy Dragon
text:
Trample
{1}{G}: Canopy Dragon gains flying and loses trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"In the Mwonvuli you must divide your attention between what hangs overhead and what lies underfoot."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Cycle of Life
text: Return Cycle of Life to its owner's hand: Target creature you cast this turn has base power and toughness 0/1 until your next upkeep. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
flavor: Thus does nature assert herself.

name: Gibbering Hyenas
text: Gibbering Hyenas can't block black creatures.
flavor:
Hyenas laughing—what's the joke?
—Femeref phrase meaning "that's not funny"

name: Jolrael's Centaur
text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"What need have I for cavalry when I can have horse and rider both in one?"
—Jolrael

name: Jungle Wurm
text: Whenever Jungle Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
flavor: Broad as a baobab—and about as smart.

name: Karoo Meerkat
text: Protection from blue
flavor:
"Be like the meerkat, my daughters: ever vigilant, true to your own, and wary of strangers."
—Nabil Alamat, Suq'Ata merchant

name: Locust Swarm
text:
Flying
{G}: Regenerate Locust Swarm.
{G}: Untap Locust Swarm. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: Better a fierce thunderhead than a sky filled with locusts.

name: Nettletooth Djinn
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Nettletooth Djinn deals 1 damage to you.
flavor:
"The few of us who survived were denied entry to our camp for two days—so like the pox were the marks we bore."
—*Travelogue of Najat*

name: Seeds of Innocence
text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated. The controller of each of those artifacts gains life equal to its mana value.
flavor:
"I have hidden from the machinations of Zhalfir for centuries. Why should I join *your* campaign?"
—Jolrael

name: Serene Heart
text: Destroy all Auras.
flavor:
"If magic is your crutch, cast it aside and learn to walk without it."
—Teferi

name: Tranquil Domain
text: Destroy all non-Aura enchantments.
flavor:
"An ancient court mage unified the houses into guilds to serve Zhalfir above their own interests. Even during the civil war, the guilds stood together, a testament to the wisdom of Teferi."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Tropical Storm
text: Tropical Storm deals X damage to each creature with flying and 1 additional damage to each blue creature.
flavor:
"After the storm, I found a sea turtle dying on the sands, a blade of grass driven through its shell."
—*Travelogue of Najat*

name: Uktabi Faerie
text:
Flying
{3}{G}, Sacrifice Uktabi Faerie: Destroy target artifact.
flavor:
Victim of the two-toed faerie
—Suq'Ata expression meaning "broken"

name: Unyaro Bee Sting
text: Unyaro Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor:
"Much can be learned from the bees about dying for a cause."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Village Elder
text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate target creature.
flavor:
"Enchant me with your tale-telling. Tell about Tree, Grass, River, and Wind. / Tell why Truth must fight with Falsehood, and why Truth will always win."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Wild Elephant
text: Trample
flavor:
"I will tell my father's stories . . . . How the elephants trampled the leopard cub, and its father, though he knew, killed nine goats instead."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Teferi's Isle
text:
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Teferi's Isle enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}{U}.
flavor: The three wizards knew only that this isle held a great mystery—and that patience alone would solve it.

name: Daybreak Coronet
text:
Enchant creature with another Aura attached to it
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has first strike, vigilance, and lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
flavor:
"Let the deception of the gods yield to the pure light of day."
—Brimaz, king of Oreskos

name: Iona, Shield of Emeria
text:
Flying
As Iona, Shield of Emeria enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Your opponents can't cast spells of the chosen color.
flavor: No more shall the righteous cower before evil.

name: Argent Sphinx
text:
Flying
Metalcraft — {U}: Exile Argent Sphinx. Return it to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step. Activate only if you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: A great mirage, a dream of wings and silver.

name: Inexorable Tide
text: Whenever you cast a spell, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
flavor:
"See how gratefully this world accepts our blessings."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Stoic Rebuttal
text:
Metalcraft — This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control three or more artifacts.
Counter target spell.
flavor: Obsessed with the pursuit of knowledge above all else, vedalken can appear to be cold and emotionless.

name: Midnight Banshee
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on each nonblack creature.
flavor: Many have heard the beginning of its low, sustained shriek but few the end.

name: Sickle Ripper
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: His sickle was forged in the heat of another cinder's funeral pyre.

name: Vampire Outcasts
text:
Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor: Some vampires reject the decadent trappings of their kind. Once they turn feral, no amount of blood will satisfy their hunger.

name: Blood Ogre
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor:
"Ogres taunt the dragons by moving into their territory, but even the hellkites find them too much trouble to hunt."
—Marza, mountain scout

name: Brute Force
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: Blood, bone, and sinew are magnified, as is the rage that drives them. The brain, however, remains unchanged—a little bean, swinging by a strand in a cavernous, raving head.

name: Spikeshot Elder
text: {1}{R}{R}: Spikeshot Elder deals damage equal to its power to any target.
flavor: Now that he knows a thousand ways of hurting people, his next shamanic quest is to discover a thousand more.

name: Splinter Twin
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Create a token that's a copy of this creature, except it has haste. Exile that token at the beginning of the next end step."
flavor: "I know just the person for that job."

name: All Suns' Dawn
text: For each color, return up to one target card of that color from your graveyard to your hand. Exile All Suns' Dawn.
flavor:
"When the fifth sun rose, Mirrodin saw its first true dawn."
—Inscribed on the skin of Thrun, the last troll

name: Mutagenic Growth
text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Sympathy is for weaklings. Whoever survives, wins."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might

name: Sundering Vitae
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor: Centuries of wind, rain, and roots compressed into an instant of destruction: such is the power of Selesnya.

name: Tarmogoyf
text: Tarmogoyf's power is equal to the number of card types among cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
flavor: What doesn't grow, dies. And what dies grows the tarmogoyf.

name: Attended Knight
text:
First strike
When Attended Knight enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
flavor: The virtues of knighthood are best taught in the field.

name: Graceful Reprieve
text: When target creature dies this turn, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
flavor: "In my moment of death, I had a vision of the world, dark and unwelcoming. I wanted to hide in the deepest meander, but the light pulled me back."

name: Wing Splicer
text:
When Wing Splicer enters the battlefield, create a 3/3 colorless Phyrexian Golem artifact creature token.
Golem creatures you control have flying.
flavor: "Progress is our great inheritance, perfection our ultimate destination."

name: Mortician Beetle
text: Whenever a player sacrifices a creature, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Mortician Beetle.
flavor: To the soldier, war is famine; to the scavenger, a feast.

name: Ogre Jailbreaker
text:
Defender
Ogre Jailbreaker can attack as though it didn't have defender as long as you control a Gate.
flavor: It took three years for it to occur to him to use the chain as a weapon, but once it did, he made up for lost time.

name: Traitorous Instinct
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. Until end of turn, it gets +2/+0 and gains haste.
flavor: The horror lurched about like a puppet from a madman's nightmare, squeezing the life from its own kind.

name: Gaea's Anthem
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor:
"To those who can hear it, Gaea's battle song brings power as swift as sunlight and as enduring as the deep roots of the forest."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder

name: Hungry Spriggan
text:
Trample
Whenever Hungry Spriggan attacks, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: If a spriggan's eyes are larger than its stomach, it has ways to remedy the situation.

name: Seal of Primordium
text: Sacrifice Seal of Primordium: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor:
"I am the simplifier, the root that drags all artifice to earth."
—Seal inscription

name: Slime Molding
text: Create an X/X green Ooze creature token.
flavor:
"Give me enough refuse and mana and I will summon an ooze that can engulf all of Ravnica."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

name: Vital Splicer
text:
When Vital Splicer enters the battlefield, create a 3/3 colorless Phyrexian Golem artifact creature token.
{1}: Regenerate target Golem you control.
flavor:
"For every one that falls, ten shall rise. The revelation of New Phyrexia is at hand."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Amrou Scout
text: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with mana value 3 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: The people of Amrou were scattered by war and driven into hiding. Scouts maintain the beacon fires that signal "return" and "home."

name: Amrou Seekers
text: Amrou Seekers can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.
flavor: The paradise of Amrou Haven had become a field of cinders. Its people struggled to survive, hoping to see visions of its past in the strange storms that quickly passed.

name: Feudkiller's Verdict
text: You gain 10 life. Then if you have more life than an opponent, create a 5/5 white Giant Warrior creature token.
flavor:
"There are all kinds of strengths, but if you have strength of soul, the others will follow."
—Galanda Feudkiller

name: Saltfield Recluse
text: {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
flavor: He remembers a past of light and healing. But he lives the bitter present—parching salt, scouring wind, and the withering heat of the desert.

name: Sandsower
text: Tap three untapped creatures you control: Tap target creature.
flavor: It drifts through the streets as a breeze of collective sighs, wilting the bustle with dreams and heavy eyelids.

name: Veteran Armorer
text: Other creatures you control get +0/+1.
flavor: "Give me a sword and I'll kill a few enemies. But give me a hammer and a fiery forge, and I'll turn the tide of battle."

name: Careful Consideration
text: Target player draws four cards, then discards three cards. If you cast this spell during your main phase, instead that player draws four cards, then discards two cards.
flavor:
"Sages who take the time to verify their sources are rewarded for their diligence."
—Jhoira, to Teferi

name: Mothdust Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Tap an untapped creature you control: Mothdust Changeling gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"Ever seen a changeling fly into a lantern?"
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

name: Vedalken Dismisser
text: When Vedalken Dismisser enters the battlefield, put target creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"I crept up on him, quiet as a guttermouse. And then suddenly I found myself facedown in a latrine pit behind Tin Street Market."
—Sirislav, Dimir spy

name: Blightspeaker
text:
{T}: Target player loses 1 life.
{4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with mana value 3 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: One croaked sermon spreads propaganda and plague.

name: Rathi Trapper
text: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor: Tangling vines, fetid murk, paralyzing poisons, and crawling dead. The swamp is nature's trap waiting to be exploited by unnatural minds.

name: Warren Weirding
text: Target player sacrifices a creature. If a Goblin is sacrificed this way, that player creates two 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature tokens, and those tokens gain haste until end of turn.
flavor:
"And that's when it was discovered that boggarts have just half a brain."
—*The Book of Other Folk*

name: Sudden Shock
text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Sudden Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: Arc mages aren't known for their patience.

name: War-Spike Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{R}: War-Spike Changeling gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Aren't there boggarts enough in Lorwyn? Couldn't it turn into a sheep? Or a sunflower?"
—Olly of Goldmeadow

name: Reach of Branches
text:
Create a 2/5 green Treefolk Shaman creature token.
Whenever a Forest enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Reach of Branches from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Growth has no limits.

name: Tromp the Domains
text: Domain — Until end of turn, creatures you control gain trample and get +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor: Ground into the footprints of the ravaging herd were clumps of salt from Benalia, moss from Llanowar, dust from Hurloon, and ash from as far as Urborg.

name: Alabaster Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: Its mortar is mixed with waters straight from the Fountain of Cho.

name: Charmed Griffin
text:
Flying
When Charmed Griffin enters the battlefield, each other player may put an artifact or enchantment card onto the battlefield from their hand.
flavor: Are you sure you can afford such a luxury?

name: Cho-Arrim Bruiser
text: Whenever Cho-Arrim Bruiser attacks, you may tap up to two target creatures.
flavor: He doesn't know why the Cho-Arrim fight the Mercadians, but he's happy to bash heads for them anyway.

name: Common Cause
text: Nonartifact creatures get +2/+2 as long as they all share a color.
flavor: Mercadia City's troops are at their best when they have no enemy to fight.

name: Cornered Market
text:
Players can't cast spells with the same name as a nontoken permanent.
Players can't play nonbasic lands with the same name as a nontoken permanent.
flavor:
Don't step on the livelihood of other vendors, or they may step on you.
—Mercadian saying

name: Crackdown
text: Nonwhite creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
flavor:
"There is no place for mercy in defense of our lives."
—Ta-Spon, Cho-Arrim executioner

name: Devout Witness
text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor: The Cho-Arrim fought Mercadia's decadence with more than just swords.

name: Fountain Watch
text: Artifacts and enchantments you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
flavor: The Cho-Arrim didn't rely only on a secret location to protect their Fountain.

name: Fresh Volunteers
flavor: Every Cho-Arrim villager is a potential warrior; when they are called, they abandon their peaceful way of life and take up arms to defend it.

name: Honor the Fallen
text: Exile all creature cards from all graveyards. You gain 1 life for each card exiled this way.
flavor:
"May the River claim Cho-Manno's body, wherever it lies."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

name: Ignoble Soldier
text: Whenever Ignoble Soldier becomes blocked, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by it this turn.
flavor: Cowardice is a term invented by those with no cunning.

name: Inviolability
text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature.
flavor: A soldier's faith is magic strong enough to protect against any blade.

name: Jhovall Queen
text: Vigilance
flavor: War-trained jhovalls eat twice their weight in war-trained soldiers daily.

name: Jhovall Rider
text: Trample
flavor: Don't be fooled by the riders' fluid grace—it takes years of practice to ride these beasts.

name: Moment of Silence
text: Target player skips their next combat phase this turn.
flavor: The silence commemorates not those who've died, but those about to.

name: Moonlit Wake
text: Whenever a creature dies, you gain 1 life.
flavor:
"As long as Rushwood glows, no life is ever truly lost."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

name: Muzzle
text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.
flavor:
Clenched teeth do not bite.
—Cho-Arrim saying

name: Nightwind Glider
text: Flying, protection from black
flavor: Once you learn to float on the shadows, you'll never fear them again.

name: Pious Warrior
text: Whenever Pious Warrior is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
flavor: The Cho-Arrim make no distinction between healers and soldiers.

name: Ramosian Captain
text:
First strike
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with mana value 4 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: The Cho-Arrim believe in leading by example.

name: Ramosian Commander
text: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with mana value 5 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: "Cho-Manno guides your spirit. I guide your sword."

name: Ramosian Lieutenant
text: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with mana value 3 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: "Give me your hand and I will give you victory."

name: Ramosian Sergeant
text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with mana value 2 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: Her commands are part rallying cry, part sermon, and wholly undeniable.

name: Ramosian Sky Marshal
text:
Flying
{7}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with mana value 6 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: The Cho-Arrim fell from the sky onto Mercadia City like a vengeful rain.

name: Renounce
text: Sacrifice any number of permanents. You gain 2 life for each permanent sacrificed this way.
flavor: Gerrard offered no defense to Orim's condemnation; the mission was under his command, and he was responsible.

name: Revered Elder
text: {1}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Revered Elder this turn.
flavor: The Cho-Arrim worship life and revere those who've experienced it longest.

name: Righteous Aura
text: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
flavor:
"There is a great difference between pain and injury."
—Cho-Manno

name: Righteous Indignation
text: Whenever a creature blocks a black or red creature, the blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "You are the disease that plagues Mercadia. I am the healer's knife that will cut you out."

name: Soothing Balm
text: Target player gains 5 life.
flavor: Orim taught Ta-Karnst and the other Cho-Arrim healers a far less invasive method of healing.

name: Task Force
text: Whenever Task Force becomes the target of a spell or ability, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: They are the reflection of Rushwood's glow on the edge of a wooden sword.

name: Thermal Glider
text: Flying, protection from red
flavor:
"The Mercadians are too busy looking down on us to see us coming."
—Cho-Arrim rebel

name: Tonic Peddler
text: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: Target player gains 3 life.
flavor: "The price is written at the bottom of the cup."

name: Trap Runner
text: {T}: Target unblocked attacking creature becomes blocked. Activate only during combat after blockers are declared. (This ability works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
flavor: "How could I catch her when the trees conspired to stop me?"

name: Wishmonger
text: {2}: Target creature gains protection from the color of its controller's choice until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
flavor: "It's not what you ask for, but how you ask for it."

name: Aerial Caravan
text:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card. (Reveal the card as you exile it.)
flavor: Successful delivery is *not* guaranteed.

name: Balloon Peddler
text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: The market festival turned out to be the high point of Jaffy's visit.

name: Blockade Runner
text: {U}: Blockade Runner can't be blocked this turn.
flavor: "I need to get back to Mercadia City," said Sisay. "We can get you there," the vizier answered. "Easily."

name: Buoyancy
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
flavor: Saprazzan merfolk become legged on land, but some find it quicker to bring the water with them.

name: Chambered Nautilus
text: Whenever Chambered Nautilus becomes blocked, you may draw a card.
flavor: What's merely a home for the nautilus can become exquisite jewelry in the hands of Saprazzan artisans.

name: Charisma
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a creature, gain control of the other creature for as long as Charisma remains on the battlefield.
flavor: It was Gerrard's nature to lead and the Mercadians' to follow.

name: Customs Depot
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: A bribe is always faster than filling out paperwork.

name: Darting Merfolk
text: {U}: Return Darting Merfolk to its owner's hand.
flavor: You might as well try to catch water with a net.

name: Drake Hatchling
text:
Flying
{U}: Drake Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: There is beauty in the space between learning to fly and taking it for granted.

name: Extravagant Spirit
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Extravagant Spirit unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.
flavor: The fewer your possessions, the fewer your worries.

name: Glowing Anemone
text: When Glowing Anemone enters the battlefield, you may return target land to its owner's hand.
flavor: Beautiful to behold, terrible to be held.

name: High Seas
text: Red creature spells and green creature spells cost {1} more to cast.
flavor:
Bend as the wave breaks or it will break you as well.
—Saprazzan saying

name: Hoodwink
text: Return target artifact, enchantment, or land to its owner's hand.
flavor: The youths of Rishada's marketplace are always ready for a quick footrace.

name: Indentured Djinn
text:
Flying
When Indentured Djinn enters the battlefield, each other player may draw up to three cards.
flavor: It's not always clear who's the master and who's the servant.

name: Misstep
text: Creatures target player controls don't untap during that player's next untap step.
flavor:
The feet have no eyes.
—Saprazzan saying

name: Overtaker
text: {3}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: "It's no challenge to master a Mercadian."

name: Port Inspector
text: Whenever Port Inspector becomes blocked, you may look at defending player's hand.
flavor: "There may be a few minor additional fees, levies, duties, surtaxes, tariffs, imposts, tolls . . . ."

name: Rishadan Cutpurse
text: When Rishadan Cutpurse enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {1}.
flavor:
The bigger the purse, the greater the fool.
—Rishadan saying

name: Sailmonger
text: {2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
flavor: Clients who cheat the sailmonger make an impact on the rest.

name: Saprazzan Heir
text: Whenever Saprazzan Heir becomes blocked, you may draw three cards.
flavor: Within the walls of the floating city, Saprazzan wealth is like Saprazzan water: abundant, free-flowing, and accessible to all.

name: Saprazzan Outrigger
text: When Saprazzan Outrigger attacks or blocks, put it on top of its owner's library at end of combat.
flavor: The Saprazzans excel at both tactics: hit *and* run.

name: Saprazzan Raider
text: When Saprazzan Raider becomes blocked, return it to its owner's hand.
flavor: Some quick dagger work and then back to the sea—that's the Saprazzan way.

name: Shoving Match
text: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: Tap target creature."
flavor: Rishadan barkeeps know something the Mercadians have yet to learn: if you keep pushing, someone will eventually push back.

name: Squeeze
text: Sorcery spells cost {3} more to cast.
flavor: Any pirate would prefer Rishada's swift and cruel justice to Saprazzo's patient punishments.

name: Statecraft
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by creatures you control.
flavor:
"Inside these walls, peace; outside, sharks. You choose."
—Saprazzan vizier

name: Tidal Bore
text:
You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
You may tap or untap target creature.
flavor: The dry riverbed became a raging torrent, and the Cho-Arrim claimed their prize.

name: Timid Drake
text:
Flying
When another creature enters the battlefield, return Timid Drake to its owner's hand.
flavor: It flees from anything that isn't shaped like a cloud.

name: War Tax
text: {X}{U}: This turn, creatures can't attack unless their controller pays {X} for each attacking creature they control.
flavor: The worst thing about being a depraved pirate is having to work with a bunch of depraved pirates.

name: Waterfront Bouncer
text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: Closing time comes earlier to some than to others.

name: Alley Grifters
text: Whenever Alley Grifters becomes blocked, defending player discards a card.
flavor: One distracts the victim, the other extracts the valuables.

name: Bog Smugglers
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: They slide over the bog like oil across glass.

name: Cackling Witch
text: {X}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The touch of his madness can drive anyone into a killing frenzy.

name: Cateran Brute
text: {2}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with mana value 2 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: The Cateran guild prefers to call them "public relations."

name: Cateran Kidnappers
text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with mana value 3 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: Recruits aren't always volunteers.

name: Cateran Summons
text: Search your library for a Mercenary card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Even when recruitment is slow, the guild can always cook something up.

name: Corrupt Official
text:
{2}{B}: Regenerate Corrupt Official.
Whenever Corrupt Official becomes blocked, defending player discards a card at random.
flavor: His favor comes at a high price.

name: Delraich
text:
You may sacrifice three black creatures rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Trample
flavor: It wears the souls of its victims like jewels on a chain.

name: Extortion
text: Look at target player's hand and choose up to two cards from it. That player discards those cards.
flavor: The enforcers make no effort to distinguish gold from flesh.

name: Forced March
text: Destroy all creatures with mana value X or less.
