flavor: The Caterans call it a screening process. The dead are in no condition to argue.

name: Haunted Crossroads
text: {B}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
flavor: It seemed as if no one wanted them to reach the Henge of Ramos—not even the dead.

name: Instigator
text: {1}{B}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able.
flavor: The desecration of their dead makes even the Saprazzans careless.

name: Intimidation
text: Creatures you control have fear. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: "If they move, kill them. In fact, kill one now to make sure the other understands."

name: Liability
text: Whenever a nontoken permanent is put into a player's graveyard from the battlefield, that player loses 1 life.
flavor: Gerrard realized that the helpless woman they'd rescued from Rath was nothing of the sort.

name: Maggot Therapy
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
flavor:
"If this is the cure, I'd hate to see the disease."
—Orim

name: Misshapen Fiend
text: Flying
flavor: You'd scarcely believe they could fly until they drop out of the sky onto you.

name: Molting Harpy
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Molting Harpy unless you pay {2}.
flavor: Shed harpy feathers leave painful wounds—which explains the harpies' mood.

name: Notorious Assassin
text: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: He wears his infamy like a fine silk shirt.

name: Pretender's Claim
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, tap all lands defending player controls.
flavor: The surest way to lose your holdings is to plead for them in Mercadia City's courts.

name: Putrefaction
text: Whenever a player casts a green or white spell, that player discards a card.
flavor:
"Do you want to be alive or whole?"
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

name: Rampart Crawler
text: Rampart Crawler can't be blocked by Walls.
flavor:
"Not even the magistrate in his lofty tower is out of our reach."
—Cateran overlord

name: Scandalmonger
text: {2}: Target player discards a card. Any player may activate this ability but only as a sorcery.
flavor: Silence costs extra. Breaking it costs extra still.

name: Silent Assassin
text: {3}{B}: Destroy target blocking creature at end of combat.
flavor: She feels no need to disturb her victim's slumber.

name: Skulking Fugitive
text: When Skulking Fugitive becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor: In the Cateran guild, being caught is a capital offense.

name: Soul Channeling
text:
Enchant creature
Pay 2 life: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor: Driven by masters more terrible than the Mercadians could imagine, the dark overseers would pay any price to keep their shipwrights working.

name: Specter's Wail
text: Target player discards a card at random.
flavor: As he gritted his teeth to focus through the pain, Tahngarth glanced at Takara. She seemed completely unaffected.

name: Strongarm Thug
text: When Strongarm Thug enters the battlefield, you may return target Mercenary card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "No, I insist—let *me* carry all that heavy jewelry."

name: Thrashing Wumpus
text: {B}: Thrashing Wumpus deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: Young wumpuses are malevolent and vicious—but they grow out of it.

name: Undertaker
text: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: The weight of death is heavy but not immovable.

name: Vendetta
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.
flavor: Starke knew the voice was Takara's, but the venom was Volrath's.

name: Wall of Distortion
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: It reflects only nightmares.

name: Blaster Mage
text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target Wall.
flavor: "Don't get up. I'll show myself out."

name: Brawl
text: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature."
flavor: Anything can happen when patience is scarce and wine is abundant.

name: Cave-In
text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Cave-In deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: One fleet was gone; others were poised.

name: Ceremonial Guard
text: When Ceremonial Guard attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
flavor:
"These guards are the most disciplined military unit in the city. They couldn't fight their way out of a broom closet, but they've got discipline."
—Gerrard, to Sisay

name: Close Quarters
text: Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, Close Quarters deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: The Mercadians' ineptitude in close combat sometimes accidentally pays off.

name: Crag Saurian
text: Whenever a source deals damage to Crag Saurian, that source's controller gains control of Crag Saurian.
flavor: It follows the strongest leader—the one with the longest whip.

name: Crash
text:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.
flavor: Gerrard shook his head as the ground rushed to meet him. "This," he thought, "is not the start I was hoping for."

name: Flaming Sword
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
flavor:
"It's not Talruum crystal, but I must admit—it gets the job done."
—Tahngarth

name: Furious Assault
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, Furious Assault deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor:
"Does it burn, Saprazzan? Do you wish you had never raised arms against us?"
—Kyren overseer

name: Gerrard's Irregulars
text: Trample, haste
flavor: Had Gerrard realized he'd end up fighting against them, he might not have trained them so well.

name: Hammer Mage
text: {X}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy all artifacts with mana value X or less.
flavor: When he's holding the hammers, everything looks like a nail.

name: Kris Mage
text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Kris Mage deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Her blade draws blood without ever touching its target.

name: Kyren Glider
text:
Flying
Kyren Glider can't block.
flavor: Mercadia's Kyren goblins are the opposite of Dominarian goblins: they're smart and cowardly.

name: Kyren Negotiations
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Kyren Negotiations deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: Kyren goblins always speak in questions and never allow wrong answers.

name: Kyren Sniper
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Kyren Sniper deal 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: Kyren goblins always act behind the scenes—even in battle.

name: Lightning Hounds
text: First strike
flavor: Quick enough to avoid jhovalls when alone and fierce enough to attack them in packs, the hounds were as at home in the mountains as the Mercadians were atop theirs.

name: Lunge
text: Lunge deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: Cho-Arrim righteousness was no match for Benalish combat training.

name: Magistrate's Veto
text: White creatures and blue creatures can't block.
flavor: The magistrate had been the goblins' puppet for so long that he made the right decisions with little prompting.

name: Mercadia's Downfall
text: Each attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each nonbasic land defending player controls.
flavor: With an explosion that shook the foundation of the city, the *Weatherlight* burst from the underground hangar.

name: Puppet's Verdict
text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy all creatures with power 2 or less. If you lose the flip, destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.
flavor:
"What was heads again?"
—Mercadian magistrate

name: Robber Fly
text:
Flying
Whenever Robber Fly becomes blocked, defending player discards all the cards in their hand, then draws that many cards.
flavor: In pursuit of the juicy fly, Squee stumbled on the hidden hangar.

name: Seismic Mage
text: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target land.
flavor: The ground shakes when he walks. His customers shake if they're late with his fee.

name: Tectonic Break
text: Each player sacrifices X lands.
flavor: Only the foolish and the rich build their houses where the land is thin and the ocean is near.

name: Territorial Dispute
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Territorial Dispute unless you sacrifice a land.
Players can't play lands.
flavor: Bit by bit, Mercadia City had forced the Cho-Arrim from their ancestral lands. They would be pushed no further.

name: Uphill Battle
text: Creatures played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor: Cho-Manno knew he had no choice but to ally with Gerrard. If that's what it took to free his people, he'd pay the price.

name: Volcanic Wind
text: Volcanic Wind deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the number of creatures on the battlefield as you cast this spell.
flavor: The Cho-Arrim call it "the fury of Ramos."

name: Warmonger
text: {2}: Warmonger deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.
flavor: Funny how money and war travel so well together.

name: Warpath
text: Warpath deals 3 damage to each blocking creature and each blocked creature.
flavor: Cho-Manno had never seen Mercadia City's forces fight so well. The magistrate must have hired a new hero.

name: Wild Jhovall
flavor: Jhovalls sharpen their claws on trees—or on Mercadians, if no trees are handy.

name: Boa Constrictor
text: {T}: Boa Constrictor gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: Its eyes are bigger than its stomach, but its mouth is larger still.

name: Briar Patch
text: Whenever a creature attacks you, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
flavor: As easily as the dryads could close a fist, so could the branches and underbrush entangle.

name: Caustic Wasps
text:
Flying
Whenever Caustic Wasps deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.
flavor: Even the wasp knows how to pay the magistrate his due respect.

name: Dawnstrider
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
flavor: Morning's mists can hide many things.

name: Deepwood Drummer
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: His drums echo Deepwood's heartbeat.

name: Deepwood Elder
text: {X}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: X target lands become Forests until end of turn.
flavor: They'd guarded the Henge so long that they were as attuned to the powerstones as they were to the trees.

name: Deepwood Tantiv
text: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.
flavor: A single tantiv is just as dangerous as a herd.

name: Deepwood Wolverine
text: Whenever Deepwood Wolverine becomes blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The jhovalls are depleting its food sources, the Mercadians are eroding its home, and you're wondering why it's angry?

name: Erithizon
text: Whenever Erithizon attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of defending player's choice.
flavor: Unlike scorpions, the erithizon isn't immune to its own weaponry.

name: Ferocity
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor:
"You lot go on ahead. I'll keep killing them until it sticks."
—Tahngarth

name: Ley Line
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of their choice.
flavor:
"I can feel the strength of the entire forest."
—Gerrard

name: Lumbering Satyr
text: All creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor:
The satyr carves the path that all of Rushwood follows.
—Cho-Arrim saying

name: Pangosaur
text: Whenever a player plays a land, return Pangosaur to its owner's hand.
flavor: Only Rushwood is vast enough to swallow this creature whole.

name: Rushwood Herbalist
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Regenerate target creature.
flavor: When generals gather their armies, healers gather their herbs.

name: Saber Ants
text: Whenever Saber Ants is dealt damage, you may create that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
flavor: They stay on the battlefield only long enough to consume the losers.

name: Sacred Prey
text: Whenever Sacred Prey becomes blocked, you gain 1 life.
flavor: To see one is a good omen to the Cho-Arrim.

name: Snake Pit
text: Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell, you may create a 1/1 green Snake creature token.
flavor:
If the ground is smooth, the way will be rough.
—Deepwood saying

name: Snorting Gahr
text: Whenever Snorting Gahr becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: There's little advantage to surprising the gahr.

name: Spontaneous Generation
text: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each card in your hand.
flavor: Saprolings always thrive on the ruins of others, and Mercadia ruins more than most.

name: Sustenance
text: {1}, Sacrifice a land: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Like the dryads, the forest itself willingly gives up some of its life for the sake of the future.

name: Tiger Claws
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.
flavor: Cho-Arrim martial artists emulate the beasts of their home.

name: Venomous Breath
text: Choose target creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by it this turn.
flavor: The dryads need neither size nor strength to defeat their enemies in battle.

name: Venomous Dragonfly
text:
Flying
Whenever Venomous Dragonfly blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor: A pretty little death is still death.

name: Eye of Ramos
text:
{T}: Add {U}.
Sacrifice Eye of Ramos: Add {U}.
flavor: Ramos wept, and there were seas.

name: Heart of Ramos
text:
{T}: Add {R}.
Sacrifice Heart of Ramos: Add {R}.
flavor: Ramos bled, and there was fire.

name: Horn of Ramos
text:
{T}: Add {G}.
Sacrifice Horn of Ramos: Add {G}.
flavor: Ramos touched, and there was life.

name: Skull of Ramos
text:
{T}: Add {B}.
Sacrifice Skull of Ramos: Add {B}.
flavor: Ramos fell, and there was night.

name: Tooth of Ramos
text:
{T}: Add {W}.
Sacrifice Tooth of Ramos: Add {W}.
flavor: Ramos smiled, and there was day.

name: Ballyrush Banneret
text: Kithkin spells and Soldier spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: Only wool from the side of the springjack turned most often to the sun can be woven into kithkin battle standards. Jackherds record every movement of their woolly-jacks until shearing.

name: Battletide Alchemist
text: If a source would deal damage to a player, you may prevent X of that damage, where X is the number of Clerics you control.
flavor: "I do not heal. Healing means that the pain has already been felt. To stop suffering, one must prevent the world's wounds altogether."

name: Burrenton Shield-Bearers
text: Whenever Burrenton Shield-Bearers attacks, target creature gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: Soul and bones, kithkin are woven into their clans. They fight fiercely and without self-interest.

name: Cenn's Tactician
text:
{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target Soldier creature.
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it can block an additional creature each combat.
flavor: The choke point was the plan, but devoted camaraderie was always her strategy.

name: Changeling Sentinel
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Vigilance
flavor: There's nothing more unsettling than locking blades with something that looks just like you.

name: Forfend
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures this turn.
flavor:
"Suddenly there stood a fortress protecting the clachan, its walls hewn of valor and mortared with honor."
—*Clachan Tales*

name: Idyllic Tutor
text: Search your library for an enchantment card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor:
"If one's life is blessed, solutions to all life's problems will appear at the right moment."
—*The Book of Kith and Kin*

name: Indomitable Ancients
flavor:
"Odum and Broadbark were the only beings mighty enough to challenge the giant Moran the Destroyer. Their battle lasted a hundred dawns, until Moran became so exhausted that he fell into namesleep. He awoke as Moran the Gardener."
—*The Tale of Odum and Broadbark*

name: Preeminent Captain
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Preeminent Captain attacks, you may put a Soldier creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.
flavor: "If you need an example to lead others to the front lines, consider the precedent set."

name: Stonybrook Schoolmaster
text: Whenever Stonybrook Schoolmaster becomes tapped, you may create a 1/1 blue Merfolk Wizard creature token.
flavor: Merrow schools rarely form by design. They come together naturally as eager learners surround the wisest teachers.

name: Wandering Graybeard
text: Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Wandering Graybeard, you may reveal it. If you do, you gain 4 life.
flavor: His tales are as tall as he is, and only a giant's life is long enough to listen to them all.

name: Declaration of Naught
text:
As Declaration of Naught enters the battlefield, choose a card name.
{U}: Counter target spell with the chosen name.
flavor: Every story, even a faerie tale, comes to an end.

name: Dewdrop Spy
text:
Flash
Flying
When Dewdrop Spy enters the battlefield, look at the top card of target player's library.
flavor: Only in dew from Oona herself is there clarity enough to see a victim's mind.

name: Fencer Clique
text:
Flying
{U}: Put Fencer Clique on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
You may as well try to swat a faerie
—Flamekin expression meaning "that's impossible"

name: Merrow Witsniper
text: When Merrow Witsniper enters the battlefield, target player mills a card.
flavor: "The world above the waterline must be monitored—and, when necessary, adjusted."

name: Sage of Fables
text:
Each other Wizard creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: Draw a card.
flavor: "There is no secret that cannot be sold."

name: Sage's Dousing
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}. If you control a Wizard, draw a card.
flavor:
"Curse these merrows and their meddling! Since coming near the river, I can't so much as sneeze without being soaked."
—Ashling the Pilgrim

name: Sigil Tracer
text: {1}{U}, Tap two untapped Wizards you control: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor: "The reflection is true. It is you who are distorted and false."

name: Stonybrook Banneret
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Merfolk spells and Wizard spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: Made from trout scales and crawfish whiskers, merrows' shimmering banners flash in the water like lightning.

name: Stream of Unconsciousness
text: Target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn. If you control a Wizard, draw a card.
flavor: Dreams are tempting because one is so powerful in them. Dreams are dangerous because that power is a lie.

name: Fendeep Summoner
text: {T}: Up to two target Swamps each become 3/5 Treefolk Warrior creatures in addition to their other types until end of turn.
flavor: "What is drowned is not forgotten. I will fulfill my oath. Come back to me, my brethren, as I have come back for you."

name: Final-Sting Faerie
text:
Flying
When Final-Sting Faerie enters the battlefield, destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
flavor: Many heroes' last sight is a grin at the other end of a rapier.

name: Frogtosser Banneret
text:
Haste
Goblin spells and Rogue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: The Frogtossers thread feathers, bones, and trophies from past raids into their standards, believing they fuel the warren with the anger of its victims.

name: Maralen of the Mornsong
text:
Players can't draw cards.
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player loses 3 life, searches their library for a card, puts it into their hand, then shuffles.
flavor: Maralen sent Veesa, Endry, and Iliona—the Vendilion clique—on the gravest of tasks.

name: Pack's Disdain
text: Choose a creature type. Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each permanent of the chosen type you control.
flavor: Like the sun to a flower, the adoring gaze of the tribe is sustenance to an elf. To be shunned is to wither.

name: Prickly Boggart
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor:
"Even without the spines, who would dare to touch it?"
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Scarblade Elite
text: {T}, Exile an Assassin card from your graveyard: Destroy target creature.
flavor: "Rejoice, eyeblight. In your last hours above the earth, those who bury you will finally make you beautiful."

name: Stenchskipper
text:
Flying
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no Goblins, sacrifice Stenchskipper.
flavor:
"Many believe it to be the manifestation of all that is vile about the boggarts. I believe it should be avoided—from upwind, if possible."
—Cenn Deagan

name: Violet Pall
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. Create a 1/1 black Faerie Rogue creature token with flying.
flavor: A faerie is the offspring of Oona and mischief.

name: Weed-Pruner Poplar
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target creature other than Weed-Pruner Poplar gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"When Byoog reached down to pull up a bit of root for the stew, he didn't expect the root to pull back."
—A tale of Auntie Wort

name: Weirding Shaman
text: {3}{B}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Create two 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature tokens.
flavor: All boggarts have an auntie, but they don't all have a mum.

name: Boldwyr Heavyweights
text:
Trample
When Boldwyr Heavyweights enters the battlefield, each opponent may search their library for a creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then each player who searched their library this way shuffles.
flavor: Even if giants bring nothing else on a journey, they bring attention.

name: Brighthearth Banneret
text:
Elemental spells and Warrior spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Reinforce 1—{1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.)
flavor: The banner symbolizes the goodwill of the Brighthearth. Their emissaries bring the mastery of fire to other races.

name: Hostile Realm
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature can't block this turn."
flavor: Lorwyn's crust explodes with power when the greater elementals are born. The flamekin use the fallout as cover for forays into enemy territory.

name: Lunk Errant
text: Whenever Lunk Errant attacks alone, it gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: "One's plenty," observed the merrow. "Way too plenty," agreed the boggart.

name: Roar of the Crowd
text: Choose a creature type. Roar of the Crowd deals damage to any target equal to the number of permanents you control of the chosen type.
flavor: One voice is but a pebble to the rest of the world. A thousand voices at once is an avalanche.

name: Seething Pathblazer
text: Sacrifice an Elemental: Seething Pathblazer gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Flamekin death rites are elaborate and spectacular affairs. Their greatest fear is death in obscurity."
—Tollek Worldwatcher, journal

name: Sensation Gorger
text: Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Sensation Gorger, you may reveal it. If you do, each player discards their hand, then draws four cards.
flavor: More, more, more!

name: Shard Volley
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Shard Volley deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor: "Let the mountain's teeth pierce our oppressors."

name: Stingmoggie
text:
Stingmoggie enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{3}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Stingmoggie: Destroy target artifact or land.
flavor: A path vexed by the stingmoggie was probably the wrong path anyhow.

name: Sunflare Shaman
text: {1}{R}, {T}: Sunflare Shaman deals X damage to any target and X damage to itself, where X is the number of Elemental cards in your graveyard.
flavor: A spark to light the guttered heart.

name: Vengeful Firebrand
text:
Vengeful Firebrand has haste as long as a Warrior card is in your graveyard.
{R}: Vengeful Firebrand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The flame of a warrior is never extinguished.

name: Bosk Banneret
text: Treefolk spells and Shaman spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: Deep in a murmuring bosk, where the trees' memories span centuries, the simple banner of green and copper signifies an elder whose rings number more than a faerie's days.

name: Deglamer
text: Choose target artifact or enchantment. Its owner shuffles it into their library.
flavor: The more pleasant an illusion's garb, the more indecent its form laid bare.

name: Earthbrawn
text:
Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Reinforce 1—{1}{G} ({1}{G}, Discard this card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.)
flavor: Gremil finally felt in touch with nature—and felt a need to share the experience with others.

name: Everbark Shaman
text: {T}, Exile a Treefolk card from your graveyard: Search your library for up to two Forest cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: "May you rise again, from seed to sapling to sentience."

name: Gilt-Leaf Archdruid
text:
Whenever you cast a Druid spell, you may draw a card.
Tap seven untapped Druids you control: Gain control of all lands target player controls.
flavor: "In our hands, the natural world finds more beauty than nature alone could ever provide."

name: Greatbow Doyen
text:
Other Archer creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever an Archer you control deals damage to a creature, that Archer deals that much damage to that creature's controller.
flavor: "My arrows will ever find you."

name: Luminescent Rain
text: Choose a creature type. You gain 2 life for each permanent you control of that type.
flavor: Storms in Lorwyn don't patter on village rooftops, but rather drench the clachan in rays of amber light.

name: Orchard Warden
text: Whenever another Treefolk creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
flavor: "After the Rising, a treefolk's mind is as limber and green as its limbs, and is at its most receptive to our teachings."

name: Wolf-Skull Shaman
text: Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Wolf-Skull Shaman, you may reveal it. If you do, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
flavor: A chorus of howls answers his call.

name: Altar's Light
text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.
flavor:
"The altar does nothing; the device is crushed under the weight of its own impurity."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Auriok Bladewarden
text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is Auriok Bladewarden's power.
flavor: The Auriok have learned through constant struggle that allies are more precious than water.

name: Auriok Steelshaper
text:
Equip costs you pay cost {1} less.
As long as Auriok Steelshaper is equipped, each creature you control that's a Soldier or a Knight gets +1/+1.
flavor: They put their safety in his hands. He puts sharpened steel in theirs.

name: Auriok Transfixer
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target artifact.
flavor: "My grandfather knew enough spells to fill a hundred scrolls. Nowadays, if a spell cannot fight the levelers, it is not even taught to our young."

name: Awe Strike
text: The next time target creature would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
flavor: Stunned by the mere presence of the leonin kha, the nim raider quickly fell to its knees.

name: Leonin Den-Guard
text: As long as Leonin Den-Guard is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
flavor: No one under the four suns can elude the watchful eye of the den-guard.

name: Leonin Elder
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
flavor:
"The wisdom of the elders is just as much a weapon as a sword or spear. We must learn to wield it."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Loxodon Mender
text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.
flavor: The Auriok believe that in the hands of a loxodon, no weapon can be broken.

name: Loxodon Punisher
text: Loxodon Punisher gets +2/+2 for each Equipment attached to it.
flavor: The loxodons believe punishment comes in two steps: pain and atonement. They carry a weapon for each.

name: Second Sunrise
text: Each player returns to the battlefield all artifact, creature, enchantment, and land cards in their graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
flavor: The bright tunnel sometimes leads back to life.

name: Skyhunter Cub
text: As long as Skyhunter Cub is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.
flavor: Every young leonin wishes to become a skyhunter, for they soar closest to the suns.

name: Soul Nova
text: Exile target attacking creature and all Equipment attached to it.
flavor: Within seconds, the nim was consumed in blinding sunfire. Afterwards, only a puddle of molten iron remained.

name: Sphere of Purity
text: If an artifact would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
flavor: Purity rejects artifice.

name: Disarm
text: Unattach all Equipment from target creature.
flavor: "Be thankful I left you your clothes."

name: Domineer
text:
Enchant artifact creature
You control enchanted artifact creature.
flavor: Since they haven't seen their original master for millennia, golems are eager to take orders from anyone.

name: Inertia Bubble
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor:
"I wouldn't want you to hurt yourself."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Looming Hoverguard
text:
Flying
When Looming Hoverguard enters the battlefield, put target artifact on top of its owner's library.
flavor: Although mute, hoverguards get their message across loud and clear.

name: Lumengrid Augur
text: {1}, {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card. If that player discards an artifact card this way, untap Lumengrid Augur.
flavor: Information pumps like blood through vedalken society.

name: Neurok Spy
text: Neurok Spy can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact.
flavor: From the murk of Mephidross to the heart of Kuldotha, the vedalken send their servants forth to gather knowledge from every inch of Mirrodin.

name: Override
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each artifact you control.
flavor: "The Knowledge Pool has all the answers—especially 'No.'"

name: Psychic Membrane
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Psychic Membrane blocks, you may draw a card.
flavor: The vedalken always put their best thought forward.

name: Regress
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Once cast, a spell can be undone. But once revealed, a secret can never again be kept."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Dross Prowler
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor:
"I would never have believed that on a world with four suns there could exist a place so dark."
—Glissa Sunseeker

name: Irradiate
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each artifact you control.
flavor: The blast ignores the cage of metal but devours the flesh inside.

name: Moriok Scavenger
text: When Moriok Scavenger enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Many go to Mephidross in search of lost riches. Most end up as part of the cache.

name: Necrogen Mists
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player discards a card.
flavor: Mephidross filled with roars of fury and wails of despair as the leonin fought to keep their memories from being pulled into the mists.

name: Nim Lasher
text: Nim Lasher gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
flavor: The rotting metal feeds the necrogen mists, and in turn the mists feed the nim.

name: Nim Shambler
text:
Nim Shambler gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Nim Shambler.
flavor: Called "the Dross" by its inhabitants, Mephidross is home to the nim, Mirrodin's mindless, ravenous undead.

name: Nim Shrieker
text:
Flying
Nim Shrieker gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
flavor: As imps they were an annoyance. As nim they are a pestilence.

name: Relic Bane
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life."
flavor: A sword that has seen cowardice in battle exacts the price of honor from its wielder.

name: Slith Bloodletter
text:
Whenever Slith Bloodletter deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Slith Bloodletter.
flavor: Goblins fear the slith, believing they are children banished from the womb of the Steel Mother, deep within Kuldotha.

name: Terror
text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"A simple trap in a dark corner of the mind, and their nightmares catch up with them."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Vermiculos
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, Vermiculos gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
flavor: Mirrodin's artificial environment requires its own predators, scavengers, and senseless forces of nature.

name: Wall of Blood
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Pay 1 life: Wall of Blood gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Blood is thicker than mortar.

name: Arc-Slogger
text: {R}, Exile the top ten cards of your library: Arc-Slogger deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: A shuffling sound and the smell of ozone follow the slogger as surely as its electric tail.

name: Detonate
text: Destroy target artifact with mana value X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.
flavor: The goblins have forty-two different words for "ow."

name: Electrostatic Bolt
text: Electrostatic Bolt deals 2 damage to target creature. If it's an artifact creature, Electrostatic Bolt deals 4 damage to it instead.
flavor: It's hard to avoid electric shock when the entire plane is metallic.

name: Goblin Striker
text: First strike, haste
flavor: There's no word in the goblin language for "strategy." Then again, there's no word in the goblin language for "word."

name: Krark-Clan Grunt
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Grunt gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: The more weapons a goblin breaks in battle, the more respected he becomes.

name: Krark-Clan Shaman
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Shaman deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor: "What do you mean, we're out of stuff to melt down? Give me your leg."

name: Mass Hysteria
text: All creatures have haste.
flavor: The sooner you see the whites of their eyes, the sooner you'll spill the red of their blood.

name: Megatog
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Megatog gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: In an ironic bit of evolution, the megatog's dozens of teeth are mainly ornamental. It prefers swallowing things whole.

name: Ogre Leadfoot
text: Whenever Ogre Leadfoot becomes blocked by an artifact creature, destroy that creature.
flavor: When the goblins need more scrap for the Great Furnace, they simply let the ogres loose and follow in their wake.

name: Rustmouth Ogre
text: Whenever Rustmouth Ogre deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.
flavor: It has an iron stomach. Literally.

name: Vulshok Battlemaster
text:
Haste
When Vulshok Battlemaster enters the battlefield, attach all Equipment on the battlefield to it. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)
flavor: "I could demonstrate how the leonin sunsplicer works, but then you'd be too dead to buy one."

name: Battlegrowth
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor: "I would gladly die for the forest, but I'm much better at killing for it."

name: Bloodscent
text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
flavor: To study the predators of the Tangle, two people are required: one to watch from above, and one to run like hell.

name: Copperhoof Vorrac
text: Copperhoof Vorrac gets +1/+1 for each untapped permanent your opponents control.
flavor: Like all forest beasts, it lives by one rule: if there's no room to grow, make some.

name: Deconstruct
text: Destroy target artifact. Add {G}{G}{G}.
flavor: "Nothing in this world, not even magic, likes to be caged."

name: Fangren Hunter
text: Trample
flavor: Big ones hunt the elves, so the elves hunt the small ones to keep them from getting big.

name: Glissa Sunseeker
text:
First strike
{T}: Destroy target artifact if its mana value is equal to the amount of unspent mana you have.
flavor: "There's a secret at the heart of this world, and I will unlock it."

name: Groffskithur
text: Whenever Groffskithur becomes blocked, you may return target card named Groffskithur from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: It growls not to threaten, but to summon.

name: Hum of the Radix
text: Each artifact spell costs {1} more to cast for each artifact its controller controls.
flavor: The elves learned long ago that anything left here slowly vanishes. Now it is a sacred site where the dead are laid to rest and where unnatural magic is erased forever.

name: Molder Slug
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact.
flavor: Fortunately for it, Mirrodin is a plane without salt.

name: Predator's Strike
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: If you hear it coming, you're not its prey.

name: Slith Predator
text:
Trample
Whenever Slith Predator deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Born amid the molten metal of the Great Furnace, the slith have more than adapted to the perils of a metal world.

name: Tel-Jilad Archers
text: Protection from artifacts; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: They are extensions of the Tangle, stretching its vines into the furthest reaches of the sky.

name: Tel-Jilad Chosen
text: Protection from artifacts
flavor: "It is my honor to keep safe Tel-Jilad's secrets, not to know them."

name: Tel-Jilad Exile
text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Tel-Jilad Exile.
flavor: For his crimes, he was made to forget all the trolls' secrets. Now he knows only that he is outcast, but not why.

name: Trolls of Tel-Jilad
text: {1}{G}: Regenerate target green creature.
flavor: "The secret of this world weighs upon us, and we have been shaped by time and duty to bear it."

name: Turn to Dust
text: Destroy target Equipment. Add {G}.
flavor: Mirrodin's inhabitants must be prepared for anything—including suddenly being unprepared.

name: Viridian Joiner
text: {T}: Add an amount of {G} equal to Viridian Joiner's power.
flavor: "The Tangle reaches out to itself constantly, forming new connections. We must follow its example."

name: Wurmskin Forger
text: When Wurmskin Forger enters the battlefield, distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures.
flavor: It takes three weeks for a patrol of hunters to down a slagwurm. It takes just as long to make a single cut in its hide.

name: Cobalt Golem
text: {1}{U}: Cobalt Golem gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Centuries before the first tides of the Quicksilver Sea rose to meet each new sun, Mirrodin's light shone on the golems alone.

name: Elf Replica
text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Elf Replica: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor: It hunts with unnerving ferocity.

name: Goblin Replica
text: {3}{R}, Sacrifice Goblin Replica: Destroy target artifact.
flavor: It destroys with unthinking glee.

name: Granite Shard
text: {3}, {T} or {R}, {T}: Granite Shard deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: It's a piece of a world the goblins have never seen but would dearly like to blow up.

name: Heartwood Shard
text: {3}, {T} or {G}, {T}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: Like all other relics, it was left on the Radix by the elves to be destroyed. Unlike all other relics, it persisted.

name: Hematite Golem
text: {1}{R}: Hematite Golem gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Centuries before the first peaks of the Oxidda Chain rewrote the laws of magnetism, the golems patrolled Mirrodin's featureless surface unhindered.

name: Leonin Sun Standard
text: {1}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The commander tells the troops where to go, but the standard reminds them why they're there.

name: Lifespark Spellbomb
text:
{G}, Sacrifice Lifespark Spellbomb: Until end of turn, target land becomes a 3/3 creature that's still a land.
{1}, Sacrifice Lifespark Spellbomb: Draw a card.
flavor:
"Awaken that which was never asleep."
—Spellbomb inscription

name: Malachite Golem
text: {1}{G}: Malachite Golem gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: Centuries before the first branches of the Tangle gave shelter from the suns' cold light, the shadows of golems were Mirrodin's only shade.

name: Necrogen Spellbomb
text:
{B}, Sacrifice Necrogen Spellbomb: Target player discards a card.
{1}, Sacrifice Necrogen Spellbomb: Draw a card.
flavor:
"Forget that which was never known."
—Spellbomb inscription

name: Nim Replica
text: {2}{B}, Sacrifice Nim Replica: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: It kills with unfeeling malice.

name: Pearl Shard
text: {3}, {T} or {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: Leonin folktales claim it was brought from beyond the sky by the first kha.

name: Pewter Golem
text: {1}{B}: Regenerate Pewter Golem.
flavor: Centuries before the first chimneys of Mephidross belched clouds of toxic gas, only the golems' movements stirred the air of Mirrodin.

name: Soldier Replica
text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Soldier Replica: It deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: It fights with inhuman vigor.

name: Sunbeam Spellbomb
text:
{W}, Sacrifice Sunbeam Spellbomb: You gain 5 life.
{1}, Sacrifice Sunbeam Spellbomb: Draw a card.
flavor:
"Cure that which was never ill."
—Spellbomb inscription

name: Tangleroot
text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, that player adds {G}.
flavor: As if there's glitch in the system, the Tangle sometimes folds in on itself, throwing off sparks of mana in a mystifying display.

name: Titanium Golem
text: {1}{W}: Titanium Golem gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Centuries before the first blades of the Razor Fields chimed in the wind, Mirrodin echoed with the golems' footsteps.

name: Angelic Sleuth
text:
Flying
Whenever another permanent you control leaves the battlefield, if it had counters on it, investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: Some crime scenes' secrets can only be discerned from an angel's-eye view.

name: Damning Verdict
text: Destroy all creatures with no counters on them.
flavor: "Guilty as charged!"

name: Grand Crescendo
text: Create X 1/1 green and white Citizen creature tokens. Creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
flavor: The roar of applause drowned out the melee raging in the lobby.

name: Jailbreak
text: Return target permanent card in an opponent's graveyard to the battlefield under their control. When that permanent enters the battlefield, return up to one target permanent card with equal or lesser mana value from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: Obscura spies rarely stay locked up long enough to make it to trial.

name: Smuggler's Share
text: At the beginning of each end step, draw a card for each opponent who drew two or more cards this turn, then create a Treasure token for each opponent who had two or more lands enter the battlefield under their control this turn.
flavor: One way or another, everyone gets paid what they're owed.

name: Cephalid Facetaker
text:
Cephalid Facetaker can't be blocked.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may have Cephalid Facetaker become a copy of another target creature until end of turn, except it's 1/4 and has "This creature can't be blocked."
flavor: Few think to look past a familiar face and a friendly smile.

name: Extravagant Replication
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, create a token that's a copy of another target nonland permanent you control.
flavor: "Just one aether tiger? What do I look like, a peasant?"

name: Storm of Forms
text:
When you cast this spell, copy it for each kind of counter among permanents you control. You may choose new targets for the copies.
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: Beware the fine print.

name: Bellowing Mauler
text: At the beginning of your end step, each player loses 4 life unless they sacrifice a nontoken creature.
flavor: He's pretty sure he can't get charged with murder if he calls it "organic demolition."

name: Body Count
text:
Spectacle {B} (You may cast this spell for its spectacle cost rather than its mana cost if an opponent lost life this turn.)
Draw a card for each creature that died under your control this turn.
flavor: "Your friends stayed quiet, and look what happened to them. You feeling a little more talkative yet?"

name: Make an Example
text: Each opponent separates the creatures they control into two piles. For each opponent, you choose one of their piles. Each opponent sacrifices the creatures in their chosen pile. (Piles can be empty.)
flavor: As the Adversary's influence grew, the conflicts between families escalated.

name: Determined Iteration
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, populate. The token created this way gains haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step. (To populate, create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
flavor: "Only a fool believes they have nothing left to learn."

name: Bribe Taker
text:
Trample
When Bribe Taker enters the battlefield, for each kind of counter on permanents you control, you may put your choice of a +1/+1 counter or a counter of that kind on Bribe Taker.
flavor: In New Capenna, it's survival of the richest.

name: Crash the Party
text: Create a tapped 4/4 green Rhino Warrior creature token for each tapped creature you control.
flavor: The profits from that night barely paid for the damages.

name: Bennie Bracks, Zoologist
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
At the beginning of each end step, if you created a token this turn, draw a card.
flavor: His enthusiastic curiosity puts even the most fearsome of beasts at ease.

name: Spiteful Repossession
text: Spiteful Repossession deals damage to each opponent who controls more lands than you equal to the difference. Then create a number of Treasure tokens equal to the damage dealt this way.
flavor: Late payment shall be extracted however they see fit.

name: Declaration in Stone
text: Exile target creature and all other creatures its controller controls with the same name as that creature. That player investigates for each nontoken creature exiled this way.
flavor: The message was clear to Sorin—Nahiri had paid Markov Manor a visit.

name: Luminarch Aspirant
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
flavor: "Rally to my light, and together we will drive out this darkness!"

name: Looter il-Kor
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Looter il-Kor deals damage to an opponent, draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: Unable to touch items of value, he goes forth to steal secrets instead.

name: Evolution Sage
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
flavor: "To care for yourself, cultivate the world. To care for the world, cultivate yourself."

name: Evolutionary Leap
text: {G}, Sacrifice a creature: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
flavor: The essence of nature is change.

name: Scute Swarm
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, create a 1/1 green Insect creature token. If you control six or more lands, create a token that's a copy of Scute Swarm instead.
flavor:
"Survival rule 782: There are *always* more scute bugs."
—Zurdi, goblin shortcutter

name: Treeshaker Chimera
text:
All creatures able to block Treeshaker Chimera do so.
When Treeshaker Chimera dies, draw three cards.
flavor: The wisdom of the past is written on the bones of ancients.

name: World Shaper
text:
Whenever World Shaper attacks, you may mill three cards.
When World Shaper dies, return all land cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
flavor: "The Great River will not be tamed."

name: Drumbellower
text:
Flying
Untap all creatures you control during each other player's untap step.
flavor: By the second night after the kami had drifted into town, the local general store was completely sold out of earplugs.

name: Ironsoul Enforcer
text: Whenever Ironsoul Enforcer or a commander you control attacks alone, return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "You break it, you buy it. You steal it, I find it."

name: Organic Extinction
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Destroy all nonartifact creatures.
flavor:
"Technology evolves faster than a blade can swing."
—Arima, lead inventor of the Futurists

name: Release to Memory
text: Exile target opponent's graveyard. For each creature card exiled this way, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token.
flavor:
"Those who have passed are beyond war, beyond suffering. Mourn them, envy them, but above all, remember them."
—Light-Paws, Imperial advisor

name: Swift Reconfiguration
text:
Flash
Enchant creature or Vehicle
Enchanted permanent is a Vehicle artifact with crew 5 and it loses all other card types. (It's not a creature unless it's crewed.)
flavor: On the bright side, the bear now had cupholders.

name: Access Denied
text: Counter target spell. Create X 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying, where X is that spell's mana value.
flavor: The Saiba Futurists guard their secret experiments with ever-evolving networks of cutting-edge defensive technology.

name: Imposter Mech
text:
You may have Imposter Mech enter the battlefield as a copy of a creature an opponent controls, except it's a Vehicle artifact with crew 3 and it loses all other card types.
Crew 3
flavor: The best way to fight evil is with its own weapons.

name: Research Thief
text:
Flash
Flying
Whenever an artifact creature you control deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
flavor: The Futurists eagerly supplement their research with their rivals' closely guarded secrets.

name: Universal Surveillance
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Draw X cards.
flavor: Few outside the Saiba Futurists know the true extent of their data-extraction network.

name: Ascendant Acolyte
text:
Ascendant Acolyte enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each +1/+1 counter among other creatures you control.
At the beginning of your upkeep, double the number of +1/+1 counters on Ascendant Acolyte.
flavor: "Limits exist solely to test the will."

name: Yoshimaru, Ever Faithful
text:
Whenever another legendary permanent enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Yoshimaru, Ever Faithful.
Partner (You can have two commanders if both have partner.)
flavor: Day after day he sat there, knowing that the Wanderer would soon be back for him.

name: Chieftain en-Dal
text: Whenever Chieftain en-Dal attacks, attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor: The clearest commands are practical examples.

name: Fanatical Devotion
text: Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate target creature.
flavor: The Oracle told Eladamri he would save his people by abandoning them. His followers adopted that ideal.

name: Lashknife
text:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
flavor: Those it won't scare, it scars.

name: Lawbringer
text: {T}, Sacrifice Lawbringer: Exile target red creature.
flavor:
One injustice starts a thousand riots. One law stops a thousand crimes.
—Lawbringer creed

name: Lightbringer
text: {T}, Sacrifice Lightbringer: Exile target black creature.
flavor:
One thought opens a thousand eyes. One sun brings a thousand dawns.
—Lightbringer creed

name: Netter en-Dal
text: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature can't attack this turn.
flavor: The wizard's vocabulary of mogg profanities increased with every net she cast.

name: Noble Stand
text: Whenever a creature you control blocks, you gain 2 life.
flavor: Soldiers will always endanger their lives to defend many other lives.

name: Off Balance
text: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
flavor: A heavy weapon deals plenty of damage—but it does have to hit.

name: Silkenfist Fighter
text: Whenever Silkenfist Fighter becomes blocked, untap it.
flavor: Simple wooden staff Made from life, protecting life, Stronger than cold steel.

name: Silkenfist Order
text: Whenever Silkenfist Order becomes blocked, untap it.
flavor: Hands weave life and death; Intertwining spirits knit Tapestries and shrouds.

name: Spiritual Asylum
text:
Creatures and lands you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
When a creature you control attacks, sacrifice Spiritual Asylum.
flavor: Trapped in safety is still trapped.

name: Topple
text: Exile target creature with the greatest power among creatures on the battlefield. (If two or more creatures are tied for greatest power, target any one of them.)
flavor:
"Let all witness the fate of those who defy me."
—Crovax

name: Voice of Truth
text: Flying, protection from white
flavor:
"Above them all is Truth, and Truth must be set free. If the wings of Truth are clipped, the voices will fall silent."
—*Song of All*, canto 167

name: Aether Barrier
text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {1}.
flavor:
"Creatures fade in and out of existence. It's an unfortunate side effect. The losses are tolerable."
—Belbe

name: Air Bladder
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: Random mutations among Rootwater merfolk were common—and disturbing.

name: Ensnare
text:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Tap all creatures.
flavor: Rootwater has become as dangerous to its denizens as to its enemies.

name: Infiltrate
text: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
flavor: Getting in was the easy part. Getting out proved to be more difficult.

name: Oraxid
text: Protection from red
flavor:
"I'm constantly amazed by the tenacity of living creatures on this plane. Even in the stronghold's white-hot core, life persists."
—Ertai

name: Pale Moon
text: Until end of turn, if a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.
flavor: Denizens of Rath had never seen the moon before. It was a symbol of change, not constancy.

name: Rising Waters
text:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land they control.
flavor: Rising waters, sinking hope.

name: Seahunter
text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Merfolk permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: "They can't feel pain. They just wiggle 'cause they're scared."

name: Sliptide Serpent
text: {3}{U}: Return Sliptide Serpent to its owner's hand.
flavor: It's futile to fight something you can see only in the corner of your eye.

name: Stronghold Biologist
text: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target creature spell.
flavor: He twists the laws of nature until they scream.

name: Stronghold Machinist
text: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target noncreature spell.
flavor: She stretches the laws of physics until they snap.

name: Stronghold Zeppelin
text:
Flying
Stronghold Zeppelin can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: As long as the stronghold controlled the sky, the rebels were doomed.

name: Trickster Mage
text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor: "If it ain't broke, I'll break it. If it *is* broke, I'll fix it."

name: Wandering Eye
text:
Flying
Players play with their hands revealed.
flavor: The evincar has many ways of keeping track of his subjects.

name: Belbe's Percher
text:
Flying
Belbe's Percher can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: Long and powerful, these birds were used to carry messages to and from the evincar.

name: Dark Triumph
text:
If you control a Swamp, you may sacrifice a creature rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: All that's left is the coronation.

name: Phyrexian Driver
text: When Phyrexian Driver enters the battlefield, other Mercenary creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Although the abuse was initially effective, the troops soon became numb to it.

name: Spiteful Bully
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Spiteful Bully deals 3 damage to target creature you control.
flavor: Like most creatures bent on total destruction, they rarely bother to double-check their targets.

name: Volrath the Fallen
text: {1}{B}, Discard a creature card: Volrath the Fallen gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the discarded card's mana value.
flavor: "I stepped out. I did not step down."

name: Bola Warrior
text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature can't block this turn.
flavor: The ingredients for panic include equal parts danger, uncertainty, and helplessness.

name: Flowstone Overseer
text: {R}{R}: Target creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: The rebels couldn't see where the roar was coming from. Then they saw it was coming from everywhere.

name: Flowstone Strike
text: Target creature gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: Aggression exacts its toll.

name: Flowstone Surge
text: Creatures you control get +1/-1.
flavor: The army was never at a loss for weapons; Crovax was their forge.

name: Flowstone Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Flowstone Wall gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: The rebels assaulted the wall, never suspecting the wall would assault back.

name: Laccolith Grunt
text: Whenever Laccolith Grunt becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Grunt assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor: They leave a trail of ash and sorrow.

name: Laccolith Titan
text: Whenever Laccolith Titan becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Titan assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor: Proximity guarantees injury or death.

name: Laccolith Warrior
text: Whenever Laccolith Warrior becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Warrior assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor: The screams are brief. The silence lingers.

name: Laccolith Whelp
text: Whenever Laccolith Whelp becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Whelp assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor: They don't feed; they stoke.

name: Mogg Alarm
text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
flavor: They make mountains into mogg holes.

name: Moggcatcher
text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Goblin permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: "They're not worth much, but they're easy to catch."

name: Rupture
text: Sacrifice a creature. Rupture deals damage equal to that creature's power to each creature without flying and each player.
flavor: All creatures have an inner fire. Releasing it can be dangerous.

name: Shrieking Mogg
text:
Haste
When Shrieking Mogg enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
flavor: You have to admire its enthusiasm.

name: Animate Land
text: Until end of turn, target land becomes a 3/3 creature that's still a land.
flavor: Irony is getting walked on by the earth instead of the other way around.

name: Coiling Woodworm
text: Coiling Woodworm's power is equal to the number of Forests on the battlefield.
flavor: Only the elves know where the woods end and the woodworm begins.

name: Fog Patch
text:
Cast this spell only during the declare blockers step.
Attacking creatures become blocked. (This spell works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
flavor: Realizing they weren't getting past the fog, the elves did the only thing they could do: wait.

name: Harvest Mage
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Until end of turn, if you tap a land for mana, it produces one mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type and amount.
flavor: "Why should one limit oneself to the resources at hand?"

name: Mossdog
text: Whenever Mossdog becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, put a +1/+1 counter on Mossdog.
flavor: The more you look at it, the more dangerous it becomes.

name: Overlaid Terrain
text:
As Overlaid Terrain enters the battlefield, sacrifice all lands you control.
Lands you control have "{T}: Add two mana of any one color."
flavor: One must reap before one can sow.

name: Pack Hunt
text: Search your library for up to three cards with the same name as target creature, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: The one you see is just a diversion.

name: Skyshroud Poacher
text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for an Elf permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: "It's OK. They're just elves."

name: Wild Mammoth
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player controls more creatures than each other player, the player who controls the most creatures gains control of Wild Mammoth.
flavor: "Sit. Heel! Down! HELP!"

name: Banishing Slash
text: Destroy up to one target artifact, enchantment, or tapped creature. Then if you control an artifact and an enchantment, create a 2/2 white Samurai creature token with vigilance.
flavor: "In the name of Kyodai, begone!"

name: Befriending the Moths // Imperial Moth
text: Flying
flavor:
"The moths of Eiganjo were once no different from any other great beast of Kamigawa's wilds. It took years of patience and dedication to convince them to bear riders."
—*History of the Empire*

name: Blade-Blizzard Kitsune
text:
Ninjutsu {3}{W} ({3}{W}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Double strike
flavor: In the time it takes most to master one blade, he mastered two.

name: Brilliant Restoration
text: Return all artifact and enchantment cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"We have done our best to heal this land together, but now I must entrust the future to my sister. She will carry our dreams onward into the sunrise."
—Michiko Konda's journal

name: Dragonfly Suit
text:
Flying
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)
flavor: Cutting-edge Imperial sentinel mechs patrol the skies over Eiganjo.

name: Eiganjo Exemplar
text: Whenever a Samurai or Warrior you control attacks alone, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Imperial samurai undergo strict training, honing their skills and purifying their spirits in the hope that they will prove worthy of a kami's blessing.

name: Era of Enlightenment // Hand of Enlightenment
text: First strike
flavor:
"We have endured lifetimes of war and carved our way to peace by blade and conquest. Now, united at last under Kyodai's guidance, we lay down our weapons and open our minds."
—Aoha, general of the First Emperor

name: The Fall of Lord Konda // Fragment of Konda
text:
Defender
When Fragment of Konda dies, draw a card.
flavor: For his transgressions against the kami, Lord Konda's immortal body was turned to stone, then shattered into a thousand still-living pieces.

name: Go-Shintai of Shared Purpose
text:
Vigilance
At the beginning of your end step, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token for each Shrine you control.
flavor: It seeks those who act with kindness and offers friendship.

name: Golden-Tail Disciple
text: Lifelink
flavor: Students of the kitsune-led Golden-Tail Academy in Eiganjo are unparalleled in both martial skill and dedication to the Imperial cause.

name: Imperial Oath
text: Create three 2/2 white Samurai creature tokens with vigilance. Scry 3.
flavor: Those chosen to guard the Imperial Palace are not only unrivaled warriors but also lionhearted champions of the Imperial cause.

name: Imperial Subduer
text: Whenever a Samurai or Warrior you control attacks alone, tap target creature you don't control.
flavor: "Cease your pathetic struggling."

name: Light the Way
text:
Choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or Vehicle. Untap it.
• Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: "That way lies death. This way, a chance."

name: Lucky Offering
text: Destroy target artifact with mana value 3 or less. You gain 3 life.
flavor: The playful kami reserved its greatest blessings for those who brought not wealth or rare delicacies, but particularly amusing trinkets.

name: Michiko's Reign of Truth // Portrait of Michiko
text: Portrait of Michiko gets +1/+1 for each artifact and/or enchantment you control.
flavor: Long ago, as the first mortal to bond with Kyodai, Michiko Konda brought an end to the Kami War and guided Kamigawa into an age of truth and harmony.

name: Mothrider Patrol
text:
Flying
{3}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor:
"Be proud, young pup! You've earned your wings. Rise and become the western wind."
—Swift-Arm, Golden-Tail headmaster

name: Norika Yamazaki, the Poet
text:
Vigilance
Whenever a Samurai or Warrior you control attacks alone, you may cast target enchantment card from your graveyard this turn.
flavor: "The blades will have their say, but peace is built with words."

name: Regent's Authority
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's an enchantment creature or legendary creature, instead put a +1/+1 counter on it and it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Before her spark pulled her away again, the Emperor appointed the wise Light-Paws to guide Kamigawa in her absence.

name: Repel the Vile
text:
Choose one —
• Exile target creature with power 4 or greater.
• Exile target enchantment.
flavor:
"You are a guest in this realm, and you've overstayed your welcome."
—Yui, Imperial intercessor

name: The Restoration of Eiganjo // Architect of Restoration
text:
Vigilance
Whenever Architect of Restoration attacks or blocks, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token.
flavor:
"A visionary looks at rubble and sees not only what was, but also what could be."
—Onyx-Eye, architect of Eiganjo

name: Seven-Tail Mentor
text: When Seven-Tail Mentor enters the battlefield or dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or Vehicle you control.
flavor: "I have taught you all I can. Take this blade and rise as my equal."

name: Sky-Blessed Samurai
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each enchantment you control.
Flying
flavor: Imperial samurai who show exceptional honor and dexterity are invited to train as mothriders, elite guards charged with protecting the skies of Eiganjo.

name: Wanderer's Intervention
text: Wanderer's Intervention deals 4 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: Just as Jin-Gitaxias's victory seemed certain, the Wanderer appeared, her blade already in motion. One mighty slash was enough to take the praetor out of the fight.

name: When We Were Young
text: Up to two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn. If you control an artifact and an enchantment, those creatures also gain lifelink until end of turn.
flavor: Since Imperial custom strictly forbade the Emperor to reveal her name—even to Kaito, her closest childhood friend—she had to suffer him calling her "your emperorness" for much of their shared youth.

name: Acquisition Octopus
text:
Whenever Acquisition Octopus or equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
Reconfigure {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control; or unattach from a creature. Reconfigure only as a sorcery. While attached, this isn't a creature.)
flavor: You can never have too many arms.

name: Anchor to Reality
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Search your library for an Equipment or Vehicle card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle. If it has mana value less than the sacrificed permanent's mana value, scry 2.
flavor: The Wanderer sighed in relief as the Reality Chip tethered her wayward spark to Kamigawa.

name: Behold the Unspeakable // Vision of the Unspeakable
text:
Flying, trample
Vision of the Unspeakable gets +1/+1 for each card in your hand.
flavor: Even as her students' minds succumbed to madness, Azami's obsession with the kami of forbidden knowledge only grew.

name: Disruption Protocol
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, tap an untapped artifact you control or pay {1}.
Counter target spell.
flavor: "Let's just turn that off, shall we?"

name: Essence Capture
text: Counter target creature spell. Put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature you control.
flavor: The Futurists regard the tradition of kami-bonding as anachronistic and inefficient, striving constantly to surpass spiritual power with technology.

name: Futurist Operative
text:
As long as Futurist Operative is tapped, it's a Human Citizen with base power and toughness 1/1 and can't be blocked.
{2}{U}: Untap Futurist Operative.
flavor: "The Imperials can't arrest you for illegal tech if you never even existed."

name: Futurist Sentinel
text: Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)
flavor:
"I folded a model in paper first to test the relative tensile strength of the plates."
—Katsumasa, the Animator

name: Go-Shintai of Lost Wisdom
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, you may pay {1}. When you do, target player mills X cards, where X is the number of Shrines you control. (To mill a card, a player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.)
flavor: It seeks those driven by curiosity and offers enlightenment.

name: Guardians of Oboro
text:
Defender
Modified creatures you control can attack as though they didn't have defender. (Equipment, Auras you control, and counters are modifications.)
flavor: "The palace is closed to outsiders."

name: Inventive Iteration // Living Breakthrough
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell, your opponents can't cast spells with the same mana value as that spell until your next turn.
flavor:
"While they squabble below, let us rise above."
—Emire, director of the Saiba Futurists

name: Invoke the Winds
text: Gain control of target artifact or creature. Untap it.
flavor:
"Are you seriously telling me your heavy combat mech . . . blew away?"
—Risona, leader of the Asari Uprisers

name: The Modern Age // Vector Glider
text: Flying
flavor: It drifted from the spirit realm into a neon world full of new possibilities . . . and decided to stay.

name: Network Disruptor
text:
Flying
When Network Disruptor enters the battlefield, tap target permanent.
flavor: "Just as I suspected. They thought they'd hidden the terminal, so they got lazy with the encryption."

name: Planar Incision
text: Exile target artifact or creature, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Jin-Gitaxias had long coveted the secrets of planeswalking. Spirits that could pass between worlds made for perfect test subjects.

name: Reality Heist
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.
Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may reveal up to two artifact cards from among them and put them into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
flavor: Kaito grabbed the chip, hoping it held answers.

name: Replication Specialist
text:
Flying
Whenever a nontoken artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, create a token that's a copy of that artifact.
flavor: "Step one is innovation. Step two is production. Sometimes step one is optional."

name: Saiba Trespassers
text: Channel — {3}{U}, Discard Saiba Trespassers: Tap up to two target creatures you don't control. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
flavor: One to clear the way, another to erase their trail.

name: Skyswimmer Koi
text:
Flying
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
flavor: Once they swam alone among the clouds, but now the people of Kamigawa have built high enough to reach them.

name: Suit Up
text:
Until end of turn, target creature or Vehicle becomes an artifact creature with base power and toughness 4/5.
Draw a card.
flavor: With a reckless leap into the pilot's seat, Hirori went from smallest kid on the block to biggest hero in the city.

name: Assassin's Ink
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control an artifact and {1} less to cast if you control an enchantment.
Destroy target creature or planeswalker.
flavor: A Reckoner always has another trick up their sleeve—or as their sleeve.

name: Clawing Torment
text:
Enchant artifact or creature
As long as enchanted permanent is a creature, it gets -1/-1 and can't block.
Enchanted permanent has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life."
flavor: A kami's anger never fades, never sleeps, never loosens its grasp.

name: Debt to the Kami
text:
Choose one —
• Target opponent exiles a creature they control.
• Target opponent exiles an enchantment they control.
flavor: The masters weren't speaking figuratively when they said guilt could be all-consuming.

name: Dockside Chef
text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice an artifact or creature: Draw a card.
flavor: The squirming is how you know it's fresh.

name: Dokuchi Shadow-Walker
text: Ninjutsu {3}{B} ({3}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
flavor: Don't fear the blade, fear the shadows.

name: Enormous Energy Blade
text:
Equipped creature gets +4/+0.
Whenever Enormous Energy Blade becomes attached to a creature, tap that creature.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
flavor: "Heavy? Maybe for you."

name: Go-Shintai of Hidden Cruelty
text:
Deathtouch
At the beginning of your end step, you may pay {1}. When you do, destroy target creature with toughness X or less, where X is the number of Shrines you control.
flavor: It seeks those with hate in their hearts and offers vengeance.

name: Gravelighter
text:
Flying
When Gravelighter enters the battlefield, draw a card if a creature died this turn. Otherwise, each player sacrifices a creature.
flavor: It appears only to those whose lives are ending, welcoming them to their fate.

name: Inkrise Infiltrator
text:
Flying
{3}{B}: Inkrise Infiltrator gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: "They can't follow your footprints if you never touch the ground."

name: Invoke Despair
text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. If they can't, they lose 2 life and you draw a card. Then repeat this process for an enchantment and a planeswalker.
flavor: Although officials said it was a sewer failure, the people whispered that it was a warning of night's reach.

name: Kaito's Pursuit
text: Target player discards two cards. Ninjas and Rogues you control gain menace until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: Kaito knew every rooftop in the city, and closed in quickly on his quarry—but he knew nothing of the Planar Bridge until it was already too late.

name: Kami of Terrible Secrets
text: When Kami of Terrible Secrets enters the battlefield, if you control an artifact and an enchantment, you draw a card and you gain 1 life.
flavor: It feeds on things better left unknown, savoring the bitterness of lies and regrets.

name: Life of Toshiro Umezawa // Memory of Toshiro
text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add {B}. Spend this mana only to cast an instant or sorcery spell.
flavor:
"Some called him the hero of the Kami War, others a selfish thief. As ever, the truth is hidden somewhere in between."
—Reki, founder of the Living Historians

name: The Long Reach of Night // Animus of Night's Reach
text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever Animus of Night's Reach attacks, it gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in defending player's graveyard.
flavor: The dark myojin's gifts were instrumental in ending the Kami War.

name: Malicious Malfunction
text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn. If a creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
flavor:
"That? A minor test, nothing more. Incompleat flesh is weak."
—Jin-Gitaxias

name: Mukotai Ambusher
text:
Ninjutsu {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Lifelink
flavor: The Mukotai Reckoners specialize in stealth and subterfuge.

name: Nezumi Bladeblesser
text:
Nezumi Bladeblesser has deathtouch as long as you control an artifact.
Nezumi Bladeblesser has menace as long as you control an enchantment. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: "It's not one or the other, kami or technology. Both offer power. I will not limit myself."

name: Okiba Reckoner Raid // Nezumi Road Captain
text:
Menace
Vehicles you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: United by defiant pride in their outsider status, the nezumi of the Okiba Reckoners boast the most advanced cyberbikes and the best riders of all the Reckoner gangs.

name: Okiba Salvage
