flavor: The spirits of fallen battlemages can serve their guilds as familiars by joining with any physical form.

name: Confound
text:
Counter target spell that targets a creature.
Draw a card.
flavor: "Did I know Szat would betray us?" Urza asked quizzically. "I was counting on it."

name: Ertai's Trickery
text: Counter target spell if it was kicked.
flavor: "Don't worry, Gerrard," said Ertai. "I'm sure the crew will come to your rescue as quickly as they came to mine."

name: Escape Routes
text: {2}{U}: Return target white or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"I'll get you to safety—or whatever passes for safety these days."
—Urborg ferry pilot

name: Gainsay
text: Counter target blue spell.
flavor:
"I'd be happy to stop contradicting you, Urza, just as soon as you start being right."
—Bo Levar, planeswalker

name: Hunting Drake
text:
Flying
When Hunting Drake enters the battlefield, put target red or green creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor: Even the fiercest beast will flee when faced with the possibility of becoming dinner.

name: Planar Overlay
text: Each player chooses a land they control of each basic land type. Return those lands to their owners' hands.
flavor: The Phyrexians don't want to conquer Dominaria. They want to remake it.

name: Sea Snidd
text: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: It always has the home-turf advantage.

name: Stormscape Familiar
text:
Flying
White spells and black spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: Each Stormscape apprentice must hand-raise and train an owl before attaining the rank of master.

name: Death Bomb
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller loses 2 life.
flavor: There's no higher honor in Phyrexia than dying for Yawgmoth's glorious vision.

name: Exotic Disease
text: Domain — Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor:
"Do not fear death. I shall release you from the eternal bonds and bring you glory."
—Lord Dralnu

name: Noxious Vapors
text: Each player reveals their hand, chooses one card of each color from it, then discards all other nonland cards.
flavor: Urborg would just as soon steal your memories as your life.

name: Phyrexian Bloodstock
text: When Phyrexian Bloodstock leaves the battlefield, destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: It reeks of terror and chaos.

name: Shriek of Dread
text: Target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: When Crosis roared, the battle ended and the slaughter began.

name: Sinister Strength
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1 and is black.
flavor:
"I bless the living with a song of death."
—Lord Dralnu

name: Implode
text:
Destroy target land.
Draw a card.
flavor: To save Dominaria, nine planeswalkers sought the annihilation of Phyrexia itself.

name: Insolence
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Insolence deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor:
"Sacrificing mortal dragons to satisfy your immortal hunger ends here."
—Darigaaz, to Rith

name: Kavu Recluse
text: {T}: Target land becomes a Forest until end of turn.
flavor: Few ever see this particular breed of kavu, which hides in forests of its own making.

name: Mire Kavu
text: Mire Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
flavor: "At this rate," said Sisay, "the next kavu we see will have wings."

name: Mogg Jailer
text: Mogg Jailer can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 2 or less.
flavor:
Hey, wake up!
—Mogg secret password

name: Singe
text: Singe deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature becomes black until end of turn.
flavor: Burnt flesh. Blackened soul.

name: Slingshot Goblin
text: {R}, {T}: Slingshot Goblin deals 2 damage to target blue creature.
flavor: It's most effective when it doesn't eat the ammunition.

name: Strafe
text: Strafe deals 3 damage to target nonred creature.
flavor:
"All right, let's light 'em up!"
—Gerrard

name: Thunderscape Familiar
text:
First strike
Black spells and green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: Thunderscape masters release familiars to help guide their apprentices down the thunderscape path.

name: Amphibious Kavu
text: Whenever Amphibious Kavu blocks or becomes blocked by one or more blue and/or black creatures, Amphibious Kavu gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: Merfolk raided the shores untroubled for years . . . until the shores started fighting back.

name: Multani's Harmony
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
flavor: "Welcome to paradise."

name: Planeswalker's Favor
text: {3}{G}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the revealed card's mana value.
flavor: Freyalise strengthens her faithful.

name: Pygmy Kavu
text: When Pygmy Kavu enters the battlefield, draw a card for each black creature your opponents control.
flavor: "We could learn a lot by watching the little ones," said Agnate. "Define 'little,'" replied Grizzlegom.

name: Root Greevil
text: {2}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Root Greevil: Destroy all enchantments of the color of your choice.
flavor: The root of all greevils.

name: Skyshroud Blessing
text:
All lands gain shroud until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
Draw a card.
flavor: "Behold," said Freyalise to Eladamri. "Your Skyshroud home has followed you to Dominaria."

name: Thornscape Familiar
text: Red spells and white spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: Blessed with many options, Thornscape masters favor scarabs as familiars.

name: Jamuraan Lion
text: {W}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.
flavor:
Der Löwe zwinkerte
—Ausdruck der Femeref für "noch einmal davongekommen

name: Cunning Sparkmage
text:
Haste
{T}: Cunning Sparkmage deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: "I see the weaknesses you hide even from yourself."

name: Shrieking Drake
text:
Flying
When Shrieking Drake enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Kaervek believes the drakes' cries herald his victory; in truth, they mourn aloud for his impending demise."
—Teferi

name: Tangled Florahedron // Tangled Vale
text: {T}: Add {G}.
flavor:
「バーラ・ゲドが再び成長し始めると、自由奔放な驚くべき形の新たな命が花開いた。」
――バーラ・ゲドの案内人、ドーラル

name: Border Guard
flavor: "Join the army, see foreign countries!" they'd said.

name: Devoted Hero
flavor: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

name: False Peace
text: Target player skips all combat phases of their next turn.
flavor: Mutual consent is not required for war.

name: Fleet-Footed Monk
text: Fleet-Footed Monk can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater.
flavor: "Hesitation is for the faithless. My belief lends me speed."

name: Keen-Eyed Archers
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: "If it has wings, shoot it. If it doesn't, shoot it anyway."

name: Renewing Dawn
text: You gain 2 life for each Mountain target opponent controls.
flavor: Dawn brings a new day, and a new day brings hope.

name: Sacred Knight
text: Sacred Knight can't be blocked by black and/or red creatures.
flavor: "No flame, no horror can sway me from my cause."

name: Spiritual Guardian
text: When Spiritual Guardian enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor: Hope is born within.

name: Starlit Angel
text: Flying
flavor: To soar as high as hope, to dive as swift as justice.

name: Steadfastness
text: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

name: Valorous Charge
text: White creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Stand in the way of truth at your peril.

name: Warrior's Charge
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: It is not the absence of fear that makes a warrior, but its domination.

name: Cloak of Feathers
text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor: A thousand feathers from a thousand birds, sewn with magic and song.

name: Deep-Sea Serpent
text: Deep-Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor: Sailors fear the deep-sea serpent; others thank the gods it has no legs.

name: Djinn of the Lamp
text: Flying
flavor: Once they learn the trick of carrying their own lamps, they never touch the ground again.

name: Sorcerous Sight
text:
Look at target opponent's hand.
Draw a card.
flavor: Do not react; anticipate.

name: Arrogant Vampire
text: Flying
flavor: Charm and grace may hide a foul heart.

name: Charging Bandits
text: Whenever Charging Bandits attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The fear in their victims' eyes is their most cherished reward.

name: Craven Knight
text: Craven Knight can't block.
flavor: "I say victory is better than honor."

name: Dread Charge
text: Black creatures you control can't be blocked this turn except by black creatures.
flavor:
"As equal were their souls, so equal was their fate."
—John Dryden, "Ode to Mrs. Anne Killigrew"

name: Howling Fury
text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

name: King's Assassin
text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: Fear is as effective a weapon as the blade.

name: Mind Knives
text: Target opponent discards a card at random.
flavor: To dodge the unerring knife, one must be free of thought.

name: Nature's Ruin
text: Destroy all green creatures.
flavor: One chill blast—the exhalation of the grave.

name: Skeletal Crocodile
flavor: The less flesh there is, the more teeth there seem to be.

name: Skeletal Snake
flavor: They watched as the snake shed layer after layer until only cold bone remained.

name: Soul Shred
text: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
flavor: It would be a shame to let life slip away to nothing.

name: Vampiric Touch
text: Vampiric Touch deals 2 damage to target opponent or planeswalker and you gain 2 life.
flavor: A touch, not comforting, but of death.

name: Virtue's Ruin
text: Destroy all white creatures.
flavor: All must fall, and those who stand highest fall hardest.

name: Craven Giant
text: Craven Giant can't block.
flavor:
"The best armor is to keep out of range."
—Italian proverb

name: Desert Drake
text: Flying
flavor: Never doubt a dragon just because of its size.

name: Fire Snake
text: When Fire Snake dies, destroy target land.
flavor: The snake's final thrashings only spread the fire within it.

name: Highland Giant
flavor: Though slow-witted and slow-moving, they are quick to anger.

name: Hulking Goblin
text: Hulking Goblin can't block.
flavor: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.

name: Lava Flow
text: Destroy target creature or land.
flavor: People ran as never before at the thought of being buried and cremated at the same time.

name: Minotaur Warrior
flavor: The herd's patience, the stampede's fury.

name: Raging Cougar
text: Haste
flavor: Mountaineers quickly learn to travel with their spears always pointed up.

name: Rain of Salt
text: Destroy two target lands.
flavor: It pelts the land with its fury, spoiling what was once sweet.

name: Scorching Spear
text: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.

name: Fruition
text: You gain 1 life for each Forest on the battlefield.
flavor: Come to these woods and suffer no pain; you've burdens to lose and new life to gain.

name: Mobilize
text: Untap all creatures you control.
flavor: A rested mind is the sharpest weapon.

name: Moon Sprite
text: Flying
flavor:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
*A Midsummer Night's Dream*

name: Rowan Treefolk
flavor: One of the forest's best protectors is the forest itself.

name: Winter's Grasp
text: Destroy target land.
flavor: Winter settles on the land, and the land prays it will wake.

name: Paladin of Atonement
text:
At the beginning of each upkeep, if you lost life last turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Paladin of Atonement.
When Paladin of Atonement dies, you gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor: For every wound there is a blessing; for every death, a reckoning.

name: Sphinx's Decree
text: Each opponent can't cast instant or sorcery spells during that player's next turn.
flavor:
"Be still."
—Azor

name: Temple Altisaur
text: If a source would deal damage to another Dinosaur you control, prevent all but 1 of that damage.
flavor:
"Kinjalli sculpted humans from clay, but the dinosaurs were carved from unyielding stone."
—Itzama the Crested

name: Trapjaw Tyrant
text: Enrage — Whenever Trapjaw Tyrant is dealt damage, exile target creature an opponent controls until Trapjaw Tyrant leaves the battlefield.
flavor:
"I would advise you not to struggle."
—Huatli

name: Admiral's Order
text:
Raid — If you attacked this turn, you may pay {U} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Counter target spell.
flavor: "Damn the cannons, mates. Charge!"

name: Release to the Wind
text: Exile target nonland permanent. For as long as that card remains exiled, its owner may cast it without paying its mana cost.
flavor: "Here and gone like a fleeting breeze."

name: Champion of Dusk
text: When Champion of Dusk enters the battlefield, you draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of Vampires you control.
flavor: "Drench these golden streets in the blood of our enemies."

name: Mastermind's Acquisition
text:
Choose one —
• Search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
• Put a card you own from outside the game into your hand.
flavor: Another piece of a nefarious puzzle.

name: Blood Sun
text:
When Blood Sun enters the battlefield, draw a card.
All lands lose all abilities except mana abilities.
flavor: As the struggle raged for control of the Immortal Sun, the world grew dark under a blood-red sky.

name: Silverclad Ferocidons
text: Enrage — Whenever Silverclad Ferocidons is dealt damage, each opponent sacrifices a permanent.
flavor:
"Control them? No. I gird them in armor and let them loose."
—Yacha, Otepec huntmaster

name: Deeproot Elite
text: Whenever another Merfolk enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on target Merfolk you control.
flavor: "You think I stand alone? I have the forest at my call, the waters at my back. I outnumber you."

name: Polyraptor
text: Enrage — Whenever Polyraptor is dealt damage, create a token that's a copy of Polyraptor.
flavor: An innumerable pack is concealed in a single reflection.

name: Zodiac Rabbit
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: ". . . The world's affairs rush on, an endless stream; / A sky-told fate, infinite in reach, dooms all. . . ."

name: Zodiac Tiger
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: ". . . Three kings no more-Chenliu, Guiming, Anle. / The fiefs and posts must now be filled anew. . . ."

name: Zodiac Horse
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: ". . . 'First take Jingzhou, next the Riverlands; / On that rich region, base your own royal stand.' . . ."

name: Zodiac Ox
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: ". . . Cao's abdication changed the face of all; / No mighty battles marked the Southland's fall. . . ."

name: Zodiac Rat
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: " . . . Cao Pi, Cao Rui, Fang, Mao, and briefly, Huan- / The Sima took the empire in their turn. . . ."

name: Zodiac Snake
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: "Thrice Xuande's ardent quest led to Nanyang, / Where Sleeping Dragon unveiled Han's partition: . . ."

name: Zodiac Goat
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: ". . . Near death in Baidi, having reigned three years, / Bei sadly placed his son in Kongming's care. . . ."

name: Zodiac Pig
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: ". . . Zhong Hui and Deng Ai next led armies west: / And to the Cao, Han's hills and streams now passed. . . ."

name: Zodiac Dog
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: ". . . Jiang Wei alone still strove with might and main: / Nine times more he fought the north-in vain. . . ."

name: Day of Judgment
text: Destroy all creatures.
flavor:
"I have seen planes leveled and all life rendered to dust. It brought no pleasure, even to a heart as dark as mine."
—Sorin Markov

name: Curse of Wizardry
text:
As Curse of Wizardry enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever a player casts a spell of the chosen color, that player loses 1 life.
flavor:
"We must all push through the pain to heal our world."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric

name: Memoricide
text: Choose a nonland card name. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles.
flavor: "You claim wisdom, yet I see nothing in here but tawdry wishes."

name: Plague Stinger
text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: It leaves its victims one sting closer to phyresis.

name: Leatherback Baloth
flavor: Heavy enough to withstand the Roil, leatherback skeletons are havens for travelers in storms and landshifts.

name: Karametra's Acolyte
text: {T}: Add an amount of {G} equal to your devotion to green. (Each {G} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to green.)
flavor: "The wilds are a garden tended by divine hands."

name: Sylvan Caryatid
text:
Defender, hexproof
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor: Those who enter the copse never leave. They find peace there and take root, becoming part of the ever-growing grove.

name: Anthousa, Setessan Hero
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Anthousa, Setessan Hero, up to three target lands you control each become 2/2 Warrior creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
flavor: The warriors she leads can rarely keep pace with her, and neither can the tales.

name: Flameblade Angel
text:
Flying
Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you or a permanent you control, you may have Flameblade Angel deal 1 damage to that source's controller.
flavor: "You must pay for your sin in blood."

name: Markov Dreadknight
text:
Flying
{2}{B}, Discard a card: Put two +1/+1 counters on Markov Dreadknight.
flavor: The destruction of Markov Manor made the surviving members of the bloodline more dangerous.

name: Soul Swallower
text:
Trample
Delirium — At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, put three +1/+1 counters on Soul Swallower.
flavor: Being engulfed is just the beginning of the nightmare.

name: Ravenous Bloodseeker
text: Discard a card: Ravenous Bloodseeker gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Nothing will cool the fire in their blood. They are too far gone. We must keep them away from our towns at any cost."
—Cosper Lowe of the Silbern Guard

name: Bishop of Rebirth
text:
Vigilance
Whenever Bishop of Rebirth attacks, you may return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "In the death of the foe lies the resurrection of the faithful."

name: Burning Sun's Avatar
text: When Burning Sun's Avatar enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target opponent or planeswalker and 3 damage to up to one target creature.
flavor:
"Tilonalli's searing rays carry the spark of life's eventual destruction as all light fades."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider

name: Elite Spellbinder
text:
Flying
When Elite Spellbinder enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand. You may exile a nonland card from it. For as long as that card remains exiled, its owner may play it. A spell cast this way costs {2} more to cast.
flavor: Paulo Vitor Damo da Rosa, World Champion XXVI

name: Archmage Emeritus
text: Magecraft — Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, draw a card.
flavor: Some emeritus professors return from their wanderings periodically to share tales of the mystical wonders of Arcavios.

name: Dragonsguard Elite
text:
Magecraft — Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Dragonsguard Elite.
{4}{G}{G}: Double the number of +1/+1 counters on Dragonsguard Elite.
flavor: "The Founder Dragons brought the Blood Age to an end. It is an honor to serve them."

name: Spelltwine
text: Exile target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard and target instant or sorcery card from an opponent's graveyard. Copy those cards. Cast the copies if able without paying their mana costs. Exile Spelltwine.
flavor: "Two spells are more than one."

name: Benthic Biomancer
text:
{1}{U}: Adapt 1. (If this creature has no +1/+1 counters on it, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are put on Benthic Biomancer, draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: "I am my life's work."

name: Mass Manipulation
text: Gain control of X target creatures and/or planeswalkers.
flavor: Those who cross the Dimir find enemies everywhere they turn.

name: Sphinx of Foresight
text:
You may reveal this card from your opening hand. If you do, scry 3 at the beginning of your first upkeep.
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 1.
flavor: "I do not understand the future I see: the guilds subverted, the world at war, armies bent to a cruel conqueror's will."

name: Awaken the Erstwhile
text: Each player discards all the cards in their hand, then creates that many 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.
flavor: In preparation for the conflict all foresaw, the Golgari called upon an army that had slept for millennia beneath the city.

name: Font of Agonies
text:
Whenever you pay life, put that many blood counters on Font of Agonies.
{1}{B}, Remove four blood counters from Font of Agonies: Destroy target creature.
flavor:
"No worthwhile reward is easily gained."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Gutterbones
text:
Gutterbones enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}{B}: Return Gutterbones from your graveyard to your hand. Activate only during your turn and only if an opponent lost life this turn.
flavor:
"Down here, things don't stay dead."
—Lavinia

name: Priest of Forgotten Gods
text: {T}, Sacrifice two other creatures: Any number of target players each lose 2 life and sacrifice a creature. You add {B}{B} and draw a card.
flavor: The Orzhov are not the only religious tradition on Ravnica, nor the oldest.

name: Electrodominance
text: Electrodominance deals X damage to any target. You may cast a spell with mana value X or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.
flavor: "Basically, we turn a bunch of little lightnings into one big lightning."

name: Immolation Shaman
text:
Whenever an opponent activates an ability of an artifact, creature, or land that isn't a mana ability, Immolation Shaman deals 1 damage to that player.
{3}{R}{R}: Immolation Shaman gets +3/+3 and gains menace until end of turn.
flavor: "Hello, kindling."

name: Guardian Project
text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, if it doesn't have the same name as another creature you control or a creature card in your graveyard, draw a card.
flavor: Simic's strength comes from its diversity.

name: Rampage of the Clans
text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments. For each permanent destroyed this way, its controller creates a 3/3 green Centaur creature token.
flavor: "Rage! Rage until the whole world burns!"

name: Depopulate
text: Each player who controls a multicolored creature draws a card. Then destroy all creatures.
flavor: No screams rang out. No blood stained the streets. In an instant, the bustling metropolis simply fell silent.

name: Giada, Font of Hope
text:
Flying, vigilance
Each other Angel you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it for each Angel you already control.
{T}: Add {W}. Spend this mana only to cast an Angel spell.
flavor: The source of the Cabaretti's Halo turned out to be a single teenage girl.

name: Errant, Street Artist
text:
Flash
Defender, haste
{1}{U}, {T}: Copy target spell you control that wasn't cast. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor: Few know her face, but everyone knows her work.

name: Even the Score
text:
This spell costs {U}{U}{U} less to cast if an opponent has drawn four or more cards this turn.
Draw X cards.
flavor: Those who try to rob the Obscura often leave behind more than they take away.

name: Ledger Shredder
text:
Flying
Whenever a player casts their second spell each turn, Ledger Shredder connives. (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
flavor: No evidence, no crime.

name: Angel of Suffering
text:
Flying
If damage would be dealt to you, prevent that damage and mill twice that many cards.
flavor: "If you wish for blessings, mortal, ask your demon masters. We've given enough to your kind."

name: Cut of the Profits
text:
Casualty 3 (As you cast this spell, you may sacrifice a creature with power 3 or greater. When you do, copy this spell.)
You draw X cards and you lose X life.
flavor: Everybody is worth their weight in gold.

name: Shadow of Mortality
text: If your life total is less than your starting life total, this spell costs {X} less to cast, where X is the difference.
flavor:
"Build your towers as tall as you want. The shadow always reaches higher."
—Message scrawled on an alley wall

name: Shakedown Heavy
text:
Menace
Whenever Shakedown Heavy attacks, defending player may have you draw a card. If they do, untap Shakedown Heavy and remove it from combat.
flavor: "Look, we both get what we want. I get your Halo. You get to keep your kneecaps."

name: Devilish Valet
text:
Trample, haste
Alliance — Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, double Devilish Valet's power until end of turn.
flavor: Nobody thought twice about checking their weapons at the door, until they were informed there was no weapon check at the door.

name: Structural Assault
text: Destroy all artifacts, then Structural Assault deals damage to each creature equal to the number of artifacts that were put into graveyards from the battlefield this turn.
flavor: After the attack on the Vantoleone, the fragile balance of power shattered completely, and the city descended into chaos.

name: Bootleggers' Stash
text: Lands you control have "{T}: Create a Treasure token."
flavor: Labyrinths of tunnels beneath the streets of the Caldaia offer an ample array of discreet routes for enterprising smugglers.

name: Evolving Door
text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Count the colors of the sacrificed creature, then search your library for a creature card that's exactly that many colors plus one. Exile that card, then shuffle. You may cast the exiled card. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: In with the old, out with the new.

name: Hanweir Militia Captain // Westvale Cult Leader
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control four or more creatures, transform Hanweir Militia Captain.
flavor: Her reputation inspires both loyalty and adoration.

name: Confirm Suspicions
text:
Counter target spell.
Investigate three times. (To investigate, create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: Everyone has something to hide.

name: Epiphany at the Drownyard
text: Reveal the top X plus one cards of your library and separate them into two piles. An opponent chooses one of those piles. Put that pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
flavor:
"Is this what you found, Tamiyo?"
—Jace Beleren

name: Startled Awake // Persistent Nightmare
text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
When Persistent Nightmare deals combat damage to a player, return it to its owner's hand.
flavor: "It seemed so real!"

name: Thing in the Ice // Awoken Horror
text: When this creature transforms into Awoken Horror, return all non-Horror creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor:
"It serves as evidence of the ancient power of the deep, a reminder that the sea is the only thing worthy of reverence."
—Runo Stromkirk

name: Behold the Beyond
text: Discard your hand. Search your library for three cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: There is power in the abyss, in blackness more profound than the darkest dreams.

name: To the Slaughter
text:
Target player sacrifices a creature or planeswalker.
Delirium — If there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, instead that player sacrifices a creature and a planeswalker.
flavor:
"Where has little Gossamer gone?"
—Thaniel, Gatstaf shepherd

name: Devils' Playground
text: Create four 1/1 red Devil creature tokens. They have "When this creature dies, it deals 1 damage to any target."
flavor:
"The city is overrun. I would say burn it to the ground, but that won't be necessary."
—Inquisitor Delmund

name: Geier Reach Bandit // Vildin-Pack Alpha
text:
Haste
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Geier Reach Bandit.
flavor: The cathars realized they had not tracked her—she had led them here.

name: Harness the Storm
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your hand, you may cast target card with the same name as that spell from your graveyard. (You still pay its costs.)
flavor:
"There is no place like a rooftop laboratory in a lightning storm. It's where genius strikes."
—Renna, Selhoff alchemist

name: Wolf of Devil's Breach
text: Whenever Wolf of Devil's Breach attacks, you may pay {1}{R} and discard a card. If you do, Wolf of Devil's Breach deals damage to target creature or planeswalker equal to the discarded card's mana value.
flavor:
"How can werewolves be considered abominations next to such creatures?"
—Arlinn Kord

name: Cryptolith Rite
text: Creatures you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
flavor: The chant was incomprehensible, but its power was unmistakable.

name: Seasons Past
text: Return any number of cards with different mana values from your graveyard to your hand. Put Seasons Past on the bottom of its owner's library.
flavor: The seeds of new life take root in the soil of old.

name: Silverfur Partisan
text:
Trample
Whenever a Wolf or Werewolf you control becomes the target of an instant or sorcery spell, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
flavor: Silverfurs are the last remaining wolfir.

name: Westvale Abbey // Ormendahl, Profane Prince
text: Flying, lifelink, indestructible, haste
flavor: With Griselbrand gone, the Skirsdag eagerly awaited another demon to claim their devotion. Ormendahl did not make them wait long.

name: Leonin Lightscribe
text: Magecraft — Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: All who hear his inspiring words are filled with hope and pride.

name: Strict Proctor
text:
Flying
Whenever a permanent entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability to trigger, counter that ability unless its controller pays {2}.
flavor: "You might believe being dead for centuries has made me more lenient. I think you'll find the opposite is true."

name: Teachings of the Archaics
text: If an opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw two cards. Draw three cards instead if an opponent has at least four more cards in hand than you.
flavor: Mages seek out the ancient beings known as the Archaics for their boundless knowledge of history and magic, dispensed only in cryptic metaphors.

name: Tempted by the Oriq
text: For each opponent, gain control of up to one target creature or planeswalker that player controls with mana value 3 or less.
flavor: To exact his vengeance, Extus needed followers. His infiltrators recruited promising mage-students from the very halls he sought to destroy.

name: Oriq Loremage
text: {T}: Search your library for a card, put it into your graveyard, then shuffle. If it's an instant or sorcery card, put a +1/+1 counter on Oriq Loremage.
flavor: Nothing can quell the Oriq's thirst for the forbidden secrets of the past.

name: Crackle with Power
text: Crackle with Power deals five times X damage to each of up to X targets.
flavor: Will gasped as Rowan drew from the raw power of the Strixhaven Snarl. For a moment, she was luminous, transcendent, terrible.

name: Illuminate History
text: Discard any number of cards, then draw that many cards. Then if there are seven or more cards in your graveyard, create a 3/2 red and white Spirit creature token.
flavor: "Look at the detail in this stonework! Professor, our assumptions about early Kathorran tool use may not be correct."

name: Accomplished Alchemist
text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
{T}: Add X mana of any one color, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
flavor: "Tincture of murkroot and lizard feet? Simple. One that doesn't taste like murkroot and lizard feet? I'm working on it."

name: Basic Conjuration
text: Look at the top six cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. You gain 3 life.
flavor: "I made that! It's mine! Did you see that?"

name: Exponential Growth
text: Until end of turn, double target creature's power X times.
flavor: Most Quandrix students fundamentally disagree with the concept of "enough."

name: Gnarled Professor
text:
Trample
When Gnarled Professor enters the battlefield, learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
flavor: "Class is in season."

name: Nightmare Moon // Princess Luna
text:
Flying
As long as it's nighttime, Nightmare Moon gets +2/+2 and has menace.
{6}: Transform Nightmare Moon. Anypony may activate this ability or help pay the cost. When they do, they become your friend.
flavor: "The night. . . will last. . .forever!"

name: Eidolon of Obstruction
text:
First strike
Loyalty abilities of planeswalkers your opponents control cost {1} more to activate.
flavor: Death turned admirable conviction into pointless intransigence.

name: Heliod's Intervention
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy X target artifacts and/or enchantments.
• Target player gains twice X life.
flavor: "I bring a dawn that no night can follow."

name: Shatter the Sky
text: Each player who controls a creature with power 4 or greater draws a card. Then destroy all creatures.
flavor: When the gods go to war, mortals pay the highest price.

name: Protean Thaumaturge
text: Constellation — Whenever an enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Protean Thaumaturge become a copy of another target creature, except it has this ability.
flavor: "Once you see past the veil we call 'reality,' altering your own shape is elementary."

name: Thassa's Intervention
text:
Choose one —
• Look at the top X cards of your library. Put up to two of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
• Counter target spell unless its controller pays twice {X}.
flavor: "I bring a flood that nothing can withstand."

name: Thryx, the Sudden Storm
text:
Flash
Flying
Spells you cast with mana value 5 or greater cost {1} less to cast and can't be countered.
flavor: Even in their mountain fortresses, the Akroans have learned not to anger Thassa.

name: Aphemia, the Cacophony
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, you may exile an enchantment card from your graveyard. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
flavor:
"Sing, beauty. Sing for death, and for the dead."
—Ashiok

name: Eat to Extinction
text: Exile target creature or planeswalker. Surveil 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.)
flavor:
"Kroxa devours what he may—not for sustenance or pleasure, but because it is his nature. He is unending hunger given form."
—Klothys, god of destiny

name: Erebos's Intervention
text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn. You gain X life.
• Exile up to twice X target cards from graveyards.
flavor: "I bring a death none can escape."

name: Treacherous Blessing
text:
When Treacherous Blessing enters the battlefield, draw three cards.
Whenever you cast a spell, you lose 1 life.
When Treacherous Blessing becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor: Phenax is generous with gifts and unforgiving of debts.

name: Purphoros's Intervention
text:
Choose one —
• Create an X/1 red Elemental creature token with trample and haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
• Purphoros's Intervention deals twice X damage to target creature or planeswalker.
flavor: "I bring a fire to recast all the world."

name: Storm's Wrath
text: Storm's Wrath deals 4 damage to each creature and each planeswalker.
flavor: Distant thunder rumbled, a dread forewarning of Keranos's displeasure.

name: Mantle of the Wolf
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+4.
When Mantle of the Wolf is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create two 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens.
flavor:
"Be fearless, for a furious rebirth awaits you."
—Nylea, god of the hunt

name: Nessian Boar
text:
All creatures able to block Nessian Boar do so.
Whenever Nessian Boar becomes blocked by a creature, that creature's controller draws a card.
flavor: Renata led the best hunters in all of Theros on a quest to bring down the terror of the Setessan wilds.

name: Nylea's Intervention
text:
Choose one —
• Search your library for up to X land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
• Nylea's Intervention deals twice X damage to each creature with flying.
flavor: "I bring a wilderness no law can tame."

name: Nyxbloom Ancient
text:
Trample
If you tap a permanent for mana, it produces three times as much of that mana instead.
flavor: Ancient yet ever-young, it is wise and subtle—and cruel and reckless as the spring itself.

name: Setessan Champion
text: Constellation — Whenever an enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Setessan Champion and draw a card.
flavor: "A blessing is not a gift. It is a duty."

name: Alert Shu Infantry
text: Vigilance
flavor: Kongming's predecessor helped Liu Bei win the battle of Fancheng by recognizing and defeating Cao Ren's use of the dreaded "Eight Gold Locks" formation.

name: Empty City Ruse
text: Target opponent skips all combat phases of their next turn.
flavor: Out of time and options, Kongming was forced to bluff at Xicheng. He tricked an army of 150,000 Wei by leaving the city gates open and calmly playing the zither.

name: Flanking Troops
text: Whenever Flanking Troops attacks, you may tap target creature.
flavor: Following the battle of Redcliffs, both Liu Bei and Sun Quan coveted the province of Jingzhou. After Sun Quan's troops failed to capture it, Liu Bei's succeeded.

name: Huang Zhong, Shu General
text: Huang Zhong, Shu General can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor: "Virile in war, he kept the north in fear; His prodigies subdued the western sphere."

name: Pang Tong, "Young Phoenix"
text: {T}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Activate only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: ". . . It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."

name: Riding Red Hare
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: One of the greatest steeds in the empire, Red Hare could travel a thousand *li* a day and climb hills as if running on flat ground.

name: Shu Defender
text: Whenever Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Confronting Cao Cao's army at Steepslope Bridge, Zhang Fei bellowed, "I am Zhang Fei of Yan! Who dares fight me to the death?" Cao Cao's army cowered and fled.

name: Shu Elite Infantry
flavor: Kongming's first campaign against the Wei kingdom was a rousing success until an arrogant Shu general, Ma Su, foolishly lost the city of Jieting.

name: Shu Farmer
text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor:
"The common folk are ceaselessly active. The fields are fertile and the soil productive, and neither flood nor drought plagues us."
—A Shu diplomat

name: Shu Foot Soldiers
flavor: Liu Bei lost many men at the battle of Runan because of his lack of strategy. It wasn't until he met Kongming that he began to truly succeed as a leader.

name: Shu Grain Caravan
text: When Shu Grain Caravan enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor: Keeping a million-man army fed was no easy task. Grain and rice caravans were the lifeblood of the empire.

name: Virtuous Charge
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "The empire belongs to no one man but to all in the empire. He who has virtue shall possess it."

name: Zhao Zilong, Tiger General
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Zhao Zilong, Tiger General blocks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Zhao Zilong was a brave and noble warrior. Twice he rescued Liu Bei's son, Liu Shan.

name: Broken Dam
text: Tap one or two target creatures without horsemanship.
flavor: Using nature to their advantage, wise Three Kingdoms generals often let dammed rivers loose to destroy their enemies.

name: Council of Advisors
text: When Council of Advisors enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: Sun Quan's long and successful rule in the years 199 to 251 was due to his ability to choose and foster talented advisors and generals.

name: Counterintelligence
text: Return one or two target creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor: Before the battle of Red Cliffs, a supposedly sleeping Zhou Yu allowed his old friend, a Wei advisor, to steal a planted letter forged as if from Wei's two best admirals.

name: Lady Sun
text: {T}: Return Lady Sun and another target creature to their owners' hands. Activate only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: Sister to Sun Quan and wife to Liu Bei, Lady Sun often felt her loyalty to both tested.

name: Lu Su, Wu Advisor
text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: Lu Su served as an intermediary between the Wu and Shu kingdoms until Zhou Yu's death in 210, when he became Wu's supreme commander.

name: Sage's Knowledge
text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"Those who know do not talk. Those who talk do not know."
—Lao Tzu, *Tao Te Ching*
(trans. Feng and English)

name: Straw Soldiers
flavor: The overnight appearance of miles of "armed" Wu forts at Guangling frightened a much vaster Wei force into fleeing for their lives.

name: Wu Admiral
text: Wu Admiral gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.
flavor: The Wu kingdom's well-trained admirals were integral to the Southlands' victory at Red Cliffs as well as the kingdom's defense.

name: Wu Infantry
flavor: The first battle of Hefei was Sun Quan's last as a field general. From then on he let his generals command in the field while he directed battle from behind the front lines.

name: Wu Light Cavalry
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: A cunning strategist, Cao Ren tricked Zhou Yu by letting him enter Nanjun. Zhou Yu thought he was capturing the city until Cao Ren's arrows rained down upon him.

name: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander
text: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor:
"After making me, Zhou Yu, did you have to make Kongming?"
—Zhou Yu crying to heaven on his deathbed

name: Zhuge Jin, Wu Strategist
text: {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn. Activate only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: When Zhuge Jin proposed the marriage of Guan Yu's daugher and Sun Quan's heir, Guan Yu's arrogant refusal led to disaster.

name: Cao Ren, Wei Commander
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
When Cao Ren, Wei Commander enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
flavor: Cao Cao's cousin, Cao Ren was known throughout the three kingdoms as the fiercest of warriors.

name: Deception
text: Target opponent discards two cards.
flavor: Believing they wrote the forged letter that had been stolen from Zhou Yu, Cao Cao rashly executed his two best admirals for treason.

name: Imperial Edict
text: Target opponent chooses a creature they control. Destroy that creature.
flavor: Frustrated with Cao Cao's control of the imperial court, Emperor Xian secretly issued an edict condemning him, using his own blood as ink.

name: Poison Arrow
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
flavor: In ancient China, not wearing armor could be a fatal mistake. Guan Yu, Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other heros were struck by poison arrows.

name: Return to Battle
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "Swallowing his eye, the valiant Xiahou Dun fought on; / But Cao Cao's vanguard, its commander wounded, could not hold out for long."

name: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal
text: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.
flavor: Sima Yi fought for four generations of the Cao family before his own grandson became emperor and united the three kingdoms.

name: Wei Ambush Force
text: Whenever Wei Ambush Force attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The battle of Puyang marked the beginning of the end for Lu Bu. He lost the city—and later his life—to Cao Cao.

name: Wei Scout
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor:
He will win who, prepared himself, waits to take the enemy unprepared."
—Sun Tzu, *Art of War* (trans. Giles)

name: Xun Yu, Wei Advisor
text: {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: "A splendid talent, admired of all men! His folly lay in serving Cao Cao's power."

name: Barbarian General
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor:
"Barbarian tribes with their rulers are inferior to Chinese states without them."
—Confucius, *The Analects* (trans. Lau)

name: Barbarian Horde
flavor: Only twenty years after the Sima clan united the empire, invading barbarians divided it again.

name: Burning Fields
text: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
flavor:
"In raiding and plundering, be like fire, in immovability like a mountain."
—Sun Tzu, *Art of War* (trans. Giles)

name: Control of the Court
text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
flavor: "Power-hungry eunuchs, the curse of the dynasty, have thrown the masses of the people into the depths of misery."

name: Desert Sandstorm
text: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature.
flavor: While pursuing the remnants of Yuan Shao's forces into the Wuhan Desert, Cao Cao was temporarily turned back by a fierce sandstorm.

name: Eunuchs' Intrigues
text: Target opponent chooses a creature they control. Other creatures they control can't block this turn.
flavor: Taking control of powerful court positions one by one, eunuchs eventually brought on the fall of the Han dynasty, leading to the chaos of the Three Kingdoms.

name: Independent Troops
flavor: "The empire, long united, must divide, and long divided, must unite."

name: Mountain Bandit
text: Haste
flavor: Penniless and far from home, many former Yellow Scarves and other soldiers became bandits to survive.

name: Ravaging Horde
text: When Ravaging Horde enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
flavor: Upon his return to the capitol after taking soldiers to loot a nearby peaceful town, the prime minister, Dong Zhou, boasted of it as a victory over bandits.

name: Renegade Troops
text: Haste
flavor: "Across the land rebellions seethed and swarmed / As vicious war lords swooped down on all sides."

name: Yellow Scarves General
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Yellow Scarves General can't block.
flavor: Zhang Jue, leader of the Yellow Scarves rebellion, was a Taoist master and tutored his soldiers in those arts.

name: Yellow Scarves Troops
text: Yellow Scarves Troops can't block.
flavor: Over 500,000 commoners followed Zhang Jue, General of Heaven, in his attempt to overthrow the corrupt Han dynasty.

name: False Mourning
text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
flavor: Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other famous generals feigned their deaths in order to later surprise their opponents.

name: Forest Bear
flavor:
Fish and bear paws—one can't have both.
—Chinese idiom meaning "you can't have it both ways"

name: Lady Zhurong, Warrior Queen
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor:
"A man, and such a fool! I, a woman, will fight them for you."
—Lady Zhurong to her husband Meng Huo, before leading an army against the Shu

name: Spring of Eternal Peace
text: You gain 8 life.
flavor: Bathing in this spring could cure ailments of body and mind alike.

name: Taoist Hermit
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor: Taoists chose to be hermits for many reasons, but all shared one unchanging goal: to follow the Tao.

name: Taoist Mystic
text: Taoist Mystic can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
flavor: By appearing in places miles apart at the same time, Zuo Ci exhibited the mystic's ability to "shrink the land."

name: Taunting Challenge
text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
flavor: Incensed by their opponents' unrelenting taunts, even wise generals were known to rashly lead their troops into battle—often to disastrous defeats.

name: Trained Cheetah
text: Whenever Trained Cheetah becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "[King Mulu's cheetahs] came riding on the winds, charging, with fangs bared and claws flexed."

name: Trained Jackal
flavor: To taunt a man into action, call him a coward. To insult him beyond forgiveness, call him a jackal.

name: Wielding the Green Dragon
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
flavor: Named for the eastern part of the sky, the source of energy and renewal, Guan Yu's crescent-moon blade weighed over 100 pounds.

name: Zodiac Rooster
text: Plainswalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Plains.)
flavor: ". . . But the time of Han had run—could he [Kongming] not tell?— / That night his master star fell past the hills. . . ."

name: Shepherd of the Lost
text: Flying, first strike, vigilance
flavor:
www.MagicTheGathering.com
www.mtg-jp.com

name: Finale of Glory
text: Create X 2/2 white Soldier creature tokens with vigilance. If X is 10 or more, also create X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying and vigilance.
flavor: The sky boiled over the citadel, dire and dark. Then the angels brought the dawn.

name: Ignite the Beacon
text: Search your library for up to two planeswalker cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor:
"If you can't save yourself, you fight to give someone else a chance."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Ravnica at War
text: Exile all multicolored permanents.
flavor: The heart of Ravnica disappeared before anyone could strike a blow in its defense.

name: Single Combat
text: Each player chooses a creature or planeswalker they control, then sacrifices the rest. Players can't cast creature or planeswalker spells until the end of your next turn.
flavor: Not even a threat to the entire Multiverse could persuade them to put aside their feud.

name: Tomik, Distinguished Advokist
text:
Flying
Lands on the battlefield and land cards in graveyards can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.
Your opponents can't play land cards from graveyards.
flavor: "Some bend the law. I tie it into knots."

name: Augur of Bolas
text: When Augur of Bolas enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library. You may reveal an instant or sorcery card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor: "There is no future save the one my master wills."

name: Commence the Endgame
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Draw two cards, then amass X, where X is the number of cards in your hand. (Put X +1/+1 counters on an Army you control. If you don't control one, create a 0/0 black Zombie Army creature token first.)
flavor:
"Even gods shall kneel."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Finale of Revelation
text:
Draw X cards. If X is 10 or more, instead shuffle your graveyard into your library, draw X cards, untap up to five lands, and you have no maximum hand size for the rest of the game.
Exile Finale of Revelation.
flavor: Ugin saw the gem that connected Bolas to his Meditation Realm as the key to his brother's downfall.

name: Narset's Reversal
text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell, then return it to its owner's hand. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor:
"In the disarray of battle, an enemy's attack may be your most convenient weapon."
—Narset

name: Command the Dreadhorde
text: Choose any number of target creature and/or planeswalker cards in graveyards. Command the Dreadhorde deals damage to you equal to the total mana value of those cards. Put them onto the battlefield under your control.
flavor: Liliana seized the reins of Bolas's vast army, gritting her teeth behind the Chain Veil.

name: The Elderspell
text: Destroy any number of target planeswalkers. Choose a planeswalker you control. Put two loyalty counters on it for each planeswalker destroyed this way.
flavor: The path to power is often paved with atrocities.

name: Finale of Eternity
text: Destroy up to three target creatures with toughness X or less. If X is 10 or more, return all creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: When you rule by fear, your greatest weakness is one who's no longer afraid.

name: Awakening of Vitu-Ghazi
text: Put nine +1/+1 counters on target land you control. It becomes a legendary 0/0 Elemental creature with haste named Vitu-Ghazi. It's still a land.
flavor: The Eternal armies advanced on Vitu-Ghazi. At Nissa's command, Vitu-Ghazi advanced on them.

name: Finale of Devastation
text: Search your library and/or graveyard for a creature card with mana value X or less and put it onto the battlefield. If you search your library this way, shuffle. If X is 10 or more, creatures you control get +X/+X and gain haste until end of turn.
flavor: Some spells sing a quiet tune. Others roar.

name: Ruthless Cullblade
text: Ruthless Cullblade gets +2/+1 as long as an opponent has 10 or less life.
flavor: She wields a blade as bloodthirsty and elegant as herself.

name: Ashes of the Abhorrent
text:
Players can't cast spells from graveyards or activate abilities of cards in graveyards.
Whenever a creature dies, you gain 1 life.
flavor: "Let no trace of the vampires' foulness remain."

name: Axis of Mortality
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have two target players exchange life totals.
flavor: The Church of Dusk teaches there is no gain without loss, no triumph without sacrifice, no drink of exquisite crimson without a dying gasp.

name: Goring Ceratops
text:
Double strike
Whenever Goring Ceratops attacks, other creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Follow her footsteps and she will show you the way."
—Itzama the Crested

name: Kinjalli's Sunwing
text:
Flying
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor:
"There are moments when I feel I could fly like the sunwing. Far away I would soar, but always a golden gale pushes me back."
—Huatli

name: Legion's Landing // Adanto, the First Fort
text:
When Legion's Landing enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Vampire creature token with lifelink.
When you attack with three or more creatures, transform Legion's Landing.
flavor:
"I claim this land in the name of the queen."
—Adrian Adanto of Lujio

name: Mavren Fein, Dusk Apostle
text: Whenever one or more nontoken Vampires you control attack, create a 1/1 white Vampire creature token with lifelink.
flavor: In the rapture of his Blood Fast, he destroyed the navigator's tools and steered the ship to shore by faith alone.

name: Tocatli Honor Guard
text: Creatures entering the battlefield don't cause abilities to trigger.
flavor: The glorious city of Pachatupa is the center of the Sun Empire, and Tocatli, the emperor's palace, is its glowing heart.

name: Wakening Sun's Avatar
text: When Wakening Sun's Avatar enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all non-Dinosaur creatures.
flavor:
"Kinjalli's encompassing rays herald new life in the moment of the sun's dawning."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider

name: Entrancing Melody
text: Gain control of target creature with mana value X.
flavor: The stronger the will, the more bewitching the song.

name: Fleet Swallower
text: Whenever Fleet Swallower attacks, target player mills half their library, rounded up.
flavor: "Captain, I think that island is following us."

name: Herald of Secret Streams
text: Creatures you control with +1/+1 counters on them can't be blocked.
flavor: "You might as well try to stop the waterfall."

name: Kopala, Warden of Waves
text:
Spells your opponents cast that target a Merfolk you control cost {2} more to cast.
Abilities your opponents activate that target a Merfolk you control cost {2} more to activate.
flavor: "I know these waters better than you know yourselves."

name: Overflowing Insight
text: Target player draws seven cards.
flavor: The truth came to Kumena like the Great River's torrent: the only way to keep his enemies away from the hidden city was to claim its power for himself.

name: Search for Azcanta // Azcanta, the Sunken Ruin
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, surveil 1. Then if you have seven or more cards in your graveyard, you may transform Search for Azcanta. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.)
flavor: The Sunken Ruin houses all the learning of a long-forgotten age.

name: Arguel's Blood Fast // Temple of Aclazotz
text:
{1}{B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 5 or less life, you may transform Arguel's Blood Fast.
flavor: Arguel's vision led him into the jungles of Ixalan . . .

name: Bloodcrazed Paladin
text:
Flash
Bloodcrazed Paladin enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each creature that died this turn.
flavor: When a paladin undertaking the Blood Fast finally gives in to hunger, the violence is sudden, explosive, and complete.

name: Fathom Fleet Captain
text:
Menace
Whenever Fathom Fleet Captain attacks, if you control another nontoken Pirate, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 2/2 black Pirate creature token with menace.
flavor: "Join me, and take the world for yourself!"

name: Sanctum Seeker
text: Whenever a Vampire you control attacks, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor: The Sanctum Seekers were the first of the knightly orders to cross the sea and are still the most zealous.

name: Sword-Point Diplomacy
text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. For each of those cards, put that card into your hand unless any opponent pays 3 life. Then exile the rest.
flavor: "Take my blood if you want. Just don't take my gold!"

name: Vraska's Contempt
text: Exile target creature or planeswalker. You gain 2 life.
flavor: It wasn't long before the taverns of High and Dry were full of whispers about the new captain who could turn a person to stone with a glance.

name: Angrath's Marauders
text: If a source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
flavor: Captain Angrath cares less about treasure than mayhem. If he can't leave Ixalan, he'll burn the plane down.

name: Rampaging Ferocidon
text:
Menace
Players can't gain life.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, Rampaging Ferocidon deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor: All raptors are aggressive, but ferocidons seem to enjoy their prey's pain.

name: Tilonalli's Skinshifter
text:
Haste
Whenever Tilonalli's Skinshifter attacks, it becomes a copy of another target nonlegendary attacking creature until end of turn.
flavor: "I am the ferocity of the Burning Sun. I am hide and feather, fang and claw."

name: Vance's Blasting Cannons // Spitfire Bastion
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of your library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast that card this turn.
Whenever you cast your third spell in a turn, you may transform Vance's Blasting Cannons.
flavor: With a broadside assault, Captain Vance carved the cliffs to form her new home.

name: Carnage Tyrant
text:
This spell can't be countered.
Trample, hexproof
flavor: Sun Empire commanders are well versed in advanced martial strategy. Still, the correct maneuver is usually to deploy the giant, implacable death lizard.

name: Old-Growth Dryads
text: When Old-Growth Dryads enters the battlefield, each opponent may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor: "The jungle was here before any city. It will be here after the last city falls."

name: Shapers' Sanctuary
text: Whenever a creature you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, you may draw a card.
flavor: Protection is woven into every vine and branch.

name: Waker of the Wilds
text: {X}{G}{G}: Put X +1/+1 counters on target land you control. That land becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.
flavor: "Our foes are many and mighty, but not as many as the trees or as mighty as the sea."

name: Archon of Emeria
text:
Flying
Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
Nonbasic lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor:
"Archons dispense justice according to an ancient, and flawed, premise."
—Nissa Revane

name: Emeria's Call // Emeria, Shattered Skyclave
text: Create two 4/4 white Angel Warrior creature tokens with flying. Non-Angel creatures you control gain indestructible until your next turn.
flavor:
"Iona no longer guards this place. We do."
—Kasla, Emeria shepherd

name: Legion Angel
text:
Flying
When Legion Angel enters the battlefield, you may reveal a card you own named Legion Angel from outside the game and put it into your hand.
flavor: "We are many, and righteous."

name: Ondu Inversion // Ondu Skyruins
text: Destroy all nonland permanents.
flavor:
"At first rumble you'd best hold on tight and pray to any gods you still hold dear."
—Nys Dal, Sea Gate trapfinder

name: Charix, the Raging Isle
text:
Spells your opponents cast that target Charix, the Raging Isle cost {2} more to cast.
{3}: Charix gets +X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Islands you control.
flavor: Zendikar's seas are deeper than anyone can fathom.

name: Glasspool Mimic // Glasspool Shore
text: You may have Glasspool Mimic enter the battlefield as a copy of a creature you control, except it's a Shapeshifter Rogue in addition to its other types.
flavor:
"When I touched the Glasspool, I tasted infinite possibility."
—Ashen Wal, Akoum Expeditionary House

name: Maddening Cacophony
text:
Kicker {3}{U}
Each opponent mills eight cards. If this spell was kicked, instead each opponent mills half their library, rounded up.
flavor: Jace traced Nahiri to the Singing City, but the magic of the ancient ruins threatened to overwhelm his mind.

name: Sea Gate Restoration // Sea Gate, Reborn
text: Draw cards equal to the number of cards in your hand plus one. You have no maximum hand size for the rest of the game.
flavor:
"We have much to remember ... and much we can never forget."
—Tazri

name: Agadeem's Awakening // Agadeem, the Undercrypt
text: Return from your graveyard to the battlefield any number of target creature cards that each have a different mana value X or less.
flavor:
"Now is the death-hour, just before dawn. Wake, sleepers, and haunt the living!"
—Vivias, Witch Vessel

name: Hagra Mauling // Hagra Broodpit
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast if an opponent controls no basic lands.
Destroy target creature.
flavor:
"Din, turn around! Now!"
—Doros, expedition guide

name: Shadows' Verdict
text: Exile all creatures and planeswalkers with mana value 3 or less from the battlefield and all creature and planeswalker cards with mana value 3 or less from all graveyards.
flavor: The shadows of death fall over everyone in the end.

name: Soul Shatter
text: Each opponent sacrifices a creature or planeswalker with the highest mana value among creatures and planeswalkers they control.
flavor: The Kargan tribes share legends of the victory their ancestors won over the Akoum Skyclave, and its horrendous cost.

name: Nahiri's Lithoforming
text: Sacrifice X lands. For each land sacrificed this way, draw a card. You may play X additional lands this turn. Lands you control enter the battlefield tapped this turn.
flavor: "Zendikar has suffered enough. It is time, at last, for my home to know peace."

name: Relic Robber
text:
Haste
Whenever Relic Robber deals combat damage to a player, that player creates a 0/1 colorless Goblin Construct artifact creature token with "This creature can't block" and "At the beginning of your upkeep, this creature deals 1 damage to you."
flavor: "Here, you take it!"

name: Shatterskull Smashing // Shatterskull, the Hammer Pass
text:
As Shatterskull, the Hammer Pass enters the battlefield, you may pay 3 life. If you don't, it enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
flavor:
"The safest way across the Skyfangs is to fly. Shatterskull Pass is a pretty distant second."
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

name: Valakut Awakening // Valakut Stoneforge
text: Put any number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your library, then draw that many cards plus one.
flavor:
"My ancestors reshaped the world to their vision. I have a few ideas of my own."
—Tars Olan, stoneforge mystic

name: Wayward Guide-Beast
text:
Trample, haste
Whenever Wayward Guide-Beast deals combat damage to a player, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Goblin cavalry tactics consist of pointing a beast in a direction and hanging on for as long as possible.

name: Ancient Greenwarden
text:
Reach
You may play lands from your graveyard.
If a land entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.
flavor: When the ruins awakened, so did their defenses.

name: Kazandu Mammoth // Kazandu Valley
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Kazandu Mammoth gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"It doesn't obey me. It cooperates with me."
—Triel, Kazandu tuskcaller

name: Turntimber Symbiosis // Turntimber, Serpentine Wood
text:
As Turntimber, Serpentine Wood enters the battlefield, you may pay 3 life. If you don't, it enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
flavor:
"The trees here twist around spikes of mana, feeding off the flowing power."
—Jori En, expedition leader

name: Ethereal Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each enchantment you control and has first strike.
flavor: Metal is scarce, smiths are pricey, and plate mail is heavy.

name: Caregiver
text: {W}, Sacrifice a creature: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: "The guilds each believe its way is right, but their ways only bring blood to Ravnica's streets and tears to Ravnica's families."

name: Divebomber Griffin
text:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice Divebomber Griffin: It deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: Justice flies swiftly on angry wings.

name: Dromad Purebred
text: Whenever Dromad Purebred is dealt damage, you gain 1 life.
flavor:
"I have seen much from the back of my dromad, most of it terribly wrong. The more I see, the more I am convinced of the rightness of my path."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

name: Festival of the Guildpact
text:
Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
Draw a card.
flavor: Everyone knows that violence at the Festival brings the worst of luck, so for at least one day a year arms are laid down in favor of brimming goblets.

name: Gate Hound
text: Creatures you control have vigilance as long as Gate Hound is enchanted.
flavor:
"Ditri, I leave this checkpoint in your capable teeth."
—Kitov, nightguard patrol

name: Ghosts of the Innocent
text: If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals half that damage, rounded down, to that permanent or player instead.
flavor:
"Ma said we should offer up blini-cakes and salt to the good ones, but I get that chill up my spine and just shut the door."
—Otak, Tin Street shopkeep

name: Leave No Trace
text: Radiance — Destroy target enchantment and each other enchantment that shares a color with it.
flavor: The magic of the Boros patrols the streets even when their soldiers do not.

name: Light of Sanction
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures you control by sources you control.
flavor: The Legion looks after its own.

name: Oathsworn Giant
text:
Vigilance
Other creatures you control get +0/+2 and have vigilance.
flavor: The town stands on his ancestors' former burial grounds. Even with the graves long gone, he continues his determined vigil.

name: Suppression Field
text: Activated abilities cost {2} more to activate unless they're mana abilities.
flavor: The most feared of Azorius punishments is to be freed—sent back out into the world, stripped of all magical defenses.

name: Wojek Apothecary
text: Radiance — {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it this turn.
flavor: "A few arrows aren't enough to pierce your faith, soldier. You'll be back on the battlefield by sun's dawn."

name: Wojek Siren
text: Radiance — Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: It is the call to arms, the call to fury, the call to blood.

name: Cerulean Sphinx
text:
Flying
{U}: Cerulean Sphinx's owner shuffles it into their library.
flavor:
"About the sphinx, I have mixed feelings. Their wisdom I crave, but their secrecy I can't tolerate."
—Szadek

name: Copy Enchantment
text: You may have Copy Enchantment enter the battlefield as a copy of any enchantment on the battlefield.
flavor: Simic mages create redundant backups of their experiments to reduce the consequences of catastrophe.

name: Drake Familiar
text:
Flying
When Drake Familiar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an enchantment to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Falconry? A fine sport I suppose, if you're attracted to the frailty of birds."
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Dream Leash
text:
Enchant permanent
You can't choose an untapped permanent as this spell's target as you cast it.
You control enchanted permanent.
flavor: The tendrils of sorcery find easy purchase on the soft underbelly of dreams.

name: Flight of Fancy
text:
Enchant creature
When Flight of Fancy enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Enchanted creature has flying.
flavor: The view from above is an inspiration to the newly winged.

name: Flow of Ideas
text: Draw a card for each Island you control.
flavor:
"A system to direct the flow of Ravnica's entire water supply? Thinking a bit small, aren't we?"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Grayscaled Gharial
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: Each tooth carries enough bacteria to kill a person in a day or two. But then, gharials do have 138 teeth.

name: Halcyon Glaze
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, Halcyon Glaze becomes a 4/4 Illusion creature with flying in addition to its other types until end of turn.
flavor:
"Earth to æther, window to wonder, stillness to the sky."
—Glazing incantation

name: Lore Broker
text: {T}: Each player draws a card, then discards a card.
flavor: Lies are sold as often as truths—and used just as effectively.

name: Mark of Eviction
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, return enchanted creature and all Auras attached to that creature to their owners' hands.
flavor: Tharashk the Bold suddenly wasn't himself. Or anyone else, for that matter.

name: Mnemonic Nexus
text: Each player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
flavor: True enlightenment comes not with a new thought, but with understanding of all the old ones.

name: Quickchange
text:
Target creature becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor: Most Ravnicans lead lives of desperate survival. Those who thrive are malleable enough to change with the ever-shifting politics of the guilds.

name: Spawnbroker
text: When Spawnbroker enters the battlefield, you may exchange control of target creature you control and target creature with power less than or equal to that creature's power an opponent controls.
flavor: "The trick isn't setting up the bad trade. It's making each side think it got the better deal."

name: Terraformer
text: {1}: Choose a basic land type. Each land you control becomes that type until end of turn.
flavor: "This feels a little more like home."

name: Wizened Snitches
text:
Flying
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
flavor:
"Be careful what information you ask them to find, for it will likely be the subject of tale time at the alehouse."
—Sirislav, Dimir spy

name: Zephyr Spirit
text: When Zephyr Spirit blocks, return it to its owner's hand.
flavor: A spiteful force exists on Ravnica that binds these ghosts to the land of the living but forbids them to touch it.

name: Carrion Howler
text: Pay 1 life: Carrion Howler gets +2/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: They chase tirelessly after the bone-carts that speed along the streets of the Plague Quarter.

name: Clinging Darkness
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -4/-1.
flavor: There's an experience worse than blindness—it's the certainty that your vision is perfect and the horror that there's no world around you to see.

name: Disembowel
text: Destroy target creature with mana value X.
flavor:
"We thought we found the victim's clothes lumped in the street. As it turned out, it *was* the victim, insides sucked out—just a sack of skin and robes."
—Agrus Kos

name: Empty the Catacombs
text: Each player returns all creature cards from their graveyard to their hand.
flavor: When the dead are laid to rest in Ravnica, it's usually just a nap.

name: Infectious Host
text: When Infectious Host dies, target player loses 2 life.
flavor:
"Lost man, dead man, knocking on the door. Cankerman, soreman, knock no more."
—Ravnican children's rhyme

name: Sewerdreg
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Sacrifice Sewerdreg: Exile target card from a graveyard.
flavor: They hardly have form, dripping through pipe and grate with the slip and stench of flowing sewage.

name: Thoughtpicker Witch
text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Look at the top two cards of target opponent's library, then exile one of them.
flavor: "Once the brew gets the brains nice and pickled, they're a lot easier to pick through."

name: Undercity Shade
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{B}: Undercity Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Officially, there's nothing under that bridge to hunt . . . . Unofficially, my torchers are too terrified to go there after nightfall."
—Agrus Kos

name: Vindictive Mob
text:
When Vindictive Mob enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
Vindictive Mob can't be blocked by Saprolings.
flavor: Many minds, a single madness.

name: Woebringer Demon
text:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature. If the player can't, sacrifice Woebringer Demon.
flavor: Each soul he devours adds its hunger to his own.

name: Barbarian Riftcutter
text: {R}, Sacrifice Barbarian Riftcutter: Destroy target land.
flavor:
"Riftcutters are suicidal anarchists, waving those lightning axes around so much that the walls are as likely to fall as their foes."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

name: Blockbuster
text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice Blockbuster: It deals 3 damage to each tapped creature and each player.
flavor: Vendors hung cords heavy with roots and laid out boxes of salted meat, unaware of the fiery disaster swiftly approaching.

name: Dogpile
text: Dogpile deals damage to any target equal to the number of attacking creatures you control.
flavor: There is no shelter from this storm, its rain of fists, or the thunderous cackles of bloodlust.

name: Excruciator
text: Damage that would be dealt by Excruciator can't be prevented.
flavor:
"Though used as a piercing weapon, the tusk is more akin to a stinger, spreading pain instantly throughout the body of its victim. This specimen deserves further study."
—Simic research notes

name: Flame Fusillade
text: Until end of turn, permanents you control gain "{T}: This permanent deals 1 damage to any target."
flavor:
"A single item acting as lantern and lance? Now *that's* military efficiency."
—Brev Grezar, Boros lieutenant

name: Greater Forgeling
text: {1}{R}: Greater Forgeling gets +3/-3 until end of turn.
flavor: Few have seen the inner workings of Ravnica's furnaces, but neighboring districts catch brief glimpses in the horrors that escape the flames.

name: Incite Hysteria
text: Radiance — Until end of turn, target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain "This creature can't block."
flavor:
"The Boros say they want to bring order to Ravnica. Funny then, how well they use chaos."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

name: Indentured Oaf
text: Prevent all damage that Indentured Oaf would deal to red creatures.
flavor: All it knows is the difference between friend and food.

name: Instill Furor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice this creature unless it attacked this turn."
flavor:
"The Rakdos know little of technology, but they definitely know how to push buttons."
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Molten Sentry
text: As Molten Sentry enters the battlefield, flip a coin. If the coin comes up heads, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 5/2 creature with haste. If it comes up tails, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 2/5 creature with defender.
flavor: Some take after their father, Stone, some after their mother, Fire.

name: Rain of Embers
text: Rain of Embers deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
