flavor: The last survivor of her patrol, the warrior returned expecting disappointment and scorn. Instead she found gratitude. "You are alive. That is reason to celebrate."

name: Viridescent Wisps
text:
Target creature becomes green and gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor: In the wisps that night, the once timid boggart saw all the terrible, bloody things he was capable of. And it was glorious.

name: Wildslayer Elves
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
flavor: Some elves battled too long in the deep shadow, their swords dipped too often in tainted flesh and poisoned blood.

name: Golgari Thug
text:
When Golgari Thug dies, put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
Dredge 4 (If you would draw a card, you may mill four cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)
flavor: "What is death?" he asked the raven. "Your next birth," it replied.

name: Life from the Loam
text:
Return up to three target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, you may mill three cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)
flavor:
"When there is no one left but the ravens, the Swarm will rise and rule all."
—Lost prophecy of Svogthir

name: Goblin Bushwhacker
text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
When Goblin Bushwhacker enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain haste until end of turn.
flavor: If you need a job done quick and extra stabby, call "McChoppy."

name: Goblin Sharpshooter
text:
Goblin Sharpshooter doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever a creature dies, untap Goblin Sharpshooter.
{T}: Goblin Sharpshooter deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: "Gunner" can't hear you over the sound of his swagger.

name: Goblin Lackey
text: Whenever Goblin Lackey deals damage to a player, you may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: "Danger" was supposed to be babysitting, so "Little Angel" became the newest member of the team.

name: Pack Rat
text:
Pack Rat's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Rats you control.
{2}{B}, Discard a card: Create a token that's a copy of Pack Rat.
flavor: A procession of gifts with no end in sight.

name: Dig Through Time
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor: No matter how deep the treasure is buried, Hunter can always sniff it out.

name: Dryad of the Ilysian Grove
text:
You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
Lands you control are every basic land type in addition to their other types.
flavor:
"Vine-wreathed, he nurtures life among the dead."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet

name: Chatter of the Squirrel
text:
Create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: Some rumors are just plain nuts.

name: Liliana, Death's Majesty
text:
[+1]: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token. Mill two cards.
[−3]: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
[−7]: Destroy all non-Zombie creatures.
flavor: Death is no excuse for disobedience

name: Meandering Towershell
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Whenever Meandering Towershell attacks, exile it. Return it to the battlefield under your control tapped and attacking at the beginning of the declare attackers step on your next turn.
flavor: The wait is proportional to the weight.

name: Toshiro Umezawa
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may cast target instant card from your graveyard. If that spell would be put into a graveyard, exile it instead.
flavor: Though only looking out for himself, Toshiro ended up saving all of Kamigawa.

name: Carpet of Flowers
text: At the beginning of each of your main phases, if you haven't added mana with this ability this turn, you may add X mana of any one color, where X is the number of Islands target opponent controls.
flavor: Winds through silent bloom

name: Karmic Guide
text:
Flying, protection from black
Echo {3}{W}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Karmic Guide enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: Just one moment more

name: Managorger Hydra
text:
Trample
Whenever a player casts a spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Managorger Hydra.
flavor:
"Whoever said two heads are better than one never met a hydra before."
—Crocodile Jackson, legendary cowboy

name: Whir of Invention
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Search your library for an artifact card with mana value X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: "Magic hat, I'm gonna be frank. What we need now is a twenty-ton tank!"

name: Mulldrifter
text:
Flying
When Mulldrifter enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Evoke {2}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
flavor: "Be you, be free, live happily!"

name: Propaganda // Propaganda
text: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
flavor:
"Obedience is the true path to happiness."
—Dolorus, magister equitum

name: Mystic Remora
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, you may draw a card unless that player pays {4}.
flavor: The bond between spellcaster and familiar allows the mage to detect even the smallest of magical ripples—and use them to their advantage.

name: Retreat to Coralhelm
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —
• You may tap or untap target creature.
• Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor: Their Enclave overrun, the merfolk took refuge within beauty.

name: Hokori, Dust Drinker
text:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land they control.
flavor: "Dust Drinker," "The Swirling Storm," "The Searing Wind"—Hokori had many names, but none of them was "The Merciful."

name: Triumph of the Hordes
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample and infect. (Creatures with infect deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: I don't know how I got here, but I'l be the last one standing.

name: Seize the Day
text:
Untap target creature. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor:
"I wish I could say it gets easier, kiddo, but I'd be lying."
—Vander

name: Mikaeus, the Unhallowed
text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Whenever a Human deals damage to you, destroy it.
Other non-Human creatures you control get +1/+1 and have undying. (When a creature with undying dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: Once a servant of the light, now a slave to the dark.

name: Lurking Crocodile
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor:
"Preying on unsuspecting goobers, this crocodile is the only foe to ever best me in a knife fight."
—Crocodile Jackson, legendary cowboy

name: Persistent Petitioners
text:
{1}, {T}: Target player mills a card.
Tap four untapped Advisors you control: Target player mills twelve cards.
A deck can have any number of cards named Persistent Petitioners.
flavor: ". . . we will no longer sit idly by, fearing for our lives! To that end . . ."

name: Havengul Laboratory // Havengul Mystery
text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{4}, {T}: Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
At the beginning of your end step, if you sacrificed three or more Clues this turn, transform Havengul Laboratory.
flavor:
"Today, we make history. Today, we make contact."
—Dr. Martin Brenner

name: Pulmonic Sliver
text:
All Sliver creatures have flying.
All Slivers have "If this permanent would be put into a graveyard, you may put it on top of its owner's library instead."
flavor: Like a great bellows it hisses, and its kin, both living and dead, are lifted to safety.

name: Mesmeric Sliver
text: All Slivers have "When this permanent enters the battlefield, you may fateseal 1." (To fateseal 1, its controller looks at the top card of an opponent's library, then they may put that card on the bottom of that library.)
flavor:
"Wait, where am I? Who am I? And what are you?"
—Skyshroud secretkeeper, last words

name: Shadow Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have shadow. (They can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: These slivers, trapped between worlds since the Rathi overlay, are among the last to claim direct lineage from the lost Sliver Queen.

name: Telekinetic Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{T}: Tap target permanent."
flavor:
"Slivers are guided only by simple instinct. Advance the hive, and you will be welcomed. Impede the hive, and you will face unrelenting opposition."
—Freyalise

name: Basal Sliver
text: All Slivers have "Sacrifice this permanent: Add {B}{B}."
flavor:
"Fascinating . . . These creatures display the paradox of tenacity and purposed self-destruction I have sought to breed into my thrulls."
—Endrek Sahr, master breeder

name: Dregscape Sliver
text:
Each Sliver creature card in your graveyard has unearth {2}.
Unearth {2} ({2}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)
flavor:
"A colony of horrors lurks beneath the mire. One must move deliberately with every ste—"
—Loamlair guide, last words

name: Plague Sliver
text: All Slivers have "At the beginning of your upkeep, this permanent deals 1 damage to you."
flavor: A sliver shares everything with its hive—even its afflictions.

name: Homing Sliver
text:
Each Sliver card in each player's hand has slivercycling {3}.
Slivercycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Sliver card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.)
flavor:
"Where did *you* come from?"
—Otarian hunter, last words

name: Two-Headed Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor:
"That which would be a fatal mutation in any other species is merely a source of new powers. I am intrigued, yet too fearful to examine it more closely."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Horned Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have trample.
flavor: A bristling wave of slivers broke against the *Weatherlight's* timbers.

name: Virulent Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have poisonous 1. (Whenever a Sliver deals combat damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter. A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
flavor:
"They actually have venom, not poison. If they were poisonous, a single drop would—IT BURNS! IT BURNS!"
—Riptide researcher, last words

name: Tireless Tracker
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
Whenever you sacrifice a Clue, put a +1/+1 counter on Tireless Tracker.
flavor:
"Tell me, Muse, of that man, so ready at need, who wandered far and wide."
—Homer, *The Odyssey*

name: Berserk
text:
Cast this spell only before the combat damage step.
Target creature gains trample and gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power. At the beginning of the next end step, destroy that creature if it attacked this turn.
flavor: Das Erste, was ich spüre, ist die Wut — und dann kommt die Kraft.

name: Solve the Equation
text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor:
"Whoever Tezzeret is working with is after more than the Emperor."
—Tamiyo

name: Veil of Summer
text: Draw a card if an opponent has cast a blue or black spell this turn. Spells you control can't be countered this turn. You and permanents you control gain hexproof from blue and from black until end of turn. (You and they can't be the targets of blue or black spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor:
"I won't tell you or anyone else where my son is. Ever."
—Tamiyo

name: Aggravated Assault
text: {3}{R}{R}: Untap all creatures you control. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: Despite being more cunning than most Orks, Kaptin Badrukk still recognizes that some plans just need more dakka.

name: Toothy, Imaginary Friend
text:
Partner with Pir, Imaginative Rascal (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Pir into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Whenever you draw a card, put a +1/+1 counter on Toothy, Imaginary Friend.
When Toothy leaves the battlefield, draw a card for each +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Go ahead, tell it that it isn't real.

name: Pir, Imaginative Rascal
text:
Partner with Toothy, Imaginary Friend (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Toothy into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
If one or more counters would be put on a permanent your team controls, that many plus one of each of those kinds of counters are put on that permanent instead.
flavor: Pir always had a *very *big imagination.

name: Repercussion
text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, Repercussion deals that much damage to that creature's controller.
flavor: "Tyrants will always suffer consequences. My favorite are the fiery ones."

name: Stasis
text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.
flavor: The universe let out a sigh of relief.

name: Lathliss, Dragon Queen
text:
Flying
Whenever another nontoken Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.
{1}{R}: Dragons you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: If you saw her, you'd go "AAAHHHH!"

name: Geralf's Messenger
text:
Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield tapped.
When Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor: The message is "Run."

name: Angelic Observer
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Citizen you control.
Flying
flavor: Still and solemn as the statues of her kind that decorated the Park Heights rooftops, she gazed in sorrow on the city below.

name: Backup Agent
text: When Backup Agent enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor: "My sources say the Beamtown Bullies were spotted in the Mezzio. Keep your eyes sharp and stay close to me."

name: Ballroom Brawlers
text: Whenever Ballroom Brawlers attacks, Ballroom Brawlers and up to one other target creature you control both gain your choice of first strike or lifelink until end of turn.
flavor: Don't try to cut in. They'll cut back.

name: Boon of Safety
text:
Put a shield counter on target creature. (If it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.)
Scry 1.
flavor:
"Saving a stranger's life is an excellent recruitment method. Luckily, peril is so easy to come by."
—Falco Spara

name: Buy Your Silence
text: Exile target nonland permanent. Its controller creates a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor: Mikey "the Mouth" kept his nickname after he struck a deal with Gregorio, even though he never spoke another word.

name: Celebrity Fencer
text: Alliance — Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Celebrity Fencer.
flavor: After a brief but memorable incident at her first performance, she was never heckled again.

name: A-Celebrity Fencer
text: Alliance — Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Celebrity Fencer.
flavor: After a brief but memorable incident at her first performance, she was never heckled again.

name: Dapper Shieldmate
text:
Dapper Shieldmate enters the battlefield with a shield counter on it. (If it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.)
As long as it's your turn, Dapper Shieldmate gets +2/+0.
flavor: Descended from Old Capenna's paladins, the Brokers are masters of defensive combat.

name: Gathering Throng
text: When Gathering Throng enters the battlefield, you may search your library for any number of cards named Gathering Throng, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: A plus-one is simply not enough.

name: Hold for Ransom
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block and has "{7}: Hold for Ransom's controller sacrifices it and draws a card. Activate only as a sorcery."
flavor:
"Let's find out how much your friends think you're worth."
—Gino, hired kidnapper

name: Illuminator Virtuoso
text:
Double strike
Whenever Illuminator Virtuoso becomes the target of a spell you control, it connives. (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
flavor: The Obscura reserve their keenest blades for traitors in their midst.

name: Knockout Blow
text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if it targets a red creature.
Knockout Blow deals 4 damage to target attacking or blocking creature and you gain 2 life.
flavor: "Subsequent efforts to deconstruct this facility will be punished with increasing severity."

name: Patch Up
text: Return up to three target creature cards with total mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "Don't tell me who sent you or who you work for. The less I know, the better."

name: Raffine's Informant
text: When Raffine's Informant enters the battlefield, it connives. (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
flavor: "I've analyzed the vault schematic. Do you want the fast way, the easy way, or the secret way in?"

name: Refuse to Yield
text: Target creature gets +2/+7 until end of turn. Untap it.
flavor: Her opponent threw her through the window, so she retaliated by throwing the window through her opponent.

name: Revelation of Power
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it has a counter on it, it also gains flying and lifelink until end of turn.
flavor: As Ob Nixilis closed in, Halo swept through Giada like an electrical current, and inside her, something long dormant unfurled its wings.

name: Sky Crier
text:
Flying, lifelink
{3}{W}: You and target opponent each draw a card.
flavor: "Breaking news! Lord Xander found dead! Suspect at large!"

name: Speakeasy Server
text:
Flying
When Speakeasy Server enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each other creature you control.
flavor: "Whatever ails you, friends, this will cure it for tonight! And leave you with a little inspiration for tomorrow."

name: A-Speakeasy Server
text:
Flying
When Speakeasy Server enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.
flavor: "Whatever ails you, friends, this will cure it for tonight! And leave you with a little inspiration for tomorrow."

name: Backstreet Bruiser
text:
Defender
As long as there are two or more counters among creatures you control, Backstreet Bruiser can attack as though it didn't have defender.
flavor: "I could show you what's in the case, but it'd be the last thing you ever see."

name: Brokers Veteran
text: When Brokers Veteran dies, put a shield counter on target creature you control. (If it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.)
flavor: One last job before he retires.

name: Case the Joint
text: Draw two cards, then look at the top card of each player's library.
flavor: Steel doors and iron bars are child's play for an Obscura operative.

name: A-Case the Joint
text: Draw three cards, then look at the top card of each player's library.
flavor: Steel doors and iron bars are child's play for an Obscura operative.

name: Echo Inspector
text:
Flying
When Echo Inspector enters the battlefield, it connives. (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
flavor: The rendezvous took place hours ago, but the Obscura agent read the residue with ease.

name: Expendable Lackey
text: {1}{U}, Exile Expendable Lackey from your graveyard: Create a 1/1 blue Fish creature token with "This creature can't be blocked." Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor:
"Altonio? No, I'm sorry. No one by that name works here."
—Raffine

name: Hypnotic Grifter
text: {3}: Hypnotic Grifter connives. (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
flavor: "All is calm. All is well. You know me to be a trusted member of your family, and I would like to discuss the contents of our safe."

name: Majestic Metamorphosis
text:
Until end of turn, target artifact or creature becomes a 4/4 Angel artifact creature and gains flying.
Draw a card.
flavor: New Capenna's statues hold Old Capenna's secrets.

name: An Offer You Can't Refuse
text: Counter target noncreature spell. Its controller creates two Treasure tokens. (They're artifacts with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor: Elspeth wanted answers. Xander needed a spy. Their paths were destined to cross.

name: Out of the Way
text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if it targets a green permanent.
Return target nonland permanent an opponent controls to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
flavor: "You bore me."

name: Psionic Snoop
text:
Flash
When Psionic Snoop enters the battlefield, it connives. (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
flavor: She knows your next move before you do.

name: A-Psionic Snoop
text:
Flash
When Psionic Snoop enters the battlefield, it connives. (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
flavor: She knows your next move before you do.

name: Public Enemy
text:
Enchant creature
All creatures attack enchanted creature's controller each combat if able.
When enchanted creature dies, draw a card.
flavor: Every Halo smuggler walks a razor's edge between untold riches and sudden disaster.

name: A-Public Enemy
text:
Enchant creature
All creatures attack enchanted creature's controller each combat if able.
When enchanted creature dies, draw two cards.
flavor: Every Halo smuggler walks a razor's edge between untold riches and sudden disaster.

name: Run Out of Town
text: The owner of target nonland permanent puts it on the top or bottom of their library.
flavor: Better to depart in haste than be dearly departed.

name: Sewer Crocodile
text: {3}{U}: Sewer Crocodile can't be blocked this turn. This ability costs {3} less to activate if there are five or more mana values among cards in your graveyard.
flavor:
"Quick, let's hide in the sewer!"
—Ginsi the Thief, now deceased

name: A-Sewer Crocodile
text: {3}{U}: Sewer Crocodile can't be blocked this turn. This ability costs {3} less to activate if there are five or more mana values among cards in your graveyard.
flavor:
"Quick, let's hide in the sewer!"
—Ginsi the Thief, now deceased

name: Slip Out the Back
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. It phases out. (Treat it and anything attached to it as though they don't exist until its controller's next turn.)
flavor: "I was never here."

name: Corrupt Court Official
text: When Corrupt Court Official enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
flavor:
"I wouldn't call what they have here a justice system. More like an auction."
—Elspeth

name: Crooked Custodian
text: Crooked Custodian enters the battlefield tapped.
flavor: "Nothing to see here. Just carrying a carpet. Yes, the carpet wears boots. Stop asking questions."

name: Cutthroat Contender
text: Pay 1 life: Cutthroat Contender gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: The fights may sometimes be rigged, but the front-row spectators know the wounds are real.

name: Deal Gone Bad
text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn. Target player mills three cards. (They put the top three cards of their library into their graveyard.)
flavor:
"Feed the rumor mills with delicious treachery. Bad blood between those two is a good deal for us."
—Kamiz, Obscura Oculus

name: Demon's Due
text: Scry 2, then draw two cards. You lose 2 life.
flavor: Ob Nixilis extends his hand not in partnership, but to affirm your subservience.

name: A-Demon's Due
text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. You lose 2 life.
flavor: Ob Nixilis extends his hand not in partnership, but to affirm your subservience.

name: Graveyard Shift
text:
This spell has flash as long as there are five or more mana values among cards in your graveyard.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "Up and at 'em, buddy. We've got more work to do."

name: Illicit Shipment
text:
Casualty 3 (As you cast this spell, you may sacrifice a creature with power 3 or greater. When you do, copy this spell.)
Search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Whatever the Maestros had ordered, it wasn't anyone's business, including his.

name: Incriminate
text: Choose two target creatures controlled by the same player. That player sacrifices one of them.
flavor:
"If I were you, I'd check that elf's coat. I saw him slipping something into his pocket just before you arrived."
—Krandal, freelance instigator

name: Join the Maestros
text:
Casualty 2 (As you cast this spell, you may sacrifice a creature with power 2 or greater. When you do, copy this spell.)
Create a 4/3 black Ogre Warrior creature token.
flavor: "We're family now, big guy."

name: Midnight Assassin
text: Flying, deathtouch
flavor: The broad avenues and graceful spires of Park Heights are the playground of the affluent. After nightfall, they also make a fine hunting ground.

name: Rogues' Gallery
text: For each color, return up to one target creature card of that color from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Between the five of them, they'd committed every crime on the books and invented a few new ones.

name: Vampire Scrivener
text:
Flying
Whenever you gain life during your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Vampire Scrivener.
Whenever you lose life during your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Vampire Scrivener.
flavor: No one remains on her list for long.

name: A-Vampire Scrivener
text:
Flying
Whenever you gain life during your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Vampire Scrivener.
Whenever you lose life during your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Vampire Scrivener.
flavor: No one remains on her list for long.

name: Whack
text:
This spell costs {3} less to cast if it targets a white creature.
Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
flavor: "It's just business. You understand."

name: Antagonize
text: Target creature gets +4/+3 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The little guy had guts at least. You can see 'em right there between those cobbles."
—Glunk, freelance crusher

name: Call In a Professional
text: Players can't gain life this turn. Damage can't be prevented this turn. Call In a Professional deals 3 damage to any target. (Shield counters don't prevent this damage as they're removed.)
flavor: For the next week, Park Heights smelled of burnt oil paint and brimstone.

name: Daring Escape
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. Scry 1.
flavor: As the Adversary's forces descended upon the gala, Elspeth whispered to Giada, "I can get you out of here, but we have to go now."

name: Glittering Stockpile
text:
{T}: Add {R}. Put a stash counter on Glittering Stockpile.
{T}, Sacrifice Glittering Stockpile: Add X mana of any one color, where X is the number of stash counters on Glittering Stockpile.
flavor: The only thing Ziatora desires is "more."

name: Jackhammer
text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
flavor:
"Subtlety is overrated."
—Mr. Orfeo, the Boulder

name: Ready to Rumble
text:
Choose one —
• Ready to Rumble deals 5 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
• Destroy target artifact.
flavor:
"It's too quiet tonight. Go make trouble."
—Ziatora

name: Rob the Archives
text:
Casualty 1 (As you cast this spell, you may sacrifice a creature with power 1 or greater. When you do, copy this spell.)
Exile the top two cards of your library. You may play those cards this turn.
flavor: "Well, I guess stealth's out of the question."

name: Strangle
text: Strangle deals 3 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
flavor: They'd warned him greed would be the death of him. He never thought to take it literally.

name: Torch Breath
text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if it targets a blue permanent.
This spell can't be countered.
Torch Breath deals X damage to target creature or planeswalker.
flavor: "Fried squid, comin' up!"

name: Unlucky Witness
text: When Unlucky Witness dies, exile the top two cards of your library. Until your next end step, you may play one of those cards.
flavor: The guard took a midnight shift to earn a promotion. Unfortunately, so did the assassin.

name: Witty Roastmaster
text: Alliance — Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Witty Roastmaster deals 1 damage to each opponent.
flavor: If you're lucky, you'll walk out with just your ego singed.

name: Wrecking Crew
text: Reach, trample
flavor: They built the neighborhood. They know its weak points. They know all the hiding places. When they come for you, they'll find you and bring the roof down on your head.

name: Attended Socialite
text: Alliance — Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Attended Socialite gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Say hello to my little friend."

name: Civic Gardener
text: Whenever Civic Gardener attacks, untap target creature or land.
flavor: "I've told you knuckleheads a hundred times: You can kill 'em here, but bury the bodies somewhere else. If you disturb my prized azaleas again, you'd better dig a second hole for yourself!"

name: Elegant Entourage
text: Alliance — Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, target creature other than Elegant Entourage gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: "Terribly sorry, but this is a private party, and your name isn't on the list."

name: For the Family
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If you control four or more creatures, that creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead.
flavor: The Cabaretti cultivate an image of harmless hedonism, happy for the other families to underestimate their formidable firepower.

name: Freelance Muscle
text: Whenever Freelance Muscle attacks or blocks, it gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the greatest power and/or toughness among other creatures you control.
flavor: He never asks why. Just who, when, and where.

name: Glittermonger
text: {T}: Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor: Street corners in the Mezzio are a tantalizing bazaar of the fantastic, the illicit, and the fake.

name: High-Rise Sawjack
text:
Reach
Whenever High-Rise Sawjack blocks a creature with flying, High-Rise Sawjack gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Slicing girders, rescuing trapped workers, killing gigantic rust flies—one tool does it all!

name: Jewel Thief
text:
Vigilance, trample
When Jewel Thief enters the battlefield, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor: "They can afford the loss. They build it into their prices."

name: Luxurious Libation
text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn. Create a 1/1 green and white Citizen creature token.
flavor:
"Crisp, flavorful, and energizing. Perhaps the most elegant offering of Halo in Park Heights. Five stars."
—Conzuelo, restaurant critic

name: Most Wanted
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
When enchanted creature dies, create two Treasure tokens.
flavor: Overnight, Elspeth was branded the most dangerous criminal in New Capenna.

name: Prizefight
text:
Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor: Underweight, underpaid, underestimated.

name: Rhox Pummeler
text:
Rhox Pummeler enters the battlefield with a shield counter on it. (If it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.)
Rhox Pummeler has trample as long as it has a shield counter on it.
flavor: When all you have is a warhammer, every face looks like a nail.

name: Riveteers Decoy
text:
Riveteers Decoy must be blocked if able.
Blitz {3}{G} (If you cast this spell for its blitz cost, it gains haste and "When this creature dies, draw a card." Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.)
flavor: He keeps the heat off his allies—by drawing it all to himself.

name: Social Climber
text: Alliance — Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
flavor: "It's all about who you know, darling. And now you're lucky enough to know me."

name: Take to the Streets
text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn. Citizens you control get an additional +1/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn.
flavor: No institution, however grand, can withstand the collective will of the people.

name: Warm Welcome
text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. Create a 1/1 green and white Citizen creature token.
flavor: "Welcome to the family. Chef Rocco sends their congratulations."

name: Avacynian Missionaries // Lunarch Inquisitors
text: At the beginning of your end step, if Avacynian Missionaries is equipped, transform it.
flavor: "We come bearing the word of Avacyn and the Lunarch Council."

name: Chaplain's Blessing
text: You gain 5 life.
flavor: "There was a time when the purpose of the church was to heal and protect. I would see that time return."

name: Ethereal Guidance
text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"The call of the Blessed Sleep is not so strong as the call to protect those in need."
—Saint Traft

name: Hope Against Hope
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each creature you control.
As long as enchanted creature is a Human, it has first strike.
flavor: "I have given my life to the church, my soul to Avacyn, and my heart to the people."

name: Humble the Brute
text:
Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
Investigate. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor: "The element of surprise only works when it's backed up by a bolt between the eyes."

name: Militant Inquisitor
text: Militant Inquisitor gets +1/+0 for each Equipment you control.
flavor: "I am an instrument of the church wielded against Avacyn's enemies."

name: Moorland Drifter
text: Delirium — Moorland Drifter has flying as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor: It has no apparent purpose or direction. It simply drifts, buoyed by breezes both tangible and otherworldly.

name: Paranoid Parish-Blade
text: Delirium — Paranoid Parish-Blade gets +1/+0 and has first strike as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor: The mind is perfectly capable of creating its own monsters.

name: Silverstrike
text: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain 3 life.
flavor:
"Shield yourself with faith. Arm yourself with silver."
—Slayer Kastinne

name: Stern Constable
text: {T}, Discard a card: Tap target creature.
flavor: "I'm sure you have a story. Everyone has a story. You can tell it to the bars."

name: Tenacity
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain lifelink until end of turn. Untap those creatures.
flavor: Thalia established the Order of Saint Traft in an effort to bring together cathars who would stand against the corruption of the Lunarch Council.

name: Vessel of Ephemera
text: {2}{W}, Sacrifice Vessel of Ephemera: Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
flavor: Geists seeking redemption must first be given the opportunity.

name: Aberrant Researcher // Perfected Form
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, mill a card. If an instant or sorcery card was milled this way, transform Aberrant Researcher.
flavor:
"Metamorphosis is a process."
—Laboratory notes

name: Broken Concentration
text:
Counter target spell.
Madness {3}{U} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: Some minds bend under pressure. Others break.

name: Daring Sleuth // Bearer of Overwhelming Truths
text: When you sacrifice a Clue, transform Daring Sleuth.
flavor: "No matter the cost, I must discover the source of these strange happenings."

name: Deny Existence
text: Counter target creature spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
flavor: When all logical solutions fail, try an illogical one.

name: Furtive Homunculus
text: Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
flavor:
"In terms of intelligence, homunculi are somewhere between humans and skaabs—clever enough to follow more complex orders, but dim enough to not question them."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Just the Wind
text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Madness {U} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: "There's nothing to worry about."

name: Lamplighter of Selhoff
text: When Lamplighter of Selhoff enters the battlefield, if you control another Zombie, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
flavor: For stitchers and necro-alchemists, it's important that work can continue at all hours.

name: Pieces of the Puzzle
text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. Put up to two instant and/or sorcery cards from among them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor: "The clues have begun to reveal a truth I hesitate to accept."

name: Seagraf Skaab
flavor:
"Your recent work is an inspiration. I have the utmost respect for your approach, and your craft is impeccable. At your convenience, I would be honored to collaborate on a project."
—Ludevic, letter to Geralf

name: Silburlind Snapper
text: Silburlind Snapper can't attack unless you've cast a noncreature spell this turn.
flavor: Nephalia is home to many hard-shelled creatures of unusual size, the largest of which are either avoided or worshipped.

name: Stitchwing Skaab
text:
Flying
{1}{U}, Discard two cards: Return Stitchwing Skaab from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
flavor:
"Amazing, isn't it, how scraps can come together to create such a wonder?"
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Uninvited Geist // Unimpeded Trespasser
text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
When Uninvited Geist deals combat damage to a player, transform it.
flavor: A slow knock at midnight is best left unanswered.

name: Vessel of Paramnesia
text: {U}, Sacrifice Vessel of Paramnesia: Target player mills three cards. Draw a card.
flavor:
"Write everything down. Trust me."
—Vallon, Thraben inspector

name: Biting Rain
text:
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Madness {2}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: On Innistrad, it is seldom wrong to stay indoors.

name: Ghoulsteed
text: {2}{B}, Discard two cards: Return Ghoulsteed from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
flavor: It once served a cathar roadwatcher, patrolling the crossways between villages. Its hooves still carry it along the same path.

name: Gisa's Bidding
text:
Create two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.
Madness {2}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: "Soft dirt makes for light work."

name: Heir of Falkenrath // Heir to the Night
text: Discard a card: Transform Heir of Falkenrath. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: Among vampires, there has long been the belief that the urge to feed must be balanced by the poise of nobility.

name: Indulgent Aristocrat
text:
Lifelink
{2}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on each Vampire you control.
flavor: "If you're not surrounded by decadence, my question to you is—why not?"

name: Kindly Stranger // Demon-Possessed Witch
text: Delirium — {2}{B}: Transform Kindly Stranger. Activate only if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor: "I'm not afraid out here, for I know that a higher power protects me."

name: Liliana's Indignation
text: Mill X cards. Target player loses 2 life for each creature card put into your graveyard this way.
flavor: "Days ago, you came to my door asking for help, Jace. Yet now here you are with accusations?"

name: Morkrut Necropod
text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever Morkrut Necropod attacks or blocks, sacrifice another creature or land.
flavor:
"There's not enough salt in all of Nephalia to wither that thing."
—Ghoulcaller Enslow

name: Pale Rider of Trostad
text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
When Pale Rider of Trostad enters the battlefield, discard a card.
flavor:
"What's worse than being alone on the moors at night? Try *not* being alone."
—Nadila Maas, moor chaplain

name: Rancid Rats
text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor: "They're in the walls! Can't you hear them?"

name: Rottenheart Ghoul
text: When Rottenheart Ghoul dies, target player discards a card.
flavor:
"To die failing to save a loved one is just so sad—or, more to the point, pathetic."
—Liliana Vess

name: Shamble Back
text: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token. You gain 2 life.
flavor: Lost loved ones are never truly gone.

name: Sinister Concoction
text: {B}, Pay 1 life, Mill a card, Discard a card, Sacrifice Sinister Concoction: Destroy target creature.
flavor: An old family recipe for an old family grudge.

name: Stromkirk Mentor
text: When Stromkirk Mentor enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on another target Vampire you control.
flavor: The lineage of Runo Stromkirk is known for producing some of Nephalia's greatest fencing masters.

name: Breakneck Rider // Neck Breaker
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Breakneck Rider.
flavor: Only the most skillful riders brave the Breakneck Ride through Kessig.

name: Convicted Killer // Branded Howler
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Convicted Killer.
flavor: None are more dangerous than those who have already been sentenced to death.

name: Dissension in the Ranks
text: Target blocking creature fights another target blocking creature.
flavor:
"It came on as quickly as taking in a breath of air. Cathars who had fought shoulder to shoulder were at each other's throats. They were not themselves."
—Halmig, Order of Saint Traft

name: Ember-Eye Wolf
text:
Haste
{1}{R}: Ember-Eye Wolf gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: No howl. No snarl. Just the roar of flames.

name: Gatstaf Arsonists // Gatstaf Ravagers
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Gatstaf Arsonists.
flavor: The glow in their eyes reveals more than anger or madness.

name: Howlpack Wolf
text: Howlpack Wolf can't block unless you control another Wolf or Werewolf.
flavor: Wolves and werewolves join together for the common cause of the hunt.

name: Inner Struggle
text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
flavor:
"Reflect upon your evils lest they reflect upon you."
—Inquisitor Laerin

name: Sanguinary Mage
text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: New cults rising in Nephalia have found allies in the Stromkirk bloodline, whose progenitor worships ancient and terrible forces.

name: Skin Invasion // Skin Shedder
flavor:
"Patient complained of burning sensation in upper back and at base of neck. Bed rest recommended. In a couple days, he should feel like a new man."
—Lagra, hamlet physician

name: Spiteful Motives
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has first strike.
flavor: Having infiltrated the Lunarch Council, the Skirsdag await the perfect moment to strike.

name: Structural Distortion
text: Exile target artifact or land. Structural Distortion deals 2 damage to that permanent's controller.
flavor:
"As Zendikar has bled, so will Innistrad. As I have wept, so will Sorin."
—Nahiri

name: Village Messenger // Moonrise Intruder
text:
Haste
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Village Messenger.
flavor: "I'm afraid it's bad news."

name: Confront the Unknown
text: Investigate, then target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Clue you control. (Create a Clue token. It's an artifact with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
flavor:
"Never flinch from the truth."
—Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Equestrian Skill
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
As long as enchanted creature is a Human, it has trample.
flavor: From the jagged peaks of Stensia, to the tangled woods of Kessig, to the bogs of Nephalia, the Gavony Riders prepare for all terrain.

name: Fork in the Road
text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and reveal them. Put one into your hand and the other into your graveyard. Then shuffle.
flavor:
"This is as far as I go."
—Beckram, Skiltfolk escort

name: Graf Mole
text: Whenever you sacrifice a Clue, you gain 3 life.
flavor:
"Their keen sense of smell draws them to the unnatural. To find one is a boon."
—Veka, hinterland inspector

name: Hermit of the Natterknolls // Lone Wolf of the Natterknolls
text:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell during your turn, draw a card.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hermit of the Natterknolls.
flavor: He hates company . . .

name: Hinterland Logger // Timber Shredder
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hinterland Logger.
flavor:
"There's a forester lives up in the highlands. Tried to sell her one of my finest axes at a bargain, but she wasn't interested."
—Old Rutstein

name: Howlpack Resurgence
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Each creature you control that's a Wolf or a Werewolf gets +1/+1 and has trample.
flavor: The renewed howling of werewolves announced the end of the Cursemute—and the beginning of Avacyn's madness.

name: Intrepid Provisioner
text:
Trample
When Intrepid Provisioner enters the battlefield, another target Human you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: "How do I know where aid is needed? Look around you."

name: Kessig Dire Swine
text: Delirium — Kessig Dire Swine has trample as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor: In the quiet of the Somberwald, new horrors stir.

name: Lambholt Pacifist // Lambholt Butcher
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Lambholt Butcher.
flavor: True peace can't be achieved until everyone else is dead.

name: Loam Dryad
text: {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Add one mana of any color.
flavor:
"I've never known dryads to suffer visitors in their woods. Beware the Ulvenwald when she welcomes you."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Moldgraf Scavenger
text: Delirium — Moldgraf Scavenger gets +3/+0 as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
flavor:
"When I was a child, we worried about picking the wrong mushrooms for the cook pot. Now we must worry about being picked ourselves."
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Quilled Wolf
text: {5}{G}: Quilled Wolf gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
flavor:
"I know a ranger that thought to make a cloak of its hide. He ended up losing an eye for his trouble."
—Raf Gyel of the Quiver of Kessig

name: Solitary Hunter // One of the Pack
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Solitary Hunter.
flavor: "Making a living in Kessig is hard, but I've learned some tricks of the trade."

name: Aether Shockwave
text:
Choose one —
• Tap all Spirits.
• Tap all non-Spirit creatures.
flavor:
"The strain upon the veil between worlds began to show near the end of the Kami War. Strange happenings that neither side could control lashed out across Kamigawa."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Araba Mothrider
text:
Flying
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"My finest creations are fashioned after the moths of Eiganjo. They fly higher, faster, and more gracefully than any of my own designs."
—Noboru, master kitemaker

name: Curtain of Light
text:
Cast this spell only during combat after blockers are declared.
Target unblocked attacking creature becomes blocked. (This spell works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Paint gold upon the wind, Shape the wind into a shield, And vanish behind the brightness."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Descendant of Kiyomaro
text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Descendant of Kiyomaro gets +1/+2 and has "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain 3 life."
flavor: "The blood of Kiyomaro flows in my veins. He did not let Eiganjo fall and neither shall I."

name: Eiganjo Free-Riders
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a white creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"The air filled with dust and the sound of wingbeats. The mothriders had joined the fray."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Hand of Honor
text:
Protection from black
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "The sword is just a tool. It is the samurai's hand that brings it to life."

name: Inner-Chamber Guard
text: Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"It seems that each time I visit Lord Konda his guards are more on edge, perhaps even more eager for the war to reach them."
—Masako the Humorless

name: Kitsune Bonesetter
text: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Activate only if you have more cards in hand than each opponent.
flavor:
"He kept generations whole before the Kami War, and now he turns his century of wisdom to healing the latest casualties."
—Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Kitsune Loreweaver
text: {1}{W}: Kitsune Loreweaver gets +0/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: "Know your history. The lessons of the past will shield you in times of doubt."

name: Moonwing Moth
text:
Flying
{W}: Moonwing Moth gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Night wings sprinkled with dust Of a thousand soldiers dead And a thousand cities fallen."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Plow Through Reito
text: Sweep — Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.
flavor: The paths of the kami crisscrossed Kamigawa like scars left by a maddened surgeon.

name: Presence of the Wise
text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
flavor: "Humbly I bow. Silently I wait. Deeply I listen."

name: Reverence
text: Creatures with power 2 or less can't attack you.
flavor:
"Despite the massive forces that allied against him, Konda never once believed he would lose the Kami War."
—Masako the Humorless

name: Cut the Earthly Bond
text: Return target enchanted permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"The more kami that passed through the veil that separated them from our world, the weaker that veil became, threatening to tear into tatters at the slightest pressure."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Descendant of Soramaro
text: {1}{U}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of cards in your hand, then put them back in any order.
flavor: "Soramaro speaks through me. Listen! And I will tell the wisdom of the ancestors."

name: Dreamcatcher
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may sacrifice Dreamcatcher. If you do, draw a card.
flavor:
"Be careful where your mind wanders. Even in the quietest moments, the kami are listening, and your thoughts give them shape."
—Lady Azami

name: Ideas Unbound
text: Draw three cards. Discard three cards at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: The apprentice stared in puzzlement. "But Master, you finished writing those spells just yesterday. Don't you remember?" The jushi's heart froze.

name: Meishin, the Mind Cage
text: All creatures get -X/-0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: It's dangerous indeed to be lost in someone else's thoughts.

name: Oboro Breezecaller
text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Untap target land.
flavor:
"I feel their unnatural influence in the weary, weeping land. Do they care nothing for the creatures who walk below their clouds?"
—Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Oppressive Will
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.
flavor: When Minamo was abandoned, its younger students found themselves thrust into a war beyond their skill with talents beyond their control.

name: Rushing-Tide Zubera
text: When Rushing-Tide Zubera dies, if 4 or more damage was dealt to it this turn, draw three cards.
flavor: Cut off from the kakuriyo by the destruction of their honden, the zubera sought new ways to bring their secrets home.

name: Secretkeeper
text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Secretkeeper gets +2/+2 and has flying.
flavor: It is all the things that humanity was not meant to know.

name: Shape Stealer
text: Whenever Shape Stealer blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, change Shape Stealer's base power and toughness to that creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
flavor:
"Stand back. I know just what to do."
—Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker

name: Trusted Advisor
text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by two.
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a blue creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Some of Minamo's students claimed he was as old as the knowledge he dispensed.

name: Choice of Damnations
text: Target opponent chooses a number. You may have that player lose that much life. If you don't, that player sacrifices all but that many permanents.
flavor:
"Life is a series of choices between bad and worse."
—Toshiro Umezawa

name: Deathmask Nezumi
text: As long as you have seven or more cards in hand, Deathmask Nezumi gets +2/+1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor:
"We had him cornered, we did . . . and, well, you know what they say about rats."
—Araba patrol survivor

name: Footsteps of the Goryo
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: In the case of violent deaths, kami offered a chance for revenge if the deceased offered up its corpse as a host to the invading kami.

name: Gnat Miser
text: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by one.
flavor: Nezumi insect-shamans enjoyed solitary lives, which was fortunate since no other nezumi could stand to live within half a mile of their foul stench.

name: Hand of Cruelty
text:
Protection from white
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "The sword is just a tool. It is the samurai's hand that delivers death."

name: Infernal Kirin
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target player reveals their hand and discards all cards with that spell's mana value.
flavor: The kirin bellowed—an echoing, twisted parody of its once-inspirational call.

name: Kagemaro's Clutch
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-X, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: The mist was thick, cloying, and constricting. Shiro fought his way to fresh air only to look back and see his comrades fallen on the battlefield behind him.

name: Kiku's Shadow
text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
flavor:
"Me? No, I'm not going to kill you. I won't even lay a finger on you. I promise."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Kuro's Taken
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Kuro's Taken.
flavor: Simple bargains are the most tempting, and oni bargains are the simplest of all: eternal life for eternal service.

name: Locust Miser
text: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by two.
flavor: "They're numerous, attack in swarms, and are always hungry. No wonder we rats hold such a kinship with them."

name: Skull Collector
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a black creature you control to its owner's hand.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Skull Collector.
flavor: "Your blood I'll use. Your skull I'll keep."

name: Adamaro, First to Desire
text: Adamaro, First to Desire's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in the hand of the opponent with the most cards in hand.
flavor:
"Beware Adamaro! In him all pain and anger is perfected."
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

name: Akki Drillmaster
text: {T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: "What part of 'hayaku ikee!' did you not understand?"

name: Akki Underling
text: As long as you have seven or more cards in hand, Akki Underling gets +2/+1 and has first strike.
flavor:
"I lost my hounds in the war and thus found myself employing akki as servants. I found their training to be remarkably similar."
—Kensuke, houndmaster

name: Feral Lightning
text: Create three 3/1 red Elemental creature tokens with haste. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: They moved like apes, but a thousand times swifter, prying into every corner, leaving pawprints of ash.

name: Gaze of Adamaro
text: Gaze of Adamaro deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
flavor: Wherever it looked, it saw destruction—the wake of its own gaze.

name: Glitterfang
text:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, return Glitterfang to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Through the veil's rip spilled hundreds of minor kami, rushing over the battlefield like embers from a kicked campfire. Then they were gone."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Godo's Irregulars
text: {R}: Godo's Irregulars deals 1 damage to target creature blocking it.
flavor: Godo trained their muscles and honed their skills, but he left their hearts wild and empty.

name: Inner Fire
text: Add {R} for each card in your hand.
flavor: "Heart of Sokenzan, I call to you! Lend me your fire."

name: Path of Anger's Flame
text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Walking the path of the kami only leaves you with singed feet."
—Soratami saying

name: Ronin Cavekeeper
text: Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
flavor: The akki were surprised to encounter a human who could fight in the caves as well as they.

name: Skyfire Kirin
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may gain control of target creature with that spell's mana value until end of turn.
flavor: Its fiery visitation burns away the fog of war and dissipates the ties of loyalty.

name: Spiraling Embers
text: Spiraling Embers deals damage to any target equal to the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: The akki knew to stay indoors on the days the oni flew their kites.

name: Sunder from Within
text: Destroy target artifact or land.
flavor: Trapped for eons within the sacred gong, the kami boomed and clanged to a deafening tempo as they destroyed their erstwhile prison.

name: Thoughts of Ruin
text: Each player sacrifices a land for each card in your hand.
flavor:
"In our war with the kami, we annihilate what is our own. Do they too suffer ruination in their hidden world?"
—Diary of Azusa

name: Ayumi, the Last Visitor
text: Legendary landwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a legendary land.)
flavor: Before Shinka's walls were built, before the torii at Okina stood, she was there, tall and proud against the sky, and she will be there long after they have fallen into dust.

name: Bounteous Kirin
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may gain life equal to that spell's mana value.
flavor: Even the most benevolent and life-giving of kami joined the war against the mortal world, but only with heavy and sorrowful hearts.

name: Briarknit Kami
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor: One thorn to warn, ten thorns to defend, a hundred thorns to destroy.

name: Dense Canopy
text: Creatures with flying can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: The orochi learned how to move swiftly and surely along the forest floor, like fish darting through gull-watched waters.

name: Dosan's Oldest Chant
text:
You gain 6 life.
Draw a card.
flavor: As Dosan's chant grew in volume, a second, deeper voice rose up in harmony behind it, strong enough to shake the earth and yet vibrant enough to fill the spirit.

name: Fiddlehead Kami
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, regenerate Fiddlehead Kami.
flavor:
"Like a riddle, it unwinds. Like a green wind, it reaches out. Like a sudden guilt, it seizes."
—Snow Fur, kitsune poet

name: Inner Calm, Outer Strength
text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: The ghostly objects around the kami circled faster and faster, creating a dizzying cyclone of motion. When it opened its eyes, it struck.

name: Masumaro, First to Live
text: Masumaro, First to Live's power and toughness are each equal to twice the number of cards in your hand.
flavor:
"In the waning moments of war, humanity's most ancient ancestors return. But whose side shall they make their own?"
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

name: Molting Skin
text: Return Molting Skin to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.
flavor: "We have learned much from the orochi."

name: Seed the Land
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, its controller creates a 1/1 green Snake creature token.
flavor: With a sadness and a sense of hope, Senka left the colony of her birth and, with her attendants, set out to serve as broodmistress, founder of a new colony.

name: Oboro, Palace in the Clouds
text:
{T}: Add {U}.
{1}: Return Oboro, Palace in the Clouds to its owner's hand.
flavor: Here the soratami wove their endless plots—graceful, artful, and deceitful, while the unwitting world moved below.

name: Abuna Acolyte
text:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
{T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target artifact creature this turn.
flavor: "You can break nothing I cannot mend."

name: Auriok Edgewright
text: Metalcraft — Auriok Edgewright has double strike as long as you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: Auriok soldiers craft their own weapons, forging a connection to the steel with each blow of the hammer.

name: Auriok Sunchaser
text: Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Auriok Sunchaser gets +2/+2 and has flying.
flavor:
"Grant me loft. Grant me light. Grant me the accuracy I need to kill all who threaten Bladehold."
—Prayer to the Whitesun

name: Dispense Justice
text:
Target player sacrifices an attacking creature.
Metalcraft — That player sacrifices two attacking creatures instead if you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: The Accorders never strike first, but they always strike back.

name: Fulgent Distraction
text: Choose two target creatures. Tap those creatures, then unattach all Equipment from them.
flavor:
"Channeling the white-hot power of all five suns creates a pretty good diversion."
—Yavash of the Accorders

name: Ghalma's Warden
text: Metalcraft — Ghalma's Warden gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: A special unit guards the loxodon artificer known as Ghalma the Shaper. They are armed and armored in her finest works of silver and steel.

name: Glint Hawk
text:
Flying
When Glint Hawk enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an artifact you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Its eyes burned nearly blind by the Whitesun, it hunts by metallic gleam.

name: Loxodon Wayfarer
flavor: The Mirran elders vanished with Memnarch, leaving behind a generation of wayward orphans.

name: Salvage Scout
text: {W}, Sacrifice Salvage Scout: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "I'm not saying it's dangerous work. I'm just saying don't sign up if you have plans for your seventieth birthday."

name: Seize the Initiative
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: The time between spotting a leonin shikari and feeling its claws is just time enough to draw your last breath.

name: Vigil for the Lost
text: Whenever a creature you control dies, you may pay {X}. If you do, you gain X life.
flavor: "As she grew cold in my arms, I swore an oath that her funeral pyre would be dwarfed by a bonfire of our enemies."

name: Whitesun's Passage
text: You gain 5 life.
flavor: All over the Razor Fields, Whitesun is celebrated. Even the followers of the rebel Juryan, far from the Cave of Light, bow their heads in reverence.

name: Darkslick Drake
text:
Flying
When Darkslick Drake dies, draw a card.
flavor: At the edge of the Mephidross, Phyrexia's influence seeps into life and land.

name: Halt Order
text:
Counter target artifact spell.
Draw a card.
flavor: An artificer's least favorite mind-missive may be "I regret to inform you that the funding for your project has been cut."

name: Lumengrid Drake
text:
Flying
Metalcraft — When Lumengrid Drake enters the battlefield, if you control three or more artifacts, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: Properly outfitted, drakes made perfect sentries for vedalken strongholds.

name: Quicksilver Gargantuan
text: You may have Quicksilver Gargantuan enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it's 7/7.
flavor:
"You know you have achieved true power if the sea itself seeks to emulate your greatness."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

name: Screeching Silcaw
text:
Flying
Metalcraft — Whenever Screeching Silcaw deals combat damage to a player, if you control three or more artifacts, that player mills four cards.
flavor: It's adaptively deaf to its own cries.

name: Sky-Eel School
text:
Flying
When Sky-Eel School enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: They swim on tides few can see, away from a threat few yet understand.

name: Vault Skyward
text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Untap it.
flavor:
"The edges of the Quicksilver Sea run dark with the spread of the Mephidross. Two more aerial passes before I can be sure what I'm seeing . . ."
—Lafarius, Neurok sky agent

name: Vedalken Certarch
text: Metalcraft — {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. Activate only if you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: "An appropriately detailed model is indistinguishable from reality, and much easier to control."

name: Volition Reins
text:
Enchant permanent
When Volition Reins enters the battlefield, if enchanted permanent is tapped, untap it.
You control enchanted permanent.
flavor: "Glorifying the will is a mistake. It is simply one more force to be mastered."

name: Blackcleave Goblin
text:
Haste
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"Bitten? Save time, amputate now."
—Lephar, loxodon surgeon

name: Carnifex Demon
text:
Flying
Carnifex Demon enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it.
{B}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Carnifex Demon: Put a -1/-1 counter on each other creature.
flavor: Every contagion has a host.

name: Contagious Nim
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"This species has grown to be my preferred receptacle for our divine message."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Corrupted Harvester
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Corrupted Harvester.
flavor:
"Before the blessed assault begins, we must seek specimens that are well-adapted to our way of . . . life."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Dross Hopper
text: Sacrifice a creature: Dross Hopper gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Bred in the vicious Mephidross, dross hoppers learned to eat quickly and escape faster.

name: Fume Spitter
text: Sacrifice Fume Spitter: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
flavor:
"Our archers made sport of it as it fumbled its way up the slag ridge. As it collapsed we thought ourselves safe, but the foul thing carried more than necrogen."
—Adaran, Tangle hunter

name: Moriok Reaver
flavor:
"The Moriok are fools. They try so hard to gain my favor. All I want is for them to die quickly, to join the ranks of the nim."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

name: Psychic Miasma
text: Target player discards a card. If a land card is discarded this way, return Psychic Miasma to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"A mind may be steeled against madness, but all battlements fall in time."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Relic Putrescence
text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever enchanted artifact becomes tapped, its controller gets a poison counter.
flavor:
"Until we shed the curse of sentience, we must endure its grotesque handiwork."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Tainted Strike
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains infect until end of turn. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"Welcome to perfection."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Assault Strobe
text: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
flavor: When breaking someone's face once just isn't enough.

name: Embersmith
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, Embersmith deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor: The Vulshok see the artificer as a catalyst, bringing the spark of creation that ignites change.

name: Ferrovore
text: {R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Ferrovore gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The Vulshok use its digestion to break down the most obstinate artifacts, from darksteel myr to seastrider plates.

name: Flameborn Hellion
text:
Haste
Flameborn Hellion attacks each combat if able.
flavor:
"The most reliable omen of a future hellion attack is a past hellion attack."
—Spear-Tribe teaching

name: Kuldotha Rebirth
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
flavor: All goblin rituals serve a dual purpose as fertility rites, even the destructive ones. Especially the destructive ones.

name: Melt Terrain
text: Destroy target land. Melt Terrain deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
flavor: Just as the most finely wrought metal can warp and rust, so too does Mirrodin buckle under pressures from without and within.

name: Ogre Geargrabber
text: Whenever Ogre Geargrabber attacks, gain control of target Equipment an opponent controls until end of turn. Attach it to Ogre Geargrabber. When you lose control of that Equipment, unattach it.
flavor: Long reach, short attention span.

name: Oxidda Daredevil
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Oxidda Daredevil gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: His goggles spattered with grime and his mouth full of bugs, he tossed the engines another priceless relic.

name: Oxidda Scrapmelter
text: When Oxidda Scrapmelter enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
flavor: It subsists on a diet rich in screaming metal and molten blood.

name: Scoria Elemental
flavor: A single molten cord links it to the subterranean furnaces, drawing heat and metal from beneath Kuldotha. Until that bond is cut, it carves a swath of raw destruction.

name: Tunnel Ignus
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, if that player had another land enter the battlefield under their control this turn, Tunnel Ignus deals 3 damage to that player.
flavor: Fight mischief with mischief.

name: Vulshok Heartstoker
text: When Vulshok Heartstoker enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: He fashions stirring words with as much passion as a smith fashioning a warhammer.

name: Acid Web Spider
text:
Reach
When Acid Web Spider enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Equipment.
flavor: Its web is an excellent source of found copper for the daring or the stupid.

name: Alpha Tyrranax
flavor: Hunger seized the tyrranax, and the Sylvok's vision quest ended in disaster.

name: Blight Mamba
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Blight Mamba.
flavor: Its venom drips with Phyrexia's hate.

name: Blunt the Assault
text: You gain 1 life for each creature on the battlefield. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
flavor:
"Much can be gained from the appearance of vulnerability."
—Ezuri, renegade leader

name: Carapace Forger
text: Metalcraft — Carapace Forger gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: "Bows and whips cannot save us from these new horrors of the Mephidross."

name: Carrion Call
text: Create two 1/1 green Phyrexian Insect creature tokens with infect. (They deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: The natural order is out of order.

name: Cystbearer
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: Phyrexia strives to simulate natural life, but it can't resist improving on the design.

name: Ezuri's Brigade
text: Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Ezuri's Brigade gets +4/+4 and has trample.
flavor: Riding ravenous, ever-growing vorracs is almost as dangerous as fitting them with saddles.

name: Lifesmith
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 3 life.
flavor: The Sylvok see the artificer as a gardener, preparing the world for hardy growth.

name: Tangle Angler
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{G}: Target creature blocks Tangle Angler this turn if able.
flavor: A plague on the curious.

name: Tel-Jilad Defiance
text:
Target creature gains protection from artifacts until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor: The Viridian elves had purged their culture of the trolls' traitorous influence. In times of strife, however, the ancestral memories returned.

name: Tel-Jilad Fallen
text:
Protection from artifacts
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: "No longer am I shackled to antiquity. My new masters will etch a glorious future."

name: Untamed Might
text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn.
flavor:
"Beasts kill for their very survival. If you would have their strength, you must know their desperation."
—Konnos, Sylvok sage

name: Viridian Revel
text: Whenever an artifact is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, you may draw a card.
flavor:
"Let them have their revel. Soon those who won't submit will be turned. Those who won't be turned will die."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Wing Puncture
text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.
flavor:
"If I were the air, I wouldn't taunt the ground. It has the weight advantage."
—Konnos, Sylvok sage

name: Withstand Death
text: Target creature gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. If its toughness is 0 or less, it's still put into its owner's graveyard.)
flavor: On Mirrodin, every conflict ends in either death or darksteel.

name: Auriok Replica
text: {W}, Sacrifice Auriok Replica: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal to you this turn.
flavor: All the loyalty of the Auriok with only a trace of their self-righteousness.

name: Moriok Replica
text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Moriok Replica: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
flavor: All the secrets of the Moriok with only a trace of their corruption.

name: Saberclaw Golem
text: {R}: Saberclaw Golem gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: The warriors of the Blade Tribe charged the golem, twenty strong. They returned numbering ten . . . and a half.

name: Soliton
text: {U}: Untap Soliton.
flavor: The gemini engines had lost connection with each other and wandered apart, developing an independent awareness of their surroundings.

name: Sylvok Replica
text: {G}, Sacrifice Sylvok Replica: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor: All the zeal of the Sylvok with only a trace of their conservancy.

name: Vector Asp
