—Volrath, to Greven

name: Marsh Lurker
text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Marsh Lurker gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: From the mists it rises, into the mists it retreats; through the mists it walks, fearless and unseen.

name: Mindwhip Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Target player discards a card at random. Activate only as a sorcery."
flavor:
"They share more than their thoughts. We must shatter their link quickly!"
—Hanna, to Orim

name: Pit Imp
text:
Flying
{B}: Pit Imp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate no more than twice each turn.
flavor: The moans of the Death Pits were underscored by the chattering of imps, for whom the ship was cause for much discussion.

name: Rats of Rath
text: {B}: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land you control.
flavor:
"These creatures offer new challenges in the scrutiny of entrails."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Screeching Harpy
text:
Flying
{1}{B}: Regenerate Screeching Harpy.
flavor:
"They are called 'fowl' for a reason."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Servant of Volrath
text: When Servant of Volrath leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
flavor:
"Volrath is a harsh master. My reflection is a constant reminder of that."
—Greven *il*-Vec

name: Skyshroud Vampire
text:
Flying
Discard a creature card: Skyshroud Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"If it tastes one drop of elvish blood I will cast it from the shroud to see it burn."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Spinal Graft
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor:
"This one has not screamed enough to show effective implantation. Kill it."
—Volrath

name: Ancient Runes
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Ancient Runes deals damage to that player equal to the number of artifacts they control.
flavor: Ertai volunteered to open the portal. He figured he owed it one.

name: Apocalypse
text: Exile all permanents. You discard your hand.
flavor:
"There is a future in which I can see only mist and a single shadow."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Blood Frenzy
text:
Cast this spell only before the combat damage step.
Target attacking or blocking creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor:
"When Torahn bellows, none survive—not even the warrior whose horns he rides."
—Talruum adage

name: Canyon Drake
text:
Flying
{1}, Discard a card at random: Canyon Drake gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "These runes are tough enough without the distraction," Ertai muttered, one eye on the drake.

name: Deadshot
text: Tap target creature. It deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.
flavor:
"Carrion! Keep your distance. My blade will come to you!"
—Crovax

name: Firefly
text:
Flying
{R}: Firefly gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"If they don't pinch, they burn. Can't ya eat any of da bugs here?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Flowstone Giant
text: {R}: Flowstone Giant gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor:
When the first of these giants woke from the bedrock, he was still sleepy. He yawned and stretched until his legs grew so thin that they snapped like icicles in the sun.
—Vec lore

name: Flowstone Salamander
text: {R}: Flowstone Salamander deals 1 damage to target creature blocking it.
flavor: The Furnace of Rath is periodically illuminated by their sparkling yawns.

name: Flowstone Wyvern
text:
Flying
{R}: Flowstone Wyvern gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Where I come from, stone stays on the ground."
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Hand to Hand
text: During combat, players can't cast instant spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.
flavor: The match between Tahngarth and Greven was close only in the mind of the minotaur.

name: Havoc
text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, they lose 2 life.
flavor: As Orim put the lightning rod into place on the bow, she cast a spell of protection to shield herself from the heat. That's when the Furnace got personal.

name: Mogg Conscripts
text: Mogg Conscripts can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
flavor:
"Torahn's horns! They've seen us. Now, statue, you must fight to save yourself!"
—Tahngarth, aboard the *Predator*

name: Mogg Squad
text: Mogg Squad gets -1/-1 for each other creature on the battlefield.
flavor: As they crept into the *Weatherlight*'s hold, the squad leader held up his hand and whispered, "Stop, goblins—what's that sound?"

name: No Quarter
text:
Whenever a creature becomes blocked by a creature with lesser power, destroy the blocking creature.
Whenever a creature blocks a creature with lesser power, destroy the attacking creature.
flavor: As Gerrard and Greven neared each other, the moggs caught between them realized they should flee.

name: Opportunist
text: {T}: Opportunist deals 1 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
flavor: The third time the Oracle glanced suspiciously at him, Starke decided she had glanced twice too often.

name: Pallimud
text:
As Pallimud enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Pallimud's power is equal to the number of tapped lands the chosen player controls.
flavor: The old Vec tell tales of a beast that fed on scraps but turned its nose up at the lavish banquet they set in its honor.

name: Rathi Dragon
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Rathi Dragon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.
flavor: Wrap the flame as twine Kingdoms will be thine.

name: Renegade Warlord
text:
First strike
Whenever Renegade Warlord attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"His tongue must be honey, the way he gathers ants to fight with him."
—Volrath

name: Sandstone Warrior
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"I used to describe something stable as 'rock solid.' So much for *that* expression."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Scorched Earth
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X land cards.
Destroy X target lands.
flavor:
"Fire cleanses as well as destroys; that is the nature of change."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Shadowstorm
text: Shadowstorm deals 2 damage to each creature with shadow.
flavor:
"You've not seen a storm until you've seen the kind that roars between worlds."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Tahngarth's Rage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 as long as it's attacking. Otherwise, it gets -2/-1.
flavor:
"Taste my horns!"
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Wall of Diffusion
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Wall of Diffusion can block creatures with shadow as though Wall of Diffusion had shadow.
flavor:
"The injury was being caught between this world and our own; the insult was to find walls within."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Wild Wurm
text: When Wild Wurm enters the battlefield, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Wild Wurm to its owner's hand.
flavor:
Wurm heads appear
Wild wurm near
Wurm tails you see
Wild wurm flee

name: Aluren
text: Any player may cast creature spells with mana value 3 or less without paying their mana costs and as though they had flash.
flavor:
Squee bounced up and down. "I sees a horsey, an' a piggy, an' a—"
"If you don't shut up," hissed Mirri, "you'll see a kidney and a spleeny."

name: Apes of Rath
text: Whenever Apes of Rath attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: Monkeys three, monkeys through.

name: Bayou Dragonfly
text: Flying; swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor:
"Like a sugar stick with wings!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Crazed Armodon
text: {G}: Crazed Armodon gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. Destroy Crazed Armodon at the beginning of the next end step. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: These are its last days. Mourning is over. Rage remains.

name: Earthcraft
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Untap target basic land.
flavor:
"The land gives up little, but we are masters of persuasion."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Eladamri's Vineyard
text: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, that player adds {G}{G}.
flavor: The mushroom wine made Gerrard's head spin, and his stomach soon followed suit.

name: Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
text:
Other Elf creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
Other Elves have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
flavor:
"We have been patient. We have planned our attack. We are ready . . . *now*."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Elven Warhounds
text: Whenever Elven Warhounds becomes blocked by a creature, put that creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"If a creature is dumb enough to love you for leashing it, why would you want to follow its lead?"
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Flailing Drake
text:
Flying
Whenever Flailing Drake blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Too many choices will always distract a greedy beast.

name: Frog Tongue
text:
Enchant creature
When Frog Tongue enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: "But *why* can't I get one?" sniveled Squee. "All da bugs here got wings."

name: Fugitive Druid
text: Whenever Fugitive Druid becomes the target of an Aura spell, you draw a card.
flavor:
"If the druids are so devoted to their trees, I will carve them coffins from their precious heartwood."
—Volrath

name: Heartwood Dryad
text: Heartwood Dryad can block creatures with shadow as though Heartwood Dryad had shadow.
flavor: To snare what lies between worlds takes the patient reach of trees.

name: Heartwood Giant
text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Heartwood Giant deals 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor: Wind in the trees is soothing, but the same can't be said for trees on the wind.

name: Heartwood Treefolk
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor:
"In all my years in Llanowar I never understood where trees fit in. They are revered by elves and watered on by dogs."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Krakilin
text:
Krakilin enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Krakilin.
flavor:
"A perfect reflection of its world: brutal, fetal, and lacking truth."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Reality Anchor
text:
Target creature loses shadow until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"See how *you* like it."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Reap
text: Return up to X target cards from your graveyard to your hand, where X is the number of black permanents target opponent controls as you cast this spell.
flavor:
"Let Volrath choke on his crop of hatred."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Skyshroud Troll
text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Skyshroud Troll.
flavor: The elves and merfolk have nothing but bitterness for each other. The trolls, however, find them both rather tasty.

name: Storm Front
text: {G}{G}: Tap target creature with flying.
flavor: The calmest day on Rath would be thought a storm anywhere else.

name: Verdigris
text: Destroy target artifact.
flavor:
"Only the most sophisticated inventions can survive nature's unsophisticated motivations."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Aven Trooper
text:
Flying
{2}{W}, Discard a card: Aven Trooper gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: The very skies seethe with the aven's hatred for the Cabal.

name: Frantic Purification
text:
Destroy target enchantment.
Madness {W} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: By definition, madness ends in one of two ways: clarity . . . or death.

name: Major Teroh
text:
Flying
{3}{W}{W}, Sacrifice Major Teroh: Exile all black creatures.
flavor: "I am the holy wind that shall avenge the Cabal's victims."

name: Morningtide
text: Exile all graveyards.
flavor:
"The spirits of the righteous shall rise into the sky. Even dirtwalkers will fly like aven."
—Major Teroh

name: Mystic Familiar
text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Familiar gets +1/+1 and has protection from black.
flavor: They soar, and the mystics follow.

name: Stern Judge
text: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each Swamp they control.
flavor: "How to punish the guilty is up to the Ancestor. Deciding who merits such punishment is up to me."

name: Strength of Isolation
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 and has protection from black.
Madness {W} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: Don't mistake isolation for safety.

name: Teroh's Faithful
text: When Teroh's Faithful enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor: The light of reason follows them even into battle.

name: Vengeful Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Exile X target attacking creatures.
flavor: Teroh dreams of his enemies' doom.

name: Cephalid Aristocrat
text: Whenever Cephalid Aristocrat becomes the target of a spell or ability, mill two cards.
flavor: It's easy to tell the difference between the devious cephalids and the trustworthy ones. The trustworthy ones are dead.

name: Cephalid Snitch
text: Sacrifice Cephalid Snitch: Target creature loses protection from black until end of turn.
flavor: The cautious are wary of their enemies. The wise are also wary of their friends.

name: Churning Eddy
text: Return target creature and target land to their owners' hands.
flavor:
"Magic is like the tide—both ebb, both flow, and both serve my whims."
—Empress Llawan

name: False Memories
text: Mill seven cards. At the beginning of the next end step, exile seven cards from your graveyard.
flavor:
"My enemies will forget everything but their anguish."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Hydromorph Guardian
text: {U}, Sacrifice Hydromorph Guardian: Counter target spell that targets a creature you control.
flavor: In front of every strong leader is a pool of loyal bodyguards.

name: Hydromorph Gull
text:
Flying
{U}, Sacrifice Hydromorph Gull: Counter target spell that targets a creature you control.
flavor:
"The only kind of water that should fly through the air is rain."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Obsessive Search
text:
Draw a card.
Madness {U} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: The question strained his sanity. The answer snapped it in half.

name: Retraced Image
text: Reveal a card in your hand, then put that card onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent.
flavor: An army from a soldier, a flock from a bird, a school from a fish . . . a profit from an atrocity.

name: Skywing Aven
text:
Flying
Discard a card: Return Skywing Aven to its owner's hand.
flavor: "I am as the wind that bears me: harsh yet gentle, fleeting yet ever-present. Together we fly beyond imagination."

name: Turbulent Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Return X target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
flavor: Laquatus dreams of seizing control.

name: Cabal Ritual
text:
Add {B}{B}{B}.
Threshold — Add {B}{B}{B}{B}{B} instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
flavor:
"Each syllable chills your veins. Each word rattles your mind."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Cabal Surgeon
text: {2}{B}{B}, {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "Clerics give up when their patients die. Can I help it if I'm more compassionate?"

name: Carrion Rats
text: Whenever Carrion Rats attacks or blocks, any player may exile a card from their graveyard. If a player does, Carrion Rats assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor:
"Just what I need—more competition."
—Cabal grave robber

name: Carrion Wurm
text: Whenever Carrion Wurm attacks or blocks, any player may exile three cards from their graveyard. If a player does, Carrion Wurm assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor: Since it eats only carrion, sometimes it needs to make some from scratch.

name: Insidious Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Search your library for X cards, then shuffle and put those cards on top in any order.
flavor: Chainer dreams of ultimate knowledge.

name: Organ Grinder
text: {T}, Exile three cards from your graveyard: Target player loses 3 life.
flavor: It knows what makes you tick. It knows how to make the ticking stop.

name: Restless Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Braids dreams of dark rebirth.

name: Shambling Swarm
text: When Shambling Swarm dies, distribute three -1/-1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures. For each -1/-1 counter you put on a creature this way, remove a -1/-1 counter from that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: Chainer's madness personified, it exists only to slaughter the innocent.

name: Strength of Lunacy
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has protection from white.
Madness {B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: Don't confuse lunacy with courage.

name: Unhinge
text:
Target player discards a card.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Don't let your mind wander—it might not come back."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Waste Away
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.
flavor: Chainer's insanity touched nearly every living thing—including viruses.

name: Zombie Trailblazer
text:
Tap an untapped Zombie you control: Target land becomes a Swamp until end of turn.
Tap an untapped Zombie you control: Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: Some zombies are natural-reborn leaders.

name: Accelerate
text:
Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"I've seen lightning move slower."
—Nomad sentry

name: Balthor the Stout
text:
Other Barbarian creatures get +1/+1.
{R}: Another target Barbarian creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"I like to think of him as concentrated barbarian."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Barbarian Outcast
text: When you control no Swamps, sacrifice Barbarian Outcast.
flavor:
"We offer power to anyone willing to take it. Sadly, few are unburdened enough by their prejudices to accept."
—Cabal surgeon

name: Crackling Club
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
Sacrifice Crackling Club: It deals 1 damage to target creature.
flavor: It adds injury to injury.

name: Crazed Firecat
text: When Crazed Firecat enters the battlefield, flip a coin until you lose a flip. Put a +1/+1 counter on Crazed Firecat for each flip you won.
flavor:
"The longer it's caged, the madder it gets."
—Firecat handler

name: Devastating Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards at random.
Each player sacrifices X lands. Devastating Dreams deals X damage to each creature.
flavor: Kamahl dreams of storms of fire.

name: Enslaved Dwarf
text: {R}, Sacrifice Enslaved Dwarf: Target black creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Captive dwarves always regain their freedom, either through escape or through a desperate, fiery death.

name: Hell-Bent Raider
text:
First strike, haste
Discard a card at random: Hell-Bent Raider gains protection from white until end of turn.
flavor: He doesn't slow until his spear is weighted with corpses.

name: Longhorn Firebeast
text: When Longhorn Firebeast enters the battlefield, any opponent may have it deal 5 damage to them. If a player does, sacrifice Longhorn Firebeast.
flavor: Its blast can fuse armor to bone, leaving skeletons that glint brightly in the sun.

name: Pardic Arsonist
text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Pardic Arsonist has "When Pardic Arsonist enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to any target."
flavor: Otaria's epidemic of insanity didn't affect certain barbarians—but no one noticed.

name: Pardic Lancer
text: Discard a card at random: Pardic Lancer gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: He gets to the point right away.

name: Pitchstone Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever you discard a card, you may sacrifice Pitchstone Wall. If you do, return the discarded card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Its material may not be precious, but the minds it protects are.

name: Skullscorch
text: Target player discards two cards at random unless that player has Skullscorch deal 4 damage to them.
flavor:
"A good whack on the head usually has the same effect."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Anurid Scavenger
text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Anurid Scavenger unless you put a card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
flavor: Krosa's topmost bottom feeder.

name: Centaur Veteran
text:
Trample
{G}, Discard a card: Regenerate Centaur Veteran.
flavor: He wears his scars like badges of honor, warning his foes that he's not easily defeated.

name: Dwell on the Past
text: Target player shuffles up to four target cards from their graveyard into their library.
flavor:
None can find what hasn't been lost.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Insist
text:
The next creature spell you cast this turn can't be countered.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"Finesse is no match for brute force."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Invigorating Falls
text: You gain life equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
flavor: Krosan druids do not fear death, for they know that nature will only prosper from their passing.

name: Krosan Constrictor
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{T}: Target black creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"It's a slithering, coldblooded menace. I've gotta respect that."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Nostalgic Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Return X target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Nostalgic Dreams.
flavor: Seton dreams of life renewed.

name: Benalish Cavalry
text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "My people swore to protect Benalia to the end. It is battered, but yet stands, as do we."

name: Castle Raptors
text:
Flying
As long as Castle Raptors is untapped, it gets +0/+2.
flavor: "Each place we see is as ruined and lifeless as the last. So here we stay, because this ruin is *ours*."

name: Children of Korlis
text: Sacrifice Children of Korlis: You gain life equal to the life you've lost this turn. (Damage causes loss of life.)
flavor:
"We have a proud history of self-sacrifice. But it is easy, in these bleak times, to find one among us who is eager to die for any cause."
—Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

name: Chronosavant
text: {1}{W}: Return Chronosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped. You skip your next turn.
flavor: "In my dreams, I hear the voices of my future selves who have died in times yet to come. I use that knowledge to avoid those dark futures and continue my search for peace."

name: D'Avenant Healer
text:
{T}: D'Avenant Healer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor: "One arrow keenly fired might prevent more battlefield wounds than I could treat."

name: Detainment Spell
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be activated.
{1}{W}: Attach Detainment Spell to target creature.
flavor: Bind the mind rather than the wrist, and you stop the intent to harm before it starts.

name: Errant Doomsayers
text: {T}: Tap target creature with toughness 2 or less.
flavor: "Heed my words, traveler. Plagues, war, desolation . . . all mere hints of what is yet to come from Dominaria's vault of horrors."

name: Flickering Spirit
text:
Flying
{3}{W}: Exile Flickering Spirit, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
flavor: It disappears each time with the hope that it will not return to the same desolation it left behind.

name: Foriysian Interceptor
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Defender
Foriysian Interceptor can block an additional creature each combat.
flavor: A focal point for time rifts, Foriys contends simultaneously with foes both new and old.

name: Icatian Crier
text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Create two 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens.
flavor: A thousand years removed from her home, her news of war had lost its context, but not its relevance.

name: Opal Guardian
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Guardian is an enchantment, Opal Guardian becomes a 3/4 Gargoyle creature with flying and protection from red.
flavor: It was a moment in time, cast in stone—a moment whose time had come again.

name: Quilled Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{T}: This permanent deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature."
flavor:
"They have long kept us under attack, but we do not lack for ammunition. The very bodies of our foes arm us against them."
—Adom Capashen, Benalish hero

name: Sidewinder Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have flanking. (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks a Sliver, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"They encircled our patrol with the stealth of snakes, corralling us like livestock."
—Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

name: Tivadar of Thorn
text:
First strike, protection from red
When Tivadar of Thorn enters the battlefield, destroy target Goblin.
flavor: His blade came down upon the neck of a goblin—but not the one he had charged. When Tivadar looked up, the world he had known was gone.

name: Watcher Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures get +0/+2.
flavor:
"I have spied them, wandering and watching—but for what? I fear they watch for us."
—Yonat of Amrou

name: Deep-Sea Kraken
text:
Deep-Sea Kraken can't be blocked.
Suspend 9—{2}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{U} and exile it with nine time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, if Deep-Sea Kraken is suspended, remove a time counter from it.
flavor: The rift remained open for days, sluicing ancient seawater. It closed only after the last great tentacle squirmed its way through.

name: Drifter il-Dal
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Drifter il-Dal unless you pay {U}.
flavor: They study the deeds of their traitorous ancestors, hoping the stories may reveal a way back to the physical world.

name: Psionic Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have "{T}: This creature deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to itself."
flavor: They evolved the ability to concentrate their neural activity into a single pulse, causing a disruptive but usually suicidal blast of psionic energy.

name: Sage of Epityr
text: When Sage of Epityr enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor: Clairvoyants across Dominaria were driven mad by the overload from the widening time rifts, while other random folk gained the gift of future sight.

name: Screeching Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{T}: Target player mills a card."
flavor:
"What wears down my people most, I think, is not the danger, but the endless screeching outside our camp."
—Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

name: Snapback
text:
You may exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"If it returns years hence, our knowledge of how to combat it will be that much greater."
—Andorel, Tolarian sentinel

name: Spell Burst
text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Counter target spell with mana value X.
flavor: The brutish mage's version of thinking.

name: Spiketail Drakeling
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Spiketail Drakeling: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
flavor: Drakelings fish with their tails, angling to snare succulent thoughts and memories on their psychic hooks.

name: Temporal Eddy
text: Put target creature or land on top of its owner's library.
flavor: As the temporal fractures spread and time itself slowly fell apart, visitors started to appear from across the past and future, and those native to the present began to disappear.

name: Wipe Away
text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: An eyeblink later, all that remained of the tree-beast was the breeze of its momentum.

name: Call to the Netherworld
text:
Return target black creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Madness {0} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
flavor: The ritual was normally performed only by horrors and pit spawn. Lesser mages had but one sanity to crack in the casting.

name: Cyclopean Giant
text: When Cyclopean Giant dies, target land becomes a Swamp. Exile Cyclopean Giant.
flavor: A tomb-eye may remain shut for centuries. It opens when it sees a world as twisted and hollow as the wretch beneath its lid.

name: Drudge Reavers
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
{B}: Regenerate Drudge Reavers.
flavor:
"The surface of the land is blanched with salt, but the soil beneath is reddened with death—a fertile ground for necromancy."
—Lim-Dûl the Necromancer

name: Evil Eye of Urborg
text:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.
Whenever Evil Eye of Urborg becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.
flavor:
"Edahlis, what *is* that thing? We should have stayed in Yavimaya . . . ."
—Aznaph, greenseeker

name: Feebleness
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
flavor: Just a small touch of magic can harness the debilitating power of Urborg's poisonous winds.

name: Mana Skimmer
text:
Flying
Whenever Mana Skimmer deals damage to a player, tap target land that player controls. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: They traverse the mana-starved wastes in search of richer lands.

name: Mindlash Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{1}, Sacrifice this permanent: Each player discards a card."
flavor: Though Dominaria's queenless slivers lack a single purpose, in some the instinct for self-sacrifice remains extremely strong.

name: Premature Burial
text: Destroy target nonblack creature that entered the battlefield since your last turn ended.
flavor:
"This soil knows well the taste of the dead. Give it the hunger for a living meal, and it can become a deadly ally."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Sangrophage
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Sangrophage unless you pay 2 life.
flavor: The living is all it eats.

name: Skittering Monstrosity
text: When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Monstrosity.
flavor: Most living things were weakened and stunted in the ruinous aftermath of the Phyrexian invasion, but a few grew more horrid than ever.

name: Sudden Death
text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
flavor: Some mages tapped into the time rifts, forcing upon others alternate timelines in which unimaginable horrors befall them.

name: Trespasser il-Vec
text: Discard a card: Trespasser il-Vec gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: At the epicenter of the Rathi overlay, the City of Traitors did not align with Dominaria. Many of its inhabitants were caught between the two worlds.

name: Vampiric Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have "Whenever a creature dealt damage by this creature this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."
flavor: They draw upon the strength of their hive and of their victims.

name: Viscid Lemures
text: {0}: Viscid Lemures gets -1/-0 and gains swampwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor:
"Lemurs? Is that all? Finally, something harmless . . ."
—Norin the Wary

name: Blazing Blade Askari
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{2}: Blazing Blade Askari becomes colorless until end of turn.
flavor: "This can't be Jamuraa. We could not have failed her this badly . . . ."

name: Bonesplitter Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures get +2/+0.
flavor: As the time streams grew more and more unstable, Dominaria's creatures struggled to adapt. The intense pressures led to many dead ends but also to lethal new forms that appeared as suddenly as the ashen rains.

name: Flamecore Elemental
text: Echo {2}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
flavor: To a fire elemental, fools and fuels are one and the same.

name: Flowstone Channeler
text: {1}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: With the evincars gone, flowstone became erratic and wild, a source of power for mages more desperate than wise.

name: Goblin Skycutter
text: Sacrifice Goblin Skycutter: It deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.
flavor: He takes out his fear of heights on anything above his head.

name: Ground Rift
text:
Target creature without flying can't block this turn.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
flavor: Some time rifts didn't take away the people but just the ground they stood on.

name: Ironclaw Buzzardiers
text:
Ironclaw Buzzardiers can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
{R}: Ironclaw Buzzardiers gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: They warn the army of danger as they squawk past in swift retreat.

name: Reiterate
text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor:
"Echoes of the Mirari's power yet linger."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Tectonic Fiend
text:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Tectonic Fiend attacks each combat if able.
flavor: The barbarians of Pardia are long dead, but its mountains still smolder with rage.

name: Thick-Skinned Goblin
text:
You may pay {0} rather than pay the echo cost for permanents you control.
{R}: Thick-Skinned Goblin gains protection from red until end of turn.
flavor: The shaman of the tribe is responsible for keeping track of all its treasures, including angry pets and cursed lamps of fiery doom.

name: Viashino Bladescout
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Viashino Bladescout enters the battlefield, target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: "Find your courage in a desperate moment, and you turn the tide of history. So sayeth the bey."

name: Volcanic Awakening
text:
Destroy target land.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
flavor: With a great roar, the land opened like a titan's yawn, with teeth of blackened rock and a lolling tongue of magma.

name: Ashcoat Bear
text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
flavor: The bears wade into time rifts to feed. They do not fear the storms, and they are quick enough to snatch prey just as it blinks in or out of time.

name: Chameleon Blur
text: Prevent all damage that creatures would deal to players this turn.
flavor:
"Sometimes the best plan is neither fighting nor running."
—Freyalise

name: Durkwood Tracker
text: {1}{G}, {T}: If Durkwood Tracker is on the battlefield, it deals damage equal to its power to target attacking creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Durkwood Tracker.
flavor: These days, trackers must follow their quarry over years as well as miles.

name: Glass Asp
text: Whenever Glass Asp deals combat damage to a player, that player loses 2 life at the beginning of their next draw step unless they pay {2} before that step.
flavor: Its venom induces a fever that causes its victims to relive the attack in recurring, haunting visions.

name: Greenseeker
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: "A rumor passes among the snakes, whispered by the rushes, inspiring the seekers: the goddess Freyalise is alive in Skyshroud."

name: Herd Gnarr
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Herd Gnarr gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Long ago, the solitary gnarr was a sign of good luck. Now they have become wild pack hunters, a sign of impending danger.

name: Molder
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment with mana value X. It can't be regenerated. You gain X life.
flavor:
"The forests have succumbed to ruin, but the spirit of Krosa remains alive and vital in these devouring spores."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Mwonvuli Acid-Moss
text: Destroy target land. Search your library for a Forest card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
flavor:
"Life gives way to death, and death to new life. Nature feeds upon her own decay."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Pendelhaven Elder
text: {T}: Each 1/1 creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: The elder who carries the ancestral mantle of Jacques le Vert is tasked with his ancient mission: to protect the creatures of Pendelhaven.

name: Phantom Wurm
text:
Phantom Wurm enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Wurm, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Wurm.
flavor: It died with the forest, yet both linger on in twisted form.

name: Primal Forcemage
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: Their calls unheeded by the withered forests, nature shamans channeled the life force of their brethren.

name: Scarwood Treefolk
text: Scarwood Treefolk enters the battlefield tapped.
flavor: To treefolk's sense of time, ages pass as hours. They stood as witnesses to the apocalypse, the years of which they saw as one cacophonous, ultra-destructive moment.

name: Spinneret Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have reach.
flavor: Each new generation of slivers evolves to assimilate the strengths of the prey upon which their progenitors fed.

name: Sprout
text: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
flavor: Centuries of temporal strife had stripped Dominaria of its natural defenses, but nature fought back with armies constructed of little more than grime and sunlight.

name: Squall Line
text: Squall Line deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
flavor: The constant shifting of Dominaria's shredded timeline played havoc with its atmosphere, combining savage electrical storms from ages past.

name: Stonewood Invocation
text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: "Might of ancient wood and stone, Into spirit, flesh, and bone."

name: Unyaro Bees
text:
Flying
{G}: Unyaro Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{3}{G}, Sacrifice Unyaro Bees: It deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: With no jungle left to contain it, the "plague of daggers" spread across Dominaria.

name: Blade of the Sixth Pride
flavor: "My pride may be gone, but our hunt is not over."

name: Logic Knot
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.
flavor: "Such sloppy work. Let's unravel it and try again!"

name: Tombstalker
text:
Flying
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
flavor: When it ran out of bodies, it broke down the crypt door and sought new sustenance.

name: Pact of the Titan
text:
Create a 4/4 red Giant creature token.
At the beginning of your next upkeep, pay {4}{R}. If you don't, you lose the game.
flavor: Born of fire, destined for battle.

name: Llanowar Mentor
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 green Elf Druid creature token named Llanowar Elves. It has "{T}: Add {G}."
flavor: "One day the vines of this forest will be as much a part of you as your own fingers."

name: Liliana's Triumph
text: Each opponent sacrifices a creature. If you control a Liliana planeswalker, each opponent also discards a card.
flavor: Her triumph came not from escaping her death, but in claiming her independence.

name: Capashen Standard
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{2}, Sacrifice Capashen Standard: Draw a card.
flavor: Benalia has no need for peacocks to serve as symbols of vanity. The Capashens strut more proudly than any bird.

name: Capashen Templar
text: {W}: Capashen Templar gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Their shields are Benalia's outermost battlements.

name: Fend Off
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: The best defense is to not get hit.

name: Field Surgeon
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
flavor: Commanders order soldiers to attack. Field surgeons order them to heal. Both are obeyed without question.

name: Flicker
text: Exile target nontoken permanent, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
flavor: Who is truer: you who are, or you who are to be?

name: Mask of Law and Grace
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from black and from red.
flavor: The archangels zealously drove Serra's light into every corner of their new home as if their creator still commanded them.

name: Reliquary Monk
text: When Reliquary Monk dies, destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor: A thing of Serra's realm exists only by the grace of her followers' faith.

name: Replenish
text: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in your graveyard.)
flavor: Treasures, trinkets, trash—the relics of the past are brought forth again.

name: Tethered Griffin
text:
Flying
When you control no enchantments, sacrifice Tethered Griffin.
flavor: Poorly trained griffins sometimes attack the noble audiences that gather to watch their progress.

name: Tormented Angel
text: Flying
flavor: Falling from heaven is not as painful as surviving the impact.

name: Voice of Duty
text: Flying, protection from green
flavor:
"Next to Law is Duty, and Duty must be obeyed. If the frame of Duty is broken, none shall weave life's fabric."
—*Song of All*, canto 167

name: Voice of Reason
text: Flying, protection from blue
flavor:
"Next to Grace is Reason, and Reason must be retained. If the web of Reason comes unwoven, madness will escape."
—*Song of All*, canto 167

name: Wall of Glare
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Wall of Glare can block any number of creatures.
flavor: The blinding barrier served Benalia better than a hundred shields.

name: Bubbling Beebles
text: Bubbling Beebles can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an enchantment.
flavor:
"Chancellor Rayne canceled the annual beeble roast. I should have married a crueler woman."
—Barrin

name: Disappear
text:
Enchant creature
{U}: Return enchanted creature and Disappear to their owners' hands.
flavor: If at first you don't succeed, run away and hide.

name: Donate
text: Target player gains control of target permanent you control.
flavor: Campus pranksters initiate new students with the old "beeble bomb" routine.

name: Fatigue
text: Target player skips their next draw step.
flavor: "Mind if I just lie down right here for a few weeks?"

name: Fledgling Osprey
text: Fledgling Osprey has flying as long as it's enchanted.
flavor: It isn't truly born until its first flight.

name: Illuminated Wings
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
{2}, Sacrifice Illuminated Wings: Draw a card.
flavor: For a moment, Urza thought not of war and destruction, but of the freedom of the skies.

name: Kingfisher
text:
Flying
When Kingfisher dies, draw a card.
flavor: It's tastiest when served with the fish it stole.

name: Mental Discipline
text: {1}{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
flavor: Barrin drowned his doubts about Urza's project by delving ever deeper into its details.

name: Metathran Soldier
text: Metathran Soldier can't be blocked.
flavor: Just as Serra crafted angels of light and faith, Urza constructed an army of sorcery and power to resist the coming invasion.

name: Treachery
text:
Enchant creature
When Treachery enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.
You control enchanted creature.
flavor:
"The academy educates; I employ. It's a perfect arrangement."
—Gatha, Tolarian renegade

name: Bubbling Muck
text: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps a Swamp for mana, that player adds an additional {B}.
flavor: The muck claims a hundred living things for each meager treasure it spews forth.

name: Carnival of Souls
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life and add {B}.
flavor: "'Davvol, blast those elves.' 'Davvol, transport those troops.' No one cares that today is my birthday."

name: Chime of Night
text:
Enchant creature
When Chime of Night is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor: Many sent to serve Davvol carried such instruments, as if to remind him who their true masters were.

name: Disease Carriers
text: When Disease Carriers dies, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: Rath is a disease all its inhabitants carry.

name: Dying Wail
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, target player discards two cards.
flavor: This is a world of spiteful wasps that sting and kill even as they die.

name: Encroach
text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonbasic land card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor:
"The rate of spread in this region is unacceptable. Start again."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath

name: Lurking Jackals
text: When an opponent has 10 or less life, if Lurking Jackals is an enchantment, it becomes a 3/2 Jackal creature.
flavor: Often it's not the hunter or the hunted but the opportunist who thrives in Rath.

name: Phyrexian Monitor
text: {B}: Regenerate Phyrexian Monitor.
flavor: Being one would be an honor, if the word "honor" had any meaning in Phyrexia.

name: Plague Dogs
text:
When Plague Dogs dies, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Plague Dogs: Draw a card.
flavor: They're not just retrievers, they're carriers.

name: Rapid Decay
text:
Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: The grave robbers arrived the day after the burial. They were a day too late.

name: Slinking Skirge
text:
Flying
{2}, Sacrifice Slinking Skirge: Draw a card.
flavor: Davvol encouraged the skirges; they made excellent sentries and were quite edible if properly seasoned.

name: Squirming Mass
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: Only the coldest hearts and the strongest stomachs can stand against it.

name: Yawgmoth's Bargain
text:
Skip your draw step.
Pay 1 life: Draw a card.
flavor: He craves only one commodity.

name: Aether Sting
text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Aether Sting deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor: When Gatha fell, he was called to account for each abomination he created.

name: Colos Yearling
text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
{R}: Colos Yearling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: A steed grows with its rider.

name: Covetous Dragon
text:
Flying
When you control no artifacts, sacrifice Covetous Dragon.
flavor: Gatha survived as long as he did by giving all Keld's predators exactly what they wanted.

name: Flame Jet
text:
Flame Jet deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: Did the land make the Keldons? Did the Keldons make the land? Or were they simply meant for each other?

name: Goblin Berserker
text: First strike, haste
flavor:
Goblins don't know the meaning of the word "tactics"
—or the word "meaning," for that matter.

name: Goblin Festival
text: {2}: Goblin Festival deals 1 damage to any target. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, choose one of your opponents. That player gains control of Goblin Festival.
flavor: "What are we celebratin' again?"

name: Goblin Masons
text: When Goblin Masons dies, destroy target Wall.
flavor: "Goblins build with true zeal—and anything else within arm's reach."

name: Landslide
text: Sacrifice any number of Mountains. Landslide deals that much damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor:
Sometimes the mountain takes.
—Keldon saying

name: Mark of Fury
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
At the beginning of the end step, return Mark of Fury to its owner's hand.
flavor: Many Keldon warriors bear the mark of intentional insanity.

name: Wild Colos
text: Haste
flavor: You'll never get a Keldon's goat.

name: Elvish Lookout
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: Like a masterful quilter, Yavimaya stitches together patches of color to warn its denizens of threats.

name: Goliath Beetle
text: Trample
flavor: The balance of nature dictates that one day humans will be stepped on by bugs.

name: Heart Warden
text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{2}, Sacrifice Heart Warden: Draw a card.
flavor:
"In Llanowar, we tend the forest's boughs and branches. In Yavimaya, we are a part of them."
—Rofellos of Llanowar

name: Magnify
text: All creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The seed torches' pollen gives off light, but the elves find it heightens their senses as well.

name: Marker Beetles
text:
When Marker Beetles dies, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Marker Beetles: Draw a card.
flavor: In case of emergency, crush bug.

name: Multani's Decree
text: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 2 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.
flavor:
"This is my place of power. Nothing can take root here unless I allow it."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

name: Rofellos's Gift
text: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Return an enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand for each card revealed this way.
flavor:
"Rise, elf. We are both of Gaea, and thus we are equal."
—Multani, to Rofellos

name: Yavimaya Hollow
text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.
flavor: For all its traps and defenses, Yavimaya has its havens, too.

name: The Cheese Stands Alone
text: When you control no permanents other than The Cheese Stands Alone and have no cards in hand, you win the game.
flavor: The meat, on the other hand, has frequent visitors.

name: Double Dip
text: Choose another player. You gain 5 life. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, you gain 5 life.
flavor: In a duel and taking a lickin' . . .

name: Get a Life
text: Target player and each of that player's teammates exchange life totals.
flavor: Gimme five! (Or whatever you got.)

name: Knight of the Hokey Pokey
text:
First strike
{1}{W}, Do the Hokey Pokey: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal to Knight of the Hokey Pokey this turn. (To do the Hokey Pokey, choose an arm, a leg, or your whole self and put it in. Put it out. Put it in. Shake it all about. You do the Hokey Pokey! Turn yourself around.)
flavor: That's what it's all about.

name: Lexivore
text: Whenever Lexivore deals damage to a player, destroy target permanent other than Lexivore with the most lines of text in its text box. (If two or more cards are tied, target any one of them.)
flavor:
Plucking the chicken
—Elvish expression meaning "flinging the monkey"

name: Look at Me, I'm the DCI
text: Ban a card other than a basic land card for the rest of the match. (All cards with that name in any zone or sideboard are removed from the match.)
flavor: Few understand the DCI's rigorous decision-making process.

name: Mesa Chicken
text: Stand up, Flap your arms, Cluck like a chicken: Mesa Chicken gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
"Lo lord of layers proudly comb-crested
Hero to hens father to feathers
Crowing sun-caller weaver of wattle
Elder to eggs."
—*Rooster Saga*

name: Miss Demeanor
text:
Flying, first strike
At the beginning of each other player's upkeep, you may compliment that player on their game play. If you don't, sacrifice Miss Demeanor.
flavor: Even war can be civil.

name: Once More with Feeling
text:
Exile all permanents and all cards from all graveyards. Each player shuffles their hand into their library, then draws seven cards. Each player's life total becomes 10. Exile Once More with Feeling.
DCI ruling — A deck can have only one card named Once More with Feeling.
flavor: If yo . . . ted.

name: Prismatic Wardrobe
text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonland permanent that doesn't share a color with clothing worn by its controller.
flavor:
"Spring in Dominaria means pastels!"
—Excerpt from *Mage's Home Journal*

name: Censorship
text:
As Censorship enters the battlefield, choose a word.
Whenever a player says the chosen word, Censorship deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor: Editor's note: There were no suitable flavor text submissions for this card.

name: Chicken à la King
text:
Whenever a 6 is rolled on a six-sided die, put a +1/+1 counter on each Bird. (You may roll dice only when instructed to.)
Tap an untapped Bird you control: Roll a six-sided die. (Like now.)
flavor: During the Chicken Revolution, the king managed to keep his head while the others—well, just ran around.

name: Clambassadors
text: Whenever Clambassadors deals damage to a player, choose an artifact, creature, or land you control. That player gains control of that permanent.
flavor: "Sorry we shelled your village—here's some gold."

name: Clam-I-Am
text: If you roll a 3 on a six-sided die, you may reroll that die.
flavor:
The Clams down in Clamville
All scootered and skittled—
"The three is no more!"
The Clam fiddler fiddled.

name: Clam Session
text:
As Clam Session enters the battlefield, choose a word.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sing at least six words of a song, at least one of which is the chosen word. If you don't, sacrifice Clam Session. You can't repeat a song.
flavor: "Duke, Duke, Duke, Duke of Pearl . . . ."

name: Common Courtesy
text:
Whenever a player casts a spell without asking your permission while casting it, counter that spell.
When a player asks you permission to cast a spell and you refuse, counter that spell and sacrifice Common Courtesy.
flavor: "You didn't say the Magic word."

name: Denied!
text: Choose a card name, then target spell's controller reveals their hand. If a card with the chosen name is revealed this way, counter that spell.
flavor: "Don't worry about it. It happens to every mage sooner or later."

name: Double Take
text: Choose another player. You draw two cards. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, you draw two cards.
flavor: "But next time we meet, . . ."

name: Fowl Play
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses all abilities and is a Bird creature with base power and toughness 1/1.
flavor: "I feel like chicken tonight!"

name: B.F.M. (Big Furry Monster)
text:
You must cast both B.F.M. cards to put
leaves the battlefield, sacrifice the other.
B.F.M. can't be blocked except by three or
flavor:
"It was big. Really, really big. No, bigger
No, more. Look, we're talking krakens and

name: Deadhead
text: {0}: Return Deadhead from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate only if an opponent isn't touching their hand (of cards).
flavor: "I'm back from the Dead," the zombie moaned. "And they were far out, man."

name: Double Cross
text: Choose another player. Look at that player's hand and choose a card other than a basic land card from it. They discard that card. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, look at that player's hand and choose a card other than a basic land card from it. They discard that card.
flavor: "You're in for a nasty butt-kickin'."

name: Handcuffs
text:
As Handcuffs enters the battlefield, choose a player.
When the chosen player's hands aren't touching each other, sacrifice Handcuffs and that player sacrifices three permanents.
flavor:
"That was fun! Now me."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

name: Organ Harvest
text: Your team may sacrifice any number of creatures. For each creature sacrificed this way, you add {B}{B}.
flavor: "Lucy, you've got some spleenin' to do."

name: Ow
text: Whenever a creature deals damage to a player, that player may say "Ow" once for each permanent named Ow. If the player doesn't, Ow deals 1 damage to them.
flavor: Have you ever noticed how some flavor text has no relevance whatsoever to the card it's on?

name: Poultrygeist
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dies, you may roll a six-sided die. If you roll a 1, sacrifice Poultrygeist. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on Poultrygeist.
flavor: Farmer Brown never ate eggs again.

name: Temp of the Damned
text:
As Temp of the Damned enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. Temp of the Damned enters the battlefield with a number of funk counters on it equal to the result.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a funk counter from Temp of the Damned. If you can't, sacrifice it.
flavor: "Not the graveyard shift again!"

name: Chicken Egg
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. If you roll a 6, sacrifice Chicken Egg and create a 4/4 red Giant Bird creature token.
flavor:
"That's a lotta nuggets."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Double Deal
text: Choose another player. Double Deal deals 3 damage to that player. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, Double Deal deals 3 damage to the player.
flavor: "I'm facing defeat, . . ."

name: Goblin Bookie
text: {R}, {T}: Reflip any coin or reroll any die. (Activate only any time it makes sense.)
flavor:
"Glok loved bets! He'd sit in the bar all night an' laugh an' laugh. Hey—he still owes me."
—Squee, goblin casino hand

name: Goblin Bowling Team
text: If Goblin Bowling Team would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus the result of a six-sided die roll to that permanent or player instead.
flavor: Flog was out of his league—this game wasn't up his alley, but the team couldn't spare him if he split.

name: Hurloon Wrangler
text: Denimwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player is wearing denim.)
flavor: "Nothing comes between me and my Didgeridoos™."

name: Krazy Kow
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. If you a roll a 1, sacrifice Krazy Kow and it deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: "I got your milk right here!"

name: The Ultimate Nightmare of Wizards of the Coast® Customer Service
text: The Ultimate Nightmare of Wizards of the Coast® Customer Service deals X damage to each of Y target creatures and Z target players or planeswalkers.
flavor: The number printed on the card is no longer in service. For help, go to wizards.custhelp.com or find us on Twitter @Wizards_Help.

name: Cardboard Carapace
text:
Enchant creature
For each other card named Cardboard Carapace you have with you outside the game, enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
flavor: . . . that exciting . . . about . . .

name: Double Play
text: Choose another player. Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor: The wizard exclaimed, "I'm no chicken . . . ."

name: Elvish Impersonators
text: As Elvish Impersonators enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die twice. Its base power becomes the first result and its base toughness becomes the second result.
flavor: "Uh-hunh."

name: Flock of Rabid Sheep
text: Flip X coins. For each flip you win, create a 2/2 green Sheep creature token named Rabid Sheep.
flavor: And their bleating was like a wet salmon slapped upon the land—slap! slap! slap!

name: Growth Spurt
text: Roll a six-sided die. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the result.
flavor: MORE TO LOVE: Friendly, nature-loving, Bunyonesque SEM seeks SEF looking for a huge commitment. . . . seeks atog prince

name: Gus
text: Gus enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each Magic game you have lost to one of your opponents since you last won a game against them.
flavor:
"Now I lay me down to sleep—
What are *you* starin' at?"

name: Hungry Hungry Heifer
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a counter from a permanent you control. If you don't, sacrifice Hungry Hungry Heifer.
flavor: Mooo.

name: Team Spirit
text: Creatures target player's team controls get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Due to some late-night partying, the chicken missed the group photo.

name: Timmy, Power Gamer
text: {4}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: "Just wait till I get my Leviathan . . . ."

name: Burst of Energy
text: Untap target permanent.
flavor:
"I stand ready to die for our world. Who will stand with me?"
—Radiant, archangel

name: Cessation
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
When Cessation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Cessation to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"The face of Light will shine upon them, and they will know war no more."
—*Song of All*, canto 918

name: Defender of Law
text:
Flash
Protection from red
flavor: "It is not my place to question Radiant's rule. I exist to enforce her will."

name: Devout Harpist
text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature.
flavor: The notes themselves are irrelevant. The music's effect, however, is worth ten armies.

name: Expendable Troops
text: {T}, Sacrifice Expendable Troops: It deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: No doubt in their minds, no fear in their hearts.

name: Hope and Glory
text: Untap two target creatures. Each of them gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Serra ruled by faith. I cannot afford that luxury."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Opal Avenger
text: When you have 10 or less life, if Opal Avenger is an enchantment, Opal Avenger becomes a 3/5 Soldier creature.
flavor: As the sun grew cold in the realm, the statue grew warm.

name: Peace and Quiet
text: Destroy two target enchantments.
flavor:
"In time our realm will shine again. But it will gleam only when we scour away the taint of doubt."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Anthroplasm
text:
Anthroplasm enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{X}, {T}: Remove all +1/+1 counters from Anthroplasm and put X +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor: I never metamorphosis I didn't like.

name: Aura Flux
text: Other enchantments have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this enchantment unless you pay {2}."
flavor: To some, the Tolarian sunrise was a blinding flash; to others, a lingering glow.

name: Bouncing Beebles
text: Bouncing Beebles can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact.
flavor: Beebles are frequently hurled against stone surfaces at high speed but always zing back into the air with a giggle.

name: Intervene
text: Counter target spell that targets a creature.
flavor:
"At first I simply observed. But I found that without investment in others, life serves no purpose."
—Karn, silver golem

name: King Crab
text: {1}{U}, {T}: Put target green creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"I'm allergic to shellfish—not only did it kill my entire village, it also gave me this nasty rash."
—Olivia, fisher

name: Second Chance
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 5 or less life, sacrifice Second Chance and take an extra turn after this one.
flavor: The greatest gift is the opportunity to right one's wrongs.

name: Walking Sponge
text: {T}: Target creature loses your choice of flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn.
flavor: Not only does it catch fish, it cleans them too.

name: Weatherseed Faeries
text: Flying, protection from red
flavor: Two days after the forge was completed, the faeries were immune to its flames.

name: Eviscerator
text:
Protection from white
When Eviscerator enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.
flavor: It roamed the time bubble like a captured animal. Kerrick knew he must soon find a way to unleash it on Tolaria or destroy it.

name: Fog of Gnats
text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Fog of Gnats.
flavor: You can swat a thousand gnats, but a thousand more will assail you.

name: Lurking Skirge
text: When a creature is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, if Lurking Skirge is an enchantment, Lurking Skirge becomes a 3/2 Phyrexian Imp creature with flying.
flavor: They never miss a funeral.

name: Rank and File
text: When Rank and File enters the battlefield, green creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Left, right, left, right . . . hmm. Okay—left, left, left, left, . . ."

name: Sick and Tired
text: Two target creatures each get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: The Phyrexians' only interest in organic life is discerning its weakness.

name: Tethered Skirge
text:
Flying
Whenever Tethered Skirge becomes the target of a spell or ability, you lose 1 life.
flavor: It bites the hand that leads it.

name: Treacherous Link
text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature is dealt to its controller instead.
flavor:
"You cannot possibly know the toll your alliances will exact from you."
—Barrin, to Urza

name: About Face
text: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
flavor: The overconfident are the most vulnerable.

name: Defender of Chaos
text:
Flash
Protection from white
flavor: Some knights will not follow orders—only disorder.

name: Ghitu Slinger
text:
Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Ghitu Slinger enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: If you survive a slinger attack, the slinger wished you to live.

name: Last-Ditch Effort
text: Sacrifice any number of creatures. Last-Ditch Effort deals that much damage to any target.
flavor:
"If you're gonna lose, at least make sure they don't win as much."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Molten Hydra
text:
{1}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Molten Hydra.
{T}, Remove all +1/+1 counters from Molten Hydra: It deals damage to any target equal to the number of +1/+1 counters removed this way.
flavor:
Keep off the glass.
—Hydra warning sign

name: Parch
text:
Choose one —
• Parch deals 2 damage to any target.
• Parch deals 4 damage to target blue creature.
flavor:
"Your porous flesh betrays you."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Pyromancy
text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Pyromancy deals damage to any target equal to the mana value of the discarded card.
flavor:
Who harnesses fire controls the world.
—Ghitu proverb

name: Rack and Ruin
text: Destroy two target artifacts.
flavor:
"My people are bound by masters centuries dead. Each artifact we destroy is another link broken in that chain."
—Barb Tail, viashino heretic

name: Rivalry
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than each other player, Rivalry deals 2 damage to them.
flavor: The goblins revered it; the viashino defended it. Only Urza understood it.

name: Shivan Phoenix
text:
Flying
When Shivan Phoenix dies, return Shivan Phoenix to its owner's hand.
flavor: To strike down the phoenix is to slash at the flame.

name: Sluggishness
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't block.
When Sluggishness is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Sluggishness to its owner's hand.
flavor: Vark decided to lie down and think of a good excuse to quit working.

name: Viashino Bey
text: If Viashino Bey attacks, all creatures you control attack if able.
flavor:
When the bey runs, match his stride.
—Viashino saying

name: Viashino Cutthroat
text:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Cutthroat to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"You guys go on ahead. I'll catch up with ya."
—Vark, goblin scout, last words

name: Harmonic Convergence
text: Put all enchantments on top of their owners' libraries.
flavor: When the eternal stars align, can mere mortals resist?

name: Hidden Gibbons
text: When an opponent casts an instant spell, if Hidden Gibbons is an enchantment, Hidden Gibbons becomes a 4/4 Ape creature.
flavor: When these apes want something, it's a matter of gibbon take.

name: Multani, Maro-Sorcerer
text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Multani, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the total number of cards in all players' hands.
flavor:
"To make peace with the forest, make peace with me."
—Multani, to Urza

name: Multani's Presence
text: Whenever a spell you've cast is countered, draw a card.
flavor: When a tree falls in the forest, Multani hears it.

name: Silk Net
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: Sometimes it's possible to pull a meal out of thin air.

name: Simian Grunts
text:
Flash
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
flavor: These monkeys mean business.

name: Treefolk Mystic
text: Whenever Treefolk Mystic blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy all Auras attached to that creature.
flavor: Urza's wards fell from him like autumn leaves as he entered the dreaming grove. He awoke imprisoned in living wood.

name: Weatherseed Elf
text: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: "My grandmother once told me the future of our world was inside the Weatherseed. When I touched it, I knew she was right."

name: Angelic Renewal
text: Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may sacrifice Angelic Renewal. If you do, return that card to the battlefield.
flavor: Angels watch over mortals with heavy hearts, knowing what fate awaits them in the end.

name: Back to Basics
text: Nonbasic lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
flavor:
"A ruler wears a crown while the rest of us wear hats, but which would you rather have when it's raining?"
—Barrin, *Principia*

name: Whirlwind Adept
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
flavor: The Flowing Staff technique does not differentiate between offense and defense.

name: Generator Servant
text: {T}, Sacrifice Generator Servant: Add {C}{C}. If that mana is spent on a creature spell, it gains haste until end of turn. (That creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: Infinite potential given finite form.

name: Penumbra Wurm
text:
Trample
When Penumbra Wurm dies, create a 6/6 black Wurm creature token with trample.
flavor: Its ferocity cannot be contained in one lifetime.

name: Emcee
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may stand up and say in a deep, booming voice, "Presenting . . . " and that creature's name. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
flavor: The ogre appealed the match loss and got it downgraded to a warning.

name: Flavor Judge
text: {T}: Choose target spell or ability that targets a permanent you control. Then ask a person outside the game if the story of what will happen makes sense. If they say no, sacrifice Flavor Judge and counter that spell or ability.
flavor: "...and now they're trying to make a brick wall on my property fight a dinosaur to the death."

name: Frankie Peanuts
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may ask target player a yes-or-no question. If you do, that player answers the question truthfully and abides by that answer if able until end of turn.
flavor: Don't cross him or you'll end up sleeping with the merfolk.

name: Old Guard
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature without reminder text. (Reminder text is still any italicized text in parentheses that explains rules you already know.)
flavor: "You say you're capable of flying. You got any proof of that?"

name: Staying Power
text: "Until end of turn" and "this turn" effects don't end.
flavor: Mongo's fleas no longer bothered him. But the family of goblins that had moved in behind his left ear was starting to get really irritating.

name: Carnivorous Death-Parrot
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Carnivorous Death-Parrot unless you say its flavor text.
flavor: Save a kill spell to deal with this guy.

name: Johnny, Combo Player
text: {4}: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: "Just wait till I get my Krark-Clan Ironworks, Genesis Chamber, and Grinding Station. Oh yeah, and a second Myr Retriever."

name: Rings a Bell
text:
As Rings a Bell enters the battlefield, choose a word with four or more letters.
After you say the chosen word for the first time each turn, an opponent may ring or imitate a bell within five seconds. When no opponent does, draw a card.
flavor: Ding, ding, ding!

name: Time Out
text: Roll a six-sided die. Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library, where X is the result.
flavor: Anyone other than a goblin would've gotten only a hand caught in the cookie jar.

name: Topsy Turvy
text:
The phases of each player's turn are reversed. (The phases are, in reverse order, ending, postcombat main, combat, precombat main, and beginning.)
As long as there are more than two players in the game, the turn order is reversed.
flavor: "Here on going is heck the what?"

name: Wall of Fortune
text:
Defender
You may tap an untapped Wall you control to have any player reroll a die that player rolled.
flavor: "You need a six? All right everyone, she needs a six!"

name: Duh
text: Destroy target creature with reminder text. (Reminder text is any italicized text in parentheses that explains rules you already know.)
flavor: Will players understand that the creature is being crushed by two parentheses? Not a chance.

name: Hoisted Hireling
text: Hoisted Hireling has flying as long as it's being held above the battlefield.
flavor: Zarv no longer trusted the kitten posters telling him to "hang in there."

name: Infernius Spawnington III, Esq.
text:
Flying, first strike, trample, haste
This spell costs {3} less to cast for each card you've revealed this turn.
When Infernius Spawnington III, Esq. enters the battlefield, you may say "I'm here." If you do, it deals 3 damage to target player.
flavor: See evil, hear evil, speak evil.

name: Inhumaniac
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. On a 3 or 4, put a +1/+1 counter on Inhumaniac. On a 5 or higher, put two +1/+1 counters on it. On a 1, remove all +1/+1 counters from Inhumaniac.
flavor: For the mind-minded mastermind.

name: Skull Saucer
text:
Flying
When Skull Saucer enters the battlefield, destroy target creature and put your head on the table. Sacrifice Skull Saucer when your head stops touching the table.
flavor: No body is ready for this kind of power.

name: Snickering Squirrel
text: You may tap Snickering Squirrel to increase the result of a die any player rolled by 1.
flavor: "In this line of work, you've got to know how to squirrel things away. Quite literally, in my case."

name: Abstract Iguanart
text: Whenever you cast a spell, note the first letter of its artist's name. If that letter wasn't already noted, put a +1/+1 counter on Abstract Iguanart.
flavor: Another moving piece by the artist El Gecko.

name: Goblin Haberdasher
text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Other creatures you control wearing hats in their art have menace.
flavor: An accessory in every sense of the word.

name: Goblin S.W.A.T. Team
text: Say "Goblin S.W.A.T. Team": Put a +1/+1 counter on Goblin S.W.A.T. Team unless an opponent swats the table within five seconds. Activate only once each turn.
flavor: They refer to their methods as "special S.W.A.T. tactics," and no one has lived to correct them.

name: Infinity Elemental
text: (This creature has INFINITE POWER.)
flavor: It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says,

name: Painiac
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. Painiac gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the result.
flavor: "You're about to be struck by a brilliant idea!"

name: Six-y Beast
text: As Six-y Beast enters the battlefield, you secretly put six or fewer +1/+1 counters on it, then an opponent guesses the number of counters. If that player guesses right, sacrifice Six-y Beast after it enters the battlefield.
flavor: Is it six?

name: Super-Duper Death Ray
text:
Trample (This spell can deal excess damage to its target's controller.)
Super-Duper Death Ray deals 4 damage to target creature.
flavor: "Comin' through!"

name: Yet Another Aether Vortex
text:
All creatures have haste.
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
Noninstant, nonsorcery cards on top of a library are on the battlefield under their owner's control in addition to being in that library.
flavor: It puts the "vortex" in "flavortext."
