name: B-I-N-G-O
text:
Trample
Whenever a player casts a spell, put a chip counter on its mana value.
B-I-N-G-O gets +9/+9 for each set of three numbers in a row with chip counters on them.
flavor: There was a farmer, had a hound . . .

name: Old Fogey
text: Phasing, cumulative upkeep {1}, echo {G}{G}, fading 3, bands with other Dinosaurs, protection from Homarids, snow-covered plainswalk, flanking, rampage 2
flavor: "These kids today with their collector numbers and their newfangled tap symbol. Twenty Black Lotuses and twenty Plague Rats. Now that's *real* Magic."

name: Spirit of the Season
text: When Spirit of the Season enters the battlefield, it gains haste if it's summer. Put a +1/+1 counter on it if it's autumn. You gain 5 life if it's winter. If it's spring, search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: Summoned for all the wrong seasons.

name: Aerialephant
text:
Flying
When Aerialephant enters the battlefield, you get {TK}, then you may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
flavor: Everyone wants to talk about the elephant in this room.

name: Assembled Ensemble
text:
Vigilance
Assembled Ensemble's power is equal to the number of Robots you control.
Whenever you cast a spell with an artifact creature in its art, create a 1/1 white Clown Robot artifact creature token.
flavor: Known for their hit single "Your Wait from This Point Is Seven Hours."

name: Bar Entry
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
• Destroy target creature with any part of its head higher than the bar. (Align the tops of both cards to check.)
flavor: "You will either begin or end the ride no taller than this."

name: _____ Bird Gets the Worm
text:
Flying
When this creature enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it. You gain X life, where X is the number of unique vowels on that sticker. (The vowers are A, E, I, O, U, and Y.)
flavor: It's not like anyone else really wanted it.

name: Clowning Around
text: Create two 1/1 white Clown Robot artifact creature tokens, then roll a six-sided die. If the result is equal to or less than the number of Robots you control, create a 1/1 white Clown Robot artifact creature token.
flavor: The Astrotorium's Clown-Bots are programmed to delight attendees by any means necessary.

name: Complaints Clerk
text:
When Complaints Clerk enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
Whenever you roll a 1, create a 1/1 white Clown Robot artifact creature token.
flavor: The longest lines in the park.

name: Far Out
text: Rather than choose the indicated number of modes for spells and abilities you control, you may choose one or more modes. You can't choose any mode more than once.
flavor: Memories that will technically last the rest of your life.

name: Gobsmacked
text:
Enchant nonland permanent
As Gobsmacked enters the battlefield, choose a person outside the game.
As long as you can see the chosen person from your seat, enchanted permanent can't attack or block, and it's activated abilities can't be activated.
flavor: You haven't see it until you see it in 6-D.

name: A Good Day to Pie
text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Whenever you put a name sticker on a creature, you may return A Good Day to Pie from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"What could be funnier than one big pie to the face? Unless . . . no. Could it be that simple?"
—Pietra, Crafter of Clowns

name: Hat Trick
text: Target blocking or blocked creature you control get +1/+1 and gains first strike until end of turn. If it has a hat, it gains double strike until end of turn. If you and that creature each have a hat, the creature gains triple strike until end of turn.
flavor: "Behold the power of my hat and the ghosts of two other hats I used to own!"

name: Impounding Lot-Bot
text: When Impounding Lot-Bot enters the battlefield, you may say "INCARCERATE!" in a robot voice. If you do, exile another target artifact or enchantment until Impounding Lot-Bot leaves the battlefield.
flavor: Not all tickets can be exchanged for prizes.

name: Jetpack Janitor
text: Alpha strike (This creature has first strike as long as it's blocking or being blocked by a creature that comes after it alphabetically.)
flavor: "'Carol, blast those aliens.' 'Carol, transport these concessions.' No one cares that today is my birthday."

name: Knight in _____ Armor
text:
First strike
As this creature enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it.
This creature has protection from names that start with the same letter as a name sticker on it.
flavor: The lucky armor stopped lightning and lasers, but sadly, also love.

name: Leading Performance
text: Choose two letters. Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control whose name begins with the either of the chosen letters.
flavor:
"If people are always on the edge of their seats, we can save money on chair backs."
—Myra the Magnificent

name: Main Event Horizon
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, choose A through M or N through Z.
Destroy each creature whose name begins with a letter in the chosen range.
flavor: "Anna and Blaine said the ride was awesome. Yolanda and Zachary aren't back yet."

name: Now You See Me . . .
text: Exile target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of mirrors on walls you can see from your seat.
flavor: With enough showmanship, even mundane items like playing cards or molecular teleporters can produce a mesmerizing spectacle.

name: Park Bleater
text:
Whenever another creature you own enters the battlefield, you get {TK}.
{W}, {T}: You may put a sticker on a creature you own that entered the battlefield this turn.
flavor: Once he stopped eating tickets, Bixby was a model employee.

name: Park Re-Entry
text: Return up to two target creature cards that each have a hat and/or mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor:
"Control to Truss. Chief, the entry scan software is reading babies as hot dogs. Again."
—Glaxxar, engineering assistant

name: Ride Guide
text: When Ride Guide enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
flavor: "When riding Erebo's Whip, remember to keep your arms, legs, and any strange flailing appendages inside the vehicle at all times."

name: Robo-Piñata
text:
When Robo-Piñata dies, choose one —
• You get {TK}{TK}.
• You may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
flavor: "I AM FILLED WITH DELICIOUS CANDY. I AM NOT A TRICK."

name: Sanguine Sipper
text: Sanguine Sipper has lifelink as long as you control a stickered permanent.
flavor: The midway offers every flavor under the sun, even to guests who need to stay out of it.

name: T.A.P.P.E.R.
text: {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control that has a hat: Tap target creature.
flavor:
"'Technologically-Advanced People-Pleasing Entertainment Robot', eh? Nice hat. Would be a shame if something happened to it."
—"Brims" Barone, midway mobster

name: Trapeze Artist
text:
Flying
Trapeze Artist enters the battlefield by being flipped from a height of at least one foot (about 0.3 meters). If it lands face down or didn't turn over completely at least once during the flip, return it to its owner's hand.
flavor: Heinrich catches the trapeze only about half the time, but he looks so good falling.

name: Animate Object
text: You get seven {TK}. Choose an inanimate object you own from outside the game. Put a power and toughness sticker on it. You may also put a name sticker, an art sticker, and/or an ability sticker on it. Put it onto the battlefield as a creature token.
flavor: Tap beverages with extreme caution.

name: Baaallerina
text:
Flying
When Baaallerina enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
{2}{U}: Another target creature with a name sticker on it gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Cute as a mutton.

name: Bag Check
text: Counter target spell, then ask a person outside the game if that spell looks dangerous to them. If they say yes, draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: "As long as there's no outside food, you're good to go."

name: Bamboozling Beeble
text:
Protection from Robots
{1}, {T}: The next time target player would roll one or more dice this turn, instead they roll that many dice plus one and you choose one of those rolls to ignore.
flavor: Myra bought beetles because they were cheaper than rubber ducks. Now the infestation is her largest expense.

name: Bioluminary
text: Whenever Bioluminary deals combat damage to a player, you get {TK}{TK}, then you may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
flavor: The Gargantikari astroserpent hated the taste of merfolk, but the audience didn't need to know that.

name: Blufferfish
text: {3}{U}: An opponent tells you a statement about themselves and secretly notes whether it's true or not. You guess which it is. If you guessed correctly, Blufferfish gets +2/+0 and can't be blocked this turn.
flavor: Lying to a fish is such an unthinkable act, most planets don't even have a law against it.

name: Boing!
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand, then roll a six-sided die. If the result is 3 or less, scry a number of cards equal to the result.
flavor: Sometimes the Astrotorium's stunts look dangerous because they absolutely are.

name: Busted!
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is the number of words in the name with the most words among permanents you control.
flavor: "All you gotta do is panic with purpose. And plead your innocence with purpose. And have your mom bail you out with purpose."

name: Croakid Amphibonaut
text: Croakid Amphibonaut has flying as long as you control a stickered permanent.
flavor:
"I designed the Astrotorium's jetpacks to be lightweight and inexpensive. Nobody mentioned reliable."
—Truss, chief engineer

name: Decisions, Decisions
text: Reveal the top three cards of your library, then choose a consonant. (Y counts.) Put each card that has the chosen letter in the first word of its name from among them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor: To B, or not to B.

name: Exchange of Words
text: When Exchange of Words enters the battlefield, choose two target creatures. For as long as Exchange of Words remains on the battlefield, exchange the text boxes of those creatures.
flavor: Before criticizing, walk a mile *(about 1.6 kilometers)* in their head. That way, when you do, you're a mile away and you have their head.

name: Glitterflitter
text:
Flying
When Glitterflitter enters the battlefield, you get {TK}, then you may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
flavor: There are no small parts, only small performers.

name: How Is This a Par Three?!
text: Whenever you cast a spell, you may have target player mill X cards, where X is the number of words in that spell's name.
flavor: Against the infinite backdrop of space, isn't all golf miniature?

name: Make a _____ Splash
text:
Flash
When this enchantment enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it.
Whenever you put a sticker on this enchantment, tap up to X target creatures, where X is the number of u's in name stickers on this enchantment.
flavor: The largest dunk tank in forty-seven galaxies.

name: Monitor Monitor
text:
When Monitor Monitor enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
Once each turn, you may pay {1} to reroll one or more dice you rolled.
flavor: Nine fires, a hull breach, and a Quafloovian meganibbler escaped from the petting zoo. Things were suspiciously quiet.

name: Plate Spinning
text: Whenever you cast a spell, copy it and you may choose new targets for the copy. Then balance a card from outside the game on one of your fingertips. When that card falls or touches another card, sacrifice Plate Spinning.
flavor: For extra style points, spin them.

name: Prize Wall
text:
Defender
{U}, {T}: You get {TK}.
{4}{U}, {T}: You may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor:
"That bear's been there since the Astrotorium opened. I've seen it move."
—Ernst, deep fry cook

name: Seasoned Buttoneer
text: When Seasoned Buttoneer enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
flavor: Everyone comments on the buttons, but few appreciate the pedals.

name: Super-Duper Lost
text: Put target creature into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library, where X is the number of doors you can see from your seat.
flavor: Fblthp decided to get some sleep, nestled among the plush Ajanis until morning.

name: _____ _____ _____ Trespasser
text:
When this creature enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it.
{3}{U}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each name sticker on it. It can't be blocked this turn.
flavor: "All you gotta do is walk with purpose. And run with purpose. And clear a five-foot gate with purpose."

name: Unlawful Entry
text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever you put an art sticker on a creature, you may return Unlawful Entry from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"Glaxxar, Security Bot 254 has wandered off. After lunch, throw on a spacesuit and go find it."
—Truss, chief engineer

name: Wizards of the _____
text: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it, then look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of unique vowels on that sticker. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order. (The vowels are A, E, I, O, U, and Y.)
flavor: Magic is the name of the game.

name: Attempted Murder
text: Choose target creature. Roll X six-sided dice. For each even result, put two -1/-1 counters on that creature. For each odd result, create a 1/2 blue Bird creature token with flying named Storm Crow.
flavor: Squawks was quick to establish the social pecking order.

name: Black Hole
text: Destroy target creature and up to X other target creatures, where X is the number of Attractions you've visited this turn.
flavor:
"Code Dark Donut! Code Dark Donut! All available fun specialists, please report to the Roil Coaster immediately!"
—Truss, chief engineer

name: Carnival Carnivore
text:
Deathtouch
When Carnival Carnivore enters the battlefield, you get {TK}, then you may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
flavor: Somehow only the third-most dangerous ride in the park.

name: Deadbeat Attendant
text: When Deadbeat Attendant enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
flavor: Some people will hire anyone with a pulse. Myra isn't that picky.

name: Discourtesy Clerk
text:
When Discourtesy Clerk enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
At the beginning of your end step, if you control three or more Attractions, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor: Myra doesn't pay the vampires to smile—but only because guests found it off-putting.

name: Disemvowel
text: Destroy target creature. That creature's controller loses 1 life for each unique vowel in the creature's name. (The vowels are A, E, I, O, U, and Y.)
flavor: Without vowels, no one can hear you scream.

name: Dissatisfied Customer
text:
Flying, haste
When Dissatisfied Customer enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. If the result is 3 or less, you lose that much life.
flavor: The mirrors weren't fun for everyone.

name: Down for Repairs
text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. Destroy up to one target Attraction that player controls. (It's put into their junkyard.)
flavor: Safety twelfth.

name: Gray Merchant of Alphabet
text: When Gray Merchant of Alphabet enters the battlefield, choose a letter. For each creature you control that has the chosen letter in its name, you gain 1 life and each opponent loses 1 life.
flavor: Like any young zombie, Gary dreamed of escaping the underworld to join the circus.

name: Haberthrasher
text:
Deathtouch
Whenever another creature that has a hat enters the battlefield under your control or a hat sticker is put on a creature you control, each opponent loses 1 life.
flavor: "Brims" Barone's enforcers are always dressed to kill.

name: Line Cutter
text: When Line Cutter enters the battlefield, roll to visit your Attractions.
flavor: Waiting is for chumps with flimsy spacesuits.

name: Night Shift of the Living Dead
text:
After you roll a die, you may pay 1 life. If you do, increase or decrease the result by 1. Do this only once each turn.
Whenever you roll a 6, create a 2/2 black Zombie Employee creature token.
flavor: At the Astrotorium, even the dead make a living wage.

name: Questionable Cuisine
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand. Create a Food token for each trash can you can see from your seat. (It's an artifact with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.")
flavor: May contain soy. May contain a deep void, chillingly hoarse and howling without voice. May contain gluten.

name: Quick Fixer
text:
Menace
Whenever Quick Fixer deals combat damage to a player, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
flavor: Myra doesn't believe in stopping rides for minor inconveniences like "they need to be repaired."

name: Rat in the Hat
text: {T}, Sacrifice Rat in the Hat: Until end of turn, you may cast target creature card that has a hat from your graveyard.
flavor: While the gremlin, beeble, and squirrel infestations wreaked havoc on the park, Roxi was able to spin the numerous rat colonies as a "robust recycling program."

name: Saw in Half
text: Destroy target creature. If that creature dies this way, its controller creates two tokens that are copies of that creature, except their base power is half that creature's power and their base toughness is half that creature's toughness. Round up each time.
flavor: The audience always loves it, but volunteers are divided.

name: Scared Stiff
text: Scared Stiff has menace as long as you control a stickered permanent.
flavor: The horrors of Sorin's Haunted Mansion scared Hurrk half to life.

name: Scooch
text:
Add or subtract 1 from target creature's power, target player's life total, or target die roll's result.
Draw a card.
flavor:
"What? No, that's ridiculous! Of course the rat doesn't work for the park. I've never seen it before in my life!"
—Monoxa, midway manager

name: Soul Swindler
text:
As long as you've visited an attraction this turn, Soul Swindler has indestructible. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
When Soul Swindler enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
flavor: "Three tries to decide your fate! Fabulous prizes! Probably no untold torment!"

name: Step Right Up
text: Open two Attractions. (Put the top two cards of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
flavor:
"Ah, the midway, beating heart of the—well, maybe the big top is the heart. If there were two hearts, then the midway—or the lungs. Lungs or stomach!"
—Captain Rex Nebula

name: Wolf in _____ Clothing
text: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it. When you do, up to X target creatures each get -1/-1 until end of turn, where X is the number of unique vowels on that sticker. (The vowels are A, E, I, O, U, and Y.)
flavor: "And to think, I came in here looking for someone to eat."

name: Xenosquirrels
text:
Xenosquirrels enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
After you roll a die, you may remove a +1/+1 counter from Xenosquirrels. If you do, increase or decrease the result by 1.
flavor:
"Hey Glaxxar, did you remember to seal the vents on the seat belt control module?"
—Truss, chief engineer

name: Aardwolf's Advantage
text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain alpha strike until end of turn. (A creature with alpha strike has first strike as long as it's blocking or being blocked by a creature that comes after it alphabetically.)
flavor:
"My Abattoir Ghoul deck is unbeatable. Wait, 1996 World Champion?"
—Johnny, to Spike

name: Amped Up
text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each electrical socket in a wall or floor you can see from your seat.
Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. Until end of turn, it gets +3/+0 and gains haste.
flavor: Space can be a lawless place—far from the prying eyes of electrical inspectors.

name: Art Appreciation
text: Put an art sticker on a nonland permanent you own. Then ask a person outside the game to rate its new art on a scale from 1 to 5, where 5 is the best. When they rate the art, up to that many target creatures can't block this turn.
flavor: There's no defending against public opinion.

name: _____ Balls of Fire
text:
When this enchantment enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it.
Whenever you put a sticker on this enchantment, it deals damage equal to the number of o's in name stickers on this enchantment to any target.
flavor: Employees were instructed to refer to meteor showers as "impromptu fireworks."

name: Big Winner
text: Big Winner has trample as long as you control a stickered permanent.
flavor: The results of the test of strength were: Yes.

name: Circuits Act
text: Roll three six-sided dice. For each different result, create a 1/1 white Clown Robot artifact creature token.
flavor: Another day, another item Pietra has to add to the "do not juggle" database.

name: Devil K. Nevil
text:
Haste
When Devil K. Nevil enters the battlefield, jump it over any number of creatures. If it clears those creatures, put that many +1/+1 counters on it. (You can see a jumping demonstration at DevilKNevil.com.)
flavor: "Danger is my middle name. Also, I don't know how to spell."

name: Eelectrocute
text:
Eelectrocute deals 2 damage to any target.
You may cast Eelectrocute from your graveyard as long as you've rolled a 6 this turn. If you cast Eelectrocute this way and it would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead.
flavor: The midway's games aren't so much rigged as they are insulated and grounded.

name: _____ Goblin
text: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it. Add {R} for each unique vowel on that sticker. (The vowels are A, E, I, O, U, and Y.)
flavor: The Astrotorium has never been a place for self-restraint.

name: Goblin Airbrusher
text: Whenever you place a sticker, create a Treasure token. If it's an art sticker, instead create two Treasure tokens. (They're artifacts with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing the paint came from, he was promoted to shirt duty.

name: Goblin Blastronauts
text:
When Goblin Blastronauts enters the battlefield, open an Attraction.
Whenever you roll a 6, you may copy the spell, ability, or Attraction visit that caused you to roll that die. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor: The goblins really put themselves into the fireworks show, despite Myra's pleas to stop.

name: Juggletron
text:
Trample
Whenever Juggletron attacks, you may put an art sticker on it.
Juggletron gets +3/+0 for each item in its art that's not touching Juggletron, another item, or the card frame.
flavor: It's all fun and games until it drops a guest. Then it's a misdemeanor.

name: Minotaur de Force
text:
Haste
When Minotaur de Force enters the battlefield, you get {TK}, then you may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
flavor: "If I ever need a haircut, I just fall a little to the left."

name: Non-Human Cannonball
text: When Non-Human Cannonball dies, roll a six-sided die. If the result is 4 or less, Non-Human Cannonball deals that much damage to you.
flavor: Designed for maximum impact, comedic and otherwise.

name: One-Clown Band
text: {2}{R}: Target Robot gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Programmed to play more than seventy instruments and only one song.

name: Priority Boarding
text: Whenever you roll a die, you may reveal the top card of your library. Do this only once each turn. Whenever you reveal a card with mana value less than the result this way, you may exile it. If you do, you may play it this turn.
flavor: The Astrotorium's express lane is practically its own ride.

name: Proficient Pyrodancer
text:
When Proficient Pyrodancer enters the battlefield, you may put an art sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
{2}{R}: Another target creature with an art sticker on it gets +2/+0 and gains menace until end of turn.
flavor: When she performed, she was on fire, but in a good way.

name: Rad Rascal
text: When Rad Rascal enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
flavor: "Rent a scooter and be just like Devil K. Nevil! Just don't go faster than the speed limit. Or jump over anything. Or catch on fire. Or break every bone in your body multiple times. Other than that, just like him!"

name: Rock Star
text:
Reach
When Rock Star enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, reveal the top five cards of your library. Ask a person outside the game to choose which of them is most like a rock band. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
flavor: Born to, and of, rock.

name: Slight Malfunction
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Roll a six-sided die. When you do, Slight Malfunction deals 1 damage to each of up to X target creatures, where X is the result.
flavor:
"Attention, valued patrons. The Tilt-o-Squirrel is now closed."
—Astrotorium public address system

name: Ticking Mime Bomb
text: When Ticking Mime Bomb enters the battlefield, without speaking or indicating any specific creature, pantomime to a person outside the game, then they choose a creature you don't control. Ticking Mime Bomb deals damage equal to twice the number of Robots you control to the chosen creature.
flavor: Silent, but deadly.

name: Trigger Happy
text: Choose a triggered ability of target permanent. It triggers. You control that ability.
flavor: Whenever you copy a triggered ability, you may do a little dance.

name: Wee Champion
text: Whenever you place a sticker, Wee Champion gets +1/+1 until end of turn. If it's an art sticker, instead put a +1/+1 counter on Wee Champion.
flavor: Nobody had ever won the bear, but then again, nobody had ever wanted it quite as much.

name: Well Done
text: Well Done deals 5 damage to target creature. If that creature is rare or mythic rare, Well Done deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor:
"What's the big deal? I've been on fire eighty-one times. Twice just while sleeping."
—Devil K. Nevil, daredevil extraordinaire

name: Alpha Guard
text:
When Alpha Guard enters the battlefield, choose a letter.
{T}: Untap another target permanent whose name starts with the chosen letter.
flavor: "Whimsy overflow in sector G! The gremlins are rampaging and the beebles are on fire!"

name: Atomwheel Acrobats
text:
Whenever you roll a 1 or 2, put that many +1/+1 counters on Atomwheel Acrobats.
{2}{G}: Roll a six-sided die.
flavor:
"If the acrobatic show doesn't wow the audience, we have no one to blame but our elves."
—Myra the Magnificent

name: Blorbian Buddy
text:
Trample
{G}, {T}: You get {TK} (a ticket counter).
flavor: When Captain Nebula tragically destroyed the planet Blorb-12 in a parking accident, Myra compensated the survivors with lifetime passes.

name: Chicken Troupe
text:
Ward {2} (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {2}.)
When Chicken Troupe enters the battlefield, you get {TK}, then you may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
flavor: Why did the chicken cross the park? To get to the other ride.

name: Coming Attraction
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle. Open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
flavor: The Astrotorium adds new attractions almost as fast as Captain Nebula can crash them into asteroids.

name: Done for the Day
text: At the beginning of your end step, if you control an Employee, a Performer, or a Robot, you may get {TK} or create a Treasure token. If you control all three, you may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
flavor: Punchy was programmed to do two things: punch tickets and love punching tickets.

name: Embiggen
text: Until end of turn, target non-Brushwagg creature gets +1/+1 for each supertype, card type, and subtype it has.
flavor: "Flea circus? No, flee circus!"

name: Finishing Move
text: You get {TK}{TK}, then you may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own. Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.
flavor: What the show lacks in historical accuracy, it makes up for in awesome submission holds.

name: Grabby Tabby
text: Grabby Tabby has vigilance as long as you control a stickered permanent.
flavor: The milk bottle toss is closed until the rules can be amended.

name: Icing Manipulator
text:
Each +1/+1 counter on a creature you control is also a Food token. (It's an artifact with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.")
{3}{G}, {T}: Roll two six-sided dice. For each odd result, put a +1/+1 counter on a creature of your choice. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: Her most popular flavors are vanilla, maple pecan crunch, and Glurgian galactopod.

name: An Incident Has Occurred
text:
Choose one or both —
• Destroy target creature with flying.
• Destroy target Attraction. (It's put into its owner's junkyard.)
You may apologize. If you do, you gain 3 life.
flavor: "So sorry, but, per our waiver, we're not responsible for 'things happening.'"

name: Jermane, Pride of the Circus
text:
{G}, {T}: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature with four or more legs.
{1}{G}{G}, {T}: Until end of turn, all creatures able to block target creature with four or more legs do so.
flavor: "Don't worry about me, folks! This beauty was well-fed by my predecessor."

name: Killer Cosplay
text:
Whenever Killer Cosplay becomes attached to a creature, choose a creature card name with an identical mana cost. That creature becomes a copy of the card with the chosen name until Killer Cosplay becomes unattached from it.
Equip {3}
flavor:
"Ach! Hans, run! Get the camera. He's adorable!"
—Steffi Bobsdotter, next words

name: Lineprancers
text:
When Lineprancers enters the battlefield, you get {TK}{TK}, then you may put a power and toughness sticker on a creature you own.
{3}{G}: Target creature you don't control blocks target creature you control with a power and toughness sticker on it other than Lineprancers this turn if able.
flavor: Can you do the can-can-can-can?

name: Mistakes Were Made
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token for each fire extinguisher you can see from your seat.
flavor: In hindsight, Chandra's Incendiary Experience should never have been built next to Auntie Grub's House of Pitch.

name: _____-o-saurus
text:
Trample
When this creature enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it. Put a +1/+1 counter on it for each unique vowel on that sticker. (The vowels are A, E, I, O, U, and Y.)
flavor:
"Petting in the petting zoo is not advised."
—Astrotorium waiver

name: Pair o' Dice Lost
text: Roll two six-sided dice. Return any number of cards with total mana value X or less from your graveyard to your hand, where X is the total of those results. Exile Pair o' Dice Lost.
flavor: The Astrotorium is a zero-waste facility, meaning it deals with zero of its waste.

name: Petting Zookeeper
text:
Reach
When Petting Zookeeper enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
flavor: Calling it a "petting zoo" really saved on the cages.

name: Pie-Eating Contest
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, gobble X. (Each time you gobble, take a bite of food or sacrifice a Food token.)
X target creatures you control each get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor: The pie was outstanding. The cobbler tasted like shoes.

name: Plot Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flavor text.
flavor: "If you've got words, we're going to have words."

name: Resolute Veggiesaur
text:
Trample
Whenever you roll your third die each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Resolute Veggiesaur.
flavor: This dinosaur doesn't know what will kill him, but he's determined it won't be heart disease.

name: Sole Performer
text: {T}: Add {T}{T}. Activate only once each turn. (While activating an ability, use {T} rather than tapping the permanent to pay for {T}.)
flavor: Elven tap is the official language of three very obnoxious planets.

name: Spelling Bee
text:
Flying, deathtouch
Whenever Spelling Bee deals combat damage to a player, that player looks at the top card of your library and chooses a word on that card. You spell that word. If you spell it correctly, draw a card. Otherwise, scry 1.
flavor: Just be thankful it wasn't grammar scorpions.

name: Squirrel Squatters
text:
When Squirrel Squatters enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. (Put the top card of your Attraction deck onto the battlefield.)
Whenever Squirrel Squatters attacks, create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token that's tapped and attacking for each Attraction you've visited this turn.
flavor: Such plush accommodations.

name: Stiltstrider
text:
Reach
When Stiltstrider enters the battlefield, you get {TK}{TK}, then you may put a sticker on a nonland permanent you own.
flavor: Impossibly tall, improbably elegant.

name: Vegetation Abomination
text:
Deathtouch
{T}, Sacrifice Vegetation Abomination: Roll a six-sided die. You gain life equal to the result.
flavor: The animal and vegetable categories kind of merged over time.

name: Atinlay Igpay
text:
Oubleday ikestray
Enwhay ouyay eakspay ay onnay-igpay-atinlay ordway, acrificesay Atinlay Igpay.
flavor: Isthay iecepay ofay avorflay exttay oesn'tday eallyray aysay anythingay.

name: Bosom Buddy
text: Whenever you cast a spell, you may gain ½ life for each word in that spell's name.
flavor: "Step 1: I believe in a power and toughness greater than myself . . . ."

name: Cheap Ass
text: Spells you cast cost {½} less to cast.
flavor: And you thought Yawgmoth drove a hard bargain.

name: Collector Protector
text: {W}, Give an opponent a nonland card you own from outside the game: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you or Collector Protector this turn.
flavor: "Here—have a Mudhole."

name: Drawn Together
text:
As Drawn Together enters the battlefield, choose an artist.
Creatures with art by the chosen artist get +2/+2.
flavor:
"My Pete Venters theme deck is nearly complete. Then I shall be unstoppable! Bwahahahaaa!"
—Pete Venters

name: Erase (Not the Urza's Legacy One)
text:
If you control two or more white permanents that share an artist, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Exile target enchantment.
flavor: Synonyms for "erase" we haven't used: ablate, a̶b̶r̶a̶d̶e̶, chafe, fray, f̶r̶a̶z̶z̶l̶e̶, scuff, and scrub.

name: Fascist Art Director
text: {W}{W}: Fascist Art Director gains protection from the artist of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: Dear Mr. and Mrs. Cranford, After careful analysis of Jeremy's vocational testing, I feel that he is best suited for a career in either torture or art direction.

name: First Come, First Served
text: Each attacking or blocking creature with the lowest collector number among attacking or blocking creatures has first strike.
flavor: Yotian soldiers hoped that one day R&D would make an artifact creature whose name starts with Z. And in their dreams, it's a 4/1.

name: Ladies' Knight
text:
Flying
Spells cast by players wearing at least one item of women's clothing cost {1} less to cast. (You can define women's clothing as you see fit. Be reasonable.)
flavor:
"I said 'Put him in a *core set*, not a corset!'"
—Richard Garfield, Ph.D.

name: Little Girl
flavor: In the future, she may be a distinguished leader, a great scholar, or a decorated hero. These days all she does is pee the bed.

name: Man of Measure
text:
As long as you're shorter than an opponent, Man of Measure gets +0/+1 and has first strike.
As long as you're taller than an opponent, Man of Measure gets +1/+0.
flavor: You need to be this tall to play this card.

name: Save Life
text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 2½ life.
• Prevent the next 2½ damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
Gotcha — If an opponent says "save" or "life," you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Save Life from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Who consistently managed to win.

name: Standing Army
text: As long as you're standing, Standing Army has vigilance.
flavor: They're the chair-men of the bored.

name: Wordmail
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each word in its name.
flavor:
"Suck on it, Stangg!"
—Sol'kanar the Swamp King

text: {1}: This card's name becomes the card name of your choice. Activate anywhere, anytime.
flavor: {1}: This card's flavor text becomes the flavor text of your choice. (This ability doesn't work because it's flavor text, not rules text (but neither does this reminder text, so you figure it out).)

name: Artful Looter
text:
{T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
Whenever a permanent that shares an artist with another permanent you control enters the battlefield, untap Artful Looter.
flavor: PRICELESS PIC PILFERED Painting Found Abandoned in Graveyard Merfolk Decry Wizards' Treatment

name: Brushstroke Paintermage
text: {T}: Target permanent's artist becomes the artist of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: He gives credit where credit isn't due.

name: Bursting Beebles
text: Bursting Beebles can't be blocked as long as defending player controls two or more nonland permanents that share an artist.
flavor: Like thousands of others, the beebles quit Magic for several years following the release of the *Mercadian Masques* set.

name: Double Header
text:
Flying
When Double Header enters the battlefield, you may return target permanent with a two-word name to its owner's hand.
flavor: Players that don't read flavor text aren't too bright, sorta smell, and dress funny. But let's just keep this between us, okay? They can get kind of violent.

name: Flaccify
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}{½}.
flavor: "Don't worry about it. It happens to every mage sooner or later."

name: Framed!
text: Choose an artist. Tap all untapped permanents with art by that artist or untap all tapped permanents with art by that artist.
flavor: Who knew an 8˝ by 10˝ could feel like a 2˝ by 4˝?

name: Loose Lips
text:
Enchant creature
As Loose Lips enters the battlefield, choose a sentence with eight or fewer words.
Enchanted creature has flying.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, that player may say the chosen sentence. If they don't, you draw two cards.
flavor: Your sentence can't be longer than this one.

name: Magical Hacker
text: {U}: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of + with -, and vice versa, until end of turn.

name: Mouth to Mouth
text: Choose target opponent and target creature they control. You and that player have a breath-holding contest. If you win, you gain control of that creature.
flavor: Interesting tidbit: Surveys show that the card Ow has one of the most popular pieces of flavor text in the *Unglued* expansion.

name: Now I Know My ABC's
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control permanents with names that include all twenty-six letters of the English alphabet, you win the game.
flavor: The quick onyx goblin jumps over the lazy dwarf.

name: Number Crunch
text:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Gotcha — If an opponent says a number, you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Number Crunch from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Can you digit?

name: Question Elemental?
text:
Did you know this creature has flying?
Are you aware that any time you say something that isn't a question, when a player points out this fact first, they gain control of Question Elemental?
flavor: "What the . . . ?"

name: Smart Ass
text: Whenever Smart Ass attacks, choose a card name. If defending player has no cards with the chosen name in their hand, they may reveal their hand. If they don't reveal their hand, Smart Ass can't be blocked this turn.
flavor: "I don't get it. Why doesn't anybody like me?"

name: Spell Counter
text:
Counter target spell.
Gotcha — If an opponent says "spell" or "counter," you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Spell Counter from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Playing *Unhinged*, . . .

name: Bad Ass
text: {1}{B}, Growl: Regenerate Bad Ass.
flavor: He wanders the land in search of Good Ass.

name: Bloodletter
text: When the names of three or more nonland permanents begin with the same letter, sacrifice Bloodletter. If you do, it deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor:
"That's not really an A. It's an Æ. They changed it! Wait, don't—"
—Hœbrus Væm, Aerathi librarian, last words

name: Eye to Eye
text: You and target creature's controller have a staring contest. If you win, destroy that creature.
flavor: True, Gargox had blinded himself for life, but the glass eyes never lost.

name: Kill! Destroy!
text:
Destroy target nonblack creature.
Gotcha — If an opponent says "kill" or "destroy," you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Kill! Destroy! from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Getting "Gotcha'ed" again and again.

name: Mother of Goons
text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, sacrifice Mother of Goons unless you insult that creature.
flavor: "Word to me."

name: Persecute Artist
text: Choose an artist other than Rebecca Guay. Target player reveals their hand and discards all nonland cards with art by the chosen artist.
flavor: The torches and pitchforks were no match for Rebecca's fans.

name: Stop That
text:
Target player discards a card.
Gotcha — If an opponent audibly flicks the cards in their hand, you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Stop That from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Now for a squirt of lemon juice.

name: Tainted Monkey
text: {T}: Choose a word. Target player mills a card. If a card with the chosen word in its text box was milled this way, they lose 3 life.
flavor: "C'mon, choose 'monkey.' Everybody loves monkeys!"

name: Wet Willie of the Damned
text: Wet Willie of the Damned deals 2½ damage to any target and you gain 2½ life.
flavor: Ever the warrior, Glissa responded with a "wedgie from beyond Uranus."

name: When Fluffy Bunnies Attack
text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of times the letter of your choice appears in that creature's name.
flavor:
"Get it? Bunnies, letters, -X/-X? Me neither."
—Bucky, flavor text writer

name: Working Stiff
text:
As Working Stiff enters the battlefield, straighten your arms.
When you bend an elbow, sacrifice Working Stiff.
flavor: Oh, does your nose itch?

name: Zombie Fanboy
text:
As Zombie Fanboy enters the battlefield, choose an artist.
Whenever a permanent with art by the chosen artist is put into a graveyard, put two +1/+1 counters on Zombie Fanboy.
flavor: The real advantage of being a zombie gamer? No one notices the stench.

name: Zzzyxas's Abyss
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all nonland permanents with the first name alphabetically among nonland permanents.
flavor: Tired of always being picked last, the wizard Zzzyxas created the ultimate revenge.

name: Assquatch
text:
Each other Donkey gets +1½/+1½.
Whenever another Donkey enters the battlefield, untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: Who wants to see a picture of a big hairy ass?

name: Deal Damage
text:
Deal Damage deals 4 damage to any target.
Gotcha — If an opponent says "deal" or "damage," you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Deal Damage from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Until he got singed . . .

name: Dumb Ass
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, target opponent chooses whether Dumb Ass attacks this turn.
flavor: Envying the intelligence of goblins is a bad place to be.

name: Face to Face
text: You and target opponent play a best two-out-of-three Rock, Paper, Scissors match. If you win, Face to Face deals 5 damage to that player.
flavor: Befuddled by this new game, Argg longed for the days of Rock, Rock, Rock.

name: Frazzled Editor
text: Protection from wordy (Something is wordy if it has four or more lines of rules text.)
flavor: The pen is mightier than the sword.

name: Goblin Secret Agent
text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal a card from your hand at random.
flavor:
SECRET AGENT
PD042198
LICENSE TO BE KILLED

name: Mana Flair
text: Add {R} for each nonland permanent with art by the artist of your choice.
flavor:
What began as black
Has slowly shifted to red.
Fickle color pie.

name: Mons's Goblin Waiters
text: Sacrifice a creature or land: Add {HR}.
flavor:
Poached Rukh Eggs
Rock
Cooked Rock
Unicorn-on-the-Cob
Wormfang Turtle Soup

name: Orcish Paratroopers
text: When Orcish Paratroopers enters the battlefield, flip it from a height of at least one foot. Sacrifice Orcish Paratroopers unless it turns over completely at least once during the flip and lands face up.
flavor:
IOU one parashoot
—Urk, mogg fanatic

name: Punctuate
text: Punctuate deals damage to target creature equal to half the number of punctuation marks in that creature's text box. (The punctuation marks are ! ? , ; : - — ( ) / " " ' ' & .)
flavor: "Ooh—right in the colon."

name: Pygmy Giant
text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Pygmy Giant deals X damage to target creature, where X is a number in the sacrificed creature's text box.
flavor:
"487. You're welcome."
—Bucky, flavor text writer

name: Red-Hot Hottie
text: Whenever Red-Hot Hottie deals damage to a creature, put a third-degree-burn counter on that creature. It gains "At the beginning of each end step, sacrifice this creature unless you scream 'Aaah!' at the top of your lungs."
flavor: She was winning the Dominarian "Are You Hot?" competition until disaster struck during the wet T-shirt round.

name: Rocket-Powered Turbo Slug
text: Super haste (This may attack the turn before you cast it. (You may put this card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking during your declare attackers step. If you do, you lose the game at the beginning of your next turn's end step unless you pay this card's mana cost during that turn.))
flavor: Did you go through all the trouble to unscramble this?

name: Sauté
text: Sauté deals 3½ damage to any target.
flavor:
"Selecting the proper beeble is the key to a good sauté. The pinker the fur and the heartier the yelp, the more succulent the beeble will be when you pop it in your mouth."
—Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar, *The Underworld Cookbook*

name: Touch and Go
text:
Destroy target land.
Gotcha — If an opponent touches their face, you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Touch and Go from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Judge's ruling: The interior of the face still counts as the face, so a nose-pick is legitimate grounds for saying "Gotcha!"

name: Creature Guy
text: Gotcha — If an opponent says "creature" or "guy," you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Creature Guy from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: There once was a player named Quinn, . . .

name: Elvish House Party
text: Elvish House Party's power and toughness are each equal to the current hour, using the twelve-hour system.
flavor: The party was going strong for nearly an hour past midnight—then all of a sudden it just petered out.

name: Fat Ass
text: Fat Ass gets +2/+2 and has trample as long as you're eating. (Gum isn't food. We checked.)
flavor: Our lawyers say no matter how funny it would be, we can't encourage players to eat the cards. Hear that? Whatever you do, *don't* eat the delicious cards.

name: Fraction Jackson
text: {G}, {T}: Return target card with a ½ on it from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Bitten by radioactive beebles in a freak algebra accident, young Ricky Robertson discovered he'd gained the ability to harness the awesome power of fractions!

name: Graphic Violence
text: All creatures with art by the artist of your choice get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor: WARNING: THE DOMINARIAN SURGEON GENERAL HAS FOUND THAT SAVAGE BEATINGS CAN LEAD TO CHUMP BLOCKS, LIFE REDUCTION, AND EVEN GAME LOSS.

name: Keeper of the Sacred Word
text:
As Keeper of the Sacred Word enters the battlefield, choose a word.
Whenever an opponent says the chosen word, Keeper of the Sacred Word gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: This is not a subliminal message.

name: Laughing Hyena
text: Gotcha — If an opponent laughs, you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Laughing Hyena from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "Two muffins are baking in an oven. One muffin says to the other muffin, 'It's getting hot in here, huh?' The other muffin says, 'Aagh! A talking muffin!'"

name: Monkey Monkey Monkey
text:
As Monkey Monkey Monkey enters the battlefield, choose a letter.
Monkey Monkey Monkey gets +1/+1 for each nonland permanent whose name begins with the chosen letter.
flavor: Many matches make more madcap monkey mayhem.

name: Name Dropping
text: Gotcha — If an opponent says a word that's in the name of a card in your graveyard, you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return that card to your hand.
flavor: Gemini (May 21—June 21) This week is a good time to branch out and meet others. But don't forget your roots. Avoid commitments and open flames.

name: Our Market Research Shows That Players Like Really Long Card Names So We Made this Card to Have the Absolute Longest Card Name Ever Elemental
text: Art rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked by a creature, it gets +2/+2 for each creature in the blocker's art beyond the first.)
flavor: Just call it OMRSTPLRLCNSWMTCTHTALCNEE for short.

name: Remodel
text:
If you control two or more green permanents that share an artist, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Exile target artifact.
flavor: 6 PM (23) This Old Grove 98055 A rusted masticore makes a beautiful addition to any garden.

name: Shoe Tree
text:
Shoe Tree enters the battlefield with up to two shoe counters on it. Use your shoes as counters.
Shoe Tree gets +1/+1 for each shoe counter on it.
flavor: It grows several feet a year.

name: Side to Side
text: You and target opponent arm-wrestle. If you win, create a 3/3 green Ape creature token.
flavor: His friends at the gym never knew Garanth's secret shame. For years he had tried to walk away from professional arm wrestling, but hey—free monkeys.

name: Supersize
text: Target creature gets +3½/+3½ until end of turn.
flavor: You want "mise" with that?

name: Symbol Status
text: Create a 1/1 colorless Expansion-Symbol creature token for each different expansion symbol among permanents you control.
flavor:
"Everyone break into teams. Weaponry, you're with me. Nature group, meet by the palm tree. Stoneworks and metalworks, follow the anvil. Everyone else, gather around the giant V."
—Sword of Kaldra

name: Uktabi Kong
text:
Trample
When Uktabi Kong enters the battlefield, destroy all artifacts.
Tap two untapped Apes you control: Create a 1/1 green Ape creature token.
flavor: "I desire the acquisition of a potassium-rich fruit comestible of *substantial* magnitude."

name: By Gnome Means
text:
{1}{W}, Remove a counter from a permanent you control: Create a 1/1 colorless Gnome artifact creature token.
{1}{W}, Sacrifice an artifact: Choose any kind of counter a printed card refers to, then put one of that counter on target permanent.
flavor: There's no race like gnome.

name: Jackknight
text: Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Jackknight. If that artifact is a Contraption, Jackknight gains lifelink until end of turn.
flavor: "My sword is at your service, as are my scissors, corkscrew, and bottle opener."

name: Oddly Uneven
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy each creature with an odd number of words in its name. (Hyphenated words are one word.)
• Destroy each creature with an even number of words in its name.
flavor: The odds are good, but the goods are odd.

name: Animate Library
text:
Enchant your library
Enchanted library is an artifact creature on the battlefield with power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in it. It's still a library.
If enchanted library would leave the battlefield, exile Animate Library instead.
flavor: Sometimes the books hit back.

name: Graveyard Busybody
text:
All graveyards are also your graveyards.
Graveyard Busybody's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards with flavor text in your graveyards.
flavor: You have to hang around the graveyard if you want to catch the talking dead.

name: Incite Insight
text: Assemble X Contraptions. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
flavor: After a hundred failed patent applications, Cornelian was stunned to find that no one had ever created a steam-powered autonomous ice cream delivery system. He immediately designed a gnome with scoops for hands.

name: Spike, Tournament Grinder
text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
{B/P}{B/P}{B/P}{B/P}: Reveal a card you own from outside the game that has been banned or restricted in a Constructed format and put it into your hand.
flavor: "Just wait—I have a response."

name: Steamflogger of the Month
text: When Steamflogger of the Month enters the battlefield, it assembles a Contraption for each Contraption you control. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
flavor: The perks aren't great.

name: Three-Headed Goblin
text: Triple strike (This creature deals first-strike, regular, and last-strike combat damage.)
flavor: It's true that two heads are better than one, but after that you run into diminishing returns.

name: Hydradoodle
text:
As Hydradoodle enters the battlefield, roll X six-sided dice. Hydradoodle enters the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the total of those results.
Reach, trample
flavor: Less housebroken than housebreaking.

name: Ineffable Blessing
text:
As Ineffable Blessing enters the battlefield, choose white-bordered or silver-bordered.
Whenever a creature with the chosen border enters the battlefield under your control, draw a card.
flavor: "Hallowed be this compilation of mixed objects!"

name: Absolute Grace
text: All creatures have protection from black.
flavor: In pursuit of Urza, the Phyrexians sent countless foul legions into Serra's realm. Though beaten back, they left it tainted with uncleansable evil.

name: Absolute Law
text: All creatures have protection from red.
flavor: The strength of law is unwavering. It is an iron bar in a world of water.

name: Defensive Formation
text: Rather than the attacking player, you assign the combat damage of each creature attacking you. You can divide that creature's combat damage as you choose among any of the creatures blocking it.
flavor:
"Your enemies will pound upon the door of your defenses, but only you shall have the key, and it is the key of life."
—*Song of All*, canto 873

name: Disciple of Law
text:
Protection from red
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: A religious order for religious order.

name: Faith Healer
text: Sacrifice an enchantment: You gain life equal to the sacrificed enchantment's mana value.
flavor: The power of faith is quiet. It is the leaf unmoved by the hurricane.

name: Planar Birth
text: Return all basic land cards from all graveyards to the battlefield tapped under their owners' control.
flavor:
"From womb of nothingness sprang this place of beauty, purity, and hope realized."
—*Song of All*, canto 3

name: Presence of the Master
text: Whenever a player casts an enchantment spell, counter it.
flavor:
Peace to all. Peace be all.
—Great Hall floor inscription

name: Serra Zealot
text: First strike
flavor:
"The humans are useful in their way, but they must be commanded as the builder commands the stone. Be soft with them, and they will become soft."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Silent Attendant
text: {T}: You gain 1 life.
flavor: "The answer to life should never be death; it should always be more life, wrapped tight around us like precious silks."

name: Soul Sculptor
text: {1}{W}, {T}: Target creature becomes an enchantment and loses all abilities until a player casts a creature spell.
flavor: Does the stone mimic life, or did it once live?

name: Voice of Grace
text: Flying, protection from black
flavor:
"Opposite Law is Grace, and Grace must be preserved. If the strands of Grace are unraveled, its design will be lost, and the people with it."
—*Song of All*, canto 167

name: Voice of Law
text: Flying, protection from red
flavor:
"Life's balance is as a star: on one point is Law, and Law must be upheld. If the knots of order are loosened, chaos will spill through."
—*Song of All*, canto 167

name: Waylay
text: Create three 2/2 white Knight creature tokens. Exile them at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
flavor: "You reek of corruption," spat the knight. "Why are you even here?"

name: Attunement
text: Return Attunement to its owner's hand: Draw three cards, then discard four cards.
flavor:
"The solution can hide for only so long."
—Urza

name: Barrin, Master Wizard
text: {2}, Sacrifice a permanent: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Knowledge is no more expensive than ignorance, and at least as satisfying."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Douse
text: {1}{U}: Counter target red spell.
flavor: The academy's libraries were protected by fire-prevention spells. Even after the disaster, the books were intact—though forever sealed in time.

name: Gilded Drake
text:
Flying
When Gilded Drake enters the battlefield, exchange control of Gilded Drake and up to one target creature an opponent controls. If you don't or can't make an exchange, sacrifice Gilded Drake. This ability still resolves if its target becomes illegal.
flavor: Buyer beware.

name: Great Whale
text: When Great Whale enters the battlefield, untap up to seven lands.
flavor:
"As a great whale dies, it flips onto its back. And so an island is born."
—Mariners' legend

name: Lingering Mirage
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is an Island.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: Birds frozen in flight. Sea turned to glass. Tolaria hidden in a mirror.

name: Pendrell Drake
text:
Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: The mages of Tolaria found strange ways to spend their free time. Occasionally they had contests to see whose kite was eaten last.

name: Pendrell Flux
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay its mana cost."
flavor: Devoured by the mists, Tolaria was stuck in time, trapped between two eternal heartbeats.

name: Sandbar Merfolk
text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: You are not prey until a predator knows of your existence.

name: Sandbar Serpent
text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: Treacherous and unpredictable currents around Tolaria earned the nickname "serpent wakes."

name: Stern Proctor
text: When Stern Proctor enters the battlefield, return target artifact or enchantment to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"I preferred the harsh tutors—they made mischief all the more fun."
—Teferi, third-level student

name: Veil of Birds
text: When an opponent casts a spell, if Veil of Birds is an enchantment, Veil of Birds becomes a 1/1 Bird creature with flying.
flavor: When wind marries sky, even the bride's veil sings her praises.

name: Veiled Crocodile
text: When a player has no cards in hand, if Veiled Crocodile is an enchantment, Veiled Crocodile becomes a 4/4 Crocodile creature.
flavor: Some roads are paved with bad intentions.

name: Wizard Mentor
text: {T}: Return Wizard Mentor and target creature you control to their owner's hand.
flavor: Although some of the students quickly grasped the concept, the others could summon only blackboards.

name: Zephid
text:
Flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: Once you've seen one, you'll understand why spells won't go near them.

name: Zephid's Embrace
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: Spells will shun you, as will everyone else.

name: Blood Vassal
text: Sacrifice Blood Vassal: Add {B}{B}.
flavor:
"They are bred to suffer and born to die. Much like humans."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

name: Carrion Beetles
text: {2}{B}, {T}: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
flavor: It's all fun and games until someone loses an eye.

name: Lurking Evil
text: Pay half your life, rounded up: Lurking Evil becomes a 4/4 Phyrexian Horror creature with flying.
flavor:
"Ash is our air, darkness our flesh."
—*Phyrexian Scriptures*

name: Parasitic Bond
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Parasitic Bond deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor:
"All bonds are parasitic. Only rulership is pure."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

name: Planar Void
text: Whenever another card is put into a graveyard from anywhere, exile that card.
flavor:
"Planeswalking isn't about walking. It's about falling and screaming."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

name: Rain of Filth
text: Until end of turn, lands you control gain "Sacrifice this land: Add {B}."
flavor:
"When I say it rained, it was not small drops, but a thick, greasy drool pouring from the heavens."
—Urza, journal

name: Ravenous Skirge
text:
Flying
Whenever Ravenous Skirge attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Hunger is a kind of madness—and here, all madness flourishes.

name: Reclusive Wight
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control another nonland permanent, sacrifice Reclusive Wight.
flavor: There are places so horrible that even the dead hide their faces.

name: Sicken
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor: Urza dared to attack Phyrexia. Slowly, it retaliated.

name: Spined Fluke
text:
When Spined Fluke enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Spined Fluke.
flavor: Its spines are prized as writing quills by the priests of Gix.

name: Unworthy Dead
text: {B}: Regenerate Unworthy Dead.
flavor:
"Great Yawgmoth moves across the seas of shard and bone and rust. We exalt him in life, in death, and in between."
—*Phyrexian Scriptures*

name: Bravado
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
flavor:
"We drive the dragons from our home. Why should we fear you?"
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Bulwark
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Bulwark deals X damage to target opponent, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus the number of cards in that player's hand.
flavor:
"It will be the goblin's first bath, and its last."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Destructive Urge
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a land.
flavor: Red sky at night, dragon's delight.

name: Dromosaur
text: Whenever Dromosaur blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: They say dromosaurs are frightened of dogs, even little ones. There are no dogs in Shiv. Not even little ones.

name: Electryte
text: Whenever Electryte deals combat damage to defending player, it deals damage equal to its power to each blocking creature.
flavor: Shivan inhabitants are hardened to fire, so their predators have developed alternative weaponry.

name: Falter
text: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
flavor: Like a sleeping dragon, Shiv stirs and groans at times.

name: Fault Line
text: Fault Line deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
flavor:
We live on the serpent's back.
—Viashino saying

name: Goblin Patrol
text: Echo {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
flavor:
"Take the sharp metal stick and make a lotta holes."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Guma
text: Protection from blue
flavor: When the giant returned for the night, he found a dead merfolk on his pillow. Although he praised the little guma, he inwardly wondered where she had hid the head.

name: Headlong Rush
text: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor: A landslide of goblins poured toward the defenders—tumbling, rolling, and bouncing their way down the steep hillside.

name: Jagged Lightning
text: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures.
flavor: The pungent smell of roasting flesh made both mages realize they'd rather break for dinner than fight.

name: Meltdown
text: Destroy each artifact with mana value X or less.
flavor: Catastrophes happened so often at the mana rig that the viashino language had a special word to describe them.

name: Outmaneuver
text: X target blocked creatures assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.
flavor:
"Push one goblin into sight, an' run a lot. That's tactics."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Raze
text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Destroy target land.
flavor: The viashino believe that the oldest mountains hate everyone equally.

name: Retromancer
text: Whenever Retromancer becomes the target of a spell or ability, Retromancer deals 3 damage to that spell or ability's controller.
flavor: "If one harm us, strike them in return. So sayeth the bey."

name: Scald
text: Whenever a player taps an Island for mana, Scald deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor:
"Shiv may be surrounded by water, but the mountains go far deeper."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Sulfuric Vapors
text: If a red spell would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus 1 to that permanent or player instead.
flavor: It was the dragons who first learned to chase their prey into the vapors before igniting them.

name: Viashino Outrider
text: Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
flavor: "Give thy ration to thy mount, if the road be long. So sayeth the bey."

name: Viashino Sandswimmer
text: {R}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Viashino Sandswimmer to its owner's hand. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Viashino Sandswimmer.
flavor: Few swim in a place of such thirst.

name: Viashino Weaponsmith
text: Whenever Viashino Weaponsmith becomes blocked by a creature, Viashino Weaponsmith gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Within the rig settlement, those who have mastered the making of weapons earn highest honor.

name: Acridian
text: Echo {1}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
flavor: The elves of Argoth were trained to ride these creatures, even when their mounts traveled upside-down.

name: Argothian Swine
text: Trample
flavor: In Argoth, the shortest path between two points is the one the swine make.

name: Blanchwood Treefolk
flavor: The massive Argivian attack on their rooted kindred was a declaration of war to the treefolk.

name: Cave Tiger
text: Whenever Cave Tiger becomes blocked by a creature, Cave Tiger gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The druids found a haven in the cool limestone tunnels beneath Argoth. The invaders found only tigers.

name: Crosswinds
text: Creatures with flying get -2/-0.
flavor: Harbin's ornithopter had been trapped for two days within the currents of the storm. When the skies cleared, all he could see was a horizon of trees.

name: Elvish Herder
text: {G}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: Before Urza and Mishra came to Argoth, the herders prevented their creatures from stampeding. During the war, they encouraged it.

name: Gaea's Bounty
text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards, reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor: The forest grew back so quickly that lumbering machines were suspended in the treetops.

name: Hawkeater Moth
text:
Flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: Each day at dusk the birds above the canopy grow silent.

name: Hidden Ancients
text: When an opponent casts an enchantment spell, if Hidden Ancients is an enchantment, Hidden Ancients becomes a 5/5 Treefolk creature.
flavor: The only alert the invaders had was the rustling of leaves on a day without wind.

name: Hidden Spider
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell with flying, if Hidden Spider is an enchantment, Hidden Spider becomes a 3/5 Spider creature with reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: It wants only to dress you in silk.

name: Titania's Boon
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
flavor: When the winds rock the trees, listen for voices in the creaking of the trunks. If you hear your name, you are one of the Goddess's chosen.

name: Treetop Rangers
text: Treetop Rangers can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
flavor:
"If you can't catch them, cut the trees down from beneath them. Force them to fight on our terms."
—Mishra

name: Venomous Fangs
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a creature, destroy the other creature.
flavor: All the pain of the shattered forest contained in a single drop.

name: Winding Wurm
text: Echo {4}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
flavor: Entire trees were stripped of their bark and branches by the wurm's writhing path.

name: Serra's Sanctum
text: {T}: Add {W} for each enchantment you control.
flavor: A fragile cocoon of dreaming will.

name: Amateur Auteur
text: Sacrifice Amateur Auteur: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor:
And thus at Maze's End
the runners end their strife.
Our saving grace, that hooded kid,
is now Guildpact for life.
—*RAVNICA! The Musical*

name: Chivalrous Chevalier
text:
Flying
When Chivalrous Chevalier enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand unless you compliment an opponent.
flavor: "I treat every foe according to the highest codes of conduct. Then I kill them."

name: Gimme Five
text: You gain 1 life for each person who high-fives you in the next thirty seconds. Each player in an Un-game who high-fives you gains 1 life. (Offer high fives. Don't hit people.)
flavor: "Up high! To the side! Down low! To the left! Other left! Over here—"

name: Knight of the Kitchen Sink
text: First strike, protection from black borders (Nothing with a black border can block, target, deal damage to, or attach to this creature.)
flavor: "Whew. For a minute, I thought I'd forgotten the garlic press."

name: Knight of the Widget
text:
Vigilance
Knight of the Widget's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Order of the Widget watermarks among permanents you control.
flavor: His armor is lightweight titanium alloy, but his will is iron.

name: Riveting Rigger
text: When Riveting Rigger enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice another artifact. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Riveting Rigger and it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
flavor: "Turn a blender into an arc welder with a portable fusion reactor and a frozen yogurt dispenser? We can do it!"

name: Sacrifice Play
text: A person outside the game chooses an attacking or blocking creature target opponent controls. That player sacrifices that creature.
flavor: In recursive chess, one piece can capture another only after beating it in a game of recursive chess.

name: Success!
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's a host or has augment, it gains lifelink until end of turn.
flavor:
"Those who witness my work often question its necessity. I've never understood that."
—Dr. Julius Jumblemorph

name: Teacher's Pet
text: {2}{W}, Sacrifice Teacher's Pet: Search your library for a card with augment, combine it with target host you control, then shuffle.
flavor: "First attempt: unsuccessful. Instead of an amphibious chicken, hybridization produced an aquaphobic fish."

name: Crow Storm
text:
Create a 1/2 blue Bird creature token with flying named Storm Crow.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
flavor:
Storm crow lonely, boon for a birder.
Storm crows together, likely a murder.

name: Defective Detective
text:
Defective Detective can't be blocked.
When Defective Detective enters the battlefield, a person outside the game looks at target opponent's hand and chooses a card from it. That player reveals that card.
flavor: Nothing gets by her . . . except the evidence, the motive, and the culprit.

name: Five-Finger Discount
text: Put target nonland permanent into your hand. You may spend mana as though it were mana of any color the next time you cast that card.
flavor: "Dognapping is such an ugly word. I would characterize this as a unilateral redistribution of pets."

name: Kindly Cognician
text: Spells you cast that refer to artifacts or Contraptions in their rules text cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: "What's wrong, dear? Nothing a 44-to-22 bronze spur gear and reducer pairing couldn't fix, I bet."

name: More or Less
text: Add or subtract 1 or one from a number or number word on target spell or permanent until end of turn.
flavor: Why was 5 afraid of 6? Because 678.

name: Novellamental
text:
Flying
Novellamental can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: "My grandmother had sold the rest of her jewelry long ago, but she left a particular necklace in my care: a golden chain, bearing a raven-shaped charm."

name: Spell Suck
text: Counter target spell, then assemble a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
flavor: S-U-C-K

name: Spy Eye
text:
Flying
Whenever Spy Eye deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card from that player's library.
flavor:
"That pigeon knows something, and we will find out what."
—X

name: Suspicious Nanny
text: Whenever Suspicious Nanny deals combat damage to a player, it reassembles target Contraption that player controls. (Gain control of it and move it onto one of your sprockets.)
flavor: "Afternoon, folks. Lovely day for a stroll with my authentic human baby."

name: capital offense
text: target creature gets -x/-x until end of turn, where x is the number of times a capital letter appears in its rules text. (ignore reminder text and flavor text.)
flavor: part basket case, all lowercase.

name: Extremely Slow Zombie
text: Last strike (This creature deals combat damage after creatures without last strike.)
flavor: Brrrrrrrrrrrr . . .

name: Finders, Keepers
text: Destroy target creature, then assemble a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
flavor: The S.N.E.A.K. Code clearly permits looting corpses for parts. That just meant Agent 47.3 had to make sure her target was dead first.

name: Old-Fashioned Vampire
text:
Flying
Old-Fashioned Vampire gets +2/+2 and has deathtouch as long as it's dark outdoors.
flavor: "Stalking hard or hardly stalking, am I right?"

name: Overt Operative
text:
Menace
Whenever Overt Operative deals combat damage to a player, it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
flavor: Saw her coming. Didn't matter.

name: "Rumors of My Death . . ."
text: {3}{B}, Exile a permanent you control with a League of Dastardly Doom watermark: Return a permanent card with a League of Dastardly Doom watermark from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: By the fourth funeral, the mooks had gotten pretty good at them.

name: Sly Spy
text: Whenever Sly Spy deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals their hand. You choose a card from it with the longest name. That player discards that card.
flavor: The Agents of S.N.E.A.K.—Serious, Nonstop Espionage and Kidnapping.

name: Squirrel-Powered Scheme
text: Increase the result of each die you roll by 2.
flavor: Lucinda didn't know which she enjoyed most: the science, the squirrels, or the maniacal laughter.

name: Steady-Handed Mook
text:
Deathtouch
When Steady-Handed Mook enters the battlefield, it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
flavor: A mook's life span is just long enough to get just good enough to get careless.

name: Subcontract
text: A person outside the game looks at target opponent's hand and chooses a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: Martha was in and out in exactly two minutes—thirty seconds to administer the poison plus a minute and a half to properly refold the napkins.

name: Box of Free-Range Goblins
text: Roll a six-sided die. Create a number of 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens equal to the result.
flavor: Skrab tried to warn his fellow goblins that the hammer was bait for a trap, but they stopped listening at "hammer."

name: Hammer Helper
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature and roll a six-sided die. Until end of turn, it gains haste and gets +X/+0, where X is the result.
flavor: "Need a hammer? Gotta get your fix? I know a guy."

name: Hammerfest Boomtacular
text: Whenever you cast a spell with a Goblin Explosioneers watermark, Hammerfest Boomtacular deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor: It's less "music" and more "straightforward hearing damage."

name: It That Gets Left Hanging
text: When It That Gets Left Hanging enters the battlefield, ask a person outside the game to high-five you. If they won't, It That Gets Left Hanging gains haste until end of turn.
flavor: "Give me . . . some skin."

name: Just Desserts
text: Just Desserts deals π damage to target creature. (π is the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter. (It's a smidgen more than 3.))
flavor:
"It's time to put the 'die' in 'diameter!'"
—Flaky the Irrational

name: Party Crasher
text:
Haste
You can attack with Party Crasher once each combat during each opponent's turn.
flavor: No rest. No mercy. No reservations.

name: Steamflogger Temp
text: {6}, {T}: Steamflogger Temp assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
flavor: When you're dumber than a hammer, every problem looks like one of those things you hit with a hammer.

name: Steamfloggery
